vnion two noble illustre famelies lancastre yorke beeyng long continual discension croune noble realme actes done bothe tymes prince bothe one linage beginnyng tyme kyng henry fowerth first aucthor deuision successiuely proceadyng reigne high prudent prince kyng henry eight vndubitate flower heire sayd linage pto mightie verteous excellent prince edward sixt grace god kyng england fraunce ireland defendor catholike faith vnder god supreme hed church england ireland moste humble subiect edward halle wisheth health honor felicitie obliuion cancard enemie fame renoune suckyng serpet auncient memory dedly darte glory prince defacer conquestes notable actes muche bare rule firste seconde age worlde nothyng set mennes knowledge ether world made either howe man beastes wer created worlde destroyed water til father moses deuine inspiracio third age inuented letter treasure memorie set furth fine notable bokes greate comfort people liuyng daie likewise mercurie egipte inuented letter writyng whiche eadmus brought grece euery nacio desirous enhaunce lady fame suppresse dedly beast obliuio diuersitie betwene noble prince poore begger ye reasonable man brute beast death left theim remembrance token euidently appereth fame triumphe glory memory litterature verie dilator setter furth fame muche therfore prince gouernoures noble menne bounde theim whiche haue liuely set furth liues actes parentes though thei bee ded mortall death yet thei writyng fame liue bee continually present man written goodnesse noble augustus pitie mercifull traian shoulde successours haue folowed ther steppe vertue princely quality contrarie parte crueltie nero vngracious life caligula beene put remembrance young prince fraile gouernors might likewise haue fallen like pit redyng vice seyng mischeueous ende thei bee compelled leaue euill way embrace good quality notable prince prudent gouernours thus writyng keye enduce vertue represse vice thus memorie maketh menne ded many thousande yer still liue though thei wer present thus fame triumpheth vpon death renoune vpon obliuion reason writyng historie ala soueraigne lorde herte lamenteh knowe remembre rule tyrante obliuion bare realme tyme briton first habitacion land man briton ether set furthe historie begynnyng wrote hole liues prince kynges excepte gildas whiche inueighed euill doynges fewe tyrantes euill gouernours muche cesar writeth realme people could tel linage begynnyng one geffrey monmothe thousand yere iulius cesar translated certayn britishe welshe boke conteinyng commyng brute sequele linage till tyme cadwalader whiche britishe boke slept litle lenger brute al posteritie ben buried poke obliuion lacke writyng strong saxon thei gayned lande set vp baner fame liues notably writte diuerse sundery famous clerkes euen firste entery lande till firste monarchy sucessyuely norman tyme many notable woorkes hath set furthe one prince perticulerly mo fine story kynges kyng willyam firste kyng edward third bee set urthe length diuerse authours latin toungue matthewe paris sometyme religious saincte albons whome ihon frossart wrote liues kyng edward third kyng richard seconde compendeously largely many thynges spoken long woorkes might beleue written greate volume bee trewe gospell haue redde olde prouerbe whiche saithe many woordes lye twayne sone maie scape sithe ende frossarte whiche endeth begynnyng kyng henry fourthe man englishe toungue hath either set furth honor accordyng desertes yet declared many notable actes worthy memorie dooen tyme seuen kynges whiche kyng richarde succeded excepte robert fabian one name whiche wrote common english chronicle men worthy praysed diligence farre shotyng wide butte historie wherfore moste drad benigne souereigne lord lest cancarde obliuion deface glory seuen prince side lineall heire enheritour haue compiled gathered made diuerse writer well forayn englishe simple treatise whiche haue named vnion noble house lancaster yorke conioyned together godly mariage moste noble graundfather verteous grandmother kyng henry fourthe beginnyng rote great discord deuision godly matrimony final ende discencions title debate besechyng highe maiestie take simple rube woorke accordyng accustomed goodnesse good part regardyng thyng good natiue countree whose fame lacke writyng may muche darkened defaced thus pray celestiall lorde send victorie ouer enemy peace confederate loue subiectes conclusion perpetuall ioye eternall felicitee richard grafton reader must craue gentle reader charitably iudge imprinter worke ought herin shalbe sene vnto purpose bee omitted either sufficiently delated set furth elles somethyng playnly spoken might noted affeccion thou wilt excuse therin professe haue nere lay nether altered added thyng selfe whole woorke otherwise aucthor writ thesame noted aucthor therof though al yet many wel knowe man later tyme lyfe paynfull studious ben wherefore perfited writt historie farther foure twentie yere kyng henry eight rest left noted diuers many pamphletes paper whych digently truly coulde gathered thesame together haue suchewise compiled may thesaied yeres apere woorke vtterly without addicion myne therfore request desyr foresaied thou wilt truly aud charitably iudge sone leasure wil serue thine ease ready fyndyng thyng herein conteyned purpose gather exact table whole woorke pthe name aucthors aswell latin whiche worke first gathered compiled conioyned latin aucthors policronicon cronica cronicarum nauclerus polidorus paulus aemilius voluteranus gauguinus albertus krantz michael ricius hector boetius ioannes maior abbas vvyssenbergensis carion supplementum cronicarum gesta tholosanorum cronica brabancie frenche aucthors enguerant de munstrellet iean uchet iean mayer de belget argenton le mere de history le annales de fraunce le annales de aquitayne le croni que de britayne giles corozett le croniques de normandi le rosarie le genolagie de roys englishe writer treuisa fabian sir thomas moore caxton ihon hardyng chronicle london ihon basset balantyne diuers pamphlettes name moste menne vnknowen name history coteigned volume introduccion deuision two house lancastre yorke vnquiet tyme kyng ry fowerth victorious actes kyng henry v troubleous season kyng henry vj prosperous reigne kyng edward iiij pitifull life kyng edward v tragicall doynges kyng richard iij politike gouernaunce kyng henry vij triumphant reigne king henry viij finis pan introduccion history kyng henry fourthe mischiefe hath insurged realmes intestine deuision depopulacion hath ensued country ciuill discencio detestable murder hath comitted citees seperate faccions calamitee hath ensued famous regios domestical discord vnnaturall controuersy rome hath felt italy testifie fraunce bere witnes beame tell scotlande maie write denmarke shewe especially noble realme englande apparantly declare make demonstracion abhorreth expresse heynous factes comitted rome ciuill war betwene iulius cesar hardy popey whose discorde bright glory triuphant rome eclipsed shadowed reherce mische e plage pleasant countree italy hath tasted suffered sedicious faccions guelphes gebelynes reporte misery daiely hath ensued fraunce discorde house burgoyne orliens scotland betwene brother brother vncle nephew curiously endi e manifolde battailles fought realme beaine betwene catholikes pestiferus sectes adamites others damage discencion hath dooen germany denmarke christian daie well declare turke bere good testimony whiche discord christen prince hath amplified greatly seigniory dominion miserie murder execrable plague famous region hath suffered deuision discencion renoumed house lancastre yorke witte cannot comprehende toung declare nether yet penne fully set furthe noble man liueth daie gentleman auncient stocke progeny clere whose linage hath ben fested plaged vnnaturall deuision discordes sectes faccions almoste liuely florishe continue presente tyme greate displesure preiudice christian publike welth olde deuided controuersie betwene fornamed family lacastre yorke vnion matrimony celebrate consummate betwene high mighty prince kyng henry seuenth lady elizabeth moste worthy quene one beeyng indubitate heire hous lancastre yorke suspended appalled person moste noble uissat mighty heire kyng henry eight hym clerely buried perpetually extinct men clerer sonne maie apparantly perceiue discord greate thynges decaie fall ruine thesame concord reuiued erected likewise also region whiche deuisio discencion vexed molested troubled bee vnion agrement releued pacified enriched vnion godhed manhod manne ioyned god whiche temptacion subtle serpente hym segregate deuided vnion catholike churche outworne sinagoge hard ceremony dedly peines mosaicall law wer clerely abholished made frustrate also christian libertie inferred christes religion stablished erected vnion man woman holy sacrament matrimony generacion blessed synne body clene extincte put awaie vnion mariage peace betwene realme realme exalted loue betwene countree countree norished coniunccio matrimony malice extinct amitie embraced indissoluble aliance consanguinite procured profite co mfort ioy succeded realme england vnion fornamed two noble family shall apparantly perceiue sequele rude vnlearned history vnion agrement respect deuision consequent reso manifest onely originall cause foutain also declare calamity trobles misery whiche happened chaunced duryng tyme thesaid contencious discencion whiche shall vnderstande accordyng acte parliamente made firste yere reigne kyng edwarde fourthe specified declared highe mightie prince kyng henry third namethe lyne yng henry third issue edward firste begotten sonne borne westminster eleuenth kalendes iuly vigile saincte marke marcilian yere lorde thousande twoo hundrd xxix edmonde seconde begotten sonne borne daye saincte marcell yere lorde thousande twoo hundred xlv whiche edwarde death king henry father entitled called kyng edward first issue first begotten sonne entitled called death kyng edward father kyng edward second issue right noble honorable prince kyng edward third kyng edward issue edward first begotten sone prince wale willya hatfeld second begotten sonne lionell duke clarence iij begotten sonne ihon gaunt duke lancaster iiij begotten sonne edmond langley duke yorke v begotten sonne thomas wodstocke duke glocestre vj begotten sonne willyam wynsor vij begotten sonne saied prince edward died life father kyng edward iij issue richard borne burdeaux whiche death kyng edward iij cosin heire hym saie sonne saied edwarde prince wale sonne thesaied kyng edward thirde succeded hym royall estate dignitee lawfully entitled called kyng richarde seconde died without issue lionell duke clarence third begotten sonne thesaied kyng edward third issue philippe doughter whiche maried edmond mortymer erle marche issue roger mortymer erle marche whiche roger issue edmond mortimer erle marche anne elienor whiche edmond elianor died without issue thesaied anne maried richard erle cambrige sonne edmond langley duke yorke fifth begotten sonne thesaid kyng edwarde thirde whiche rycharde issue thee famous prince richard plantagenet duke yorke whiche issue noble prince kyng edward fourth father quene elizabeth vnited matrimony high sage prince kyng henry vij ihon duke lancastre issue henry erle darby ihon erle somersette henry erle darby issue kyng henry fifth father kyng henry sixte whiche begat prince edwarde slayne tewkesbery diseased without issue ihon erle somersette named sonne ihon duke lancastre engendered ihon duke somer ette father lady margarete countes richemonde mother noble haute prince kyng henry seuenth whiche espoused lady elizabeth heire illustre family yorke whiche mariage deuise badge hous lancastre whiche redde rose vnite ioyned white rose whiche cognisance ensigne noble progeny yorke genealogy conteigned ende woorke plainly shall appere aforenamed henry erle darby beeyng created alitle duke herfforde aprudente politike persone politike welbeloued yet welbeloued highly disdayned began consider hymself kyng richarde cosyn germaine nowe brought trade liuyng litle nothyng regarded counsaill vncles graue sadde persones thyng pleasure settyng appetite stede lawe reason wherefore daie beeyng compaigny thomas mowbrey firste duke norffolke erle marshall beganne breake mynde hym dolour lamentacion malice displeasure rehersyng howe kyng richarde litle estemed lesse regarded noble prince realme muche laie hym soughte occasion inuented cause practised priuely howe destroye part theim thretenyng death manacyng exile banishment forgettyng remembryng blotte honor detrimente damage publike wealthe suffre realme l se aunciente fame pristinate renoume slouth negligence thynges bothe tyme peace also warre aswell realme without waxed worsse worsse neuer prosperous successe fortunate conclusion noble menne murmured comon people grudged menne wondered vnprincely doynges desired duke norffolke whiche one kynges priuy counsaill well heard hym aduise kyng turne lefe take better lesson duke norffolke heard fully deuise toke good parte rekened yt gotten praie whiche obtayne greater fauor kyng euer tyme dissimuled matter deede bothe depe dissimuler pleasaunte flaterer oportunite sawe tyme glad tell tale scicophantes bee thei haue thyng instill eares heddes prince declare kyng heard agrauate make offence greater muche added nothyng diminished matter somewhat quickened tikeled waueryng mynd kyng richard brought hym great fury water fumitory well disgested stomacke determined bothe party indifferently called hym duke lancastre counsaill also duke herfforde norffolk caused accusor report opely wordes declared whiche rehersed theim related kyng duke henry heard tale otherwise reported ether thought saied somwhat vnquieted noueltie thyng troubled anger vntruth matter stode stil paused good lokyng stedfastly vpo king takyng good corage hym makyng low obeisace besought highnes coceiue mistrust hym til seen herd turnyng hymself accuser declared worde worde said shewyng cause occasion spake deniyng fiersly al new inue cions alleged proponed charge affirmyng kyng would permit suffre hym would proue accusor vntrue vniust afalse forger lie sedicious tale stroke spere det swerd duke norffolke affirmed constantly saiyng true refused cobate kyng demaunded thei would agre betwene themselfes whiche thei denied threw doune gage truth kyng selfes agre study agre grauted battaill assigned place citee couentree moneth august next ensuyng caused supteous theatre listes royal gorgeously prepared day apointed ij valiant duke ca couentre accopanied noble gentile linage whiche theim encoraged hertened vtmoste day cobate fight duke aumarle daie high counstable theduke surrey daie high marshall england entred listes great copany men apareled silke sendall embrodered siluer richely curiously euery man hauyng tipped staffe kepe feld order tyme prime came barrier listes duke herfford mounted white corser barbed blewe grene veluet embrodered sumpteously swannes antelope goldsmithes worke armed poinctes constable marshall came barrier demaundyng hym answered henry lancastre duke herfford whiche come hether dooe deuoyre thomas mowbrey duke norffolke traytor vntrew god kyng realme incontinent sware vpo holy euangelistes quarel trewe iust vpon poyncte desired entre listes put vp swearde whiche helde naked hande put doune viser made crosse forhed spere hand entered listes discended horsse set hym doune chayer grene veluet whiche set trauers grene blewe veluet one ende listes reposed hymself expectyng abydyng commyng aduersye sone hym entered felde greate pompe kyng richard accompaignied pecres realme compaignie therle sent paule whiche come frauce post se chalenge performed kyng aboue ten thousand persones harnesse least fraie tumultie might spryng emongest noble parttakyng quarellyng kyng set stage whiche richely hanged pleasantly adorned kyng armes made open proclamacion prohibityng menne name kyng high constable marshall enterprise attempte approche touche parte listes vpon payne death except apoyncted ordre marshall felde proclamacion ended another herald cried behold henry lancastre duke herfford appellant whiche entered listes royall dooe deuoyre thomas mowbray duke norffolke defendante vpon payne bee proued falce recreant duke norffolke houered horsebacke entery listes horse beyng barbed crimosen veluet embrodered richely lion siluer mulbery tree made othe constable marshall quarell iust trewe entered felde manfully saiyng aloude god aide hym hath righte departed horse satte doune chayer whiche crimosen ueluet cortened aboute white redde damaske lorde marshall vewed speres see thei egall length deliuered one spere hymself duke herfforde sente spere duke norffolke knighte heraulte proclaymed trauerses chayers champion bee remoued commaundyng theim kynges behalfe mounte horssebacke adresse themselfes battaill combate duke herfforde quickely horssed closed bauier caste spere rest trupet souded set forward coragiously toward enemy vj vij pace duke norffolke fully set forward whe kyng cast doune warder heraultes cried ho ho kyng caused speres taken commaunded repaire chayers thei remained two long houres kyng counsaill deliberatly consulted waie best bee taken waighty cause heraltes cried silence sir ihon borcy secretary kyng red sentence determinacion kyng counsaill long rolle pronounsyng maner lordes master intimate notify kyng counsail hery lancastre duke herfforde appellante thomas duke norffolke defendante haue honorably valiantly apered within listes royal daie haue redy darraine battaill like two valiant knightes hardy chapions matter greate weighty betwene two greate prince ordre kyng counsaill henry duke herfford diuerse consideracions hath displeased kyng shall within xv day departe realme terme ten yeres without returnyng excepte kyng repealed vpon pain death people whiche hertely loued duke herfford heard crie thei wer litle amased marueled muche doen deuor performance chalenge thus banished exiled herault cried oyes secretary declared thomas mowbrey duke norffolke ordinace kyng cousaill sowen sedicion realme wordes wherof make proffe shall voide realme england dwel hugery beame pruce list neuer returne englande approche cofines border thesame vpon pain death kyng would staie profites reuenewes landes handes till receiued suche somes money duke taken vp kynges treasorer wage garison caleis whiche wer still vnpaied iudgemetes wer thus deuulged kyng called two exile made swere one neuer come place wher willyngly kepe company together forren region whiche oth thei receiued humbly departed listes supposed kyng mistrusted thei two ioyne one conspire reuenged thei frendes might woorke hym greate trouble calamitee cause haue deuised othe duke norffolke whiche supposed haue borne kyng sore repentant enterprise departed sorowfully realme almaine laste came uenice thoughte melancoly deceassed duke herfforde tooke leaue kyng elthathe duke harforde banished realme whiche released foure yeres banishment tooke hys iourney came caleis fraunce wher continued wondreful write straunge nombre people ranne euery towne strete lamenting bewailyng departure woulde say whe departed onely shelde defece comfort come people vadid gone though sone falle spere ye moone lapsed fro proper epicicle arriued fraunce kyng charles hearyng cause banishement whiche estemed verye small lighte receaued hym gently hym honorably entreteyned somuche fauour obteined mariage onli doughter iho duke berry vncle frenche kyng kyng richard cast astoppe waie well considered howe comminaltie loued duke desirous thei returne england forseyng bee ioyned great affinite blood house berry fraunce afterward sodeinly returne englande might fortune redounde displeasoure pleasour wherefore letted mariage owne distruction duryng ye first yere duke exile father iho gaut duke lacaster decessedihon g unt duke lancaster deceased buried northe syde high aultare ye cathedral churche seint paul londo death duke abbreuiated life king richard notwithstading ye duchy lancaster duke henry laufully discended onlye seazed without ryght title goodes duke ihon parent also defrauded heire laufull inheritaunce receauing rente reuenues al patrimony geuing distributed duke landes paresites flattereing foloers facte adiudged al nobilitee bee vnlaufull vniust vngodlye depriue man beyng banished realme without deserte without culpe without cause inheritaunce patrimony edmund duke yorke vncle henry lawfully duke lancastre sore moued thys chaunce see kyng breake violate lawes iustice equite murther brother duke glocestre spoyle robbe sonne brother tyme asmuch pacience could beare tollerate suffer death brother exile nephiew hundred mo iniuries whiche leuitie youth kyng remitted buried obliuion therefore consideryng glorye publique wealthe natiue countree like decay reason ye kyng moste ingenious man nere hym wolde boldely admonishe hym office duetie thought acte wiseman tyme get resting place leaue folowing doubtful capitain whiche leade sworde wold cut owne throte bolle wherfore duke aumarle sonne went house langley reioysyng nothing common wealth mishappened either deuice consent daily lamentably desired aide almightie god turne away kyng richard darke cloude whiche sawe hangyng ouer head season kyng richard sailed irelad diuers aucthors testifie therekyng richard sailed ireland parte processe whiche dependeth sequele deuision whyle kyng richard irelande graue persones nobilitie sage prelate ye clergy sad magestrates ruler city tounes comminaltie perceiuyng daily realme fall ruine desolacion maner irrecurable long kyng richard either liued reigned long deliberacion wrote fraunce duke henry nowe called dede duke lancastre herfford solicityng requiryng diligent celeritie conueigh england promisyng ayde power assistence expellyng king richard mete couenient princely office degree would take vpon scepter rule diademe natiue coutrey first nutritiue soyle cause sent reuerent father thomas arundel archebishop cauntorbury certain lordes citizen diuers city boroughes habite palliate dissimuled citie paris goyng one waye another assemblyng together house cluigny duke soiourned sawe archebishop especial frende loked fautours louers thaked god man ought merueil welcommed ambassador none nede wonder reioysed applauded accesse commyng wise men may thinke foly fooles may laugh skorne saluted onely resaluted hertely welcommed frendely entertained archebishop desiryng duke absent al person suche aswer copanions sayd like wordes louyng naturall kynsmen countreymen moste noble mightie princean made thomas arundell archebishop cauntorbury hery duke lancaster muche long time considered debated themselfes affaire busynes tempesteous worlde ceason whiche manne nacion sure life enioyeth landes seigniory without dread possesseth mouables without terrour feare whiche outragious doynges many yeres occupied hath brought publique wealthe aboundant countrey almost wrecke vtter exterminion last ankerhold refuge comforte studye deuise howe haue gouernour ruler whiche excell florishe wysedome pollicie iustice aboue reason great nomber nobilitie maner comminaltie beyng led persuaded wel cast iyes marked peres noble realme england could finde duke marque erle potentate within realme whose empire aucthoritie thei would subiect vassal gladly assure knowe aswell wee miserable subiectes haue long borne yoke waton vnwitty kyng richard haue paciently tollerat parnicious persecucion gredy auaricious councellers haue wynked pollyng extorcion vnmeasurable officer backes bee galdde wee suffre chynne bone weake lenger cary therfore necessitie reason affeccion constancy leuytie enforceth v lament desire ayde comforte wee bee sent moste part nobilitee also parte vniuersall comminaltie desire require take vpon high power gouernaunce sceptre natiue countre right inheritaunce gouerne rule defende according approued wisedome long experimented pollecie haue euer knowen bee iustice prudence integritee comaunde admonyshe attempt thyng whiche shal bee iust honest laudable whiche request well cosidre diligently ponder priuely self shall easely perceaue nothyng profitable honest glorious eny way happen chaunce accepte conforme self desyre wishe comaude thynges accordyng right reason honestie offre golde siluer perle precious stone countrey body goodes v vse oures desiryng geue v recompence indifferecy quietnes peace restore seate trone lady instice whiche hath long banished nacion thentent wise sage good persones whose desire appetite euer liue well maie honour loue embrace gouernour kyng sent god malicious obstinate persones whose conscience grudged daily offence feare iustice punishement doeth continually vexe trouble fearyng skourge plague naughtie dooynges mischeuous actes maie either sone amende shortly auoide countrey region occasion offred refuse whiche wisdome pollecie valiauntnes shall appeare vniuersal worlde whiche shal bryng v vnitre monacord also represse sedicion cancard dissimulacion nobleman shal triumphe riche menne shall liue without feare poore nedy persones shal oppressed confounded doyng shall obtein thankes creator loue people fauour neighbour fame honour euer bishop ended duke paused awhile put hood sayd lorde cauntourbury frendes louers commyng v verie pleasauntthe answere henry duke lancaster e arudell b cautorbury ioyous message wee owne naturall disposicion good syngular affection haue euer borne v haue loued embrased highly estemed doinges surely woulde knewe sorowe agony mynde haue borne vexacions calamity oppression manifest iniuries obprobrious offence done comitted v knowe well inough wee wolle speake tyme whiche wee estemed oure selfe partener thinge common betwene v hard hed shall feele hande membre greued sicke vnlike displeasure discommoditee shoulde happen withe taste parte suche agremente emonge membres suche comunitie emong frendes wherfore neither ambicio worldli honour desire empire rule affeccion worldly rich mucke worlde wolle agre peticio onely releue miserable calamitie restore iustice auncient rome preheminece defed poore innocet people extort powre gredy cormerates rauenous oppressours requiryng ioyne v aduaucyng forward incepted purpose pretesed entreprice duke condiscended bisshoppes requeste bisshop complices departed englande makyng relacion confederate duke agremet pleasure exhortyng euery man bee prest ready arryuall departure duke fayned frenche kyng would go brytein visite frend duke ihon brytein frenche kyng thynking hym meane inwardely outwardly dissimuled sent duke britayne letter comendacion fauour duke lancaster knowen entent trans ret englande depose sonne lawe kyng richarde would suerely haue stopped tide let purpose passage shoulde saie ye whiche shalbee shalbe duke passed britayne conducted waged certeyn menne warre shippesthe aryuyng landyng duke good wynde better spede sailed englad landed rauespurre holdrenes moste wryters affirme saie landed plymmoth aud portesmouth soeuer arryued sure tooke lande peaceably withe againsaie interrupcion tedious rehersyng howe erles northumbrelande westmerlande lordes percy rose willoughby resorted taking othe hym dooe kyng richard bodelye harme made hym homage becam liege men omyte howe child reioysed weme clapped ther handes howe men cried ioye euery toune village passed relinquishe farther concourse people number horse whiche occurred hym iourneyed toward london reioysyng repaire commyng citie wil speake procession singing cleargie pleasant salutacions eloquent oracio made hym prelacie presentes welcomynges laudes gratificacions made citiesens comminaltee citie london wil go purpose whe come london consulted frendes diuers dayes whome came thomas earle arundell sone richard arundell king richard litell afore put deathe whiche lately escaped prison duke perceaued fauour nobilitie affection cleargie sincere loue comminalte towarde hym procedynges marched foreward greate company toward west countrey passyng waie people assembled great houge multitude nature common people euer desirous newe change callyng kyng deprauyng railyng kyng richard innocent dastarde meicocke worthy beare name kyng assembled together conuenient nomber people purpose clerely determyned depose kynge rycharde rule dignitie proclaimed open warre agaynst hym partaker fautours frendes kyng richarde beyng irelande certified duke arriuall whence pacified sauage wilde people retourned agayne england entending resiste defend eminent peril apparant ieopardy tuicio safegard entred strong castel flinte north wale x myles distaunt chester kyng richard perceued people plumpes fled duke henry amased doubted councell sodeinlie take one part sawe title iust trewe vnfallible beside small truste welshemen conscience cleane pure immaculate without spot enuy side sawe puissaunce aduersaries sodaine departyng mooste trusted thynges turned vpsydoune thinges beyng abashed encouraged compelled necessitie determined kepe hym selfe castell till myghte see worlde stable suretie nowe euidentely espied manifestly perceaued lefte lowted forsaken theym tyme myght haue bene ayded relieued whiche nowe late farre ouerpassed thing worthy noted whitestone al prince ruler men set auctoritee rule duke henry lancastre shoulde thus called kyngdome haue healpe assistence whole realme whiche perchaunce neuer thereof thoughte yet dreamed kyng richard shuld thus lefte desolate void desperate hope comforte offence ought imputed frailtee wanton youth malice heart cankerdnesse stomacke suche frayle iudgement mortall men whiche vilependyng regardyng thynges presente eies euer thincke thynges come haue prosperous successe delectable sequcie duke lancastre knewe king richarde come castel flinte whiche man maye call dolorous castell king richarde declined dignitie lost tipe glorie preheminence assembled together great armie small space lest myght geue enemy time preuent purpose lose good occasion victory geuen came towne bristowe apprehended willyam lord scrope kinges treasurer sir iho busshe sir henri grene knyghtes caused heddes striken thence toke iourneie directly chester thomas percy earle worceter great master lord stuard kynges houshold beyng brother earle northumberland hard tell duke approch bering displeasure king proclaimed brother traiter brake al kinges houshold white staffe ensigne token office without delay went duke henry whe kinges familier seruitours perceiued dispersed selfes one countrey another duke came toward castell flinte wherof king richard beyng aduertised councell ihon pallet richarde seimer assured ruauntes departed castell toke sandes ryuer dee trusting escape chester haue refuge succoure farre passed forelayed taken brought duke sent hym secretly towre london duke thus possessed longe desyred praye came london solempne estate called parliament kynges name whiche many kynges frendes appeared declared howe vnprofitable kyng richarde bene realme duryng reigne howe subuerted lawes polled people ministred iustice man suche pleased hym entent common bee perswaded vniust vnprofitable prince tiraunte ouer subiectes worthy bee deposed set forthe xxxv solempne article heynous eares men almost vncredible effecte whiche article truely reporte hereafter accordyng copie pfyrst kyng richard wastfully spent treasure realme geuen possession croune men vnworthy reason wherof daily newe charge layd neckes poore comminaltie diuerse lordes well spiritual temporall appointed highe court parliament co mon treate diuers matter concernyng common wealth beyng busie commission affinitie went empeach treson force menace compelled iustices realme shrewsburie condiscend opinion destruction said lordes muche began reise war ihon duke lancastre thomas erle arundell richarde erle warwicke lordes contrary honour promyse pitem caused vncle duke glocester arrested without lawe sent caleis without iudgemente murdered hym although erle arundell vpon arainement pleaded charter pardon could heard vile shamefull maner sodainly put death pitem assembled certain lancashire cheshire men entent make warre foresaid lordes suffered robbe pill without correction reprefe pitem although king flateringly great dissimulacion made proclamacion throughout realme lordes named attached crime treason onely extorcions oppression done realme yet laied theym parliament rebellion manifest treason pitem hath compelled diuers saied lordes seruauntes frendes menace extreme paimentes make great fine theyr vtter vndoyng notwithstandyng pardon theim graunted yet made fine newe pitem diuers appointed common estate realme common welthe king caused al rolles recordes kept contrary promise made parliament open dishonour pitem vncharitably comaunded man vpon paine losse life goodes entreate retourne henry nowe duke lancastre pitem realme holden god pope prince said kyng richard obteined diuers actes parliament owne peculier profite pleasure obteined bulles extreme censure rome compell al menne straightely kepe contrary honour auncient priuileges realme pitem although duke lancastre done deuoir thomas duke norffolke profe quarel yet saied kyng without reason ground banished realme ten yeres contrary equitee pitem duke departure vnder brode seale licenced make attourneis prosecute defend cause saied kyng departure wold suffre none attourney apere pleasure pitem kyng put oute diuers shriues lawefully elected put rome diuers owne minion subuertyng lawe contrary othe honour pitem borowed great somes money bound vnder letter pattentes repaimet thesame yet one peny paid pite taxed men wil vnhappy councel thesame treasure spent folie paiyng pore men vitail viande pitem said lawes realme head somtime brest reason whiche fantasticall opinion destroied noble men empouerished pore common pitem parliament settyng enacting diuers notable statute profite aduauncement common welth priuie frendes soliciters caused enacted acte enacted shuld preiudiciall predecessor whiche prouiso often liste lawe ment pite serue purpose wold suffer shrefes shire remaine aboue one yere two pitem sommons parliament knightes burgess electe election bene full proceded put diuers persones elected put place serue wyll appetite pitem priuie espialles euery shire communicacion commoned lasciuious liuyng outragious doyng streighte way apprehended made greuous fine pitem spiritualtie alledged hym goyng ireland exacted many notable somes money beside plate iuels without law custome contrary oth take coronacio pitem diuers lordes iustices sworne say truthe diuers thinges committed charge honor realme profite kyng said kyng menaced theym sore thretenynges man wold durste saie ryght pitem assent nobilitee caried iewels plate treasure ouer see irelande great empouerishyng realme al good recordes comon welthe extorcions caused priuely embesiled conueied away pitem leages letter bee concluded sent see rome region writyng subtill darke prince durst beleue yet owne subiectes pitem mooste tirannously vnprincely said liues goodes al subiectes prince hads disposicio pitem contrary great charter england caused dyuers lustie men appele diuers olde men vpon matter determinable common law court marcial court triall onely battaile whervpon said aged personnes fearyng sequele matter submitted theym selfes mercy fined raunsomed vnreasonably pleasure pitem craftely deuised certain priuie othes contrary lawe caused diuers subiectes first sworne obserue bounde bondes former keping great vndoyng many honest men pitem chauncellour accordyng lawe woulde wise graunt prohibicion certain person king graunted vnto person vnder priuie seale greate thretnynges shuld disobeied pitem banyshed bishop canterbury without cause iudgement kept parliament chamber men armes pitem bishop goodes graunted successour vpon condicion shuld mainteine al statute made shrewsburie anno xxi statute made anno xxii couentree pitem vpon accusacion archbishop king craftely perswaded saied byshop make answere would warrant aduised come parliament withoute answere condemned exiled goodes seazed bee article effecte whiche laied sauyng fowre concernyng bishoppe caunterbury whiche onely touched hi workyng vnwrought king richard fro croue much article hemous detestable accusacions laied open parliament thought parte kyng richard worthy deposed al honor rule pryncely gouernance instrumentes autentike solempne depose instrumentes made certain person homagers realme resigne hym homage fealty dewe kyng soueraigne deposicion executed tyme came westminster called great councell nobilitie common entente conclude make expedicion thynges whiche purposed set forward meane season diuerse king richardes seruauntes licence accesse person comforted animated encouraged beyng sorowe withered broken maner halfe deade aduertisyng exhortyng regard welthe saue lyfe firste aduised willyngly suffer self deposed bothe dignitie depriued rich duke lancastre might without murdre battail obteine scepter diademe whiche well perceiued gaped thrusted mene wherof thought shuld per assurance life long continue therfore might commit selfe good hope best felowe companio man aduersitie associat ioyne self withal surely councel good honeste great extremitie yet full effect folowed sequele thyng sheweth apparantely declareth profite honoure suretie bad bene kyng richarde myght whiche professed name title kyng whiche much saie ruler keper people excogitate reme bred haue bene keper owne hedde lyfe whiche nowe beyng forsaken reiect abandoned al euil sheperd herdeman time dyd plie kepe diligently ouerse easily reduced brought hades enemy nowe mastery perswade man beyng desperate pensife ful dolour abdicate selfe empire imperiall preheminence onlie hope life sauegard agreed al thynges hym demanded desired kepers shewe declare duke wold vouchsafe accord come wolde declare secretely thynges hym profitable pleasant kepers sent word saiynges duke whiche incontinent repaired chamber kyng richard comoned many thinges amongest affirmed accusacions muche trewe whiche comminaltie realme alledged say euel gouerned dominion kingdome therfore desyred disburdoned great charge heauy burdein besechyng duke grant safegarde lyfe haue compassion hym nowe time bene bountifull magnificent duke biddyng good comfort fear warranted lyfe wold resigne scepter croune dignitie also nether procure consent thyng act whiche myght hurtfull preiudiciall person succession whiche demaundes graunted frely condiscended agreed duke lancastre nexte daie declared kyng richardes hole mind coucel especially vncle edmunde duke yorke whose helpe much vsed whiche hearyng al thynges broyle day come london noble common well pleased kyng richard shoulde frankely frely owne mere mocion whiche muche desired lest shuld noysed reported thervnto inforced violence constrained resigne croune depart regalitee long caused great assemble apointed towre london kyng richard appareled vesture robe royall diademe head scepter hand came personally cogregacion said wordes effecte richard king england duke fraunce aquitaine lorde ireland confesse say lordes subiectes hole space xxii yere whiche haue obteined possessed rule regiment famous realme england partely ruled euell sinister councell peruerse flatteryng person partely led frailtie young waueryng wanton youth delectacion worldly volupteous appetite haue omitted executed royall office bounden dutie accordyng oughte haue dooen ministeryng iustice prefermente comon wealthe whiche negligence thynke selfe doo sore repente bewayle specially brought poyncte knowledge confesse self worthy longer reigne haue farther rule nother amende misdedees correcte offence whiche suerly entended dooe especially olde age whiche euill thynges accustomed amended fautes offence youth corrected reformed young man comonly befounde indued muche vertue good quality whiche agitate pricked heate youth shall turne decline right pathe direct waie yet cometh ripenes yeres greate grauitie doth amend change ter olde errates wanton actes experience teacheth rugged colte commeth good horse shreude boye proueth good man sithe fortune doth permit suffre thentent publike welth realme maie bee holpen auansed meane like declyne decaye intent shall bee lefull elect chose cosyn germayne henry duke lancastre man mete realme prince apt kyngdom kyng souereigne lorde owne mere mocion frewill putte depose self royall dignite preheminence sofferaignitee resigne possession title vse realme rightes vnto apperteigyng handes possession lamentable voyce sorowfull countenance deliuered scepter croune duke lancastre requiryng euery persone seuerally name graunt assente might liue priuate solitarie life swetnesse whereof would well pleased pain punishement hym go abrode deliuered goodes three hundred thousande pounde coyne beside plate iuels pledge satisfaccion iniuries wronges hym committed dooen soeuer promised disceiued shortly resignacion conueighed castell lede kent thence poumffret wher departed miserable life shall heare herafter firste yere pthe vnquiete tyme kyng henry fourthe hen fame dispersed abrode kyng rycharde putte hym selfe dignitee royallthe yere resigned scepter diademe imperiall henry plantagenet borne bolyngbroke countie lyncolne duke lancastre herfford erle derby lecester lyncolne sonne ihon gaunt duke lancastre one voyce bothe noble comons published proclaymed declared kyng england fraunce lorde irelade daie saincte edward confessor westminster great solemnitee royal pompe sacred enoynted crouned king name kyng henry fourth euer reioysed coronacion whosoeuer delighted high promocio suer edmond mortimer erle marche whiche heire lionell duke clarence thirde begotten sonne kyng edwarde third haue heard richard erle cabrige sonne edmond duke yorke whiche maried anne sister thesame edmonde wer doynges nether pleased contente muche deuisio beyng begon one linage persecuted neuer ceased till heires male bothe line wer battaill murdered sedicion clerely extinct destroyed daie coronacion thentent seme take vpon hym croune scepter royall without title lawfull clayme extorte power iniurious intrusion aduised make title heire edmonde surnamed vntruly fayned crouchebacke sonne kyng henry third saie said edmond elder brother kyng edward first deformitee repudiat put croune royall mother blanche doughter sole heire henry duke lancastre next bloud vndoubtfull heire onely fredes also priuy enemy knewe title title inuentors mischief fayned imagened published wer surely enformed thesaid edmond younger sonne kyng henry third accordyng declared act parliament recited also hauyng true knowledge edmod nether crokebacked deformed persone goodly gentil man valiante capitain somuche fauored louyng father preferre hym mariage quene dowager nauerne hauyng greate liuelode gaue hym countie palatyne lancastre many notable honour high seigniory large priuileges therefore thei aduised hym make clayme newe obteined regiment caused proclaimed published chalenged realme onely conquest also cause kyng richard adopted heire declared successor hym resignacion accepted croune scepter also next heire male bloud royall kyng richard crouned created eldest sonne lorde henry prince wale duke cornwale erle chester beeyng age xij yeres sol ite finished called high court parliament whiche demaunded kynges frendes doen kyng richard bishop carleile whiche man wel lerned well stomacked rose vp said lordes require take hede answere make question thynke none worthy mete geue iudgemente noble prince kyng richard haue taken souereigne liege lorde space xxij yeres assure ranke traytor arrante thiefe cruell murderer whiche apprehended deteigned prisone offence shall bee brought iustice heare iudgemente yet proceade iudgemente anoynted kyng nother answere excuse saie duke lancastre call kyng hath offended trespassed kyng richard realme kyng hath doen hym v manifesty knowen duke banished realme kyng richard counsaill iudgemente owne father space tenne yeres cause knowe yet without license kyng richarde returned realme ye worse hath taken vpon hym name title prehemience kyng therfore say affirme apparantly wrong manifest iniury procede thing kyng richard without callyng opely answer defence bishop ended incontinent therle marshall attached committed ward abbey albones concluded kyng richard continew large prisone bee plentifully serued thynges necessarie bothe viande apparell persones would presume rere warre congregate multitude releue deliuer hym prisone bee first dye sedicious commocion parliamente lorde fitzwater appeled duke aumarle high treason offered fight hym listes royall likewise lorde morley appeled therle salisbury xx appellantes whiche waged battaill parliamente kyng pardoned offence sauyng fautes lorde morley therle salisbury comitted ward request fredes offence wer remitted thei deliuered punished also extremely suche priuie dooers homecide thomas vncle late duke glocester whiche shamefully murdered toune caleis besides auansed frendes called exile richard erle warwike restored erle arundelles sonne owne possession dignite many toke speciall fauor ihon hollande duke exceter erle huntyngdone halfe brother king richard whiche espoused lady elizabeth owne sister beeyng capitain caleis greatly moued inwardly greued kyng richarde brother amoued seate royall began reyse stirre vp newe mocions fedicious faccions within realme wherfore aduoyde suche pestiterus danger newe kyng recociled hym fauor made hym surely coniectured perfite frende deede inwardly dedly enemie parliament wer adnichilate al actes pa ed parliament holden kyng richard xxj yere reigne whiche called euill parliament nobilitee worse menaltie worste comonaltee parliament ruled reason men aliue wer condemned without examinacion men dedde put execucio priuy murder wer adiudged openly die hie prelate realme without answere banished erle arraigned could suffered plede pardon consequently one counsailer al thyng counsailers nothyng affirmyng saiyng esope whiche hearyng feloe saie could thynges saied could nothyng thus reconciled nobilite gat fauor spiritualte wonderfully pleased comonaltee muche pleasyng possessyng croune pleased hymself frendes fauor bothe auoydance al claimes title ambiguitees made vnto croune diademe realme dignitee ligne succession enacted confirmed entayled assent high courte parliamente foloweth worde worde request peticion aswell nobilitie comons parliamente assembled ordaigned established enheritance crounes realmes englande fraunce lordshippes kyng souereigne lorde aswel side sea beyond apperteignyng appurtenaces shall bee vnited remain persone souereigne lorde kyng heires body lawfully begotten especially request assent aforsaid ordeigned established pronounced enacted writen declared lorde prince henry eldest sonne soueraigne lorde kyng shall bee heire apparante successor saied souereigne lorde thesaid croune realmes seigniory haue enioy al appurtenaunces discease saied soueraigne hym heires body begotten die without heires body begotte saied crounes realmes seigniory appurtenance shal remain lorde thomas secod sonne said soueraigne lorde heires body begotten departe without issue body begotten premiss remaigne lorde ihon third sonne heires body begotten dye without issue crounes realmes seigniory aforsaied appurtenance shal remain lorde humfrey iiij sonne said souereigne lorde heires body lawfully begotten whiche acte passed thought neuer bee subiectes molested troubled lorde mutabilitee fortune god chaunge worldely safetie christe stablenes consisteth mannes prouision ferme suerty hath prince throne degree considryng kyng hauyng possession croune realme open parliament agreed prince condiscended clerkes ratified common enacted three estate realme thought hymself surely mortised ferme rocke immouable foundacion sodainly trimbelyng quickesande vnstedfast grounde like haue sonke ouerthrowen diuerse lordes whiche wer kyng richardes frendes outwardly dissimuled whiche thei inwardly conspired determined confounde kyng henry thei bothe sworne allegance doen homage erect set vp old lorde frend kyng richard second case lacked orgaine conueighance bothe secretly serche knowe myndes nobilitee bryng assemble counsail thei might consult comen together bryng efficacite effect long desired purpose secrete enterprise se deuill ready set furth mischief good angell auance vertue time abbot westminster man aparant vertues professyng openly christ christian charitee due subieccion obeisance prince whiche abbot hearyng kyng henry saie erle darby mature age growen grauitee prince litle religeons muche imagined hymself obteinyng croune realme wer therin long continuer would remoue greate beame greued iyes pricked conscience muste vnderstande monasticall persones lerned vnliterate better fed taught toke write regester boke fame noble actes wise dooynges politike gouernances kynges prince whiche cronographie kyng gaue possession graunted liberty exalted honor worldly dignitee called sainct praised without deserte aboue moone geanelogie written one iote might exalt fame ether gotten omitted christian prince touched liberty claimed part iustly possession would haue intermitted holy francheses desired aide comon enemy tonges talked penne wrote tirant depresser holy religion enemie christes churche holy flocke damned accursed persone dathan abiron depe pitte helle wherof prouerbe bega geue blessed take awaie bee accursed thus feare lesyng possession made pay yerely annates romish bishop thus feare correccion honest restraint libertee made ordinary yea almoste obedience prince sue dispensacions exempcions immunitees abbot spake whiche could well forgette saiyng kyng henry beyng greate fauor high estimacion kyng richard called hous daie terme season al suche lordes persones whiche ether knewe thought affeccionate kyng richarde enuious estate auancement kyng henry whose name wer ihon hollande duke exceter erle huntyngdon thomas hollande duke surrey erle kent edward duke aumarle erle rutland sonne duke yorke iho montagew erle salisbury hugh spe ser erle glocester ihon bishop carleill sir thomas blount magdalen one kyng richardes chapell man like hym stature proporcion liniamentes body vnlike birthe dignitee condicions abbot highly fested greate lordes speciall frendes thei well dined thei withdrew themselfes secrete chamber sat doune counsail thei wer set ihon hollande duke exceter whose rage reuen gyng ye iniury doen kyng richard nothyng mitigate mollified rather encreased blossomed declared theim allegeance promised othe confirmed kyng richard brother forgettyng high promocions notable dignity whiche present obteigned high fauor munificent liberalitee saied brother whiche thei wer onely othe allegeance bounde also kindnes vrbanitee insensed moued take part hym frendes also bound reuenged hym cause mortall enemy dedly foe whiche doyng thought policie meter vsed force wittie practise rather bee experimented manifest hostilitee open warre expedicion enterprise deuised solempne iustes enterprised betwene hym xx parte erle salisbury xx part oxforde whiche triumphe kyng henry bee inuited desired moste busely regardyng marciall playe warly disporte sodainly bee slain destroyed meanes kyng richard whiche yet liue restored libertie repossessed croune kyngdome appoincted farther assemble people numbre persones whiche accomplishe performe inuented assaie policie deuise much pleased sedicious congregacion thei onely made indenture sextipartite sealed seales signed handes whiche eche bounde hym selfe endeuoure theim selfes bothe destruction kyng henry creacion king richard also sware holy euangelistes one trewe secrete euen houre point death thynges thus apointed concluded duke exceter came kyng windsore requiryng hym loue bare noble actes chiualrie woulde vouchesafe onely repaire oxford see behold man lie feates warlike pastime also discouerer indifferente iudge ambiguitee arise couragions actes royall triumphe kyng seeyng hymself effectuously desired brother lawe nothing lesse imagenyng whiche pretended gentelly graunted frendly condiscended request whiche thyng obteined lordes cospiracie departed house theinoised set armorer worke trimmyng harneis solemne iustes helme visere two bauiers two plackardes curiously graue conningly costed collers fretted set gilte bullion one company plackard rest port burley tasse lamboys backpece tapull border curace gylte another bande enameled azure one sorte vambrases pacegardes grandgardes poldren pollettes parted golde azure another flocke theym siluer sable mainferres close gantlettes guissettes flancardes droped gutted red spekeled grene one sorte quishes greues surlettes sockettes right side left side siluer spere burre cronet al yelowe diuers colour one band scafferon cranet bard horse white gilte armyng sweardes freshly burnyshed conningly vernished spurres white gilt cole blacke one parte plume white another redde third seuerall colour one ware headpece lady sleue another bare helme gloue dearlyng declare costly base riche bardes pleasant trapper bothe goldesmithes worke embrawdery lesse sumptuously curiously wrought wold aske long time declare euerye man appetite deuised fantasy verifiyng olde prouerbe many heades many wittes duke exceter came house raised men euery side prepared horse harneis mete apte compassed purpose duches wife sister kyng henry perceiued lesse trouble coniectured prepared brother dede eminent hand wherfore wept made great lamentacion duke perceued dolour said besse chaunseth brother king richard deposed dignitie committed harde sharpe prison whiche bene kyng ruled realme noblie space xxii yeres brother exalted throne dignitie imperiall hearte heauie life stoode ieopardie combe clerely cut reioysed laughed triumphed wherfore pray contente may aswell reioyce haue pleasure deliueryng restoryng brother iustly dignite iocond pleasaunt brother vniustly vntrulie depriued disseazed brother sure yf brother prospere shal fall decline brother continue estate magnificece doubte decay ruine suspecte losse life beside forfeyture landes goodes sayd kissed lady whiche sorowful pensife departed toward oxforde great company bothe archer horseman came founde ready al mate confederate wel apointed purpose excepte duke aumerle erle rutland thei sent messenger great haste duke aumerle went westminster se father duke yorke sittyng diner counterpaine endenture confederacie wherof spake bosome father espied demaunded sonne lowely beningly answered myght bee sene touched saint george quod father see force toke bosome perceaued contente sixe signes seales sette fixed whereof seale sonne one sodainlie rose table comaundyng horse sadeled greate furie saied sonne thou trayter thou hast bene traitour kyng richard wilt thou nowe falce thy cosen kyng henry thou knowest wel inough thy pledge borowe mayneperner body body land goodes open parliament goest thou sekemy death destruction holy rode leauer see strangeled gibbet duke yorke mouted horsbacke ride toward windsor kyng declare hole effecte sone adherentes partaker duke aumerle seyng case stode toke horse rode another way windsor riding post thither whiche father olde man could alighted castel gate caused gate shutte saiyng must nedes deliuer key kyng came kynges presence kneled downe knee besechyng mercy forgeuenes kyng demanded cause declared plainely hole confederacie entier coniuracion manner forme haue harde well saied kyng trewe pardon bee fained extreme perill bee kyng duke talked together duke yorke knocked castel gate kyng caused let delyuered endenture whiche taken sonne kynges handes writyng redde sene perceiuyng signes seales confederate chaunged former purpose daie heryng say chalengers al ready defender come deuoir purposed haue departed toward triumphe nexte day prudent forecastyng councel somwhat staied till myght se ayre clere darcke cloude nere place listes nowe beyng aduertised truthe veritie howe destruction deathe compassed lictell vexed great meruclous agonie perturbed vnquieted therfore determined make abode hauyng time loke gase iustes tourneis take hede howe kepe conserue lyfe dignitie place taried tyll knewe way enemy wold set forward shortly wrote earle northumberland high costable erle westmerland high marshal assured frendes al douteful daunger perelous ieopardie coniuratoures perceiuyng lacke duke aumerles coming also seyng preparacion made kynges commyng imagined selfes enterpryse intimate published kyng wherfore thyng whiche attempted priuilie nowe openly speare shilde determined diligent celeritie set forthe aduaunce adorned magdaleue man resemblyng muche kyng richard roiall princely vesture callyng kyng richard affirming fauour kepers deliuered prison set libertie folowed quadrat array entent destroy king henry pernicious venemus enemy owne naturall countrey confederate newe publyshed idole accompanied puissant armie men toke directe way passage toward windsor king henry beyng admonished approchyng fewe horse night came tower london xii clocke mornynge caused maire citie apparell armure beste moste couragious person citie brought iiim archer iiim bill men beside deputed defend citie lordes confederacie entered castel windsor findyng praie determined spede passe forthe london waie changyng purpose returned towne colbroke taried lordes much people folowyng feare entreatie surely beleuyng kyng richard present company king ry issued london twentye men came hounsloe heath pitched campe abidyng commyng enemy aduertised kynges puissaunce el amased feare forthinkyng repentyng begonne busines mistrustyng owne company felowes departed thence barkamstede aucester lordes toke lodgyng duke surrey erle kent erle salisbury one ynne duke exceter erle glocester another al hoste laie feldes baily towne fowre score archer set house wher duke surrey laie house mannely assaulted strongely defended great space duke exceter beyng another inne erle glocester set fier diuers howses towne thinkyng assailantes wold leue assault rescue goodes thing nothyng regarded host liyng without hearyng noiseand seyng fire towne beleuyng kyng come thyther puissaunce fledde without measure saue selfes duke exceter company seyng force townes men encreace fled backeside entendyng repaire armie whiche found dispersed retired duke seing hope cofort fled essex erle glocester goyng toward wale taken beheaded bristowe magdalent fliyng scotland appreheded brought tower lordes whiche fought still towne chichester wer wouded deth taken heades striken sent london taken sir bennet shelley cell sir barnard brokas xxix lordes knightes esquiers sent oxford kyng soiourned sir thomas blonte prysoners executed whe duke exceter hard complices wer taken councellers appreheded frendes alies put execucion lamented owne chaunce bewepte misfortune frendes bewailed fatall end brother kyng richard whose death saw mirrour vnhappy sedition malicious attempte approche wanderynge lurkyng hidyng selfe priuy place attached essex lordshippe plasshey towne duches glocester made shorter hed place especially lordship seduced falcely betrayed thomas duke glocester inward auctour open dissimuler death destruction comon prouerbe verified haue done shall fele oh lord wolde wisshe example many highlye promoted rule mighte memorie mete measure owne iniquitie il doinges force auctoritie power entent exaumples auerte myndes ill doynges vngodly execrable offence magdalein represented person kyng richard amogest rebel diuerse put execucion heades chefe conspiratoures sette polles london bridge feare whiche disposed commit like offence abbot westminster whose house traiterous confederacy conspired hearyng chefetains felowshippe espied taken executed going betwene monastery mancion thoughte fell sodaine palsey shortely without speche ended life whome byshop carlile feare sickenes rendred spirite god one rather desiryng die deathes darte temporall swearde nowe come time al confederate compaignions vnhappye sedicion tasted accordyng desertes painfull penaunce pleasante pastime rather pestiferus obstinacy innocent nocet man vngilty gilty pondered egall balaunce pore king richard ignorant coniuracion kept miserable captiuitie knowyng nothyng sawe chamber king henry adiudged die beyng singed tickeled laste craftie policie enemy wold deliuer outof inward feare aud discord cleane put away ground wherof suche frutes displeasure mighte waie attempted againste man hereafter shoulde ether faine resemble represente persone king richarde wherfore saye commaunded talke condiscended many write knewe tyll dooen confirmed howe euer kyng richarde dyed violent death without infection naturall disease body common fame euery daye serued table costely meate like kyng entent creature shuld suspecte thing done contrary order taken parliment meate set forbidden shuld touch ye smel died famin kynd death miserable vnnatural ye detestable ten time painefull death whiche extremity terrible die thirst standyng riuer starue hunger besette twentie deintie disshes one writer whiche semed haue muche knowledge kyng rychardes affaire saieth kyng henry sittyng table sore sighyng said haue faithefull frende whiche deliuer whose life wil deth whose death wil preseruacion life saiyng muche noted whiche present especially one called sir pier exton knight incontinently departed fro court eight strong person came pomfret commaundyng esquier whiche accustomed sewe take assaye beefore kyng richard shuld vse maner seruice saiyng let eate wel nowe shall long eate kyng richard sate downe dyner serued without curtesie assay muche meruailyng sodaine mutacion thyng demaunded esquier duety sir said otherwise comaunded sir pyers exton newely come king henry heard worde toke caruyng knife hand strake esquier head saiyng deuell take henry lancastre together worde sir pier entered chamber wel armed viii tal men harneis euery man hauing bill kyng richarde perceuyng armed knewe well came confusion puttyng table valiantly toke bill first mannes hand manly defended himselfe slewe fowre short space sir pier benig sowhat dismaied resistyng lepte chaire kyng richard wonte sitte fowre person assailed chased aboute chamber whiche beyng vnarmed defended againste enemy beyng armed whiche valiaunt acte conclusion chasyng trauersing fro one side came chaire wher sir pier stode whiche strooke pollax felled hym ground shortely rid worlde without ether confession receit sacrament knight perceiued deade sobbed wept rent heare criyng oh lord haue done haue murthered hym space xxii yeres haue obeied king honored soueraigne lord noble men abhorre v honest person disdaine v pore people wil rayle crie vpon v duryng naturall liues shalbe poincted finger posterite shal reproued child homecides ye regicide prince quellers thus haue declared diuersities opinion concernyng deathe infortunate prince remittyng iudgement whiche thinke trewe trouthe died violent death darte naturall infirmitie atropos cut line lyfe body embaulmed seared couered lead al saue face entent al men might perceiue departed mortal lyfe conueighed london cathedrall churche saincte paule solempne obsequie thence conueighed la gley buckyngham shire enterred kyng henry v remoued westminster intombed honorably quene anne wife although scottes vntreuly write escaped prisone led verteous solitary life scotlande died buried blacke frier sterlyng trust worlde suretie man hath life constancie mutable comonaltie men maie apparantly perceiue ruyne noble prince whiche beeyng vndubitate kyng crouned anoynted spiritualtie honored exalted nobilitee obeyed worshipped comon people sodainly disceiued theim whiche moste trusted betraied theim preferred slain theim brought vp norished menne maie perceiue see fortune wayeth prince pore men one balance vvhen newes kyng richardes deposyng reported frauce kyng charles court wondered detested abhorred suchean iniurie bee doen anoynted kyng crouned prince hed realme especial waleram erle sent paule whiche maried kyng richardes halfe sister moued high disdain kyng henry ceased stirre prouoke ye frenche kyng counsaill make sharpe warre englande reuenge iniurie dishonor comitted doen sonne lawe kyng richard hymself sent letter defiance england whiche thyng sone agreed armie royall appoyncted spede inuade england frenche kyng stomacked high disple sure inwardly coceiued infortunate chance minde fell old diseace frenisy nede accordyng old prouerbe saile isle ofanticyra isle asia wherein groweth herbe purgeth melacoly therof ca prouerbe go saile anticira saieth goo puro youre melancoly anticyra purge mela colie humor meanes phisicions somwhat releued brought knowledge hymself armie come doune picardy redy trasported englad whe certainly certified kyng richard ded enterprise deliuerace frustrate voyd tharmie scattred departed sonder bvt whe certaintie kyng richardes death declared aquitaynes gascons moste parte wisest men countree fell greate bodely feare dedly dreade lamentyng instabilitee englishe people iudged theim spotted perpetuall infamie brought dishonor losse aunciet fame glory comittyng heynous cryme detestable offece king soueraigne lorde memorie wherof thei thought would neuer buried extincted fered losse goodes liberty thei imagined ciuill discencion intestine deuision realme england bee vexed troubled countree frenchemenne inuade bee destitute lefte voide aide succor englishe nacion citezens burdeaux toke matter sore ye stomacke kyng richard borne brought vp citee lamentyng criyng sithe beginnyng worlde neuer detestable vilanous heynous acte committed whiche beyng sad sorowe enflamed malencolie saied vntrue vnnaturall vnmercifull people betrayed slain contrary law iustice honestie good man iuste prince politike gouernor besechyng god deuoutly knee reuenger punisher detestable offence notorius crime vvhen frenchman whiche haue iyes wakyng serpent perceiued dolor agony aquitaynes gascons wer death prince duke countrymanne thei reioysed aplauded maruelous maners thynkyng theimselfes gascons nowe abhorryng detestyng englishe men dogge adder thei verie easely mighte obtain whole countree douchie aquitaine member territory apperteignyng thei would ether entreatie inuasion moue people beyng amased comfortles shepe without shepeherd beastes without herdman wherfore greate haste slowe spede lewes duke burbon sent angiers wrote diuerse citees tounes confynes aquitain gascon exhortyng large promise flateryng wordes reuolte turne englishe subieccion become vassal croune fraunce al glosyng wordes serued litle al faire promise profited muche lesse people knewe englishe yoke fether yoke fraunce ponderus lede seyng daily frech men vexed molested ther miserable people extreme exaccios intollerable talleges rasyng skinne bone purse botome wherfore thei determined rather abide old subieccion obedience displeasure irrecurable auenture themselfes newe chance doubtfull parell kyng henry beeyng aduertised al frenche attemptes couert conueighances sent lorde thomas percy erle worceter goodly crewe souldiours aquitain aide assist sir robert knolles leuetenante perswade exorte people continewe ancient libertie dewe obeysance erle arriued wisely entreated noble men grauously perswaded magestrates citees tounes gently familiarly vsed tracted vulgare people onely appeased furie malice brought theim louyng vniforme obeysance receiuyng othes obedience loyall fealtie whiche done retourned againe england great thankes kyng charles fraunce perceiued purpose attempte frustrate came good conclusion aquitayne kyng richard deade enterprise england value small purpose determined selfe inuent way howe haue lady isabell doughter somtime espoused kyng richard restored purpose sent solemne ambassade england kyng henry whiche gentely receiued gaue answere wold send commissioner shortely caleis whiche shoulde farther common coclude onely request diuers matter gret effecte efficacie shortely departyng sent edward duke yorke called duke aumerle whiche succeded said duchie father edmond duke yorke littell disseased henry erle northumberland countrei guisnes commissioner assembled diuers place sondry time duke borbon aboue al thynges required name french king master haue quene isabell deliuered englishman continually deny requiryng haue maried henry prince wale man bothe blud age al thinges equall frenche kyng mariage vtterly refused saiyng wolde neuer ioyne affinitie englishe nacion aliance vnfortunate successe began entreate continuall peace whiche request frenchemen refused conclusion agreed truce whiche taken betwene kyng richarde terme xxx yeres renouate confirmed author affirm newe leage concluded confirmed betwene realmes duryng liues bothe prince whiche semeth haue certein colour veritie kyng sent shortly foresaid lady isabell vnder conducte lord thomas percy erle worceter associate many noble honourable personage well woman men hauyng al iewelles ornamentes plate gret surplusage geuen hir kyng whiche brought england sente solemne estate caleis deliuered waleran erle sainct paule lieuetenant french king picardie conueighed father whiche gaue mariage charles sone lewes duke orleaunce frenchman often time required king henry assigne dower al vaine englishemen answered matrimony neuer consummate reason wherof dowable treatie mariage concluded matter seased moued old prouerbe saith winde commeth rain one euil comoly ensueth another duryng time kyng henry vexed vnquieted bothe within realme without ovven glendor squire wale perceiuyng realme vnquieted kyng yet placed lure vnmouable seate entedyng vsurpe take vpon hym principalitie wale name preheminence thesame faire flatteryng wordes large promise enuegled entised allured wilde vndiscrite welshman thei toke hym prince made hym othe aliegeance subieccion whose supportacion beyng elated set vp aucthorite intent bee doubte neighbor made sharpe warre reignolde lorde grey rithen toke hym prisoner promisyng hym libertee dischargyng raunsome would espouse marie doughter thynkyng affinitie haue greate aide muche power wale lorde grey beeyng riche nether substance frendes consideryng offer onely waie releffe deliuerance assented pleasure maried damosell false father lawe vntrew vnhonest periured persone kept hym wife still captiuitee till died cotent heynous offence made warre lorde edmond mortimer erle marche owne lordship wigmore conflict slewe many therles men toke hym prisoner fete ryng hym chaynes cast hym depe miserable dongeon kyng required purchase deliuerance diuerse nobilitie could heare side rather would wished al linage heuen title doubt question vpon cause heare ensued great sedicion thvs owen glendor glorifiyng hymself twoo victory inuaded march wale west side seuerne robbed vilages brent tounes slewe people laden praies bloudy andes returned wale neuer desistyng euil till next yere kyng reised greate armie puissance resist defende malicious attemptes sedicious inuasions shal declared sufficiet first yere kyng henry realme troubled domestical sedicion vexed craftie practice inuencions frenche men inuaded infested frantike waueryng welshemen also fortune hauyng enuy glory fortunate procedyng man muste saied firste yere also arme scottes spere shelde hym realme wherof occasion shall bee declared accordyng scotticall history litle tyme george dunbarr erle march realme made meanes kyng robert scotlande dauid eldest sonne might marie espouse erles doughter called elizabeth deliuered performance thesame mariage kynges handes greate money archebaulde erle douglas heard conclucion disdainyng therle march blud auaunced stocke wherfore ether faire wordes el disbursyng greter money enuegeled kyng roberte scotlande dauid heire refusyng first damosell espoused mariell erle douglas doughter therle marche desired restitucion money kyng gaue many friuolus trifelyng aunsweres wherfore disdainyng bee mocked deluded money wife family fled england henry erle northumberlande entendyng dent swerd reuenge iniury displesure hym kyng comitted doen help borderer brent diuerse tounes slew many person realme scotland kyng roberte beeyng thereof aduertised firste depriued erle george dignitees possession caused goodes bee confiscate wrote kyng englande instantly requiryng hym would truce longer continew ether deliuer possession erle marche traitor rebelles persone realme el banishe exile theim realme territory dominion kyng henry discretly answered herault scotland worde prince ought bee kepte writyng seale ought bee inuiolate consideryng graunted saue conduite erle compaigny would nether without cause resonable breake promise yet deface honor whiche answer declared kyng scottes incontinente proclaime intimate open warre kyng england bloud fire sweard kyng henry perceiuyng policie preuenteth chance gathred assembled together greate armie entered scotlande burnyng townes village castle sparyng nothyng religious house church brent greate parte tounes edenbrough lithe beseged castle maiden edenbrough thende september whereof capitain dauid duke rothsay prince realme archibalde erle douglas many hardy men roberte duke albanie beyng appoyncted gouernor realme kyng sicke vnapt rule sent vnto kyng henry harrold assuryng hym honour would abide tary coming repaire whiche within sixe day would geue hym battaill remoue siege el die kyng beeyng glad ioyous good newes rewarded herault goune silke chayne gold promisyng hym worde prince depart thence abide comyng gouernor sixe day passed ye sixe sixtene gouernor nether apered sent worde winter waxed cold vitaile failed men died flixe rained euery daie habundantly hunger colde caused kyng breke vp siege departe scotland without battaill skirmish offered duryng whiche tyme bothe warden march beyng kyng scottes made rode northumberlande burned diuerse tounes bamborough shere shortly returned el thei trapped come late home kyng england dismis ed souldiers discharged army scottes entendyng bee reuenged greate domages theim englishe nacio doen committed therle douglas appoyncted twoo armyes inuade englande first chieftain sir thomas halibarton dirlton patrike hebburne hale whiche made rode englande returned litle losse greate gain orsaid sir patrike hebburne encoraged boldened prosperous successe first iorney greate armie people lowdian inuaded northumberlande robbyng spoylyng cou tree departed homeward without greate gain beastes captiues returne encoutered therle northumberlandes vicewarden gentilmen border toune northumberlande called ne englshemen sore assailed scottes valiantly resisted long fight victory fell englishe parte ihon mayer scot writeth wer slain flower loughdean especially sir patricke hebburne many linage wer apprehended sir ihon willyam cockeburne sir robert ba ihon thomas hablincton esquiers greate nomber comon people erle douglas sore beyng greued losse nacion frendes entendyng requitement possible thesame consente gouernour scotlande gather houge armie twentie thousande talle menne whiche armie lord mordake earle fife sonne gouernour scotland erle angus many erles baron nobilitie scotland valiaunte capitayns couragious souldioures entered northumberlande banner displayed like menne ether apte thynkyng theim selfes able destroy townes spoyle countrey march northumberlande thei wer entered england thinkyng puissaunce able encounter force valey beside toune called homeldon issued sodainly lorde henry percie scottes haut valiant corage calledsir henry hotspur company lorde george dunbar erle marche banished scotlande haue heard al gentill menne northumberland eight thousande men horsebacke fote encounter sharpe fight daungerous long continuaunce doubtfull felled rescued reseuyng slaine gredy praye stroke fled se baggage kept emongest page thus pure fightyng englishemen fainte hertes bragging scottes brighte beame victory shone sainct george crosse slaine men great renoune estimacion sir iho swinton sir adam gordon sir ihon leuiston sir alexander ransey dalehowse xxiii knightes moo whose name ether ignorance feare reproche hector boece scottish archechronocler kepeth silence dothe omitte beside xm comons wer taken prisoner mordacke erle fife archebald erle douglas whiche combat loste one eye thomas erle murrey robert erle angus writer affirme erls athell montethe vc lord percy thus obtained glorious victory sent prisoner diuerse fortress determyned subdue destroy countreis lowdene marche whose heades gouernours ether slain force taken captiues gret power entered tiuedale wastyng destroiyng hole countrey beseged castell cokelaues wherof capitain sir ihon grenlowe seyng castel long able defended copounded englishman yf castel wer suckered within iii monthes wold deliuer englishe mennes handes capitaine thereof wrote vnto gouernour whiche callyng great councell moste parte aduised hym rather frankely frely yeld castel put ieopardie caste hasard remnaunt florishyng nobilitie realme muche courage abated fumishe crake refrigerat remembraunce last conflicte batail gouernour rebukyng timerous heartes feminine audacitie whether thought questio sware man wold folowe nobilitie woulde deuoire reskewe castell day othe nether kept broken litell preparyng lesse entendyng oth whiche solemply made neuer set fote forward duryng first ii monethes reisyng siege reskewe castel englishe men beyng sent go kyng wale raysed siege departed leauyng noble men prisoner styll earle northumberland lord percie sonne kyng commaunded kepe vse deliuer without assent kyng henry forgat enterprise walesthe second yere made prouision menne municions artillary mete conuenient great businesse whereof frenche kyng beyng aduertised sente priuilie lorde iames burbone earle marche two brother ihon lewes xiic knightes esquiers aide owen glendor inuasions kyng henry toke shippyng xxx saile mouthe seine wynd fauourable purpose coulde neuer approche coaste wale came towne plimmouthe deuonshire leauyng great shippes liyng ancre nyghte toke land brent spoiled destroied diuers small village poore cotages robbed v vi littel craiers fisher botes laden fysshe corne companie like gredy wolfe sekyng praie winde rose highe great tempesteous rage furious storme sodainely flusshed drowned xii great shippes whiche laie mouthe hauen safegard defence wherof erle aduertised perceuyng firyng beacon people began assemble plumpes encounter also seyng power sore diminshed well slaughter suche ranged abrode hope spoyle praye furious rage vnmercifull see hydeous tempest muche paine great labour toke shippes againe without ieopardie lyfe driuen coast britaine landed sainct malos french kyng perceiuyng chace il successe apointed one marshal called memorancie maister crosbowes xiim men saile wale toke shippyng brest winde prosperous landed milford hauen leauing castel penbroke vnassaulted well fortified manned vitailed besieged towne harforde west whiche wel defended erle arundell power much lost gained thence departed towarde owen glendor whome nominated prince wale founde towne dinbigh abidyng comyng ten thousand men wer louingly receiued gentelly enterteined al thynges prepared thei passed glamorgan shire toward worcester brent suburbes hearyng kynges approchyng sodainly retourned wale king great puissaunce folowed founde embattailed highe mountaine gret valey betwene bothe army eche armie plainely perceiued euery hoste loked assauted aduersary groud take aduautage thus cotinued eight day fro mornyng nyght ready abide geue battaile wer many fearce skirmish many propre feates armes daily done whiche french croniclers englishe writer reporte slaine lorde patrioles try brother marshall france lord mattelone lord uale bastarde burbon v hundred gentelmen frenche men welshe men sore trobeled afflicted famine hertes appalled corages sore abated kyng stopped passage nether vitayl succour could way conueighed wherfore necessitie compelled eyther fyghte flee aduisement councell marshall fraunce whiche put muche confidence waueryng welshemen hole hoste departed theight day midnight secretes maner thei could deuise frenche men littel rewardes gaine returned britayne makyng small boast painfull iourney
