kyng seyng departed folowed wale chasing hilles dale dale woddes woddes marishes yet could neuer haue aduauntage world see quotidiane remouyng painfull busi wanderyng troblesome vncertaine abidyng continual mocion daily peregrinacion desert felles craggy mountain bareine vnfertile depopulate countrey thus beyng tossed countrey countrey hill vale marishe wod noughte worsse without gaine profite withoute vitayle succour necessitie copelled retire armie retourne againe worcester whiche retournyng welshemen knowing passage countrey toke certaine cariages laden vitayle great displeasure great comforte came worcester perceiuyng winter approche season yere conuenient proper men warre lie feldes specially suche barraine hilly countrey wale dispersed armie time returned london meane time kyng thus occupied wale certain malicious cruel person enuiyng malignyng heartes king henry contrary opinion many wil mo shortely obteigned possessed realme regalitie blased abrode noised daily amongest vulgare people kyng richard whiche openly sene dead yet liuyng desired aide common people reposesse realme roiall dignitie furtheraunce fantasticall inuencion partly moued indignacion partely incensed furious inalencolie set vpon postes caste aboute stretes railyng rime malicious meter tauntyng verse kyng henry procedynges beyng netteled vncurteous ye vnuertuous prickes thornes serched authours amongest found culpable offence crime sir roger claryngdon knight eight gray frier whiche according merites desertes strangeled tiborne put execucion may forget shewe howe kyng henry sekyng nowe affinitie frendshippe germanie sent yere eldest doughter blaunche accompanied erle sommerset bishop worcester lord clifforde noble personage almaine whiche brought coleyne great triumphe maried willyam duke bauier sonne heire lewes bauier emperour whiche yere also died lady katherine swinsford thyrde wife ihon gaunt duke lancastre father kyng henry buried lincolne yere kyng henry maried iane duches britaine late wife ihon duke britaine citie winchester triumphal pompe conueighed thorow citie london westminster crowned quene thynges thus doyng england waleran erle sainct paule whiche maried halfe sister richard hauyng malicious heart deadly hatred kyng henry assebled great company men warre nomber xvi xviiic whereof greatest parte noble men made great prouisio al thinges necessary feate enterprise sainct nicholas day entered shippes harflete landed isle wight sawe apperaunce defence burned two poore village iiii simple cottage great triumphe noble acte made iiii knightes sodainly aduertysed espial people isle wer assembled approched fight hym al haste possible toke shippes retourned home againe wherwith noble men company much discontente displeased consideryng prouision great gaine smal none season ihon erle cleremount sonne duke burbone wonne gascoigne castelles sainct peter saincte marie newe castell lord delabrethe wonne castell carlaffin whiche small losse englishe nacion duryng time died philippe duke burgoin duke albert bauier erle henault pthe thirde yerethe iii yere yere appered comete blasyng starre houge quantitie long season astronomer affirmed signified great effusion mannes blud iudgement frustrate shal perceiue henry erle northumberland thomas erle worcester brother sonne lord henry percy called hotspur king henry beginnyng reigne bothe fautours frendes aiders perceiuyng nowe pacified domesticall sedicion repressed enemy reduced realm conuenient quietnes began somwhat enuie glory hym grudged agaynste welthe felicitie specially greued kyng demaunded earle sonne suche scottishe prisoner taken conflictes fought homeldon nesbit haue heard captiues whiche taken ther deliuered kynges possession onely mordake earle fife sonne duke albanie gouernour scotland king diuers sondry time therle sonne required percy affirmyng owne propre prisoner peculiar praies deliuer theym vtterly denaied insomuche kyng openly saied wolde deliuer woulde take without deliuerance wherwith beyng sore discotent councell lord thomas percy erle worcester whose study euer procure malice set al thynges broile vncertentie fainyng cause proue tempte kyng came wyndsor requiryng raunsome otherwise cause bee deliuered prison edmond mortimer erle marche cosyn germain whome reported owen glendor kepte filthy prison shakeled yrons onely cause toke parte hym faithful trewe kyng began litell muse request without cause dede touched nere sherte well may perceiue genealogy rehersed beginnyng story edmond sonne earle roger whiche sonne lady philip doughter lionell duke clarence third sonne kyng edward third whiche edmonde kyng richardes going ireland proclaimed heire apparant croune realme whose aunt called elinor lord henry percie maried therfore kyng litell forced although lignage clerely subuerted vtterly extincte vvhen kyng long digested studied matter made aunswere sayd earle marche taken prisoner neither cause seruice willyngly suffered selfe taken woulde take parte againste owen glendor complices therfore woulde nether raunsome releue hym whiche fraude kyng caused openly published diuulged whiche aunswere party angry doubt publyshyng cautell earle marche willyngly taken ten time fumed raged muche sir henry hotspur said openly behold heire realme robbed righte yet robber owne wyl redeme hym fury percy departed nothyng mindyng depose kyng henry high tipe regalitie deliuer set trone cosyn frende confederate edmonde earle marche whome onely deliuered oute captiuitie owen glendor also entered leage amitie said owen king henry al frendes fautours great displeasure long vnquieting kyng henry partaker passe ouer declare howe certayne writer writeth earle marche lorde percy owen glendor wer vnwisely made beleue welsh prophecier king henry moldwarpe cursed goddes owne mouth thre dragon lion wolffe whiche shoulde deuide realme betwene deuiacion deuinacio mawmet merlin wyll reherse howe deputy howse archdeacon bangor seduced falce fained prophesie deuided realme amongest yet write howe tripartie endenture sealed seales englande seuerne trent south eastward assigned erle marche wale landes beyond seuerne westward appoincted owen glendor remnaunt trente northwarde lorde percie declare whiche prophesied confusion destruccion perdicion persones onely geuyng credite suche vain fable also settyng forwarde hopyng attaine effecte thesame whiche especiall lorde percie owen glendor erle marche euer kepte courte vnder suche keper could nether doo attempte thyng againste kyng without knowledge died without issue leuyng righte title interest anne sister heire maried rycharde erle cambrige father duke yorke whose ofspryng continuaunce tyme obteigned game gat garland ye waueryng welshman call prophesies nay call theim vnprofitable practises name diuinacions nay name diabolicall deuises say thei prognosticacions nay thei pestiferous publishinges declaryng credite geuing subtil obscure meanynges prince haue deceiued many noble manne hath suffred many honest man hath begyled destroyed kyng henry knowyng newe confederacy nothyng lesse myndyng happened gathered greate armye goo agayne wale whereof erle northumberlande sonne wer aduertised lorde thomas erle wocester diligence raysed power thei could make sent scottes whiche wer taken prisoner hamaldon aide men promisyng erle douglas toune barwicke parte northumberlande scotishe lordes greate lordshippes segniories thei obteigned vpper hande superioritee scottes allured desire gain malice thei bare kyng henry somewhat desierous reuenged olde greues came erle greate compaignie make cause seme good iuste thei deuised certain article aduise richard scrope archebishop yorke brother lorde scrope kyng henry caused bee beheded bristow haue heard whiche article thei shewed diuerse noble men prelate realme whiche fauouryng concentyng purpose onely promised aide succor wordes writyng seales confirmed thesame howbeit whether wer feare ether thei would lokers dede doer nether promise worde writyng performed al confederate abadoned daie conflict left alone erle stafford excepte whiche beyng haute corage hye stomacke kept promise ioined percy destruccio lorde percy therle douglas erles scotlad greate armie departed northparties leuyng father sicke whiche promised vpon amendment recouery without delay folowe came stafford vncle therle worcester met began consult vpon great affaire high attempted enterprice thei exhorted souldiers compaignions refuse pain auancemente common wealth spare trauell libertie countree protestyngopenly thei made warre onely restore noble realme england accustomed glory fredo whiche gouerned tirant lawfull right kyng capitaines sware souldiers promised fight ye dye libertie countree thynges prepared thei set forwarde towarde wale lokyng euery houre new aide succor noysyng abrode thei came aide kyng owen glendor kyng heryng erles approchyng thought policie encounter welshme ioyne armie include hym bothe partes therefore returned sodainly toune shrewesbury skantely entered toune postes aduertised erles baners displaied battailes ranged wer comyng towarde hym hote coragious thei light horse began skirmishe hoste kyng perceiuyng dooynges issued encamped hymself without estgate toune therles nothing abashed although succor theim deceiued embattailed themselfes farr kynges armie thesame night thei set article wherof spake thomas kaiton thomas saluaine esquiers kyng henry signed handes sealed seales whiche article chronicler saue one maketh mecion cause occasion great bloudy battaile whiche bothe partes wer aboue fourty thousande men assembled worde worde accordyng copie reherce vve henry percy erle northumberland high constable england warden west march england toward scotlande henry percy eldest sonne wardein easte march englande toward scotlande thomas percy erle worcester beyng proctours protectours comon wealth lorde iesu christe supreme iudge doo allege saie entende proue handes personally instante daie henry duke lancastre thy complices fauorers vniustly presuming named kyng englande without title right onely thy guyle force thy fautors thou thyne exile diddest entre englande thou madest othe v vpon holy gospelles bodely touched kissed thee dancastre thou wouldest neuer claime croune kyngdom state royall thyne owne propre inheritance inheritance thy wife englande richard soueraigne lorde kyng thyne raigne duryng terme life gouerned good counsail lordes sp rituall temporall thou hast impri oned thesame thy soueraigne lorde kyng within toure london vntill feare death resigned kyngdomes englande france renounced right theforsaid kyngdomes others dominion landes beyonde sea coulor whiche resig acion renunciaion counsaile thy frendes comp ice open noysyng rascall people thee thy adherentes assembled westminster thou hast crouned thy self kyng realmes aforsaid hast seazed entered castle lordsh ppes perteignyng kynges croune contrary thyne othe wher ore thou art forsworne false also alledge saie entend proue wher thou sworest vpo thesame gospelles thesame place tyme v thou w uldest suffre dismes leuied clergie fiftenes people tallagies tax bee leuied realme england behoffe realme duryng thy life consideracion thre estate realme except great nede cau e importance resistance enemy onely none otherwise thou contrary thyne othe made hast doen bee leuied right many dismes fiftenes imposicios tallagies aswell clergie comonaltee realme englande marchauntes feare thy magestie royall wherfore thou arte periured false also allege saie entede proue thou sworest v vpon thesame gospelles theforsaied place tyme oueraigne lorde thyne kyng richarde reigne duryng terme life royall prerogatiue dignitee thou hast caused thesame soueraigne lorde thine traiterously within tastell poumfret without cosent iudgement lordes realme space fiftene day many nightes whiche horible emong christian people heard honger thirst colde perishe murdered wherfore thou art periured false also alledge saie entend proue thou tyme soueraigne lorde thyne kyng richarde horrible murder ded aboue saied thou extorte power diddest vsurpe take kyngdome englande name honor kyngdome fraunce vniustly wrongfully contrary thyne othe edmonde mortimer earle marche ulster next direct heire england fraunce imediatly due course inheritaunce deceasse theforsaied richard wherfore thou art periured false also alledge saie entend proue aforsaid thou madest othe thesame place tyme supporte maintein lawes good customes realme englande also afterward tyme thy coronacion thou madest othe thesaied lawes good customes kepe conserue inuiolate thou fraudulently contrary lawe englande thy fautors haue written almoste euery shire englande chose suche knightes hold parliament shalbe thy pleasure purpose thy parliamentes iustice bee ministered thy mynde complaintes moued shewed v wherby tyme might haue perfight redresse notwithstandyng wee accordyng conscience truste ruled god haue often tymes therof complained wel testifie bere witnes right reuerend father god thomas arundell archbishop cau torbury richard scrope archebishop yorke wherfore nowe force strength hande lorde iesu christ muste aske remedy helpe also alledge saie intende proue edmod mortimer erle marche ulster taken prisoner owen glendor pitched foughten feld cast prisone lade yron fetter thy matter cause falsely thou hast proclaymed willyngly yelde hymself prisoner thesaied owen glendor nether wouldest deliuer hym thy self yet suffre v kinsman raunsome deliuer hym yet notwithstandyng haue onely concluded agreed thesame owen raunsome propre charge expences also peace betwene thee thesaid owen hast thou onely published declared v traytors also craftely deceitfully imagened purposed conspired vtter destruccion confusion persones whiche cause defy thee thy fautoures complices comen traytoures destroyer rea inuadours oppressoures confounders verie true righte heires croune englande whiche thyng entend hades proue daie almightie god helpyng v vvhen kyng henry ouerseen article defiance answered esquiers redy dent swerde fierce battaill proue quarell false fayned writyng slanderous wordes nd righteous cause iust quarell doubted god would bothe aide assiste hym vntrue persones false forsworne traytours whiche answere messenger departed next daie mornyng early vigile mari magdalene kyng perceiuyng battaill nerer ether thoughte loked leste long tariyng might minishyng strength set battailles good ordre likewise enemy whiche bothe puissance courage nothyng hym inferior sodainly trumpettes blew kynges parte cried sainct george vpon aduersaries cried esperaunce percie furiously army ioyned scottes whiche forward lordes side entendyng bee reuenged old displeasure doen englishe nacion set fiersely kynges forward thei made drawe backe almost broken arraie welshemen also whiche sithe kynges departure wale lurked lien wooddes mountaignes marishes heryng battaill towarde came aide erles refreshed wery people new succurs ferfull messenger declared kyng people wer beaten doune euery side nede bid hym stirre sodainly approched freshe battaill comforted hertened encouraged par thei toke hertes theim manly fought enemi prince henry daie holpe muche father although wer sore wouded face arow yet neuer ceased ether fight battaill moste strongest courage men hertes moste danted greate battail co tinued thre long houres indifferet fortune bothe partes last kyng criyng sainct george victory brake arraie entered battaill enemy fought fiersely auentured far battaill erle douglas strake hym doune slewe sir water lonte three appareled kynges suite clothyng saiyng maruaill see many kynges sodainly arise kyng reised daie many noble feate armes scottes write frenche men affirme though englishemen kepe silence hymself slewe handes daie xxxvj persones enemy parte encoraged doynges fought valiantly slew lorde percie called sir henry hotspurre best capitain part aduerse death knowen scottes fled welshemen ran traitor wer ouercome nether wooddes letted hilles stopped fearfull hertes theim wer vanquished flie flighte therle douglas whiche hast fallyng cragge mountagnie brake one genitals taken valiantnes kyng frely frankely deliuered taken also sir thomas percie erle worcester diuerse kynges parte wer slain sir water blount xvic persones parte rebelles slain erle stafford lorde percie aboue fiue thousand scottes none escaped aliue glorious victory kyng obteigned rendered almightie god humble hertie thankes caused therle worcester morowe mary magdaleine shrewesbury drawen hanged quartered hed sent london whiche place many mo capitaines wer executed greate battaill like triumphante conqueror returned greate pompe london senate magestrates solemply receiued litle reioysyng good fortune fortunate victorye departure shrewesbury forgettyng enterprise owen glendor sent wale great prince henry eldest sonne thesaid owen sedicious fautors whiche beyng dismaied maner desperate comfort reson kynges late victory fled desert place solitary caues receiued afinall reward mete prepared goddes prouidence suche rebell sedicious seducer beyng destitute comforte dreadyng shewe face creature lackyng meate sustain nature pure hunger lacke fode miserably ended wretched life ende prouided suche gaue credence false prophesies ende thei diabolical deuinacions wer promised great possession seigniory ende happeneth suche beleuyng suche fantasticall folie aspire gape honor high promocions prince litle labor lesse losse tamed brideled furious rage wild sauage welshemen lefte gouernors rule gouerne countree returned father great honor small praise erle northumberland heryng ouerthrowe brother sonne came owne free kyng excusyng hymself one nether party knowyng doyng enterprice kyng nether accused held hym excused dissimuled matter ij cause one berwicke possession whiche kyng rather desired haue polici force therle castelles alnewicke warkeworth fortified scottes therle wer appreheded northumberland wer ieoperdy become scottish cause kyng gaue hym faire wordes let hym depart home wher continued inpeace rebelled shall perceiue sequele story pthe fourth yerethe iiii yer yere waleram erle sent pole considryng defied kyng henry also made diuerse voyage doen litle damage englishnacion susteigned muche losse continuyng olde malice kyng england assent frenche kyng assembled great numbre men warre vc men armes vc genewaies crosebowes flemynges fote laied siege castell marke thre leages fro caleis within territory kyng englande xvi daie iuly wherof capitain philip halle esquier lxxx archer xxiiii souldiers therle raised castle diuerse engine thei preuailed thei within shot fersly cast stone incessantly toke suche paine hearer almoste incredible erle perceiuyng feate suche successe loked retired men lodged toune fortifiyng thesame fere rescous might issue caleis next day gaue sore assaute great force entered vtter court castle toke therin great number horse kyen catell whiche assaut sir roberte barenguile cosin therle slain thesame daie c archer horseback comyng caleis lawe perceiued dooynges demeanure therle compaignie toward night thei sent heraulte certefiyng hym would dine hym nexte daie proudly answered would gladly receiue dinnar comyng redy prepared nexte daie ensuyng issued caleis cc men armes cc archer ccc fote x xii chariottes laden vitail artillery conducted sir richard astone knight leuetenant englishe pale erle somerset capitain generall march whiche good ordre battaill marched toward enemy whiche espial wer aduertised comyng notwithstandyng thei issued lodginges encounter kept self within closure englishman shot sharply closly together flemynges fotemen began flie men armes feryng slaughter horse ran awaie light gallop genowais whiche spent part shot thassaut made litle defence small resistence slain put flight hasty rashe erle sent paul diuerse without stroke geuen enemy fled sent omers wer taken best armie frenche duche chronicle reporteth thre foure score persones emongest capitain bullayne one many lordes kinghtes slain englishman taken carte municions vitailes enemy brought thether thei returned caleis greate triumphe within fiue day issued englishe pale numbre vc men towarde arde night tyme thynkyng haue found toune vnprouided sir mansard de boy lorde kygnie defended let englishemen purpose losse fourty men thei returned caleis whiche dedde persones wer brent old hous enimies ignorate damage englishemen sustained therle sent paule beyng terwin imaginyng recouer somewhat losse honor sente greate compaignie noble men valiant personage cocluded inuade march enemy frenche kyng consideryng erles euil fortune vnfortunate chance comauded hym leue enterprise whiche sore displeased yet auoyd perelles frenche kyng laid garrison bullein place marque pownt sonne duke barr therle dampnay sir ihon harpadane knight greate renoune high estimacion kyng england circuspectly forseyng thynges come imagenyng frenchemen attempted newe enterprice hym dominion beyonde sea sente iiiim men caleis sea whereof iiim landed sluce whiche besi ged castle standyng mouthe hauen made diuerse assautes lost diuerse compaignie newes brought theim duke burgoyne required licence frenche kyng besiege toune caleis whiche cause thei raised siege returned defence fortresse desired praie frenche nacion pthe fifthe yerethe v yere aboute season loys duke orliaunce brother frenche kyng man lesse pryde haute courage wrote letter kyng henry aduertisyng hym perfighte loue whiche bare noble feates chiualrie marciall actes auoidyng slowe worme deadely dormouse called idlenes ruine realmes confounder nobilitie obteignyng laude renoune deades armes manly enterprise coulde imagine inuent nothyng either honorable laudable mete feld eche parte hundred knightes esquiers beyng gentleman bothe name armes armed al pointes furnished speares ax swerdes dagger fighte combate yeldyng euery person god shal send victory haue prisoner raunsome pleasure offeryng hym selfe company come citie angulesme kyng england wolde come laundes burdeaux defend chalenge kyng england whiche graue wittie duke light couragious wrote hym againe littell mused muche meruailed duke beyng sworne aswell kyng richard mainteyne peace beetwene brother frenche kyng theym concluded set signe great seale wolde nowe vainglory vnder colour doyng dedes armes onely violate peace breake amitie betwene concluded also geue occasion displeasure ingratitude whiche conclusion might rise mortall war deadely enemitie affirmyng farther kyng anointed dutie ether bound obliged answere chalenge pere egall estate equiuolent dignitie christian prince ether ought shoulde consent warre effusion christen blud onely defence realme conquest right amplifiyng christes faithe christian religion pride worldly ame vainglory declaryng also oportunitie time conuenient leisure serued wold trans ret passe sea himselfe suche company thought conuenient countrey gascoigne whiche time duke myght set forward band attainyng honour accomplishing couragious desire haute enterprise promising worde prince thence depart till duke ether fulfillyng owne desire singuler combate betwene two onely auoidyng effusion christen bloud shoulde thinke satisfied fully answered howbeit time beyng enbusied weightie affaire vrgent cause concernyng publike welth realme could neyther apoint time place protestyng deferryng time nether disdaine yet cowardnes abate pride whiche knowyng fering reproche regarded othe writyng seale answere duke orleaunce replied kyng henry reioyned doynges vnprincely tauntes vncharitable checkes co teigned rehersyng againe thinges declared omitte put obliuion duke orleaunce content king england assembled armie vim men entered guien besieged town uergy wherof capitaine sir robart antelfelde valiant knight hardy captain hauyng onely thre hundred englishman duke almoste euery day assaulted towne fiersely within towne conragiously defended muche lien thre monethes loste many men nothyng gotten without honour spoile returned fraunce admiral britayne whiche beyng highly elated muche encouraged laste yere taken certaine englishe shippes laden wine accompanied lord castyll valiant baron britaine xiic men armes xxx shippes sailed sainct malowes came towne darthmouthe woulde haue landed puissaunce townsman aide countrey repulsed put backe whiche conflicte lorde castell two brother foure hundrede slain aboue two hundred prisoner taken raunsomed wherof lord baqueuile high marshall britaine one whiche brought kyng redemed admiral sory infortunate enterprise muche losse gain returned hastely countrey kyng henry aduertised attempt sent lord thomas sonne whiche duke clarence sea gret nauie shippes entent eyther battaill depopulacion sea coastes bothe britaine fraunce reuenge iniurie inuasion sailyng sea costes landed diuers time fiered shippes brent townes destroied people without fauoure mercie thoughte quarell well reuenged sailed toward england retournyng encountred two great carickes ieane laden riche marchandise substancial stuf betwene greate conflicte blouddy battell long fightyng englishemen preuailed brought bothe carickes camber rye one misauenture fier perished losse gaine bothe party time ihon duke burgoin whiche long laboured obteined licence besiege towne caleis preparyng enginnes ladder carte instrumentes necessary conuenient great feate notorious siege assembled omers vim men armes xvc crosbowes beside xiim fotemen hauyng vitail bumbardes municions warre sufficient conuenient abrode blowen enterprise thynges wer prepared hole army assembled french kyng councell whiche put diffidence exploite glorious busines countermaunded prohibited farther procede weightie purpose cause conceiued great hatred deadely malice duke orleaunce onely stop let glory renoume euer maligned grudged procedynges also shal shortly heare brought death finall destruction pthe sixt yerethe vi yere yere earle northumberland whiche bare still venemous scorpion cankered heart coulde desist inuent deuise way meanes howe reuenged kyng henry fautours began secretely communicate interior imaginacions priuie thoughtes richard scrope archebishop yorke brother willia lord scrop treasorer england kyng henry haue hearde beheaded towne bristow thomas mowbrey erle marshal sonne thomas duke norffolke kyng henry cause banished realme england lordes hastynges fauconbridge bardolfe diuerse whiche knewe beare deadely hate inward grudge toward kyng long consultacion finally concluded determined amongest theym al frendes alies power shoulde mete yorkes wold day appointed therle northumberlad chefetaine supreme gouernour armie promised bryng great nomber scottes sedicious conspiracy secretely kept closely cloked kyng thereof knowledge fully aduertised wherfore preuent time assembly suche power could sodainly gather together al diligece marched toward north party vsed celeritie iourney thither come al hoste power confederate hearde inkelyng marchyng forward sodainly wer apprehended archebishop earle marshal sir ihon lampley sir robart plumpton personnes wer arrained atteinted adiudged die monday n whitson weke withoute citie yorke beheadded necessitie oughte forgeate howe folishe fantasticall personnes haue written howe erronius ipocrites sedicious ass haue endited howe supersticious frier malicious monkes haue declared diuulged contrary goddes doctrine honour prince common knowen veritie howre execucio bishop execucioner desired haue fiue stroke remembraunce fiue woundes christ kyng time sittyng diner v stroke necke person inuisible incontinently strike leprey whiche manifest lye shal plainely perceiue shall man say suche writer toke vpon knowe secretes goddes iudgement shall men thinke suche beastly person whiche regardyng bounden dutie obeisance prince souerain lord enuied punishment traiters torment offeders shall men coniecture suche whiche fauouryng worldly dignitie priuate auctoritie peculiar profit wil thus iuggle raile imagine fantasy soueraigne lord prince put theim memorye miracle dishonor perpetual infamy wel let wise men iudge haue said beside person diuers thesaid conspiracie faccio lord hastinges lord fauconbridge sir ihon coluile dale sir ihon griftith beheaded durham therle northumberland hearyng councel reueled confederate put execucion shameful death fled scotland old frend george dunbarre earle marche yere renoked exile restored possession name dignitie taried tyll nexte somer sailed frauce flaunders desyryng aide assistence againste kyng henry sawe littel hope comfort fewe willyngly ententife request accompanied lorde bardolffe muche dismaied desperate returned trew frendes scotlande made abode hole yere abydyng fauour fortune chaunge vnfortunate chaunce duryng whiche tyme kyng withoute difficultie toke possession towne barwicke castelles alnewyke fortress appertainyng earle liyng berwycke caused put deathe baron sonne greystocke sir henry beynton ihon blenkensoppe fiue fautoures worker newe inuented conspiracy kyng thus appeased asswaged late begonne commocion sent son prince wale accompanied edward duke yorke great puissance encounter scottes promise wer bound ayde assiste confederate rebelles thei hearyng founder warre apprehended put deathe made haste f ward taried peacibly home prince entryng scotland findyng resistence brent tounes spoyled village wasted countrey euery passed whiche thyng muche amased kyng scottes councel notwithstandyng gathered appoincted greate hoste vnder conducte erles douglas bowgham resist prince inuasions yet sente ambassador hym requiryng hym peace finall concord whiche requeste vtterly denaied humble peticion graunted truce certaie monethes whiche bothe glad ioyouse prince laden pray spoile retourned great gain father prince thus infected countrey scotlad land sir robart umfreuile vice admirall england vexed cou trey fyffe loghdian sea coast liyng scottishe sea xiiii day euery daie landed one side toke praies spoyles prisoner gre gret power duke albanie erle douglas insomuche brent toke town peples faire day caused men mete clothe bowes great gain retournyng shippes brent galiet scotland many vessel sente clothe vitail diuers marchandises euery towne northumberland settyng thereon great price wherfore scottes called robyn mendmarket kyng time newely vnquieted perturbed notwithstandyng fortunate successe obteigned outward warres interiour affayres yet people bare suche cankered hearte towarde hym expell hym rule dignitie left occasion vnsought deuice vnattempted sodainly sprage fame vncertain auctour king richard yet liuyng scotland whiche fable suche credite geuen prudente policie forsene sequele kendeled greatter flame within short space might haue well bene quenched extincte pthe seuenth yerethe vii yere sommer pestilenciall plage infected citie london countrei roud king durst repaire thither yet nere confines wherfore departyng castel lede determined take ship quinboroughe isle shepey sail ouer lye essex plasshey passe time til plage seased certain pyrates fraunce lurkyng temmes mouthe waityng pray thomas lord camois certaine shippes warre appointed wafte ouer king kyng see middest iourney whether wind turned lord camois kept directe course shippe slugge frenchemen whiche al similitude knowledge kynges passage entered amongest kynges nauie toke fowre vesselles nexte kynges shippe one sir thomas rampston knight kinges vicechamberlain chamber stuffe apparel folowed kyng nere shippe nat bene swift landed soner frace essex goddes prouision fortunate chaunce escaped daunger ariued appointed porte kyng beyng sore moued lord camois caused atta hed endited condiscended agreed frenchemen kyng iourney intercepted taken poinct arraigned last day october edmond erle kent day high stuard realme day giltie giltles fautie clere culpable innocent fact doyng peres found giltie dismissed barre hauyng restitucion bothe landes goodes office yere kyng henry onely desiryng newe affinitie forein prince also preferment line progeny sent lady phylip yonger doughter ericke kyng denmarke norwey swethen whiche conueighed thither great pompe muche triumphe maried said kyng tasted bothe welthe wo ioye pain season died sir robert knolles knight man great policie wisdome experience war bene capitayn time kyng edward iii till latter dayes whiche beyng gouernour aquitayne encombred age resigned office sir thomas belfford valiaunt capytaine retourned london disseased honorably buried churche white fryer pthe eyght yerethe viii yere haue heard kyng robert scotlande aged impotent able rule gouerne realme walter brother beeyng hym created duke albani whiche firste duke euer scotlande made gouernor brother countree dominion whiche office preheminece hym obteigned sore thirsted croune scepter royal cared litle though kyng brother two sone christes fote heuen somwhat purpose vnfortunatly chaused dauy rothesay prince realme eldest sonne kyng accused father diuerse heynous crime especiall lasciuious dissolute liuyng rauishyng wiues deflouryng virgin defilyng maiden wherfore kyng deliuered hym brother gouernor trustyng good counsaill discrete aduertisemente would onely amend life also fall wisedom prudence grauitie whe duke possessed part desired pray sent nephewe fro castle castle prisone prisone place place conclusion lodged toure within castle franckelande famyne caused miserably ende life puttyng poore woman painfull death whiche gaue prince milke brestes rede prisone death long hidden king father conclusio gouernor shewed king diuerse persones traiterously murdred hym whiche wer apprehended iudged die yet liues thei neuer knewe yet saw hym kyng notwithstandyng brother excuse doubted muche thend sonne named iames wherfore priuely prouided ship whiche put child beyng age ix yeres vnder tuicion lorde hery senclere erle orkeney willyng couey prince realme frauce possibilitie could thether attain fortune driue hym ye cost england wrote letter kyng england tenor wherof insueth robert kyng scottesa letter sente kyng scottes sendeth gretyng kyng henry englande although relacion persones haue knowen tyme magnanimitie clemencie infinite vertues planted roted royall persone yet voyage self personally last made scotlad haue manifest open experience thesame whe like enemy inuaded countrie brent tounes destroyed people yet fauor shewed suche place people whiche receiued fostered noble father fled englad feare rebelles whiche sore afflicted lande haue receiued almoste muche profit aduantage hurte damage terrible warres bloudy inuasions wherefore cannot laud praise highnes iudge noble herte mete kyngdo also loue cease loue duryng naturall life notwithstandyng realmes nacions daily contende make warre glory rule empire yet v bothe beyng kynges suche occasion geuen thei folowe steppe progression whiche duetie kyng oughte striue shall prosecute moste humain fauor continual clemencie muche maie felowes compaignios alies singuler loue perpetual amitie suche cause different discencion betwene v realmes part shall endeuor self bryng thynges good co clusion mutuall conformitie thesame trouble perplexitie child father rebelles englande compelled necessitie desire aide seke coforte forain prince strange nacions although help god power people able inough kepe thesame outwarde power forain attemptes yet secrete malice suche lurke bee daily norished bosome cannot kepe theim suertie within myne owne dominion yet place thei bee pestiferous conspiracy put sure defence perfight sauegard except thei preserued faith fidelitie good iust men worlde tyme full malice replenished rancor wheresoeuer golde siluer whiche bee instrumentes mischief maie enter penetrate shalbe founde minister prone redy perpetrate al detestable crime mischeuous inuencions knowe perceiue person endued many notable vertues adorned magnanimitie fidelitie iustice clemencie finally onely r plenished whole compaignie felowship vertues moral also power rich puyssance prince tyme maie highnes ether compared assimuled beyng noble notable quality allected encoraged moste hertely require helpe humbly desire aide relefe comfort mine eldest sonne dauid suspect fame runeth althoughe cannot yet thereof make perfight proffe murthered comen murther open thefe notorious malefactor furious persone brother vncle whiche ought haue protected saued comitted gouernance child whole realme whiche vnnaturall kinseman hath killed child hath shamefully slain murdered hym moste cruell miserable kynd death famyne ought whose duety haue aduoyded put fro iniuries persones hath afflicted moste contumelie greatest iniury manifest damage euer subiecte attempt prince brother brother enemy kinseman made gouernor withstand power malice mine outward enemy compasseth imagineth destroy myne issue consequently myne owne persone wherfore fauor bere iustice sent god mankinde naturall loue fatherly affeccion bere child posteritie humbly require hertely desire magnificece mine onely child onely maie safely surely liue vnder defence proteccion also accustomed goodnes vouchsaue preserue defende onely heire posteritie malicious attemptes cruell kynred ambicious consanguinitie rather remembrance father chance whiche necessitie found muche humanite nacion also frailtie worldly suretie whiche assone changeth good euill euill worse faire redolet flower daie florisheth morow widreth sodainly vadeth requiryng haue remembraunce prince put whole confidence comon people whiche variable wethercocke wynd haue outward frendes forain amitie empire fallyng regiment britell prince coupled chaines indissoluble amite mutually faithfully defende comen enemy aduoyde manifest iniuries power strength comen people ether hurte cast theim throne suche suertie kyng garnished loue fauor amitie outward prince louyng neighbor wherfore may seme expedient high wisedome lowly requeste louyng suete whiche thynke clemencie wil reiect refell desire accordyng last truce concluded betwene v whiche conteigned men conueighyng letter one v suerly sauely passe repasse without cotradiccio would plese breke deny thesaid liberty berer sone honor kepe promise sincerly inuiolated faithfully obserued thus gracious god preserue noble person royal estate long continew vvhen thynges necessary prepared mariner halsed vp ankers departed ba castle young prince henry percie sonne lorde percie slain shrewesbury rigor tempest wer driuen cost holdernes called flamborough hed xxx daie marche yong prince refreshe hymself toke lande wroughte priuely knowen taken copany conueighed kyng beyng windsore dew reuerece deliuered father letter whe letter redde vnderstand kyng assembled counsail knowe doen noble enfant continual warres daily battail bothe displeasat odious affirmed could happen better surer occasion peace amitie betwene bothe realmes whiche beyng offred thei would wise reiected taken consideryng prince sent thither trust sauegard hope refuge request aide comfort euill willers malicous enemy whose opinion toke place affirmed hym prisoner bee ordered asmuche taken warre beeyng open father onely maintayne therle northumberland rebelles within countrie geue greate honor also sent greate nombre nobilite kyng battaill shrewesbery wherfore agreed deteined prisoner lawfully taken duely appreheded tidynges difinitiue sentence shewed father tooke suche inwarde conceit sore penciffenes ended naturall life within fewe monethes although takyng young prince first tyme displeasant realme scotlande yet surely region greate cause reioyse thanke god fortunate chaunce good lucke insued tyme people scotlande wer rude rusticall without vrbanitie hauyng litle lernyng lesse good maners good quality least prince beeyng xviij yeres prisoner within realme instructed taught scholemasters pedagoges apointed onely clemencie kyng onely florished good learnyng freshe litterature tyme serued also excelled poynctes marciall feates musicall instrumentes poeticall artes liherall science muche returne captiuitee furnished realme bothe good learnyng ciuill policie whiche barbarous sauage rude without al good nurtur pthe nyneth yerethe ix yere therle northumberland whiche fraunce region obteigne aide kyng henry misled purpose putte whole confidence scottes especiall olde frende george erle marche assembled great power sctotish nacion inuade northumberland recouered diuerse owne castle seign ories people without nombre daily resorted wher fore entendyng bee reuenged olde greues accompaignied lorde bardolffe diuerse scottes englishman entred yorke shire began destroy depopulate countrie wherof kyng beyng aduertised caused greate army bee assembled marched toward enemy kyng came notyngham raufe rekesbie shrife yorke shire middest february power countrie sodainly set therle compargnie place called bramham long fightyng erle lorde bardolffe many wer taken brought yo ke executed heddes sent london kyng hauing knowledge diuerse pirate wer wanderyng cost englande prepared great armie furnished men vitaile municions warre mete conuenient suche enterprice beginnyng marche sent sea lorde edmond hollande erle kent chieftain crewe armie erle searched coaste fraunce founde one pirate robber aduertised espial thei heryng armie wer diuerted partes britayn wherfore said erle entendyng reuenged whiche sought made course thether arriual thei conueighed shippes hauens could fight sea wherfore launched botes fierce souldiers toke land fiercely assaulted towne briake standyng sea side citiezens threwe dar e cast stone shotte quarelles manfully defended walles whiche conflicte earle receiued wound head departed world v day assailantes dismaied set fire death captaine like men desperate styll assaulted towne fine force entered set fier slewe would make resistence lacke captain men warre laden praies prisoner returned againe englande edmond erle kent suche fauour kyng henry alonely aduaunced promoted highe office great preheminences also meane small coste obteigned eldest doughter one heires lord barnabo millaine brother lord galeace whose sone also called galeace murderyng vncle barnabo made himselfe first duke millaine mariage lord barnabo paied hundred duccates churche saint marie oueryes southwarke day solempnite doen alphos de caniola lucie death husband issue moued kyng mary bastard brother earle dorcet man aged il visaged whose person nether satisfied fantasy whose face pleased appetite wherfore preferring mind kynged desire delityng whiche shoulde satisfie wanton pleasure gaine profite loue toke husband henry mortimer goodly yong esquier bewtifull bacheler cause kyng onely displeased also mariyng withoute licence seassed fined great money whiche fine kyng henry v bothe released pardoned also made knyght promoted hym great office england normandie whiche sir henry issue lady anne maried sir ihon awbemond mother elizabeth chandos mother phillis maried sir dauie halle capitayne caen also issue mari maried ihon cheddur luce espoused sir ihon cressy yere reason frost shepe birdes died without nomber whiche continued fiftene weekes pthe yerethe x yere aboute time ihon duke burgoine man quicke witte desirous rule haute courage great auctoritie amongest frenche nacion whome ciuill discorde pleasure faternall amirie mutuall concorde began sore grudge maligne lewes duke orleance brother french kyng chefe kynges councell ordered al thinges discrecion king brother haue heard fallen frensy therfore medled nothyng duke orleance otherside beyng highly set vp pride began disdain froune duke burgoin perceiued aspired gaped haue supreme regimente publike affaire weightie cause thus one would haue superior would haue pere cancard disdain shorte space grewe suche hate realme france deuided two faccions thone parte fauoryng duke orleance enclinyng duke burgoyne whiche deuision almoste brought realme france vtter ruine perpetuall confusion frenche kyng beyng somwhat amended dissease heryng controuersie betwene two prince set theim bothe paris reproued pride rebuked malice taunted vngodly dooynges muche nobilitie beyng present iudged displeasure haue bothe forgotten forgeuen high corages sone abated roted malice hast plucked vp duke burgoyne still co passyng destruccion duke orleance appoyncted secrete frende called raffe actouille bryng purpose passe raffe forgettyng enterprise assembled together compaignie suche person moste trusted wolffe gredy pray duke orleance commyng court night season fiersly set vpon hym shamefully slewe hym murder published king lameted noble grudged comon people cried god vengeance duke burgoyne iustified act mouth master ihon petit doctor deuinite whiche wrested scripture doctor far course iustificacion within fewe yeres adiudged heresy whole vniuersite paris french kyng lest greater mischief ensue compelled hide cloke inward affeccion dolorus herte dissimule matter doubtyng lest duke burgoyne whose herte haute corage well knowen proceade hym euill acte would ioyne take part englishe nacion realme france wherefore long consultacion entreatie kyng prince bloud royall charles duke orleance sonne duke lewes lately murdred ihon duke burgoyne reconsiled brought fained concord fainte agremente eche theim takyng corporall othe vpon holy euangelistes neuer disagre renewe displeasure thyng passed preuaileth othe hertes still burne malice continually smoketh careth periury whe apetite reuegyng daily encreaseth case duke orleance whiche perceiuyng king vncle beare duke burgoyne let detestable murdre father lightly passe without pain punishmet alied confederated hymself duke berry burbon erles alaunson arminacke whiche reised agreate puissance people defied duke burgoin coplices mortall foo dedly enemy duke burgoine feryng sequele matter ther macio mariage betwene prince wale doughter somwhat bolder send kyng england aide succor enemy kyng henry lesse forseyng whiche ensued whiche discord two great prince might turne realme profit honor sent duke burgoine thomas erle arundell sir gilbert umfreuile lorde kyne sir robert umfreuile sir ihon grey xijc archer whiche toke shippyng douer landed sluce thenglishmen wer ariued flaunders duke burgoin thenglishmen power rode daie night til came nere paris ther next daie hard fightyng coragious shotyng englishman gat bridge saint clow whiche passed ouer riuer saine toke slewe souldiers whiche duke orleance left garrison defend bridge emongest sir mansard de boy valiant capitain taken prisoner englishemen highly raunsomed duke orleace compainy whiche wer like haue compassed enemy almost al way refuge stopped enclosed night tyme made bridge ouer riuer part saint denis strete escaped fled highe cou try conflicte duke burgoyn beyng ruffe thinkyng man ether aucthorite bloud equiuolente person blinded kall vainglory iyes toke vpo hole rule gouernance realme ordered kyng pleased kinges wil thinkyng trobelous season vnknit knot ambiguity doubtes perceiuyng al thynges haue better succeded purpose imagined dismissed thenglishmen countrey geuing harty thankes great rewardes doyng king hery much disalowed consideryng sent away defence great brunt war wer ouerpassed shuld haue taken hede policie enemy practised puissance thei assembled well remebred one faire day assureth good sommer one fliyng swalow prognosticateth good yere pthe eleuenth yerethe xi yere kyng henry beyng quiet molested ciuil discencion domesticall faccions called high court parliamente whiche concluded diuerse actes mete expedient publike welth realme people exalted promoted thre yonger sonnes hie honor lorde thomas duchie clarence lorde ihon duchie bedford lorde humfrey duchie glocester lord thomas halfe brother erle dorcet made duke excester howbeit writer saie erected estate dignitie kyng henry v first yere reigne whiche thyng nether materiall disputable consideryng none issue pthe twelfth yerethe xii yere vuhile thynges wer thus doyng england iho duke burgoyn ruled rost gouerned kyng charles frenche kyng whole realme muche stomaked enuied duke orliace fautors caused frech kyng person arme adherentes traitor hym aparat enemy comon weith sent diuerse capitaines inuade landes territory countrees poytiers angulesme seigniory aperteinyng belongyng homage obeisance duchie aquitain guien wherfore duke orleance berrie burbon fre de alies seyng onely hope consisted kyng england sent hym alberte aubemound man lesse lernyng audacite yet lesse audacitie wit policie whiche name confederate offred certain codicions shal accordyng myne aucthor truly reported whiche wer made co cluded yere lorde mcccc ij viij daie maie first thesaid lordes offred fro thece furth thei expose set furth owne person finance lades serue kyng england heires successor souer thei wer required called iust quarelles whiche iust quarelles kyng englade shall take aperteigne duchie guyen appurtenance affirinyng thesaid duchie perteigneth ought apertain hym righte lineall heritage lawfull successyon manifestyng thence furthe thei blemishe spotte truthe fidelite assist aide hym recoueryng thesame duchy also thesaied lordes offered sonnes doughters nephewes neces parentes subiectes contract mariage accordyng discrecion kyng englande also thei offred tounes castle tresures generally al goodes ayde kyng heires successor fence rightes quarels bonde allegiance might saued another secrete apointement declared also thei offred kyng england generally al frendes adherentes alies wel willers serue quarel recouery hole duchie guien also cease al fraude sayd lordes recognised ready affirme saied duchie guien belong kyng england like semblable wise liberty franchise euer said kynges predecessor held possessed also said lordes knowledged al townes castels fortress within duchie guien holde kyng england trewe duke guien promisyng seruice homage best maner suche case might also promised deliuer kyng much laie townes castelles apperteinyng roialtie seignorie england whiche nomber xx townes castels regarde townes fortress whiche puissaunce seigniory would healpe kyng england heires deputy winne men sufficiente number propre charge expences also kyng england agreed duke berry trewe uncle anduassal one holdeth landes prehem n ce fealtie homage vassalle duke orleance lubiecte vassalle earle arminacke shoulde holde hym homage fealtie landes seigniory hereafter folowyng saye duke berry holde countie pontiew duryng life duke orleaunce hold countie augulesme duryng life onely countie perrigot euer erle arminacke holde iiii castels vpon certain surety condicions indenture appointed offer couenauntes agrementes affirmed kyng england duke guien ought defende succour men lord soueraigne conclude treatie leage duke burgoine brother child frendes alies fvrthermore kyng england ought ayde sayd lordes trewe vassal iuste quarels recoueryng damage iniuries wrongfully done also required kyng england send viii thousand men ayde againste duke burgoine whiche daily prouoked french kyng make open warre landes seigniory promisyng farther dis ource pay al costes charge whiche sayd armie englishman expend duryng warre whiche letter written viii day may kyng henry louingly receiued gentely entertayned messenger alberte well debated considered case first detesting abhominable murder late duke orliaunce seyng iustice ministred punishment done shamefull acte hauyng also approued experience duke burgoine wolde kepe longer promise selfe listed secondarily consideryng large offer prince made bothe greatly honour high profit commoditie realme subiectes thought bounde office kyng ayde succour theym whiche cried iustice could haue none especiall point beyng subiectes vassalles ought defended maintenaunce superioritie seigniorie wherfore louyngly promysed aide relefe returne messenger pleasant deliuerance captiue fro sore imprisonment marchant passyng way beset theues beyng reskewed frendes copanions without cause french king courage animated maliciously encesed duke burgoyn persecuted faction orliaunces citie citie towne towne power extremitie thei wer bothe force necessitie compelled repaire citie bourges berry appoincte theym selfes ther render defend ye must vnderstand prince somtime haueargus son aristor v king argiues fain hym haue hundred iyes sygnifiyng ther wysewme circumspeccion argus iyes andmidas poetes fa e haue longe eares signifiyng hereby kynges heare farre midas eares feate secretly wrought england apparantly espied fraunce wherefore french kynges counsail sent earle paule olde cankered enemy englishman party picardy fiften c horseme great nomber fotemen ordeined certain men geue assaulte toune guisnes stode stale lie waite relefe myght come caleis furious frenchman brake fewe old pale pore men gardeins guisnes men warre castell shotte fiercely arowes caste oute wildefier suche abundance assailantes faine retire erle sainct paule whiche neuer wonne gain lost honor englishe men handes returned onely losse people defrauded desired pray returned toune saincte quintins pthe xiii yerethe xiii yere frenche kyng meane seaso enticement duke burgoine layd sege citie bourges berry duke orleance confederate included fortified theselfes kyng england therof aducrtised al diligence sent forthe sonne thomas duke clarence edward duke yorke viiic horsmen ix thousand archer whiche toke land bay hogges normandy sainct waste territory constantine thenglishemen swarmed like bee rounde aboute countrey robbyng marchantes spoilyng husbandman brennyng townes ioyously receiued erles alauson richmond fautors orliencial part councel fraunce willing englishman ioyne concurre duke orleaunce berry complices caused common fame although wer trewe diuulged abrode finall peace perfit amitie concluded betwene frenche kyng lordes whiche lately hym aduersaries fable notified englishman whiche hasty iourneis passed ryuer leire spoiled towne monastery beauliew wasted fire swerde countreis touraine maine duke burgoyn sent lord rambures great armie whiche short time vanquished dolphyn fraunce fearyng doynges englishemen concluded fayned peace betwene duke orleaunce burgoyne adherentes duke orleaunce without delay dispatche dominion fraunce english armie duke rich paie englishman gredy haue muche thei marchyng toward guien good order sackyng townes raunsomyng riche persones gat great treasure many good prayes beside aide duke orliaunce king henry sent caleis therles kent warwike ii thousand fightyng men whiche spoiled defaced countie bullenois brent towne samer de boy toke assault fortresse russalte diuers duke orleance daily called dispatche englishemen fraunce came duke clarence army rendryng gramercies disoursed muche money ether frendes myghte easily spare two hundred ixm frankes whiche remayned vnpaide deliuered gage second brother ihon erle angules e whiche grandfather france afterward french king sir marcell bourge sir ihon samoures sir archibault uiliers diuers whiche earle long continewed englande shall perceiue hereafter agrement taken duke clarence yorke gret pray riche prisoner welthy hostage came burdeaux makyng warre frontier fraunce greate gaine profitable lucre onely commyng e glishmen france duke orliaunce restored onely peace quietnes al person saue duke burgoyne also fell suche fauour kyng realm al men welbeloued muche honored highly estemed continewed till waueryng fortune turned variable whele beyng enemy englishe nacion vaquished taken prisoner remained englande aboue xxiiii yeres till flower age passed sore blemyshed pthe fourtenth yerethe xiiii yere great fortunate chaunces happened kyng henry perfightly remebring could praise geuen prince execute office administryng iustice whiche aboue al thyng necessary minister al people entendyng liue quietenes beyng deliuered al ciuill deuision intestine discencion almost al christendom infected disturbed onely gret decay christes religion christian creature great exaltacio painim prince dilatyng pestiferus sect false counterfait prophet vainglorious mahumet called great cou sail thre estate realme whiche deliberately consulted concluded aswel politike gouernaunce realme also war made infidel especially recouery holy citie ierusale whiche christian warres entended ende transitory life cause prepared great army gathered muche treasure entending set forward spring time se chaunce euer man intendeth god sodainly reuerseth prince wil god wil thinke stable god sodainely maketh muta le entent salomon saiyng might found trewe wrote wisdome men folishnes god whe prince thus furnyshed treasure sufficient valiant capitaines hardy souldiers tall shippes furnished vitayles municions thynges necessary suche iourney roiall taken sore sodain disease aied bed whiche disease lepry stryken handes god folish frier declared nether wold shame dehilitie able enterprise gret iorney iewrie person taken soreapoplerye grose humo fil vessel heade whence felyng body co meth therefore whiche haue dis ase epriued felyng mouyng apoplexye whiche languished tyll appoyncted howre none grefe malady duryng whiche lickenes auctors write caused crowne set pillowe beddes heade sodainly pange sore trobeled lay though al vitall sprite bene departed suche chamberleins cure charge bodye thinkyng bee departed deade couered face linnen cloth prince sonne therof aduertised entered chamber toke away crowne departed father sodainly reuiued traunce quickly perceiued lacke crowne hauyng knowledge prince sonne possessed caused hym repaire presence requiryng cause misused hiselfe prince good audacitie answered sir mine al mennes iudgeme te semed deade world wherfore next aparant heir toke mine wel faire son said kyng gret sigh right enioyed god knoweth wel prince die kyng wil haue garlad trust kepe swerd al mine enemy haue done wel said kyng comit al god remeber wel turned bed shortly departed god chamber abbotes westminster called ierusalem xx day march yere lord miiiicxiii yere age xlvi reigned xiii yeres v monthes odde day muche per plexitie littel pleasure whose body funerall pope co ueighed canterbury solemply buried leuyng behind lady marie doughter lord hufrey erle hereford northhapton henry prince wale thomas duke clarece iho duke bedford humfrey duke glocester blanche duches bauier philip quene denmarke last wife quene iane child kyng mean stature wel proporcioned formally compact quicke deliuer stout courage apeased al ciuile discecions shewed selfe gentely men gat loue noble latter day malice il beginnyng tidynges death related duke clarence beyng aquitayn al diligent celeritie toke ship therle angulesme hostage returned england great cofort brother end vnquiet tyme kyng henry fourth victorious actes kyng henry fifth henry prince walesthe yere sonne heire kyng hery iiii borne monmouth riuer wye obsequies noble paret soleply celebrate supteously finished toke vpon high power regiment realme englande xx daie marche yere christ sauior entered immaculate wobe holy uirgin naturall mother thousande foure hundred xij crouned ix daie aprill next ensuyng proclaimed kyng name kyng henry fifth whiche royall possession hym obteined diuerse noble men honorable personage hym homage liege sware dewe obeisance whiche thyng experimeted hym thei conceiued good expectacion bothe verteous beginnynges also fortunat successe al thynges whiche attempted begonne duryng tyme prosperous reigne fortunate empire kyng man whiche accordyng olde prouerbe declared shewed honor ought change maners incontinent stalled siege royall receiued croune scepter famous fortunate region determined hymself put shape new man vse another sorte liuyng turnyng insolencie wildnes grauitie sobernes waueryng vice constant vertue thetent would continue without goyng backe therunto bee allured familier copaignions passed young age wanton pastime riotous misorder insomuche imprisonmente one wanton mate vnthriftie plaifaiers strake chiefe iustice fiste face whiche offence onely commited streight prison also father put preuy counsaill banished courte brother thomas duke clarence elected president kynges counsaill great displeasure open reproche therfore banished seperated fro hym old flatterer familier compaignions vnrewarded yet vnpreferred inhibityng vpon greate pain approche ether speche presence yet lodge soiourue within ten mile courte mansion place clected chose men grauitee men witte men high policy whose wise counsaill prudente instruccion mighte tymes rule honor gouerne profite prince almost arabicall phenix emogest predecessor paragon emongest gouernors chiefly remembre kyng ought bee ruler wit grauitie circumspeccion diligence constancie cause haue rule hym comitted honor onorarius charge daily burden looke muche mennes liuynges consider remembre owne doynges propre actes whiche use muche trustyng readinesse owne witte iudgementes owne waueryng called counsaill su e prudent politique personage whiche onely help ease charge pain supportyng burden realme empire also incense instruct hym suche good reason fruitefull perswasions might shewe hymself synguler mirror manifest example moral vertues good quality comen people louing subiectes daily seen vicious prince doth muche hurte pernicious exaple hymself owne peculier offence muche euill cicero saieth although bee euill self prince euill euill doynges corrupt daily seen prince chage people altereth kynges go subiectes folowe certainly preferred high authoritee therefore muche exalted honor rule ouerse correct maners co dicions people vigilantly forsee daily study acquire hymself laude glory profite comodite delight worldly pleasure whiche commen emongest lowest sorte vile rusticall people nothyng nothyng worthy called seruant ruler subiect rather gouernor bee shame reproche prince whiche ought gouerne rule shall cowardnes slouth ignorance pupille viij x yeres age beyng xx xxx yeres shalbe compelled obey folowe willes ruled beare rule like ward like garde like seruant like master suche gouernor kyng richarde seconde whiche hymself beeyng moste euill disposicion symple minde suche debilite witte yet litle herte corage might haue demaunded learned good profitable counsaill aduise taken kept retayned folowed thesame howsoeuer vnprofitable counsailers wer confusion finall perdicion suche another ruler kyng edwarde seconde whiche two named kynges fell high glory fortune whele exstreme misery miserable calamitee whose infortunate chance thynke kyng henry beyng admonished expulsed hym old plaie felowes preuie sicophantes vngracious gard author procurer al mischifes riot assigned place men grauitee persones actiuitee counsaillers greate witte pollicie laied prudent polletique foundacion entendyng mynd many noble notable actes remembryng goodnes cometh god al worldly thynges humain actes bee weaker poorer celestiall power heuenly rewardes determined begin thyng pleasaunt acceptable god wherefore first commaunded clergie syncerely truly preache worde god liue thesame thei temporaltee might lanternes light mirror vertue laie men willed serue god obey prince prohibityng aboue al thynges breche matrimony vse sweryng wilful periury exhortyng bothe loue toge ther man wife brother brother beside elected best learned men lawes realme officies iustice men good liuyng preferred high degree authoritee madnes welshemen scottes whose often incursion robbery wel father day experimented assaied studied assuage represse intent beeyng quiet owne region might ether make outward warre without doubte dangier el commen wealth realme study encreace glory seigniory kepe conserue vvhen thynges thus settled framed purpose caused body kyng richard second remoued funerall pompes conueniente estate langeley westminster honorably enterred quene anne firste wife solempne toumbe erected set vp costes charge noble prince kyng henry althovgh prudente prince pollitique gouernor set established thynges beyng difference variaunce within owne peculier realmes countrees territory confines thesame yet nothyng lesse forgettyng one thyng myndyng desiring ceassyng long scisme deuision sprong continued catholike church christian religion moste ambicious desire auaricious appetite certain persones callyng themselfes spirituall father deede carnall coueteours gredy glottos aspiryng honor vertue proud see rome desiryng pille profite christes flocke christian religion hauyng knowledge generall counsaill somoned bee celebrate kept faire citee constance vpon riuer ryne though honor yet ductie beyng thereof warned emperor sigismond bee hearer partaker high cause especiall high assemble wherefore sent thether richard erle war ke three bishoppes famous prelate doctor besides knightes esquire numbre eight hundred horsses thei wer men well appareled horsses richely trapped compaignie well furnished almaines wondred italian gased nacions astonnied se suche honorable compaignie come countree farre distant sinody assembled one authore writeth cccxlvj bishoppes abbottes doctor vclxiiij noble men knightes esquire xvjm beside seruantes whiche accomptyng townes men wer numbred lxvm persones ambassadours highly receiued emperor sygismond romishe bishop called ihon xxiij whiche thesame counsaill greate abhominable crime detestable offense hym perpetrated comitted whiche could pourge hymself make defence thesame sinody accordyng demerites put doune estate depriued gregory xij one scismatical numbre fearyng shame regardyng worldly affeccion putte doune hymself owne propre mocion foolishe vsurped name popishe dignitee benedict xiii still stifly affirmyng hymself uiker god muche desired honor muche wrapped owne folishe fantastical opinion frend could persuade hym argumet entice hym reason refrain hym thesame accordyng desert open iudgement wil lost bothe name honestie thre yeres otho columbe noble romaine borne elected bishopricke rome named martyne fifth cousaill ihon wicliffe borne england ihon husse iherom prage wer condened death duryng firste yere sir ihon old castle whiche wife called lorde cobham valiant capitain hardy gentleman accused archbishop cauntorbury certain poynctes heresy whiche bishoppe knowyng hym highly kynges fauor declared highnes whole accusacio kyng first hauyng compassion noble man required prelate straied shepe rather gentlenes rigoure reduce hym olde flocke sendyng hym godly exhorted louyngly admonished hym reconcile hymself god lawes lorde cobham onely thanked kyng moste fauorable clemencye also declared firste hym mouthe afterwarde writyng foundacion faith ground belefe botome stomacke affirmyng grace supreme hed competent iudge none persone offeryng hundred knightes esquire come purgacio el fight ope listes accusors kyng onely knowyng lawes reame also persuaded counsaill hereticall accusacions ought tried spiritual prelate sente hym tower london abide determinacion clergie accordyng statute cace prouided whiche tyme xxiij daie septembre solempne session appoincted cathedrall churche sainct paule another xxv da said moneth hal frier prechers london whiche place thesaid lorde examined apposed fully heard conclusion archbishop denounced hereticke remitted toure london fro whiche place ether help frendes corrupcion kepers priuely escaped cam wale temained space thre yeres tyme certain vnlawfull assemble taken sir robert acton knight man greate wit possession ihon broune esquire ihon beuerley clerke greate numbre whiche brought kynges presence hym declared cause commocion risyng accusyng greate nubre sort societie whiche cofessio haue seen leaue large folishe acte many persones apprehended prison aboute london wer replenished people chief thein whiche wer xxix wer condempned clergie heresy attainted high treason mouers warre kyng temporal lawe guyld hall xij daie december adiudged treason drawen hanged heresy consumed fire galowes whiche iudgemente executed ianiuer folowyng thesaied robert acton xxviij saie occasion death conueighance lorde cobham prisone write bothe treason heresy record declareth certain affirme feined cause surmised spiritualtie displeasour truth iudgement wherof leaue men indifferent surely coniectures true writynges gospell therefore nether witnes facte present deede ouerpasse matter begin another pthe seconde yerethe ii yere kyng henry cotinually studiyng honor hymself aduancement people called high courte parliament last daie april toune leicester whiche parliamente many profitable lawes concluded many peticions moued wer tyme deferred emongest whiche requestes one bill exhibited parliamente holden westminster xj yere kyng henry fourth whiche reason kyng vexed troubled ciuill deuision domesticall dissencion came none effect might bee well studied pondered regarded brought good conclusion effect whiche supplicacion temporall landes deuoutely geuen disordinatly spet religious spirituall persones might suffise maintein honor kyng defence realme xv erles xvc knightes vjmiic esquites c almole house relief onely poore impotente nedy persones kyng haue clerely cofers twentie thousande poundes many prouilions valewes religioushouses whiche ouerpasse remembred bill muche noted feared emogest religious fort effect muche touched insomuche fat ab otes swet proude prior frouned poore frier cursled sely nonnes wept al together wer nothyng pleased yet co tent finde remedy mischief rent stop wounde clergy myndyng rather bowe breake agreed offre kyng greate money staye newe moued demaund cause offre semed wise prelate nether decente conuenient thei well forsawe perfightly knewe commos perceiued thei reward offre money would resist request peticion thei stirred moued fury wold onely rayle despise theim corruptours prince enemy publique wealthe would crye call kyng temporall lordes thei like lese bothe worke oyle cost linyng wherfore thei determined cast chaunces whiche mighte serue purpose especiall replenishe kynges brayne pleasante study nether phantasy regard serious peticion importunate common vvherfore daie kyng present parliament henry chicheley archebishop cautorbury therto newly preferted whiche beforetime monke carthusian whiche professed wilfull pouertie religion yet commyng abrode muche desired honor man muche regardyng godes law louyng owne lucre lowe obeysaunce made kyng said maner effect whe iconsider entierly beloued lesse drad soueraigne lorde naturall princethe acion hery hicheley archebishoppe patrone preferrer also neglecter dutye secrete mummer suche thynges whiche touche inheritance croune honor realme ether holde peace kepe silence author agree glory kynges consisteth onely high bloud thinkyng yf king shuld passe ouer fraunce whole puissaunce powre weake withstand strength scotland shuld inuade duryng kynges ab ence wherfore rose vp making obeysance kyng sayd svrely sirthe oracio raufe erle westmerland lord canterbury hath clerkely declared conquest fraunce honorable gotten obteigned profitable pleasant sauyng grace reformacion say affirme conquere scotland necessary apparante easie profitable realme gaine fraunce althoughe well learned lord archbishop haue proceded degre uniuersitie yet haue red heard great clarckes say strengthe knitte combined together force efficacie seuered dispersed example sprinkle vessell water moisteth cast wholy together bothe washeth norisheth notable saiyng time hath encoraged emperor animated kynges allured prince conquere realmes adioynyng vanquishe nacions dominion adiacent subdewe people either necessary purpose beyng daily enemy continuall aduersaries profe whereof beholde chefe cause occasion ruler gouernours sore laboured
