persones wherof wer prince noble bearyng banner cxxvi remnant sauyng xvic wer knightes esquiers gentleman noble men gentleman wer slain viiimiiiic whiche vc wer dubbed knightes night battail fro felde escaped liue erle dampmartyn lorde deiariuier clunet brabante sir lewes burbon sir galiot gaules sir ihon dengermes fewe men name englishemen battaill wer slain edward duke yorke therle suffolk sir richard kikeley dauygame esquire al aboue xxv wil geue credite uche write miracle writer soner beleue affirme slain aboue v vjc person whiche vnlike considryng battail earnestly furiously fought space three long houres wherfore incredible yet vnpossible englishman fiue twenty slain destroyed battail maie mirror glasse al christian prince beholde folowe kyng henry nether trusted puissaunce people fortitude champion strength barded horsses yet owne pollicy putte god whiche corner stone immouable rocke whole cofidence hope trust neuer leaueth destitru e put confidence hym sent hym glorious victory whiche victory almoste incredible edde boke kynges god likewise defended aided onely put trust committed selfes wholy gouernaunce kyng englande refreshed hymself souldiours toune caleis suche prisoner left harfflew haue heard wer come hym caleis vi daie nouembre prisoner toke shippyng caleis thesame daie landed douer hauyng hym ded body duke yorke erle suffolke caused duke bee buried colledge fodrynghey therle ewhelme passage sea rough troubleous two shippes laden souldiers apperteignyng sir ihon cornewal lorde fanhope wer driuen zelande howbeit nothyng loste person perished kyng soft iorneies al prisoner cam london westminster rested hymself conueniet tyme deliuer prisoner kepers se saue custody might declare vnto would bee tedious prolixe mayre london senate appareled oriet grayned skarlet iijc comoners clad beautiful murrey wel mounted gorgeously horsed riche collers greate chaynes met kyng blackhethe reioysyng victorius returne clergie london riche cross supteous cope massy cesers receiued hym thomas wateryng solepne procession laudyng praisyng god high honor victory hym geuen graunted thynges omit returne matter vvhen dolorus tidynges bloudy battaill declared frenche kyng beeyng roan hym dolphyn duke berry briteyne second sonne therle ponthew lamented chaunce cursed euill daie whiche lost many noble men man haue maruaill yet dolor onely lady souned deathes husebandes orphalines wept rent heares losse parentes faire damoselles defied daie whiche thei lost paramors seruates waxed mad destruccio master finally euery frend frend euery cosyn alye euery neighbor neighbor sory displeased greued wherfore frenche kyng counsaill preceiuyng war newly begon towarde euill spede determined prouide chance might folowe forsee thynges thei sodainly happened first elected chief officer warres called constable whiche therle arminack wise pollitique capitain auncient enemy thenglishmen sir ihon corsey made master crosbowes thei fortefied tounes furnished garrison thynges thus workyng ether malencoly losse agincourt sodein desease ihon dolphyn uienoys heire apparaunte charles frenche kyng departed naturall life without issue whiche happy chaunce robynet bournouile compaignions haue heard death life life would haue death pthe fourth yerethe iiii yere notable victory obteigned englishman kyng henry departed englande frenche kyng made newe officer hope releue sette vp olde estate realme coutrie thomas duke excester capitain harflew accompaignied thre englishman made great roade normandy almoste citee roan whiche iorney gat great habundance bothe rich prisoner returne therle arminacke newly made conestable fraunce entendyng first iorney wynne spurres compaignie aboue vm horssemen encountred hym skirmishe sore fight fierce englishemen wer able resist force frenche horseman duke saue men compelled retire pollitiquely could deuise could lost almoste ccc fotemen frenchman contet good lucke folowed theim almoste barrier harflew englishemen within toune espied chace thei issued good ordre met enemy onely slew toke greate numbre theim also chaced aboue eighte mile toward citee roan abovte ceason sigismond emperor almayn whiche maried barbara doughter therle zilie cosyn germain remoued kyng henry pedegre set end boke shall plainly perceiue man greate vertue fidelitie whiche onely long labored set vnitee cocord christes churche christian religio also sent diuerse ambassador aswel ye frech kyng kyng englande farre distaunt country region encrease perfight peace reasonable vnitie wherfore seyng ambassade brought nothyng conclusion person came fro farthest part hugary frauce englande intendyng knit together christen prince one line amitee beyng frendes together make war reuenge quarelles turke persecutor christes faithe enemie christendome noble emperor came archebishop reynes diuerse noble men ambassador fro frenche kyng england kyng england old amitee betwene hous englande beame withall nobilitee hym receiued blackheth vii daie maie brought hym london westminster greate triumphe iustes tournayes marciall feates wer hym ioye pleasure shewed set furth duryng whiche tyme came englande albert duke hollande whiche also frendly entreteigned two prince wer kyng conueighed wynsore george feast elected compaignions noble ordre garter color habite thesame theim deliuered satte stalles al solempnitee feast whiche ordre thei knowledged themselfes highly honored muche exalted solempne feast finished duke holland wel feasted greatly rewarded returned countrie themperor taried stil neuer ceasyng declare perswade vtilitee goodnes ioye might ensue bothe realmes englande fraunce wer brought finall concord perfight vnitee euill chaunce frenche nacion purpose barre lette thei predestinate suffre yet plague detrimentes thenglishe people thei tasted concorde hande peace enteryng gate newe cause discord dissencion sodainly brake cam kynges knowledge beyng informed losse conflict late territory roan haue heard displeased vnquieted would heare treaty haue woorde peace named emperor like wise prince seyng aspect planet reigned contrary purpose ceassed talke matter till another daie coniuccion meker signes stirryng peace mete conueniet tyme came broched vessell cocord amitee put faire cup presented suche pleasant wordes surely kyng tasted sufficiently ye frenchme sodainly prepared new army therle arminacke puffed vp last victory although honor wer small gain lesse determined clerely get toune harflewe wherfore closely could gathered together men euery part appoincted mete harflew daie assigned appoinctment kept toune besieged bothe water land capitaines toune knewe perfightly first mocion ihon uicount narbon uiceadmirall fraunce brought whole nauy riuage shore adioynyng toune entendyng priuely haue entred toune water side perceiued subtile ymaginacion toke place thei kept watch toure sodainly perceiuyng enemy approche rang alarum bell duke excester incontinent caused men repaire walles fortified gate dispatched swifte barke kyng henry letter requiryng hym aide succor although frenchemen perceiued wyly enterprise knowen toune could taken sodenly stollen deuised yet co tinued siege water land made diuers assaultes whiche nothyng gained yet euer somewhat lost newes come eares kyng henry knew people great ieopardye excepte great diligence vsed relief deliuerance without delay apparelled great nauy intended person minister succour subiectes besieged emperor sigismond sagely disuaded wisely counsailed aduenture selfe iorney send valiant captain whiche shortly might appeace furious storme quickly quenche blasyng flame aduertisyng neither necessary honorable prince whole waight charge comon welth consisteth aduenture hazard self euery peril doutful chaunce kyng beyng persuaded reasonable louyng aduertisment frende emperor appoincted duke bedforde brother accompanied therles marche marshal oxford huntyngdon warwicke arundel salsbury deuonshyre diuers baron cc sayle passe normandy reskew toune harflew whiche makyng good expedicion shipped rye prosperous wind freshe gale came mouth riuer seyn day assumpcion lady vicount narbon perceiued englishe nauy approche geuyng token al company coragiously set toward enemy gate possession mouth hauen duke bedford perceiued nauy enemy come forward fiersly set certain strong wel made shippes whiche fyrst encountre vanquished toke two frenche shyppes wherof capitaines rashe somewhat bold withal souldiours tackelyng duke folowed inco tinently puissance like valiant capitaine great courage audacitee set enemy fight long long perilous perilous terrible battailes sea euer desperate neither assailauntes defendantes loke refuge know backdore skape long fight victory fel englishemen toke sonke almost whole nauy fraunce whiche many shippes hulkes carikes nombre fiue hundred whiche iii great carickes sent england conflict slaine frenchemen small nombre appeared body whiche swarmed euery day thenglishe shippes victorye fortunately obteined duke bedforde sailed water vp toune harflew without let impediment landed refreshed vitaile money succour welcome duke excetter vncle reporte haue bene necessitie would haue gladly bene refreshed vvhen earle armynacke heard puissaunt nauye frau ce vanquished taken raised siege toune returned smal ioy paris hope sawe likelyhod meane recouer toune har ew whiche sore thirsted discomfiture great losse fortitude stregth frechmen began decay braggyng beautie began fade nowe prince noble realme fel diuision discord among selues say nobilitie studiyng howe reuenge olde iniuries displeasure refused take payne thaduauncement pulique wealth sauegard country priuy displeasure couert hatred power began wexe slender libertie brought suche malicious diuersitie doubtful difference herafter shalbe shewed merueil coutrey brought perpetual bondage whiche thing doubt folowed kyng henry lenger liued mutable worlde notwithstandyng duke leaunce capitaine head one faction time captiue prisoner england yet grewe muche priuy dipleasure cankard hatred betwene charles dolphyn ihon duke burgoyne one studied compassed deuised ouercome armure pollicy dissimulacion crafty coueyaunce euery iorneiman faction euery noble partaker one put whole study diligence auance forward sect part one would take hede howe ist refell present ieopardye whiche commyng englad one incouenience suffred many folow frauce tyme french kyng good memory war toward semed doubtful perilous prince vntrusty discord hundreth mo thinges might bryng realme exstreme misery vtter distructio shal heare vvhen duke bedford acheued enterprise performed comission bothe raisyng siege harflew vitaylyng toune smal nombre prisoner great haboundance pray wel shippes prouision sea england great triumph glory victory muche thaked kyng brother lauded praised emperor sigismond beyng straunger whiche sayd openly happy subiectes whiche haue suche kyng happy kyng hath suche subiectes vvhen emperoure perceiued moue farther peace vayne request tarye lenger englande procure amitie losse tyme sawe englishemens myndes sore offended last siege harflew whiche facte selfe wel cotent greatly moued therfore leauyng treaty persuasion entred league amitie kyng england whiche confederacy least shuld broken euery contractor studyed deuised way meanes possible howe obserue vnuiolated preserue vnbroken whiche plain meanyng true dealyng muche honor great comoditie emperor thus cocluded league kyng england done al thinges england accordyng thought necessary toke iorney homeward garmany kyng partely shewe pleasure partely owne affaire associated toune caleys whiche tyme duke burgoyn offred come caleys speake emperor kyng heard speake league confederacy concluded betwene kyng sent water grauelyng duke gloucester brother ear e marche hostage duke burgoyne sent also earle warwicke noble company coduct presece grauelyng foorde duke met salutacions done duke burgoyn conueighed caleys emperor kyng highly feasted welcommed duryng whiche tyme peace concluded betwene kyng england duke burgoyn certain space coce nyng onely county flau ders arthoys whiche cause frenche kyng sone highly displeased duke gloucester also receiued grauelyng earle charoloys sonne duke burgoyne honorably conueighed omers lodged night next day earle charoloys came diuers nobleman visite duke gloucester lodging entred chambre duke backe towarde talkyng seruantes se welcome earle charoloys fyrst entrey sayd shortly without great reuerence comyng towarde welcome fayre cosyn passed furth tale seruates earle charoloys al youth wel content suffred tyme vvhen duke burgoyn done al thinges caleys came ix day returned grauelyng duke gloucester met againe louyngly departed one caleys sainct omers whiche voiage duke burgoyn suspected enemy croune fraunce duke departyng emperor highly feasted rewarded pleasure sailed holand roade beame kyng likewise toke ship returned england sainct luke euen yere lord mccccxvii pthe fift yerethe v yere yere kyng assembled together high courte parliament open audience made shorte pithy oracion declaryng vnto iniuries lately doone committed frenche nacion shewyng also iust laufull occasion warres signifiyng furthermore great discord ciuile dissencion whiche reigned amongest nobilitie fraunce rehersyng many thynges whiche necessary nedeful represse ouercome withal power puissaunce without deferryng prolongyng tyme desiryng prouide money treasure hand conduct wage souldiors thentent nothing lacke thei shuld ready set enemy cause wer iust demaudes reasonable soner spoken assented soner demauded graunted geue men courage go furth money fyrst gathered make prouision al thinges necessary royal voiage surely creature whiche war either discotented displeased semed al men lesse profitable honorable lesse honorable conuenient parliament also ihon duke bedford made gouernor regent realme head pulique welth office shuld enioy long kyng makyng warre french nacion kyng would take voyage sent earle huntyngdon serche skoure sea least frenchman liyng waite might attrappe sodenly knowledge settyng forward lusty earle called ihon holand sone duke excetter behedded circiter tyme kyng henry fourth cosyn kyng great nombre shippes searched sea one coast inconclusion encou tred ix great carickes ieane whiche lord iaques bastard burbon reteined serue frenche kyng set sharply conflict great fight long inconclusion frenchman wer ouercome fled iii greatest carickes patrones monsure iaques de burbon admyral wer taken asmuche money haue payed souldiors whole flete halfe yere iii carickes wer bouged sent botome sea kyng hearyng good chaunce aboute ende iuly toke ship portesmouth accopanied duke clarence gloucester brother sayd kyng earles huntyngdon mershal warwike deuonshyre salsbury suffolke somerset lordes rosse wylloughby fitzhugh clynton scrope matriuers bourchier ferreys groby ferreys chartley fanhope gray codnore sir gilbert umfreuile sir gilbert talbot diuers hauyng wynde wether desire laded normady nere castle called touque wher cosulted capitaines way best taken cocerning high enterprise norman hearyng kynges arriual wer sodenly striken deadly feare wer almost distracted fro sences dred wherfore like mad men desperacion ranne house tounes village wiues child bag baggage walled tounes fortefied garrison cariyng corne wyne vitaile necessary sustinance liuyng preparyng swordes hatchettes crosbowes al weapon mere set back resist enemy sent worde charles frenche kyng requiryng defend preserue louing subiectes cruel fierse enemy men warre whiche left euery place skoure countrey went walled tounes rural cominaltee thentent aide assist tounes men well knewe able resist enemy beyng abroade felde al walled tounes castle normandy mayne wel furnished men vitaile name freche capitaines tedious reherse therfore ouerpasse vvhen kyng henry taken counsel layde siege castle touque beyng wel fortefied nature man arte began assault although within valiantly defeded yet fine force ouercame toke within mercy made therof capitaines sir robert kerkeley knight determined besiege strong toune caen remembryng according dutie good capitaine frenchemen would come healpe frendes beyng nede exstreme necessitie whiche thyng desired wished vpo purpose set furth toward caen warlikest fashion depopulatyng coutrey destroiyng village euery part passed toune caen standeth plaine fertile coutrey stronger walled depe ditched wel vitayled replenished people citezens fearyng kynges comyng prouided al thinges necessary defensible assone kyng come cast depe trenche high mount prohibite within toune haue egresse outwarde passage done began fiersely assault toune men toune wer nothyng abashed stode manly defence abidyng chaunces whiche might ensue fight fierce euery toke hede charge englishman studied way possible damage enemy shot arrowes cast stone shot gonne brake walles engynes vndermyned set skalyng ladder wal cast wylde fyre euery man laboured come handstrokes whiche desyre side norman threw doune great stone barres yron dartes hote pitche burnyng brimstone boylyng lead diuers day assault cotinued lytle losse englishman whiche toke harme defeders gat hurt assailantes kyng henry perceiued dice rane purpose abstained assault determined vnderminyng subuert ouerthrowe walles tower toune wherfore withal diligence pyoners cast trench laborer brought tymber within fewe day walles stode onely vpo postes fal fyre put kyng caused people approche walles kepe citezens occupied least either shuld make coutremyne immpediment workemen laborer wherfore caused thassault cried againe euerye man ranne walles skalyng ladder hokes cordes plommetes euery man desiryng get vpo walles hand hand graple enemy citezens manfully defeded fight quicke fierse partes englishman diuers place perced brake walles diuers ouertures hole made vnder foundacion pyoners whiche thenglishmen might easely entre toune kyng hauyng copassion tounes men desiryng rather haue saued destroyed wold humbly submyt selues grace fearyng toune fine force spoyled taken compelled geue pray men warre sacked destroyed sent worde herault yet tyme mercy clemency would incontinently rendre selues toune obstinately hopyng succour answered would stand defence englishman skaled walles enterprised enter trench fight sore space houre english men coragiously enforced enter norman manfully defended inconclusion englishman obteined vvhen kyng possessed toune incontinently co maunded al harneys weapon brought one place whiche al diligence done without resistence miserable people knelyng knee holdyng vp handes cried mercy mercy kyng gaue certaine comfortable wordes bad stand vp euer accustomed wet foote chief churche toune rendred god heartie thankes prosperous successe fortunate chauce yet night would slepe comaunded al armye watche aray either least men warre night tyme might fal spoyle sacke el citezens fearyng sequele might ensue would priuely steale conueigh selues away mornyng called al agestrates gouernours senate house stony stubbernes mad obstinacy adiudged dye sore fined highly raunsomed callyng together souldiors men war bothe gaue high laudes praise manly doynges also distributed euery man accordyng desert spoyle gaine taken toune tounesmen chiefly assault tried honor valiant corages vnfearfull hertes imagined kyng henry conflict would principally shewe aswell owne force puissance experience warres nacion ether intent frenchemen know thei mette suche enemy able inuade countrie defend strength malice el obliuious makyng warre euery prince muste study obtain fame renoune old prouerbe saieth thyng well begone succedeth prosperous ende happy conclusion althovgh toune wonne yet castle whiche strong well fortified bothe men thynges necessary defence yet frenchman possession capitain thentent shewe hymself valiant willyng breake othe nether wauer allegeance bosted would rather dye defence frely yeld castle kyng henry minded subuert castle without whiche waie easy bee wonne beautifull necessary kepe toune fro goyng backe also defend thesame oportunitee serue whiche castle distroyed necessitee must build reedifie el another place wherfore sent worde lorde mountayny beyng capitain would yelde castle daie depart without dammage would bee foolishe obstinate clemency fauor hym sequestred capitain compaignions well digested message beyng dispaire cofort vpon condicion offred rendred castle yelded themselfes kyng henry obteigned bothe toune castle caen vvhile kyng englande besiegyng toune frenchman nether conuenient hoste resist power wer ready able releue frendes miserable necessite thei deuision dissencion emongest themselfes good cause kyng charles small wit reason sicknes could rule spoyled bothe treasure kyngdome euery man spente wasted common treasure charles dolphin beyng age xvi xvii yeres onely lamented bewailed ruyne decaye countrie onely studied thaduauncement comon wealth onely deuised resist enemy hauyng nether menne money greatly troubled vnquieted conclusion counsaill therle armynacke constable fraunce founde meane get treasure rich whiche quene isabell mother gotten horded diuerse secrete place comon vtilite countrie spente wisely wagyng souldiors preparyng thinges necessary war quene forgettyng great perel realme stode remebryng displesure act dooen declared sonne constable mortall enemy promised thei persecuted vttermoste euen womanly malice set highest authoritie aboute kyng husband ihon duke burgoyn geuyng hym regiment direccion kyng realme preheminence souera ntie duke burgoyn hauyng sworde authoritie whiche sore longed glad reuenged old iniuries began make warre dolphyn tamed framed purpose young vnbrideled gentleman determined might refell withstande come enemy realme thesame like reason moued dolphin myndyng first represse extincte ciuill dissencion home would inuade forain enemy prepared warre subdew destroy duke iho burgoyn chief hed leader wicked great mischief wherby realme muche vnquieted decayed maner brought final ruyne vtter destruccion fraunce inflamed euery part troubled warr deuision yet man would ether prouide great danger put furth finger hynder mischief kyng henry myndyng lye still normandy leaue enterprice vnperformed sent duke clarence sea coast whiche greate difficulty gatte toune bayeux duke glocestre also smal assault lesse defence toke citee liseaux meane ceason kyng henry taried still cane fortefiyng toune castle put toune xvc woman impotent person replenished toune english people kyng soiourned caen kepte solempne feast made many knightes beside shewed example greate pitee deuocion searchyng castle found innumerable substance plate money belongyng citezens wherof would suffre one peny touched conueighed away restored goodes owner deliuered euery owne fame gettyng caen blowen normandy norman wer sore afraied muche abasshed onely haue seen men woman child ronnyng euery waie great plopes fro toune toune knowyng whether flie also rurall persones huseband men draue beastes village suche place thei hoped refuge defence man would haue thought normandy sodainly left desolate voyde people catell rumor spred abroade clemency shewed captiues mercy graunted suche submitted themselfes grace capitaines tounes adioynyng came willyngly presece offryng hym selfes tounes goodes wherupon made proclamacion al men whiche would become subiectes swere hym allegeance enioy goodes liberty large ample maner thei whiche gentle entreteinyng fauorable hadlyng stubburne norman cause thei wer content also glad remoue turne frenche part become subiectes croune englande vvhen kyng henry set caen good ordre left capitaines one toune castle sir gilbert u freuile erle kyne sir gilbert talbot made bailife ther sir ihon pophane departed fro caen argenton whiche shortly redred hym tounes folowyng without stroke striken yelded hym made captaines person whose name ensue creuly sir henry tanclux almaine thorigny sir ihon popham toune geue boyeux lorde matrauerse argenton lorde grey codner chamboy lorde fizghugh made lord thesame uernoyle perche sir ihon neuell alaso duke gloucester leuetenat sir raufe letal essay sir william hoddelston baylif alanson faloys sir henry fitzhugh cruly sir loys robset conde norean sir ihon fastolffe diuerse tounes likewise yelded duke clarence wherin putte capitaynes cite lisieux sir iho kikley cowrton ihon awbyn barney william houghton chambroys iames neuell becheluyn therle marshall harecort richard woduile esquyer fangernon ihon saint albon creuener sir ihon kerby geuen annilliers robert horneby ragles sir ihon arthure fresheney le uicount sir robert brent likewise diuerse tounes countrie constantine wer surrendered duke gloucester appoyncted capitaines cauenton lorde botraux seint clow reignold west ualoignes thomas burgh chiergurg lord grey codner decease sir water hungerford pont done dauy howel hay dupayes sir ihon aston bayly constantine costaces lord burgainy seint saluiorle uicount sir ihon robset pontorso sir robert gargrane ham ery erle suf olke lorde place gift briqueuile thesaied erle gift also anranches sir philip halle bayly alanson uire lorde matrauers sainct iames de bewron lorde vvhen kyng englande wanne thus normandy nauy lost nothyng sea skowred stremes nether frencheman briton durst apere howbeit one daie arose hideous tempest terrible storme nether cable held anker preuailed erles marche huntyngdon taken haue southampto whole nauie perished people destroyed yet sauegard straunge thesame hauen two balyngers two great carickes laden marchaundise wer drouned broken maste another caricke blowen ouer wall hapton diuerse writer affirme suche power wynd suche rigoure tempest whe fury wynd asswaged sea waxed calme therles marche huntyngdon passed ouer sea compainy landed normandy marchyng towarde kyng norman fled fast fearfull hare dooth gredy greyhounde sely partridge sparowhauke thei passed countrie destroiyng village takyng paynes till thei came kyng goyng towarde roan duryng marciall feactes greate conquestes normandy sir ihon oldecastle lord cobham whiche haue heard conuicted heresy proclaimed rebell vpon thesame outlawed brake toure ortune chaunced apprehended march wale lorde powes restored olde lodgyng toure kepers looked narowly hym thei whiche takyng drawen toure hardell sainct giles elde hanged chaynes consumed fire well nowe leauyng matter englande let v returne affaire normandy pthe si yerethe vi yere kyng henry thus victoriously obteined many tounes many fortress possession enemy great ame litle per onage whole terror feare frenche nacion ymagined hymself nothyng n thyng gotten excepte brought famous citee roan beyng empery diademe duchy normandy possession dominion whiche euery parte norman conueighed money iewelles houshold stuffe whiche citee sithe firste arriual thei onely walled ortressed many rampiers strong bulwarkes also val capitaines hardy souldiours small numbre wherfore set forward army toward toune called pontlarche standyng vpon riuer seyne viij mile roan betwene paris roan frenchemen whiche kepte passage heard kynges approchyng thei gathered together greate numbre men warre redy defend prohibite passage apointyng another band men thei failed kepe farther side bridge watche hourely attend nether bote vessell eskape maner waye came toune first sette forwarde towarde bridge whiche sawe well defended would without greate losse obteigned sodainly blew retraite reculed almoste myle backward pleasant place riuers side pitched campe night season botes barge hoggeshedes pipe conueighed ouer brode riuer seyne greate compaignie armie without resistaunce enemy thei whiche wer hetherside seyne thynkyng thenglishmen gone conquere place folowed studied defed toune whiche ynough king saw men wer otherside water next day earely returned toune assauted bothe side thinhabitantes perceiued contrary expectacio thei wer copassed beset enemy sawe hope refuge succor humble hert great ioy rendered vp toune kyng hauyng let impediment determined besege assault citee castle roan whiche taken diuerse long tedious iornayes set hym vncle lorde thomas duke excester agreat compaignie horssemen archer whiche banner displayed came toune sent capitaines wyndsore heraulte armes willyng deliuer toune kyng master el would persecute fire bloud sworde thei proudly answered none thei receiued hym none thei would deliuer except fyne force thei wer therunto copelled declare theselfes valiant capitaines hardy men war issued toune great band men armes encoutred fiercely theglishmen whiche like men nether afraied astonied manfully receiued fyne force draue toune leuyng englishman xxx compaignie prisoner ded person duke good spede proude aunswer frenche capitaines returned kyng rendred alitle toune louiers whiche gaue said brother duke clarence whiche made deputie sir ihon godard knight duke excester also newly taken citee eurcux made capitain ther sir gilbert halsall knight duke excester returned pont arch haue heard capitaines roan set fire suburbes bet doune church cut doune tree shrede bu shes destroyed vine round citee thentent thenglishmen haue relief comfort ether lodgyng fewell vvhen kyng heard dispitefull doynges whole army remoued pont rche last daie iuly came citee roan compassed rounde aboute strong siege fearfull assaute kyng laie greate puissaunce hous charitee east side citee duke clarence lodged b fore port caux west part citee duke excester toke place northside porte denise betwene duke excester clarence appoyncted erle marshall euen gate castle wer ioyned therle ormond lordes haryngton talbot duke excester toward kyng encamped lordes rosse willoughby fitzhugh sir william porter great band northrenme euen port saint hillarij therles mortaint salsbery wer assigned abbey saint kathermes sir ihon grey lodged directly chapel called mount mighell sir philip leche treasorer warres kept hil next abbey baron carew kept passage riuer sayne hym ioyned valiaunt esquire called ienico whiche twoo capitaines valiauntly kept riuage water sayne fartherside riuer wer lodged therles warren huntyngdon lordes neuell ferrers sir gilbert umfreuile well furnished company warlik souldiors directly gate called port du pont intent aide passe riuer toward citee greate chaine yron deuised potlarche sette pile one side water beside chayne sette vp new forced bridge sufficient bothe cariage passage whiche therle warwicke whiche gotten damp rot sent toune cawdebeck standyng riuerside betwen sea citee roan whiche toune hardly assaulted capitaines offered suffre englishe nauy passe toune without hurte detriment citee roan also roan yelded thei promised rendre toune without fayle farther delaie composicion thei sealed performaunce thesame thei deliuered pledge appoynctment englishe nauy numbre c sailes passed cawdebeck came roan besieged water side siege came duke gloucester therle suffolke lorde burgainy whiche taken toune chierburgh wer lodged porte sainct hillarij nerer enemy fortie roddes persones armie dvryng siege arriued harflew lorde kylmaine ireland band xvi hundreth ireshmen armed mayle dartes skaynes maner countrey talle quicke deliuer person whiche came presented selues kyng liyng styl siege onely gentely entertained also kyng informed frenche kyng duke burgoyn would shortly come either rayse siege vitaile toune north gate thei wer appointed kepe northsyde army especial way co meth forest lyon whiche charge lord kylmaine company ioyfully accepted deuoyre men wer praised damage enemy surely quicknes swiftnes preiudice enemy great barded horse hurt damage nimble irishme thvs fayre cytie roan compassed enemy besieged prince belet water lande hauyng neither comfort ai e kyng dolphyn although army strong without yet within lacked neither hardy capitaynes manful souldiors people ynowe written knew nombre occasio erre trueth time siege within citie christen people cc ten thousand person dayly wer issue made cytie diuers porte sometyme thenglishmen gat another time frenchman saued somtyme neither either got saued surely capitaines men warre within toune settyng honor life preferryng fame worldly rich dispisyng pleasure vilependyng fearfull heartes sware eche neuer render deliuer toune might either hold sworde hand put spere rest kyng england beyng aduertised haute courage high stomackes determined conquere famyne whiche would tamed weapon wherfore stopped passage water land vitaile could coueighed cytie cast treaches rounde walles set ful stake defended archer thei within could haue way ether inuade enemy could depart relinquishe fortresse cytie one day tidynges wer fayned frenche kyng approched al power raise siege reskew cytie wherfore kyng hery comaunded al men lye harneys lest might subtile cautel surprised vnware taken vnprouided freche kyng neither came sent great wonder thenglishmen siege thus continuyng lammas almost christmas diuers enterprise attempted diuers police deuised euery part might damage hurte aduersary enemy part muche reioysed gaine duryng whiche tyme vitayle began sore faile within toune vineger water serued drinke reherse accordyng writyng diuers author onely howe deare dogges rattes myse cattes wer solde within toune gredely poore people eaten deuoured also howe people died dayly faute foode yong infates lay suckyng stretes mother brestes liyng dead staruen hunger would abhorre lothsome doynges reioyse miserable mischace riche men within toune put gate pore indigent creature whiche thenglishmen kept trench beaten driuen backe againe gate toune whiche closed barred miserable people vncomfortably forsaken vnnaturally dispised owne nacion housholde felowes betwene walles cytie treches enemy lay styl criyng helpe relief lacke wherof innumerable sely solles dayly died hourely starued yet kyng henry moued pitie stirred copassion honor christes natiuitie christmas day refreshed al poore people vitayle great comfort relief whiche act thanked lauded praised kyng england also praied god preseruacion furtherance hynderance euil successe vnkynd citezens vncharitable country men miserable famyne dayly encreasyng daunted heartes bold capitaynes abated courage riche burgess turmeted body poore citezens stout souldiour faintnes could ska e welde weapon riche marchaunt money could bye sheuer bread cominaltie cried captaines nedy people besought lordes haue compassion inuent way succor comfort gouernou toune long consultacion consideryng great necessitie seyng none apparence succour relief determined necessary conuenient treate kyng england vpo newyeres euen ther came walles gate bridge diuers comissioners appoincted capitaines whiche made signe thenglishemen liyng without speake gentleman person authoritie earle huntyngdon whiche kept part sent sir gilbert umfreuile declared might haue guyde safeconduite would gladly speake kyng syr gilbert promised onely theyr message also certifie kinges pleasure purpose whiche comunicacion ended repaired duke clarence kynges counsail aduertisyng request citezens whiche incotinent assembled selues kynges lodgyng sir gilbert umfreuile wysely soberly declared kyng myndes intentes citezens kyng like graue prince consideryng thyng gotten without effusion christen bloud honorable profitable sawe haute corages braggyng frenchman wer hard besiegyngsore abated almost tamed thought conuenient heare lowly peticion humble request willed sir gilbert aduertise content heare xii whiche safely coueighed presence answere sir gilbert departed made relacion therof capitaynes standyng gate whiche next day mornyng appointed iiii knightes iiii lernedmen iiii sage burgess al clothed blacke go kyng englad xii person wer receiued port sainct hillarij sir gilbert umfreuile accompanied diuers gentleman yomen kynges houshold comonly called yomen croune conueighed kynges lodgyng found masse deuine seruice finished king henry gorgeously apparelled sumpteously adourned came trauers fiersely princely beholdyng frenche messegers passe chambre incontinently xii ambassadours wer conueighed amongest one learned ciuile law arrogant learned yet arrogant vndiscrete sayd wordes right high mightie prince right noble puissant kyng wyl elfe diligently co sider wherin consisteth glory voctorye triumph conquerour shall plainly perceiue type honor tamyng proud men ouercomyng valiant souldiors subduyng strong cyties populus region laiyng christen people hunger thirst famine whiche con teth neither manhod wit pollicy ala regard honor se yonder great multitude miserable people criyng meat wepyng drinke diyng lacke succour relief glory sha obtayne killyng wretch famyne whiche death deathes dispised abhorred wyl shew charitable god merciful men let al poore pe p e whiche wyl depart cytie passe campe get liuyng place manfully assaut cytie force dare subdue conquere enterprise succede ortunately thing doubtful doyng shal onely obtaine worldly glory terrestrial victory ouercommyng strong puissant men armes riche cytie also merite much god deliueryng hauyng compassion poore nedy indigent person orator sayd kyng whiche request lesse suspected whiche thus desired began muse wel perceiued crafty c tel fraudulent inuencion frenche messenger erse countenance hold spirit made answer saiyng thynke fa tastical frenchman ignorant brutal cannot perceiue double dealyng crafty conueighaunce iudge simple know wherin glory coqueror cosisteth esteme ignoraunt perceiue craftes warlike pollex strong enemy subdued brought subiection yes yes loiteryng truand forgette good lesson thinges blynd obscure wyl declare open goddesse battaile goddesse warre called bellona correctrice prince right witholdyng iniurie doyng plage god euil liuyng vntrue demeanor amongest subiectes hath iii handmaides euer necessitie attendyng bloud fyre famine whiche thre damosel force strength euery one alone able sufficient turment afflict proud prince al ioyned together puissance destroy populous countrey richest region world assaultyng toune seke bloud although gained doubt yet gaine wer cleare without losse people set cytie fyre consume also haue lost precious iewel whiche haue sore longed long laboured therfore saue myne owne people whiche one poinct glory capitaine preserue toune whiche lauful iust inheritaunce saue many wil willyngly destroied haue appointed makest maide thre damosel aff lict plage tyll bridled brought reason shalbe shal please appointment therfore say affirme gayne capitaine thre handmaides bothe glorious honorable triumphant thre yongest maide al thinges profitable comodious answer demaundes touching pore people liyng ditch assure lament lacke charitie toward christen brethre ye owne nacion one language one countrey reioyce vndoyng many creature castyng away many enemy like tirantes put toune thentent slay yet haue saued liues would neither geue meat drinke yet beyng mortal enemy haue succoured releued vncharitie shame reproche taken receiue selfe doer haue done good let god rewarde loke thankes haue done euil shal done suffre pore people passe cytie campe wyll accomplishe cloked request shal kepe styl helpe spend vitailes assault toune wil know therto able willyng se tyme occasion seyng choice hand tame either bloud fyre famyne wyl take choice pleasure kyng frownyng countenaunce departed fro chambre comaunded dine officer vvhen departed frenchman began marueil excellent wit muse hautnes courage dined consulted together required againe haue accesse royal presence whiche grauted humblyng selues knee besought take truce viii day whiche might commissioner take ende good conclusion counsail kyng like piteous prince rather couetyng preseruacion people distruction good deliberacion taken grauted askyng whiche answere ioyously returned departure wer appointed set vp iii riche tentes one lordes england consult together second commissioner cytie third partes argue debate matter comissioners englishe part wer erles warwike salsbury lord fitzhugh sir water hungerford sir gilbert umfreuile sir ihon robsert ihon uasques de almada french part wer apointed sir guy de butteler vi dvryng truce euery day comissioners met englishman accused frenchman excused englishman demaunded muche frenchman profered lytle thus arguyng reasonyng viii day came nothyng done one article concluded wherfore englishman toke doune tentes french men toke leaue departyng remembryng selues required englishe lordes loue god truce might continue tyl sunne risyng next day whiche lordes sone assented frenchman wer returned roan sodenly al toune sprong rumour truce expired nothyng determined poore people ranne stretes like frantike person shoutyng criyng callyng captaines gouernors murtherers manquellers saiyng pride styffe stomacke al misery happened toune threatenyng slay would agre kyng englades demaund request magistrate beyng amased fury people called al toune together knowe myndes opinion whole voice comons yelde yeld rather starue frenchman euenyng came tent sir ihon robsert requiryng getlenes moue kyng truce might prolonged iiii day kyng therunto agreed appointed tharchbishop cantorbury vii named part citezens appoincted egal nomber tentes againe set vp dayly assembles muche treaty party fourth day helpe god treaty concluded finished great reioysyng poore citezens copy wherof foloweth worde worde pthe appointmentes yeldyng vp cytie castle roan first accorded guy de botellier capitaine cytie castle roan consent noble citezens dwellyng beyng sayd cytie castell shall yelde deliuer handes ful excellent kyng england deputed cytie castle aboue sayd without fraude male engine tyme middes xix day present moneth ianuary sayd lord kyng wyll cytie castel deliuered vnder maner forme within written also accorded day houre sayd noble citezens thei dwellyng beyng sayd cytie castel shal submit al thinges grace sayd lorde kyng also accorded houre vnto real effectual yeldyng sayd cytie castle none sayd noble beyng sayd cytie castle shal go foresayd cytie castle without special grace sayd lord kyng also accorded houre vnto deliuerance cytie euery party shal abstaine deedes warre make againe partie also accorded foresayd noble citezens beyng sayd cytie castle shal pay foresayd lorde kyng ccc thousand scute golde wherof alwayes two shalbe worth englishe noble stead euery scute xxx great blankes whyte xv grotes whiche ccc thousand scute one halfe shalbe payde sayd lord kyng deputy within cytie roan beforesayd xxii day present moneth ianuary halfe shalbe paide sayd lord kyng deputy feast saint mathew apostle next comyng shalbe xxiiii day february next without vtter delay also accorded al euery horse harneys armures artileries shot habilimentes warre longyng souldiors straungers beyng sayd cytie castle shalbe put together two house sayd lord kyng assigned shalbe deliuered capitaine sayd cytie sayd lord kyng middes xix day ianuary therupon required also accorded euery armour artillery habilimentes war sayd castle shalbe put together one house within castle shalbe deliuered oure sayd lorde kyn deputy partie day castle shal fallen deliuered sayd lord kyng also accorded al euery armures artillery habilimentes warre thesaid citee al maner citezens al dwellyng therin shalbe brought put together one hous mo house theim deliuered lorde kyng capitain thesame citee shalbe deliuered forsaid lorde kyng deputie tyme thesaid capitain partie moste doubtfull lorde kyng middaie present moneth ianuarij therupon required take armuries belong marchauntes whiche wont sell theim ceassyng fraude maleengine befal marchauntes suche armures vnder colour colouren hide maner tho armures hid coloured al thei diden lorde kyng shal forfeted body marchaunt ponished kynges also accorded maner shalbe made brennyng hynderyng harmyng appairyng wastyng destroiyng horsse armures artillery habilimentes warre within forsaied citee castle beyng al euery without fraude maleengine shalbee kepte whole vnhurt lorde kyng beforesaied deliuered also accorded al euery chayne wer wont layed ouerthwart stretes lane thesaid citee shall bee put hous turned profite citezens thesame citee also accorded forsaid lord kyng shal haue place space lande frewill highnesse bee chosen hym paleis bee made within thesaied citee within walles citee shall seme moste behouefull neuerthelesse fall within thesaid place space included hous edefice place ground longyng thesaied citezens dweller thesame citee saied lorde kyng hym suche maner house edefices place ground longeth apperteineth shal satisfie house edefices place congruely shal recopence also accorded al euery subiectes said lord kyng wer prisoner persone beyng thesaid cite castle pledge shalbee vtterly free aneyntz persones somes thei bounde daie presente date accorde also accorded euery souldier strager beyng thesaid citee castle shall swere euangelies god departyng thei shall beare armes lorde kyng vnto first daie ianuarij next come maner commaundemet maner persone contrary maie doen enioyned also accorded al euery reliques goodes longyng abbey sainct katheryn within thesaied citee castle beyng holy shalbeen deliuered hym kyng shall depute receiue deliuerance thesaid citee also accorded forsaid noble citezes within thesaid citee castle beyng shall cause thesame citee castle thesaied xix daie present moneth ianuarij sufficiently honestly made cleane also diligently honestly ded body ded ded vnto daie deliuerance said citee honestly diligently shall buried also accorded forsaid noble citezens beyng thesaid citee castle furthwith shall receiue suffre entre thesame citee al euery poore persone beyng diches aboute diches thesame cite whiche penury go thesame cite thei shalbee bounde succor vnto xix daie ianuarij aboue saied thei wil aunswere god kyng el thei shall receive none person thesame citee castle vnto forsaied daie without special licence saied lorde kyng happe messenger herauld party aduersary kyng come gate diches thesaid castle citee vvhiche article apointmetes beforsaid euery maner accorded forsaied capitain noble citezes thesaid castle citee beyng wel truly without fraude malengine hold obserue kepe thei behoten tho kept fulfilled thei bynden befall forsaid moste doubt full lorde kyng god forbid ouercome battaill hym ymade charles aduersary fraunce duke burgoyn come siege lord kyng remoue forsaid citee nether theforsaid capitain ne none noble citezens souldiors beyng within theforsaid citee castle shall gone ne maner help thei shal deliuer ner leane lorde kyng commyng maner wise also appoyntmentes couenauntes accordes euery theim beforsaied well truly vnbroken bee kepte suretie thesame couenauntes accordes aid capitain noble citezens abouesaid shalbe taken tyme ymediatly handes lorde kyng lxxx notable pledge wherof xx shalbe knightes esquire remnant citezens thesame citee owne costes sustained also partie sothly moste doubtfull lorde kyng aforsaid graciously eningly cosidryng meke submittyng yeldyng thesame citee castle abouesaid hath graunted euery persone estate degree condicion thesaid citee castle beyng except certain persones within expressed wil become liege subiectes lorde kyng fro hencefurth dwell vnder obedience shall haue heritage goodes moueables vnmoueables within duchy normandy constitute whiche date present letter forsaid lord kyng person haue graunted except armurs artillaries abouesaied makyng doyng heritage vnmouable goodes forsaid lorde kyng seruice therof accustomed suche maner seruices graunt lorde kyng owen long also graunted lorde kynges behalfe citezens dweller citee roan tyme come shall shall haue euery franchise liberty priuileges whiche worthy mynd progenitor lorde kyng kynges englande duke normandy thesaid citee wer graunted possession wherof thei first day forsaid lorde kyng came theforsaid citee also large grace benygnitie hath graunted self citezens dweller citee shall haue al liberty fraunchises priuileges wherof thei wer possession theforsaid first daie comyng lorde kyng citee graunt progenitor kynges fraunce whiche tyme philip de ualoys aduersary said lorde kyng daily warryng vpo realme also graunted accorded lorde kynges behalf straungiers souldiours theforsaied citee castle beyng tyme willyng become liege lord kyng theforsaied citee castle yeldyng beforsaid frely departen leauyng saied lorde kyng armures horsse artillaries thynges harneis goodes except norman liege lorde kyng whiche euery shall abide prisoner lorde kyng except luca italico whiche also shalbe prisoner lorde kyng also whose name bee set boke longeth clerkes intermete also graunted lord kynges behalf warre also shrewed speches duryng siege folke aboue mencioned condicion thei royall person haue dooen defamed lippes haue spoken moste derest lorde kyng cosidrryng daie pitie mekely shalbe forgeuen take prisoner abouen speciall excepted also accorded lorde kynges behalfe theforsaied souldiors straungers forme present treatie accorde willyng departen lorde kyng shall ordain make saueconduite forme accustomed theforsaied citee yelden souereigne lorde kyng vpon wolstones daie beyng xix daie ianuarij afterward gat many strong tounes castle depe caudebec torney many mo shalbe written vvhen daie apoynctment came whiche daie wolston sir guy de butteler burgess toune good ordre came kynges lodgyng deliuered hym keyes citee castle besechyng hym fauor copassion kyng incontinent appoyncted duke excester greate compaignie take possession toune whiche like valiaunt capitain mounted goodly courser entred toune castle appoyncted watche ward euery toure bulwarke fortresse garnished walles banner stander penos kynges armes badge deuises next daie beyng frydaie kyng greate triumphe like conqueror accopaignied iiij duke x erles viii bishoppes xvi barones greate multitude knightes esquire men warre entred roan receiued clergie xlij cross whiche sang diuerse swete soges outwardly reioysyng soeuer inwardly thei thought met hym senate burgess toune offeryng hym diuerse faire costly presentes maner passed citee lady churche al solempnitie receiued bishop cannon said orison caused chapelaynes syng antheme quis est magnus dominus greate lorde god c doen came castle continued good space receiuyng homage fealty burgess tounes men settyng ordres emogest reedefied diuerse fortress toures duryng tyme made proclamacion al men whiche would become subiectes enioye goodes landes office whiche proclamacion caused many tounes yeld many men become englishe whiche ceason duke britain seyng power fraunce began decaye came kyng roan concluded hym league owne mere mocion fearyng ether afterward bee compelled therunto el offred late would accepted vvhen renderyng roan blowen normandy kynges proclamacion diuulged countrie maner incredible heare many tounes yelded desired many
