mortimer baylife homflew reherse tounes wer conquered fortress yelded wer made capitaines thesame pamphlet would turne volume tedious pleasaunt therfore ouer passyng small name muche doyng wil returne principall thynges touchyng sequele history desireth knowe circumstance deliuery lette hym ouerloke frenche writer whiche aduoyde shame confesse write veritee pthe seuenth yerethe vii yere gettyng roan deliuery tounes wer blased blowen whole realme fraunce wonder tell beleue howe hertes frenchman wer sodainly heuy courage sone coled mournyng lamentyng iminent mischief whiche thei sawe diuision nobilitee like shortely fal heddes sorowyng euil chance thei sawe remedy prepared yet none help hand thought whosoeuer kicked wynched matter ihon duke burgoyn raged swelled ye muche freated wist saie lesse dooe meruaill vexed troubled doble desease one tyme ruled kyng charles thynges whether reason agreed cause knewe nether free dis yet deliuered scope malice therfore imagined mischiefes calamity whiche chaunced common wealth bee imputed assigned vnpolitike doyng negligent permission wherfore ymagined proffitable realme hymself moste auaylable meanes possible could deuise practise inuent waie meane whiche might reconcile ioyne amitee twoo greate mightie kynges englande fraunce whiche thyng obteigned beyng deliuered al feare exterior hostilitee determined first reuenge quarell charles dolphyn represse cause grudge disdain recouer bothe fauor commonaltee also put awaie al cause suspicion imagined infamy hym procedynges intedyng buyld vpon fraile foundacion sent letter ambassador kyng englande aduertisyng hym would personally come communicacion bee betwene hym charles frenche kyng doubted onely meanes peace induced blouddy battaill clerely exiled kyng henry heard gentely ambassador agreed request desire came maunte feast pentecost kept liberall hous commers sat hymself greate estate whiche daie ether good seruice dooen good expectacion thynges come created gascon de foys valiaunt gascoyn erle longeuile sir ihon grey likewise made erle tankeruile lorde burshier erle ewe solempne feast ended place enteruiewe metyng apoynted beside melaus riuer seyne faire playne euery parte commissioner appoynted grounde frenchman diched trenched paled lodgynges feare afterclappes englishman parte barred ported kyng englande large tent blewe veluet grene richely embrodered two deuises one antlop drawyng horse mill antlop sittyng high stage braunche olife mouthe tente replenished decked poysie busie laboure commeth victorious reste top heigth thesame set greate egle golde whose iyes wer suche orient diamondes thei glistered shone ouer whole felde frenche kyng likewise parke faire pauilion blew veluet richely embrodered flower deluse toppe thesame set white harte fliyng made fyne siluer winges enameled betwene two campes enclosers apoynted tent purple veluet cousailers mete euery part egall nombre watch night se good ordre day vvhen daie apoinctment approched kyng england acco paignied duke clarence gloucester brother duke excester vncle henry beauford clerke vncle whiche bishop winchester cardinall erles marche salsbury numbre thousand men warre entered parke toke lodgyng likewise frenche part thether came isabell frenche quene kyng husband fallen old frenaticall desease hauyng compaigny duke burgoyn therle sainct paule attendyng faire lady katheryn doughter xxvi lady damoselles also furniture thousande men warre estate reposed themselfes one night tentes next day al suche appointed repaired toward pauilion ordained consultacion kyng england like prince great stomacke lesse good behauor receiued humbly frenche quene daughter honorably embraced familierly kyssed duke burgoyn made lowe curtesy bowed kyng kyng louyngly toke hand honorably entertained salutacions embrasynges finished fel counsel within pauilion assigned whiche kept garde appointed party none comissioners shuld attempt enter kynges requestes made demaundes declared french quene company toke leaue louyngly kyng england returned ponthoyse certifie husband demaundes claymes kyng henry returned mante next day assembled againe frenche part brought lady katherin thentent king england seyng beholdyng fayre lady minion damosel inflamed rapte loue obtayne beautiful espouse soner agre gentle peace louyng composicion company met together viii seueral tymes sometyme one parte sometyme notwithstandyng englishman frenchman lodged great distance sunder yet neuer fraye occasion tumulte riot prouoked stirred party whiche bothe nature considered somewhat marueiled assemble many wordes spent dedes done many thinges required offered many argumentes made co clusion taken author write dolphyn let treatie sent duke burgoyne sir tauegny du chastel declaryng would let agrement would comon take suche ordre whole realme frauce therof glad reioyce cause breche man certainly declareth effect ensued long consultacion party princely fashion departed englishman mantis frenchman ponthoyse kyng england nothing pleased yet contented comunicacion came none ende wherfore mistrustyng duke burgoyn let stop desire requestes sayd vnto departyng fayre cosin wil haue kynges daughter al thinges damaund wil driue kyng realme well sayd duke burgoyn driue kyng realme shalbe wel weried therof doubt lytle departure duke burgoyn beyng nobly accompanied roade toune melune wher dolphyn soiorned plaine feldes ii like frendes comoned together co cluded apparantly open amitie sure frendship written notary signed handes sealed great ale armes sequele sheweth heart thought tong talked mynde meant hand wrote treaty concluded vi day iuly yere lord proclaymed paris amience ponthoyse newe alience notified shortely kyng england liyng maunt whiche therwith sore displeased without cau e perceiued force two prince muche stronger beyng vnited one beyng seperated deuided yet notwithstandyng great sworne sealed amitie nothyng minded set forward intented enterprise ayde god performe conquest maugre euil wyll puissaunce enemy wherfore sent capitayne bueffe brother earle foys newly created earle longuile xvc men secretly toune ponthoyse whiche trinitie sonday erly mornyng came toune sodainly shortely set vp skalyng ladder wal entred toune watche perceiued criyng saint george saint george lord lisleadam capitain toune perceiuyng walles skaled market place gained opened gate toward paris whiche withal retinue diuers tounes men nombre viii thousand fled englishman durst nombre smal one deuide selues fal pilfryng til prime duke clarence came ayde v thousand men way encoutred diuers burgess toune fliyng al substance toward beauuoys toke prisoner brought againe olde dwellyng place duke come ponthoyse muche praised valiantnes assailantes gaue chief spoyle toune marchauntes whiche great plenty foyson duke great puissaunce came paris lay cytie two day two nightes without proffre either issue enemy defece assauted whiche could wel long ample nobre smal great enterprise furnished wherfore seyng enemy durst one loke returned againe ponthoyse takyng whiche toune countrey fraunce especial parisienswer sore dismayed astonied fortresse hable resist withstand muche irishman ouercame al isle fraunce frenchman dammages innumerable writters affirme brought dayly praies englishe armye beside would robbe house lay beddes backes kine ride vpo cary yong child sel englishman slaues whiche straung doynges feared frenchemen within territory paris coutrey rude person fled village withal stuffe cytie paris frenche kyng duke burgoyn liyng denise hearyng al doynges departed al hast quene daughter troy champaigne takyng great deliberacion best done leauyng paris earle paul lord lisleadam great puissance defende cytie tyme duke clarence toke strong toune gysors taken toune gayllard al tounes normandy shortely either taken force rendred except mount aint michel whiche gayne therof lytle losse assautyng semed muche also could smal harme none countrey adioynyng neither assaulted besieged thus haue heard duchy normandy reduced agayne right line restored possession right heyre bene ro tyme kyng henry third yere lord wrongfully detained kynges england wisemen fraunce sore lamentyng chaunce cou trey misery people sawe perceiued puissance ynough defende enemy perfite co cord amongest selues apparantly sawe although wer peace openly concluded betwene dolphyn duke burgoyn yet thei imagined good fruit succeded thesame duke either secret displeasure bare dolphyn doubt thenglishme neuer assailed self army kyng henry neuer sent ayde succour dolphyn wherfore meanes frendes new comunicacion appointed thentent corrupt dregges olde malice inwarde grudge might clearely cast extinct place metyng appoincted toune monstrel fault yonne called smal brooke called yonne runneth riuer sein ouer whiche riuer made bridge diuers barres ouerthwart prince openyng barres might eche embrace touche kepyng barres shut eche might se common pleasure day appointed ii great prince mete bridge thentent al ciuile discord comunicacion cleare forgotten least suspended tyl enemy vanquished driuen coutries confines mocion worse succeded entreators deuised euery man fulfilled hope peace concord crafty imaginacion crepte cancard displeasure almost brought al thinges libertie bondage vvhen day place solempne enteruiewe agreed assigned tauagny du chastel prompt prone al mischief called remembraunce shamefull murder lewes duke orleaunce vnder long bene capitaine done committed duke burgoyne haue heard determined selfe reuenge death olde maister lorde say therto stirred prouoked dolphyn vnlike dolphyn whiche bare continual hatred duke burgoyn imagined paraduenture meanes represse subdue whole power high pride duke without suspection fraude reproche vntruth vilany wel day came whiche xii day august euery prince nombre appointed came bridge duke burgoyne beyng warned frendes kepe closure barres side shut lytle regarded fredesmonicion could auoide stroke prouided opened barres closure came dolphyns presence whiche cleane armed kneled doune one kne shewyng great reuerence humilitie dolphyn shewed louyng countenaunce reproued laiyng charge muche vntruth great dishonor duke againe boldly defended cause nowe duke duryng comunicacion kneled styl sworde backe often turnyng mouyng answeryng dolphyn counsel put backe plucke sworde forwarde sir robert de loyer wyll drawe sworde lorde dolphyn tauagny du chastel apperceiued occasion geuen performe enterprise incontinent strake hatchet head could speake standyng shortly dispatched life diuers part thinkyng dead began draw weapon amongest lord nouale slaine taken murther condempned apprehended parliament president prouynce vicount narbone guylliam battelier tauagny du chastel robert loyre iiii ende ihon called proude duke burgoyne whiche regarded ciuile warre intestine dissencion owne life welfare sodein death thinke came without desert shamefully murtheryng lewes duke orleance french kynges brother suche iustice god bloud part recompensed bloud vnnatural homicide requited shameful death soden destruction heynous murder thus committed might reherse dolphyns seruauntes despoyled duke garmetes sherte couered face hosen could declare dolphyn sent letter paris cyties tounes publishyng vntruely diuers opprobrious wordes spoken diuers great outragious offence done duke kyng whole realme could declare howe wisemen fraunce detested abhorred abhominable act perceiuyng ende like ensue contrary side whiche linage orleance reioysed laughed miserable chaunce sodain fal thenglish nacion partie neither facte counsel wyl declare kyng englande notorious dede done committed pthe viii yerethe viii yere philip erle charoloys sone heyre duke ihon murther death father duke burgoyn earle flauders enformed liyng gaunt misfortune final ende noble parent louyng father toke mater cause greuously heauily insomuche cousel durst one speake especial lady michel wife syster dolphyn daughter kyng great feare forsaken cast house fauoure thinges ende sorow asswageth doloure somewhat mitegate fyrst thaduise counseil receiued fauor company fayre duches louyng wife sent diuers able ambassadours king england liyng roan treate conclude peace betwene certaine space whiche request hope better chaunce kyng henry agreed knot knit kept solempne obsequy father saint uaas arras xxiii prelate cross duryng whiche tyme earle saint paule parisiens sent ambassadours knowe defend selues englishman gently answered messenger trusted shortly ayde god licence kyng conclude peace perpetual amitie great comfort relief ambassador wer departed make relacion magistrate gouernors cytie paris long cosultacion aswel men spiritualtie temporal lay person sent bishop arras two notable person kyng england certaine article clause whiche duke burgoyn offred loue sayd kyng england consideryng selfe duke burgoyn couenient organe necessary instrument conueigh desire purpose louyngly receiued honorably entertained duke ambassadours declaryng vnto would without prolongyng tyme send ambassadours whiche open lawful requestes reasonable desire answere duke messenger departed towarde arras incontinent departure kyng henry sent earle warwike bishop rochestre many knightes esquiers duke burgoyn whiche declared effect purpose ambassade comyng gently heard requestes alowed augmented altred disalowed coclusion often sendyng betwene kyng duke agreed kyng comons would assent frenche kyng quene daughter katherin troy champaigne gouerned ordred whiche would rather x tymes spurre forward purpose entente duke burgoyn bridle pul backe one iote preferred say truce tripertited betwene ii kynges duke countreys determined kyng englad shuld send copany duke burgoyn ambassador troy chapaigne sufficiently authorised coclud great matter kyng england beyng good hope al affaire prosperously succede go forward sent duke burgoyn vncle duke exceter earle salsbury bishop ely lord fanhope lord fitzhugh sir ihon robsert sir philip hal diuers doctor nombre ccccc horse whiche co pany duke burgoyn came cytie troy xxi daye marche kyng quene lady katherin receiued heartely welcomed shewyng great signes token loue amitie fewe day fel counsel whiche co cluded kyng henry england come troy mary lady katherin kyng make heyre realme croune dignitie death departure natural life many article whiche hereafter place conuenient shal heare reher ed vvhen thynges done concluded ambassador england departed toward kyng leuyng behynde sir ihon robsert geue attendaunce lady katherin kyng henry heard ambassador reherse article pointes treatie amitie concluded condiscended agreed diligence set toward troy logyng sight darlyng fayre lady katherin althoughe reioysed thynges succeded luckely purpose imagined yet trusted somuche glosyng wordes golden promise frenche nacion beyng auncient enemy would rashely auenture person without perfite serch diligent inquirie doynges attemptes doubtful newe reconciled frendes beyng warned admonished late mischance ihon duke burgoyn yet recent euery man eye sawe sunne shyne ayre clere euery syde accompanied duke clarence gloucester brother earles warwike salsbury huntyngdon ewe tankeruile loguile xv thousand men warre departed roan ponthoyse thence sainct denis two league paris thence pontcharenton left garison menne kepe passage thence prouynce came toward troy duke burgoyn accompaignied many noble men receiued hym two league without toune coueighed hym lodgyng prince hym armie lodged small village theraboute reposed went visete kyng quene lady katheryn founde sainct peter churche ioyous metyng honourable receiuyng louyng embrasyng bothe partes whiche twenty daie maie ther wer kyng lady katherin made sure together high aultare third daie iune nexte folowyng thei solempnite espoused maried thesame churche whiche mariage englishman made suche triumphes pompes pagiauntes though kyng worlde present muche three frenche writer affirme noble fraunce merueled honor glory englishman thei disdeigned maligned owne fortune solempne ceremony wer honorably finished mariage consummate twoo kynges counsaill assembled together diuerse day wherin former league treatie diuerse poyntes altred brought certaintie deuice kyng englande brother great matter finished kynges sware part obserue agrement league poynctes likewise sware duke burgoyne great nombre prince noble whiche presente soner thei marueiled noble actes dooen kyng henry thei knowledge report thei marueled thei sawe beheld honor estate wisedom persone whether thei sware outwarde countenaunce inwardly thought contrary let whiche knowe frenche constancy iudge tell truthe assuredly thei perceiued hym bee prudent bothe askyng geuyng counsaill thei sawe hym expert apt marciall feates nymble thynges apperteignyng warre thei thought hym strong perelles imagined hym fortunate chaunces doynges wherfore saied thei muche marueled hym regarded persone named proclaimed heire regent fraunce french kyng sent copie treaty euery toune frauce kyng englande sent thesame englishe euery citee market toune bee published deuulged copie whereof written woorde woorde ensueth article appoynctmentes peace betwene realmes englande fraunce henry grace god kyng englande heire regent fraunce lorde irelande perpetuall mind christen people tho vnder obeisance notefie declare though hath orne diuerse treaty betwene moste excellent prince charles father fraunce progenitor peace betwene twoo realmes fraunce englande whiche haue borne fruite consideryng greate harmes whiche hath onely fallen betwene twoo realmes great deuision hath betwene holy churche haue taken treaty saied father whiche treaty betwixt saied rather v concluded accorded forme maner foloweth first accorded betwixt oure father v forasmuche bond matrimony made good peace betwene v moste dere beloued katheryn doughter aied father moste dere mother isabell wife thesame charles isabell made father mother therfore father mother shall haue worship sitteth semeth worthy prince princesse worshipped principally temporall persones worlde also shal distroble disseason letten father aforsaid holde possede long liueth holdeth possedeth tyme croune dignitee royall fraunce rente proffites thesame sustenance estate charge realme forsaid mother also hold aslong liueth thestate dignitee quene maner thesame realme conuenable conuenience part thesaid rente proffites also forsaid lady katherin shall take haue dower realme englande quenes england afore wer wont take haue say xlm scute whiche two algate shalbe worth noble englishe also way maners meanes maie without transgression offence made v kepe lawes customes vsages rightes saied realme englande shall doen labor pursute thesaid katheryn al sone maie doen made su e take haue said realme englande tyme death thesaied dower xlm scute yerely whiche twayne algate worth noble englishe also hap thesaid katheryn ouerliue v shall take haue realme fraunce ymediatly tyme death dower xxm frankes yerely vpon landes place lordshippes held blaunch somtyme wife philip boseele saied father also death father aforsaied thence forwarde croune realme fraunce rightes appurtenaunces shall remain abide v v heires euermore also forasmuche saied father witholden diuerse sicknes suche maner maie intende owne persone dispose nedes theforsaied realme fraunce therfore duryng life saied father faculty exercise gouernance disposicion publique common proffite thesaied realme fraunce counsaill noble wise men thesame realme fraunce shalbe abide v hencefurthe maie gouerne thesame realme v also admit cou saill assistence thesaid noble suche shall thynke mete whiche faculty exercise gouernance thus toward v shall labor purpose v spedefully diligently truly maie ought worship god saied father mother also common good thesaied realme realme counsaill help worthy greate noble thesame realme defeded peased gouerned right equitie also owne power shall courte parliament frauce kept obserued authorite soueraignte doen maner place tyme commyng shalbe subiect saied father also wee oure power shall defende helpe euery peres noble citees tounes commonalty synguler person tyme commyng subiectes father rightes customes priuileges fredome fraunchises longyng dewe maner place tyme commyng subiect father also diligently truly shall trauaile power iustice administred doen thesame realme fraunce lawes customes rightes thesame realme without personalx excepcion shall kepe holde subiectes realme tranquilitie peace power shall defend maner violence oppression also power shall prouide power able persones proffitable taken office aswell iustices office longyng gouernaunce demaynes office thesaid realme fraunce good right peaceable iustice thesame thadministracion shalbe comitted vnto theim thei suche person lawes rightes thesame realme vtilitee proffite saied father shall minister forsaied realme shall bee taken deputed thesame office also wee power sone maie commodiously bee doen shall trauaile put obedience saied father maner citees tounes castle place countrees persones within realme fraunce disobedient elles saied father holdyng whiche called dolphin arminack also might comodiously surely frely doen exercise fulfill thynges aforsaid accorded worthy noble estate thesame realme fraunce aswell spiritual temporalles also citees notable commonalty citezens burgeis tounes realme fraunce obeysaunt tyme saied father shall make othes folowen first v hauyng facultie exercise disposicion gouernaunce forsaied common proffite hestes commaundementes thei shall mekely obediently obeye intende maner thyng concernyng exercise gouernance thesame realme also worthy greate noble estate thesaid realme aswell spiritual temporalles also citees notable commonalty citezens burgeses thesame realme maner thynges well truly shal kepe power shall kept muche theim belongeth theim thynges apoyncted accorded betwene forsaid father mother v counsaill v lust calle v also continually death death saied father charles thei shalbe true liegeme heires thei shal receiue admit v iege souereigne verie kyng fraunce suche obeye v without opposicio contradiccion difficultee thei forsaid father duryng life neuer realme frauce shall obey man kyng regent fraunce v heires also thei shall counsaill helpe assente lese life lymine take euill takyng suffre harme diminicion person estate worship goodes thei knowe suche thyng cast ymagined againste v thei shall let power thei shall doen v weten therof hastely thei maie theimself message letter also maner conquestes bee made v fraunce vpon thesaied inobedientes duchie normandy shalbe doen proffite said father power shall al maner landes lordshipes place conquered longyng persones obeyng saied father whiche shall sweare kepe presente accord shalbee restored thesame persones thei long also al maner persones holy churche beneficed duchy normandy place realme frauce subiect father fauoryng partie duke burgoyne whiche shall sweare kepe present accord shall reioyce peaceably benefice holy churche duchy normandy place next aforsaied also likewise maner persones holy churche obediente v beneficed realme fraunce place subiect father shal swere kepe presente accord shal enioye peaceably benefice holy churche place next abouesaied also al maner church uniuersitees study generall al college study college holy churche beyng place tyme commyng subiecte father duchy normady place realme fraunce subiect v shall enioye rightes possession rente prerogatiues liberty fraunchises longyng dewe theim maner wise thesaid realme fraunce sauyng right croune fraunce euery persone also goddes help whe happeneth v come croune fraunce duchy normandy place conquered v realme fraunce shall bowe vnder commaundement obeysaunce monarchy croune fraunce also shall enforce v dooe power recompence bee made said father without diminicion croune fraunce persones obeiyng hym fauoryng partie said burgoyn longeth landes lordshippes rente possession said duchy normandy place realme fraunce conquered v hethertoward geuen v placs landes gotten gotten ouercome name said father vpon rebelles inobedientes hym bee suche maner recompence bee made saied persones life saied father shall make recompence suche maner place goodes happeneth goddes grace croune fraunce landes lordshippes rente possessios whiche longeth suche maner persones thesaied duchy place geuen v thesame persones shalbee restored theim without delaye also duryng life father place nowe tyme commyng subiect letter common iustice also grauntes office giftes pardos remission priuileges shalbe written procede vnder name seale saied father forasmuche synguler cace maie fall maye bee forseen mannes witte whiche might necessary behouefull write letter suche maner cace hap good surety saied father gouernaunce longeth v beforsaied eschewen perilles otherwise might fall preiudice saied father write oure letter whiche shall commaunde charge defende nature qualitie nede father behalfe oures regent fraunce also duryng oure father life wee shall calle e write v kyng fraunce vtterly shall absteyne v name long father liueth also saied father duryng life shall nempne call write v frenche maner nostre filz henry roy dengleterre beretere latin maner precharissimus filius noster hericus rex angliae here franciae also shall put none imposicions exaccios charge subiectes said father without cause resonable necessary ne otherwise common good realme fraunce saiyng askyng lawes customes reasonable approued thesame realme also shall trauaile power effect intent thassent three estate either realmes fraunce englande maner obstacle maie doen awaie partie ordeigned prouided fro tyme heires come croune fraunce bothe crounes saie fraunce england perpetually together one thesame persone saie father life v terme life thence forward persones heires shalbee one another bothe realmes shalbee gouerned fro wee oure heires come thesame seuerally vnder diuerse kynges one tyme vnder person whiche tyme shalbe kyng bothe realmes souereigne lorde beforesaid kepyng neuerthelesse maner thynges ether ye realmes rightes liberty customes vsages lawes makyng subiecte maner wise one thesame realmes rightes lawes vsages also hence forwarde perpetually shalbee still reste maner wise discencions hate rancoures enuies war e betwene thesame realmes fraunce englande people e ame realmes drawyng accorde thesame peace maie cea e bee broken also shalbe hence forwarde euermore peace tranquillitee good accord common affeccion stable frendship betwene thesame realmes subiectes beforesaied thesame realmes shall kepe theselfes counsaill helpes comon assistence maner men enforce theim doen ymagine wronges harmes displeasours greuaunce theim ether theim thei shalbee conuersaunt marchandisen frely surely together paiyng custome dew accustomed thei shalbe conuersaunt also al tho confederate alies aid father realme fraunce aforsaid also confederate realme englande aforsaied shall viij monethes tyme accord peace notified declare letter thei wolle draw accord woll comprehended vnder treaty accord peace sauyng neuerthelesse ether crounes also maner accions rightes reuenues longen sayd father subiectes v subiectes againe maner ally confederacy also neither father neither brother duke burgoyn shall begynne ne make charles clepyng selfe dolphyn uyennes treaty peace accorde counsel assent al eche v thre thre estate either sayd realmes aboue named also assent sayd brother burgoyne noble realme frauce whiche therto owen called shal ordaine gouernance sayd father sekyrly louyngly honestly askyng royal estate dignitie maner shalbe worship god father realme fraunce also al maner person shalbe father personal seruice onely office seruices aswell noble gentles shalbe suche hath bene borne realme fraunce place longyng fraunce good wise true able foresayd seruice sayd father shal dwel place notable obedience nowhere el wherfore charge comaunde sayd liege subiectes beyng vnder obedience kepe kept al longeth accord peace forme maner accorded attempte maner wyse thyng may preiudice co trary accorde peace vpon pai e life lymme may forfaite v youen troy xxx day may proclaimed london xx day iune also thinges aforesayd euery one shal geue assent letter patentes sealed seale vnto oure ays father al approbacion confirmacion v bloud royal al cyties tounes v obedient sealed seales accustomed oure sayd father beside letter patentes sealed vnder great seale shall make cause made letter appro atory confirmacions peres realme lordes citezens burgess vnder obedience whiche article haue sworne kepe vpon holy euangelistes ought forget howe ii men named learned bothe lawes one called master ihon bouchet aquitanical writer archedeacon terbe master de prato solempne prothonotary pratyng gloser wrote treaty composicio make therof great matter makyng peace shuld appeare england right frauce graunt nothyng england geuen fyrst ihon bouchet saieth treaty worst cotract euer made kynges england saith apparant kyng englad hah neither tytle right croune fraunce coposicion right thei take coposicion vpon text master gloser saieth composicion geueth new right wer old taketh away geueth new whiche new gift litle value lesse afficacie law issue female may enherite accordyng lawe salique therfore cannot make doughter heyre croune fraunce might bold wold axe maister ihon bouchet question wrongfully kepe possession true lawful inheritaunce neither able purse neither power prosecute cause competent iudge proces lawe wyll owne mere mocion moued paraduenture conscience render right wyl suffre enioy lande duryng life wyl mary daughter haue land gift thyng iustly law equitie rendred receiued lykewise riche man owe poore man hundreth poundes whiche able substance feare displeasure dare attempt suyte quarel detter wyl offer pay money dayes whiche request poore man agreeth newe gift money payment det fyrst question demaudant tytle could graunt accion land duryng life second plaintiffe none interest could geue day payment yet case one part right would make offre copound co posicions haue respect right precedent matter would iudge kyng great puissant realme asset whole counsel would dishenerite onely sonne surrendre title without apparant right open tytle knowen shewed partie olde prouerbe sayeth long sufferaunce acquittance prolongyng tyme derogacion right also restitucion graut payment duetie gift doctor write clerkes afferme treaty arbitrementes composicions bothe godly charitable honest restore one partie auncient right whether landes goodes dispence releue takyng profites land vsyng marchandies occupacion money master gloser whiche affirmeth composicion taketh away old right geueth new coposicion value surely master ihon de prato would haue suche peuyshe proctor reteined say euery coposicion geueth new right taketh away aunciet title yet sayd coposicion neither geueth geue right whiche coclucion manifestly repugnant antecedent therfore must answered thus nothyng geuen nothyng taken away consequently coposicion coposicion remaineth styl olde auncient tytle state paraduenture master gloser wyl say allege tytle england abrogated house ualoys may lawfully prescribe kynges england haue possession fortie yeres meane kyng hery tytle clayme chalenge part realme fraunce pray remember yeres accompt doynges shal euidently perceiue king edward third indubitate heyre general croune fraunce kyng richard second kyng henry fourth noble kyng henry fift neuer desisted vi viii yeres moost either battaile treatie chalenge clayme aucient right old enheritaunce quene isabel discended title euer strife neuer quiet tyll nowe right lyne restored law salique put boget among lye fayned fable thus may se affection frenchemen archefoole cannot forge lye pleasure rothodawe wyll faine glose mainteine folish fatasie let v leue wylful writer returne kyng england whiche al e article treaty beyng concluded sworne made frenche kyng duke burgoyn frenche lordes solempne sumptuous supper banket departyng sadly soberly sayd wordes thought care study noble prince men high honor inuent meane study way kyngdomes benefite almightie god enlarged amplified co exyng ioynyng one may left posteritie clene pure domestical dissecion ciuile discorde thentent prince potestate hath day al europe greater gouernance richer regiment puissant empire trust leue hereafter ther shal power dominion able copared equyuolent wherfore entende fyrst extirpate plucke away rote leuynges ciuile discecion realme lately begon whiche ly brest charles kynges sone decre iudgement assent newe state dignitie dolphyn vtterly depriued disgraded couenient decent beare armure muche destroy confound bring obaysance reasonable coformitie maner prince thinke would proue obtaine possesse kyngdome beyng lusty yong striplyng fearyng god regardyng honor contrary promise humaine honestie ashamed polute staine selfe bloud homicide valeaunt duke burgoyn cancard stomacke brest yong prince oh tyrannical heart body gentle men vntrue tong mouth christen men christian pagane whiche neglecting honor violatyng promise dispisyng honestie would procure cosent abhominable fact sedicious murder wherfore thynges wel pondered iustly considered require ioyne stand cleue heyre successor dere welbeloued father lawe king charles realme kyngdome fyrst noble auncesters right title iust clayme lawfully discended grudge pray englishman shall succede croune frauce assure wil noted mere alien straunger great grandfather kyng edward third sone quene isabel daughter philip fayre sister heyre iii kynges relme dead without issue great graundmother quene philip discended noble house ualoys old trite prouerbe true woman side surer side childe foloweth wombe although one part englishe yet surer part frenche frenche floure budded brought furth therfore remembre englishe put mindes coutrey borne cosider christen man anoynted kyng profession apperteineth onely defend protect people subiectes forein power outward inuasions also minister indifferent iustice conserue pollitike ordre moderate quietnes finally accordyng desert merites promote auance prefer rich honor estate whiche thinges would trusty frendes whose louyng heartes beneuolent myndes shall neuer forgette put obliuion dutie god shuld office kyng shuld whiche lawes nature reason ought rendre kyndnes kyndnes goodnes desert honor merite therfore coclude humbly require stande strong kyng charles father lawe stede myne owne parent worship loue honor concord agrement whiche cal trust peace final mortal ende loue serue true posteritie assure part occean sea shall soner leue flowyng bright sunne shal soner leue shinyng shall ceasse whiche becommeth prince subiecte father ought natural child vvhen thus persuaded nobilitie al army hauyng french kyng duke burgoyn came toune sene burgoyn toke part dolphyn destroied countrey xv day toune yelded made capitain lorde ienuale thence remoued monstreau fault yone duke burgoyn slain haue heard whiche toune take assault many dolphyns parte apprehended could get castel gettyng toune castle whiche newly replenished men vitayle denied redre strongly besieged duryng whiche assault duke burgoyn enformed diuers place duke father buried whose corp caused taken vp sered coueighed diron high burgoyn buried duke philip father kyng england sent certaine prisoner taken toune aduise capitaine castle yeld obstinatly denied request geuyng opprobrious wordes kynges herault wherfore kyng englad caused gybbet set vp castle whiche hanged xii prisoner gentleman frendes capitaine lord guytry lieftenant castle perceiued meanes could succoured fearyng taken force beganne treat kyng englad whiche viii day would take none offer co clusion rendred selues simply liues onely saued vi wekes siege castle deliuered earle warwike made capitaine toune castle whiche fortefied men ordinance artillerie thence kyng england departed molyn vpon seyne besieged round aboute whose company frenche kyng yong kyng scottes duke burgoyn clarence bedford gloucester duke barre prince oreng moyle syr ihon stanley syr lewes mohu xv maister souldiers valeaunt prince noble men besieged strong toune space almost vii monethes without made mynes cast trench shot gunnes dayly walles within wherof lord barbason chief capitaine manfully defended euery day skyrmishyng scalyng assautyng losse bothe party al losse within duryng whiche siege frenche quene quene england duches burgoyn came diuers tymes visite husbandes se fredes kyng england highly feasted louyngly entertained pleasant pastymes comforted euery creature reported honor liberalitie gentlenes siege long cotinued vitayles within toune began fayle pestilence began growe capitaine began treat coclusion toune deliuered vpon certain condicions wherof one al concentyng death duke burgoyn deliuered kyng wherof lorde barbason suspected one wer deliuered kyng england whiche sent vnder conduyte duke clarence brother cytie paris wherof frenche kyng made capitaine toke possession bastyl saint anthony louure house neele place boy de uynannes vvhen toune thus yelded kyng england made capitaine ther therle huntyngdon fro thence departed army corbeil frenche kyng two quenes soiorned thence ii kynges accompanied duke bedford burgoyn gloucester exceter therles warwike salisbury greate numbre noble men knightes set furthe toward paris citezens good ordre met without gate clergy also solempne processio al stretes wer hanged riche clothes people stretes shouted clapped handes ioye twoo kynges rode together kyng englande geuyng vpper hande father inlawe greate citee paris lady churche thei said deuocions thei departed lodgynges frenche kyng hous sainct paule kyng englande castle louure next day twoo quenes made entree paris wer receiued like solempnite husbandes daie declare greate giftes costly presentes plenty vitaile geuen kyng englande reherse conduites abundantly spouted wine diuerse colour discribe costly pagiantes plesant songes swete armony wer shewed song plaied diuerse place citie shewe greate gladnes hertie reioysyng greate delight comen people concorde peace finall reherse many thynges would weried bothe readyng hearyng dvryng season ii kynges thus lay paris greate asseble called aswell spiritualtie nobilitie whiche two kynges sat iudges duches burgoyn proctor appeled dolphin vii murdre duke ihon husband whiche appele cousaill part made diuerse offer amendes aswell foundacios priestes praie solle recompence money widowe child finall determinacio wherof kynges toke farther deliberacion apointed farther daie citee paris tyme resorted three estate realme euery persone seuerally sware upo holy euangelistes kepe support maintein defende treaty peace finall whiche concluded betwene twoo prince counsailes therto euery noble man spirituall gouernor teporall ruler set seales whiche instrumentes wer sent kynges treasury exchequer westminster sauely kept wher thei yet remain two kinges orned paris feaste christmas frenche kyng liyng hous paule kept estate open courte man except houshold seruauntes men base estate frequented hous kyng englande quene kepte suche solempne estate plentifull hous princely pastyme gaue many gyftes partes fraunce noble men resorted palice se estate dooe hym honor kyng england toke vpon hym regent frauce redresse cause remoue officer reforme thynges misse caused new coyne made called salute wer armes fraunce armes england frauce quarterly set thynges quietnes constituted sir gilbert um reuile capitain un good numbre valiant souldiers erle huntyngdon cosyn germain deputed capitain boy de uincens duke excester vc menne warre assigned kepe citee toune paris thus ordered affaire accordyng deuice ordre quene wife prince noble departed paris came citie roan remouyng caused proces made charles called dolphyn comaundyng hym apere table marble paris lacke aperance solempnitie suche cause requisite denounced giltie murther homicide ihon late duke bugoyne sentence court parliament exiled banished realme territory fraunce depriued honores name dignity preheminences whiche herafter might haue wherefore dolphyn went lang edoc poytiers gettyng hym suche frendes could especiall obteigned highly fauor therle arminack onely toke part also releued hym money aided hym men owne persone continually serued hym foe enemy vvhile kyng henry soiorned citee roan receiued homage noble normandy emogest therie stafford homage countie perche arthur britayn homage countie yury whiche kyng geuen also ordeined leuetenaunt generall bothe fraunce normandy brother thomas duke clarence deputie normandy erle salisbury feast christmas whiche kept triumphe solemptie castle roan passed quene wife departed roan amies came caleis toke ship morow candelmas daie landed douer came eltham londo westminster meruel write meruel se ioy triumphe solace reioisyng receiued al subiectes especiall lodoners tediousnesse ouer passe doubt englande greate cause reioyce coming suche noble capitain valiant prince mightie conqueror whiche small space briefe tyme brought vnder obeysance greate puissant realme dominion fraunce first rendre god creator moste huble hertie thankes caused solempne procession obserued kept v day together euery citee toune doen made greate purueighance thynges necessary coronacion quene spouse faire lady katheryn whiche doen daie mathy xxiiij daie february whiche solepne feast coueighed fote betwene ii bishop vnder riche ca apie fro great halle westminster peter churche anoynted crouned al ye ceremony great estate aperteinyng requisite whiche solepnitie ended great pope coueighed westminster hall ther set ye throne table marble vpper end hall whose seruice solepnite list rede let loke chronicle robert fabia declareth large pthe nynth yerethe ix yere thynges thus dooyng englande duke clarence brother kyng lieuetenat generall fraunce normandy assembled together garrison normandy toune bernay thece departed countrie mayne pount de gene passed riuer youe rode countrie lucie passed riuer loyre entered aniowe came citee angiers made many knightes saie sir william rosse sir henry godard sir rowlad rider sir thomas beaufforde called bastard clarence diuerse forraid brent spoyled coutrie returned praie pillage toune beaufford valey aduertised greate numbre enemy wer assembled together place called bangie saie duke alanson callyng hymself leuetenant generall dolphyn therle marche auerne therle merle therle ponthiure uicount thomars uicount chasteaulerat uicount damboyse lorde egle bastard alanson bastard de la marche bastard uandosme lorde champaine sir anthony champayne lorde fountayes lorde bellay lorde dauerton lorde rambures lorde tanagny de chastell sir ihon turmyn lorde dasse lorde buell lorde gaules lorde graueney lorde dela brete lorde de la faiet marshall dolphyn baron coluces lorde danzebost lorde uipond diagosales capitain spaniardes scottes whiche late come scotlande serue dolphyn ihon erle boghan robert brother sonnes gouer scotlande archibald dowglas erle wigto alexader lynsay brother therle crayford sir thomas swynton sir william stuard sir willyam doglas sir ihon turnebull sir robert lisle sir william connyngham sir alexander meldryne sir alexander hume sir ihon balglauie sir willyam lisle sir ihon haliburton sir ihon crawforth sir william candey sir ihon grey sir ihon commyn sir rober boence sir archibalt forbosse sir ducane comine many duke clarence lomberd resortyng hym called andrewe forgusa retained part aduerse duke inquired nubre enemy reported numbre small strength far vnmete compare halfe power puissaunt armie entisyng prouokyng hym set frenchman warratyng hym famous victory faire daie duke geuyng muche credite traytor like valiant coragious prince assembled together al horssemen army lefte archer behynde hym vnder ordre bastarde clarence two portyngales capitaines fresnye le uicount saiyng onely noble would haue honor iorney duke passed straight narowe passage espied enemy ranged good ordre battaill monicion lombard whiche sold hym enemy thesaid aduersaies laied suche bushementes straightes duke wayes without battaill could ether retire lie englishemen seyng remedy valiauntly set enemy whiche wer foure one battail ierce fight dedly neuer wer fewe men seen coragiously defend theimselfes englishemen daie thei fought defeded slewe felled auailed thei wer repressed multitude brought confusion slain duke clarence therle tankeruile lorde rosse sir gilbert u ffreuile erle kent sir ihon lumley sir robert uerend almoste two thousande englishman therles somerset suffolke perche lorde fitizwater sir ihon barkeley sir rauffe neuell sir henry iuglos sir willyam bowes sir willyam longton sir thomas borough diuerse taken prisoner frenchemen wer slain aboue xijc best men warre thei gained muche bastard clarence whiche taried beauford enformed numbre frenchman wherfore archer made hast succor duke thei came late frenchman hearyng approchyng archer fled prisoner hast thei could leuyng behynde theim bodie thesaid duke ded carions archer came sawe enemy gone lorde thei mourned lamented euell chance deceiued duke seyng remedy thei tooke ded body buried theim sauyng duke corp whiche great solempnitie sent englande buried cantorbury beside father englishemen brente spoyled countrie mayne returned alaunson departed euery man garrison battail fought bawgy aniow easter euen yere lorde thousande ccccxxj lament foly foolishenes duke maruell vnwitty doyng rashe enterprise would aduenture life hazarde compaignie leuyng behynde hym archer whiche haue shilde defence maie said desired honor loste life coueted victory ouercome thus old prouerbe verified whiche saieth shepe ronne wilfully emongest wolues thei shall lese ether life fell kyng henry beyng aduertised infortunate chance deceatfull losse louyng brother sent without delaie edmond erle mortaigne brother therle omerset normandy geuyng hym like authoritee preheminence brother late deceassed duke clarence enioyed called highe courte parliamente whiche declared wisely seriously greate grauitie actes wer dooen realme frauce estate tyme presente thynges wer necessary tyme come thei would looke haue iewell high kyngdo whiche thei long labored sought comonaltie gladly graunted fiftene clergy beniuolently offred le disme delay kynges affaire lacke paiment bishoppe wynchester vncle lent hym xxm pounde receiued thesame dismes thynges necessary voyage wer ready prepared sent brother ihon duke bedford armie whiche frenchman write iiiim men armes xxm archer hym caleis shortly middle maie passed sea arriued greate triuphe hym shewed dolphyn vijm men besieged toune chartiers whiche manfully defended bastarde thyan set apoynted duke excester kyng henry myndyng lose faire toune armie departed good ordre battaill toward paris mostreull receiued hym duke burgoin whiche fro place attended kyng dowast ponthiew came abbeuile kyng tooke toune sir iaques herecort called ferte duke departed kyng sixe day promisyng honor daie returne kyng englande passed forwarde beauuoys gisors thence came boy de uincens founde frenche kyng quene louyngly saluted thei honorably receiued highly feasted thether came accordyng appoyntment philip duke burgoyn daily consultyng wisely deuisyng howe subdue represse haultnes force dolphyn hauyng perfight knowledge long ether liued wandered vnbrideled long neuer treaty finall peace obserued wherefore duke burgoyn apoynted haste fight dolphyn reise siege charter kyng englande puyssaunce came toune naunte thether repaired duke burgoyn iiiim men whose commyng king alitle reioysed thei thence departed thei knowledge true instruccion dolphyn heryng puissant army kyng approchyng geue hym battail reculed people toward tower towrayne wherfore kyng england incontinent onely sent duke burgoyn picardy resist malice sir iaques harcort whiche daily inferred war caused wast destruccio thesame coutrie also apointed iames kyng scottes laie siege toune driex whiche sore sworde engins enforced inhabitantes sixe wekes passed thei deliuered thesame kyng scottes behofe kyng henry souereigne lorde whiche made capitain exle worcester baily sir henry mortimer king self remoued naut passed ouer riuer leyre folowyng dolphyn toward tour mistrustyng power puttyng diffidece owne flocke fled burges berrie chosyng place chiefe refuge surest fortresse bothe situacion place also fidelitie constancie people determined tary till fortune would turne whele loke hym gracious looke louyng countenaunce therfore iest comonly called kyng burges berry kyng englande puissance fast folowed fliyng dolphyn vitail began faile horssemen waxed scante consideryng burges beeyng dolphyns onely succoure refuge beeyng well vitailed well manned proffitable auailable defender hym make assaute wherfore willyng saue people famyne knewe dent frenche sworde clerely exempt vntouched returned ouer riuer leyre gat gasconeis vpon youne toune called kynges newe toune diuerse whose name nowe reherce tedious pleasaunt seyng toune meaux brye bee toune replenished enemy middest new gotten subiectes determined take awaie open scruple whiche might poyson infecte membres dwellyng hard wherfore noble folowyng besieged thesaid citee meaux therle worcester therle yury therle brayon lorde clifford lorde forniuall lorde louell lorde iwdeley lorde seynt mawre lorde deyncort lorde zouche lorde morley lorde fanhope sonne whiche died lorde ferreis chartley lorde botreux lorde clynton lorde harryngton lorde willoughby lorde fitzhewe kynges chamberlaine sir ihon germayn sir ihon fastolffe sir lewes robsert sir willyam gascoyn sir robert harlyng sir willia philip diuerse toune lesse vitailed manned better manned fortified kyng englande could nether haue hym deliuered pleasure could gayne assaut greate losse detriment wherfore determined depart til ether gained subuerted toune duryng siege borne wynsore daie nicholas nouember kynges sonne called henry whose godfather wer ihon duke bedford henry bishop wynchester iaquet duches holad godmother wherof kyng englande certefied liyng siege meaux whe aduertised good fortune happie chaunce god sent sonne gaue thankes creator redemer geuyng hym goodly ympe whiche succede croune scepter heard reported place natiuitie whether fantasied old blind prophesy foreknowledge el iudged sone fortune sayd lord fitzheugh trusty chamberlein wordes lorde henry borne monmoth shall small tyme reigne muche get hery borne wyndsore shall long reigne al lese god quene englande thus deliuered faire sonne returned fraunce first husbande father mother partes honorably receiued louyngly entertained highly feasted appeared lesse loued noble husbande naturall parentes pthe tenth yere ouryng tyme siege sir oliuer manye valiant man warre dolphyns part whiche capitain castle faloys yeldyng composicion sware neuer bere armure kyng englande assembled greate numbre men warre aswell briton frenchemen saie lorde mountburchier lorde coynon lorde chastelgiron lorde tyntignace lorde dela howssay diuerse whiche entered cou tree constantine normandy robbed killed englishman thei might ether espie take theim auauntage therle suffolk keper march hearyng doynges sent lorde scale sir ihon aston bayly constantine sir willyam halle sir ihon banaster many errisons within territory whiche encountered enemy place called le parke leuecque englishe bishop parke ther sore long fight many propre feate armes dooen daie many man place ouerthrowen englishman onely desired victory frenchman desired safe returne coclusion frenchman beyng able withstand charge laied began flie whiche conflict flight wer slain lorde coynon lorde castell giron three hundred wer taken prisoner lorde dela howsay sir oliuer manny lx kyng aduertised good chance happy iorney sent sir oliuer manny hym liyng meux saied faire father haue sworne promised vnto v would neuer make war beare armure v subiectes ye aucient knight ought haue kept faith promise whiche haue vntruly vnhonestly broken violate yet wolle although lawe armes might lawfully dooe put death graunt life wolle sende englande lerne speake englishe shortly sent london shame mere malyncoly died buried white frier scottes write beleue theim ye kyng england hearyng dolphyn sent aide scotland retained theim wage owne abilitie thei bee nether able send army ouer sea yet substaunce beare continuall warre owne history declare chronicle make mencion yet countrie poore people proude sent one daie iames scottishe kyng presence cousaill declared hym humanite fauor synguler affeccion kyng henry father bare duryng naturall life toward thesaid kyng scottes puttyng hym remembraunce greate loue manifold gratuites whiche self sithe beginnyng reigne exhibited shewed kyng iames nether father thyng negligently omitted whiche ether might apperteigne office frend dutie tutor whiche loue cherishe orphane pupile promisyng hym libertie greate rewarde would cause scottes whiche wer adherentes dolphin returne gain countree natiue region whiche request kyng scottes freshe herte answered saiyng noble father hath dooen fauor benefite haue receiued handes shall maie assure forget power shall serue shall faile recompence dooynges like kyndnes request maruell alitle firste consideryng prisoner haue possession realme secodarely yet nether sworne subiectes thei oth allegeance boud obey comaundemetes wherfore desyre moue inthis thyng canot yet might would fyrst forese whether wer honorable realme honest leue old frend extreme necessitie without ayd cofort answer kyng england cotent scottes say kyng iames departing fro presence kyng henry saied happy shall bee whiche shalbe subiectes suche kyng endued suche wit wisedome yong yeres age kyng england liyng styl toune meux brye haue heard sore bet walles ordinance cast doune bulwarkes rampeyres euery syde toune sore oppressed within toune wherof hearyng lord offemond copany chosen person set dolphyn came priuely night walies set vp ladder diuers company mounted vp entred toune passed ouer plancke come walles fel deepe ditche englishemen hearyng noyse ranne ditche toke lord ofmount slewe diuers company whiche stode defence capitaine within toune perceiuyng succour taken playnely iudged toune could long continue wherfore caused goodes toune conueighed market place strong wel fortefied kyng england beyng therof aduertised comaunded hast geue assault toune whiche quickly done toune fine force within thre houres taken spoyled day kyng besieged round sayd marketplace toke mylle adioynyng capitaines perceiuyng case fearyng taken assault began treat kyng englande whiche appointed earle warwike lord hungerford comen conclusicion treaty taken toune marketplace goodes deliuered kyng englandes handes x day may yere lord mccccxxii vvhen deliuery strong toune meaux published thorough countrey al tounes fortress isle fraunce lannoys brye champaine yelded selues kyng england appointed valeant capitaines hardy souldiers kyng henry thus taken possessed toune meaux fortress pleasure returned againe boy de uyncennes founde frenche kyng quene wife whiche ioye receiued xxx day may beyng vigile pentecost ii kynges quenes returned paris wher kyng englad lodged castle loure page duplicate page duplicate onely reason bodely labour vnquietnes mynde fro whiche smal noyse coulde awake insomuche souldiers either sang nightes minstreles played campe souded noyse slept soudly courage constant heart vnmutable cast away al feare dread fro banished alarum wer made enemy fyrst armure fyrst would set forwarde time war gat knowledge onely enemiesdid thei sayd entended al thynges knowen deuices person thing point done made priuie suche knowledge orderyng guydyng armye suche grace encouragyng people frenchman sayd could vaquished battel suche wit suche prudence suche pollicie neuer enterprised thyng fully debated foresene al mayne chaunces might happen end concluded diligence courage set purpose forward marueile heare howe beyng prince honor prince youth prince rich continually abstain fro lasciuious liuyng blynd auarice yea time losse sad time victory whiche constacy men haue vse suche stable stomacke suche grauitie geuen bottome heart pollicy findyng sodaine remedy present mischiefes practice vsed sauyng selfe people sodaine distress excepte actes plainly appeare thinke almost thyng incredible speake bountefulnes liberalitie man could gentle liberal free geuyng rewardes al person accordyng desertes saiyng leuer dye subiect auarice neuer desired haue money kepe geue spend mercyful offender charitable nedy indifferent al men faithful fredes fierce enemy toward god deuout toward world moderate realme father say blasyng comete apparant lanterne day myrror christendome glory countrey floure kynges passed glasse succede emperor magnanimitie euer excelled potentate piteous lorde bounteous prince lesse subiectes neuer kyng coquered whose fame death liuely florisheth actes lifewer sene remebred death published among comen people incotinent heartes wer appalled courage abated dolor muche encreased wittes muche troubled like mad men rent garmentes tare heere accusyng blamyng fortune taken away precious iewel noble ornament sure defence doubt muche hope taken awaye fro englishman gettyng fraunce sodaine death muche trust encreased stomackes frenche nacion hopyng recouer aucient libertie olde parentage whiche cause say poysoned scottes write died disease fiacre whiche palsey crape enguerant sayeth died anthony fier al fable many mo write peter basset esquire time death chaberlain affirmeth died plurisis whiche tyme rare sickenes straug disease name part vnknowen phisicions wer acquainted lytle remedy therfore euery iudged thought named sickenes knew shotyng nere pricke vnderstandyng nature disease kyng reigned ix yeres v monethes xxiii dayes liued ful xxxviii yeres stature comen sort body lene wel mebred strogly made face beautiful somwhat long necked blacke heered stout stomake eloquent tong marcial affaire doctor al chiualry paragone body enbaumed closed lede layde charet royal richely apparaled cloth gold vpon corp layd representacion person adorned robe diademe scepter bal like kyng charet drawe vi horse richely trapped seueral armes fyrst armes george ii tharmes normandy iii armes kyng arthur iiii armes edward fift armes fraunce onely sixt armes england fraunce charet gaue attendance iames kyng scottes principal morner duke exceter thomas vncle therle warwike richard therle marche edmond therle stafford humfrey earle mortaine edmonde beausford lord fitzhugh henry lord hungerford water sir lewes robsert burchier sir ihon cornewale lord fahope lord crumwel wer morners lord louel lord audeley lord morley lord souche bare baners saintes baron dudley bare standerd therle longuile bare baner hachementes wer borne onely capitaines nobre xii roud charet rode ccccc armes al blacke harnes horse barded blacke speres vpward coduit ordre al dolorous dole comauded sir willia philip treasorer kynges houshold sir wyllia porter chief caruer beside euery syde charet went ccc person holdyng long torch lordes bearyng baners banerols penons funeral pompe conueighed boy de uyncens paris roan abbeuile caleys douer thorough london westminster buried suche solempne ceremony suche mournyng lordes suche praier priestes suche lamentyng common neuer day sene realme englande shortly solempnitie sorowful quene returned england kept estate yong kyng sone thus ended noble puissant prince noble fortunate reigne ouer realme england whose life although cruel atropos tyme abbreuiated yet neither fyre rust frettyng tynne shal amongest englishman ether appall honoure obliterate glorye whiche fewe yeres brief day achiued high aduentures made great conquest pthe ende victorious actes kyng henry fift trobleous season kyng henry sixt dea h determinate end mannes lifethe yere al yearthly thynges finall poynt pricke whiche fauoureth nether emperour spareth kyng plesure confoundeth riche slaieth poore vnbodiyng solle godly prince marcial capitain renoumed flower onely dismaied appalled hertes corages englishe nacion also pufte vp encoraged myndes stomackes dolphyn proude people one parte thynkyng kepyng normandy dominion hym gayned bee dangerus part trustyng farther coquest frauce onely doubtfull iudgementes apparantly impossible yet politike prince sage magestrates realme england well remembryng thynges wer passed sagely ponderyng tyme present moste prudently forscyng chaunces iminent perels hand thentent set membres body stedfast vnder hedde whiche shepe without sheperd far folde might wandre straie large caused yong prince henry sole orphane noble parent kyng henry fifth beyng age ix monethes sound trumpettes openly proclaimed kyng englande fraunce xxx daie august yere lorde mcccxxii name kyng hery sixt great reioysyng comfort englishe nacion custody young prince apoyncted thomas duke excester henry beaufford bishopp wynchester duke bedford deputed regent fraunce duke gloucester assigned protector englande whiche takyng vpon hym office least paraduenture might herafter repent actes doynges man remembryng forgettyng hymself called hym wise graue counsailers whose aduise prouided ordeined thynges whiche ether redounded honor realme semed profitable publique welth thesame set ordre al matter concernyng inward affaire realme englande prouided farther thynges necessary conuenient warre farther conquest fraunce appoyncted valiant expert capitaines whiche ready oportunitie tyme required beside gathered greate somes page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate money maintein men warre left nothyng forgotten might let hynder purposed enterprise vvhile thynges thus deuised within realme englande duke bedforde regent fraunce lesse studied toke payne onely kepe ordre countrees region kyng henry late coquered gained also determined leue daily warre continuall trauaile till tyme charles dolphyn whiche flote kyng charles father moneth octobre present yere departed god wer ether subdued brought dewe obeysance surely deth kyng charles caused many alteracions chaunges realme fraunce greate parte nobilitee whiche ether feare puissance englishemen please folowe mynde appetite charles frenche kyng toke parte kyng henry dolphyn heryng french kynges death returned english part adioyned themselfes compainie dolphyn diligently studied howe vanquishe dryue awaie englishe nacion territory fraunce duke bedford beeyng greatly moued sodaine chaunges fortified tounes bothe garrison municions assembled together great armie bothe englishman norman made long oracion admonishyng obserue kepe othe faith whiche thei made late kyng henry heires inuiolate vnbroken willyng wise occasioners counsailers young kyng henry depriued father lawfull inheritance hatred certayne traitor frenchemen whiche renewed old hatred beyng late extinct betwene realmes englande fraunce studied set al thynges broyle requiryng also call memory realmes englande fraunce twoo moste famous regios europe benifite almightie god wer late vnited connexed ioyned together eternall league composicion strogly established worldly power wer able puissaunce sufficient resist withstande malice although tymes chaunce warre losse mighte turne part yet conclusion detriment recouered surplusage gayned accordyng bounden duty thei would honor serue loue young kyng henry soueraigne lorde would diligently persecute set enemy thei onely shewe theselfes true faithfull subiectes true vndoubted kyng also fidelitie good seruice receiue hym condigne rewardes ouer beside immortall fame renoune exhortacion staied hertes many frenche capitaines whiche willyngly sware kyng henry feaultie obedience whose example comonaltie thesame thus people set ordre realme fraunce nothyng mynded warre nothyng spoken conquest dolphyn whiche lay tyme citee poytiers heryng death parente herte mixed bothe ioye sorowe notwithstandyng sorowfull naturall child whiche lamented death father yet ioyous power princely estate hym happened whiche iudged able defend enemy recouer frendes callyng together prince faccion caused hymself bee proclaimed kyng frauce name charles vij beyng good hope recoueryng patrimony expellyng enmies haut corage prepared war assembled together great armie first war began light skirmish proceded main battailes dolphyn thynkyng make long delayes greate cause lest power enemy might daily augmented sent lorde grauile toune pount melance stadyng riuer seyne whiche sodainly came thesame walles souldiors within heard approche toke toune slewe greate nombre englishe souldiors reget fraunce aduertised sodain enterprise apoyncted lorde thomas montacute erle salisbury manne bothe greate pollicie haute corage compared old valiant roman men day accompaignied erle suffolke lorde scale yong lorde pounynges sir ihon fastolffe master houshold thesaid lorde regent diuerse besige toune pont melance whiche two monethes rendered thesaid erle lorde grauile sware trew kyng englande euer daie shortly forgettyng othe returned old master erle salisbury apoynted sir henry mortimer sir richard uernon capitaines toune thence departed champaignie ther besieged toune sen toke sir guillam maryn capitain slewe souldiors within toune made capitaines sir hugh geddyng sir richard awbemond parisian whiche euer like wethercocke variable inconstaunt perceiuyng dolphyn daily began haue aide power accustomed trustyng returne vnder obeysance subieccio whiche thei bothe wished desired intente apere come desire faith fidelite put balance diffidence englishe nacion sent diuerse senator citee ambassador kyng englad desiryng hym aide succor onely greate thankes rendered dooyng dutie subieccio also high feastes wer made promise declared thei stil continued due obeysance wer adherent kynges enemy yt neither succour want cost spared comen cofort publike vtilite whiche answer copaigny outwardly pleased whatsoeuer thei inwardly imagined departed paris season humfrey duke gloucester either blynded ambicion dotyng loue maried lady iaquet iacomin doughter sole heire william bauier duke holland whiche lawfull wife ihon duke brabant liuyng whiche mariage onely woundered comon people also detested nobilite abhorred clergie suerly swete tast pleasant mariage brought sower sauce bothe amorus housbande wanton wife ihon duke brabant force spirituall compulsaries neuer left till recouered lady duke gloucester possession shall pthe seconde yerethe ii yere chauces thus happenyng haue heard ihon duke bedford philip duke burgoyn ihon duke britayn made assemble frendly enteruiewe citee amia thei renewed olde league auncient amitie made betwene noble prince kyng ry fifth concluded addyng therto codicions agrementes eche bothe frend aider enemy one bee enemy thei bee bothe frendes aiders kyng englande well willyng wel willers auengers aduersaries affinitie embracer amitie concluded mariage betwene duke bedford lady anne sister duke burgoyn agrementes wer finished regent departed troy chapain whether high pompe conueighed lady anne burgoyn whiche presence brother uncle duke brabant therles salisbury suffolke ixc lordes knightes esquire maried ihon duke bedford suche solempnitie feste triuphe tyme seen burgonions dvryng triumphe parisias thinkyng blind iyes duke bedford wrote hym diuerse castle fortress liyng rounde territory wer replenished enemy daily stoppyng passage robbyng marchantes vtter vndoyng thei helpe wer relieued fraudulently meanyng falsely entisyng hym absent hymself theim till craftie conueighed purpose wer compassed achiued diuerse stubbernly beryng yoke subieccion english nacion perceiuyng duke bedforde principall capitaines englishman farre paris emploiyng themselfes ioy solace honor high mariage conspired bryng citee charles dolphyn callyng hymself frenche kyng duryng tyme absence thentent inueted purpose succede thei therof aduertised dolphyn counsaill appoyntyng daie comyng post entre treason commonly hiden sedicion long vnreueled pie chatter mouse pepe cannot declare regente informed secrete confederacy sedicious faccio wherfore meanyng lose short tyme whiche smal space gayned put spurres horsse greate power entred paris one daie faire apoinced two nightes lokyng enemy beyng vnprouided sodainly caused apprehended taken openly put execucion ieoperdy thus escaped putte diffidence parisian trustyng litle noble geuyng lesse credite comons determined fortifie garrison owne nacion castle nere adioynyng citee whiche within small tyme habundauntly furnished auoyde nighte watcher adioynyng paris confines thesame first toke possession ether assaute composicion toune traynel bray vpon seyne two castle one called pacy called cursay also euill neighbor parisian sente sir ihon fastolffe great master houshold notable army besiege castle pacy whiche takyng vpon hym enterprise handled enemy capitain named guyllam reymon esquire garrison yelded symply mercy discrecio sent prisoner citee paris besieged castle coursay whiche hym shortly rendered vpon like appoyntmet praie prisoner returned lorde regent master season dolphyn sent lorde willyam stuard constable scotland therle uentadore auergne many noble part laie siege toune crauat coutie auxerre within partes burgoyn wherof heryng lorde regent duke burgoyn thei assembled greate armie erle salisbury ordeined capitain whiche valeant parsonage lorde willoughby lorde pownynges lorde molyns sir thomas rampston sir william oldhaule sir ihon passheley sir thomas flemyng sir edmond sir ihon grey sir reignold grey sir ihon arthur sir henry bisset sir william peytow sir richard leke sir gilbert haliall sir lancelot lisle thomas aborough william glasdale mathew gough didon amore richard ap madocke dauy loyd burgonions lorde sent george erle ionignye erle brayne lord castelyn marshal burgoyne lorde uergier bastard lorde chastelon lorde crouy lorde lisle adam lorde pesmes bastard thyan sir france le arragonoys ihon de gyngie many numbre aswell englishemen burgonions xvm men warre whiche came good array geue battaill besieger toune crauant riuer youne whiche renneth thesaid toune betwene englishe army aduersaries thei could wel assaile enemy whiche defended bankes passage strongly yet notwithstandyng bothe horsmen fotemen englishe part coragiously put themself riuer fyne force recouered banke burgonions incontinent folowed thei wer gotten plain archer shot bilmen strake long fight indifferent iudgement conclusion frenchman able resist force abyde puissance english nacion wer take ether slain discomfited mortall battaill slain taken numbre viiim men name chief capitaines shall apere frenchemen slain therle lestrake therle comygens therle tunier lorde coquart de cameron bastard arnynacke uicont towraye bastard forest lorde de port lorde memoracie xviii hundred knightes esquiers beside comons taken prisoner constable scotlande whiche lost iye therle uantadore sir alexander meldryne sir lewes ferigny xxiic gentlemenne frenche nacion taken scottes slain lorde sent ihons toune sir ihon balgrarie sir ihon turnebull sir ihon holiburton sir robert lile sir william conyngham sir william douglas sir alexander hune sir willyam lisle sir ihon rocherforde sir william cawford sir thomas seton sir william hamolton sonne ihon pillot iiim scottes slain englishemen sir ihon grey sir wylliam halle sir gilbert halsel richard ap madocke xxic slaine fortunate victory obteined englishemen fyrst gaue great laudes thankes almightie god entered toune crauant muche praisyng doynges capitaines fidelitie citezens set thynges ordre returned paris regent ioyously receiued whiche constituted therle salsbury wel worthy vicegerent lieftenaunt king country fraunce bry chapaigne sir ihon fastolf substituted deputie vnder duchy normady syde riuer seyne deputed gouernor coutreys aniow mayne assigned able capitaines euery holde fortresse therle salsbury whiche could slepe great office trust layde siege toune castle moutaguillon bry wherof capitaines pregent cotyny guille bourgoys briton whiche valiantly defeded castle space v monethes incoclusion assailantes wer fierse within safegard liues rendred hold capitaines sware neuer bere armure englishman side riuer leyre duryng siege erle suffolke toke force castle coucy strong castle de la roche gat appointment mosconoys novve muste go backe put memorye howe iames kyng scottes beyng bothe prisoner tyme kyng henry fourth also subiect kyng henry fift sone seruyng warres fraunce tyl departed transsitory life boy de uyncens chief morner attended corp sayd deceassed vnto burial westminster wasreleased captiuitie restored realme possession true knowledge therof shal vnderstande englande demaunded smal raunsome great prince scottes accompte kyng scottes neither able offered summe conuenient wherfore cousel realme england grauously pondered wisely considered coniunction mariage england scotland perfectly knit one indissoluble band amitie betwene frenche scottishe nacions shortly broken dissolued wherfore protector realme englad consent whole baronage gaue mariage lady iane doughter ihon earle sommerset desceased onely sister ihon duke sommerset also cosyn germayne remoued kyng nece cardinal wynchester duke exceter kyng scottes hauyng great affection fayre lady muche desiryng deliuerance libertie put hostage residue raunsome great part therof deminished abated money allowed hym mariage deliuered depart pleasure alacke old prouerbes bee true ape although bee clothed purple ape scotte neuer gentely enterteined englishe prince dissimulyng scotte kyndnes could shewed prisoner bryng hym vp good litterature loue maie bee declared captiue instructe hym marciall feates warlike affaire fauor ascribed high renoumed prince geue mariage vnderlyng vassall cosyn kinswoman royal parentage lawfully discended kyndnesses suffised gratuity auailed make kyng iames frendly realme englande notwithstandyng homage doen young henry kyng englande fraunce castle wynsore present yere three duke twoo archebishoppes xii erles x bishoppes xx baron twoo hundred knightes esquire mo accordyng tenor foloyng iames stuart kyng scottes shalbe true faithfull vnto lorde henry grace god kyng englande fraunce noble superior lorde kyngdome scotlande vnto make fidelitie thesame kyngdome scotlande whiche hold claime hold shall beare faithe fidelitie life lymme worldly honor al men faithfully shall knowledge shall seruice due kyngdo scotland aforesaid god help holy euangelistes nether regardyng othe estemyng great abundance plate riche clothes arras hym mother vncles wife liberally geuen frendly deliuered whiche sorte rich fewe none daie wer euer seen coutrey scotlande like dogge whiche hath cast vp stomacke returneth vomet like snake whiche engenderyng lampray taketh old poyson taken ayre smelled sent scottishe soyle became like falce fraudulet forfathers vntrue prince like proude pratyng progenitor toke ymage braggyng bostyng scot newly alied hymself frenche nacion yet soeuer nacion bothe write testifie learnyng whiche greate benifite kynges englande duryng captiuitee realme obteigned replenished countrey good litterature nurture whiche brought vp englad brought people ciuilitee captiuitee nacion greatest libertie euer thei could haue deliueryng blynde ignorance angelicke knowledge reducyng theim bestiall maners honest behauor conclusion causyng theim knowe vertue vice pollicie rudenes humain honestie sauage liuyng deliuerance doynges iames fyrst name kyng scottes whiche neither reigned verye quietly yet euer fauored englishemen frenche people sauyng hauyng countrey yong gentleman northumberland called andrew gray whiche duryng captiuitie companion promoted mariage heyre lorde foules anguis whiche lord gray scotland day descend pthe iii yerethe iii yere leue doynges scotland returne affaire england duke gloucester beyng protector gouernor realme cosideryng wood must ministred kepe fyre men ought set set forwarde war called pieres nobilitie realme agrementes deuises sent frauce regent brother xm men warre whiche regent coutrey paris louyngly receiued according degres honestly entertained duryng liyng paris diuers chaunces happened fraunce euen englishman valiantly wonne victoriously coquered tounes castle open warre apparant conquest frenchman fraudulently stale couertely obtained diuers fortress holdes appertainyng thenglish faccion especial fayre toune compaigne prety toune crotoy vvhen duke bedford aduertised craftye trickes sodaine inuented trames sent furth army fyrst compaigne wherof capitaine erle suffolke accompanied therle liguy diuers capitaines englishman whiche lay one side riuer sohame side laye lord lisle adain sir thomas raupstone prouost paris frechmen beyng strongly furnished wel vitailed coragiously defended toune assailates englishman perceiuyng guyllia remond otherwise called mariolayn bene leder souldiers within toune whiche pacy take prisoner sir ihon fastolf caused sent paris brought seige set chariot halter aboute necke coueighed gibbet without toune sending worde garison within toune would without delay redre toune fortresse thei would incotinent stragle old capitaine chief conductor souldiors within toune perceiuyng guyllia raymond onely trust relefe aucient frend necessitie shuld suffre death hope al ayde extinguished sure nutriment liuyng secluded deliuerance sauegarde themselues yelded toune might depart horse harnes onely sure conduite safetye yet long toune compaigne deliuered sir philip hal whiche sent crotoy lorde regent viiic men besiege toune gat assault sodainly frenchman either desposed garrison appointed lodgynges toke al men warre put raunsome ii tounes cowardly stollen manfully recouered yet writer frenche fable deface glorye englishman write say tounes yelded burgonyons whiche neither kepyng souldiers person kyng england thinges thus doyng fraunce sir ihon de la pole brother therle suffolke capitaine auranches normandy assembled garrison base march coutrey aniow came cytie angiers brent subbarbes spoyled destroyed whole countrey hauyng many prayes prisoner men might cary encountred earle aubemerle vicount narbone vi thousand frenchman whiche findyng englishman arraye cariage great spoyle sodainly set slewe ccc person toke prisoner sayd sir ihon delapole sir ihon basset ihon auford leuetenaunt faloys ihon clyfton henry mortymer vic although frenchman gat day one place yet thei wet victorious away another bastard de la baulme lorde craignar capitaines courrallon great band made roade masconnoys chance met mathew gough englishemen whiche scouryng countrey se heare newes enemy sore conflict hard encountre partes maner beyng corage nombre egal long fight french men almost al wer slaine taken bastard beyng wel horsed fled folowed fiersnes spurres mathew gough chased castle gate toke would haue hid diche preseted earle salsbury returnyng compaigne paris whiche onely gaue rightes beloging prisoner also rewarded goodly courser highly exalted name manhode abovte season arthur brother ihon duke britaine comonly called earle richemond hauyng neither profite name countrey notwithstadyng king henry v created carle yury normandy gaue onely great pencion thesame toune yury yet brother duke brytaine fearyng englishman nowe hauyng normandye would smel desire tast swete soyle britaine late contrary leage othe returned part charles dolphyn like wise returned craftly without cause fled flaunders came dolphyn poytiers whiche glad comyng gained cm crounes briton kept toune castle yury hearyng master ioyned dolphyn bothe kepte castle duke bedford furnishyng dayly new people municons also infested spoyled robbed countrey adioynyng doyng englishman hurt damage either could deuised imagined lord regent beyng aduertised trouble calamity assebled great army englishman norman entendyng serche dolphin euery part thetent geue battail pitched feld make final ende entended conquest hauyng companye therle salsbury therle suffolke lord scale lord wylloughby lord pounyng sir reynold gray sir ihon fastolf sir ihon saluayne lanslot lisle sir philip halle sir ihon pashely sir ihon gray sir thomas blunt sir robert harlyng sir william oldhal many valiant knightes esquiers nombre frenche writer testifie xviiic men armes viiim archer came toune yury whiche wel defended englishemen began vndermine walles within glad rendre
