toune vpo condicion whiche taken howbeit capitaines castle promised yeld fortresse wer rescued day assigned dolphyn nomber sufficiet raise siege vpon promise hostage wer deliuered possession lord regent licence herault sent dolphyn aduertise tyme determined whiche hearyng destresse people rendes wer sent incontinent ihon duke alanson lieftenant general therle doglas settyng furth made duke toraine therle boughan hope good spede made constable fraunce whiche office enioyed fully hundreth houres therles aumarle uatadoure connerre maulieurier forest vicountes narbon thouars lordes grauile gaules malycorne manny ballay fountaines mountfort many noble knightes esquiers nombre xvm freche men briton vm scottes erles doglas transported late scotland nede loue army royal approched within ii mile yury sent xl light horsmen view espy nomber coduit englishman spyes came nere siege wer espied chased copanions againe declared seen perceiued duke alanson seyng could gette auantage englishemen although dolphyn geuen hym straight comaundement fight regent whether heart fayled thought wayte fortunate season purpose enterprise retired backe whole army toune uernoyle perche whiche belonged kyng england sent word garison toune discofited slaine al englishe army regent small nober swyftnes horse saued selfe inhabitantes uernoyle geuyng light credit frenche fablers receiued duke alason al army toune submitted selues whiche toune desyred haue gift dolphyn owne inheritance lawful patrimony approched day rescous yury day lady assumpcion day rescous appeared sir gerrard de la pallier captain castle whiche beyng dispayre ayde comforte presented key duke bedford shewed letter signed sealed hades xviii great lordesh whiche day promised geue duke battaile desolue siege raise assault well sayd duke heartes would haue serued puissaunce sufficient one haue profered haue performed faithful promise syth disdaine seke god saint george willyng shal desist folowe tractes horse tyl one part v battail ouerthrowen gaue safeconduyte capitaine wold depart many briton within castle yury seyng faint heartes false promise flatteryng frenchman submitted selues lorde regent sware true kyng gentely accepted put wage furnished castle toune newe garrison inco tinent sent earle suffolke vic horse espy wher frenchemen lodged whiche passed dampeuile came bretnel wher heard newes frenchman taken uernoile perche yet abidyng wherof al diligent celerite sent worde duke bedford mindyng lese long desired pray set forward great hast toward enemy frechmen hearyng comyng set people array made one maine battile without forward rereward appointed certaine lu bardes horsmen breake array englishemen either behynd side wherof capitaine sir stephyn uenoyles called hire duke bedford ignoraunt howe ordre men made likewise one entier battaile suffered man horse backe set archer euery one hauyng sharpe stake front battaile sydes like wynges behynd battaile page chariottes cariages horse tyed together either reines bridle tayles thentent enemy sodainely surprise disturbe backe behynd defend cariages wer appointed two thousand archer frenchman fyrst light remembryng often tymes piched feldes bene ouercome vanquished englishe nacion began somewhat feare sawe remedy fight toke good courage set softely forwarde whiche marchyng duke alaunson sittyng horsebacke saied capitaines ovyng compainionso acion duke alaunson hardy souldiers call remembraunce englishemen haue onely gotten v noble isle fraunce duchy normandy aniow also sith enterprise conquest hath bothe slain parentes killed frendes yea hath driuen naturall prince soueraigne lorde chief habitacion surest chaumber faire citee paris whiche act neuer pagan durst attept euer prince able acheue besides se duke bedford regent kyng englande entendyng nothyng deposicion destruccion kyng nobilitie finall coclusion bryng extreme bondage v wiues child al people long renoumed region many hundred yeres called realme fraunce whiche muche saie fre countrey franke lande ala shall kyng made subiecte shall peres nobilitee bee made vassal also slaues bondman forrain nacion liberty frauce auncient fredome defended fraunchises harte serued kyng ruled kynges princis possessed empire nacion subdued germany conquered italy ouercame proude spanyardes shall wee fallyng kynd father feare puissaunce arrogant englishemen beyng men forecast excellente wit long gettyng shortly lesyng suffre olde glory fraunce put obliuion haue englishe infant whiche liueth pappe bee kyng gouernor liue seruitude barbarous nacion neither bountifulnes honor clerckes saie greatest plague euer god scourged israelite permitted bee caried natiue countrey bondage babilon thei liued captiuitie space many yeres bee greater scourge haue forrein ruler free region dishonor countrey haue nobilitie put backe rule gouerned stranger beleue beleue v one blot bee slaue turkeye vnder turkishe bondage free man frauce vnder englishe libertie poynt sure thei gain battaill thei vnlike obtain whole region whiche thei get enheritaunce rich people bee subiectes thei bee ruler fare well franke frenche libertie thei lordes welcome englishe seruitude stande al poynt either free bondman whiche terme bondage detested nacions reproch man call hym villain bondman therfore manly defence must onely withstand mischief hartie corage must driue backe imminet plage daie either deliueraunce vile seruitude daie entry vale bondage conclusion battaill doubtfull bee vanquished gain side almoste without recouery cosidryng best men wisest capitaines vnder kyng get vpper hande heddes shalbe free englishe yoke although duke bedforde hath hym power gather side sea yet assure god willyng turne one fote backeward feare hym picked armie therefore exhorte remembre wife child selfes fight manfully sticke eche libertie countrey doubt victory shalbee honor shalbe kynges daie vanquishe hym sparcle armie shall diligently folowe fortune good grace onely fraunce v shall yeld normandy bowe shall recouer al citees tounes whiche possession wer gained aide come rescue poore isle englande consideryng hang ballaunce betwene honor shame libertie bondage gaine losse let euery man take harte corage hym litle regardyng caryng either death force enemy manly countenaunce marche furth toward foe englishemen perceiuyng greate nombre knowyng chief strength consisted scottes began somwhat stay consult moste expedient bee doen duke bedford sittyng baye courser middes battaill vnder ba ner euriously beten armes content whisperynges protractyng tyme saied vnto theim audible voyce yov valiaunt capitaines hardie souldiersthe orarion duke bedforde louyng compaynins armes frendly felowes cosidre self daie honor profite wee shall get trauaile pain doubt stand stil musyng would runne furth galloppe runne fete would winges flie faste euer hauke praie greate honor gotten paine swete lucre gayned trauaile muste remembre nothyng wel doen growe good conclusion thyng good neuer begon neuer ended brother late soueraigne lord whose soule god pardon hath entred countrey awne lawfull inheritaunce first conquered normandy agremet kyng charles vsurper assent nobilitee agrement clergie speciall request commonaltie restored rightfull inheritaunce lawful patritrimony whiche death returned come nephewe moste redoubted souereigne beginnyng conquest good sequele better yet resteth finall knot knitte last locke shut vp suffre charles dolphyn whiche vsurpeth name estate royall realme frauce proceade farther purpose gather puyssaunce allure people cannot tell feates flattryng fortune worke sure suffre fier still flame hath begon shall haue skant water quenche thesame hath assembled frenche men get lacke aide hath retained scottes croppe hym beginnyng shall growe let hym grow farther passe reache distomfite hym bryng conquest conclusion let hym alone shalbe new begin therfore say wisedome take occasion hery side balde side profered wee feare multitude remembre awne victory whiche haue euer obteined lesse nombre greater feare death remembre glory immortall fame shall succeade valiaunt actes sell life dere shalbe slain considre haue kyng nephew duke brother twoo noble vncles haue frendes kynsemen child whiche wil reuege death vttermost poynt therfore saie let euery man day best daie thed great trauaile daie greate victory daie euerlastyng fame therfore good felowes put onely trust god call hym aide boldly marche forward hardly enemy skace ended exhortacion englishman beyng incouraged prudent persuasion sette enemy criyng sainct george bedford frenchemen likewise cried moutioye sainct denise arrowes flewe long bowes one parte quarrelles crosse bowes parte thei came hande stroke greate fight terrible battaill indifferent iudgement victory heraulde could determyne whiche parte fortune moste shewed louyng countenaunce bothe side men wer slain wounded bothe partes wer felled recouered thus stil doubtful iudgement battaill continued aboute three houres duke alau son meane season neuer ceased exhorte praie people manly fight suffre enemy whiche wer point ouercome faint harte victor ouercommers likewise duke bedford rode armie refreshyng weake freshe men encoragyng people moste plesaunt wordes last perceiued frenchman heate trauaill waxe wery faint bee freshe thei wer surely nature frenchman labor long fightyng muche braggeth fighteth al strength set incontinent suche violence thei bare theim doune ground fine force frenche horseme daie litle seruice archer galled horse thei desired muche approche presence battaill fought xxvij daie august yere lorde mccccxxv whiche battaill wer slain frenchemen erle aumerle erle uentadore erle forestes erle mary lorde grauile lorde gaules lorde fountaynes lorde amboys uicount thouars lorde mounteney lorde combreste lorde brunell lorde tumblet lorde poysy thre hundred knightes beside uicount nerbon whose body haged gibbet one murtherars duke burgoyne scottes also wer slain archibald erle douglas made duke toroyne iames douglas sonne erle nigton ihon erle boughem newly made constable fraunce sir alexandre meldryne sir henry balglauie sir ihon sterlyng sir william homelsdone sir iames graye sir robert kanden sir alexander lynsaie sir robert stewarde sir robert swinton xxvij hundred scottes name armes besides battaill wer slain report montioye kyng armes fraunce englishe herauldes presente frenchemen scottes ix thousand seuen hundred englishman xxj hundred man name sauyng v yong esquiers wer taken prisoner ihon duke alaunson bastard alaunson lorde fayect lorde hormit sir pier harison sir loys de uancort sir robert brusset sir ihon turnebull scot twoo hundred gentleman besides common souldiours duke bedforde thus obteined vpper hand enemy discomfited onely strength dolphin vpon knee rendred almightie god hartie thankes without effusion teares commaunded frenchemen within toune uernoile go depart el abide adueture thei perceiuyng euil successe bostyng enterprise seyng meane wherby lowe ebbe thei might bee ayded deliuered vp toune went furthe thesame life saued whiche toune lorde regent constituted capitain sir philip hall departed thence citee roan triumph vnworthy ioyously receiued honorably feasted thynges set ordre remoued paris maie see succeded spirite false prophecie duke alaunson thinkyng predestinate body aboue ouercome conquere duke bedford bosted haue heard burgess uernoile discofited regent fraunce whole armie toune yury knowyng mar god battaill beyng angry liyng appoynted onely puyssaunce vanquished uernoile also hymself bastarde vncle bee taken brought bondage often seen whiche rekeneth without hoste muste reken twyse fisheth net maie lese nothyng gain victory published fraunce common peope lamented miserable destiny nobilitie mistrusted awne estate dolphyn abashed yea abashed wo derfull write merueilous heare driuen countreis apperteinyng croune fraunce might resort coutreis except burbonoys aluerne berry poyctou towrayn part aniow barrayn longnedoe diuerse frendes whiche aduocates paris exiled theselfes fro parliament paris whiche al rightes iurisoiccions vnto belongyng kepte holden name kyng henry sixte lawfull heire kyng realme fraunce therefore shewe hymself kyng erected courte parliament chauncery courtes citee poytiers established greate seale due circumstaunces thervnto aperteinyng whiche continued space xiiij yeres shall heare declared duke bedford liyng paris entendyng bryng obeysaunce charles dolphyn el driue hym litle cony holdes small country set lorde scale sir ihon montgomerey sir ihon fastolfe two thousand men conquere country aniow mayn whiche without assaulte rendred strong castle beamount le uicot teune silly oste courceriers roussy uasse couetemenat twenty whiche prolixitie tyme thynke necessary bee omitted surely englishe puyssaunce tried proued assaied spred abrode throughout fraunce frenche thought conclusion englishe men would haue haue al thinges whiche thei either wisshed enterprised duke bedford yet thirstyng good fortune sente erle salisbury greate armie accompained lorde scale approued capitaines whose name haue heard countrees aniow mayn whiche wer euil neighbor duchy normandy whiche army wer xm men war ther lusty capitaines entered firste countrey mayne beseged riche strong citee mauns chief toune emperie country region although citezens aswel sodain accesse enemy feare name therie salisbury whiche dread enemy honored frendes wer somewhat amased astonied yet capitaines named sir baldwyn champaigne lord toisse sir guilliam de marignie sir hugh de goo studied muented way possible defend themselfes damage harme enemy surely thei within toune crewe compainei warlike practised souldiors englishemen approched nigh walles thei might without losse detriment shot walles great stone great gonne whiche kynd engine yt tyme litle seen heard fraunce stroke wh rof shaked crushed riued walles within fewe day citee dispoyled toures outward defence citezens mauns muche merueilyng newe orgaynes bothe seyng destruccio iminent desperate aide succor offered toune vpon condicion persones whiche would tary within toune might abide would departe horsse harnessse onely permitted whiche offer accepted toune rendred wherof erle made capitain therle suffolke liuetenaunt sir ihon fastolfe said erle salis ury besieged faire toune sainct susan whereof capitain ambrose de lore lesse audacitie pollicy accompainied greate nombre hardy men warre erle salisbury bothe viewed seen situacion nature place determined assaulte place whiche moste weake worne trompettes blew assault scalyng ladder raised walles englishemen greate noyse began clime ascende souldiors whiche durste come toune encountre englishe armie manfully ranne walles resiste defende assaylantes daie assault many aduenturrs still continued although inhabitauntes citezens sore wounded thei neuer lette bothe defende theimselfes anoye hurte enemy therle perceiued light assault slight skirmishe lost somewhat gained nothyng made wall cast trenche round toune caused great ordynance shotte part wall whiche moste teble slender daily nightly neuer ceassed beate breke doune wall toures within twoo day moste part wal persed cast doune ground capitain perceiued newe feates began entreate offered hymself souldiors twoo thousand crounes thei might departe doublettes onely liues saued whiche winter aproched taken toune yelded whiche toune made capitain sir ihon popham valiaunt circuspect knight said erle besieged toune castle mayon la iuhez wherein capitain lorde escotaiz whiche toune space fiue wekes yelded life defendors onely saued kepyng whereof appointed sir ihon montgomery knight feast purificacion lady besieged castle de lafort barnard duryng siege sale made toune alanso beyng englishman possession gascoyn one gariso iiiic crounes charles de uilliers peter le beuffe frenche capitaines daie apointed deliueraunce bothe toune money gascoigne opened discouered whole agrement erle salisbury whiche ordeined lorde willoughby sir ihon fastolfe two thousande englishemen encountre byers kynges toune ala son daie apointed tyme assigned charles de uilliers chief marchaunt riche enterprise early mornyng two c horssemen three hundred footemen approched nere toune abidyng gascoyne displaied banner thynkyng triumphantly entre toune happened otherwise thei wer ware suspected rescue thei wer enuironed englishe armie slain taken euery creature saue peter danthenazy xxv whiche swiftnes horsses saued selfes conflict ended lorde willoughby copany returned therle salisbury toune le fort barnard capitaines wherof consideryng hope succor sente theim vitaill diminished thei long able abide harde assaultes english nacion rendered toune castle reseruyng horsse harneis onely whiche toune therle receiued vse kyng regent valiaunt seruice doen erle gaue thesame toune hym heires euer beside therle partely assaulte partely composicion toke diuerse tounes sainct kale wher made capitain richard gethyne esquier thanceaux lermitage made gouernor matthewe gough guerlande whiche assigned ruler ihon banaster malicorne wherof made capitain william glasdale esquier lisle soubz boulto wherof made capitain sir lancelot lisle knight lowpellande whereof made capitain henry braunche mountseur whiche made constable sir willia oldhall knight la suke assigned kepyng iho suffolk esquier beside aboue xl castle pile wer ouerthrowen destroyed fame report newes wer blowen fraunce f ated feared raged angre veritie al thynges beyng duke bedford declared englande men reioysed wer glad onely conquest many tounes also god sente theim victory pitched felde mortall battaill wherfore generall procession wer commaunded rendre god almighty humble harty thankes whose onely gift nad power man notable victory wer gotten achiued couenient talke muche fraunce omit al thynges doen england wherfore shall vnderstand ye easter yere kyng called high court parliamet toune westminster comyng parliament hous conueighed citee vpon great courser great triuph whiche child iudged al men haue ymage liuely portra ture louely countenaunce noble parent famous father also like succede heire morall vertues marcial pollicies princely feates vndoubted inheritor realmes seigniory dominion whiche parliament graunted kyng subsidy xiid pound towardes mainteinaunce warres marchaundise commyng realme goyng thesame besides somes sette euery tonne liquor euery sacke woolle aswel englishe men strau gers duryng whiche parliamente came london peter duke quymber sonne kyng portyngale cosin germain remoued kyng duke excester bishop winchester vncles highly fested liberally rewarded elected noble ordre garter duryng whiche season edmonde mortimer last erle marche name whiche long tyme restrained liberty finally waxed lame disceased without issue whose inheritaunce discended lorde richarde plantagenet sonne heire richard erle cambridge beheded haue heard toune southhapton whiche richard within lesse xxx yeres heire erle edmond ope parliament claimed croune scepter realme herafter shall manifestly appere tyme whiche parliament also whether either deserte malice auoyde thynges might chaunce accordyng prouerbe whiche saith dead man doth harme sir ihon mortimer cosin said erle attainted treason put execucion whose deathe small slaunder arose emongest common people actes doen englande fraunce humfrey duke gloucester lady iaquet supposed wife passed sea came mon henawde force toke suche landes ihon duke brabant first husbande possession said lady iaquet whiche doyng philippe duke burgoyne beyng greate frende duke brabant muche disdained frouned thought olde loue familiaritie hare duke gloucester would frendly monicion turne hym vnhonest vngodly life reasonable reformacion brotherly conformitie wherefore wrote louyngly hym vtterly leaue folowe newe attempted enterprise aduertisyng hym protestyng openly vsurpyng wrongfully withholdyng another mannes possession vile slaunderous defilyng pure cleane bedde adulteriously kepyng wife christe brother duke gloucester beyng case wilfull either blinded dotage inflamed coueteousnesse wife possession regardyng neither admonishement duke brabant yet godly aduerti ement duke burgoyn sware would leaue make farther war till expulsed duke brabant wife seigniory territory dominion wherfore duke burgoyn assembled together greate armie make war duke gloucester cause quarel duke brabant frend cosyn duke gloucester partly great affaire wer imminent realme england partly assemble people resist withstad power duke burgoyn brabant left wife mon henaude lordes toune whiche sware hym defende kepe men till tyme returne wherefore leauyng twoo thousande englishman departed calice englande vvhen gone duke burgoyn threatened vexed yea almost famished within toune mon thei deliuered possession lady iaquet iacomyne whiche incotinent sent gaunt wher disguised self mannes apparel escaped toune awne zelande called zirice fro thence conueighed toune hollande called tregowe honorably receiued made strong withstande enemy succor duke gloucester sent fiue hundred duke burgoyn brabant left quiet brent tounes holland slewe people zelande greate detriment displeasure inconclusion matter brought martyn v bishop rome whiche adiudged first matrimony duke ihon brabant good effectuall seconde espousal celebrated duke humfrey gloucester bee value force effecte duke brabant died lawfull duke gloucester mary lady iaquet duke gloucester obeiyng sentence beganne waxe lothe supposed wife neuer profite losse whose cause frendes became enemy whose sake openly slaundered wherfore wanton affeccion blinded toke wife elianor cobham doughter lord cobham sterberow whiche fame wet soueraigne lady paramour great slaunder reproche wer vnquieted pretensed wife truly tenne tymes vexed occasion woman shall herafter plainly perceiue began mariage euill ended worse lady iaquet death ihon duke brabant maried gentleman meane estate called frake bursellen whiche cause duke burgoyn imprisoned housbande left greate trouble suche ende twoo mariages pthe fourth yerethe iii yere litle tyme sir thomas rampstone sir philip branche sir nicholas burdeit englishemen nombre v hundred men repaired fortified toune sainct iames de leitron frontier normandy adioynyng britayn arthure erle richemond iury brother duke britayn whiche like vntrue gentleman sworne forsworne kyng england sodainly fled charles dolphyn whiche muche reioysyng fauor amity gaue hym constableship frauce whiche therle boughan slain uernoyl small tyme occupied lesse space enioyed newe constable litle ioyful high office thought pleasure dolphyn master aduauce name first entry authoritie imagined enterprise hym honorable prince acceptable auoyde driue toune sainct iames de beueon al englishe nacion hope victory gathered together aboue xlm men briton frenchemen scottes enuironed toune sainct iames sainct iaques de beuron strong siege englishemen within whiche nombre passed vjc men manfully defended daily assaultes fierce frenche men englishemen consulted together waie best bee taken long debatyng thei determined issue toune fight enemy daie briton weried long assaulte towardes euenyng englishemen came toune one parte posterne castle another part gate toune criyng saincte george salisburye set enemy bothe behind frenchemen seyng corage englishemen hearyng crie thynkyng therle salisbury come raise siege ranne awaie like shepe wer taken slain drouned water iiii thousand men mo besides ioly gallantes left behynde theim hast tentes xiiii greate gonne xl barrelles pouder ccc pipe wine cc pipe bisket floure cc frailes figges resons vc barrelles heryng frenchman beyng thus vanquished fel diuision emongest theimselfes one laiyng charge losse men cause fliyng suche euer chauce war victorie obteined moste coward faint harted boy boste bragge battaill loste faulte assigned beste wourste newe constable sore dismaied muche ashamed discomfiture shamefull flight remedy pacience entent blotte deface shamfull fliyng notable victory great armie entered countrey aniowe brente spoyled destroyed two thre moste litle poore thetched village whiche smal acte doen malice queched old grief thought victoriously reuenged season fell greate diuision realme england whiche sparcle like growe greate flame whether bishop winchester called henry beaufort sonne ihon duke lancastre third wife enuied authoritee humfrey duke gloucester protector realme whether duke taken disdain rich pompous estate bishop sure whole realme troubled partaker citezens london fearyng insue vpon matter wer faine kepe daily nightly watch though enemy hande besiege destroye theim muche shoppes within cite london wer shut feare fauorers two greate personage eche parte assembled small nombre people pacifiyng whereof archebishop cantorbury duke quymber called prince portyngale rode eight tymes one daie betwene twoo aduersaries matter staied tyme bishoppe winchester content nephewe lorde protector seute letter regente fraunce tenor wherof insueth right high mighty prince right noble one leuest lorde recommend vnto harte desire welfare kyng souereigne lorde realmes england fraunce awne health also hast hether trouth tary shall put lande aduenture felde suche brother haue god make hym good man wisedom knoweth profite fraunce sta deth welfare england c written great hast alhallow euen true seruaunt life ende henry wynchester duke bedford beyng sore greued vnquieted newes constituted erle warwicke whiche lately come fraunce sixe thousande men liuetenaunte frenche dominion duchy normandy small company duches wife returned ouer sea englad tenth daie ianuary solemnitie receiued london citezens gaue paire basynnes thousande marke money london rode westminster lodged kynges palaice xxv daie marche comyng london parliamet began toune leicester duke bedford openly rebuked lordes generall thei tyme warre priuie malice inwarde grudge almoste moued people warre commocion whiche tyme men ought one mynde harte consent requiryng defend serue drede soueraigne orde kyng henry perfourmyng conquest fraunce whiche maner brought conclusion parliament duke gloucester laied certain article bishoppe wynchesters charge whiche answeres herafter ensue pthe article accusacion accord betwene lorde gloucester lorde wynchester insueth article kynges counsaill hath conceiued whiche high mighty prince lord gloucester hath furmised vpon lorde wynchester chauncellour englande answere thesame first beyng protector defendor lande desired toure opened hym lodge hym therein richard woodeuile esquire hauyng tyme charge kepyng toure refused desire kepte thesame toure hym vnduly reason commaundement saied lorde winchester afterward approuyng thesaid refuse receiued thesaid wodeuile cherished hym state worship kyng saied lorde gloucester item said lorde winchester without aduise assente said lorde gloucester kynges counsail purposed disposed hym set hande kynges persone haue remoued hym eltham place windsore entent put hym suche gouernaunce hym list item said lorde gloucester al persones bee lande waie nature birthe belongeth se gouernaunce kynges person informed said vndue purpose saied lorde winchester declared article nexte aboue saied lettyng thereof determinyng haue gone eltha vnto kyng haue prouided cause required saied lorde winchester vntruly kynges peace entent trouble said lorde gloucester goyng kyng purposyng death case gone waie set men armes archer thende london bridge nexte southwerke forbarryng kynges high waie let drawe cheine stulpes set vp pipe hardelles maner forme bulwarkes set men chamber seller windowes bowes arrowes weapon thentent bryng final destruccion saied lorde gloucester persone aswell come hym item saied lorde gloucester saith affirmeth souereigne lorde brother kyng henry fifth told hym time said souereigne lorde beyng prince lodged palaice westminster greate chambre noyes spanyell night man espied taken behynd tapet said chambre whiche man deliuered therle arrundell examined vpon cause beyng tyme whiche examined time confessed steryng vp procuryng saied lorde winchester ordained haue slain thesaied prince bedde wherfore thesaid erle arru dell let sacke hym furthwith drouned hym thamise item souereigne lorde kyng henry fifth said vnto said lorde gloucester father kyng henry fourth liuyng visited greatly sickenes hande god saied lorde winchester saied vnto kyng henry fifth beyng prince kyng father visited sickenesse personable therfore disposed come conuersacion gouernaunce people muche counsailed hym take gouernaunce croune lande vpon hym pthe answere bishop ensueth answeres excusacious made lorde wynchester chauncellour englande vnto cause matter heuinesse declared article hym lorde gloucester first refuse made vnto lorde gloucester openyng toure hym lodgyng therin comaundement saied lorde wynchester answereth presence said lorde gloucester commyng countey henawd cause suche wer thought reasonable semeth lefull toure haue notably stuffed kept vitaile beit furthwith executed likewise saied lorde gloucester gone saied countrey henawd sedicious odious billes language cast vsed cite london sounyng insurreccion rebellion kinges peace destruccion aswel diuerse estate land straungers beyng vnder defence muche doubt therof straungers great nombre fled land sure kepyng thesaid toure richard wooduile squire trusted kyng souereigne lorde dead wel ye knowe also chamberlain counsailer vnto lorde bedford certain nombre defensible persones assigned vnto made deputie ther thassent kynges cousail tyme london abide therin safegard therof straightly charged thesaied counsaill duryng tyme saied charge suffre man bee toure stronger hymself without especial charge commaundement kyng thaduise counsaill item sone vpon comyng saied lorde gloucester lande countrey henawd saied lordes kynges counsaill wer enformed saied lorde gloucester grudged thesaid maner enforcyng toure let saie london wel vnderstand thei heuyly thretened tyme absence otherwise thei haue bene land wherfore right euil contented especial said forcyng toure set vpon maner chast vilain consideryng good equitie trouthe thei alwayes kept vnto kyng offeryng therupon remedy thei would item richard scot liuetenaunt toure commaundemet said lorde gloucestre brought vnto hym frier randolfe whiche long confessed treason doen hym kynges person dead whiche knowledge put bee kepte saied toure straightly commaunded vnder great pain geuen vnto saied scotte kepe hym straightly surely let hym saied toure without commau dement kyng thaduise counsail saied frier randolf said lorde gloucester kept hymself wittyng saied scot declared vnto said lorde winchester sone brought said frier randolf vnto lorde gloucestre saiyng vnto saied lorde winchester vndone helped hym expressed cause saied withholdyng frier randolf saiyng ouer desired said lorde gloucestre deliueraunce said frier randolfe leade hym vnto toure sufficient warraunt discharge saied lorde gloucestre aunswered hym commaundement sufficient warraunt discharge hym whiche thyng aboue saied thought lorde wynchester saied lorde gloucester toke vpon hym authoritie stretched vnto caused hym doubte dreade leste would haue proceaded suche tyme saied woodeuile came vnto hym aske aduise counsaill lodgyng saied lorde gloucester toure aduised charged suffered said lorde gloucester person lodge therin stronger hymself shoulde puruey hym sufficient warraunt thereof kyng thaduise counsaill item saied article foresaied cause heuinesse saied lorde chauncellor answereth neuer purposed set hande kynges person remoue hym shoulde bee remoued put maner gouernaunce thaduise kynges counsaill could conceiue maner goodnes aduauntage might haue growen vnto hym therof rather greate perell charge hereof saied lorde winchester redy make profe tyme place conuenient item third article forsaid cause heuinesse said lorde chauncellor answereth ofte diuerse tymes warned diuerse credible persones aswell tyme kynges laste parliament holden westminster sithe said lorde gloucester purposed bodely harme warned therof counsailed saied persones diuerse tymes abstain hym fro commyng westminster said lorde winchester declared vnto saied lorde gloucester item tyme thesaied parliament diuerse persones lowe estate citee london greate nobre assembled daie vpon wharffe crane uintry wished desired thei persone lorde winchester saiyng thei would haue throwen hym thamise haue taught hym swymme winges whiche billes language slander threatenynges cast spoken said cite said lord chau cellor caused hym suppose thei saied willed desired destruccion although thei cause item comyng london sir raufe botiller master lewes sent fro lorde bedford rest lordes counsaill thei beyng informed saied lorde gloucester beare displeasure saied lorde winchester thei came saied lorde gloucester ynne second sondaie next alhallowen daie opened vnto hym thei knowledge vnderstandyng thesaied displeasure praiyng hym lette theim knowe bare suche displeasure saied lorde winchester also cause thereof whiche tyme said lorde winchester afterward informed saied lorde gloucestre affirmed heuy towarde hym andnot withoutten cause paraduenture would put writyng item modaie next alhallowen daie last past night people thesaid citee london commaundement said lorde gloucester said cause lorde chaucellor wist assembled citee armed arraied continued night emongest diuerse whiche night excitacion said lorde chauncellor wist sedicious heuie language vsed especiall persone saied lorde chauncellor thesame mondaie night saied lorde gloucester sent vnto ynnes courte london chargyng court dwellyng thesame hym vpon morowe eight clocke best arraie item morowe beyng tewesday next folowyng earely saied lorde gloucester sent vnto maire alderman saied citee london ordain hym vnto nombre three hundred persones horssebacke accompany hym suche place disposed hym ride whiche saied vnto kyng thentent haue persone remoue hym place without assent aduise kynges counsail whiche thyng thought vnto saied lorde chauncellor ought nowise haue doen sene item saied lorde chauncellor consideryng thynges aboue said doubtyng therfore perelles might haue insued thereof intendyng purueye namely awne suretie defence accordyng lawe nature ordained let force people come bridge london towarde hym whiche might haue indaungered noyed intendyng wise bodely harme vnto saied lorde gloucester persone onely awne defence eschewyng perell abouesaied item toward fourth fifth saied article lorde chauncellor answereth euer true al wer soueraigne lordes reigned vpon hym neuer purposed treason vntrouth persones especiall persone saied soueraigne lorde kyng henry fifth whiche consideryng greate wisedome trouthe manhod men knewe hym ne would tyme kyng haue set said lorde chauncellor greate truste founde thought hym suche vntrouthe whiche thyng saied lorde chauncellor offred declare shewe belogeth man estate requiryng therupon lord bedford lordes spirituall temporal parliamet might sene wer iudges couenient case thei would hym right el might haue leaue kyng aduise go sue right hym ought iudge towarde letter sent lord winchester vnto lorde bedford whiche tenor rehersed whiche lorde gloucestre complained hym malicious vntrue purpose said lord winchester toward assemblyng people gatheryng feld kynges lade troublyng therof kinges peace said lorde winchester answereth said letter duely vnderstande suche wise vnderstod meant writyng maie reasonably gathered taken saied lorde winchester intended gather feld assemble people troublyng kynges land kinges peace rather purposed acquite hym kyng trouthe kepe rest peace kynges land eschew rebellion disobedience trouble beginnyng said letter calleth said lorde bedford leuest lorde one kyng ought except dutie trouthe whiche hath euer kept kepe moreover saied lettre desireth commyng home lorde bedforde welfare kyng realmes england fraunce whiche stande principlly kepyng rest peace praieth saied lorde bedford spede commyng england eschewyng ieoperdy lande felde whiche drade hym might haue folowed long taried toward wordes ye tary shall pu land aduenture feld suche brother ye haue c saied lorde winchester saieth sothe wrote thesaid letter occasion certain ordinaunces made maire alderman london excessiue takyng mason carpentars tiler plasterer laborer daily iorneis approued kynges aduise counsaill caste many heuinesses sedicious billes vnder name suche laborer thretenyng risyng many thousandes manassyng estate lande likewise sedicious euill language sowen continued likely haue sued purpose intent disobedience rebellion redressyng whiche semed lorde chauncellor said lorde gloucester endeuor diligence might haue shewed lacke whiche diligence thei disposed disobey saunce incoraged inboldened like thei haue made gatheryng kyng true subiectes haue compelled haue made felde haue withstand theim whiche feld makyng aduenturyng lande tokenyng neuer said lorde chauncellors intent gather feld trouth moste stirred hym suche riotously would make suche assemble soueraigne lorde weale lande desired hastely commyng saied lorde bedforde whiche would wise haue greatly desired would haue purposed hym vnto vnlawful makyng feld wist wel said lorde bedford would moste sharply haue chastised punished would riotous asseble make answere made duke caused writyng folowyng opely proclaymed beit knowen folkes intent lord bedford lordes spirituall temporall assembled present parliament acquite hym procede truly iustely indifferently without parcialitie maner matter qurelles moued bee moued betwene lorde gloucester one partie lorde winchester chauncellor england party sure keping kynges peace accorded saied lorde bedford saied lordes spiritual temporall othe made forme foloweth saie pthe othe lordes saied lorde bedford saied lordes spiritual temporal eche shal farfurth connynges discrecions suffisen truly iustly indifferently cousaill aduise kyng also procede acquite self al thesaid matter quarelles without thei theim shall priuely appertly make shewe hymself party parciall therin leuyng eschewyng affeccion loue mede doubt dreade persone persones thei shal wise kepe secrete shalbe commoned waie counsaill matter quarrelles aboue said said parliament without thei shall worde writyng kyng wise open discouer thesaid party person saied counsail haue speciall commaundement leaue thereto kyng saied lorde bedforde eche shall might power assist waie counsaill el shewe vnto kyng lorde bedforde rest said lordes put said party reaso suffer saied party assistentes procede attempte waie feit kynges peace helpe assiste comfort thereto let might power withstande assist vnto kyng saied lorde bedforde kepyng kynges peace redressyng suche maner procedyng waie feit force duke duke bedford duke norffolke duke excestre bisshoppes archebishop cantorbury bishop carlisle bishop bathe bishop landaffe bishop rochestre bishop chichester bishop worcester bishop sainct dauies bishop london bishop duresine erles erle northumberlande erle stafforde erle oxforde lordes lorde hungerforde lorde tiptoft lorde ponynges lorde cromewell lorde boroughth lorde louell lorde botreux lorde clynton lorde zouche lorde audeley lorde ferreis groby lorde talbot lorde roos lorde grey lorde grey ruff lorde fitzwalter lorde berkeley abbottes abbot waltham abbot glaustinbury abbot saincte augustine cantorbury abbot westminster abbot sainct mary yorke abbot sain te albons sworne presente vvhiche othe maner forme aboue rehersed lordes aswell spirituall temporall beyng parliamet leicester assembled fourthe daie marche promised vpon faithe dutie allegeaunce whiche thei owe kyng soueraigne lorde truly obserue kepe accordyng true meanyng purport thesame pthe arbitrement name god henry archebishop cantorbury thomas duke excester ihon duke norffolke thomas bishop duresme phillip bishop worcester ihon bishop bathe humfrey erle stafford william alnewike keper kynges priuie seale rauffe lorde cromwell arbitratoures maner cause matter quarels heuinesses greuaunces incidentz circumstaunces dependentes connexes beyng hagyng betwene high worthy prince hu frey duke gloucester one partie worshipfull father god henry bishop winchester chauncellor englande partie either theim peacyng saied quarelles debate taken chosen maner forme conteined plainly comprimesse made therupon whiche tenor sheweth forme nemoradvm vii daie marche iiii yere soueraigne lorde kyng henry sixt high mightie prince humfrey duke gloucestre reuerence god good kyng soueraigne lorde lande namely reuerece specially request praier mightie highe prince lord bedford brother agreed hym put putteth maner matter queralles deede incidentez circumstaunces dependentz connexes touchen hym persone hath anywise feleth hym greued heuy lorde vncle lorde winchester el lorde winchester findeth greued hym asmuche thei touch hym persone fro beginnyng worlde vnto daie aduise ordinaunce arbitrament worthy father god henry archbishop cantorbury high noble prince thomas duke excester ihon duke norffolke worshipfull father god thomas bishop duresme philip bishop worcester iho bishop bathe noble lorde humfrey erle stafford worshipfull persones master william alnewike keper kynges priuy seale raufe lorde crumwel promisyng behightyng faith body worde princehode kynges sonne kepe obserue fulfil hym behalf al shalbe declared ordeined arbitred forsaid archebishop duke bishoppes erle keper priuie seale lorde cruwell matter querelles aboue saied grauntyng also promisyng ouer comprehended forsaied arbitrement toward puttyng awaie heuinesse displeasure wise conteined lorde gloucester haue wise assisted counsailed fauored vnto said vncle winchester toward matter touchyng lorde gloucester remitteth gouernaunce thereof vnto kyng counsaill thei deme aduise counsaill hym thynketh doen witnesse whiche thyng present compromise said lorde gloucester hath subscribed name awne hande humfrey gloucester like forme lorde winchester another compromise hath subscribed awne hande vnder worde priestehod stande aduise ordinaunce arbitremet persones abouesaied mutatis mutandis cause beforsaied querelles v sene heard diligetly examined decreed assent saied party ordeine award lordes gloucester winchester thyng doen spoke one partie persone persones afore vii daie present moneth marche neuer take cause querelles displeasure heuinesses one ne nether counsailers adheretes fauorers thing thynges past saied lorde gloucester bee good lorde saied lorde winchester haue hym loue affeccion kynseman uncle saied lorde winchester haue saied lorde gloucester true sadde loue affeccion bee ready hym suche seruice apperteineth honesty saied lorde winchester estate doo eche theim bee good lorde vnto adherentes counsailers fauourers shewe theim tymes fauorable loue affeccion thyng doen saied afore seuenth daie marche decre ordaine awarde saied lorde wynchester presence kyng oure soueraigne lorde lorde bedforde lorde gloucester resydue lordes spirituall temporall common beeyng presente parlyamente saye declare maner forme foloweth soueraigne lorde haue well vnderstande noysed emong state land kyng soueraigne lorde tyme beyng prince lodged greate chamber westminster baiyng spanyell night taken behynd tapet thesame chamber man haue confessed myne excitacion procuryng haue slain foresaied prince bedde wherevpon thesaied erle let sacke hym furthwith drouned hym thamise furthermore accused haue stirred kyng last died tyme also prince haue taken gouernaunce realme croune vpo liuyng father thesame tyme beyng kyng whiche language noysyng fele name fame greatly enblemisshed diuerse mennes opinion vpon take firste god witnesse afterwarde worlde haue tymes true louer true man soueraigne lorde shalbe life also haue soueraigne lorde father time reigne true man suche toke trust cherished liues end trust man affirme contrary neuer life procuryng imagenyng death distruccio person ne assentyng suche thyng like thereto tyme kyng prince el estate like wise true man kyng henry iiij time soueraigne lorde reigned vpon matter maner wise liketh soueraigne lorde commaunde ready declare shall like thaduise counsaill assigne wherefore beseche soueraigne lorde humbly consideryng grounded processe whiche might lawfully matter aboue saied conuict blessed god holde declare thaduise al lordes spirituall temporall beyng presente parliament true man soueraigne lord haue vnto souereigne lord wer father graudfather true man also haue tymes vnto saied father whilest prince el estate said slaunder nosyng notwithstandyng declaracion enacted saied present parliament wordes declared maner aboue said said lorde winchester semeth saied lord arbitratours fittyng said lorde winchester drawe hym part meane tyme lordes beyng present bee singulerly examined therupon saie aduise assented theim maner saied lorde winchester desireth let hym called lord bedford haue wordes effect yt folowe faire vncle lorde aduise counsaill hath commaunded saie hath well vnderstande considered al matter whiche ye haue openly declared presence thereupon ye desire peticion declare aduise assent lordes spirituall temporall beyng presente parliamente declareth true man hym ye haue bee lorde father graundfather also true man lorde father while prince el estate thesaied dis aunder noysyng notwithstandyng thesaied declaracion enacted present parliament whiche wordes thus saied declared thesaied lordes arbitratours saied lorde winchester haue wordes foloweth saied lorde gloucester lorde gloucester haue conceiued greate heuinesse ye haue receiued diuerse reportes haue purposed imagined persone honor estate dyuer e maners whiche ye haue take great displeasure sir take god witnes reportes euer haue paraduenture suche haue greate affeccion god forgeue neuer imagined ne purposed thyng might hynderyng preiudice persone honor estate therfore praie ye vnto good lord time furthe gaue neuer occasion purpose hereafter goddes grace whiche wordes hym saied decreed said arbitratours lorde gloucester answere saie faire uncle sithe ye declare suche man ye saie right glad suche man take doen decreed saied arbitratours euery ech lordes gloucester winchester take either hande presence kyng parliament signe token good loue accord whiche doen parliament adiourned till easter greate fire discencion betwene twoo noble personage thus arbitratours knowledge iudgement vtterly quenched laied vnder boord controuersies betwene lordes takyng parte one partie wer sone apeased brought concord ioy wherof kyng caused solepne feast kept whitson sondaie whiche daie created richard plantagenet sonne heire erle cambridge father hampton put execucion haue hearde duke yorke forseyng prefermet destruccion sede generacion bee extreme ende finall confusion daie also promoted ihon lorde mowbrey erle marshall sonne heire thomas duke norffolke kyng richard seconde exiled realme dominion title name stile duke norffolke duryng whiche feaste duke bedforde adourned kyng high ordre knighthode whiche thesame daie dubbed sweard knightes whose name ensue richard duke yorke ihon duke norffolke erle westmerlande henry lorde percie ihon lorde butler sonne therle ormond lorde rosse lorde matrauers lorde welles lorde barkeley sir iames butler sir henry graye tankaruile sir ihon talbot sir raufe graye werke sir robert ueer sir richard grey sir edmond hungerford sir water wyngfeld sir ihon butteler sir reignold cobham sir ihon passheleue sir thomas tunstall sir ihon chedeocke sir raufe langstre sir william drurye sir william ap thomas sir richard caruonell sir richard wooduile sir ihon shirdelow sir nicholas blunket sir william cheyney sir william babyngto iustice sir raufe butler sir robert beauchapme sir edmond trafford sir ihon iune chief baron diuerse solempne feast ended great aide subsidye graunted continuaunce conquest fraunce money gathered men wer prepared euery citee toune cou trey duryng whiche busines thomas duke excester sadde wise wel learned cousailer great vncle kyng departed mortal life manner grnewiche al funeral pompe conueyed london berry buried whiche yere also died lady elizabeth halfe sister whole bloud kyng henry iiij maried lorde ihon hollande duke excester lord fanhope buried blacke frier london vvhile thynges wer thus appoyntyng concludyng englande erle warwicke leuetenaunt regente realme fraunce entered countrey mayne besieged toune chasteau de loyre whiche shortly hym redered wherof made capitain matthew gough esquire toke assaute castle mayet gaue valeauntnes iho winter esquire conquered castle lund made gouernor william gladdisdale gentleman whiche place informed frenchemen assembled together countrey beausse wherfore like valyaunt capitain power marched thetherwarde encountre enemy fight aduersaries whiche hauyng knowledge approchyng fled durste abide triall ieoperde aduenture returnyng beseged castle montdublean whereof capitain sir roberto de croix whiche siege cotinued thre wekes conclusion englishemen sore charged theim capitain whole company contente yelde castle liues horse harneis onely erued whiche long consultacion many agrementes made frankely grau ted saied erle warwicke leauyng valeaunt lorde willoughby returned paris duryng whiche season ordained assent thre estate realme englade gouernor young kyng like maner noble duke excester death appoynted assigned yet taried still fraunce small seruice shall perceiue pthe fifth yerethe v yere regent fraunce thus beeyng englande meanes made duke burgoyne deliuery duke alanson whiche taken prisoner battaill uernoyle last yere twoo hundred thousande crounes deliuered set large neither release abatement part raunsome would wise acknowledge kyng englande bee liege souereigne lorde suche affeccion bare dolphyn suche trouth shewed natural countrey thynges wer concluded ordered established bothe conseruacion peace tranquilitie within realme englande also maintenaunce warre finall gainyng region fraunce duke bedforde wife tooke leaue kyng westminster landed calice also passed sea henry bishop winchester whiche thesaied toune inuested habite hatte dignitie cardinall ceremony appertainyng whiche degree kyng henry fifth knowyng haute corage ambicious mynde man prohibited hym allegeaunce either sue take meanyng cardinalles hattes presume bee egall prince kyng beyng young regent frende obteined dignitie greate profite empouerishyng spiritualtie bull legatyue whiche purchased rome gathered muche treasure man maner money surnamed riche cardinall winchester nether called learned bishop verteous priest duke bedford returned fraunce lorde rustinan marshall britayn assembled greate company britishe nacion whiche fortefied repaired toune pountorson thesaied marshall thousand men entered countrey constantyne normandy came toune auranches thenglishmen within garrison issued boldly fought enemy long conflicte many stroke geuen briton wer ouer come lorde rustynan taken moste parte people slaine duke bedforde hearyng toune pountorson newly fortified strongly defended sent thither erle warwicke accopanied lorde scale diuerse valiaunt capitaines souldiers nombre vij thousande men besiege toune whiche enuironed euery parte neither man could steale beast could passe siege long continuyng vitaill began waxe scant englishe armie wherefore lorde scale hauyng company sir ihon harpeley bayly constantine sir william brearton bayly caen sir raufe tesson sir ihon carbonell iii thousand good men war departed fro siege get vitail pouder thynges necessary purpose enterprise thei returnyng cariage sea cost nere michael mout thei sodainly wer encountred enemy wherof chief wer baron coloses lorde dausebost capitain thesaid mount lorde mountabon lorde mountburchier lorde chasteau giron lord tyntygnat lord chasteau brian vim men warre lorde scale company seyng thei wer compassed euery side deadly daungiers sea one side enemy meane waie escape flie discended horsses like gredy lion together vnpeaceable fury set enemy skirmishe strong fight fierce englishman kept themselfes close enemy could haue auantage last lorde scale cried george thei flie thenglishmen toke suche corage frenchman fought dismaied thei began flie englishman leped horssebacke folowed theim slewe toke aboue xic persones emongest wer taken baron colsoes lorde chasteau brian xxx knightes victory lorde scale vitailes prouision prisoner returned siege erle noble men ioyously receiued notable facte highly magnified preysed siege thus continued pountorson christopher hanson souldiers garrison susan made rode countrey anioy came castle called ramffort castle priuely scaled capitain company wer taken slain thei knewe enemy approchyng knowledge feate made open frenchemen whiche assembled nombre xxm reyse siege breake vp campe liyng toune pountorson thei lefte iourney tyme returned castle ramffort besieged thesame space tenne day englishemen consideryng multitude enemy farre absence frendes began treate frenchman vpon condicion departe bagge baggage horse harnes thei rendered vp castle departed rich thei brought whiche castle thus possessed frenchemen thei forgat reskew poutorson brake vp army sone lorde raix callyng liuetenaunt general dolphin accompanyed lorde mount iehan lorde beaumanoire lord tussye nobre thre thousande persones entered countrey mayn laied siege castle malycorne wherof capitain englishma called oliuer osbaters castle capitain force taken obteined like maner thei toke litle castle lude william blackeborne leuetenaunt willia glasdale esquire put hym rausome slewe al souldiers victory whiche thei muche gloried frenchman perceiuing therle warwicke continued stil siege toune pountorson knowyng espial englishman wer determined geue battaill thei attempted rayse siege therefore fearyng fight open battaill reculed backe dolphyn litle gain small honor frenchman briton beyng straightly besieged within toune pountorson perceiuyng likelyhod succor come seyng englishe army daily increase fearyng sequele therof thei violence bee taken vanquished thei offered toune thei might departe horse harnes onely whiche request long sute peticion theim hardely graunted erle like valiaunt capitain entred toune appoynted gouernors lorde roos lorde talbot leuyng conuenient garrison returned lorde regent takyng toune league treaty concluded betwene regent duke britayn whiche agrement bothe tounes pountorson iames de beuron wer beaten doune ground clery defaced lord rais departed territory mayne haue heard christopher hanson phillip gough martyn godffrey called scaler diuerse garrison susan nombre xxx archars went mornyng seke aduetures came nere castle sainct laurence de mortiers thesame season whe sir iames de sepeaulx capitain thesame gone castle greatest nombre retinewe churche directly castle masse time thenglishmen entered subtiltie gate gat dongeon sir iames returned masse entered gate taken men fled castle furnished englishman capitain therof appoynted sir william oldhaule season sir ihon fastolfe gouernor country aniow maine assembled great puissaunce men warre laied siege castle sainct owen destays beside toune lauall wherof capitain sir guillam orenge whiche ten day besiegyng rendred castle liues armure except howbeit one railyng slaunderous persone put terrible execucion thence thesaid sir ihon remoued strog castle grauile xii day thei within offred yeld castle daie thei wer succored dolphin power offre taken pledge deliuered wer guilla cordouen ihon de maisierie esquiers pledge deliuered sir ihon fastolffe returned post regent aduertisyng composicion agrement wherfore thesaid lorde reised greate power fight frenche men daie appoynted company wer erles mor aigne warwicke lordes roos talbot sir ihon fastolffe sir ihon aubemond sir ihon ratelife diuerse nombre twentie thousande men marched forwarde hope mete ioyne battail enemy aduersaries whiche wer farre durste approche wherefore regent sent sir ihon falstolffe incontinent receiue castle thei within cotrary promesse appointment newly vitailed manned place forsaking pledge felowes armes refused render fortres accordyng appointment wherfore pledge brought sight theim within castle openly put death lorde talbot made gouernor aniow mayne sir ihon fastolffe assigned another place whiche lorde talbot beyng bothe noble birthe haute corage comming fraunce obteined many glorious victory enemy name yet dredful frenche nacion muche renoumed emongest al people ioly capitain sonne valiant mar entered mayn slewe men destroyed castle brent tounes conclusion sodainly toke toune lauall lorde loghac diuerse retrayted theim selfes castle remained eight day duryng tyme agreed al capitaines burgess men warre whiche wer within castle depart bagge baggage paiyng lord talbot al thynges one hundred thousand crounes castle beyng deliuered committed kepyng gilbert halsall whiche slain siege orleance made capitain matthew gough whiche beyng iorney senlies treason miller kept mil adioynyng walle frenchemen entered toune brought subieccion obeysaunce duke bedford aduertised espial toune montarges whiche territory orleance slenderly kept smally furnished might bee taken litle pain losse regent glad newes sent therle suffolke sir ihon pole brother sir henry bisset sixe men assaute toune thei came thether founde toune better manned strongly defenced expectacion imagined thei gaue assaute laied siege aboute toune therle warwicke appoynted lye greate nomber menne warre sainct mathelines de archamp encountre frenchman thei would attempt ayde vitaill wer enclosed within toune fortresse stode suche place water marishes army must seuer thre partes one could easely helpe either boates bridge toune besieged space two monethes meane season arthur britayne constable dolphyn sent thether hast lorde boisac marshall frauce stephin le hire ponton de sentrayles lorde grauile diuerse valiaunt horssemen nomber thre thousand aboue whiche priuily night came side sir ihon de la pole sir henry bisset laye thei founde al ordre without watche frenchemen entered lodge slewe many beddes thei spared man resistance smal sir iho delapole horsse saued hymself fled ouer water brother sir henry bisset escaped boate eight hym residue whiche would haue passed bridge ioyned erle suffolke fled suche plumpes ouer bridge tymber brake great nombre drouned ye wer slain drouned xvc men erle warwicke hearyng chaunce departed sainct mathelyn diligent spede came montarges offeryng battaill frenche capitaines whiche answered thei manned vitailed toune enteded nomore time thenglishmen seyng trauaile bee vain came backe softely ordinaunce duke bedforde seme fortune time would freche men haue one ioyfull daie thesame also myngled dolor displeasure tyme sir nicholas burdett appoynted duke somerset vexe trouble enemy costes britayne sent light horssemen euery part vexyng people wastyng coutrey tounes passed brente al buildynges spoyled robbed prisoner praies wer aboundantly taken smal village wer destroyed greate tounes wer raunsomed without hurt damage thesaid sir nicholas returned normandy mischance beyng declared constable fraunce capitaines cut combes plucked doune harte whiche set mery pynne victory montarges thei maner like desperate persones lothe attempte fa ther enterprise englishe nacion saiyng god turned englishe deuill would helpe fraunce duke alauson whiche haue hard late deliuered englande reuiued dull spirites dolphyn fainte harte capitaines promisyng theim greate victory litle trauail muche gain smal labor wherfore hope good lucke determined notable feate thenglishe men happened chaunce vnloked vnthought euen thei would haue whisshed desired onely magistrate chiefly spiritual person citee mauns knowyng duke britayne brother reuerted turned frenche partie began sore mourne lament thei wer subiectes vassal yoke power englishemen wherfore thei determined fully concluded aduertise myndes determinacions capitaines charles dolphyn called frenche kyng certain false frier therof wrote humble louing letter newes pleased muche french capitaines lesse maie bee sure dolphyn hymself thyng discended heauen theim vnsought vnimagined deuised wherfore take oportunitie time serued lese great benefite honestly offred lordes delabreth fayet marshal fraunce accompanied lordes monte ihan bu l doruall torsye beaumamoyre heire gullyam brother fiue hundred hardy capitaines valiaunt souldiers toke vpon theim enterprise sendyng greate thankes laudes clergie citezens assured ridelitie soueraigne lord promysyng theim bee daie appoynted doubtyng find redy accordyng promes gladly receiue vvhen daie assigned night appoynted come frenche capitaines priuely approched toune makyng litle fire hill sight toune signifie comyng approchyng citezes whiche great church wer loking approch shewed burnyng cresset steple whiche sodainly put quenched saie capitaines horssebacke came gate traytors within slewe porter watche men let frendes footemen entered firste men armes waited barrier intent muche nede required necessitie copelled might fight ope feld meane season many englishman wer slain greate claymor houge noyse hard toune wont accustomed toune treason sodainly surprised taken cause cry beginnyng noyse fewe except confederate ether knewe perceiued remnaunt citezens beyng partaker faccion imagined englshmen made hauocke toune put sweard englishemen othersyde iudged citezens begonne new rebellion theim el striuen emongest theimselfes erle suffolke whiche gouernour toune hearyng clamor noyse people hauyng perfect knowledge suche escaped fro walles case citee stode without tariyng prolongyng tyme entered castle whiche standeth gate sainct uincent wherof constable thomas g wer esquier whether also fled many englishemen place pestured thei wer rescued likely famished surely thei sore assauted marueilously hurte shot alablasters crosse bowes thei defended theimselfes manfully enemy gat small aduauntage handes hardines serued pollicy defended theim thei priuely sent messenger lorde talbot whiche laie alanson certefiyng hym case thei stoode vitaill thei none municios failed castle almoste vndermined yeldyng must folowe resistaunce could preuaile lorde talbot heryng newes neither stept banquetted hast assembled together valiaunt capitaines whose name haue often time heard rehersed nombre vii hundred men warr euenyng departed alanson mornyng came castle called guyerche twoo myles mauns thence sent espial matthew gough espie gouernance enemy might shewe countreymen hade aide rescowes matthew gough well sped priuely night came castle knew french men beyng lordes citee castyng perels fearyng creature began waxe wanton fell riote though enemy could damage thynkyng englishemen whiche wer shutte vp castle studied nothyng escape deliuered whe matthew gough knowen al certaintie eaten litle breade dronke cuppe wine comfort stomacke priuely returned within mile citee met lorde talbot lorde scale made open theim al thyng according credence whiche spede matter daie approched al hast possible came posterne gate alighted horse sixe clocke mornyng thei issued castle criyng sainct george talbot french men whiche wer scace vp thought nothyng lesse sodain approchment rose beddes shertes lepte ouer walles ranne naked gate sauyng liues leuyng behynde theim apparell horsses armure rich none hurt suche whiche ether resisted would yelde wherof slain cast prisone slain taken foure hundred getlemen villaines frankely let go inquisicion made author vngracious coniuracion wer accused thirtie citezens twenty priestes fiftene frier whiche accordyng desertes put execucion pthe sixt yerethe vi yere citee mauns thus beyng reduced englishe mennes handes lorde talbot departed toune alanson whiche marciall feat manly acheued erle warwicke departed enlande bee gouernor young kyng steade thomas duke excester late departed god whose stede sent fraunce lorde thomas mountacute erle salisbury fiue thousande men whiche landed calice came duke bedford paris consultyng duke bedforde concernyng affaire realme fraunce seyng thynges prosperously succede englishe part began meruailously phantelic citee countrey orliance stadyng riuer loyre cite well fortified bothe nature situacio place pollicie man imagined woorke one daie study one houre wherfore remitted farther deliberacio yet man tyme whose wit strength pollicie englishe name muche fearfull terrible french nacion whiche hymself might bothe appoynt commaunde thynges maner pleasure whose power appeared deathe greate part conquest consisted estemed man bothe painful diligent redy withstand thynges perilous imminent prompt counsail labor weried yet corage tyme abated appalled men put trust one man synguler person gat harte men greate enterprise long debated argued priuie counsaill erle salisbury deuise although semed harde straunge hym wer thyng predestinate easie graunted allowed whiche enterprise final conclusion naturall destiny shall shortely perceiue thus replenished good hope victory furnished artilery municions apperteinyng greate siege accompanied erle suffolke lorde talbot valiaunt company nombre tenne thousande men departed paris passed countrey beause toke assaute toune yainuile frenchman fled castle continued fiue day ende wherof thei rendered themselfes symply thesaid nombre wer put death certain cause taken mercie tooke also toune bawgency sufferyng euery man whiche would become vassaile subiecte kyng england enherite landes enioy goodes tounes meun vpon loyre iargenan hearyng treatise presented hym keyes toune vpon like agrement egall condicions moneth septembre laied siege one side water loyre whose commyng bastarde orleaunce bishop citee great nombre scottes hearyng therles intent made diuerse fortificacions toune destroyed suburbes whiche wer twelfe parishe church foure ordres frier thei cut also doune al vine tree bush within fiue leages toune englishman haue neither comfort refuge succor must litle digresse declare bastard orleance whiche onely capitain citee also charles sixt made erle dunoys greate authoritie fraunce extreme enemie englishe nacion story shall apparauntly perceiue whose line steme dyscend duke longuile marque rutylon lewes duke orleance murthered paris ihon duke burgoyne haue harde owner castle concy frontier fraunce toward arthoys wherof made constable lord cauny man wise wife faire yet faire well beloued duke orleance husband betwene duke husbande cannot tell father conceiued child brought furthe prety boye called ihon whiche child beyng age one yere duke disceased long mother lorde cawny ended liues next kynne lord cawny chalenged enheritaunce whiche worth foure thousande crounes yere alledgyng boye bastard kynred mother side saue honesty plainly denied conclusion matter contencio presidentes parliament paris hang controuersie till child came age eight yeres old whiche tyme demaunded hym openly whose sonne fredes mother side aduertised hym require day aduised great answer whiche asked hym grauted meane eason said frendes persuaded hym claime inheritaunce sonne lorde cawny whiche honorable liuyng aunciet patrimony affirming said contrary slau dered mother shamed hymself stained bloud also haue liuyng thing take scholemaster thinkyng disciple wel learned lesson would reherse accordyng instruccio brought hym iudges daie assigned question repeted hym boldly answered harte geueth noble corage telleth sonne noble duke orleaunce glad bastrde meane liuyng lawfull sonne coward cuckolde cauny foure thousande crounes iustices muche merueiled bolde answere mother cosyns detested hym shamyng mother father supposed kinne reioysed gainyng patrimony possession charles duke orleance heryng iudgement toke hym family gaue hym greate office fee whiche well deserued duryng captiuitie defeded la de expulsed thenglishmen conclusion procured deliueraunce coragious bastard siege continued thre wekes ful issued gate bridge fought englishemen thei receiued hym ierce terrible stroke company compelled retire flie backe citee englishemen folowed theim faste killyng takyng enemy thei entred bulwarke bridge whiche greate toure standing thende thesame taken incontinent thenglishmen whiche conflict many frenche men taken mo slain kepyng toure bulwerke comitted william glasdale esquier gotten bulwarke sure waie neither man vitaill could passe come made certayne bulwarkes roude citee castyng trench betwene one laiyng ordinaunce euery part saw battery might deuised thei within perceiued thei enuironed fortress ordinance thei laied gonne gonne fortefied toures bulwarkes within made new rampires buylded newe mudwalles auoyde crackes breches whiche might violent shot sodainly insue thei appoynted bastard orleance stephin ueignold called heire se walles watch kept bishop sawe thinhabitates within cite wer put good ordre vitaill wer wantonly consumed vainly spent toure taken bridge ende haue heard high chamber hauyng grate full barres yron whiche man might loke al length bridge cite grate many chief capitaines stode diuerse time vieuyng cite deuisyng place best assautable thei citee perceiued well totyng hole laied pece ordynaunce directly wyndowe chaunced lix daie siege laied citee therle salisbury sir thomas gargraue william glasdale diuerse went thesaid toure high chabre loked grate short space sonne master gonner perceiued men lokyng wyndowe tooke matche father taught hym whiche gone doune dinner fired gonne whiche brake sheuered ye yron barres grate wherof one strake therle strogly hed stroke away one iyes side cheke sir thomas gargraue likewise striken died within two day therle conueyed meum vpon loyre laie beyng wounded viij day duryng whiche tyme receiued deuoutly holy sacramentes commended soule almighty god whose body conueyed england al funerall pompe buried bissam progenitor leuyng behind hym onely daughter named alice maried richarde neuell sonne raufe erle westmerland hereafter shalbe made mencion detriment damage losse succeded englishe publique wealthe sodain death valiaunt capitain long departure manifestly apered high prosperttie great glory englishe nacion party beyond sea began shortely fall litle litle vanishe awaie whiche thyng although englishe people like valiant strong body firste tyme perceiue yet ye thei felt grow like pestilet humor succesciuely alitle litle corrupteth membres destroyeth body death noble man fortune warre began change triumphant victory began darckened although death therle wer dolorous englishme yet surely moste dolorous duke bedford regent fraunce whiche loste right hande lacked weapon fight enemie seyng dedde men cannot sorowe called lamentacion dedde body cannot remedy chaunces men liuyng like prudent gouernor pollitique patron appointed therle suffolke leuetenaunt capitain siege ioyned hym lorde scale lorde talbot sir ihon fastolfe diuerse valiaunt knightes esquiers lordes caused bastiles made rounde citee whiche thei troubled enemy assauted walles left nothyng vnattempted whiche might bee theim aduantage hurtefull enemy time lent vitaile artillerie began waxe scant englishe armie wherfore therle suffolke appoynted sir ihon fastolfe sir thomas rampsto sir phillip hal retinewes ride paris lorde regent informe hym scarsenes necessitie whiche beyng therof informed without delaye prolongyng prouided vitaile artillery municions necessary conuenient greate enterprise laded therwith many chariottes carte horsses ure coduite sauegard appoynted sir simon morhier prouost paris gard citee diuerse awne houshold seruauntes accompany sir ihon fastolfe coplices army liyng siege orleaunce whiche departed good ordre nombre v hundred men warre beside wagoner paris came yaynuile beausse mornyng early greate frost thei departed place toward siege thei came toune called ronuray laudes beausse thei perceiued enemy co myng nombre ix xm frenchemen scottes capitaines wherof charles cleremot sonne duke burbon beyng prisoner englande sir william stewarde constable scotlande alitle deliuered captiuitie erle pedriacke lorde ihon uandosme uidane charter lorde touars lorde lohat lorde eglere lorde beaniew bastard tremorle many valiant capitaines wherfore sir ihon fastolfe companion set company good ordre battaill picked stake euery archer breke force horseman backes thei set wagos cariages within theim thei tied horsses enemy could nether assaile backeside yet spoile horsses maner thei stode stil abidyng assaute aduersaries frenchemen reason greate nombre thinkyng victory handes egerly like lion set englishemen whiche greate force theim receiued manfully defended stoode theim vpon consideryng inequalitie nombre long cruell fight englishman droue backe vanquished proude frenchemen compelled theim flie conflicte slain lorde willyam stewarde constable scotlande brother lorde doruall lorde delabret lorde chasteanbrian sir ihon basgot frenchemen scottes nomber xxvc aboue xj hundred taken prisoner although frenche writer affirme nombre lesse fortunate victory sir ihon fastolfe company whiche man reputacion either slain taken came cariages vitaile prisoner siege orleance thei wer ioyously receiued welcomed souldiors conflict part cariage heryng leuten stuffe frenchman cal vnfortunate battail herynges erle suffolke beeyng thus vitailed continued siege euery daie almoste skirmished enemy whiche beyng dispaire succor began comen emongest theimself thei might rendre toune moste honoure profite muche reasonyng long debatyng emongest capitaines magistrate toune way best folowed affirmed onely shamefull dishonorable also vnnaturall vnreasonable yelde toune englishemen beyng neither frendes fauorers frenche nacion fearyng victory englishman imagined thei force possessed citee thei would tyrantes accustomed serue wilfull obstinate people therefore thei thought greate folye notable lightnes beware one deny refuse thei saw glory must nedes decline shame reproche thei thought find meane waye saue themselfes cite fro captiuitie enemy deuised submit citee theselfes al vnder obeysance phillip duke burgoyn brought stocke bloud royall auncient hous fraunce thinkyng meanes thei deede breke minishe greate amitie betwene englishemen hym poynt concluded thei made open sent duke al deuises intentes whiche certified would gladly receiue offre regent fraunce would therto agre co sent therupo dispatched certain ambassador duke bedford newes wer straunge pleasaunt vpon whiche poynt assembled great counsaill thought maner yeldyng bothe honorable profitable king englande reason wherof greate citee riche countrey brought possessio enemy hades trusty frendes without farther cost bloudshed duke bedford wer contrary opinion thinkyng bothe dishonorable vnprofitable realme england se cite long besieged costes expense kyng england almoste brought poynt yeldyng yelded fore prince potestate hym regent exaple wherof might prouoke tounes herfater ame reason toke place regent answered duke ambassador honorable yet co sonaunte reason kyng englande beate bushe duke burgoyne haue birdes wherfore sithe right war charge saied citie ought yelded person hym vse profite litle chance succeded great change thenglishe affaire double mischief answere rose prangout first duke burgoyne began conceiue certain priuye grudge thenglishmen cause thynkyng enuy beare malice glory profite whiche continuance time became enemy leued frenche kyng secondly englishemen lefte siege orleaunce whiche treaty thei might haue frend haue continued neutre till lorde duke orleaunce erle angulosie brother wer deliue red captiuitie english people men wer angel aw thynges come thei like beastes would ronne confusion fortune whiche gideth destiny man turne whele listeth soeuer saith nay vvhile treaty orleaunces hand charles dolphin daily studied hourly labored plucke fauor harte nobilitie fraunce englishe nacion intent might assemble puyssance sufficient relefe frendes beyng shut vp citie orleauce studiyng compassyng matter happened hym straunge chaunce whiche write alitle frenche aucthours especially ihon bouchet writeth muche saie came hym beyng chynon mayd age xx yeres man apparell named ione borne burgoyne toune called droymy beside uancolour greate space cham erleyn commen hostrey rampe suche boldnesse would course horse ride theim water thynges yong maiden bothe abhorred wer ashamed yet say whether wer foule face man would desire either made vowe liue chaste kept maydenhed preserued virginitie monster sent dolphin sir robert bandrencort capitain uancolour declared sent fro god bothe aide miserable citee orleaunce also remit hym possession realme whiche expulsed ouercomed rehersyng hym vision trauses fable full blasphemy supersticio hypocrisy maruell muche wise men beleue lerned clarkes would write suche phantasy reherse thei saie knewe called hym kyng neuer saw speake reuelacion swerde appoynted churche saincte katheryn fierboys torayne neuer write declared suche priuy messasges god lady sainctes dolphyn made teres ronne doune fro iyes deluded blynded deceiued deuils meanes whiche suffred begynne race inconclusion rewarded shamefull fal meane season suche credite geuen honoured sainct religious beleued one sent god temporaltie muche armed poyntes rode poytiers bloys ther found men war vitail municions redy conueyed orleauce englishman perceiuyng thei within could long continue faute vitaile pouder kepte watche diligently thei wer accustomed scoured coutrey enuironed thei ordained whiche negligence citezens shut perceiuing sent worde therof frenche capitaines whiche pucelle dedde tyme night greate rayne thundre vitaile artilery entered citee thei welcomed marueill folkes greate trouble ioyous litle comfort next daie englishemen boldely assauted toune promisyng theim best scaled walles great rewardes men mounted ladder coragiously gonne arrowes pike bette enemy walles frenchemen although thei marueiled fierce fightyng english people yet thei wer amased thei defended theim selfes darke night whiche daie great priuate feate worthy memory either attempted doen bastard orleaunce seyng puyssaunce thenglishe nacion began feare sequele matter wherfore sent worde duke alaunson aduertisyng hym case toune stoode could long continue without hasty spede quicke diligence whiche delaiyng tyme deferryng space came al army within two league citee sent woorde capitaines next morowe thei redy receiue theim whiche thyng nexte daie thei accomplished englishemen thought muche auaile greate multitude entered citee vexed famyne replenished scarsenes next daie mornyng frenchemen alt gether issued toune assauted fortresse bastile called bastyle sainct loure whiche great force litle losse thei toke set fire assauted toure bridge foote whiche manfully defended frenchemen beyng nombre fiersely assauted thei toke lorde talbot could come succor whiche willyam gladdisdale capitain slain lorde morlyns lorde pownynges also frenchemen puffed vp good lucke seyng strong fortres vngotten whiche vnder defence lorde talbot fetched compasse aboute good ordre battaile marched thether ward lorde talbot like capitain without feare dred great multitude issued bastile fier fought frenchemen thei able withstande puyssaunce fled like shepe wolffe citee greate losse men small artilerie englishemen wer lost two bastyles sixe hundred presones erle suffolke lorde tolbot lorde scale capitaines assembled together cause wer shewed bothe necessary conueniente either leue siege euer deferre till another tyme luckey conueninet intent thei seme either flie bee driuen siege enemy thei determined leaue fortress bastyles assemble plain feld abyde daie abidyng outcommyng battaile enemy conclusion taken accordyngly executed frenchemen weried last bickeryng held heddes durste appere thei set fire lodgynges departed good ordre battail orleaunce next daie whiche viij daie maie erle suffolke ridyng iargeaux cccc englishemen lorde talbot another copany returned meum whiche toune fortified incontinent assauted wan toune lauall castle sore vexyng punishyng tounes men hard harte cancard obstinacie leauyng garrison reculed meum siege thus broken vp tel triumphes wer made citee orleaunce wood spente fiers wyne dronke house songes wer song stretes melody made tauernes roundes daunced large brode place
