virgyns perpetrate done vnmercifull pagan cruel turkes assure eares woulde abhorre hearing eye woulde abyde readynge therfore passe ouerthe byrth prince edwarde sonne kyng hery vi trobleous season xiii daye october ye quene deliuered westmynster fayre sonne christened named edward grew goodely perfight man shall heare whose mother susteyned litle slaunder obloquye commo people saiyng kyng able get chyld sonne many slaunderous woordes quenes dishonor nede rehersed birthe childthe kynges two brother created erles kyng highly auaunced twoo brother mother side edmond created erle richemod father kyng henry vij iasper created erle penbroke whiche died without issue pthe xxxii yere foren warre outward battailesthe xxxii yere brought ende finall conclusion domesticall discord ciuill discencion began renew arise within realme englande care outward hostilitie whiche kept myndes prince realme occupied exercise taken awaye vanished desire souereigntie ambicion preemine ce sodainly sprang farre whole realme diuided twoo seuerall faccions priuate partes kyng henry discended house lancastre claymyng croune kyng henry iiii graund father first aucthor diuision richard duke yorke heire lionell third sonne kyng edward third wresteled game stroue wager reason wherof noble aswell common people partes diuided destruccion many man great ruyne decay region one part studied vanquishe suppresse commo wealth set side iustice equitie clerely exiled duke yorke sore gaped thirsted superioritie preeminence studied diuised practised al way meanes whiche might attein pretesed purpose long hoped desire emongest imaginacios one semed moste necessary purpose whiche yet stirre prouoke malice people duke somerset onely ruled kyng ordered thynges pleasure imaginyng beyng made waie purpose shortly come good conclusion wherfore noble realme complayned lamented detested miserable state daily ruyne noble countrey notyng affirmyng duke somerset roote cause thesame named called vniust man mischeuous persone tyrannicall gouernor coueteous cousailor laiyng also great offence kyng henry saiyng man neither wit stomacke neither mete kyng apt gouerne common wealth therefore duetie noble men great prince onely thinke weightie matter spedely prouide remedy set realme another staye whiche complaintes perswasions duke yorke altered myndes many persones high estate thei liked worlde wauered approued thactes kyng cousail ambicion auarice newly entered harte thei studied sodainly change al thynges turne worlde vpsetdoune duke sawe menes appetite felt well mindes chiefly enterteined two richardes bothe neuelles one salisbury warwicke beyng erle first father second sonne erle salisbury seconde sonne raufe neuell erle westmerlande whose doughter duke yorke maried thesaid richard espoused lady alice child sole heire thomas montacute erle salisbury slain siege orleaunce haue declared whiche woman engedered richard ihon george richarde eldest sonne espoused anne suster heire entire bloud lorde henry beauchamp erle duke warwicke whose right title created named erle warwicke awne progeny parentage richard onely man maruelous quality facundious facions also youth certain practise naturall inclinacion set forward wittie gentle demeanour persones high lowe degre emong sortes people obteined greate loue muche fauor credence whiche thynges daily increased abundant liberalitie plentifull house kepynge rich aucthoritie high parentage reason whiche doynges suche fauor estimacion emongest common people thei iudged hym able thynges without hym nothyng well doen cause aucthoritie shortly fast increased whiche waie bowed waie ranne streame part auaunced side gat superioritie pthe xxxiii yere whe duke yorke fastened chainethe xxxiii yere betwene twoo strong robustious pillers frendes seriously wrought pollitiquely handled busines duke somerset arrested quenes greate chamber sent toure london without great solempnitie kept dol full christmas open parliament wer laied diuerse heinous article high treaso aswell losse normandy late mischance whiche happened guyen kyng time sicke clarendon conueyed london reason wherof finall determinacion proceded greate waightie cause put suspence til next assemble high court parliament duryng whiche tyme kyng either awne mynde quenes procurement caused duke somerset set libertie whiche doyng grew great enuy displeasure betwene king diuerse lordes especiall betwene duke yorke kynges linage aggrauate malice newe begon quene whiche ruled rost bare whole rule caused duke somerset bee preferred capitainship calice onely common also many nobilitie wer greatly greued offended saiyng lost normady would calice duke yorke adherentes perceiuyng neither exhortacion serued accusemet preuailed duke somerset determined reuege querell obtein purpose open warre marciall aduenture lenger slepe waightie businesse beyng march wale associate especiall frendes erles salisbury warwicke lorde cobha assembled army gathered greate power like warlike persones marched toward londo londoner hearyng great multitude commyng toward citie wer greatly astonnied muche abashed euery persone considered awne part either holdyng one side beyng contrariant medelyng part incurre indignacion displeasure king beyng credebly informed greate army commyng toward hym assembled host intendyng mete duke northe parte many frendes citie london cause greate spede small lucke beyng accompanied duke somerset buckyngham therles stafford northumberlande wilshire lorde clifford diuerse baros departed westminster xx daie may toward tonne albons whose doynges duke yorke aduertised espial power costed countreys came thesame toune third daie next ensuyng kyng hearyng approchyng sent hym messenger straightly chargyng commaundyng hym obedient subiect kepe peace enemy naturall countrey murdre slay awne countremen propre nacio kyng henry desirous peace warre sendyng furthe orator one ende toune erle warwicke marchementhe first ba taill albons entered ende toune fiersly set kynges foreward theim shortly dicomfited came duke somerset oth r lordes kynges power whiche fought sore cruell battaill whiche many tall man lost life duke yorke sent euer freshemen succor wery put new men place hurt person whiche onely pollicie kynges armie profligate dispersed chieftaines feld almoste slain brought confusion died vnder signe castle edmond duke somerset long warned eschew castle beside hym lay henry second erle northumberlande hufrey erle stafforde sonne duke buckyngham ihon lorde clifford viijm men humfrey duke buckyngham beyng wounded iames butler erle wilshire ormond seyng fortune loweryng chaunce left kyng poste lone great numbre fled away thend first battaill albons whiche fought thursdaie feast pentecost beyng xxiij daie maie xxxiij yere kynges reigne body noble men buried monastery meane people place edmond duke somerset left behynde hym three sonnes henry edmonde ihon whiche extremitie death toke part line kyng henry victory obteined duke yorke compaignions remembred often tymes declared diuulged abrode onely cause warre thauauncement publique wealth set realme comodious estate better codicion wherfore vsyng lenitie mercy bounteousnes would touche apprehend body kyng henry might bothe haue slain vtterly destroyed consideryng hym ward gouernaunce greate honor due reuerence conueyed hym london westminster whiche place somoned appoynted great assemble thre estate commonly called parliamet whiche began ix day iuly whiche session duke gloucester openly declared true prince bothe kyng realme beside enacted persone either iudge report poynt vntruth duke yorke erles salisbury warwicke commyng warlike maner kyng albons consideryng attempt enterprise onely se kynges persone safegard suer kepyng put aliene hym publique oppressor common wealth whose misgouernaunce life might hasard aucthoritie hang small thred whiche parliament also duke yorke made protector realme therle salisbury appoynted chauncellor greate seale hym deliuered erle warwicke elected office capitain calice territory thesame deuise pollitiquely inuented sequele thereof firste aucthors bothe honorable profitable fortune ship sailed al one way practise whole rule regiment whole realme consisted onely heddes order duke chauncellor warlike affaire businesse rested principally erle warwicke emongest agreed kyng henry still reigne name dignitie neither deede aucthoritie myndyng either depose destroy thesaid kyng least thei might sodainly prouoke stirre fury ire common people theim whiche holines life abundant clemencie simple sort muche fauored highly estemed whiche aucthoritie geuen three persones ruled realme thynges awne discrecions whiche without battaill manslaughter might haue easely depriued thesaied kyng bothe life lande firste thei amoued priuie counsaill suche persones kyng loued quene fauored puttyng place men secte confederacie changyng officer throughout realme disposicion tholde spoken prouerbe toke place new lordes new lawes suche lippes suche lettice yet al rule finde mencion made differryng iustice pollyng bribery openly proued gouerned tyme sauyng thei tooke sainctuary westminster ihon holland duke excester beyng repugnant ordre taken concluded last parliament conueyed hym poumfret castle whiche takyng accompted execrable dampnable offence diuerse spiritualtie especially abbot westminster monkes spot could rede euer moste caste duke fame duryng protectorship counsaill pthe xxxiiii yere vene ous wormethe xxxiiii yere dreadfull dragon called disdain superioritie whiche hath consumed bloud many noble prince destroyed linage many gouernors realmes kyngdomes well pagan christian could abstein fro incensyng harte lorde hanry beauford newly come duchy somerset death duke edmond father whiche battaill sainct albons haue heard rehersed lost life humfrey duke buckyngham whose sonne heire named humfrey erle stafford tasted thesame cuppe forenamed conflict lordes aucthoritie fauoryng folowyng part kyng henry whiche onely bewailed compassion vnsure condicion waueryng estate rule lordeship perceiuyng openly wherunto cloked getlenes subornate fashio duke yorke tended crept vp also thought necessarie conueniet puruey remedy mischief happened wherfore open mouthes fierce corages thei came quene margaret informyng honorable reproche infamy kyng haue one bee protector gouernor hym realme would saie either childe whiche nede norice fede pappe innocent creature whiche muste ruled tutor asserteinyng farther duke yorkes intent vnder colour protectorship sodainly destroy depose kyng least thought therfore willed quicke mischief prouide hasty remedy loued safegard husbande tuicion self quene hauyng wit common sort woman haue consideryng estate husbande condicion self perill onely sonne thought necessary plucke sword aucthoritie handes whiche vnder colour rulyng vnder others desired gouernors superior theimselfes wherefore greate counsaill called grenewiche duke yorke discharged protectorship erle salisbury also dismissed office whiche malicious mutacion emongest nobilitie caused sodain alteracions sedicious commocions spryng arise commonaltie especiall within citee london young marchaunt whiche tyme diuerse citees within countrey italy prohibited magistrate ruler vse weare weapon either inuasiue de en siue chalenged italian chepe side wearyng dagger confutyng hym lawes awne countrey whiche like colericke knaue presumpteous persone disdainfully suche tautes checkes aunswered marchant willing suffre ope reporche publique strete proude villain toke force dagger thesame litle cut croune cracked pate italian greate hast complained mayer offence whiche nexte courte holden guyldhaule consent whole senate sent thoffendor declaryng hym crime commauded hym ward whereof diuerse light marchantes within citee sore abhorryng italian nacion lickyng fat beardes taking accustomed liuyng reason thesaid estraugers imported transported realme suche marchandises commodity necessary thenglishemen onely wer accustomed assembled together greate plumpes force compelled maire deliuer prisoner newgate yet multitude doyng nothing saciate appeased like madde person frantique fooles ranne seuerall house diuerse uenecians lucas florentynes theim spoyled robbed riffled without reason measure maire perceiuyng greate enormitie assebled great numbre substanciall graue citezens whiche without greate bloudshed maymyng sundery persones finally appeased rage caused people departe house beginner temerarious commocion sodain vprore either perswaded frendes fearyng chaunce whiche first facte might sodainly insue departed westminster registered hymself sactuary man quene whiche ruled thynges hearyng greate riote vnlawfull misdemeanour sent duke excester buckyngham accompanied many noble men london commission oyer determiner punishement outragious offence sedicious crime maire citee two duke two chief iustices wer set guyldhaule performance commission began call empanelles thenquiry vse order diuerse light witted lesse brained person ye citie priuely armed ye ringing bow bel thought asse ble together great multitude mid opinio force might take fro kepers prisoner apprehended late comitted robbery riot goynge trial arreigmet great tumult sodain fury discrete sage citizen litle litle appeased finally quenched meane season duke commissioner beynge vntrewly aduertised ye ieopardy life sodaynly departed fro guyldhaule left inquyrie day mayre next day perceiuyng grudge rose called common counsail wherof ye nuber jciiij score od person auctoritie thesame ordeyned wardeins misteries assemble felowship particular hawles wher thei exhort ye obseruacion kynges peace kepyng good order within citie thei espied man either prone redy reyse rumour desirous ye delyueraunce suche accused captiue custodie name shoulde secretly written couertly deliuered lorde mayre pollitique doyng finally ended entragious insolent people appeasyng ye comissioners returned guyldhaule many robber attainted codignely put execucion besyde diuers great fynes rausomes payd set vpon many merchauntes winkyng doynges assentyng thesame pthe xxxv yere french nacion hearyng domesticall diuision ciuile dissencionthe xxxv yere within realme englad much desyring reuenged olde displeasure great damage many yeares born susteined english people appoynted two nauyes inuade depopulate townes porte adioynyng ryuage sea capitayn ye one army willia lord pomiers syr pier bressy great ruler normandy two capitayns opportunitie wether serued sett vp sayles mouthe sayme seuered self one westward eastward syr peter de bressy lusty capitai saylyng cost susseix kent durst take land til arriued downes hauyng certayn espial perfit notice towne sandwyche neither peopled fortefied litle chefe ruler towne thece departed auoyde pestilenciall plage sore infected slew people entered hauen spoyled towne pore stuffe ther founde ryfflyde taken fearinge assemble cotrey shortly returned lord pomiers likewise toke course westward night bret certayn house founay litle pillage retired britayn two aduentures fortunate chaunces coparison great expeses iorneys scant worthe one pore myte single farthyng frenche writer dylate setfurth paynt pene though gotte cresus rich alexander kyngdoms forgettyng many hundred thousande poundes lost yeres precedynge menne beyng indifferent reader historie plainly appereth verily bread better hungry person bread smal gayn desireth recouerie great pleasure therfore french aucthors make litle much yet much thynges considered effect nothyng scottes also degeneratyng fro olde mutabilitie alteryng au cient condicions accustomed perfidie vsuall vntreught entered northuberland kyng iames second beyng person burned small house litle cotages middes greate enterprise hearinge duke yorke marchyng toward great army much payne gayn haste reuerred countrey let v passe ouer tyme outward inuasions returne awn domestical debate dayly discord first forgettyng whyle fore enemy inuaded outwarde partes extreme confynes trobleous realme great conflict attempted betwene lord egremond sonnes erles salisbury fray many person slayn greater number hurt lord egremod great tumult could escape force taken brought kynges cou saill kyng quene shew self al person indifferent adiudged pay erle salysbury great summe money heynous offence done kynges lawes committed gayle newgate within citie london pryson helpe fautors secretly escaped sodaynly departed great vexacion shryfes london tune beyng season craft printyng first inuented citie men germaniewhe moste excellente sciece printinge first inuented great furtheraunce person desiryng knowledge thyrstyng litterature quene margarete whose breath ruled whose worde obeyed aboue kyng counsail within realme englande entendyng destruccion duke yorke frendes deuise thought mete practised nere citie london wel perceyued duke yorke estimacion emonge citezens comunaltie kyng husbad awn person caused kyng make progresse warwyckeshyre health recreacion hawkyng huntynge came citie couetrey diuers way studied priuely bryng quene harte ease long expectate desire death destruccio duke yorke erles salesbury warwycke furniture matter al iii noble sent couetre kynges letter vnder priuie seale place foresayd lordes suspectyng treason puttyng diffidece creature obediently resorted serpent lurked vnder grasse vnder sugered speache hide pestiferous poyson noble men admonished frendes sodaynly departed lyfes threde bene broken mortall fate ensued secrete admonicion good willers whome earthly treasure comparable auoided net narowly escaped snare wherupon securitie tuycion life duke yorke departed wygnore march wale erle salisbury resorted fayre castell middelham northcouncrye erle warwyke sayled town caleys although bodyes noble personage sedicious fraudulet meanes sonder seperated ye haue heard yet harte knitte coupled one neuer forgettyng dayly studyeng bothe reuenged olde dispites malicious atteptes committed imagened also compasse purpose get superioritie ouerhand aboue euilwillers apparant enemy cause letter neuer ceased messenger neuer slept pursses tyme shut enentert ayning olde frendes obteyninge new confederate tyll kyng henry alyes profligate expelled clerely realme shall appere pthe xxxvi haue long troubled readyng diuers diuisionsthe xxxvi yere sedicions operacions great disturbance within realme emong temporaltie litle digresse cotinued purpose declare ouerthwarte iudgement gyuen emong ye father spiritualtie reynold pecocke bishop chichester man somwhat learned better stomacked began moue question priuatly opely uniuersities cocerning annates peterpens iurisorccios aucthorities apperteyning sea romereynold pecocke bishop chichester ab ured paul scrosse onely put forth question declared mynd opinion thesame wherefore cause abiured paules crosse bokes brent self kept awne house duryng naturall lyfe say hys opinion spirituall person god law oughte haue temporall possessios writ saied personal tithe dew god law whatsoeuer cause sort haue declared vsed kyng henry adherentes perceyuing duke yorke lay still made open apparance assemble commocio returned london called great cousaill openly declaring french kyng perceiuing realme england implicate troubled ciuile dissencion mutual discord afeard sende admiral costes ket deuonshyre spoyle townes burne house murder english people cause also animated scottes make rodes incursion confines march realme great losse detriment kynges leage people two na ion set continually greue vex hys realme englande tyll perceiued perfite concord vnfayned amitie concluded knitte together betwene cosanguinitie sorte contrary parte confederacie entent woulde chefe aucthor peace principall styrrer vertuous concorde promised gentelly entertayne duke yorke fautors olde grudge beyng inwardly forgotten also outwardly forgyuen shoulde cause perpetuall loue betwene frendes concord ensue familiaritie emong lordes cocord emong comons whiche vtter enemy inward grudgethe de ise vnitie realme realme great glorie profite deuise al men presente wel taken adiudged honorable kyng profitable realme wherupo diuers graue sad person sent duke yorke great estate realme sin battayle sainct albons neuer met came comoned together commaundynge reasonable cause great consideracions resorte kynges palayce without procrastinacio delay commaundement came london richard duke yorke richarde erle salisbury accopanyed great number meigniall seruautes frendes lest peraduenture lacke ayde myghte haue bene betrapped knowledge warnyd came fro caleys london erle warwycke whose seruituers apparreled rede cote embroudered white ragged stafes iij lordes lodged within citie duke baynardes castel erle salis ury herber erle warwyke place beside graye frier thesame season lesse copany came citie yong duke somerset erle northumberland lord clyfford whose father slayn sainct albos resorted duke excester buckingham lorde egremond moste nobilitie realme duke yorke mate lodged within citie duke somersetthe mortal hatered betwene ii lignages la caster yorke frendes soiourned without templebarre holborne place suburbes sayd iewes disdayned company samaritan lancastrias abhorred familiaritie yorkysh lynage commynge lordes citie kyng quene familie shortly folowed lodged bishoppes palayce london lordes great companyes attendyng one vc vc diuers iiiic persones band continuall watche kept mayre senate london aswell day nyghte preseruacio peace cotinuauce good order lordes lodged within citie kept dayly counsail blacke frier within citie parte soiornyng without ye walles assembled likewise chapter house westminster thus euery part studied awn profitte aduaucement also reueg thynges done foe aduersaries archebisshop canterbury vertuous prelate exhorted applied perswaded pa tie although great wre neither heard regarded coclusion thei brought communicacion long altercacion aswell olde iniuries new displeasure one faccion agaynst committed ye feare outward hostilitie foren inuasion mollified inducate harte outwardly promising forget olde rancor auncient displeasure sealed signed writinges one euer frend together obedient kynge fauorers fredes enemy enemy cocord ioyfull superior embraced common people euer beare burden whe prince controuersie open apparaunce demonstracion godly concorde publique procession appointeda general procession paules kyng peres realme solepnely celebrate within cathedrall church sainct paule citie london day concepcion lady moneth march solempne feast kyng habite royal dyademe hedde kept estate procession went hand hand duke somerset erle salisbury duke excester ye erle warwyke one faccion another sect behynd kyng duke yorke ledde quene great familiaritie men sightes wo worth dissimulacion false flatteryng contenaunce fye doble entendement cloked adulacion whiche hath bene common seruituers palacies imperiall regal pestiferous venime secrete malyce hath ben destruccion many noble man confusion great number trew meanyng faithfull person wiseman saieth w thow hast doble hart meant dis ulacio espied arrow wherwith dissembler wounded thys cloked pageant dis nuling procession hereafter shall playnly declared bodyes ioyned hand hand whose harte farre sonder mouthes louingly smiled whose corages inflamed malice toungues spake lyke suger thoughtes inuenemed dis ulinge person tasted vessel woo wyseman sayde none company vnblotted vndest oied lorous drink dis ulacio cancard worme pestife u onely thys tym reigned englande also dyd muche harme courte frauce ihon duke alason whiche bene prisoner wel enterteyned realme england capitayn generall warres fraunce agaynst englishman highly fauoured great estimacion frenche kynges house suche trusted vsed familiaritie wt al greatly promoted highly exalted accused highe treason enemye kyng traytor countrey alledgyng loge tyme conspired englishman cause agayn recouer duchye normandy wherupo order law suffered death vniustlyihon duke alanson executed frace diuers aucthors affirme whereof one sayeth kynges sekyng treason shall fynde lande denyal prince desyre inuented destruccion innocent naboth well let v leue cloked collusion remayned fraunce returne open dissimulacion appeared englande pthe xxxvii yere fier beyng enclosed strayte placethe xxxvii yere wil force vtter flame course water astricted letted flow brust continuaunce tyme thys cacard crocodryle subtile serpet could log lurke malicious harte venemous stomackes co clusion must according nature appere shewe self apparant cocord intrinsecall discord accordyng nature dissimulacion diuers noble men byrthe stable worde putting honor trought honestie forgat othe brake promisse aduaunced forth banner displeasure flagge malice man may set hat person regard neither awne peculiar profite publique wealth natiue countrey yet passe othe promise brekyng discord pleasant discension delectable long dissimuled amitie certayn fray either chaunce thyng prepensed made vpon yoman erles warwyke seruiteur kynges assaylant sore hurte ye erles led kynges meigniall seruautes seyng felow hurt offendor escaped assembled great number watched erle returnyng counsaill toward barge sodaynly set hym yomen swourdes blacke gard spittes fyre forkes log fight many erles men maymemed wouded helpe frendes toke wherry escaped london whome quene incontinent commaunded apprehended captiue prisoner sent towre lodo bene taken shortly ended dayes made hys end vnhappy fraye sodayn chauche malice arose dayly errible warre euery man trouble person quiet displeasure doen erle quenes good mynd toward hym secrete frendes priuely reueled diligece toke iorney warwicke yorkeshire ounde duke yorke erle salisbury declaryng assaute kynges seruauntes pretensed purpose fraudulent quene whiche complaint made fearyng lest long absence might deposed defrauded capitainship calice greate spede embarked hymself sailed thither daily expectyng lokyng waie duke yorke would take acheuyng long inteded purpose whose departure duke yorke therle salisbury somwhat exasperate moued doble dealyng began grudge murmure affirmyng quene rested nothyng fraude femmyne malice whiche rulyng kyng pleasure wil studied nothyng muche destruccion nobilitie peeres realme long consultacion agreed erle warlike company marche toward kyng complain bothe manifest iniury doen sone also vnkynd breach sworne amitie late agremet whiche suite preuail omit occasion hym geuen reuengyng displeasure hym doen quene sinister counsailors whiche euill vngodly ordered subiectes whole realme deuise made concluded therle salisbury remoued middelham castle acco painied iiii vm men toke waie lancashire shropshire toward london meane season quene whiche assisted ruled duke somerset buckyngha hauyng vigilant iye circumspect brayne pollitique gouernor imagined therle warwicke kindeled fire begon tumult thentent accordyng pretensed purpose set duke yorke siege royall high throne realme whiche cause beyng woman smal wit litle pollecie conceiuyng opinion bote make farther concord league aduersaries hearyng therle salisbury setyng forward acopany armed men archer assebled together greate counsaill puruey remedy imminent mischief multitude often time happeth many heddes many wittes diuerse wer opinion neither people weapon stirred till erle approched doubtyng whether came demaunde warre peace aske iustice reforme wrong otherwise thought wer contrary opinion makyng foundacio argument raisyng people assemble souldiors hym could signifie peace treatie concord except man saie intreatyng fauor naked sworde hande humble submission meke request whiche onely consideracion moued saie force force ought repelled greate power came middest realme necessitie encountered fortune would serue vtterly destroyed sentence toke place without delaie sir iames twichet lorde awdeley seignorie power laie partes erle passe appoynted mete hym geue hym battaill sawe cause place conuenient quene folowed lord audeley accordyng commission assembled aboue xm men knowyng espial whiche waie therle kept approched nere hym faire plain called blore heath within mile toune drayton countrey salope commonly called shropshire erle perceiuing liuery souldiors circumuented likely trapped quenes power determined rather abide aduenture fame honor farther flie losse reproche encamped hymself night side litle broke brode somewhat depe mornyng earely beyng daie tecle caused souldiors shote flightes towarde lorde awdeleyes company whiche laie otherside thesaied water company made signe retraite lorde awdeley remembryng onely trust put also quenes terrible commaundement whiche bryng presence therle salisbury quicke ded blewe vp trumpet set furth voward sodainly passed water therle salisbury whiche knewe slaightes stratagemes pollecies warlike affaire sodainly returned shortly encountred lorde awdeley chief capitaines residewe armie could passe water fight sore dreadfull therle desiryng auyng life aduersaries couetyng destruccion fought sore obteinyng purpose conclusion erles army men desperate aide succor egerly fought thei slewe lorde awdeley capitaines discomfited remnaunt people battail wer slain xxiiiic persos greatest plague lighted chesshire men one halfe shire one one part part whiche numbre wer sir thomas dutton sir ihon dunne sir hugh uenables therles twoo sonnes one called sir ihon neuell sir thomas wer sore wouded whiche soberly iorniyng northcountrey thinkyng repose selfes wer iorney appreheded quenes frendes conueyed chester kepers deliuered shortly el marche men destroyed gayles suche fauor common wale duke yorkes band affinitie thei could suffre wrong doen euil worde spoken hym frendes pthe xxxviii yere battail duke yorke perceiuing destruccion hym frendesthe xxxviii yere intended last conflict apparantly declared also remembryng counsailes priuy intetes wer opened kyng quene whiche studied diuert turne michief infortunitie whiche might chaunce either theim frendes thought mete neither lenger dissimule farther kepe bill vnder wyng therfore coragious harte aswell obteinyng croune tuicio safegard hym frendes determined lenger slepe den diligence set furthe busines auaunce banner therefore sendyng therle salisbury felow compere doynges counsailes fortune long communicacion quenes misgouernaunce without assent thynges pleasure determined raise greate army fine force either die win purpose saie men assembled frendes wer sent puissaunt armie gathered bothe northren men welshemen whiche good ordre came march wale adioynyng shropshire thei determined either abide enemy mete thei marched forward king ignorant assemble yet vnaduertised duke intet wherfore resist mischief beginnyng caused commissios made sent euery part realme suspected either haue assured frendes indifferet fauorers men money reason whiche commaundemet great numbre assembled many loue thei bare kyng feare thei quene whose countenaunce w fearfull whose looke terrible al men toke small displeasure frounyng vndoyng indignacion death king acco panied duke somerset excester line lancastre determined clerely set ont duke yorke confederate force either vtterly vanquish pollecy attrap bryng confusion wherupon hope good lucke kyng army long marchyng came nere duke yorke strongly incamped alitle toune ludlow nere adioynyng confines wale long come trustie frende richard erle warwicke greate numbre expert men marciall feates brought hym calice wherof twoo menne approued pollecye warres normandy guyen one called andrew trowlop iho blount army thus liyng one conspect vewe studied meanes pollecies take aduauntage eche lesse ieoperdye one might set duke perceiuyng reason experte capitaines waye howe might easely dampnifie discomfite enemy though lenger slepe page duplicate page duplicate purpose manfully geue onset secrete frendes capitaines determined next mornyng early dreadfull blastes terrible trompet begin battail set kyng army wer redy aray deuise succeded nothing imaginacion proceded effect andrewe trolop calicians whiche wer men great knowledge muche experiece liued kynges wage yeres perceiuyng thei fight souereigne lorde hymself whose frend thei estemed tyme therle warwicke euer haue taken ruputed enemy destroyer dedde night daie battaill secretly departed duke campe submitted themselfes kyng admonishyng hym thynges prepared deuised losse destruccion auncient capitaines wer welcome kyng ioyously receiued referre men whiche haue relief distresse haua sodain good chaunce thei thinke least vpon duke yorke aduertised departyng maruaill though sens wer moued wittes disturbed man sodainly riseth traunse woteth sai first considered power aucthoritie kyng sawe andrewe troloppe frend sodainly transformed image extreme enemy whose force pollecie asmuche discoforted hym truste whiche put hym incouraged wherfore euidently perceiuyng counsaill purpose forenamed andrew reueled disclosed thought better hym departe suretie abide chaunce mutable fortune whiche turneth whiele wil pleasure wherupon yonger sonne edmond erle rutland secretly departed wale passed ireland al ioy honor gladly receiued therle march sonne heire apparant forsaid duke accompanied therles salisbury warwicke sir ihon wenlocke stale away thesame night came deuonshire wher meanes ihon dinham esquire whiche high treasurer england time kyng henry vij thei bought ship whiche cost cx markes exmouth sailed gernsay cam calice wer let posterne ioyfully welcomed frendes next daie mornyng kyng beyng aduertised departyng duke yorke partaker caused al horssemen folowe theim euery passage thei wer neither seen espied thei folowed made reporte kyng perceiuyng lordes escaped pardoned poore souldiours sauyng certain ryng leader whereof punished fined hanged quartered remoued ludlowe dispatched hoste spoyled toune castle sent duches yorke two yonger sonnes kept ward duches buckyngham suster continued certain space proclaimed lordes traytors hym enemy countrey rebelles croune confiscatyng al landes goodes office committyng gouernaunce northe partes erle northumberlande lorde clifford trustie moste faithfull frendes toune calice made capitain henry newe duke somerset olde husbande man saieth hastie sowyng often time deceiueth late neuer wel proueth businesse protractyng tyme onely hurted harmed kyng sequele beginnyng dispossessed aduersaries refuge holde doubte either tamed vanquished theim litle labour small daunger duke somerset reioysyng muche newe office elected diuerse hardy valiaunt souldiours greate pompe sailed toward calice thought surely haue entered hauen artillarie shot fiersely bothe toune risebancke sufferyng sore repulse land whitsandbay sent woorde capitaines toune receiue hym kynges lieuetenaunt shewed letter patentes neither writyng regarded looked necessitie resorted castle guysnes daily skirmishyng garrison calice losse gain arriuall aforesaied diuerse mariner owyng good therle warwicke young duke conueyed shippes hauen calice theim diuerse erle warwickes enemy ianyn fendill ihon felowe diuerse presented theim thesaied erle whiche incontinent caused heddes bee striken daily conflicte still continuyng betwene lordes whiche soiorned calice duke somerset liyng guysnes small numbre commonaltie daily resorted erle marche confederate reason whereof though thei daily lost people many slain yet numbre restored gappe euer filled whiche continuall losse daily detriment duke somerset yet like valiaunt prince nothyng lesse myndyng lacke ayde expelled great office renoumed aucthoritie whiche kyng hym geuen partes beyonde sea sent letter kyng messenger quene desiryng aide succor defence querell lawfull assistence postes vnheard requestes vnprouided without delay richard lorde riuers sir anthony wooduile valiaunt sonne whiche lorde scale accompanied foure hundred warlike persones appoynted passe sea coadiutors duke somerset marciall capitaynes endeuouryng theim selfes poynt whiche thei wer assigned came porte sandwyche abode wynde wether whiche obeyeth neither kyng serueth emperoure erles marche warwicke beyng calice knowledge doynges secrete conuenticles wherfore anticipate preuent duke purpose thei sent ihon dinham valiaunt esquire small numbre men multitude couragious harte toune sandwyche whiche sodainly entered thesame tooke lorde riuers bedde sonne also robbyng house spoylyng shippes great rich marchandise beside thei tooke principall shippes kynges nauie liyng port well furnished ordinaunce artillarie without fauour mariner whiche fauoured one part although ihon dinham capitain lordes parte sore hurte maymed legge reason wherof euer halted somewhat limped yet courage pollecy much vanquished enemy brought shippes royall laded preye prisoner toune calice theim presented erle marche knowyng lorde riuers doughter bee erles wife whiche husbande leuyng thinkyng father sake destroyed knowe secretes god without hym declare chaunce shall insue bootie gotten good lucke obteined diuerse beste shippes taken hauen sandwiche wer well vitailed manned theim erle warwicke transfreted sayled irelande common duke yorke greate affayres businesse wether faire wynd fauorable erles purpose within lesse xxx day passed repassed calice deuelyne asserteined erles marche salisbury duke yorkes deuise intent bothe entre realme englande erle warwicke come short home tel tidynges duke excester whiche beyng admirall sea laye weste countrey stoppe erles passage might haue awne capitaines nauy murmured hym mariner dispraised disdayned hym gladde heare erle warwickes good successe whiche occasion neither would durst one medle coupe erles nauie dvryng tyme kyng called parliament citee couentre whiche duke yorke confederate attaynted high treason goodes landes confiscat forfeted prohibite landyng partes hauen tounes watched sea costes garnished bekens sir simon mondford great crew appoynted kepe dounes fiue porte menne passyng flaunders vpon payne death prohibited passe calice lest lordes borow money prest marchantes staple xviiim late great displeasure ye kyng carasey quene lordes lyeg caleys wer ignorant doynges prouisions dayly asserteyned done kynges priuie chamber wherfore firste sent company sandwyche conquered towne apprehended syr symon moutford brought mate hauen caleys incontinet xii chefe felowes lost heddes sandes rysebanke kynges nauye gayned capitayns arriual sea take destroied lordes lyenge caleys hoping frendes within realme determined passe sea land england thei put castel towne caleys sure safe custodye onely vse passed sea landed sandwych passyng kent came lord cobham ihon guldefford william peche robert horne many gentelmen conueyed citie london fame landyng knowen gentelmen repaired yome resorted southpartes realme vpon rumor thomas lord scale man great fauour kyng quene accompanyed erle kendale gascoyn lord louel resorted london great company armed men declaring mayre citie repayre onely defend kepe citie spoyle robbery traytors kyng crediblie enformed woulde thither make accesse mayre aunswered wel knew awne othe bounden duety toward souereign lord prince neded neither prompter yet coadiutor either defend gouerne citie comitted charge aunswere lord scale associate litle displeased entered towre london dayly new inuentions doyng displeasure domages citezens citie whome sore suspected rather fauour hate erles marche warwycke band affinitie whiche erles great army came shortly london mayre citezens ioyously receyued whome resorted archebishop canterbury bishop london ely excester many prelate religious person lordes nothyng slackyng purpose came dayly consulted assembled together house frier franciscane within citie longe debatinge secrete consultacion hadde agreed whoole puy sa nce shoulde marche forwarde towarde kynge determining eith r force fayre meanes bring purpose conclusion whe counsaill dissolued erles march warwycke thomas lord faucobridge hery lord borchier called erle eue great number men came kent essex surrey sussex number writer afferme xxvm person departed london toward kyng lyeng couentre called quenes secret arbor leuyng behynd kepe londoner fidelitie reuertyng parte erle salisbury lord cobham syr ihon wenlocke lord cobha certayn alderman citie kept west side agaynst towre syr ihon wenlocke vigilantly watched east parte towarde sainct katherynes person either could issue entre great displeasure lord scale company whiche dayly shote ordenaunce likewise great ordinaunce shott hurt pleasure partes kyng ignorat doynges assembled great army accompanied duke somerset lately come guysnes duke buckyngham diuers great lordes parte faccio came towne northampton quene encouraged frendes promised great rewardes helper kyng studied nothing peace quyet solitarie life ye kinges host assembled quene perceyued power able matche force aduersaries caused army issue towne passe ryuer nene newe felde betwene harsyngton sandifford capitaynes strongely emparked selfes high bankes depe trench erle marche beyng lusty floure coragious yought lyenge betwene towceter northampton determined set kynges army without longer protractyng tyme nighte season remoued campe toward northampton marchyng forward set hys men good order battayl wherof vawegard coducted erle warwycke either strenght stealth maugre lord beamond kept strayt goyng toward kynges campe entered freshly began battayle aboute vij clocke ix daye iulij whome folowed erle marche baner father fight contynued doutfull iudgemente till houre nyne tyme kynges army profligat discomfited thesame slayn drouned ryuer lesse xm talle englishme kyng hym self left alone disconsolate taken apprehended man borne predestinate troble misery calamitie battayl slayn humfrey duke buckyngham ihon talbot erle shrewesbury valeant person de generating fro noble parent thomas lord egremond ihon viscont beaumond syr william lucy made great hast come parte fight first approche strike hed wt axe diuers getilme slayn ciuile battail whose name remembred published aucthor haue redde beside dead person many taken prisoner left horse disceded fight fote duke somerset narowly escaped fled quene prince edward bishoprycke durhame whiche place determined congregate gather new armye power hoope recouery agreed flye scotland expect better lucke happier chaunce fortune fauour erles beyng victorious blody battayle conueyed kyng night towne northampton next day great solempnitie small comfort set forward king easy iorneys brought london xvi day iulij fayntly receyue febly welcomed lodged bishop palace whose commyng citie towre london deliuered erle marche vpon certayn composicion lord scale suspectyng sequele deliuery thesame toke wherry priuily entendyng haue fled quene espyed diuers waterme belongyng erle warwycke whiche wayted forthcommyng thamse sodaynly take shortly slayne many dartes dagger body left blody naked gate clyncke buried church adioynyng diuers person apprehended endited treason whero pardoned executed thomas thorpe second baro thexchequer great frend house lancaster extreme enemie familie yorke taken disguysed monkes apparell shauen croune brought erle warwycke sent hym towre london long remayned duryng troble parliament somoned begyn westmynster moneth october next folowyng tyme richarde duke yorke beyng irelad swyft currers flieng postes aduertised f great victorie gayned hys parte feld northhampton also knew kynge case kepte ordered pleasure wil wherfore losyng tyme uggyng one houre sayled deuelyne chester small company longe iourneys came citie london entered friday next feast sainct edwa de confessor swourd borne naked toke lodgynge kynges awne palayce wherupon comon people babbeled kyng kyng henry loger reigne durynge tyme parliamente duke yorke bolde contenaunce entered chamber peres sat downe trone royall vnder clothe estate kynges peculiar seate presence aswel nobilitie spiritualtie pause made saide wordes effect singuler good lordesthe duke yorkes oration made lor er parliament indifferet fre de whose power aucthoritie consisteth peyse stay noble realme england aswell tyme christe sauiour redemer toke vpon fraile fleshe humayn nature euer synce hath ben realme renoumed kingdom famous region aswell emongest paganes christian greatly bruted beloued feared lesse requyre frendly exhort beyng together louers god frendes countrey neither yet iudge suspect either enflamed ambycio desirous high rule couetous soueraigntie haue presumed enter vnder trone attempted set princely chayer seage royalle except heare cause digest wel truthe without two poyntes knowen vnderstanded iudgementes may voyde cogitacions friuolous therfore declare publysh sit place iustice lawfully belongyng rest whome chayre righte apperteineth requireth fauor parcialitie bearyng egall right frendly indifferencie trew administracion iustice beyng partye greued complaynaut minister self medecine helpe experte lech chyrurgians may except faithfull ayders also trew counsaylors yet noble realme naturall countrey shall neuer vnbuckeled quotidia feuer except principall physician trew trusty appotecaries consult together makyng pocion trye clene pure stuffe fro old corrupt putrified dregges vndoutedly rote botome long festured cakar yet extirpat feble foudacion fallible buildyng yet espied hath bene dayly de uccion nobilitie quotidian confusion ye pore communaltie realme kyngdom know know high mightie prince kynge richarde ii trew indubita e heyre valeant conquerour renoumed prince kynge edwarde iij sonne heyre hardy knyght couragious capitayn edward prynce wale duke acquitayn cornewall eldest sonne said kyng edward iii kyng onely dead also men reputed taken ye trew infallible heyre wy pollitique prince kyng henry iij sonne heyre kyng edward second sonne heyre kyng edward first heyre firste begotten sonne sayd noble vertuous prince kyng hery iii kyng richard name second lawfully iustly possessed croune diademe realme region tyll henry derby duke lancaster herdford sonne ihon duke lancaster fourth begotten sonne sayd kyng edward iij yonger brother noble auncestor lyonel duke clarence iii begotten sonne sayd kyng edward force violence contrary duety allegiauce also homage done sworne raysed warre battayle caste flynt northwales agaynst sayd kyng richard apprehended imprisoned within towre lodo duryng whose life captiuitie wrongfully vsurped entruded vpon royall power high estate realme region takyng ye name stile aucthoritie kyng gouernor thesame therewith satisfied contented compassed accomplished death destruccion hys naturall prince worthy souereigne lord common homicyde bocherly murder regicide destroyer kyng whose piteous death execrable murder ala harte pantethe remember abhominable facte right title croune superiorite realme lawfully reuerted returned rogier mortimer erle marche sonne heyre lady philippe onely chyld aboue rehersed lyonel duke clarece rogiers doughter called anne derest welbeloued mother trew lyneall heyre discent iustely agayn say yet truly deny remember title myne put trew heyre croune dede right withholden clayme good haue iustice surely lerned men great science litterature saye affirme lyneall discent vsurped possession nothynge preuayle continuall clayme lawfully made openly published auoyding scruple ambiguitie edmond erle marche welbeloued vncle tyme firste vsurpar dede right called kyng hery iiij cosyns erle northhumberlad lord percy beyng captiuitie owen glendore rebell wale made title righteous clayme destruccion noble person likewise derest lord father farre setfurth right title loste life worldly ioy towne southampton power indifferent iustice sythe whose death commyng full age haue neuer desisted pursew title requyre right meanes synister counsaill iniust detencion neither obteyne recouer fyne force compelled vse power stede prayer force stede request sayde priuate emolumet peculiar profite restore peace loue quietnes naturall regio euer sythe fyrste vngodly vsurpacion forenamed henry vntruely called kyng henry iiij hath ben clerely banished thesame iniustly exiled murder manslaughtes hath bene perpetrated committed within thys countrey sythe beginnyng vngracious vsurpacion number noble men haue ben slayne destroyed executed sith vnfortunate day manyfest iniquitie hath ben openly borne maynteyned euery countrey citie sith dolefull death kyng richard person darre sue right dai cotrary counsailors beare swyng rule roste wel wel although almighty god slackely slowely procede punishment synners yet differryng scorge recompensed ye greater payn rod striketh yea oftentymes leaueth malefactor apparantly vnpunished scorgeth bloud punisheth heyres worldly aduersitie suche mercy pleaseth shew sharpe whyp lyst strike although henry lancaster erle derby toke vpon scepter croune wrongfully bare name stile king much tyckeled myne uncle erle marche yt time beyng within age yet neuer suerty self enioyed perfyt quietnes either mynd body surely corrupte conscience feleth neuer reste loketh swourd vengeaunce discend stryke sonne also called kyng henry v obteyned notable victory immortall prayses noble actes done realme fraunce yet god offence vntrew parente sodaynly touched vnbodiynge soule flower yought glory conquest although fayre sonne yong apparat heyre yet orphan one preacher say god threatened send punishmet vnruely vngracious people saiyng hys prophet esay shal gyue chyldren prince enfantes without wysedom shall haue gouernaunce prophet lyed note thinges order henry v whose fame iustly reproue deface succeded sonne whome haue called natural prince obeyed heyre whose tyme wrongfull reigne require diligently cosider great tormentes affliccions god hath whypped scorged miserable isle yea many scourge plague nacion egyptian onely except euer tormented afflicted withall speake rebellious murder oppressios late ben done exercised emong v declare manifest croune glorie realme negligence silly man vnwise counsaill minished defaced dishonored normandy whiche father gat regayned conquered agayn insolencie coueteous counsail whole duchye acquitayn iic od yeres peaceable possessed kynges realme one yere litle gotten ower handes seignorie speake angeow mayne losse isle frauce riche citie parys ala hart sobbeth myne eye water toungue foltereth either speake thinke loss misfortune natiue coutrey hath late susteined preacher say euill gotten gooddes long continue vsurped power hath prosperous successe molest rehersyng calamitie whiche fell emogest israelite athalia slew bloud royal except litle ioas tyranously vsurped croune troble cotinual warre happened emoge romaine iulius cesar toke vpon hym without lawe aucthoritie name stile emperor put remembrance awne nacion mischiefe strife misery succeded realme iniurious vsurpacions herrald sonne godwyn erle kent stephe bloys erle bulleyn one beyng cause conquest realme occasion infinite trobles domesticall discencion within thesame yet vexacions scorges shadowe counterfeit light comparison great calamity misery whiche present haue seen experimented yet middes affliccio make end thesame god ineffable goodnes lookyng countrey iyes pitie aspect mercie hath sent truth restore decayed kyngdo auncient fame old renoume whiche open parliament accordyng iust true title haue take possession royall throne puttyng diffidence firme hope god grace diuine ayde assistence peeres realme shall decore maintein thesame glory hym honor bloud publique wealth aswell present poore common subiectes kyngdom regiment duke thus ended oracion lordes sat still like image grauen wall dome god neither whisperyng spekyng though mouthes sowed vp duke perceiuyng none aunswer made declared purpose well content sobre silence taciturnitie aduised well digest pondre effect oracion saiyng neither fully displeased pleased departed lodgyng kynges palace vvhile thus declaryng title chambre peres happened straunge chaunce tyme emongest comons nether house assembled croune whiche hang middell thesame garnishe branche set lightes vpon without touche creature rigor wynd sodainly fell doune thesame tyme also fell doune croune whiche stode top castle douer signe prognosticacion croune realme bee diuided changed one line another iudgement comon people whiche wer neither god priuitie yet priuie counsaill yet thei wil say opinion whosoeuer saie nay lordes realme forgat duke demaunde long protracted tyme se good ende waightie cause wherefore diuerse lordes aswell spiritual temporall many graue sage persones commonaltie daily assembled blacke frier place treate common matter beyng smal importaunce duryng whiche tyme duke yorke although kyng wer lodged palace westminster yet praier intercession would visite se kyng till perfit conclusion wer taken greate waightie purpose saiyng affirmyng subiect man onely god lord superior none wil alitle space leue lordes consultyng together speake outward attemptes foren doynges ciuill discension within realme englande muche animate incorage iames secod name kyng scottes make warre englishe nacion partly displeasure conceiued death edmond duke somerset mother brother partly shew hymself emogest people bothe valiaunt coragious kyng iames irste rule began entre suspicion william erle douglas man great kynne power euer mistrustyng nothyng desired depriue hym aucthoritie vsurpe thesame cancard suspicion rooted kynges harte sodainly branched muche kyng sendyng erle whiche trustyng awne innocencie humbly came pres nce caused hym shamefully slain murdered whiche iniury twoo brother archibald erle murrey hugh erle ormount alitle pricked incoraged erles angus morthon beeyng one line surname made open warre thesaied kyng iames inconclusio preuailed suppressed great power douglass thynkyng hymself kyng without either peere fere assembled greate army entered march northumberlande besieged castle roxborough caused newe bombarde lately cast flaunders called lion diuerse peces shot castle wherof one beyng weake slender brake peces one fragmentes slewe kyngkyng iames scotlande layne pece gone standyng emongest greate company people wounded erle angus scottes dismaied death kyng seyng castle easy wonne manfully assauted muche pain gat thesame long defended till richard duke gloucester conquered destroyed kyng iames quene mary wife left three sonnes iames whiche succeded hym alexander duke albany ihon young kyng iames put vnder tuicion iames kenede bishoppe sainct andrewes whiche duryng noneage ruled realme kynges greate honor awne profite peculier gaine made sumpteous house buylded college whiche young pupill kyng iames neither could hable abovte season duryng vnnaturall cotrouersy within realme englande charles frenche kyng whiche trouble calamitie gat hym perpetual name emongest nacion aboue sterres exalted ended poynt fatall fine whiche prince youth neuer regarded wanton pastyme la ous dalliauce wittes set industrie onely applied recouer paternall patrimony princely inheritaunce plainly mirror menne maie perceiue pain often profiteth labor commoly auaileth idlenesse sildome dalliaunce neuer charles succeded kyng lewes name xi whose dooynges shal heare shal studie marueill straungenes demeanour craftie pollecie secrete compass returne great counsaill lordes celebrate lodo duke yorkes claime pthe xxxix yerethe xxxix yere long argumentes made deliberate cosultacio emong peeres prelate common realme vpon vigile sainctes condescended agreed three estate muche kyng henry taken kyng space xxxviij yeres inioye name title kyng haue possession realme duryng life naturall either died resigned feted thesame infringyng poynt concorde saied croune aucthoritie royal immediatly bee diuoluted duke yorke liued el next heire line linage duke thensefurtharticles agrement betwene kyng henry vi richarde duke york protector regent lande prouided allwaie kyng closely apertly studie go aboute breake alter agrement compesse imagine death destruccion saiede duke bloud forfet croun duke yorke take article many onely written sealed sworne twoo party also wer enacted high court parliament ioye whereof kynge hauyng company thesaied duke rode cathedrall churche sainct paule within citee lo daie sainctes went solepnely diademe hed procession lodged good space bishoppes palace nere thesaied churche vpon saturdaie next insuyng richard duke yorke sounde trumpet solempnely proclaimed heire apparat croune englande protector realme parliamet kept couentre last yere declared deuilishe counsaill onely celebrate destruccio nobilitie lawfull parliament thei whiche wer returned wer neuer elected accordyng dew ordre lawe secretly named theim whiche desired destruccion auauncement publique wealthe common profite agrementes wer doen enacted kyng dissolued parliament whiche laste parliamente euer ended suche pleasure almightie god king henry beeyng good verteous manne whiche tasted innumerable aduersities calamity worlde depriued terrestrial croune recompensed heauenly garland ioyfull place surely per ite good man though plagued thousande displeasure cannot blessed haue good soule toward god duke yorke well knowyng quene would spurne impugne conclusion agreed taken parliament caused sonne sent kyng beyng manly woman vsyng rule ruled therto counsailed duke excester somerset onely denied come also assembled together great army intendng take kyng fine force lordes handes set theim new skoole protector liyng londo hauyng perfite knowledge doynges assigned duke norffolke erle warwicke trustie frendes kyng therles salisbury rutlande conuenient company departed london second daie decembre northward sent erle marche eldest sonne folowe hym power duke small iorneis came castle sandall beside wakefelde christmas eue began assemble tenauntes frendes quene beyng thereof asserteined determined couple hym power small ayde come hauyng company prince sonne duke excester somerset erle deuonshire lorde clifford lorde rosse effecte lordes northe parte eightene thousande men write twentie twoo thousande marched yorke wakefelde bad base duke euen castle hauyng hym fully fiue thousande persones determined intontinent issue fight enemy though sir dauy halle old sernaunt chief counsailer auised hym kepe castle defende thesame smal numbre till sonne erle marche wer come power marchemen welshe souldiours yet would counsailed great fury saied dauy dauy hast thou loued long wouldest haue dishonored thou neuer sawest kepe fortres regent normandy dolphyn hymself puissaunce came besiege like man like birde included cage issued fought myne enemy losse euer thanke god honor haue kepte self within walles feare great strong prince hid face man liuyng wouldest thou dread scoldyng woman whose weapon onely toungue nayles incarcerate self shut gate al men might woundre creature maie report dishonor woman hath made dastarst man euer daie could yet proue coward surely mind rather die honor liue shame honor commeth fame dishonor riseth infamy great numbre shall appall spirites incorage theim surely thinke haue many frendes enemy whiche ioynyng wil either flie take part therfore auaunce banner name god sainct george surely wil fight though fight lone therle salisbury frendes seing corage resolued theselfes opinion ordered men set furth warlike fashion moste aduauntage duke somerset quenes part knowyng perfitly duke gat victory day wer minished liuynges left bare like men quickened exasperate safegard life defence goodes determined abide chaunce espie moste aduauntage appointed lorde clifford lye one stale erle wilshire thei theimselfes kept mayne battaill duke yorke people discended doune hill good ordre array suffered passe foreward toward mayne battaill plain ground betwene castle toune wakefeldethe battaill wakefeld enuironed euery side like fishe net deere buckestall manfully fightyng within halfe houre slain dedthe duke yorke lain whole army discomfited hym died trusty fredes two bastard vncles sir ihon sir hugh mortimer sir dauy halle chief cou sailor sir hugh hastynges sir thomas neuel william thomas aparre bothe brother twoo thousande eight hundred wherof many wer young gentleman heires greate parentage southe parte whose linage reuenged deathes within foure monethes next immediatly insuyng conflicte wounded taken prisoner richarde erle salisbury sir richard lymbrike raufe stanley iho harow capitain hauson diuerse battaill fightyng prieste called sir robert aspall chappelain schole master yong erle rutland ii sonne aboue named duke yorke scace age xii yeres faire getlema maydenlike person perceiuyng flight sauegard ariyng bothe master secretly conueyed therle felde lord cliffordes bande toward towne coulde enter house sayd lord clifford espied folowed taken reson apparell demaunded yog gentelman dismaied word speake kneled knee imploryng mercy desiryng grace holding vp hades making dolorous countinance speache gone feare saue sayde chappelein prince sonne peraduenture may good hereafter word lord clifford marked sayde god blode thy father slew myne wil thy kyn woord stacke erle ye hart dagger bad chappeleyn bere erles mother brother worde done sayde acte lord clyfford accompted tyraunt gentelman propertie lyon furious vnreasonable beaste cruell withstande hym gentle prostrate humiliate selfes yet cruell clifforde deadly bloudsupper content homicyde chyldkillyng came place wher dead corp duke yorke lay caused head stryken set croune paper fixed pole presented quene lyeng farre farre felde great despite much derision saiyng madame warre done kinges raunsome present much ioy great reioysing many laughed sore lamented quene self sonne many glad me death knowing awne nere hande lord clifford surely man nature frayle thinges passed sone forgotten mischiefes come forsene victory ye quene parte obteyned caused erle salisbury prisoner bee sente pomfret bee behedded sent heddes duke head yorke set vpon pole ouer gate citie yorke despite lignage whose chyldren shortly reuenged father querell quenes extreme perdicion vtter vndoynge husband sonne ende valeant lord rychard plantagenet duke yorke fyne ensued much hardines erle marche commonly called death father dede right duke yorke lyeng glocester heryng death noble father louyng brother trusty frendes wonderfully amased cofort giue faithful louers assured alyes remoued shrewsbury townes vpon ryuer seuerne declaryng murder father ieopardye hym selfe vnstable state ruyne realme people march wale aboue measure fauored lynage lord mortimer gladly offered ayd assistence either instantly requyred hartely desired soo puyssant army number xxiijm redy go agaynst quene murderer father settyng forward newes brought iaspar erle penbroke halfe brother kyng hery iames butler erle ormond wylshyre assembled together great number welshe irysh people sodainly surprise take frendes captiue conuey quene duke yorke called erle marche somwhat spurred quickened noueltyes retired backe mett enemy faire playne nere mortimer crosse farre herford east candelmas day mornyng whiche time sunne write appered erle march like iii sunnes sodainly ioined al together one vpo sight therof toke suche courage fiercely set enemy shortly discofited cause men imagined gaue sunne full brightnes cognisauce badge enemy lefte dead ground iiim viiic erles penbroke wilshyre fled syr owen tewther father sayd erle penbroke owen maried kyng henry mother haue heard dauid floyde morgan ap reuther diuers take behedded citie herford season ye quene greatly encouraged victory obteined late wakefeld partly duke yorke vtter enemy ryd worlde partly perceyued lordes north countrey adhere cleue parte factio wherfore great multitude northre people marched toward london whose approche londoner nothing glad affirmed brought rusty company spoile robbe citie saide would reuenged suche fauored duke yorke pore citezes hangyng betwene water fyre much amased ye magistrate gouernors caused great watch kept good order obserued quene still came forwarde northre people entendyng subuerte defaict conclusion agreme te enacted assented last parliamet long iorney came town sainct albons wherof duke northfolke ye erle warwycke duke yorke lefte gouerne kyng absence beyng aduertised assent ye kyng gathered together great hoste set forward towarde saincte albons hauyng kyng company head chefetayn warre mynding differre time farther vpon shrouetuesday early morning set vpon enemy fortune day fauored quene parte preuayled duke erle discomfited fled leauing king accompanied lord bonuile syr thomas kyriell kent whiche vpon assuraunce promise taried still fled trust deceiued victorie obteyned kynge broughte quene two deteyned prisoner continued till kynges departyng towne battayl slayn xxiiic men aboue whome noble man remebred saue syr ihon gray thesame day made knight xii ye village colney happy quene two battayls vnfortunate kyng enterprise person presente ther victory fled euer parte comoly subdued vanqueshed whe quene margaret thus wel sped first caused kyng dubbe prince edward sonne knyght xxx person morning fought quenes side parte sent mayre london commaundinge without delay sende certain carte laded lenten victayle refreashing army mayre incontinent made prouisio laded carte sent toward quene moueable co mo fauored quenes parte stopped ye carte crepulgate boldely sayde enemy came spoyle robbe citizen neither releued victayled notwithstanding gentell aduertisement gyuen mischefes whiche might ensue doynges yet remayned still one obstinate mynd wilfull permittinge cariages passe go forward cotrouersie diuers northen horseme came robbed suburbes citie would haue entered crepulgate thei commoner repulsed beten backe iii slayn wherupon mayre sent recorder kynges counsaill barne excuse matter duches bedford lady scale diuers sad father spiritualtie went quene mollifie rancore asswage melacolie conceiued citie humble request quene counsail appointed certayn lordes knyghtes iiic talle person ryde citie ther vewe se demeanoure disposicion people diuers alderman appointed mete barnet conuey london soeuer man purposeth god disposeth deuises shortly trasmuted another forme trew report brought onely citie also quene erle marche vanqueshed erles penbroke wilshyre erle warwycke whome rested chefe trust faction last conflict saincte albons mete sayd erle marche chippyng norton cottesood power cominge toward london trew tale turned quenes purpose altered long deuised entente muche litle trustinge essex lesse kent london least husband sonne departed sainct albons northcountrey roote foundacion ayde refuge onely consisted daye departyng caused heddes lord bonuile syr thomas kyriel cut presence sonne cotrary mynd promise husbad emogest men warre faith othe syldome perfourmed duches yorke seyng husband sonne slayne knowyng succede eldest sonnes chaunce sent ii yonger sonnes george richard ouer sea citie wtrechte almayn philippe duke bourgoyne wel receyued fested thei remayned till brother edwarde obteyned realme gotte regiment duringe time diuers merchantes mistrusting mutacion world fled realme emogest one philippe malpas man greate rich sayling flaunders taken ihon columme french man payed iiiim markes raunsone erles marche warwycke hauyng perfite knowledge kyng quene adherentes departed sainct albons determined first ryde london chefe key common spectacle whole realme thinking assure self east west parte kingdome king henry faction nesteled stregthed hun alyes north region boreal plage meaninge haue buckelar swourd southerne byl coteruayle northren ba ard two great lordes resoluinge self vpon purpose accompanied great number men warre entered citie london first weke let declare kentishmen resorted people essex swarmed county adioyning londo dayly repaired se ayd comfort lustly prince flower chiualry whome hope ioy trust quietnes onely consisted thys wise prudent noble man perceiuing parte realme frendly adherent mynoing take time time serued called great counsaill lordes spirituall temporall repeted title right realme dignitie royall rehersing article agrement onely concluded betwene kyng henry noble father richard duke yorke theyr writinges signed sealed also corroborated cofirmed aucthoritie high court parliament breach whereof neither forgat omitted vndeclared lordes considered weyghed title declaracion thei determined authoritie sayd counsaill much kyng henry contrary othe honor agrement violated intringed order taken enacted last parliament also insufficient rule realme inutile common wealth publique profite pore people therfore aforesayd authoritie depriued detected kyngly honor regall souereigntie incontinent edward erle marche sonne heyre richard duke yorke lordes sayd counsaill embled named elected admitted kyng gouernour realme day people erles parte beyng muster sain ihons felde great number substanciall citezens assembled behold order sodaynly lord fawcobridge toke muster wisely declared multitude offence breach late agremente done perpetrated kyng hery vi demaunded people whether thei woulde haue sayd kyng henry rule reigne lenger ouer whome whole voyce aunswered nay nay asked thei would ser e loue obey erle march earthly prince souereign lord questio aunswered yea yea crieng king edward many great showtes clappyng handes lordes shortly aduertised louyng consent common franckely frely fre wil giuen wherupon incontinent conueniet number substanciall common repaired baynardes castel making iust trew report erle eleccion admission louyng assent faithfull common erle long pausynge first thanked god great grace benefite declared shewed lordes common also harty fauour assured fidelitie notwithstanding like wise prince alledged insufficiencie greate roome weyghty burden lacke knowledge want experiece diuers quality gouernour apperteyninge yet conclusion beynge perswaded archebishop caterbury bishop excester lordes beyng present graunted peticion toke vpo charge vpon next day beyng iiii day marche kyng rode church sainct paule offered te deum song great solempnitie conueyed westmynster set hawle scopter royall hand al people great number assembled title clayme croune england declared ii maner wayes firste sonne heyre duke richard father right enheritor thesame second aucthoritie parliament forfeiture committed kyng henry wherupo agayne demaunded common would admitte take sayd erle prince souereigne lord al one voice cried yea yea agremet cocluded entered westmynster church vnder canapy solepne processionkyng edward iiii proclamed king englande kyng offered homage taken al noble present returned water london lodged bishop palace dayly makyng prouision go northwarde aduerse faccion open enemy morow proclaymed kyng name kyng edward iiii throughout citie thinges doyng southpart king hery beyng northcountrey thinking slayn duke yorke chefe capitayn contrary lynage brought thyng purpose conclusion would assembled great army trusting litle payne small losse destroy residew enemy estemed force small validitie sore deceiued dead stocke sprang stronge mightie braunche meanes could either broken made sere kyng edward iii whiche beloued fauoured people man spoke person reme bred much estemed bothe nobilitie commonaltie liberalitie clemencie integritie corage aboue extolled praysed heaue reason whereof men al age al degree dayly repaired offering theym selfes men ieopard life plenteously gaue money support charge mayntayne warre reason wherof assembled together puissant army thentent gyue enemy fierce sharpe battayle one day obteyn purpose make ende troble army redy al thinges prepared departed london xii day marche easy iourneys came castell pomfret rested appointyng lorde fitzwater kepe passage ferybridge great number talle personage let man thinke yet imagine either counsaill kynge henry vigilant quene either neglected forgat know searche enemy prepared power men either could perswade allure purpose take part thus thinking self furnished committed gouernauce armye duke somerset erle northumberland ye lord clifford men desiring reuenge ye death paretes slayn first battayle sainct albons noble apitaynes leauing kyng henry wyfe sonne sauegard citie yorke passed ryuer wharfe power entendinge prohibite kyng edward passe ouer ryuer ayree expedicion exployt purpose many comparison made betwene erle northumberland lord clifford bothe beynge lusty yought franke corage lorde clifforde determined light horseman make assaye suche kepte passage ferybridge departed great army saturday palmsondaye early enemy ware gat bridge slew kepers thesame al woulde withstand lord fitzwater hearing noyse sodainly rose bed vnarmed pollax hande thinking ye byn fray emogest came doune appeace thesame either began tale knew matter meat slayne bastard salisbury brother erle warwycke valeaunt young gentelman great audacitie erle warwycke enformed feate like man desperate mouted hackeney came blowyng kyng edward saiyng syr praye god haue mercy soules beginnyng enterprise hath lost life se succor world remit vengeaunce punishment god creator redemer lighted doune slewe horse swourde saiyng let flie wil surely wil ary wil ta kissed crosse swourde lusty kyng edward perceiuing courage histrusty fred erle warwycke made proclamacion men whiche afrayde fighte shoulde incontinent departe tarried battell promised great rewardes addicion souldiour volutariely would abide conflict flye turne backe could kil haue great remuneracio doble wage thys proclamacio ended lord fawconbridge syr water blout robert horne forward passed ryuer castelford iij myles ferebridge entending haue enuironed enclosed lord clyfford copany beyng therof aduertised departed great haste toward kyng henry armythe conflict ferebridge thei mete thei loked attrapped thei ware lord clifforde either heat payne putting gorget sodainly wt arrowe say without hedde striken throte incontinent rendered hys spirite erle westmerlandes brother company almost slayn place called dintingdale farr fro towton ende slew yong erle rutland kneling knee whose yong sonne thomas clifford brought vp wt shepperd poore habite dissimuled behauior euer feare publish lignage degre till kyng henry vij obteyned croune gat diademe whome restored name possession conflict ended ferebridge lord fawco bridge hauyng foreward duke northfolk fallen sycke valeautly vpon palmsunday twylight set furth army came saxton might apparantly perceyue hoste aduersaries accompted lxm men therof aduertised kyng edward whose whole army thei knew payed wage affirme xlviiimvic lx person incotinet erle warwycke set forward leuyng rereward vnder ye gouernace syr ihon wenlocke syr ihon dynham first made proclamacion prisoner take one enemie saued thesame day ix clocke xxix day marche beyng palmsundayethe conflict sa vpo palmsundai hostes approched playn felde betwene towton saxto eche parte perceyued thei made great shoute thesame instante time fell small snyt snow violence wynd driuen face kyng heries parte sight somwhat blemeshed minished lord fawnconbridge led forward kyng edwardes battail rehersed man great polecie much experience marciall feates caused euery archer vnder standard shot one flyght caused prouide made stad still northre feling shoot reason snow wel vewyng distauce betwene enemy like hardy men shot schiefe arrowes fast thei might al shot lost labor vayn came nere southerme xl ta lors yerdes whe shot almost spent lord fawconbridge arched forwarde archer onely shot awne whol sheues also gathered arrowes enemy let great parte ye agaynst awne master another part thei let stand groud sore noyed legges owner battayle ioyned erle northumberlad andrew trolope chefetayns kyng heries vawgard seynge shot preuayle hasted forward ioine enemy may besure part nothing arded valeauntly foughte enemy battayl sore foughte hope life set side euery parte takynge prisoner proclaymed great offence reason wherof euery man determined either conquere dye felde deadly battayle bloudy conflic e continued x houres doubtfull victorie one parte time flowyng sometime ebbyng conclusio kyng edward coragiously comforted refreshyng wery helping wounded part discomfited ouercome lyke amased fledde toward tad aster bridge saue selfes meane way litle broke called cocke broade greate deapnes whiche hast escapyng feare folowers great num er drent drowned much common people affirme men alyue passed ryuer vpon dead car asis great ryuer wharfe great sewer yt broke water comyng towton colored bloude chace continued night parte next day euer northren men saw perceiued aduantage returned fought enemy great losse partes iij dayes slayn knewe wrote partes xxxvimvijclx xvi personsa gre slaught r englishman englishman one nacio wherof chefe erles northumberland westmerland lord dakers lord welles syr ihon neuel andrew trolop robert horne many knyghtes esquiers erle deuonshyre taken prisoner duke somerset excester fled felde saued selfes conflict maner vnnaturall sonne fought ather brother brother nephew vncle tenaut lord slaughter onely sore debilitate much weke puyssance realme considering dedde men whe thei liuyng force ynough resist greatest prince power al europe also gaue courage outward enemy foren pote tate ade make warre realme thinge vnlikely haue en ued either lewes french kynge bene time quiet realme iames kynge scottes bene age master selfe yet thanked god although gate con uest opened yet shut agayn espied great victorie kyng edward rode yorke solempnitie receyued first caused heddes father erle salisbury frendes taken gate buried body caused erle deuonshyre iii behedded set heddes place fter sent men light horse espye parte kyng henry lurked hearinge irrecuperable losse frendes departed incontinent wife sonne towne barwycke leauynge duke somerset came kynges courte scotland requiring counsaill ayde succor relief cofort yong kyng hauing compassio miserable fateand great mischaunce sorowful man onely coforted fayre woordes frendly promise also assigned compedent pencion liue tyme abode within realme scotland kyng henry considering great humaniti shewed scottis kyng whome onely consisted whole hope especiall trust ayde succor thought bynd oblige sayd king great benefite parte cause deliuered towne barwycke inge henry vi deliuered towne barwic han de iames king scotlande vpon twede towne scottes many yeres desired yet thei neither force fayre promise could obteyne desire purpose time writer affirme voluntarily coacted nece itie rendered thesame towne el could permitted enter haue succor realme scotlande whatsoeuer cause kyng iames taken possession towne frendly enterteyned faithfully supported parte faccion kyng henry concluded mariage betwene syster yong prince wale mariage philippe duke bourgoyne enemy quene margaretes father labored much infringe interrupte consent fredes matrimony agreed neuer solempnised shall heare kynge henry somwhat setteled realme scotlande sent wy e hys sonne fraunce kynge rene father trustyng ayde succor assemble greate army agayne possesse hys realme dignitie meane season determined make hys abode scotland se espye way hys frendes englande woulde study inuent restitucion aduauncement whether destinye folye imprudetly demeaned hym selfe within shorte space came handes hys mortal enemy quene margaret thus beyng frauce obteyn impetrate yong frenche kynge fautors louers hus ande lancastreall band might safely surely haue resorte parte realme frauce prohibiting contrary faccion accesse repaire countrey thvs haue hearde variable chaunce tragedicall hystory kynge henry sixthe whiche reigned ouer realme eight thirtie yeres odde monethes whiche tenthe yere h deposicion agayne erected hys throne estate royall shalbe declared nowe leuynge kynge henry prynces hys faccion consultynge together scotlande quene margarete hys wyfe gatherynge men together fraunce wyll returne actes kyng edwarde finis pthe ende trobelous season kynge henry vj prosperous reigne kyng edward fourthe prosperous fortune glorio victorythe first yere happely succedyng yog prince couragious capitain mortall battaill fought towton haue heard beyng incoraged set vp partly obteined great conquest partely perceiued aswell noble commos realme began drawe hym take part fashion maner triumphaunt conqueror victorious champion great pompe returned london according old custome realme called great assemble person degree xxix daie iune westminster solempnitie crounedand anoynted kyng called kyng edwarde iiij willyam conqueror yere christes incarnacion miiiiclxj whiche yere called high court parliament wherewith
