thestate realme wholy set good ordre specially thynges apperteined comon wealth whiche wer muche neglected decaied duryng tyme ciuill intestine war caused statute ordinaunces made kyng henry sixte whiche either touched title profite bee adnihilate frutrate whiche parliament erle oxford farre striken age lorde ambrey ueer sonne heire whether wer malice enemy thei wer suspected offended kyng thei bothe diuerse counsailors wer attainted put execucion whiche caused ihon erle oxford euer rebell afterward created twoo younger brethern duke saie lorde george duke clarence lorde richard duke gloucester lorde ihon neuell brother richard erle warwicke first made lorde mountacute afterwardes created hym marque mountacute beside henry burchier brother thomas archebishop cantorbury created erle essex william lorde fawconbrige made erle kent lorde henry burchier beyng noble man marciall actes highly approued renoumed richard duke yorke long tyme geuen suster elizabeth mariage hauyng firme hope sure confidence generacion perpetuall aide duke sequele aswell prosperitie aduersitie associate together al chance fortune trust defraude afterward appered kyng edward fourth sonne thesaid duke richard whiche assured fidelitie made hym erle essex thende bothe father sone euer hym bothe aide bulwarke erle henry begat lady elizabeth wife foure sonnes william thomas ihon henry one doughter named isabel whiche liued bat small season whiche sonnes compassyng bryngyng greate thynges passe lacked industrie prouidence grauous waightie affaire wanted neither labor diligence ieoperdies thei wer hardy strong coragious finally forseyng thinges thei neither lakced pollecie wer destitute counsaill lorde william eldest sonne henry e vertues wer surely planted ingrauen whiche william espoused lady anne woodwile discended high paretage whose mother iaquet doughter peter luxenborough erle sainct paule lorde henry afterward erle essex cicile isabel whiche died vnmaried cicile maried water lorde ferre chartley returne purpose pthe seconde yereth ii yere al chauces thus luckely happened kyng edward thynges maner framed would haue theim henry duke somerset sir raufe percie diuerse beyng dispaire hope good chaunce might happen kyng henry sixte came humbly submitted theimselfes gentely interteined louyngly receiued whiche deede duke shortly repented season kyng henry vj scotlande whiche haue aide comfort scottishe king deliuered vnto hym toune barwicke haue heard whiche continually possession englishman tyme kyng edward firste whiche hardy corage manfull assautes slaughter many thousandes scottes valiauntly conquered thesame season also quene margaret beyng fraunce meanes father frendes found suche frendship french kynges handes obteined crewe fiue hundred frenchemen whiche small numbre purpose yet greater number husbande able intertein wage awne offer thus beyng accompanied bostyng frenchman sir pier bracy bryton knight capitain man fierce house feld yet fierce fliyng eld house hardy set foreward house feld set vp sailes prosperous wind arriued scotland company wer welcome husbande sonne report suche languish would haue succor suche lacke aide would comforted quene companyquene margarete wi h company arriueth tynmouth thought doo greate enrterprise nature frenchemen bee busy bold sailed gallant band toward newe castle landed tynmouthe whether wer fraied awne shadow frenchemen cast many doubtes truth whole army returned shippes tepest rose sodainly taken small caruell good spede arriued safe barwicke neither vexed kyng edward newe inuasion yet liued old age misery wretchednes callamitie leasyng bothe husbande sonne realme honor although fortune fauorable yet company stormy blastes driuen shore baborough castle thei set shippes fire cowardly fled island called holy island wher thei wer assailed bastard ogle esquire called ihon manner kyng edwardes retinue many wer slain almoste iiiic taken prisoner put raunsome capitain bracy coward coragious happened chaunce fishar man came barwicke quene margaret mastres whether gaue hym thankes doubte sure none deserued yet made hym capitain alnewike castle whiche freshe men kepte till thei wer rescowed chaunce litle amased quene thyng abated haute corage incontinently obteined greate company scottes frendes bringyng husband leauyng sone called prince edward toune barwicke entered northumberlande toke castle bamborough stuffed scottes made therof capitain sir raufe gray came forward towarde bishopricke durham duke somerset heard newes without delaye refused kyng edward rode poste kynsman kyng henry sixte verefiyng old prouerbe kynne repe maie go refusyng surety estate whiche kyng edward promise hym vncertain gain whiche hoped get supportyng kyng henry hym fled also sir raufe percy many kynges fre de many mo folowed hym coueteousnes spoyle rapyne muche puyssaunce kyng henry thought bee muche force strength army enemy kyng edward army iudged greater spoyled burned tounes destroyed feldes whersoeuer cam kyng edward could blame hym dooynges nothyng content wherefore like wise prince intendyng stop gut kyng henry power made farther issue prepared al municions conuenient warre rigged apparreled great nauie shippes vitailed lyn hull thei furnished souldiors army sea thus warlikely set forward sent lorde montacute bothe hardinesse sage conduyte marciall affaire muche trusted beleued northumberlande raise people withstande enemy royall persone accompanied brother greate part nobilitie realme without great puyssaunt armie marched toward enemy came citee yorke sendyng greate quantitie faithfull subiectes ayde lorde montacute least paraduenture geuyng muche confidence men bisshopprike northumberlande might theim deceiued surprised lorde montacute forgat office good capitain beeyng well furnished suche knewe would neither flie backeward stande still lookyng fightyng thought leger tract tyme valiant corage marched forward toward enemy iorney incountered lorde hungerford lorde roos sir raufe percy diuerse place called hegely sodainly thesaied lordes maner without stroke strikyng fled onely sir raufe percy abode manfully slain diuerse saiyng diyng haue saued birde bosome meanyng kept promise othe kyng henry vj forgettyng kyng henry moste necessitie abandoned submitted hym kyng edward haue heard lord motacute seyng fortune thus prosperously leadyng saile auaunced hardy corage toward enemy passyng forward espialles perfite intelligence kyng henry power incamped faire plain called lyuels water dowill exham shirethe battaile li el water wil exham shire neede bid hym hast hast thought lese occasion hym manifestly geuen leaue good porte fortune hym opened vnclosed therefore good ordre battail manfully set enemy awne cape whiche like desperate persones small corage receiued hym sore fought feld partie long tract could get aduauntage till last lorde montacute criyng men valiauntly entered plain force battaill enemy brake array whiche like men amased fled hether thether desperate succor whiche flight chase wer taken henry duke somerset whiche reconciled kyng edwarde lorde roos lorde molyns lorde hungerford sir thomas wentworth sir thomas huse sir ihon fynderne many kyng henry daie beste horseman company fled faste man could ouertake hym yet nere pursued certain henxmen folowers wer taken horse beyng trapped blew veluet wherof one hed shesaid kyng henry healmet say high cap estate called abococket garnished twoo riche crounes whiche presented kyng edward yorke fourth daie maie duke somerset incontinently greate mutabilitie lightnes behedded exam lordes knightes wer new castle alitle respite wer likewise put execucion beside person diuerse numbre xxv wer executed yorke place wherby fautors kyng henry partie trust al victory consideryng capitaines hopped hedles fro battaill escaped kyng henry vj sir humfrey neuell willia taylboys callyng hymself erle keme sir raufe gray richard tunstall diuerse whiche beyng feare takyng hid themselfes lurked denes whole secretly thei wer closly hid thei espied erle keme taken close place riddesdale brought new castle axe lost life sir humfrey neuel long lurkyng caue taken holdernes yorke behedded thus euery man almoste escaped taken scorged seme god ordeined suche persones rebelled kyng edward haue co clusion death reward guardone battaill called exham feld kyng edward came citie duresme intent bee nerer enemy thei would make farther attempte sent thence northumberlande erle warwicke lorde montacute lordes fawconbrige scrope diuerse recouer suche castle fortress enemy held force defeded lordes first besieged castle alnewike whiche sir pier bracy frenchemen force strong hande kepte wise would yeld sendyng ayde scottes wherupon sir george douglas erle angus xiiim men well chosen daie tyme rescowed frenchemen castle englishemen lookyng whiche thought muche better haue castle without losse lese bothe castle men consideryng great power scottes smal numbre thei entered castle manned thesaied lordes besieged castle dunstanborogh force toke ihon goy seruaunt duke somerset capitain thesaid castle taken brought yorke hachet receiued reward lordes also tooke force strong castle bamborough sir raufe gray whiche sworne kyng edward whiche periurie bothe prince disgraded high ordre knighthode dancastrethe disgradynge knight cuttyng gylt sporres retyng cote armes breakyng sword ouer hed finally body shorted legth hed harme thus rewarded doble deceipt manifest periurie victory kyng edward returned yorke despite therle northumberlande whiche lurked realme scotland created sir ihon neuel lorde montacute erle northumberlande reprofe iaspar erle penbroke created william lord herbert erle thesame place mediacion frendes therle northumberlande reconciled fauor restored hym fully possessios name dignitie intendyng therby diminishe honor frend preferred sir ihon neuel stile marque montacute meanes estate degre higher therle warwicke elder brother power pollecie possession farre baser lower pthe thirde yerethe iii yere although kyng edward might thynke thynges good case hymself also puyssance sufficient al enemy yt obteined great victory yet prouide diligence neither kyng henry quene margaret wife meanes remain englande least sight perswasions theim especially old frendes alies might alter change mindes also wyn harte mutable comonaltie wherfore edified bulwarkes buylded fortress euery side parte realme might place propice mete armie arriue take lande beside wrote south partes realme wise thei receiue thesaied quene thyng help minister presume attempt priuatly openly infringe commaundement offendors take aduersaries punished vtter enemy parte marcheth vpon scotland laied watch espialles persone go realme kyng henry company whiche lay soiornyng scotlande euer ieoperdy perill might bee construed demed haue insued meanes kyng henry suche doubtes shortly resolued determined feare doynges wer clerely put vnder extinct hymself whether wer past feare well stablished perfite mynde could long kepe hymself secrete disguysed apparell boldely entered englande soner entered knowen taken one cantlowe brought towarde kyng erle warwicke met waie kynges commaundementkyng henry vi taken comitted toure london brought hym london toure laied sure holde quene margarete wife hearyng captiuitie husbande mistrustyng chaunce sonne desolate comfortles departed scotlande sailed fraunce remained duke reyner father till toke infortunate iorney englande lost bothe husband sone also wealth honor worldly felicitie newe duke somerset brother ihon sailed flaunders thei also liued greate misery till duke charles kyn discended house lancastre mother succored small pencion whiche greate comfort therle penbroke wet countrey countrey alwaies harte ease securitie life suretie liuing vnstable blind goddes fortune whe sitteth highest whele falleth groud vnderneth fall also neither haue aide helpe yet theimselfes takyng kyng hery vj departyng wife realme quietnes tranquilitie men contrary part faccion durst attept yet moue new tumulte conspiracie consideryng bothe hed fallen chief membres fled vanquished wherfore kyng edward beyng clerely doubt hostilitie danger set mynd whole foure yeres folowyng bothe amendyng thynges preiudiciall common wealthe also stablishyng thynges mete necessary people realme dominion firste al folowyng old auncient adage whiche saith hus andman ought first tast new growe frute distributed possession suche toke parte kyng henry vi souldiors capitai e whiche thought well deserued beside lefte poynt liberalitie vnshewed whiche might allure hym beneuolence louyng harte people especial nobilitie gaue bothe large precious giftes rewardes yt would gladly haue loue men aswell noble ignoble aswell riche poore shewed hymself familiar bothe nobilitie commonaltie thought conuenient either estate honor whiche gentilnes frendly familiaritie euer vsed lawes realmekyng edward iiii deuised name coynes part reformed part newly augmented coyne bothe golde siluer whiche yet daie curraunt newly deuised diuided gold named royal noble siluer called grotes halfe grotes caused open proclamacion diuulged persones whiche adherent aduersaries part would leaue armure submit theselfes wholy grace mercye bee clerely remitted pardoned relessed thei obstinatly would refuse haue paine law suche transgressor assigned appoynted profite gentle interteinyng people brought hym good wil fixed harte people obteined kynd frendly handelyng may iyes manifestly perceiue fauor ayde people euer warres victor conqueror enterprise afterward hym attempted either euill successe wer sone refelled afterward shall perceiue brought realme estate surely thynkyng lesse trustyng set sure stall sta ble throne vnmoueable chaire croune realme kyngdom desirous hymself beyng prince haut corage young lusty sanguyne complexion haue wife also daily ollicited required mocioned peres nobilitie realme ioyne suche make bee bothe honoure contentacion also securitie establishment royall succession continuaunce progeny newe possessed countrey late recouered kingdom wherupon like wi circumspecte prince desirous quene thirstyng suche make aide whose parentes alies confederate beyng ioyned theim perfite affinitie might litle nothyng doubte attemptes aduersarie kyng henry yet malice secret frendes priuy fautors matter great waight importance hangyng long consultacion emongest moued send iames iii kyng scottes obteinyng faire lady margaret suster thintent side kyng henry aduersary destitute aide refuge succor comfort whether wer priuie sickenes open impediment hym counsaill declared spied mocion vanished toke farther effect many men haue said none haue written farther consulted lady elizabeth suster heire apparant done henry kyng castle whiche afterward heire deede maried done fernado kyng arragon mariage hym moste conuenient conuenient profitable bothe hym realme theim lineally succede hym consideryng might obtein kyngdom castell whiche greate graund mother one indubitate heires doughter done peter late kyng castell valiaunt knight edward prince wale restored seigniory realme kingdom wer cace onely hable defend hymself realme englande foren enemy vtter inuasions also puyssance sufficient inuade likely recouer duchy guyen yea whole acquitain beyng awne true lawefull inheritance ayde onely castilian puttyng englishement litle trauaill lesse charge mocion thus setforward semed highly redounde bothe honor kyng high auauncement thestate realme consideryng first high pare tage woman secondly indubitate expectacion thinheritance realmes castell lion mariage agred vpon whiche semeth likely intreated cocluded tale teller saie erle warwicke sent spain well instructed lesse accompanied conclusio thesaid mariage diligently consider egall balaunce ponder youth appetite kyng edward tendre age minoritie noble damosell maie euidently perceiue neither decent conuenient hym realme expect tary maturitie ful age noble prince beyng prince wel cherished lustie courage apte generacion would could liue sole vnmaried without wife till age mete conueniet bed appereth goodly sepulture cite granado buried also diuerse famous notable historiographer bothe spain region write affirme changed transitory life yere lorde mdvi beyng l yeres age one moneth onely lackyng whiche report borne yere lorde miiiiclvi therle warwicke sent mariage kyng edwarde beginnyng third yere reigne yere lord mcccclxiii sixe fully vii yeres whiche tyme kyng edward fully accoplished xxiiii yeres treatie whiche mariage although vnpossible yet ye cause aforsaied semeth alitle vnlikely admit mariage moued peradue ture might erle warwicke sailed spain deede likelihod legacion frustrate came none effect sure thesame yere cam kyng lewes xi beyng frenche kyng liyng tour greate honor receiued honorably interteined whothe treaty mariage kyng edward th iiii kyng edward master demaunded haue mariage lady bona doughter lewes duke sauoy suster lady carlot french quene beyng frenche court mariage semeth pollitiquely deuised high imaginacion inuented well consider state condicion kyng edwardes affaire time kyng henry vi safe custody strong toure london moste parte adherentes thought either profligated extinct quene margaret onely except prince edward sonne whiche wer soiornyng angiers old duke reiner aniow father writyng hymself kyng naples scicile ierusalem hauing muche profites letter glorious stile rente reuenues thesaid large riche realmes dominion kyng arragon toke profites thesame would make accopt therof duke reiner kyng edward therfore thought necessary haue affinitie fraunce especially quenes suster whiche quene although ruled kyng husband many wome yet certain especiall humilitie content haue fauor folowe desire wedded men ofte tymes doubt stormes rather haue lowryng countenaunce ringing peale whe go rest quietnes trusting mariage quene margarete thesame quene carlot litle nothyng regarded although father called kyng quene none hauing subiectes profites dominion haue aide succor cofort frech kig none fre de alies wherfore quene carlot much desirous aduace blod progenie especially great prince kyng edward obteyned good kyng husband also syster matrimony syde clerely assented erle dampmartine appoited otherthe mariage cocluded kig edward iiii sayle englad clerely finishyng thesame thinges thus concluded erle warwycke dismissed highly rewarded great noble corage obteyned fauor kynge quene noble frauce fled englad honorably receiued frendly maynteined louingly succored shall perceyue hereafter bvt consider olde prouerbe true saieth mariage destinie duryng ye time erle warwycke thus fraunce concludyng mariage kyng edward king huntyng forest wychwod besyde stonnystratforde came recreacion mannor grafton duches bedford soiorned wyfe syr richard woduile lord ryuers attendyng doughter called dame elizabeth greye wydow syr ihon grey knight slayn last battell saincte albons power kyng edward wydow hauyng suyt kyng either restored hym thyng taken requyring hym pitie haue augmentacion liuyng founde grace kynges eye onely fauored suyte muche phantasied personkyng edward falleth loue buches bedfo de doughter marieth woma formal countenaunce excellent beautie yet beautie fauor sober demeanure louely lokyng femynyne smylyng neither wanton humble besyde toungue eloquent wit pregnant able rauishe mynde meane person whe allured made subiect hart great king kyng edward well considered linyametes body wise womanly demeanure saw determined first attept might prouoke souereigne lady promisyng many gyftes fayre rewardes affirmynge farther woulde therunto condisced myght fortune peramour concubyne chaunged wyfe lawfull bedfelow whiche demaunde wisely couert speache aunswered repugned affirmynge honor farre vnable hys spouse bedfelow awne poore honestie good either hys concubyne souereigne lady littell heated darte cupido nowe set hote burnyng fyre confidence perfyte constancy trust constant chastitie without farther deliberacion determined felfe clerely marye askyng counsaill whiche kenwe neither would durst impugne concluded purpose bvt duches yorke hys mother letted much lay alledgyng precontract made hym lady lucye diuers lettes al doubtes resolued thinges made clere cauillacions auoyded priuilie mornyng maried grafton first phantasied visage pthe iiii yerethe iiii yer next yere great solempnitie crouned quene westmynster father also created erle ryuers made high constable englande brother lorde anthony maried sole heyre thomas lord scale er lord scale syr thomas grey sonne syr ihon grey quenes fyrst husband created marque dorset maried cicilie heyre ord bonuile albeit mariage first apparaunce pleasaunt king ioyous quene profitable bloud highly exalted yea sodainly promoted nobilitie maruayled allowed sodayne risyng swift eleuacion yet wil marke sequele story shal manifestly perceyue murther miserie troble ensued reason mariage denied mariage kyng edward expulsed realm durst abide mariage therle warwycke brother miserable slaini commodi yng edwardes marriage mariage kyng edwardes ii sonnes declared ba ardes coclusion priued life finally mariage quenes bloud confounded vtterly maner destroyed men afterward diuyne either god contented yet pleased matrimony el punished kyng edward posteritie diepe dissimulynge couert clokynge hys faithfull frende erle warwycke coiectures part rather men phatasies diuine reuelacion whe mariage blowen abrode forren kynges prynces maruayled musyd noble men detested dis ained commo people grudged murmured al one voyce sayde hys vnaduised wowyng hasty louyng spedy mariage n ither meete beyng kyng consonant honor high estate french kyng quene littell discontent blame haue syster first demauded graunted conclusion reiected apparantly mocked without cause reasonable wherfore shortly appeseher dolor thei maried ihon galece duke millayn liued great felicitie erle warwycke perfit knowledge letter trusty frendes kyng edward gotten new wyfe done kyng lewes ambassade co ioynyng new affinitie frustrate vayn earnestly moued sore chafed chaunce thought necessarye king edward deposed croune royal dignitie inconstant prince worthy kyngly office men parte agre mariage cause erle warwycke bare grudge made warre kynge edwarde affirme th wer cause added made fyre flame litell smoke kyng edward obteyned kyngdome thoughte onely helpe meane erle warwycke bega suspect yea doubt fearyng lest beyng aucthoritie estimacion people well might worke pleasure displeasure therunto mynded wherfore thought coueniet litle litle plucke awaye minyshe power aucthoritie predecessor gyuen erle thentent myght pleasure bothe home outward party without feare dread without checke taunt whatsoeuer awn mynde semed conuenient man may se often chau ceth frendes one good turne render another yet remember great gratuite benefite time necessitie shewed exhibited kyndnes shew vnkindnes great benefites receyued great displeasure recompense thys erle warwycke nothyng ignorat although loked better thankes ample benefites kyng edwardes handes yet thought best dissimule matter tyll time come might fynd kyng without stregth imbrayd pleasure done himthe displeasure betwene kig edward iiii erle warwycke farther erreth treuth kynge edward attempt thyng erles house much agaynste erles ho estie whether woulde haue deflowred hys doughter nece certayntie honor openly knowen surely thyng attempted king edward loued well loke fele fayre dammosels whether iniury erle thought taken king edwardes handes disdayne aucthoritie erle vnder king cause dissolucion amitie league trueth priuie intencions harte brake many smal peces england fraunce flaunders could neuer ioyne agayn duryng naturall lyfes erle warwycke beyng thus moued inflamed set kyng lest fury purpose might espied broughte nought determined self couertly dissimulyng longe suffer wronges iniuries hym done til might spye tyme conueniet world hys awn appetite setting furth enterprise accompilshyng purpose wherupon sayled england reuerence saluted kyng wont declared ambassade thexployt thesame without spot grudge perceyued though ignorant new matrimony taryed c urte certayn space shewe thesame person thesame good mynde towarde kynge tyme hys legacion great affeccion bare either kyng quene obteyned licence kyng depart hys castel warwycke hys health recreacion whither great honour acco panied diuers kynges familier seruitors thoughe none inward grudge couert dissimulacion ben hydden betwene remayned tyll hys priuie imaginacions made open hys enterprise ready set forwarde duryng whiche time quene deliuered yonge fayre lady named elyzabeth whiche afterward wyfe noble prince kynge henry vij mother kyng henry viij pthe v yerethe v yere kyng edward reigned thys full terme v yeares pleasure yet displeasure either policie fredshippe euer superior vpper hande hys enemy dayly studied intentyuely applied whole mynd al labor diligence obtayne loue fauor amitie outward prince foren potentate first haue rowlad olyuer frech king whome knew hys frendes reason refusall hys quenes syster procured amitie henry kynge castell ihon kyng arragon concludyng whiche amitie graunted lycence liberte certayn cottesolde shepe transported countie spaynekynge edward lyceced tayne number shepe transported spayne people report haue multiplied encreased hath turned comoditie england moche spanysh profit small hynderance lucre gayne whiche beforetymes england raysed wolle felle beside thys haue amitie hys nexte neyghbor kyng scottes wynkynge towne barwyke contet take truce xv yeres bvt lord happy chauce good lucke kyng edward besyde new frendes conferates whiche farther coulde cal helpe whistel stode moost daunger distresse fortune besyde expectatio prouided hym euen hys elbowe brother lawe perpetual allye frendly neyghboure whiche offered allyaunce new amitie either refused myssed surely al hys putatyue dare say fayned frendes leage hys extr necessitie bene clerely abandonyd comfort left disconsolate thys happy chaunce came thys occasion thys season lord prince flaunders brabant zeladt lowe contreis thereaboute philippe duke burgoyne man greate age yeres muche honor great estimacion hygh reuerece emongest kynges prynces hys dayes duke harde enemye mortall kynge henrye sixte duke onely one sonne legitimate called charles erle charol y man suche haute corage hygh enterprice vntimerous audacite euen lyke sonne mar fewe none sene hys tyme discomfited kyng loys xi frech kyng battayle montleherrye frenchemen hathe yet forgotten lade luke also hath recent memorie sore scorge cruell plage thys erle charles thys tyme wydower hauyng onely sole doughter sonne wherfore hys father hym selfe companion order golde flece cousail thought onely expedient much necessary take wyfe ye place might matrimony haue aliance ayde agaynste outwarde enemy especially agaynst frenche kyng whome knew dayly wayte watche lyke serpente fraude might swalow catche possession vpon comunicacio declared certayne beynge present kynge edward englande fayre virgyn hys syster called lady margarete lady excellent beautie yet womanhod beautie vertue womanhode whose innumerable good quality beside giftes nature grace fortune seriously setfurth duke philip erle charoloys hys sonne bothe father child iudged mariage moste metest matrimony christendom onely excellent quality manifold vertues emprinted person noble virgyn also great profite allyance continuall frendship shoulde growe ryse betwene realme englande duke landes vi yere thys poynte clerely resolued onthe vi yere duke appoynted hys bastard sonne lorde anthony commonly called bastarde bourgoyne chefe ambassadoure purpose man great witte corage valiantnes liberalitie whiche beyng richely furnished plate apparel necessary estate hauing copany getelmen expert feates chiualry merciall prowes nuber cccc horse brabanders write toke hys ship prosperous wynde arryued englande nobilitie receyued al honorable entertainment conueyed kynges presence like prince knew apperteined degre louingly welcomed familiarly embrased bastard noble came hym hys commission seene hys message declared kynge gaue hym gentell answere tyme ambassadours departed lodgynge kept greate housholde made triumphat chere may thinke kyng edward vnwyse yet vnpurueyed counsail forsake thys beneficiall alliauce amicable consanguinitie louynge frendshyp thus frankely hym profered graunted hys counsaill fote hande endeuoured theym selfes brynge passe fynally conclude thesame erle warwycke onely excepte whiche berynge hys harty fauoure frenche kynge yll reportes dyd asmuche hym laye hynder thys mariage affinitie whose good duke charles well informed hys opinion ce tayne daye kynge sente ambassadours declared theym howe gladlye dyd bothe accept graunte louynge request demaunde promisyng word prynce duryng life frend fredes duke erle ennemies aduersaries ennemies wordes littel pl ased burgo nyons caused lady margaret syste sent beyng richely appareled accompanied great multitude ladyes gentelwomen entred kynges great chaber sober demeanure faire visage louyng coutenaunce princely port estemed personage quality bothe burgonnyons vnw rthy matche matrimony greatest prynce worlde kynge ambassadours comoned good tract tyme lord anthony bastard burgonnye contracted openly sayde lady margaret name brother erle charles name duke father erle brother presented lady margaret ryche costly iuell whiche ioyouslye receyued great thankes many gratulations geuen b th father lawe new contracted husband thys mariage thus concluded contracted speke bankettes festes disguisynges pastymes pleasure made shewed ambassadours longe write matter b yng serious much tedious one thig v ry honorable mete put obliuio bastard burgoyne man haute corage chalengeda chaleng anthony lord scale broth r quene man bothe egall hart valyantnes bastard fight hym bothe fote horsbacke lord scale gladly receyued hys demaunde promised hym othe gentelman aunswere hym felde day appoynted lyke chalenges made borgonyons gentelmen englande maye surely beleue refused kyng ente dyng see marciall sport valiant chalenge performed caused lystes royall champio costely gallery lady loke newly erected edefied west smythfelde lo day kyng assigned ii lordes entered within listes well mounted richely trapped curiouslye armed whiche daye ran together certayne course wyth sharpe speres departed egall honor next daye entered felde bastarde sitting bay courser beinge somwhat dymme sight lord scale gray courser whose haffro long sharpe pyke stele whe ij valeat persones coped together tornay lord scale horse chauce custome thrust hys pyke nostrelles horse bastarde payne mouted hygh fell one syde wyth hys master lord scale roade roud sworde shakyng hys hand yll kyng comaunded marshall helpe vp bastarde whiche openly sayed holde cloudes though horse fayled surely fayle coutercopaignions remounted made countenace assayle kyng either fauoryng brother honor gotte mistrustyng shame whiche mighte come bastarde agayne foyled caused heraldes cry lostell euery man departe morow two noble men came felde two poleax fought valiantly lyke two coragious hamp ons laste point axe lord scale happened e ter ight healme bastard fyne orce might haue plucked hym knee kynge sodaynlye caste doun arder marshall seuered bastard content chaunce desirous reuenged trustinge cunning poleaxe whiche feate greatly excercysed great exper ent required kyng iustice might performe enterprise lord scale refused king sayd wolde aske counsail calling hym costable marshall officer armes longe consultacion lawes armes rehersed declared bastarde sentence diffinitiue duke clarence constable englande duke northfolke erle marshall woulde prosecute farther attempted chalenge muste lawe armes deliuered aduersarye thesame case like condicion taken hym saye poynt lord scale axe fixed sighte healme depe seuered bastard heryng iudgemt doughted muche sequele procede agayne wherefore content relinquyshe hys chalenge rather abyde hasarde hys dishonour chalenges done valiautly achened englishman passe ouer corragious actes thus ioy accomplished sorowfull tidinges broughte bastard duke philip father passed transitory lyfe whiche tidinges littell sorowfull therevpon takynge leue kynge edwarde syster newe duches burgoyne liberally rewarded plate iuels celeritie returned new duke charles nephew accopting exployt made ambassade message answere great contentacion accomplishement desire said duke thereof hartely thanked lady consent thynge desired forgettynge gratefie kynge edwardes preferment furtherance louinge request contract made duke philip dyed yere saluacion mcccclxuii vj yere kynge edwarde iiij whiche yere kyng edward marque montagewes loue fauour bare erle warwycke promoted george neuel brother archebishoperyke yorke vii yerethe vii ye returne charles duke burgoyne whiche greate victory victorious triumphe returned conquest lande luke bruseles forgetting contract bastard brother lord anthony made name noble princesse lady margaret syster edward kyng englande deu sed alwayes might honor royaltie haue receyued countrey first wrote kyng england sende ouer sea diligence accordinge pact leage betwene concluded beynge nothinge slacke especially suche cause highly magnified bloude prepared shippes thinges necessary honorable conduyte copany accompanied uke exceter southfolke wyfes beynge bothe systers great companye lordes lady number ccccc horsses beginninge iune departed londo douer sayled uys companye receyued thence conueyed bruges mariage celebrate solempniezd abundaut fare delicate vian serued feast riche hanginges house garnished trimmed many cupperdes golde siluer palace adourned many garnyshe siluer vessell companyes serued iustes tourney bankettes disportes nup iall feast neither dare wil write accordinge braba der cronicle lest perauenture men might thynke flattered litle perchance thynke saye trew greate dele let go ye matter ioy solace returne pestilent serpent whiche longe sucked vp poyson began vomit cast abrode iij yeres folowing whole realme continually infected thesame whiche infeccion neuer ceased till ayre purified bloudde deathe selfe barnet felde call youre remembraunce depe dissimulinge erle warwycke retorne beyonde sea continuall grudge lurked stomack toward kyng edwarde syth tyme ye must thynke necessitie wolde length either burste vessell meanes issue euen tyme beyng towne warwycke accompanyed two bretherne marque mountacute archebishop yorke framed communicacion make merye passe furth time two thre dayes last hauynge occasio speake kyng doynges procedinges first moued excited al way possible helpe ayde restore kyng hery sixte croune royal dignitie agaynethe persuasion erle warwyke vnto two brethre agaist king edward fourth saiyng wise dere welbeloued bretherne incredible faythefulnes secrete sobernes polytique prudence haue euer long cotinuace tyme experimented doth onely encourage harte yea setteth great hope obteynynge purpose also putteth dreade mistrust fermely beleuyng surely iudging yt wyl tothe nayle endeuer selfe vttermost power bryng effect purpose thing shal declare vnto surely woulde wise shoulde thynke whiche shall speake kyng edward kyng henry rise lightnes phantasie mynd triffelyng toye lately fallen imaginacion true experience iuste iudgement haue bothe quality condicions maner co pell constraine saie saie doe doo surely kyng henry godly good verteous persone neither forgettyng frendes puttyng obliuion benefite hym meane persone receiued yet paine cause susteined hath lefte vnrewarded god hath sent sonne called prince edward borne bee great worthynes prayse muche bountefulnes liberalitie men maie many laudable thynges coniecture consideryng pein labor trauaill taketh helpe father captiuitie thraldome kyng edward contrary side man cotumelious opprobrious iniurious person deserue kyndnes sheweth vnkyndnes theim loue dedly hateth detestyng take pein preferment maintenaunce publique wealth realme al geuen pastime pleasure daliance soner preferryng high estate men discended lowe bloud basse degree men old vndefiled house whiche hath bothe supported hym common wealth realme perceiue eue come poynt destroye nobilitie el nobilitie must shortly necessitie destroye confounde hym reason would wer first hurt first reuege cause vnknowen bothe immediatly obteined croune began first secretly openly enuie disdain impugne fame glory renoune house familie saied al honor preferment aucthoritie haue onely receiued handes neither obteigned dignitie rule great labor aide trauaill whiche l men maie seme vntrue whiche consider name chief title principall aucthoritie v geuen kyng henry sixte hym euery man remembre firste toke parte father claimed croune tyme cause greate ieoperdie almost slain kynges meniall seruauntes neuer lefte man prosperitie aduersitie till garlande realme quietnes shall manifestly perceiue wee oure bloudde hath shewed selfes like father hym like frend v haue receiued benefites hym surely thei muche wee haue deserued muche looked yet thei bee muche would wee inioye ye bothe well perceiue knowe let thynges ouerpasse speake vngentle vntrue vnprincely handelyng laste ambassade beyng sent french kyng treate mariage hym hauyng full aucthoritie bynd lose contracte conclude whiche thyng finished accomplished lightly mynde chaunged priuily vowed secretly maried bothe knowe better meanes almoste credence courte fraunce kyng quene though come thether like espiall moue thyng neuer mynded treat mariage determined neuer take effect whereby fame estimacion whiche kynges prince haue conceiued v partly obteined vertue prowesse noble auncestors partly acheued oure awne peines forward actes shall bee obfuscate vtterly extinguished nothyng set worme touched turne beast striken rore sound innocet child hurt crye poore vnreasonable beastes sely babe lacketh discresion grone harme theim proffered ought honest man angery thynges touche honestie daily attempted meane person case bee angery muche ought noble man fume stirre coales high tipe honor touched fame maner brought infamy honor almost blemished appalled offence desert brother know true dishonor one dishonor v hurte one hurte wherefore rather liue vnreuenged suffre hym reigne whiche hath sought decaye dishonor surely spend life lande goodes settyng vp iuste good man kyng henry sixte deposyng vntrue vnfaithfull vnkynde prince onely meanes called kyng edward fourthe faire wordes allured archbishop shortly intent purpose lorde marque could meanes bee reduced take parte kyng edwarde till erl bothe promised hym great rewardes high promocions also assured hym aide power greatest prince realme eue marque vnwillyngly maner coacted gaue consent vnhappy coniuracion intisement procurement therle fainte harte lesse courage alwaies shewed hymself enemie kyng edwarde excepte laste daie whiche lukewarme harte double dissimulacion wer bothe destruccion brethre erle warwicke beeyng man greate wit farre castyng many thynges vigilantly foreseyng either perceiued perfect knowlege hymself duke clarence bare best kyng edward brother deede thought firste proue hym farr wer probleme open sawe hym flexible purpose secrete imaginacions stomacke thynkyng might pollicie promise allure duke partie kyng edward destitute one best hawkes moste nede make flight tyme place conuenient erle began complain duke ingratitude doublenes kyng edward saiyng neither handled hym like frende kepte promise hym accordyng estate prince required erle halfe tolde tale duke greate fury answered lorde thynke haue hym kynd vnkynd yea vnnatural beyng awne brother thynke frendship make hym kepe promise neither nature kynred wise prouoke moue hym fauor awne bloud thynke exalte promote cosin alie whiche litle careth fall confusio awne line lignage knowe well enough heire lorde scale hath maried wife brother heire also lorde bonuile haryngton hath geuen wife sonne theire lorde hungerford hath graunted lorde hastynges thre mariages meter twoo brother kynne suche newe foundlynges hath bestowed theim swete saincte george sweare brother gloucester would ioyne would make hym knowe wee three one mannes sonnes one mother one lignage discended whiche preferred promoted straungers wife bloud therle warwicke hard duke wordes whiche bothe sore thrusted lusted began boldly disclose duke intent purpose euen full requiryng hym take parte hym bee one attempted confederacie least duke might thynke matter lightly vncircumspectly begon declared hym warely howe secretly spedily thynges concernyng purpose compassed studied forsene requiryng hym greate vrgente cause bothe take pein trauaill also studie circumspeccion forseyng thynges thus begon might brought certaintie finall conclusion rather wynne duke hart erle beside diuerse many faire promise made duke offered hym eldest daughter beeyng ripe age elegant stature mariage whole halfedele wife inheritaunce duke perswasion request therle promised thynges whiche would could maner require desire duke erle long consulted concernyng straunge dangerous affaire thei first determined saile caleis toune erle chief capitain wife twoo doughters soiorned visite duke clarence beyng amour small affeccion erle continually remembryng purpose set thought begin kindle fire vngracious coniuracion whiche many yeres vexed vnquieted realme englande departure wherefore appoynted brother archebishop marque thei meane absence stirre vp newe commocion rebellion countie yorke place adiacente ciuill warre seme men haue begon without assent knowlege beyng partes beyond sea eight yerethe viii yere thynges wer thus determined graue counsaill allowed erle duke sailed directly caleis thei solempnely receiued ioyously interteined countesse twoo daughter duke sworne sacrament kepe promise pacte inuiolate made concluded erle warwicke maried lady isabell eldest daughter thesaied erle lady churche cal greate pompe solempnitie whiche mariage solempnized duke therle consulted sadly together meanes thei continue warre whiche theim appoynted recently within fewe day begonne yorke shire without great rumore disturbaunce quietnes countrey mother pernicious commocion vncharitie impietie citee yorke olde riche hospitall dedicated saincte leonarde whiche almosehouse poore indigente people harbored refreshed sicke impotente persones comforted healed good purpose char table intent whole prouince yorke gaue yerely hospitall certain measure corne maner oblacion first fruites newe grayne thynkyng gyfte geuen holy place holy expence bee theim meritorious god acceptable certain euill disposed persones erle warwickes faccion intendyng set bruill countrey perswaded greate nombre husbande men refuse deny geue thyng thesaied hospitall affirmyng saiyng corne geuen good intent expended pore people master hospitall wexed riche suche almose priestes wexed fat poore people laie leane without succour comfort content saiynges thei fell dooynges proctor hospitall acc rdyng vsage went aboute countrey gather accustomed corne thei sore beaten wounded euil intreated good men lamented vngodly demeanure peruerse people much reioysed toke suche courage thei kept secrete conuenticles priuie communicacios muche within fewe day thei made suche confederacie together thei wer assembled nombre xv thousad men euen ready prest set citie yorke fame commocion great assemble came eares citizes yorke thei firste greatly astonied leauyng feare aside thei greate doubt vncertaintie whether best issue walles geue battaill rebelles kepe citie repulse violence enemy manfull defendyng walles porte lorde marque montacute gouernor presedent countrey kyng shortly put citizen feare suspicion inuasion takyng spedy cou saill consideryng oportunitie tyme small nombre menne well chosen encountered rebelles gate yorke long conflicte toke robert huldurne capitain theim commaunded hed bee striken caused souldiours darke entre citie yorke long labor refreshe marueiled marque thus put death capitain ruler people stirred reised vp hym felowes coniuracion conspiracie saie intent would seme faultes innocent brother doynges priuie imaginacions affirme saie promise made brother deliberatly determined take parte kyng edward shall appere small space entered greate grace high fauor people beyng nothyng abashed death capitain rather eger fierse faire meanes craftie perswasions found meanes get theim henry sonne heire lorde filz hughe sir henry neuell sonne heire lorde latimer one beeyng nephew cosin germain therle warwicke although young gentleman bare name capitaines yet thei tutor gouernor called sir ihon conyers man suche courage valiauntnes fewe day northe partes firste consideryng thei could get yorke want ordinaunce artilery whiche thei lacke dede thei determined pede marche toward londo intendyng waie reise suche phantesie people harte yt thei thynke kyng edward neither iust prince god profitable comon welth realme kyng edwarde dooynges erle warwicke duke brother manifest ouerte come poynt expected loked diuerse letter sent hym certified greate armie northren men wer spe e commyng toward london therefore greate hast sent wyllyam lorde herbert within twoo yeres created erle penbroke without delaye encountre northren men extremitie al power erle penbroke commonly called lorde herbert litle ioyous kynges letter partly deserue kynges liberalitie whiche meane gentleman promoted hym estate erle partly malice bare erle warwicke beyng sole obstacle thought obteined wardship lorde bonuiles daughter heire eldest sonne whervpon accompaignie brother sir richard harbert valiaunt knight aboue vi vii thousande welshemenne well furnished marched forwarde encountre northren men assiste furnishe hym archer appoynted humffray lorde stafford southwike named created erle deuonshire kyng hope valiauntly would serue hym iorney hym eight hundred archer twoo lordes wer met cottishold thei made diligent inquiry northren menne wer explorators thei asserteined thei passyng towarde northampton whervpon lorde stafford sir richard harbert twoo thousande well horsed welshman saied thei would go vewe se demeanor nombre northern men vnder w oddes side thei couertly espied passe forward sodainly set rerewarde northren men suche agilitie quickly turned aboute moment houre welshemen wer clene discomfited scatered many taken remnaunt returned armie small gain kyng edwarde beeyng nothyng abasshed small chaunce sente good woordes erle pembroke animatyng byddyng hym bee good courage promisyng hym alonely ayde shorte tyme also hymself persone royall would folowe hym puyssance power yorke shire menne beyng glad small victory well cooled went farther southward toke waie toward warwicke lokyng aide therle whiche lately come caleis duke clarece sonne lawe gatheryng reisyng men succor frendes kyns olke kyng likewise assembled people euery side aide assist therle penbroke compaignie part receiued comfort succor frend partaker bothe army met chaunce faire plain nere toune called hedgecot three myle banberybanbery feld wherin three hilles equal distaunce yet equall quantitie liyng maner although fully triangle welshemen gat firste west hill hopyng haue recouered east hil whiche thei obteined victory vnwise prophesier promised northren men incamped themself southe hill erle penbroke lorde stafford southwike wer lodged banbery daie feld whiche sainct iames daie erle pembroke putte lorde stafforde inne wherein delighted muche loue damosell dwelled house contrary mutuall agrement taken whiche whosoeuer obteined first lodgyng deceiued remoued many greate woordes crake betwene twoo capitaines lorde stafford southwyke greate dispite departed whole compaignie band archer leauyng erle pembroke almoste desolate toune whiche diligence returned host liyng feld vnpurueied archer abidyng suche fortune god would sende prouide sir henry neuell sonne lorde latimer tooke hym certain light horssemen skirmished welshemen euenyng euen campe diuerse valiaunt feates armes litle hardy went farre forward taken yelded yet cruelly slain whiche vnmercifull acte welshemen sore ruied next daie night northren men beyng inflamed litle discontented death noble man mornyng valiauntly set welshemenne force archer caused theim quickely descende hill valey bothe hostes fought therle penbroke behaued hymself like hardy knight expert capitain brother sir richarde herbert valiauntly acquited hymself polleaxe hand enemy afterward reporte twise fine force passed battaill aduersaries without mortall wounde returned euery one felowes compaignions armes doen halfe thactes whiche daie noble prowes ach ued northremen obteined neither sauetie victory beside beholde mu abilitie fortune welsheme poynt haue obteyned victory northernme eyng manner discofited ihon clappam esquier seruaunte erle warwycke mouted vp syde ye east hyl accopanied onely ccccc men gathered rascal towne northampton village hauyng borne standard erle white bere cryenge warwycke warwycke welshman thinkyng erle warwycke come hys puyssance sodaynlye men amased fledde northernme pursued slew without mercy ye cruelty shewed lord latymers sonne welshme slayne aboue vma greate slaughter welshemen besyde fled taken erle penbroke syr rychard herbert brother diuers gentelmen taken brought banberie behedded much lamentacion lesse entreatie made saue lyfe syr rychard herbert hys goodely personage whiche excelled men also noble chiualry shewed feldes day battayll muche brother erle laye doune hed blocke suffer said syr ihon conyers clappam master let dye olde saue brother whiche yonge lusty hardye mete apte serue greatest prince christendom syr ihon conyers clappain remembryng death yonge knyght syr henry neuel cosyn erle warwycke could syde caused erle hys brother diuers gentelme number x behedded northamptonshire men diuers northernme procured fury made capitayne called hym robyn riddisdalerobin riddesdale sodaynly came manner grafton erle ryuers father quene lay whome loued force toke sayde erle syr ihon sonne brought northampton without iudgement stroke heddes whose bodyes solemply enterred blackefreers northampton kynge edward aduertised thys vnfortunate chauces wrote al hast shiriefes somerset shyre deuenshyre coulde meane take lorde stafford southwyke vpon payne lyues without delay put hym execucion whiche accordingly kynges commaundement longe exploracion made founde hym hyd village brentmarche called taken brought bridgwater cut shorter hedde thys orderhegecote feld commonly called banbery felde manner ende hegecot felde comely called banberie felde foughten morow sainct iames daye viij yere kynge edwarde iiii whiche battaile euer synce hath bene yet co tinuall grudge betwene northernmen welshemen thys battayle northernme resorted towarde warwycke erle gathered greate multitude people whiche erle gaue hygh commedacions syr ihon conyers capitaynes north much reioysing obteyned glorious victory requiring continew begon kyng likewyse sore thrusting recouer hys losse late susteyned desirous bee reuenged deathes murder hys lordes fredes marched toward warwycke greate armye euer wente forwarde company increased commaunded noysed published common people onely entent destroy vtterly confounde vnhappy stocke yll graffed generacion suche pernicious person wolde disturbe bring thraldome ye quiet comons peaseable people erle warwycke espialles perfyt knowlege kyng armye bent toward hym sent hast possible duke clarece far hym great power requyringe hym bothe hostes myghte ioyne one farre coulde imagyne tyme battayle nere duke hearynge newes good order battayle came encamped selfe erles host thynges redy prepared fight meanes fredes meane founde comon peace whiche letter writte eche parte declaring griefes bottom stommackes herauldes spared horseflesh riding betwene kyng erle retornynge erle kynge kynge conceyuinge certayne hope peace hys awne imaginacion toke bothe lesse hede selfe also lesse fered outward atteptes hys ennemyes thinkyng trustynge truely thynges good poynt well pacified kynges doynges espial declared erle warwycke lyke wyse politique capitayne entendyng lese great auantage hym geuen trustyng brynge hys purpose fynall ende determinacion onely obteyning enterprise dead nyght elect company men warre secretly possible set kynges felde kylling kept watche kynge ware thoughte nothynge lesse chaunce happened place called wolney iiii myle warwyckekyng edward iiii taken prisoner erle warwike take prysoner brought castell warwicke entent kynges frendes myghte know chaunced hym caused hym secret iorneys nyght conueyed myddelham castell yorkeshyre kept vnder custody archebishop yorke brother hys trusty frendes entertayned kyng like estate serued hym lyke prynce place farre taking kyng shortly knowe wynde newes made many men feare greatly dread many wonder lament chauce kyng edward beyng thus captiuitie spake euer fayre archebishop kepers whether corrupted money fayre promise libertie diuers dayes go huntyngekyng edward escaped prison one day playne met hym syr william stanley syr thomas borogh dyuers hys fredes suche great bend men neither kepers woulde durst moue retorne prison agayn thus haue harde kyng edward deliuered saye set large erles consent commaundemente sayd hym kepyng myght haue destroyed hym hym captiuitie might haue deteyned yet myne awne frewill gentelnes without pacte raunsom contented set libertie deliuer thys doyng might seme countenaunce treuth erle desisted persecutyng warre hym newly begonne treuth good chaunce happed kynge edward yll lucke kynge henry surely yll fortune man may playnly coiecture extreme poynt decay hys house estate apparantly hande consideryng neither mannes pollicie worldly rich vnhappy predestinate chaunce coulde pollicy put instrumet scraped away wel goddes pleasure consider erle warwycke frendes onely thentent ayde conserue defende kynge henry vi haue dispended substance aduentured lyues taken paynes intollerable hauyng sure determinacion fixed myndes long kyng edward lyued kyng henryes faction neuer prosper yet erle taken prisoner captiuitie fortune escaped wilfully deliuered thys may playnly perceyue lucke kyng henry vnfortunate done hym quarell euer redouned hys misfortune detriment euer notyng thinges contriued imagened come vnlucky successe sens bodyes anger feare madnes rauyshed maner distracte selfes retorne purpose kynge edward escaped handes hys enemyes went streyghte yorke great honor receyued citiezens taried two dayes prepare small army accompany hym hys iorney whe perceyued coulde haue hoste mete conuenient passe london thorough middes enemy appoynted turned yorke lancaster founde lord hastynges hys chamberlayne well accompanyed ayde lord hastynges suche drew hym beyng well furnished spedy iorneys came safe cytye london erle warwyke ye duke clarece knowlege kyng treason yt put trust escaped handes one moment tyme long studyes forcastes brought none effect conclusion wexed angrye chafed without measure callynge together chief frendes began consult agayn new enquire estate enemy entent might make beginnyng new warre coniectured haue taken ende kyng brought captiuitie myndes prynces much satisfied corage greatly kindeled reason great number men hauing pleasure discord concord louyng better stryfe vnitie offered selfes beginne newe warre awne desire request kyng edward toke euen lyke study warres ennemyes dyd myndinge either bringe conformitie reason dent sworde el power battayle vtterly destroye exstirpate affinitie entent ye men might lede quiet lyfe lyue securitie rest sedicious rebellinge person state realme broughte great miserie church temple euery robbed spoiled house burnt men slayne euery place realme replenished bloud slaughter sorow lamentacion cornefeldes destroied city cownes made desolate languished famyn dearthe besyde many thinges happen crueltie furye warre rebellion tumult trouble common wealth realme sore vexed troubled many especial nobilitie muche lamented pitied state comminaltie diligence rode betwene kyng erle duke reconsile eche coclude perfect peace amitie requiring rather remeber benefites euerye haue receyued sette forth vngratitude iniury whiche one hath done rather occasion discord meane come amitie exhorted theym rather deserue loue men keping peace v e fightinge intestine warre destroy realme wynne hatred malice nacion vnkynd vnnaturall cherishe hys natural parentes procreators much vnnatural wicked suffer natyue coutrey beyng common father mother contencion stryfe brought decay vtter perdicion aucthoritie first nobilitie realme secondarely charitable mocion mytigated myndes bothe kyng duke erle eche gaue fayth go come sauely without ieopardy whiche promise duke erle hauing perfight trust cofidece came lo accompanied small number men comparison great dangier westmynster kyng duke erle longe communicacion together end taken made betwene fell great wordes exprobracions opening either olde benefites shewed olde ingratitude receiued great furye without co clusion departed kyng canterbury duke erle warwycke erle warwycke prepared new host ryse lyncolnshire made capitayne syr robert welles sonne rychard lord welles experte man armes pollitique warre newes sodaynly brought kynge littell vexe tykil hym euer feruetly hoped aduersaryes wolde rather come honest condicios cocorde temerariously sodaynly renouate warre rumor yt sprede contrary expectacion new begonne battayll soner gathered together host resistence thesame hand sent rychard lord welles willing vpon sight letter hast repayre vnto hym oftentymes excused syckenes debilitie body excuse serued thynkyng purge selfe sufficiently kynges presence toke hym syr thomas dymocke maried syster together came londo come vp fredes certefied hym kynge hym littell displeased highly discontented wherfore verye feare hys brother law toke sentuarie westmynster entendynge abyde tyll prynces ire somwhat asswaged mitygate kyng edward thought pacifie thys besy tumulte withoute anye farther bloudshed promisyng person pardon caused theim vpon hys promise come sentuary hys presence callyng hym lorde welles willed hym write syr robert hys sonne leaue warre take erles parte meane season wyth hys army went forward towarde hys enemyes hauynge hym lorde welles syr thomas dymocke beynge past two dayes iorney staford hys enemyes pytched felde perfyt knowlege syr robert welles nothyng moued hys father letter styl kept campe abyding kyng power kynge hauyng hygh indignacion hys presumpcion mynded reuenged parte cotrary faith promise caused lord welles father saide syr robert syr thomas dymocke behedded terrible example shal put confidece promise prince whe syr robert welles hard kyng drew nere hys father syr thomas dymocke ware behedded stode firste greate perplexitie studyeng whither gyue battail bothe perilous doughtfull fight great armye erle warwycke hys power assembled yet hauyng yonge lusty courage manly boldnes stimulate pricked forward set hys enemyes battayle sore fought bothe partes many man slayne conclusion whyle syr robert exhortyng prouokynge hys men tary maner disconfit redy flye enuyroned beset aboute hys enemyes taken hym syr thomas delaund knyght many mo hys takyng lyncolnshyre men amased threw away coates lighter runne away fled therfore battayl yet called losecote felde kyng glad victory commaunded hand syr robert welles diuers put execucio thesame place fame battayll slayne xm men least erle warwycke lay tyme castell warwycke cominge houge host nexte day towarde armye lyncolneshyre hard saye foughte soner thought either could woulde hys partye ouerthrowen vanquyshed although might discoraged yet thought necessary dissimule cace oftentymes battayles vayn thinges regarded trew thentet comfort certayn company beyng dispayre redy flee woorde dede conscribed prepared new host studye industrye coulde practise vse imagened compasse thomas lord stanley maried hys syster might one confederacy coniuracion whyche thynge coulde bryng passe lord stanley hadde aunswered plainly woulde neuer make warre kig edwarde thought spende lenger tyme waste mistrustyng able mete hys enemyes duke clarence hys sonne lawe departed exceter taryenge dayes perceyuynge thynges lacked whiche apt necessary warre determined sayle kyng loys french kyng renew familier acquayntaunce whiche hym ambassade mariage kynge edward haue hard hauyng sure cofidence hope either haue great ayde frenche kyng el incense hym earnestly make battayll agaynst kyng edwarde restyng vpon opinion hyred shippes dartmouth deuonshyre well armed poyntes trymmed decked wynde wether serued theym duke erle wyues great number seruauntes plucked vp sayles toke waye fyrst toward caleys erle warwycke chefe capitayn thought haue left hys wyfe doughters tyll returned fraunce ix yere erle warwicke thus fled englandthe ix yere yere lorde iust yere kyng edwardes reigne ix sodain departyng kyng edwardes aduersaries onely vexe bite hym stomacke also stimulat quicken hym loke diligently affaire busines especially absence erle warwicke made common people daily long bee desirous haue sight hym presetly behold personage thei iudged sunne clerely taken worlde absent suche high estimacio emongest people name neither one manne thei muche honor neither one persone thei muche praised cloudes highly extolled shall saie onely name sounded euery song mouthe common people persone represented greate reuerence publique play open triumphes bee hewed set furthe abrode stretes whiche hartie fauor apparant occasion faccion compaignie within fewe dayes merueilously increased augmented whiche cause kyng vexed double mischief doubted muche moste feare twoo either familier enemy abidyng home extrauagant fooes lyngeryng beyonde sea chiefly prouided lackly withstande erle warwickes landyng first wrote charles duke burgoyn whiche maried lady margaret suster helpe therle compaignie haue neither aide refuge part fre de territory dominion tidynges ioyfull duke burgoyne hym whiche accordyng olde prouerbe hated erle warwicke worse curre dogge serpent partly ouerthrower confounder house lancastre whiche erle linially discended duches mother partly therle suche high office renoumed englande kyng edward duke brother lawe might liberally thynges realme hymself would whiche duke estemed greate bondage partly erle stoode power might conclusion mariage betwene kynges suster thesaid duke chief rancor erle warwicke fauored frenche kyng duke loued last beeyng fraunce promised frenche kyng frende frendes vtter enemie fooes aduersaries roted hatered cankarde malice whiche duke bare erle caused hym attempte mo displeasure inuent mo mischiefes therle either kyng edward could imagyn duke required shall plainly perceiue sequele historie let v speake erle warwickes doynges whiche muste nedes plaie pagtaunt enterlude el plaie wer apoynt erle haue hard sailed dartmouth toward caleis capitain generall prosperous wynd came toune whiche fortresse deputie erle lorde uaw lere gascoyne beside diuerse therle warwickes seruauntes whiche bare great office aucthorities toune uaw clere whether dissimulacion bearyng good mynde kyng edward sequele hereof doubte whether stede receiuyng master triumphe bent discharged hym diuerse peces ordinaunce sendyng hym worde take lande nauie liyng thus caleis ancrethe duches clarece deliuered soonne vpon sea toune caleis duches clarence deliuered faire sonne whiche child therles deputie vnneth would suffre christened within ye toune without greate intreatie would permit twoo flagon wine bee conueighed aborde lady liyng hauen greate rigor extremitie seruaunt vse master inferior vse superior wherefore erle hoped nothyng lesse mistrusted assured purueyed place whiche greatest treasure belongeth englande fairest capitainship worlde least christendom fain kepe sea without comfort aide seruauntes kyng englande quickely aduertised refusall mosire de uaw lere made capitain therle warwicke whiche manful doyng muche pleased kyng incotinent made hym hier capitain toune caleis letter patentes whiche sent hand therof discharged clerely therle traitor rebell duke charles burgoyn liyng sent homer whiche would nedes haue ower erle warwickes boate beyng aduertised also monsire de uawcleres refusall made master sent hym trustie seruaunt philip de commines whiche wrote al doynges chronicle gaue hym yerely thousand crounes pencion small reward god wotte high seruice vntruly kepe master office praiyng requiryng hym continue truth fidelitie toward kyng edward shewed begonne messenger founde hym towarde suche conformitie content sweare presence truly take kyng edwardes part men onely vse kepe defend strong toune caleis thesaied phillip de commines sore mistrusted monsire de uawclere sent worde erle warwicke priuily liyng whitsandbay landed taken lost al england said toke part hym duke burgoin thinhabitantes toune wer enemy lorde dura kynges marshall retinue garrison wer aduersaries finall conclusion onely sauegarde comforte withdrawe hym compaignie fraunce knewe bee highly receiued better welcomed toune calice take thought thesaid monsire de uawclere promised thereof make hym good reconyng tyme opportunitie serue counsaill profitable erle warwicke kyng englande lesse pleasant duke burgoyn prince might well thynk bothe office capitainship caleis pecion crounes wer paied suche depe dissimuler euill employed erle warwicke bothe departure englande determined also monsire de uawclere newly counsailed aduised nauie sailed toward normandy meane waie robbed spoyled tooke many riche shippes duke burgoyns countreys whiche sore netteled duke caused hym prepare strong greate armie sea take therle prisoner returned homeward last nauie spoyle tooke lande depe normandy gouernor countrey frenche kyng frendely welcomed hym louyngly hym entertained certifiyng kyng lewes landyng arriuall kyng lewes greate ceason muche merueiled publique fame common renoume noble actes high prowes erle warwike thought nothyng might pleasauntly happe chaunce towarde hym haue cause occasion hym ministered wherby might erle profite pleasure whiche long lust accordyng desire likely take effecte contentacion erles greate commoditie wherefore beyng ioyous landyng france sent vnto hym certain prince whiche declared hym kynges behalf kyng long tyme sought way meanes hym plesure aide comfort seyng tyme come erle necessitie thynges assured hym would neither forget hym yet desist thyng whiche might consonaunt louyng request frendly desire requiryng hym duke sonne law take pein come castle amboys set riuer leyre affirmyng ythei neither lose labor thynke iorney haue euill successe conclusion duke charles knewe therle landed normandie sent hast poste kyng lewes ioyned league requiryng hym neither help men money erle warwicke duke clarece open enemy kyng edwarde felowe frende brother lawe perpetuall alye trustie confederate addyng therto sharpe woordes minatorie saiynges would case refuge succor frenche kyng onely contempne proude wordes laughed manacyng blode braggyng soberly answered without enfringyng league treatie lawfully might would helpe frendes especiall suche whiche desertes bee aboue renoumed extolled whiche nombre affirmed therle warwicke one whiche thyng saied neither cost charge burthen duke one blancke put hym pein moment houre duke certified kyng englande answer sodainly dompe began seriously immagyne frendes foe apprehended thought gyltie began question frendes enemis coniuracion occasion many fearyng themselfes fled vnto sanctuary many trustyng kynges pardon submitted yelded theimself kynges clemencie emongest ihon marque montacute humbly yelded hymself vowed bee euer true kyng doen tyme muche humanitie faire woordes receiue intertain intent flecte allure harte men ioyne knit hym hostilitie vtter enemy thynges thus treated englande therle warwicke duke clarence rode greate pompe toward amboyse frenche kyng laie way people gathered greate nombre flocked se beholde iyes persone visage hym whose valiant actes wonderfull dooynges eares haue many tymes fulfilled replenished whe came kynges presence kyndes curtesie humanitie receiued welcomed long tracte tyme declared cause consideracions commyng fraunce kyng lewes aswell hauyng nowe delectacion presence frende accustomed reioyse bee ioyous harde either laude praise hym absence promised hym power rich thynges might could doo helpe hym trouble refreshe hym aduersitie quene margarete whiche soiorned duke reyner father called kyng scicile c harde tell erle warwicke duke clarence abandoned englande wer come frenche courte hopyng newe comfort diligence came amboyse onely sonne prince edward came iasper erle penbroke ihon erle oxenford whiche diuerse long imprisonmentes lately escaped fled englande fraunce came fortune assemble thei hadlong comoned debated diuerse matter concernyng suretie wealthe thei determined meane frenche kyng conclude league treatie betwene first begin sure foundacion newe amitie edward prince wale wedded anne second daughter therle warwicke whiche lady came mother fraunce mariage semed staunge wise men consideryng erle warwicke first disherited father cause sonne mary one daughter whose suster duke clarence maried euer extreme enemie house lancastre wherevpon thei ned mariage prince euer blot duke iye mariage duke mote iye prince eche lokyng exalted therle hym smiled eche thinkyng ouer throwen erle hym lowred mariage duke therles toke solempne othe thei neuer leaue warre vntill suche tyme kyng henry sixt prince sonne restored full possession diademe realme quene prince depute appoynt duke erle gouernors conseruators publique wealthe till suche tyme prince come mannes estate habilitie meete conuenient take vpon hym high charge greate burden many condicions concluded whiche bothe reason weightines great busines required setforward lordes wer thus frenche courte landed caleis damosell belongyng duches clarence saied whiche made monsire de uawclere beleue sent kyng edward erle warwicke plain ouerture declaracio peace whiche tidynges uawclere glad erles sake thought peace bee restored old possession rome dignity sore damosel deceiued message proued beginnyng erles confusion perswaded duke clarence neither naturall honorable hym either condiscende take parte house yorke whiche lineally discended set vp house lancastre whiche lignage house yorke whole parliament realme declared indubitate heires kyngdome also kyng henry sixte bloud affirmed thesame therevpon made composicion whiche record appereth farthermore declared mariage therles daughter prince edward none cause make prince kyng clerely extingishe house yorke duke hymself one next heire croune eldest brother child reason mariage prince erles daughter sancke duke stomacke promised returne extreme enemie brother taken whiche promise afterwarde forget answere dampsell departed englande therle warwicke therof beyng clerely ignoraunt league concluded haue harde frenche kyng lent shippes money men thei mighte surer saile englande appoynted bastard burgoyn admirall fraunce greate nauie defende armie duke burgoyne whiche stronger bathe frenche kynges nauie englishe flete kyng reyner also help daughter smal power menne muni ion warre armie whiche small conscribed come together harflete mouthe riuer seyne expectyng wind wether erle warwicke receiued letter englande men muche daily hourely desired wished sore arriuall returne almoste men harnesse lokyng landyng wherefore required make hast yea hast hast although brought succor hym farther assured assone taken lande mete hym many thousandes proued deede doo hym seruice pleasure thei could might offer comon people beside diuerse noble men wrote help hym harnesse money thynges necessary warre beside awne persones thei promised aduenture querell therle receiued letter litle regardyng suche offre many greate benefites hym euen hande apparauntly proffered fully determined duke th e le oxenford penbroke quene margaret sonne fully yet furnished suche iorney go part nauie part tharmie attempt first brunte fortune chaunce whiche well succeded quene margerete soonne residue nauie people followe englande erle warwicke thynkyng weightie matter worthy ly gered accelerate al diligence possible takyng leue freche kyng lewes geuyng hym small thankes bothe behal e kyng henry also awne parte beyng dismissed came nauie laye anker commaundyng men go shippe borde myndyng take course toward englande duke burgoyn whiche content therle warwicke compaignie succored aided french kyng brother lawe kyng edward englande withstande armie take therle warwicke prisoner possible prepared suche greate nauie lightly hath sene gathered maner nacions whiche armie laie mouthe seyne ready fight therle warwicke set harborowe se worke god thesame night therle departed ther rose suche sodain wynde terrible tempest duke shippes wer scatered one another drouned wether driuen scotlande two wer compaignie together one place mornyng next folowyng wether wexed faire wynde prosperous wherupo hope bone voiage erle company halsed vp sayles good spede laded dartmouth deuonshyre place passed frauce almost vj monethe last passed tyme duke burgoyne charles hated erle warwycke enuied prosperitie loued kyng edward sauyng ayde trusted tyme necessitie wrote kynge edwarde bothe doynges erle warwycke fraunce hys armye power also certefied hym hys trusty seruautes place erle purposed people take lande kynge edward passed litle matter trustynge much mouable common realme without anye army layd either kepe erle landyng either encoutre wyth hym first arryuall e tent fredes draw hepes hym hys strength left purueiance defece alone rode huntyng hawkyng vsing maner pastime ladyes damosel disport solace coulde imagened inuented erle warwycke taken lade made proclamation name kyng henry vi vpon high paynes commaunding charging men apt able bere armour prepare self fight edward duke yorke contrarye al right iustice law vntrewly vsurped croune imperial dignite realme almost incredible thinke sone fame erles landyng blowen ouer thorow al whole realme many thousand men warre first tidinges landing sodaynly assembled set forwarde welcome thus according hys desire fully furnished euery syde kynred frendes toke way towarde london iudged faythfully beleued fynde open frendes priuie enemy cancard harte kyng edward knew erles landynge great repayre people incessantly without intermission dyd resorte began thynke busines studied fynd remedy mischief late first wrote duke burgoyne requyring hym haue vigylant eye sea se stremes kept scoured nauie erle neither might returne agayn fraunce shoulde agayne propulsed realme doynges englande bad let hym alone puissance abilitie sufficient ouercome defende al enemy rebelles within awne realme countrey saiyng littel nothing pleased duke burgoyne messenger thought bene muche profitable kyng edward haue circumspectly forsene afore prouided stoppe landyng sodaynly abide fortune battayle euer dubious vncertayne kynge edward accompanyed duke glocester brother lord hastynges chamberleyn maried erles sister yet euer trew kyng master lord scale brother quene sent currier al trustye frendes fornyture able person mete warre conueniente defence awne royall person entending might pollicie subtill engyn circuuent trappe erle warwycke knowing perfitly mastred chief belwether flocke wolde sone dispercled sent fewe effect came yet came willyng came willingly betrusted came feare muche doughted come greatest heddes wynked sayd could ment would come kyng edward beyng perplexitie diffidence reysyng army trusty frendes departed lyncolnshyre consulting best done sodainly fully determined certayn purpose newes brought hym townes countrey adiacent great rore made fiers sang songes cryeng kynge henry kyng henry warwycke warwycke king edward much abashed new tidynges especials explorators declared accopted hym realme vp open proclamacion comaunded make warre agaynst hym enemy kynge henry realme wherfore hys nere frendes aduised admonished hym flye ouer sea duke burgoyne hys brother lawe tary tyll god fortune sende better luck chaunce beyng somwhat ruled consayll much quickened hauyng knowlege erles warwyckes power within halfe dayes iorney lesse hys tayle hast possible passed wasshes greater ieopardye besemed prince came towne lynne founde english shyp ij hulkes hollad redy fortune wolde make sayle take iorney wherupon beyng maruelous agonye doughtyng mutabilite townes men takyng farther leysure sure succor sauegard brother duke glocester lord scale diuers trusty frendes entered shyp without bagge bagage without clothe sacke male perchaunce great purse littel treasure leyser prouyde according degree estate lord chamberlayne taryed whyle exhortyng hys acquayntance necessitie tarye behynde shew self openly fredes parte aduerse awne sauegard hartely requiryng priuelie cotinew harte trew kyng edward frendly persuasion declared entered ship redy depart yere lordes blessed incarnacion mvclxx ix yere kynge edward one smal shyp hys awn ii hulkes vij viijc persones hauyng rayment apparel warre smal store money sayled toward holland tyme easterlynges mortal enemyes aswell englishman frenche nacion done ye last yeres past much preiudice domage englishe marchantes bothe takyng spoylyng shyppes kyng sayle ower makynge course fast coulde possible easterlyuges whiche many shippes warre sea hym espied accordyng olde prouerbe one yll commeth neuer alone vii viii gallant shyppes began chace kyng copany kynges shyp good sayle much gat easterlinges came coast holland discended lower towne holland called alquemare cast ancker nere towne possible coulde enter hauen ebbyng water easterlynges also approched englishe shippe nere great shyppes coulde come lowe water entendynge fludde haue obteyned pray likely monsieur de gronture gouernour duke charles holland season bene personally present party miserable chaunce strauge lucke happen sodaynly kyng especiall kyng owne valyantnesse prowes ouercome foe destroyed enemyes v vi great mortal battayles fyrst persecuted exiled expulsed hys awne realme kyngdom hys awne seruantes subiectes kynsmen secondarely beyng destitute helpe consolacion flyeng onely frende brother law duke charles refuge comfort chased sea hys mortall enemyes deadly foe lyke taken prisoner brought captiuitie thyng happened god woulde lyen long vnraunsoned kyng henry beyng restored hys pristinate estate dignitie royall el dyed prisoner greate wretchednes misery soure sauce tasted penaunce hys wanton liuyng negligent ouersey g thinges mighte well haue forsene preuented mynd geuen pastyme dalyaunce sensuall pleasure forgat olde adage saynge tyme peace prouyde warre time warre prouide peace thyng either wel remebred politiquely prouided bene chaced expulsed realme within xi dayes dede onely excuse foly say much trusted fortune flatteryng thought neuer see chaunge yet haue dyce yll chaunce chestes checke mate kyng edward thus lyeng ancker great feare easterlinges good chaunce coforted great perplexite releued wist thesame tyme laye towne alquemare lord gronture chief gouernour hollande duke charles borgoyne beyng incontinent aduertised kynges arryuall also great ieopardy prohibited firste easterlinges wyse payne death intermit medle englishme duke frendes alies commaundement vexed troubled easterlinges makyng sure reconynge haue pray pryse kyng duke diuers baron ryche ge telmen cryed god rayled cursed duke hys officer rage halsed vp theyr sailes without expectatio good lucke departed home countray lorde gronture came borde shyppe kyng edward hym honorably saluted requyred come lad offering hi seruice al pleasure coulde imagine done kynge hym hartely thanked wel reuiued coforted wordes al hys company set lande wel refreshed lord gront lyke noble man cosideryng poore estate necessitie kyng people ministred habundantly thinges conuenient necessary accordyng euery man estate degree duke charge cost bene well refreshed newly apparreyled conduyted hage ryche towne holland arryued churche holy daye longe mychelmas lord gronture aduenture wrote duke hys master fyrst abasshed amased se erle warwyke whome hated cocodrylle haue vpperhande hys brother rather haue harde kynge edwardes death hys discomfiture especially erle warwycke whome feared
