disdayned one man liuynge yet willed lord gronture se hym hys company wel enterteyned hage tyll sent let englishman consider rehersed profyt commoditie helpe distresse mariage lady margarete kyng edwardes syster duke charles dyd hym hys extreme necessitie meane vncurable extremitie alyes coferates castell arragon farre hym either spedely flye shortely come fro ayde armye french kyng hys extreme enemye frende kynge henry whose cause kyng scottes leage betwene put littell confidence lesse truste stedes eastland hym open warre yet thys mariage god prouided hym place flye bothe refuge releue fame spred kynge edwardes flyenge innumerable people resorted erle warwycke take parte kyng edwardes trusty frendes went diuers sentuaries dayly lokyng howerly harkening heare health prosperous ret r e afterward serued hym manfully truly emongest quene elizabeth hys wyfe moste desperate comfort toke sentuarye westmynster great penurie forsake frendeskynge edward v borne sanctuary deliuered fayre sonne called edwarde small pope lyke pore man chyld christened baptised godfather beyng abbot pryor westmynster godmother lady scrope kentyshmen thys season whose wyttes euer mouable chaunge prynces came subberbes london spoyled house robbed berehouses counsayll syr geffray gate sentuary men brake vp kynges benche deliuered prisoner fell radclefe lymehouse sainct katherynes burnynge house flaughter people rauishyng woman small sparcle growen greater flame erle warwycke greate power sodaynly quenched punyshed offendors whiche benefite hym done caused hym much praysed accepted emonges common setteled put order thinges according thought conuenient upo xij daye october rode towre london whiche without resistence deliuered toke kyng henry vi warde kept brought kynges lodgyng serued accordyng degre xxv daye sayd moneth duke clarence accompanied erles warwycke shrewsbury lord stanley lordes gentelmen feare loue onely gase waueryng world resorted greate company towre london thence great pompe broughte kynge henry vi appareled longe gowne blew veluet hygh streates london cathedrall church sainct paule people right hand left hand reioysing cryeng god saue kynge though thyng succeded would haue offered k nges vse conueyed palleys bishop london kept hys housholde lyke kynge kyng henry vi thus readepted meaneskyng henry vi agayne restored kyngly e ate onely erle warwycke hys croune dignitie royall yere oure lorde newly many ouerthrowes beginnynge reygne lykely within short space fall agayn taste accustomed captiuitie vsuall misery yll chauce misfortune many me opinios happened hym man great wit suche men comonly call innocent man neither foole neither wyse whose study always excell godly liuynge vertuous example worldly regiment temporall dominion much coparison study delectacion vertue godlines littel regarded manner despised al worldly power temporal authoritie syldome folow seke person fro flye disdayne take hys enemy ascribed hys coward stommack afferming man apt purpose mete enterprise neuer small euer dispiseth dispraiseth comon people allow marueyll often taken mad vndiscrete person notwithstandyng vulgare opinio foloweth loueth embraseth contrary doth proue bothe sad wyse verifieng salomon prouerbe wisedom world folishenes god ascribe infortunitie onely stroke punishment god afferming kyngdome whiche henry iiij hys grandfather wrongfully gat vniustly possessed agaynst kyng rychard ii heyres could diuyne iustice longe contynew iniurious stocke therfore god diuine prouidence punished offence grandfather sonnes sonne kyng henry thus obteined agayn possession dominion realme called hygh court parliament begyn xxvi day nouember westmynster whiche kyng edwarde declared traytor hys coutrey vsurpor realme vniustly taken hym croune scepter hys gooddes cofiscate adiudged forfayted lyke sentence geuen agaynst hys partaker fredes beside enacted extreme punishment done without delay ouer suche person cause taken apprehended either captiuitie went large vpon trust suerties emongest lord ihon typtoft erle worcester lieuetenant king edward ireland excercisinge extreme crueltie fame wet princely pitie charitable copassion especial ii enfantes sonnes erle desmod either treason layed malice agaynst hym conceyued atteynted behedded besyde estatutes made kyng edward clerely reuoked abrogated made frustrate crounes realmes england frauce authoritie thesame parliament entayled kyng henry vi heyres male hys body lawfully begotten default suche heyre male body begotten sayd crounes dignity entayled george duke clarence theyres male hys bodye lawfully engendred farther sayd duke authoritie aforesayd enabled next heyre hys father richard duke yorke take discent hym hys landes dignity preheminences though ben hys eldest sonne heyre tyme death iasper erle penbroke ihon erle oxenford diuers kyng edward attaynted restored theyr olde name possession auncient dignity kepe euen longe myght beside erle warwycke one whome commo welthe much beholden made ruler gouernor realme felow compaignion associated george duke clarence sonne law meanes whole estate realme publique wealth thesame wer newly altred chaunged yea maner clerely trans igured transmuted parliament came lorde marque montacute excusyng hymself onely feare death declined kyng edwardes patte whiche excuse accepted obteined pardon whiche destruccion hym brother manfully appartly taken kyng edwardes parte surely beyng open enemie muche lesse hurted beyng fained false coloured frende suche thynges wee se iyes bee well ware seldome thynges knowen v hurt preiudice quene margaret erle warwicke sailed englande euer forcastyng doubtyng chaunce might happen neuer cease praie god sende victory frendes confederate whiche knewe husbandes letter bee obteigned prince edwarde sonne trayne entered shippes take voyage englande wynter sore wether stormie wynde contrariant fain take lande defer iorney till another season enemy saied goddes iuste prouision whiche occasion many battailes muche manslaughter englande neuer returne thether doo mischief frendes otherside said kept awaie iorney empeched sorcerer necromanciers thus mennes immaginacions ranne toungues clacked season iasper erle penbroke went wale visite countie penbroke found lorde henry sonne brother edmond erle richmond hauyng fully ten yeres age complete whiche kept maner like captiue well honorably educated kynde ciuilitie brought vp lady harbert late wife willyam erle penbroke beheded banbery haue hard lorde henry kyng richarde brother kyng edwarde vanquished ouerthrowen obteined croune regalitie realme wee ought beleue bee sent god hym onely bee prouided kyng extinguishe bothe faccions partes kyng henry vi kyng edwarde iiii whiche almoste brought nobilitie realme finall destruccion vtter decaye consideryng exalted dignitie nothyng mynded one thyng studie applied henry borne margaret onely doughter heire ihon first duke somerset beyng fully xiiii yeres age whiche lady margaret although conioyned mariage lorde henry sonne humfrey duke buckyngham thomas sta ley erle darby bothe beyng lustie age mete generacio yet afterward brought furthe fruite though dooen part sufficiently haue borne one man child thesame kyng iasper erle penbroke toke child beyng nephew custodie lady harbert returne brought childe london kyng henry sixte kyng good space hymself secretly beholden marked bothe wit likely towardnes saied suche prince hym lothis kyng henry seuent surely bothe wee aduersaris leuyng possession thynges shall hereafter geue rome place holy man shewed chaunce happen erle henry ordeined god tyme come deede haue enioye kyngdome whole rule realme haue shewed thynges wer doen englade kyng henry obteined newe possession old kyngdome thynkyng surely haue possessed enioyed thesame lenger season either could aduersaries bee permitted suffered must congruent necessitie declare vnto greate perplexitie sodain trouble multiplicitie immaginacions landyng kyng edward friseland brought encombered charles duke burgoyn fraudulently awne auauntage dissimuled first kyng edward partie aduerse openly denied aide kyng edwarde priuily ministered ample large succor hym thynke would thynges forgotten wherfore must call remembraunce duke charles haue hard greate intelligence monsire de uawclere list hymself called either chief capitain caleis el deputie capitain erle warwicke whiche promised hym duke pencion yerely thousande crounes intent stande still true kyng edward relinquishe kyng henry especial abandon therle warwicke duke although smal confidence rather greate diffidence othe promise mosire de uawclere thought necessary knowe case caleis stode mutacios wer next neighbor tyme bulleyn bullenoys artoys handes duke charles pledge deliuered father rehersed wherfore al hast sent kyng edward spake hym sent trustie counsailer phillip de commines accompaignied twoo gentle men caleis whiche twoo gentleme fauoredmore partie lancastre yorke lorde arge ton met people countrey bullenois fliyng euery parte like wylde dere erle warwicke lately sent caleis foure hudred archer horsebacke whiche forraied spoyled countrey bullenoys duke messenger whiche sene soda mutacion worldly thynges durst kepe iorney thesame night taried turnoham sent monsire de uawclere saueconduite also wrote duke feare thei duke sent woorde phillip de commes spede passe toward caleis thei wer taken would shortly raunsom bye redeme theim passed litle either pein seruaut charge expence purpose might bee serued woorde brought messenger turnehan thesame tyme thei receiued letter monsire de uawclere louyng wordes gracious termes declaryng thei might safely come frely departe thei wer liberally accustomed sir phillip compaignions came caleis without meting solempne entertainment contrary tholde fashion sene whe thei entered toune thei might perceiue euery man therle warwickes badge euery dore wer set white cross ragged staues time poyses whiche purported frenche kyng erle warwicke wer al one thynges semed straunge nothyng pleasaunt burgonions lorde uawclere sent diner next day beyng wel accompaignied cappe white ragged staffe gold enameled many could haue neither gold siluer silke cloth badge taken vp within one quarter houre newes came england suche mutacion comon people like rede euery wind agitable flexible burgonios laie thus caleis thei knowlege therle warwicke prepared iiiim valiaunt men make frontier warre duke countreis whereof poste thei certified duke whiche fumed smoked matter wist neither well aske confortable wholesome counsaill warre compelled haue frenche kyng whiche taken certain tounes succoured kyng edward sure erle warwicke haue p e lefte kyng edward confederate alie tyme tribulacion discon olate destitute aid succo r worlde hym might speake shame vnfaithfulnesse dishonor duke well aduised matter wrote messenger thei require haue league made betwene twoo realmes kept obserued diuerse priuie instruccions phillip de comines beyng wise well learned declared counsaill cal duke master alitle marueiled englishemen ouer runne destroye countreis hauyng aleague sure strong many wordes efficacie enfor ed lately made betwene twoo countreis territory dominion affermyng mutacion prince dissolucio league although prince named chief contractor euery treatie amitie concluded yet countreis bounden subiectes shall make recompence thynge bee altered wrongfully course rather obtein desire thei caused merchauntes gooddes englande beyng duke countreis attached redresse spoyle english men dooen duke countrey whiche sore greued merchauntes muche hindered voyage beside mercha te staple caleis wrote kyng erle warwicke wolle fell caleis sold vttered wont greatest part wherof bought duke subiectes vassal redy money souldiers garrison lacke wage king paied custome merchaunt conclusion stande aduenture bothe losse stocke credence perswasions mollified therle warwickes mynde especially kyng greate store money furnishe caleis al store surely duke burgoyne league litle disturbed geuously molested consideryng thynges correspondent tyme therles appetite content thus condescended agreed alyaunce made betwene realme englande duke dominion still remain muiolated sauyng stede edwarde bee put kyng name henry conclusion thus brought ende came euen man would wishe passe duke burgoyns purpose tyme frenche kyng wonne hym faire toune amia sainct quintines duke haue war bothe frauce england likely haue shortely poore duke el vtterly vndoen brought destruccion pacifie please erle warwicke neuer loued lesse fauored wrote louyngly hym declaryng lineally descended naturally procreated noble stocke familie lancaster graund mother beyng daughter high mightie prince ihon gaunt duke lancastre nature obliged aliance enforsed support honor maintein defend thesaid noble house lignage duryng life euer hath doen bothe worde deede maner persones estate promisyng beare good harte louyng mind frendly fauor kyng henry sixte sequele prince potentate many flatteryng termes glosyng wordes faire promise thynke neither duke hymself inwardly mynded yet erle outwardly beleued returne kyng edward beyng duke burgoyns lande whiche although wer countrey yet neuer dispaire ferme hope haue mature ready occasion geuen obtein kyngdome dominion shorte space partly hoped greate helpe brother lawe duke burgoyn partly daily solicited letter message men faccion englande returne spede promisyng hym compaignie comforte many wer whiche either feare rigor lawe whiche thei offended el disdainyng worlde altered el beyng brought kyng edwardes fauor hope excercise pollyng rome thei fliyng englande daily came englande prouoked hym take iorney homward kyng edward maner rauished golden promise came duke burgoyn toune sent poll declared hym greate intelligence realme englad assured fredes thesame requiryng hym aide hym spede onely truste sole hope relife hym beyng onely brother law eche beyng compaignion others order kyng ware golden flees duke ware gartier duke somerset whiche cosin germain remoued duke burgoyn brought vp pencion duke house surely duke burgoin loued better house lancastre house yorke sore labored contrary affirmyng vngodly vnprincely vnnaturall exalte set vp straunger hauyng right depose depriue naturall kynsman hauyng iuste title discended hym kyng father kyng grandfather scepter regalitie duke charles greate perplexitie knowyng well say whether consanguinitie preuaile affinitie nature fauor willyng might displease bothe party warre ouert nose frenche kyng concluded openly intendyng another thyng secretly aide duke somerset hym takyng certain promise thynges doen erle warwicke thei espie time moste propice conuenient duke somerset ioyous newes sailed englande made report kyng henry kyng edward presente heard determinacion whiche brought hym great heauines depe perplexitie beit priuely aduertised frende cloked dissimulacions onely cause duke charles would nowise haue warre bothe realmes thesaid duke put worse vanquished frenche kyng able neither aide succor king edward wherfore blind al frenche kyng whiche sore desired duke might haue warre englande knewe enterprise halfe gotten duke declared openly would nowyse minister succor kyng edward streightly chargyng commau dyng vpon pein harte man passe sea hym armie al proclamacion notwithstandyng duke saw kyng edward vpo hope frendes would nedes repaire englande hauyng copassion vnfortunate chaunce caused priuily deliuered hym fiftie florence crosse sainct andrewe caused foure greate shippes bee appoynted hym hauen uere zelande whiche fre al men come duke hired farther hym xiiii shippes esterlynges well appoynted suretie toke bonde serue truly till wer landed englande xv day whiche returnyng esterlynges glad trustyng meane obteined po ession realme thei shoud soner come concord peace rest cion liberty franchise whiche thei claimed haue within englande duke burgoyn men reported cared muche whose side victory fell sauyng paim money would oft saie frend bothe partes eche parte trendly hym x yerethe x yere kyng edwarde beeyng thus furnished thought nothyng peinfull wretched tariyng one daie lenger nothyng bee desired celerite saile toward countrey whervpon hauyng hym onely iim men warre beside mariner spryng yere yere lorde thesame season duke burgoyn went fight frenche kyng amia sailed englandekyng edwardes landyng came cost yorke shire place called rauenspurt settyng men lande consulted capitaines knowe place thei first succor resort vnto imagined waie could hym sure hauyng small compaignie souldiours long debatyng concluded diuerse persones hauyng light horse skoure countrey euery side se perswasions thei might allure harte rusticall vplandishe people take kyng edwardes part aud harnes querel whiche diligence folowed comission semeth somewhat leane truthe kyng edward beyng wise circuspecte prince would haue foolishe hardy enter englande halfe handfull men warre excepte sure spedy succor faithfull frendship whiche argument doubte duke clarence secretly agreed marque montacute secretly procured fauor whiche priuie signes cloked workynges open token manifest doynges afterward appered light horseman whiche sent aboute thei felte myndes entente rude people muche thei might thei returned kyng edward nexte daie makyng relacion tounes rounde aboute wer permanent stiffe parte kyng henry could bee remoued folye farther solicite attempt considerynge moued exhorted bee trew kynge edwarde one man durste speke feare erle warwycke aunswere kynge edwarde perfitly digested necessitie chaunged hys purpose clayme restored croune kyngdome england nowe caused published onely claymed duchie yorke ye entent requyryng nothyng bothe trew honest might obtayne fauor common people almost incredible se effect new imaginacion thoughe fayned sorted toke immediatly vpon fyrst opening power hath iustice euer emogest men whe blowen abrode kyng edwardes desyre farther nothyng couetyng desyre kyngdome royall dominion erthelye promocion desyred hys iust patrimony lyn enheritance men moued mercye compassion began hande either fauor hym el resist mighte obteyne hys duchye yorke founde meanes pacifie men myndes reconcile harte determined take hys iorney toward yorke went beuerley erle warwycke lay warwykeshyre beyng enformed king edward landed goyng toward yorke hast wrote marque montacute hys brother whiche lyen castell pomfret laste wynter great company souldears geuynge hym warnyng aduertesyng perill whole affayres flode enemy obtayne possessio entre citie yorke willyng commaunding set kyng edward expedicion byd battayle el kepe passage passe farther tyll hym self gathered greater host diligence assemblynge come ioyne hys brother marque erle knew way hys enemy wolde take iorney wrote townes yorkeshyre citie also commaundyng men kynges behalfe redy harnes shutte gate kynges enemyes kyng edward without wordes spoken came peaceably nere yorke whose commynge citiezens certefied without delay armed selfe came defende gate sendyng hym two chiefest alderman citie whiche ernestly admonished hym behalfe come one foote nerar temerariouslye enter great eopardy considering fully determined bent copell hym retract det swourd kyng edward markyng well message littell trobled vnquieted hys mynde driuen seke furthest poynt hys wit two mischeuous perilous chaunces euen hys eye hard euaded refelled one go backe agayn feared lest rurall commen people coueteousnes pray spoyle would fall hym one fled away feare reade shoulde procede farther hys iorney myght citiezens orke issue power sodaynly circuuent hym take hym wherfore determined set forward neither army weapon lowly wordes gentel entreatynges requyryng hartely messenger sent declare citiezens came neither demaunde realme englande superioritie onely duchie yorke olde enheritance duchie might meanes readept recouer woulde neuer let passe hys memorie great benifite frendly gratuitie hym exhibited fayre wordes flatterynge speche dismissed messenger good spede hys folowed quickly almost ye gate sone ambassador citiezens heryng hys good answere ment entendyng nothynge preiudiciall kynge henry royall authoritie much mitigated cooled began commen hym walles willyng conuey hym selfe place without delay assured hym haue neither hurte damage gently speakyng men especialy suche alderman whome called worshipfull proper name saluted many fayre promise made exhorted desyred fauorable frendshyp frendly permissio might enter awne towne name title al whole daye consumed doutfull communicacion erne interlocution citiezens partely wone hys fayre wordes partly hope hys large promise fell pact conue cion kyng edward woulde swere entertayne hys citiezens yorke gentell sorte fa yon obedient faythfull kyng henryes commaundementes preceptes woulde receyue hym citie ayde cofort hym money kyng edward whome citiezens called onely duke yorke beyng glad fortunate chauncekyng edwardes othe obedience kyng henry vi next mornyng gate enter priest beyng redy say masse masse tyme receyuyng body blessed sauior solemply swearyng kepe obserue two article aboue mencioned agreed vpon far vnlike either entended purposed obserue plainly afterward men manifest euidetly perceyuyng toke nomore studye diligece one earthly thyng dyd persecute king henry spoile kingdome dayly sene aswel prince men lesser reputatio led blynd auarice deuelish ambicion forgettynge scruple conscience ende honestie vse take othe immortal god know perfitly shalbe broke violate hereafter othe fyrst made sworne yet person example thereof straunge fynde one tyme worthely scorged periurie much often tymes blot suche offence parentes punished sequele posteritie thynge may fortune speke lyfe rycharde iij cause shall arise may euidetly appeare progeny kyng edward scaped vntouched open periurie kyng edward appesed citiezens fury past entred citie clerely forgettinge othe first set garrison souldiers towne entent nothyng moued agaynst hym citezens gathered great host reason money whe thing redy according desyred enformed enemyes make great preparacion resist hym thought necessarie therefore spede diligence make hast toward london none left right way toward pomfret marque mo tagew army lay toke way right hand fully iiii myle cape enemyes whe saw made stirryng shewed selfe sight returned comen hygh way agayne littel beyonde campe came sauely towne notingham came syr william parre syr thomas borogh syr thomas montgomerie diuers hys assured frendes aydes caused hym fyrst coming make proclamacion hys owne name kyng edward iiii boldely sayng hym would serue man kynge proclamacion cast great shame dolor harte citezens yorke might apparently perceyue fraudulently seduced good wil vnhonestly might sayde deluded mocked fame blowen abrode kyng edward without detriment sauetyme come notyngham prince noble men sydes began fall hym fermely beleuyng either marque montacute beryng fauor kyng edwarde woulde hym encounter frayde set ouer geue battayl knowynge parte hys souldiers would enclyne soeuer occasion moste parte thought securitie auantage theim self take parte ioyne kyng edward beyng poyntes furnisshed men warre rather cleue kyng hery alwayes ieopardy lyfe lande kyng edward blame hym beynge good fortune animated army furnished poyntes came towne lecester heryng erle warwycke accompanied ihon erle oxford together warwycke great power determined set hym politiquely imagening preuent inue cion determined great haste remoue whole army hopyng surely either geue battayle either allure bryng side hys brother george duke clarence comen priuie place came confederate lest peraduenture illaquiated copased knowinge duke nothyng constant one mynd long permanent season tell erle warwycke displeased grudged agaynst brother marque lettynge kyng edward passe ware longe write hym self viguantlye prouided politiquely forsene thinges ye marque neuerthelesse power enemy first began gather neuer moued fote made resistence commaunded besydes thys suffered small number souldiers hys eye open sight without battayle passe wherfore erle consideryng kyng edward dayly encrease hys power runnyng ryuer goyng augmenteth thought moste necessary hym geue battayle spede therupon accersed called together hys army hast sent duke clarence ioyne hym conscribed assembled together great host london perceiued duke lyngered dyd thinges negligetly though doubt warre peace began somwhat suspect duke hys bretherne corrupted lately chauged therfore without delay marched forward toward couentry thentent set hys enemyes meane season kyng edward came warwycke founde people departed thence al diligence auauced power toward couentre playne citie pytched felde next day cam thither hys men set forwarde marshalled array valiatly bad erle battayle mistrustyng deceaued duke clarece dede kept hym selfe close within walles yet perfect worde duke clarence came forward toward hym great army kyng edward beynge also therof enformed raysed hys campe made toward duke lest might thought fraude cloked betwene kyng set hys battayles order though would fight without leger delay duke likewise whe eche host sight rychard duke glocester brother though bene made arbitrer betwene fyrst rode duke hym commoned secretly came kyng edward lyke secretnes vsed hym conclusion vnnaturall warre fraternall amitie concluded proclaymed leuyng armye weapo syde bretherne louyngly embraced familierly commoned together meruayll duke clarece small persuasion lesse exhortynge turned erle warwyckes parte haue hard thys marchandyse labored conduyted concluded damsell duke french court erles vtter confusion kyng edward caused proclaymed duke came hym taken hys trew frendes without fraude yll suspicion withstandyng semeth god dyd neither forgeue forget punishe duke condigne punishment violatyng brekyng hys othe solempnely aduysedly taken made erle warwycke god many yeres suffered hym lyke periured person dye cruell strau ge death concluded emongest iij brethern attempte therle warwycke fayre meanes might recosiled promise allured parte duke clarence sent diuers hys secret frendes first excuse hym acte done secondarely requyre hym take good ende whyle might kyng edward erle hard paciently duke message lord howe detested accursed cryenge cotrary othe promise fidelitie shamfully turned face confederate alies duke messenger gaue none aunswere leuer always lyke hym selfe lyke false periured duk fully determined neuer leue warre tyll either lost hys awne naturall lyfe vtterly extinguished put vnder foe enemyes thence kyng edward thus beyng furnished strong host went without maner diffidece mistrust toward lodon knowen duke clarence come hys brethern came together one knot citie suche feare rose sodaynly emongest citiezens dryue wittes ende knowing either say last feare compelled take kyng edwardes parte selfe season erle warwycke sent letter kyng henry duke somerset tharchebishop yorke hys counsayll kepe citie enemy handes space ii iii dayes comming enemy shortely woulde hande puyssant armye comaunded defended citie strongly small purpose citiezens thesame tyme began maturely consult parte folow indempnite conclusion considered kyng henry innocent person hym self apte moderate gouerne publique wealth realme syde kyng edward men document onely hys awne pollicie wyt wont order realme gouerne kyngdome farther kyng edward person able bothe defende hym selfe also hys iniurie hostilitie wherupon men glad leane hym take hys parte concluded take hys parte recryue hym citie determinacion beyng blowe abrode nature people euer delyte nouelties communaltie coulde compelled commaundement tarye home ranne hepes citie mete hym saluted hym kyng souereygne lord duke somerset kynge henryes fredes saw world thus sodaynly chaunged euery man fledde hast shyfted hym selfe leuyng kyng henry alone host sacrificed bishop palace london adioyning poules churchekyng henry vi agayne taken co mitted pryson knowing counsayll aske troble aduersitie clerely dulled appalled place kynge edward taken agayne committed prison captiuitie thys sodayne chaunge thesame day archebishop yorke entent people myght fermely stycke hys syde caused hym ryde london appareled gowne blewe veluet great company cryeng kyng henry kyng henry whiche sight asmuch pleased citiezens fier paynted wall warmed olde woman knowynge nyght hys tryumphynge shoulde iorned trymblynge hys solempnitie conuerted mournyng chauce hym prouided kyng edward returned london agayn xi daye april sixe monethes sayled flaunders fyrste callynge hym greate assemble people hyghly commeded fidelitie citiezens constantly bare unto hym rendryng alderman harty thankes kept cuased people continew permanent good myndes loyaltie toward hym blaming farther rebukynge well marchaunt straungers englishemen whome knew haue prested lente money kynge henry arrayenge settynge forth new armye agaynst hym greuously wyth terrible wordes declared theyr sedicious cryme trayterous offence good comforte expell feare released bothe punyshment theyr bodyes losse gooddes graunted theim pardon theyr faultes offence whiche gentell meane easy indulgencie reconciled hym harte whole multitude obteyning fayre louynge wordes whiche coulde haue acheued sharpe stroke blody woundes therle warwicke ponderyng gain whole battaill stode makyng haste diligence followed hisenemies hopyng thei wer let neuer litle stop tariyng way fight thei come lodon thought muche auauntage cosideryng perfightly knew citee bee destitute men warre defence haue maner municions set walles tower thei wer able abide siege cause euer thei inclined victorious stronger parte followyng enemy passed greate part iorney enformed kyng edward peaceably entered london taken sent kyng henry prison whiche thynges depely considered sawe al cauillacions necessitie wer brought ende thei must co mitted thasard chaunce one battaill wherefore rested army toune sainct albons partly refreshe souldiers partly take counsaill best dooe erles armie wer ihon duke excester edmond erle somerset ihon erle oxenford ihon marque montacute erle brother well knewe bee well mynded sore stomacke take parte lordes therefore stode doubt whether tyme might trust hym fraternall loue betwene washed awaie diminished suspicion euer opinion therle conceiued hym erle man past feare determined coragiously sette enemy sainct albones remoued village meane waie betwene london sainct albones called barnetbarnet felde beyng tenne mile distaunt bothe tounes toune standeth hill whose toppe faire plain twoo army ioyne together one part plain erle warwicke pitched feld tariyng enemy rumor erles commyng spred instant ouer london whiche quickened kyng edward litle wherefore spede adioyned hoste brought hym firste london compaignie elect picked chosen persones strong young mete assay beside new aide come hym harnesse weapon horse engine instrumentes mete warre neither forgatte slackly furnished shall saie determined clerely spende rich yea could imagyn vpon chaunce battaill firmely beleuyng conflict knit vp knot labor bryng hym quietnes puyssaunt armie marched forwarde put people vre thei might bee ready fight euer thei encouter enemy deuided theim foure partes brought hym also kyng henry sixte likelyhod intent either aduersaries seyng kyng stande prisoner captiuitie bee abashed discomfited hym el fortune battaill turne hym kyng henry hym bothe sauegard proteccio easter eue noone came barnet farre enemy encamped army least enemy compel hym fight night enuironed campe newe fortificacions trench tariyng night hym synguler profite enemy greate detriment consideryng lenger taried people came aide stronger power stronger power muche weaker part aduersaries whiche farre succor hoped newe relief comforte thus bothe army lodged night plain harnesse tentes nere together whiche neighyng horsses talkyng menne none bothe hostes could night take rest quietnes breakyng daie erle warwicke sette men raie maner right wyng set marque montacute erle oxenford certain horseman duke exceter toke left wyng middes betwene bothe set archer appointed duke somerset bee capitain set men order encoraged men fight many comfortable wordes willyng theim strike good fierce corage remembre thei fight onely libertie countrey tiraunte whiche wrongfully right inuaded subdued realme thei fight querell true vndubitate kyng cruell man torcious vsurper cause godly pitifull prince abhominable maqueller blou butcher title gentle liberall bountifull kyng extreme nigard coueteous extorcioner whiche cause good godly iust god iustice must bede shelde defence kyng edward likewise ordred battailes forward set duke gloucester middle ward hymself duke clarence hauyng kyng henry rule gouerne lorde hastynges led rereward besides three battales kept compaignie freshe men store whiche hym great pleasure dooen encoraged men saiyng aduersaries wer onely traitor realme spoylers pore commonaltie people destitute al grace good fortune good liuyng whiche mischeuous persones thei preuaile faintnesse harte gentleman richmen wer ieoperdy life meane men dounbt robbyng spoylyng inferior persones hasard perpetuall bondage andseruitude daie began spryng trompettes blewe vp coragiously battaill fiersly began archer firste shot bill men theim folowed kyng edward hauyng greater nomber men valiauntly set enemy erle otherside remembryng auncient fame renoume manfully withstode hym battaill bothe side sore fought many slain whose rome succeded euer freshe freshemen meane season men together care euer lokyng whiche waie fortune would encline erle warwicke long fight wisely perceiue men ouer pressed multitude aduersaries wherfore caused newe men relief theim fought forward reason whiche succor kyng edwardes parte gaue litle backe whiche cause lokers fighter galoped london saiyng therle wonne feld whiche thyng kyng edward perceiue diligence sent freshe men succor battaill wer fierce dedly crueller bloudy feruent firie yet thei fought mornyng almoste noone without part gettyng auauntage kyng edward beyng wery long conflict willyng se end caused greate crewe freshe men whiche onely pollicie kepte daie store set enemy maner beyng wery fatigate although erle sawe newe succor freshe newe men netre battaill beyng nothyng afraied hopyng victory knowyng perfitly kyng edwardes power co forted men beyng wery sharpely quicknyng earnestly desiryng hardy stomackes bere last finall brunt battaill felde euen ende souldiers beyng sore wounded weried long conflict geue litle regard wordes beyng manne mynde inuincible rushed middest enemy auentured farre awne compaignie kil sley aduersaries could rescued middes enemy strike doune slain marque montacute thynkyng succor brother whiche sawe greate ieoperdy yet hope obtein victory likewise ouer throwen slain erle ded parte fled many taken one man name nobilitie aucthors write battaill fought nere hande kyng edward constrained fight awne person fought sore man partie erle warwicke whiche wont euer ride horsebacke place place ranke ranke comfortyng men aduised marque brother relynquishe horse trie extremitie hande stroke horsebacke might fortune haue escaped ende richard neuell erle warwickethe death therle warwicke whose stoutestomacke inuincible corage many straunge fortune perilous chaunces hym escaped caused death came old age priuilie stele hym darte take hym worldly mundain affeccions death one thyng life could death rest peace quietnes tranquillitie whiche life euer abhorred could suffre abide bothe partes wer slain battaill tenne men prisoner nomber could certainly knowen kynges part wer slain sir humfrey burchier soonne lorde barnes el man estimacion occasion greate slaughter kyng edward wont battaill obteined crie saue co mon kill capitaines spared theim thei onely highly fauored therle warwicke also thei came erle hym battaill feld ended duke somerset ihon erle oxenford wer poste hast fliyng towarde scotlande feryng ieoperdies might chaunce long iorney altered purpose turned wale iasper erle penbroke euery man fled whether mynde serued hym duke excester muche difficultie escaped westminster disguised toke sanctuary kyng edward victory al though wanne without greate effusion bloud aswell awne parte parte enemy greatly reioysed comforted ter maner victorious conqueroure leadyng hym kyng henry like captiue moste triumphant maner easter daie noone made entery solempnly citie london churche sainct paule offered standerd rendered almightie god greate victory moste huble hartie thankes ded body erle marque brought london coffin thei bee buried space three day thei laie open visaged cathedral church paule thintet men might euidently perceiue thei vnfainedly dedde least peraueture common people hereafter dissimulyng persone take hym name therle warwicke thynkyng liuyng might stirre newe sedicion excite vnware rebellion common people saied kyng iocound ioyous destruccion therle sorow ull dolorus death marque bothe knewe appered inwardly faithfull frend whose onely sake caused bothe body bee auncesters solempnly enterred priory bissain meane season quene margaret hauyng knowlege thynges englande altered brought trouble broyle reason kyng edwardes late returne realme gathered together small compaignie hardy valiaunt souldiours determined hast diligence prince edwarde soonne saile englande yet suche destinie beyng letted lacke prosperous wynd encombered muche rigorous tempeste daie faire common prouerbe saieth landed port weymouth dorset shire passed sea taken lande declared kyng edward gotten garland kyng henry husband desolately left post lone taken prisoner erle warwicke brother bothe slain ded armie destroyed scatered taken conclusion parte susteined moste bitter plague scorge consideryng bothe chauce tyme many yeres red sene harde miserable chaunces misfortune sodainly one anothers necke haue taken effect like woman dismaied feare fell ground harte perced sorowe speache maner passed spirites tormented malencoly calamitie misery tyme detested abhorred vnstable contrariant fortune stedfastly blamed accused peinfull labor care mynde turned infelicitie muche lamented bewailed euill fate destenie husbande whiche eminently iyes sawe approche accused reproued reuiled conclusion sens vexed afflicted caste suche agony preferred death life rather desiryng soner die lenger liue perauenture cause interior iye sawe priuily gaue secrete monicion greate calamity aduersities whiche hang ouer hed likely incontinent fall succede whiche persones neither loked regarded quene margarete might well consider thynke euill aduentures chaunced moste parte vnworthy death humfrey duke gloucester vncle husbande whiche mischaunce although wer occasion prouoker yet greately offended concented thereto saue life rulyng might conueniently haue staied letted surely beyng liue hauyng moderacio gouernaunce common wealth kyng henry neuer wauered many hasardes ieoperdies life would desire god men would egall balance ponder indifferently consider cause misfortune euill chaunces whiche beyng eleuate aucthoritie dooe mete measure iustice iniury right wrong high power blynd aucthoritie vnbridled nowe purpose quene margarete sawe bid battail purpose maner dispaire wealth self sonne prince compaignie departed sainctuary called beauliew hamshire monastary monkes ordre cisterciens registered self persones priuileged knowen landed edmond duke somerset lorde ihon brother thomas courtney erle deuonshire whiche euer toke contrary part whose sodain chaungyng shortly turned awne confusion iasper erle penbroke ihon lorde wenlocke man made onely kyng edward ihon longstrother prior sainct ihones englande came greate hast beaulew presented theimselfes quene although wer almoste drouned sorowe plunged pein yet sawe beheld noble princely personage resort vnto presence somewhat comforted greatly reuiued first lest bee laied charge dooen thyng misauisedly declared shewed cause could come time gladly would haue doen purpose intent taken unitie sanctuary besechyng studie prouide diligence wealthe conseruacion onely iuell prince sonne tyme dispaired doo thyng force armes might bee profite thought moste conuenient tyme yere enemy let stop saile fraunce tary till god would sende better lucke pleasaunt fortune bryng long purposed busines good conclusion ende duke comfortable wordes somewhat eased dolorus harte vnfortunate quene thesaid duke began long processe enter communicacion warre renewed hast possible extreme diligence least compaignie tariyng might bee diminished kyng edwardes power encreased augmented consideryng tyme armie gathered together muche laste battaill strength chief souldiours weaked appalled notwithstandyng fortune shone hym obteinyng victory therle warwicke yet might turne saile otherside causyng hym tast eger vineger geuen hym drynke dilicate ypocrace men se daily warlike affaire poynt happeneth seldome tyme sodain commutacions vnloked variaunce affirmyng farther nomber nobilitie bare towarde kyng henry husbande good myndes fixed harte would help hym bothe men money awne free would take vpon name capitain agai st enemy often tymes enterprised offered greate power able men awne expence charge promisyng twoo erles assure farre greater nomber valiant expert warriers would esteme shewed victory thei liste handes merily required theim bee hardy harte good chere matter required great expedicion thought necessary farther reason cause battaill determine hand battaill geuen ordered quene whose mynde gaue mocion come good conclusion answered could well allowe sentence thought might happen greater losse losse awne life suspected thei would helpe thynges thei moste phantesied affected life prince edward soonne whole hope familie stoode remained perell ieoperdie therfore either thought necessarie defer battaill till another time ele conueigh sonne fraunce lye sure secrete till chaunce first battayle tried assayed marueyll although naturall mother much mynded studied sauegarde tuycion lyfe sonne ponderyng next husband whome reputed clene vndone vtterly coste awaye nothyng belo ed nothyng derer nothynge made thus prudent politique quene requyred cheuetaynes expert marciall feates shoulde hande premeditate selfes maturely deliberatly thynges moued done thoughte conuenient geue battayle woulde agrement hart conformable longer disputacion matter duke sayde nede waste anye woordes determyned lyues lasted styll kepe warre agaynste enemyes therfore thynge whiche greate counsayll deliberacion cocluded ought auaunced set forward whole consent agrement thus euery man together clerely bent encouraged ye battayle gathered hys power hym selfe duke thorough hys dominion raysed chosen companye men warre lykewise erle deuoshyre erle pebroke wet wale erledo prepare hys people diligence quene last brought hope good fortune sayd well duke aduised company departed bathe entendynge make abode tyll affinitie together assembled whether euer went none thereof knowlege mistrustyng left consayl titiuille bee published opened aduersaries came place prefixed kyng edward knew quene margarete landed englande duke somerset complices prepared new armye hand dispatched certayn cu rers ight horse euery parte se number hys enemyes way entended take explorators according theyr instruccions serched soughte partes west made elacion diligently retorne knowen sent kynge beyng great agony knewe waye enemyes toke determined surely encounter one place came london vpon conclusion armye gotten london set forward oxford shyre sekynge place apt mete pytche hys tentes conducted abyndon encamped hym selfe comaunding men appoynted warre celeritie folow hym place hynges host beyng assembled reduct one company newes brought hym hys enemyes come bathe soiorne tarye purposely augmet encreace nu ber dayly dyd resort wherfore kyng without delay remoued strayght marleborough beyng distat bathe xv mile making haste great diligence possibilitie might geue theim battayle diuerted wale whether thought entended deed would take iorney ioyne selfe erle penbroke gathered great host party quene knew kynge edwarde come nere taried long bathe remoued greate haste brystow sent certayn horseman espye whether might sauely passe ouer ryuer seuerne gloucester wale whether determined fyrst go augment armye without delay spere shelde coragiously set enemyes soeuer would abyde sent retorned agayn declaryng towne gloucester vnder obeisaunce rychard duke gloucester kynges brother although sollicited lord beauchampe powike lay castell rule towne townesmen fyrst rewardesafter menacing either take part peasably suffer passe ouer bridge neither moued would speake cofortably messenger whe hard newes shortly departed bristow army proper towne seuerne syde called tewkesburye leuing gloucester vnassauted lest peradueture might sped tyme wt much losse littel gayne passage towarde tewkesbury lord beauchape toke rereward ordinance might haue wel spared small preiudice whe quene come tewkesbury knewe kynge edward folowed hys horseman backe sore abashed woderfully amased determined selfe flye wale iasper erle pe broke duke somerset willyng nowyse flye backward doughtes casted might chauce way determined tarye take fortune god sende beynge awne munde fixed fayre parke adioy ynge towne pytched hys felde agaynst consent many capitaynes would haue drawen syde whyle tyl therle penbroke hys armye hym associate serued reason chaunce folowed duke somerset entending abide battayle lyke pollitique warrior trenched campe rounde suche altitude strongly enemyes meanes facilye could make entrie farther perceyuyng parte coulde neuer escape without battayle determined se ye final ende good yl chauce wherfore marshalled host manner lord ihon somerset brother led forward middelward gouerned prynce vnder coduyte lord sainct ihons lord wenlocke whome kyng edward highly preferred promoted degre baron rereward put rule erle deuonshyre battayles thus ord red placydthe battayll tewkesbury quene sonne prince edward rode felde encouragyng theyr souldiers promising shew self valyat enemyes greate rewardes hyghe promocions innumerable gayn spoyle bootye aduersaries aboue fame renoune thorough whole realme kyng edward lykewise day come within myle tewkesbury put hys brother duke gloucester forward hym selfe middelward lord marque lord hastynges led reregarde duke gloucester lacked policye valyantly hys battayle assauted treche quenes campe whome duke somerset lesse courage defended duke gloucester politique purpose hys men reculed backe duke somerset perceiuing lyke knight couragious circu spect came trenche whole battayle folowed chace doubtynge prince lorde wenlocke middelward folowed iust hys backe whether lord locke dissimuled matter kynge edwardes sake whether hys harte serued hym still stode lokyng duke gloucester takynge auantage auentured turned agayn face face duke somerset battayl nothynge lesse thinkyng returne within smal season shamefully discomfited duke somerset seyng hys vnfortunate chaunce returned ye middelward seyng lord wenloke standynge still reuyled hym called traytor axe strake ye braynes hedde duke glocester entered trenchea terrible stroke hym kyng log conflict quenes part went almost wrecke parte slayne sledde succor thyck parke ye monastery place quene foude chariot al dead sorow ye prince apprehended kepte close syr rychard croftes duke somerset lord prior sainct ihons force taken prisoner many also felde chace slaine lord ihon somerset erle deuonshyre syr ihon delues syr edwarde hampden syr robert wytyngham syr ihon lewkenor iii thousande felde ended kyng edward made proclamatio euer could bring prince edward hym alyue dead shoulde haue annuitie cl duryng lyfe prince life saued syr richard croftes wyse valyaut knyght nothing mistrusting kynges former promyse brought furth prisoner prince edward beynge goodly femenine well feautered yonge gentelman kynge edward well aduised demaunded hym howe durst presumptuously enter realme banner displayed prince beyng bold stomacke good courage answered sayinge recouer father kyngdome enheritage father grandfather ym lyneally diuoluted wordes kyng edward sayd nothyng thrust hym hym say stroke gauntlet incontinent stode whiche george duke clarence rychard duke gloucester thomas marque dorset willia lord hastynges sodaynly murthered pitiously manquelled bit ternesse murder actor latter dayes sted assayed rod iustice punishment god hys body homely enterred symple corse church monastery blacke monkes tewkesburye last ciuile battayl fought kynge edwardes dayes whiche gotten iii daye maye x yere hys reigne yere lord mcccclxxi beyng saterday monday next ensuyng edmond duke somerset ihon longstrother prior sainct ihons syr garuays clyfton syr thomas tressham xii knyghtes gentelmen behedded market place tewkes ury quene margaret lyke prisoner brought londoquene margaret brought prisoner london remayned tyll kyng remer father rausomed money summe frenche wryters afferme borowed kyng lewes xi power abilitie repaye greate dutie solde frenche king heyres kyngdomes naples bothe sciciles countye prouynce title kyng charles vii made conquered realme napels raunsom payed conueyed fraunce small honor great triumphe honorable enterteynmet wt pope aboue al pryde receyued realme xxviii yeres beginnynge tyme lyued like quene middel ruled like empresse toward thende vexed troble neuer quyet peace extreme age passed dayes fraunce lyke death lyfe languisshyng mornyng continuall sorowe much selfe husbande whose age almost consumed worne losse prince edward sonne whome husband thought leue bothe ouerlyuer progenye also kyngdome whome lyfe nothyng coulde either displeasant greuous battayl kyng edward rendered god hys huble thakes caused publique procession deuout reuerence solemply kept thre dayes together euery towne parishe visited townes place hys enemyes assembled first together payne punishmente small number good diligence returned toward london enformed one thomas neuel bastard sonne thomas lord faucobridg valyant capitayne man lesse corage audacitie euell condicios suche apte person meter could chosen set worlde broyle put estate realme yll hasard new begonne great comocion bastard tyme appoynted erle warwycke uiceadmyrall sea charge kepe passage betwene douer caleys none either fauored kynge edward hys frendes escape vntaken vndrouned death erle warwycke broughte pouertie robbed sea lande aswel hys enemyes also frendes reason wherof gat together great nauy shippes spoiled euery shyp laste toke lande kent gathered together great company kentishmen mete purpose marched toward london essex men hauynge wylde whaye wormes heddes ioined saiyng commyng quarell deliuer captiuitie kyng henry vi bryng hym hys wyfe euer outward wordes inward cogitacions onely hope spoyle desyre robbe pyll bastarde hym selfe assaulted drawe bridge london capitain called spisyng scaled algate essex harnesed wyfes chesecloutes assaultes deadly geuen manfully resisted much bothe partes many slayne hurt last citiezens put backe rebelles lew wounded great number draue bastard al hys pray shyppes lyeng radcleffe hauyng good prosperous wynde made sayle haste roued sea accustomed styrryng although littell thynke fyrst yet begonne long afore brought kynge edwardes busines doubtfull difference kynge edward hys last battayles twise fortunate sondry seuerall tymes one tyme persecuted inuaded enemyes surely tyme erle warwycke pytched armye comyng toward london quene margarete companye take lande enterprice thryse great ieopardy coragiously attempted set behynd whyle erle warwycke gaue onset bothe one moment edmond duke somerset geuen battayle tewkesburye iasper erle penbroke come trayne bastard fawconbridge vexed londeners euen tyme one ij thynges consequently haue folowed kynge edwarde muste necessitie agayne flye realme el shame rebuke yelde hym selfe either slaughter captiuitie meane chaunces small gaynes good lucke desyred praysed much battayle good fortune fortunate chaunce made chiefly auaunced returne bastard faucobridge waueryng hither thither doubfull surge sea sure lyfe water lande either thynking man woulde se hym al men blynd coulde espie hym especially secret place came open hauen southampton toke lade long vntaken shortlier behedded iasper erle pebroke credibly asserteyned quene margarete lost battayle tewkesburye trust comfort releue parte poore kyng henry men warre bringyng co federates returned backe way towne chepstow wher taryeng deploryng lamentyng hast much hasted vnpurueied blynd finall conclusio destroyed brought nought al kyng heryes estate rich preheminece left frendes redy tosse waues fortune seke lyuyng thy might sauely get began thinke prouide way best take kyng edward season beynge feare erle penbroke sente priuely wale roger uaughan man bothe stronge people frendes entent gyle engyne sodaynly trap surprise erle hauyng intelligence certayne frendes watche priuilie leyd sodainly thesame towne toke roger uaughan without delay stroke hys hed thomas uaughan god prouidece receyued death hymselfe deceipt prepared erle good hast departed thence penbroke whome incontinent morgan thomas kyng edwardes comaundemet strogly beseged hym enuyroned castell diche trenche coulde lightly flye escape thence eyghte dayes deliuered seage raysed hys faythfull trusty frendes dauid thomas brother foresayd morgan thece conueyed tynbye hauen towne wale getting conuenient shyppes transport hym hys ouer sea fraunce hys nephew lord henry erle rychemonde hys familiers toke shyp fortune leadyng landed brytayne hys arryuall fyrst went duke frauces brytayne hym reuerently saluted expoundyng hym cause cace necessitie thether commyng committyng lyfes goodes chaunces hym hys nephew whole duke discrecion ordinaunce duke receyued bothe erles benignitie shewed lesse honor fauor humanitie suche entertainment thei naturall brother geuyng theim faithe seriously made promise beyng hym thei sustein maner wrong iniurie creature offred assuryng thei might within dominion tymes place go safe good suretie kyng edwarde appeased meanes afore rehersed kyngdome people intent insurge hereafter newe commocion within realme made iorney kente sat iudgement suche last tumulteous busines toke part bastard fauconbrige many wer vnworthy streightly punished raunsomed whiche busines perfo med thintent men might se apparantly indubitate peace come realme feare exterior hostilitie banished exiled euer poore kyng henry sixte litle depriued realme imperiall croune tower londonkyng henry ower spoyled life worldly felicitie richard duke gloucester constant fame ranne whiche thintent kyng edward brother clere secret suspicion sodain inuasion murthered thesaid kyng dagger whosoeuer manqueller holy man shall appere bothe murtherer consenter condigne vndeserued punishement bloudy stroke butcherly acte thei enemy risen thei might reuenge themself shall hereafter perceiue thei exercised crueltie awne selfes proper bloud embrued polluted awne handes membres ded corp kyng henry billes gleues pompeously call funerall pompe conueighed tower churche saincte paule laied beree laie space one whole daie nexte daie without prieste clarke torche taper syngyng saiyng conueighed monasterie chertesey beyng distant london xv mile buried remoued winsore new vawte newly intumilate kyng henry reigned full xxxviii yeres xvii day repossessed kyngdom vi monethes liued lii yeres hauyng wife one onely sonne called edwarde prince wale kyng henry stature goodlythe discripci n kyng henr body sleder whiche proporcion al mebers wer correspondent face beautifull whiche continually resident ountie mynde whiche inwardly endued abhorre awne nature vice well body soule verie infancie honest conuersacion pure integritie knower euill keper goodnes dispiser thynges whiche bee wonte cause myndes mortall menne slide fall appaire beside pacience adicate harte iniuries hym committed whiche wer small nombre neuer asked vengeaunce punishement rendered almightie god creator hartie thankes thynkyng trouble aduersitie synnes hym forgotten forgeuen shal saie good ge tle meke sober wisman declare affirme mischiefes misery partly came hym awne offence partly hepyng synne vpon sinne wretchedly aunceters forfathers wherefore litle nothyng estemed anywise turment macerate hymself euer dignitie honor state life child frend lost missed sound offence toward god loked without repentaunce mourned sorowed like office holynes caused god worke miracle hym life tyme old menne saied reason whereof kyng henry seuenth without cause ed iuly bushop rome haue hym canonized sainctes fee canonizyng kyng wer great qua titie rome canonisyng bushoppe prelate although satte sain te peter cheire thesaied kyng thought necessary kepe money home profite realme countrey rather empouetishe kingdom gainyng newe holy daie sainct henry remittyng god iudgement intent kyng henry liberall mynde especially suche loued good learnyng sawe profite verteous science hartely fauored embraced wherfore holpe awne young scholers attein discipline founded solempne schoole eton toune next vnto wyndsore whiche hath stablished honest colege sad priestes greate nombre child whiche bee coste rankely frely taught eruditametes rule grammer beside edefied princely colege uniuersitie cambrige called kynges colege erudicion suche wer brought vp eton whiche daie florisheth kyndes well litterature toungues aboue worthy bee called prince coleges xi yerethe xi yere returne kyng edwarde whiche releued moste part prickyng feare inward suspicio thintent print shadowe remain aduerse faccion realme diligently required serched fragmentes leuynges enemy parte intendyng represse vtterly extinguishe theim first begyn sent george neuell brother erle warwicke archbushoppe yorke vnder strong conduite castle guysnes kept extreme captiuitie long continued laste frendship deliuered whiche pensiuenes grudge mynd shortely deceassed laurence bathe hym thomas rotheram sea yorke ordinarily succede beside ihon erle oxenford whiche barnet feld bothe manfully gat valiantly kept sainct mighels mout cornewal either lacke aide perswaded frendes gaue vp mount yelded hymself kyng edward life onely saued whiche hym graunted doubtfull imaginacions kyng edward sent hym ouer sea castle hammes space xii yeres strong prison miserably kept diligently looked many beside diuerse partes realme beyng litle nothyng suspected wer either committed prison greuosly fined taxed beside least neighbor countrey might harborough receptacle foe aduersaries concluded newe league iames iii kyng scottes terme xx yeres yet whatsoeuer thought imaginacion besy diuises pollitique forcastynges mynd phantesie wer clere exonerate dispatched feare inward trouble tidynges wer brought hym erles penbroke richemond arriued britayne duke highly cherished well fostered entertained pthe xii yerethe xii yere thyng nipped kyng edwarde hardly verie stomacke though mynd castyng euill come signifie erle richemond attein croune diademe realme whiche mischief wel disgested secretly sent wise close messenger duke brytayne whiche sticke promise duke great sumpteous rewardes knowing mede many thynges corrupteth would deliuer bothe therles handes possession duke gladly hard sent knewe twoo erles bee praie suche greate value determined deliuer theim rather entertain theim hym diligently thei accustomed duke answered orator stoode honor would deliuer twoo erles bounde obliged faithe promise promised dooe kynges pleasure thei kept suche vigilant persones continually watched kyng haue maner cause thynke thei could attempt thyng might sounde either displeasure preiudice messenger sawe thei could obtein whiche thei desired like wisemen held themselfes contented whiche duke offered returned england kyng wrote duke britayne louyngly requiryng hym accomplishe spede whiche awne mocion offered promisyng hym onely menne greate rewardes yerely rewarde hym full hande well stuffed purse duke perceiuyng swete gain whiche rose hym abode two englishe erles countrey least thei cause abandon dominion seke succor forrein region caused one segregated remoued theim suche englishemen wer daily attendant came theim britayn place appoynted briton seruitors minister continually attend waite theim kyng edward thus pollitiquely thought compassed duke britayne thynkyng nothyng lesse take damage duke burgoyne hand yea suche damage imil tude bothe like continually greue vexe realme englande farther occasion common op puttyng backe commodity growen within realme transported outward partes north estward yet eft sone brought newe doubte perplexitie declaracion whereof muste vnderitande lewes frenche kyng brother called charles whiche wisest yet man greatest experience certain curtesie loued better haue menne rule hym take vpo hym rule although kyng tyme soonne brother hym open heire apparant litle fauored esse loued hym nothyng geuyng hym good part porcio father landes whiche copelled counsaill gaue hym moneth next moneth would flatery thretnyng war corrupcion brother seruauntes obtain bring handes possession first gaue duchie berry whole normandy wherof long tyme bereft possession regiment title without cause geue partie yong charles thesaid charles afterward departed countreys brye champaigne fraudulent feate kyng lewes caused hym elinquishe thesame take paretage duchie guyen called named duke guyen euil entreating duke guyen frech kyng brother caused diuerse prince small puyssaunce fauor aide succor thesaid duke whiche chief wer charles duke burgoyn fraunces duke britayn lewes erle sent poll con able fraunce duke guyen sollicityng adherentes sore labored haue mariage sole daughter onely heire charles duke burgoyne hoped lorde souereigne duke charles inheritauuce furtheraunce mariage holpe power duke britayn saied onely acte constable fraunce parte thought lone able compasse mariage haue soly thankes duke guyen frenche kyng could let stoppe mariage brother obteined young lady possession sawe well inough duke guyen beyng ioyned duke britayne bee strong inough least puyssaunce inough encomber frenche kyng child kyng edwarde englande sore smoked hard tell first mariage without cause considered freche kyng heire maile one weake boy duke guyen likely croune frauce brother nephewe age procede burgoyn brabant holand zeland flaunders lowe countreys englishe men moste parte made martes vttered merchaundise vnited annexed croune fraunce handes old auncient enemy realme poore england litle caleis co tinually daunger enemes almoste theim enui oned rounde aboute thinges considered kyng edward counsaill tooke matter greate earnest seriously wrote duke charles would conculde mariage fraunce hurt preiudice realme englande knowe onely broken league amitie also finde better haue dissimuled best frende priuily without reason haue iuggeled realme england duke burgoyn made reasonable answeres honest excuse counsaill englande nowise would geue credite thereto euer surmising mariage take ffect certainly season englishemen rather haue taken part french kyng duke burgoyne onely empeche stoppe mariage muche englishemen disdained haue house burgoyne conioyned vnite croune fraunce duke burgoyne dalied dissimuled party matter geuyng faire wordes makyng large promise whiche first deceiued incoclusion promised daughter nicholas duke calaber rather haue buried edded duke philbert sauoy outward answere assuredly nothyng mynded inwardly maximilian duke austrice kyng romaine soonne emperor fredericke could neuer obtein duryng life duke charles onely glosyng painted promise wordes writynges promise euer thei wer clerely set side surely fixed determined argeton counsailer doth write mariage long liued sort effecte least consent lette v leue duke burgoyne aboute affaire returne kyng edward xiii yere reigne called high courte parliament palace whiche alt lawes ordinaunces made hym daie corroberated confirmed suche lawes made hym kyng henry caused abrogated reuiued renouated made farther lawes confiscacion goodes rebelles persone restoryng suche fled realme quere occasio whiche aduersaries traitor kyng countr litle wer high reason attainted death codemp toward charge late suste ed competent money demaunded frankely graunted inconclusion inward g dges open discordes whiche long continued harte nobilitie whiche wer fewe parte beyng consumed warres clerely extirped brought vnitie cocorde kyng edwarde holpe agrement muche hym laie intent men forget iniu y theim dooen put awaie rancor malice followyng good godly example clerely pardoned almoste offence menne beyng within realme frankely discharged although thei taken parte aduersaries hym high treason crime pthe x ii yerethe xiii yere kyng edwarde thus settyng ordre pacifiyng thynges whiche square charles duke burgoyn whose spirite neuer quiet whose ambicious mynde neuer satisfied whose haute high stomacke could neuer tamed till death swaged abated desiryng aswell amplify enlarge territory dominios liyng side riuer ryne toward high burgoyn also recouer amia tounes whiche frenche kyng fraude feates warre hym wrongfully vsurped aboue thynges couetyng haue freche kyng haue greate shame losse hinderaunce could inuent one waie apt mete imagined purpose entice perswade kyng englande ambassador make warre vpon thesaied kyng countrey recoueryng old right auncient title thesame frenche kyng father right equitie holden deteig ed kyng edward began litle harken side muche help duke burgoyne muche bounde aide tyme exile haue harde reuenged kyng lewes reputed mortall enemie firste aydyng erle warwicke complices hym secondarely long mainteinyng fosteryng quene margarete soonne prince edwarde whome farther affinitie made godfather hys sonne charles doulphyn within coutreys dominios whereupon consulted nobilitie chiefe sage person realme manner haue certayn naturall inclination make warre frauce either hope great spoyle gayne certayne priuie canker engendered harte forefather tyme long past lyneall succession descended stomackes nephewes aunswered duke messenger beginnyng yere would lande caleys puissant army frenche kyng well perceyue lacked neither men hys men lacked stomackes bothe reuenge soueraygnes quarell also recouer right treugth thys season mortal warre betwene king lewes duke borgoyne likely fal betwene kyng lewes nature hard speche chorlish answere froward vngentell aswel hys frendes foe reason whereof many great men within realme fraunce content grosse rudenesse rude dis ulacio began haue intelligens cleue duke borgoyn emongest lewes luxenborough erle sainct pol constable fraunce beyng confedered duke noble men determined vex scorge kyng lewes plague whiche transformed man clere altered olde quality el ieopardye bothe losse lyue realme determined fraunce shoulde bee set assaulted bothe outward enemyes inward dis ulers thynges duke borgoyne kyng edward dyd communicate entent soner allure prouoke hym enterprise warre according hys desyre thynges token victorie animated kyng edward enforced hym maner make warre fraunce expedicion prepared thynges necessarie bothe water lande small summe money sufficient great charge money yere hym auaunced realme consumed hys houshold necessarye affayres conceyued new deuice hys imaginacion engine might couertly perswade entice hys ryche frendes geue graunt conuenient summe money toward ine able charge incredible costes thing willingly assent would impute greater ingratitude vnkyndnes wherupon caused hys officer bryng ryche person one another explaned cause purpose necessitie warre begon fayntnesse leuenesse hys treasure great importion lacke money hartely requyring loue affeccion always born hym beyng natural prince awne gratuitie frewill geue hym ayde money mayntenance warre army say inuencion came effect calling remembrauce benefites hym receyued shame feare moued encouraged gaue hym liberally bothe substauce treasure whiche without grudge coulde haue otherwise obteyned wil let passe prety conceyt happened gathering shall onely note humilitie kynge fantasie woman kyng edward called hym wydow muche aboundynge substance lesse growen yeres whome merely demaunded gladly woulde geue towarde greate charge treuth quod thy louely countenance thou shalt haue euen xxl kyng lokyng scace halfe summe thanked louingly kyst whether flauor brethe cofort stommacke estemed kysse kynge precious iuell swore incontinently haue xxl whiche payed offered kyng willing shew benefite hym much acceptable worthy put obliuion called graunt money beneuolence withstading many grudge maleuolece gaue great summes toward new foude beneuolence vsing getill fashion toward wyth frendly prayer assistance necessitie tempted theim could none otherwise frankely frely yelde geue hym reasonable reward x iii yerethe yere thynges conuenient suche enterprise redynesse kynge edwarde army remoued douer founde vc shyppes hoyes redy transport hym hys army ouer sea hym selfe wt nobilitie warlikely accopaignied passed ouer betwene douer caleys iiij daye iuly landed caleys wyth great triumphe hys army horse munycons warre scace passed ouer xx dayes whome frenchman bragged haue ben taken wel considered chauce knew kyng edward army royall without trouble landed suertie caused euery man accordyng degre ordered lodged armye wrytinge argenton fayrest strongest armye passed englande fraunce many yeres men well armed surely thynges appoynted prouided frenche nacio onely amased behold much praysed oder thys army xvc men armes well horsed parte barded rychely trapped moste galiard fashion hauyng many horse decked one suyte farther xvm archer beryng bowes arrowes whiche greate parte horsebacke also great number fighting men aswell set vp tentes pauilions englishme great plenty serue artilarie enclose campe otherwise labor army one page kyng england arryuall highly displeased wyth duke borgoyn worde prince promised hym mete landing ijm men armes light horseme besyde great number lanceknightes halberders would haue begonne warre iii monethes kynges transportyng vex greaue frech kyng cause seke wittes duke borgoyn season lay seage stroge towne nuyce puissant army agaynst whome ware assembled emperor frederike almost whole empire rescow towne whome kyng england sent lord scale post requyring hym leaue voyd seage impregnable towne nuyce retorne hast people army make warre fraunce according promise othe declaring farther tyme passed somer woulde lost charge lord scale departed hast toward duke whome wil leue rydinge toward nuyce whyle fraunce frauce much art thou bounde laude prayse sauior deliuerance tyme thy affliccio god permitted cancard hart duke indurate weke brayne vexed yet ambicious affeccion bee enflamed power ioyned army england one syde hauyng syde duke brytayn power thre prince bene lyke haue make fraunce either bow breke either yelde suffer chaunces fortune lyke wauering goddes prouided punishment kyng edward departed douer sent frenche kynge officer armes whome argenton vntrewly calleth garter borne normandy rome gartier neuer geuen estraunger herault deliuered french kynge dew reuerence letter diffiance bothe stile pennyng excellently endited frenchman would scant beleue framed englishman letter requyred frech king render king englande realme fraunce right lyneall enheritaunce aperteyning belonging thentet might put agayn church nobilitie common auncient estate liberty disburde exonerate great charge trauayles labor case refuse dyd protest harme ensue forme maner suche case requise accustumed done kyng lewes red letter secretly selfe alone great study withdrew self hys warderobe sending english herault sayd h syr know wel wot kyng englad master neither descended partes awne fre mocion yet v requyred onely entised prouoked duke burgoyn somewhat enforced comons realme may se season yere passeth duke burgoyn poore estate returning nuyce discoforted costable also whome kyng souereygne lord sure hath intelligence fauor master hath maried nece sure rende taken world knew haue promoted haue done would littel thynk would vntrewly handle dothe assure depe dissimuler continual dissimulacion entendeth lede lyfe entertayning awn profit although kyng master vnsure hys promise yet one thing shall sure shal euer dissimuled therfore say master better haue peace olde enemye promise familiaritie new dissimuling frede peace pleaseth god thinge desyre sayd gaue herault iiic crounes promisinge hym crounes good apoyntement came passe herault beyng coueteous crounes secret according duetie office promised thinges lay doubting kyng master would conformable reasonable offer aduisinge frenche kyng kyng edward landed send herault fetche saue conduyte pasport labor trauayle treatie sayd herault first resort lord stanley lord haward coducting kinges presence herault depart kynge gaue pece crymosen ueluet xxx yardes long commaundinge strayghtly chargyng man hardy comen let hym passe gentel fashio herault gone king lewes callyng vii viii familiers caused letter red whiche littel afrayd lesse abashed considering english herault shewed playnly enter port treatie maner gayne conquere fortresse enformacion littel ioyous wisely secretly according thesame saw tyme prosecuted purpose season lord scale came duke burgoyn nuyce accompting hym message commaunded duke burgoyn beyng sore set coquere town nuyce aunswered lord scale honor lost shame spoken thorough christendom rayse feld breke hys seage hoped shortly gayne towne triumphat victory come ayde kyng edward whole army thys answere lord ale departed onely answere comen without augmentacion kyng edward sent haue duke kepe promes folye duke charles besege towne impregnable euen thesame tyme englishman request passed sea thyng tyme regiment bothe traueled sore requyred neuer coulde compasse tyll season also thinges beyng well disposed hys purpose brytayn place except regarded conquere new towne defende hys olde possession seigniory shortly bishoppe rome authoritie left nuyce vnconquered lesyng great nu ber people remnaut sent lorayne barroys lye trouble duke reyner lorayn whiche littel defied hym lyeng nuyce self small company came kyng edward caleys kyng edward fyrst comming began somwhat greued laiyng charg hys mocion request desyre hys army passed sea onely entent mortal warre plague scourge proude realme fraunce leuyng thynges whiche molest trouble frenche kyng parte applied hym selfe matter lorayne externe nacions reuenge open iniuries done hys neyghbor frenche kynge duke excused hym selfe wyth ieoparding losse hys honor returned nuyce also necessitie compelled leue hys armye lorayne reuenged ouer duke reyner whiche hym nuyce spytefull wordes raylyng termes defied detested affirmyng farther nowe beginnynge small companye great enterprice myght gayned profe wherof deliuered kynge letter credence sent frome constable fraunce willed kyng geue credite perfait faith duke makyng relacion suche secretes hym geuen charge declare kynges awne person fyrste shewed though constable promised kyng duke reder vp towne sainct quintynes yet come good effect bene yelded duke beynge germany shall kynge duke beynge bothe personally presente deliuerace wherfore exhorted kyng set forward display hys banner set furth hys standard hys mocion kyng accompanied duke hys armye departed caleys passed boleyne perone englishman thought selfes duke lyke enemyes frendes enterteyned gate entered apoynted remnant lodged feldes better purueyed awne duke prouision kyng england thinkyng surely fyrmely beleuyng constable ment treuthe soner enduced credence constable great uncle quene wyfe dede nothing lesse mynded trouthe remoued campe peron duke borgoyn beyng hys army marched toward saynct quintynes certayne englishman ran toune agaynst whose commyng thought belle haue benrong gate set open whe aproched toune artillarie beganne shote toune came bothe fote horsbacke skyrmished englishman whiche two thre slayne welcome semed straunge kyng edward ponderynge together yestardayes promise two dayes doyng duke woulde kyng desist hys purpose toune yelded sight handfull people whyche thyng sayd although constable woulde gladly haue done first yet woulde haue couler thoughe papere verye conpulsion force therefore kynge woulde make semblance besege toune wou warrant incontinent rendered kynge englande perceyuyng deluded first enterprice thought surer heare fayre wordes constable duke geue credit theyr vntrew disceatfull doynges englishemen returned theyr campe yl content blame murmeryng agaynst constable callynge hym traytor periured vntrew gentelman besyde angre ther came next daye another corsey smarted littell sorer duke charles borgoyne whose meanes kynge edward taken vpon hym warre either perceyued constable promise fayre sunne shynyng swetely spoken sowerly performed el saw hym selfe lacked men money procede farther kyng edward iorney toke hys leaue sodaynly kyng englande saiynge must nedes visite se hys armye berroys promisinge shortly puissance returne agayne great auantage comoditie bothe hast departed departyng bothe displeasaunt straunge king englande considering hope haue duke hys continuall felow armes haue hys counsayll order hys people whiche late frequented warre fraunce yet perfitly knewe force agilitie maner frenche nacion passed sea raysed standard duke procurement entered lande hys enemyes nowe left alone withoute guyde leder without ayde succor middell hys foe coulde lesse thynke duke neither vsed hym lyke prince yet kept hys promes lyke trewe man whyche vnstable dissimulyng workynge caused ye rather enforced kyng edward thynke neuer thought neuer enteded englishe men sore murmured constable lesse duke sauyng thei determined neuer geue confidece constable wordes greatly doubted whether thei might geue credite duke promise thus laie thenglishmen feldes whe cold nightes bega waxe long without gain coquest caused common people alwaies content hardnes rather desire returne homewarde procede day iorney forward french kyng whiche bothe wily wittie especially awne purpose knewe espial vntrue refusall made constable vnfrendly departyng duke burgoyne daily murmuryng thenglishemen bothe wherfore thought nowe verie expedient folowe counsaill englishe herault sendyng saueconduite metyng ambassador common treatie might bee well compassed yet auoyde doubtes reised armie perceiued power enemy encrease studied power resist theim ouer armie made capitain monsire robert de estoteuile valiaunt man sent artoys defende frountiers kyng englandes entree inuacions hymself taried still senlis frenche kyng beyng thus priuilie desirous peace although outwardly shewed countenaunce mar meanyng quietnes settyng furthe warre caused varlet subornated cote armure frauce whiche hast made trupet banner king lewes muche desirous greatly passed honor seldome courte either officer armes trompet whiche varlet well animated lesse instructed message whiche deliuered hym writyng bothe bolde countenaunce sober demeanure couterfeight herault although verlet dede bothe wittie well spoken rode sad maner nere englishe army put cote armes englishe outskourers perceiuyng cote officer armes gently saluted hym enquired hym whether iorney laie sadly answered message french kyng kyng englande conueighed tent lorde haward lorde stanley wer dinner highly entertaigned lesse welcomed dinner brought kyng whose presence bold audacitie fearful speche declared first credence officer armes credite lawe nacions ought geuen secondarely published thynges hym geuen charge commaundement saiyng right high mightie prince right puyssaunt noble kyng excellent wisedo pe fectly knowe high knowlege apparantly perceiue inward affeccion feruent desire kyng master hath alwaies haue perfecte peace sure vnitie fraternall concord betwene noble persone realme honorable personage dominion would truthes sake confesse saie neuer christian prince thrusted amitie yet louer hath sought attain fauour paramor hath soughte haue perpet frendship amitie alliance intent subiectes bothe realmes quietly liuyng vnder twoo prince confederate combined together indissoluble confederaci league maie mutually embrace eche harte maie personally haue resor frequent eche others prince territory dominion merchaundises ware finally one liue frende frende brother brother compaignion compaignion continall loue
