reste tranquilitie parte dooth affirme saie sithe receiued firste croune kingdom annoynted holy ampulle neuer attempted yet imagined warre thyng preiudicial toward royall persone realme people peraduenture saie supported maintained erle warwicke maiestie surely dooth denie aided hym duke burgoyne knewe onely extreme enemie also laie waite bothe sea land either take hym vtterly destroye hym whiche duke burgoyne onely awne cause hath excited sollicited highnes come ouer troubelous tempestious sea intent cause yea maner compell kyng master condescende suche treatie appoyntment bee onely profite neither honor yet gain suche daily flatered hym peculier profites many deede daily sucked elbowe obteined thyng thei breathed affaire wer put obliuion lefte large assistence euen thei daie hath duke burgoyn caused first come fraunce set forward armi incoclusion lake promise lese faire season yere lye feldes winter whiche warre cotinue shall neither profitable yet nobilitie yet pleasaunte painfull commonaltie finally bothe realmes especially merchaunt menne shall bryng bothe misery pouertie calamitie came duke burgoyne nu e caleis onely visite rode poste haste onely blynde returned backe lorayne cause onely leue desolate abandon constabl kepe one promise beleue yet still trust neuer founde faithe fidelitie god ordain master maie ioyne league amitie dare bothe saie swere fine stele neuer cleued faster adamant stone sticke claspe bothe wealthe woo prosperitie aduersitie shall please harken reasonable treatie beyng poore man shall ieoperdie life whiche chief treasure vndertake communicacion shall sorte come suche effecte bothe nob litie shalbe glad reioyse common shalbe contented pleased thei haue deceiued shalbe bothe abashed ashamed moste humbly besechyng highnes pleasure shal encline waie maie haue sure saufe conduite one hundred horse suche personage kyng master shall send farther intimacion mynd purpose pleasure shalbe haue communicacio place indifferent betwene bothe tharmies shal warraunt like saueconduite men sende oures accomplished message instruccions kyng englande counsaill highly commended audacitie toungue sobernes geuyng hym reward faire gylte cuppe hundred angelles deliueryng hym saueconduite accordyng request demaunde whiche spede departed hauyng hym english herault bryng like sauecoduite frenche kyng bothe prince maturely consulted matter saueconduites wer deliuered bothe partes ambassador mette village beside amia sent kyng englande lorde haward sir thomas sentliger doctor morton chaunceler englande frenche kyng sent bastarde burbon admirall fraunce lorde sainct pierre bushop enreux called heverge maie litle marueiled french kyng thus labored sought peace make humble large offer thei considred case realme frauce stode tyme hauyng kyng englande duke burgoyne duke britayne enemy furnished set vpon one instaunt thei maie saie frenche kyng bothe wise circumspecte humble hymself auantage el god holpen realme fraunce troubled tossed greate ieoperdie daungerous extremitie ambassador met place appoynted englishe menne demaunded whole realme fraunce least normandy whole aquitaine allegacions well proued englishman pollitiquely defended frenche men argumentes without conclusio daie passed commissioner departed made relacion master frenche kyng counsaill would wise consent kyng englande haue parte parcell lande within realme fraunce rather fully determined put hymself whole realme hazard auenture lothe ye aferde lothe haue englishemen next neighbor commissioner next metyng concluded agreed ce tain article whiche bothe prince accepted allowed first couenauted greed french kyng paie kyng england without delaie lxxvm crounes sunne yerely lm crounes paied london duryng kyng edwardes life farther agreed charles dolphin mary lady elizabeth eldest daughter kyng edward thei twoo haue mainteinaunce estate thewhole duchie guyen el lm crounes yerely bee persolued paied within toure london space ix yeres ende thesaied terme dolphin dolphines peaceably enioy whole duchie guyen charge french kyng kyng england clerely exonerate greed appointed ii prince bothe thencreace loue continuaunce amitie enteruew eche place moste expedient mete great purpose metyng eche take corporal othe presence thother peace endure ix yeres betwene bothe realmes inuiolate obserue kepe al thynges cocluded agreed appoynted kyng englandes part wer coprised ally league duke burgoyn britain thei would assent whole aforsaid king edward paied league hostage lorde haward sir iho cheyny master horse til army passed ouer sea peace much reioysed french kyng nothing could either plesaunt exceptable haue thenglishme short space shortly cared clerely auoyded transported realme immaginyng euer tariyng thei would like holesome sweteaire fruitfull country great nomber would cotinually sicke vexed till thei returned sought health thesame delicious climate wherfore rid al hastie spede borowed ysaid lxxvm crounes euery man might lend porcion king edward likewise although puissance strong inough acheue great enterprise enemy farther encoraged renomed famous actes hym tyme perpetrated brought passe many battai e desiryng also rather haue war frech nacion beyng old auncient enemie thenglishe name bloud yet called remembraunce ciuill warre exhansted consumed substaunce treasure vrgent necessitie expostulate wer scant abilitie conscribe set furthe newe armie knowyng treasorie home bee voyde faint able long wage souldiers thought bothe reasonable profitable obeye necessitie abstein battail seyng bothe honorable offer hym obleted agrementes auantage hym ocioned consideryng chiefly beside neither duke burgoyne constable fraunce would obserue performe promise made sworne wherupo moste counsaill specially suche loued better peace warre wife soft beddes better hard harnesse stony lodgyng agreed conclusion concord duke gloucester frenche nacion odious tode whose swordes thrusted frenche bloud detested abhorred cried peace saiyng trauaill pain expences shame loste employed nothyng gamed continuall mocke daily derision frenche king al minion immaginacion tooke effecte without delaie gentle manne frenche kynges chamber peace concluded demaunde englisheman many battailles kyng edward vanquished answered nyne wherein hymself personally greate honor saied frenche man praie smilyng many hath loste englishman perceiuyng ment saied one whiche pollicie strength haue caused hym lese well said frenche manne may ponder paire balace gain nyne gotten battailes rebuke one maner loste tell wee haue saiyng force englande hath doth surmount force fraunce engenious witte frenche men excell dull braynes englishman battailes haue gayners league treaty wittes haue made loser may content selses losse treaty spoyle gatte warres battailes comunicacion reported frenche kyng whiche priuily sent englisheman supper onely made good chere also gaue hym thousande crounes praise peace helpe maintain thesame yet neuerthelesse beyng litle moued bragges declared communicacion duke gloucester whiche sware would neuer haue sette foote englande thought haue made frenchemen assaied strength puyssaunce englishemen whatsoeuer thought thynges wer transmuted another kynde could immagin duke burgoyne beyng enformed peace entreatyng betwene two kynges came small hast luxenborough onely accompaignied sixtene horse kyng englades lodgyng wherof kyng beyng litle abashed seyng bothe sodain commyng fierse countenaunce like one would rather bite whyne demaunded hym cause sodain commyng duke sharply answered knowe whether either entered communicacio onely absolutely concluded peace betwene frenche kyng hym kyng edward declared sondery diuerse greate vrgent cause touchyng aswell vniuersall publique wealth whole christianitie awne priuate commoditie quietnes realmes french kyng concluded peace amitie terme ix yeres whiche comprised felowes frendes bothe duke britayne requiryng hym condiscende agree thesame oh lorde oh sainct george duke burgoyne haue thus doen deede haue passed sea entered fraunce without killyng poore ie burnyng sely shepe cote haue taken shame ull truce noble auncester kyng edward thirde euer make armie fraunce made many whiche either gain victory battaill profite conqueryng city tounes countreys victorious prince nere kinne kyng henry fifth meane whose bloud haue either rightefully wrongfully god knoweth xstirpate destroyed small puyssaunce entered frauce conquered whole norma dy alonely coquered peaceably kepte neuer would either commen agree league till whole realme fraunce offered hym thereof made regent heire apparat without thyng dooyng honor profite gainyng haue condiscended pace bothe honorable profitable pesec de wholesome pomegranate thynke either moued entised take iorney peculier aduauntage comoditie whiche power able reuenge mine awne cause without help onely haue recouer old rightes possession wer ro bothe torciously wrongfully holden thintent shall knowe haue nede aide neither enter league take truce frenche kyng till bee passed sea haue three monethes duke charles said furiously threwe doune chayer would haue departed kyng hym staied saied brother charles sith haue spoken leaser would muste shall heare would first concernyng entery fraunce manne liuyng knoweth occasion neither well hath cause halfe well remembre haue fully put greatest thynges bee memorie boxe obliuion bee yet mynde frenche kyng power tooke faire oune amia strong pile quintynes diuerse ounes whiche neither durst yet able either rescowe defende sith whiche tyme hath plagued hath taken frendes yea priuie chamber secrete counsail youre secretes bee hym reueled made open knowe haue better cause remembre forget theim determined besege toune nuce thought youre self greate doubte whether lease home absence frenche kyng dremyng waityng like foxe praie el gain germany power presence kepe wolfe folde frenche kynge castels dominion chiefe principall cause fayre prayed sore laboured entyced passe ouer sea promysynge mountaynes golde w hiche turned snowe wasted water boastynge crakynge sende horseman fotemen yet shewynge neither lackey page hadde made enterprice oure selfe soly awne quarell thynke woulde haue expected youre commynge aduenture hadde bene haue recouered ryghte imagyn woulde haue passed sea slenderly lokynge ayde nay nay haue well knowen entended conquest woulde haue strongly inuaded set realme fraunce sauor burnynge townes infeccion ayre corcupted multitude dead carcase slayne enemyes youre countreys flaunders brabant haue cause inough wonder trustyng gotten woulde haue kept aswell auncetours haue done occasion warre wilfully saye cowardly prosecute thesame frenche kynge whiche neuer offended subiectes except maynteininge erle warwycke displeasure bare hym agaynste offered beyng destitute succour ayde bothe honorable honest ouertures peace offer maner enforced reason enclyne accept haue concluded truce whiche god willyng bothe kepe obserue god sende ioy quod duke sodaynly toke horse rode agayn luxenborough day kyng duke neuer loued neuer saw eche end vntrustynes promisbrekyng duke burgoyn angry hard peace communicacio much angry constable fraunce fearynge lest conclusion might reputed french kyng v trew e wel deserued wherfore sent hys confessor kynge edward letter credece requyryng hym hartely littell regard frech kynges woordes lesse trust promise affermynge frenche kynge woulde lenger kepe promise kynge edwarde syde sea rather shoulde agre frenche kyng small summe money offered lende hym l thousand crounes many fayre profers kynge englande made answere truce concluded woulde nothing chaunge concernyng matter kept promyse hym would haue made apoyntement agrement constable maner sydes dispayre yet wrote french kyng messenger besechyng geue credite belefe ale tolde fayned agaynste without hearyng answere affirmynge kynge always knowen hys treuth fidelitie towarde croune fraunce shoulde still fynde hym till dyeng day promising warranting stand pleasure woulde copasse duke burgoyn two vtterly destroy kyng englande army returned counsaylers french kyng made answere master kyng england ioyned confedered sure amitie wherfore would wise know condisced thing might either preiudiciall sounde detriment englishman sayd kyng master much trusted constable hys sake would talke priuy chaumber french kyng entry chamber caused lord countay seruaunt duke burgoyn accopanied lord argenton one priuie counsayll stande secretly behynd selyng hangyng chamber selfe sat chayre directly place soeuer purposed hym standing behynd clothe might asely se facile heare lewes de creuell felow entered kynges chamber nothinge thinkinge lesse sprytes enclosed declared payne master taken french kynges sake send moue entyce duke burgoyn leaue clerely forsake kyng england duke founde suche rage fury agaynst englishman request onely vtterly determined forsake refuse amitie also would sende aduenturers lanceknightes robbe spoyle retornyng spekyng wordes thinking surely much please kyng sayd lewes conterfeyted fashion gesture duke burgoyn began stape fote groud bete hys fyste table sweryng sainct george kyng englande extracted noble house yomans sonne worth one halfpeny restored kyngdome made kyng onely ayde reprouyng reuilyng hym suche yll wordes shamful termes al herers abhorred frech kyng fayning thycke hearyng caused reiterate saiyng agayn coterfeited gesture duke angry contenaunce roryng voyce man hathe sene better couterfaytor player comedie tragedie lord cotay sore displeased se hys master made iestingstocke kepte thinges secret tyll retorne master pagiaunt played kyng bad messenger co stable haue comended brother master declare newes rose grew would therof aduertise hym gaue licence depart master thoughte selfe great suertye hys estate dede neuer nere falle perdicion estemyng duke burgoyn assured frende whiche hated hym panym turke accomptyng also french kyng haue yll suspicion hym whiche neither trusted yet beleued worde writyng message either writen sent ende hath dissimulacion suche frute springeth double dealyng crafty coueyeng either co stable bene faithfull kyng master bounden duetye allegeaunce ought el kept promes made king england duke burgoyn dalied dissimuled surely extremitie bene ayded succored coforted one thre lest al thre forsake yet forsaken sought loked watched profit promocion hys vndoyng destruccio let v leaue co stable returne coclusion peace thinges apoynted wryten established peace proclaymed bothe campes kyng england soner consumate amit e othe agreed came within halfe leage amyas french kyng thentent obteyne fauor glishmen sent army c carte loden wyne best might gotten farther englishman resorted town amyas bothe pastime busines ordeined entri gate town two great long table set euery syde streat englishman passe euery table abundantly furnished sortes delicate viand especially would prouoke appetide drynke lacked wyne sorte seruitours redy serue minister al thinges necessary farther accompany familierly entertayne english nacio euery table apoynted v vj gentelmen beste compaignions whole coutray onely se serued without lacking also drynke make good chere kepe company euer entered towne taken brydels maner nforced drynke wheresoeuer came payed money set scot free chere lasted iii iiii dayes french kynges cost conclusion small vnquietinge one day entered towne amyas ixm englishman wel armed frechman durst forbid entre occasion enteryng toune onely refreshe bye thinges necessary business affayres frenche kyng therof enformed somwhat vexed amased fearyng either losse toune hurt people sent thenglish capitaynes requiring withdraw souldiers theyr campe capitaynes performed kynges desyre much lay sent xx ten came backe agayne brought co pany french kyng sent monsier de guye marshall frauce toune se englishmes behaueour founde drinkyng singing slepyng might perceyue ment neither disceat vntreuth yet frenche kyng nature suspicious especially toward englishman came gate amyas strongly accopaignied caused iijcmen armes kept secretly capitaynes house copaigny set portall englishme entered smal number god wot haue resisted great company englishman either enteded thing toward french kyng toune kyng englad priuilie enformed frech kinges doubtfull imaginacion vntrew suspicio wherfore sent word make proclamacion englishma entre toune vpon peyne frech kyng made answere neither stode honor yet princely humanitie shoulde forbid frendes called take pleasure toune might please kyng englad apoint certain yome hys croune stand gate apoynt onely shoulde enter also number theim thoughte moderacion suerty pleasure party request kyng england quicke spede caused performed great quietnes french kyng cousaill casting farther periles reason required haue still remebrace article treaty two prince shoulde enteruiew mete place party appoynted kyng england appoynted lord haward syr thomas sentliger herault frech kyng assigned lord bonchace lord argento whe thei vewed ryuer agreed conuenient surest place pycquegnye water iii league fro amyas toune standeth lowe ryuer passeth thorough syde french kyng come coutrey fayre open likewise parte pleasaunt towarde ryuer ther cawsey ii arow shout legth enuyroned marsh surely daungerous passage conueye prince straunge realme strayte frenche men ment fraude verely kyng england great trust confidece honor promise french kyng nobilitie woulde vpon assurance aduentured farther might haue ben performed cocluded iiii commissioner large bridge made ouer ryuer middel bridge made great strog grate tymber like grate lyon kept hole grate extende longer quantitie man myght easely put thorough arme bridge made couered bordes onely kepe wether vnder couerture might stand xii person euery sude grate extended one syde bridge euen directly way one prince come grate ihon duke burgoyn slayn ouer ryuer onely one fery bote bridge thynges necessary ended performed great purpose well diligently vewed sydes appointed xii noble personage attendant euery prince barres iiii englishman assigned stand frech men bridge se doyng behauoure likewyse iiii frenchme limitted englishman cause policie day appoyn ted xxxi day august yere christes blessed incarnacion mcccclxxv eche kynge approched ryuer syde army eche army might se frenchman say write army englishman greater muche fayrer battayll excuse cace saiyng fourth parte army lacking may alow excuse please token meting shot artelerie knowen french kyng xii noble men entered bridge came closure whome ihon duke burbon cardinall hys brother prelate mete ladyes carpet ecclesiasticall pulpet x emongest whome lorde argenton like disguised apparell frech kyng ware pleasure day haue hym adourned kynge englande came alonge causey haue spoken well accopaignied semed well kyng hys brother duke clarece erle northumberland bishop elye hys chanceler lord hastynges chamberlayn viij lordes kyng edward iiii appareled clothe golde frised hauynge hys bonet blacke weluet floure delyce golde set ryche orient stone goodly fayre beautefull prince beginninge littel growe flesh approched nere grate toke hys cappe made low solempne obeysance french kyng made hym humble reuerence hys fashion somwhat homely kyng lewes embrased kyng edward thorough barrier saiynge cosyn right hartely welcome party assuringe man world haue desyred se speke wyth lauded almighty god mette together good godly purpose whereof doubte shal haue cause reioyce kyng england hym thanked answered hys wordes soberly grauelye princely frenchme littell mused chanceler england made solempne oracion laude prayse peace concluding prophe ie sayd pycquegny concluded peace bothe honorable profitable realmes englad frauce chaceler opened letter agremetes treatie demadyng contented answered ye eche prince layed right hand missal left hand holy crosse toke solepne othe obserue kepe treatie truce ix yeres cocluded betwene confederate alies coprised mencioned specefied thesame farther accoplishe mariage chylderne thinges theron depending according agreed concluded betwene ambassador whe othe take sworne french kyng sayd merily kyng edward brother take peyn come parys shall feasted entertayned lady shall apoynt cardinal burbon confessor shall gladly assoyle suche synnes committed kyng england toke wordes pleasauntly thankefully enformed cardinall good compaignion chaplayne mete dalyeng pastyme thys communicacion merily ended french kyng entendynge shew hym selfe lyke master emonngest hys seruauntes made hys compaigny draw backe hym meanyng comon wyth kyng england secretly englishman drew without commaundemet two kynges commoned alone secretly thynke profite constable fraunce frenche kyng demaunded kyng edward whether duke burgoyn would accept tre ce kynge edwarde answered woulde agayne make offer vpon refusall would referre report treuth bothe kyng lewes began speke duke britayn whome would fayne haue excepted leage kyng england answered brother requyre moue warre duke britayne fidelitie tyme nede aduersitie neuer founde frendlye sure stedfast louer kyng lewes called copaignye agayne lowly amiable commendacions toke leue kyng englad speking certayn frendly wordes euery englishma kyng edward doyng lykewise frechme one tyme departed fro barrier mounted horsebacke departed french kyng amyas kyng edward hys army whome sent french kynges house thynges necessarie prince much neither torch torchettes lacked vnsent french king departed picquegny called hym lord argento sayeng peace god kyyg england amorous fayre prince fyrst becke woulde gladly se parys mighte fortune fynde pleasaunt talkatyue dame fayre woordes pleasaunt pastymes myght allure hym theyr fantasy myght brede occasion hym come ouer sea agayne whiche woulde gladly se hys progenitor haue ben longe often bothe parys normandye thys syde sea loue neither hys syght hys copaginye home loue hym brother take hym frende frenche kyng departyng sore desirous make warre duke britayne whiche could except wer lift treatie wherfore sent lorde bouchage lord pierre kyng englande entreatyng hym way mocions possible leaue duke britayn alie haue hym comprehended league kyng englande hearyng seriously feruently speake duke britayn earnest cou tenaunce answered saiyng lordes assure wer peaceably home realme yet defence duke britayn countrey would passe sea either would iniurie make warre vpon hym frenche lordes nothyng farther saiyng muche marueiled kyng englande surely claue duke britaynes partie thei knew el least remembred henry erle richemonde within power dominion duke britayne kyng edwardes phanteasie euer gaue hym would make title croune englande next heire house lancastre knewe well duke britayne would transporte hym england bothe kyns olke frendes neuer smal aide yea although wer shadowe army wer enforced newly begin conquest though neuer wonne croune obteigned possession realme whiche verie cause stacke sore duke britaynes part thesame night lordes returned amia reported master kyng edwardes answere whiche therwith best pleased pleasure displeasure remedy dissimule matter night also came lorde haward twoo kyng englades counsaill whiche coadiutors toward peace frenche kyng supper lorde haward said frenche kyng secretly eare stoode pleasure could perswade kyng englande come amia yea p tauenture farre paris familierly frendly solate hymself hym trustie frende faithfull brother frenche kyng mocion nothyng pleasaunt callyng water washed rose without answere makyng saied one counsaill imagined awne conceipt request would bee made englishe menne began common matter frenche men pollitiquely brake communicacion saiyng kyng celeritie must marche forward duke burgoyn although mocion semed onely encrease loue continuall amitie betwene prince yet frenchman hauyng perfecte remembraunce innumerable damage huttes whiche thei late day susteined englishe nacion whereby continual hatred encreased fraunce thought pollicy wisedom faire woordes frendly countinaunce put request mocion rather departe homeward pricke forward paris peraduenture thei might bee entertained tyme thei would another come thether bothe vndesired vnwelcomed peace said made onely holy ghoste daie metyng white doue satte toppe kyng englandes tent whether sat drie came hether token geuen god referre iudgemente treatie metyng duke gloucester lordes whiche content truce duke came afterwarde amia diuerse lordes englande frenche kyng whiche bothe highly feasted also presented plate horse well garnished kyng lewes consideryng gai englishemen gotten makyng warre fraunce miserie calamitie pouertie frenche nacio suffered many yeres susteined reason thesaid warres determined clerely rather pacifie entertain englishe nacion wordes great rewardes although wer great charge muche hardines put hymself nobilitie realme hasard geuyng battaill predecessor vnwisely doen po er agyncort wherfore bye peace grauted kyng edwarde yerely tribute lm crounes bee paied london whiche accoumptyng croune iiii amounteth xm l haue fauor good chief counsailers gaue greate pencions amountyng xvim crounes yere saie chauncello lorde hastynges chief chamberlein man lesse witte vertue greate aucthoritie master without cause aswell tyme adu rsitie faire flateryng worlde well truely serued hym lorde hawarde sir thomas mountgomerie sir thomas setliger sir ihon cheiney master kynges horse marque dorset sonne quene diuerse gaue great liberal rewardes thintent kepe hymself amitie england wanne obteined purpose desire place persones geuen greate giftes beside yerely pencions argenton counsailer affirmeth awne knowlege lorde haward lesse terme twoo yeres rewarde money plate xxiiiim crounes tyme metyng gaue lorde hastynges kynges chief chamberlain frenchman write hundered markes siluer made plate wherof euery marke viii ounce sterlyng thenglish writer affirme gaue thesaid lorde hastynges xxiiii doosen boulle saie ii dosen gilte xii dosen vngilte euery cuppe waiyng xvii noble whiche g ite either betokened hym greate liberall nature el greate especiall confidence thesaid lorde chamberlain beside gaue hym yerely twoo thousande crounes pencio whiche sent hym pier cle et one master house geuyng hym charge receiue hym acquitaunce receipt thesame pencion thintent appere tyme come chauncellor chamberlain admirall master horse kyng englande many counsaill fee pencionaries frenche kyng whose yerely acquitaunces lorde hastynges onely except remain recorde bee shewed chamber accomptes palaice paris whe pier cleret paied pencion lorde hastynges gently demau ded hym acquitaunce discharge whiche request denied onely required hym letter three line bee directed kyng estifiyng receipte pencion intent kyng master thinke pecio imbesiled lorde hastynges although knewe pier demaunded nothyng reason answered sir gift cometh onely liberall pleasure kyng master request determinate shall haue putte sleue praie render hym gifte neither shall haue either letter acqui aunce scrowe signed hande receipte pencion thintent bragge another day kynges chamberlain englande hath pencionary frenche kyng shewe acquitaunce chamber accomptes dishonor pier lefte money behynd made relacion thynges master whiche although yet muche praised wisedom pollicie lorde hastynges pencionaries commaundyng hym yerely bee paied without discharge demaundyng kyng englande rec iued tribute nobilitie rewardes frenche kyng trussed vp tentes laded bagage departed toward caleis came rememberyng craftie dissimulacion vntrue dealyng lewes erle pole high constable fraunce entendyng declare hym french kyng verie true likenes portarture sent vnto hym twoo letter c edence written thesaied constable true report suche woordes message hym sente declared thesaied constable ambassadours whiche letter frenche kyng gladly receiued thankfully accepted chief instrument bryng constable death escaped long season suche ende dissimulers kyng edward come caleis set al thynges ordre toke shippe sailed prosperous wynde englande receiued maior london magistrate clad scarlet vc comoners appareled murrey xxviii daie septembre xiiii yere reigne vpon blacke heathe conueighed greate triumph citie westminster long labor reposed hymself euery daie almoste talkyng quene wife mariage daughter caused called dolphenesse thynkyng nothyng surer mariage take effecte accordyng treatie hope whiche mariage caused hym dissimule thynges whiche afterward chaunsed greatly frenche kynges profite smally kyng edwarde arriued englande frenche kyng thynkyng meane possible haue constable onely duke burgoyne determined conclude truce ix yeres vpon couenaunt euery man haue awne ambassadours would haue truce proclaimed thynkyng thereby saue duke periurie whiche sworne neuer conclude peace till kyng englande three monethes realme returne caleis kyng englande dooynges asserteined frendes wherefore hast sent sir thomas moungomerie wise sage knight frenche kyng beyng uernyns concludyng duke burgoyns ambassador requiryng hym take none truce duke charles whiche theim concluded desiryng hym farther wise departe sainct quintines duke offeryng would longer continue warre thesaied duke would pleasure duke displeasure passe sea nexte sommer frenche kyng paie hym fiftie thousand crounes losse whiche sustein custome reason wolles caleis warre could haue vent vttred also paie halfe charge halfe wage souldiers men warre frenche kyng moste hartely thanked kyng englande kynde offre faithfull frendshippe excusyng hym peace al ready assented verie peace betwene theim concluded sauyng onely duke would bee contractor league compreheded thesame another prince alie matter thus answered faintly excused thesame sir thomas mountgomerie dispatched plate conueniently rewarded hym returned lorde haward sir ihon cheiney whiche wer hostage frenche kyng til kyng edwarde returned englande frenche kyng marueiled litle kyng edwardes offres thought perilous cause englishemenne passe sea ioyne frenche menne thei neuer loued coniecturyng farther englishe menne burgonyons would sone agre reason old acquaintaunce familiaritie chaunce bothe become enemy frenche men wherefore auoydyng ambiguites determined conclude truce xv yere kyng edwarde maner establishedthe xv yer well affaire outwarde warres priuate perticuler busines home notwithstandyng beyng moste valiaunt fortunate victor suche many terrible bloudy battailes might thynke leade life perfect quietnes sure sauetie yet consideryng henry young erle richemond one ofsprynges bloud kyng henry sixte yet liuyng good health iudged hymself bee farre purpose onely thyng vexe trouble ioye felicitie thought hymself neuer bee sure estate voyde trouble feare wherfore determined yet sollicite moue frauces duke britayne either giftes promise praiers deliuer erle handes supposed faccion bande kyng henry parte hym extincted clerely defeated bryng lure rule awne mynde pleasure wherfore sent doctor stillyngton twoo ambassador well laden small golde hast duke britayn intent desire appere honest open face world willed declare duke request haue erle deliuered onely purpose ioyne aliance mariage extirpate plucke vp dregees leuynges aduerse part contrary faccion whiche enterprise whatsoeuer thei saied onely affinitie onely death innocent erle henry acheued brought passe duke gently hard orator firste began deny excuse might ought agree request inconclusion praiers requiryng monnyes sollicityng duke beyng weried ouercome deliuered erle ambassador letter highly commended kyng edwarde thynkyng deliuered shepe wolfe sonne father beleuyng surely without scruple doubt kyng edward would geue mariage lady elizabeth eldest daughter deede maried father death herafter shall heare whe thambassadors praie thei muche desired thei departed toune malo standyng sea side thei rekened haue taken shippyng haue sailed englande erle richemond knowyng goyng toward death pensiuenes inwarde thought fell feruent sore agewe season one iho cheulet estemed emong prince britayne fewe countrey muche credite wel accepted duke thynges thus concluded solace countrey beyng thereof certified beyng chafed abhominacion fact resorted courte familierly came duke presence stode sadly paly without worde speakyng duke muche abashed sodainly marueiled sad frownyng coutenaunce demaunded ignifie dumpishenes mynde inward sighyng whiche countenaunce manifestly appered euident modestly answered moste noble redoubted lorde palenes visage dedly loke doth prognosticate time death approche hand whiche chaunced day assure muche lesse hurted preserued fele dolorous pag sorow ul sighynges whiche fact doen thought impossible obteined hath imprinted stomacke hart depely grauen well perceiue either shall lese life el liue perpetuall distresse continuall misery synguler good lorde verteous actes noble feates haue gotten maner immortall fame whiche eue mannes mouthe extolled eleuated aboue high cloudes ala semeth praie pardon reudenes haue obteined high laude glory nothyng lesse regarde kepe pre erue thesame inuiolate consideryng forgettyng faith faithfull promise made henry erle richemod hath deliuered moste innocent young gentleman cruell tu menters bee afflicted rente peces slain wherefore suche loue whiche nomber one cannot chose lament sory whe thei se openly fame glory moste renoumed name suche dis altie vntruthe promise blotted ed perpetuall note aunder amie peace myne awne good ihon duke praie thee beleue suche thyng like happen therle richemond kyng edward hath sent hym make hym beyng suspect enemie good faire sone lawe well l ihon redoubted lorde geue credence therle ry brynke perishe permitte set one foote power dominion mortall creature able hereafter deliuer hym death duke beyng moued perswasions ihon cheynet whiche either litle beleued smally suspected kyng edward desire erle raude deceipte el seduced blynde auarice loue money honestie fidelitie wisedom would require consider vnaduisedly aduisedly haue doen wh rfore diligence sent furthe peter landoyse chief threasorer commaundyng hym intercept staie erle richemond hast possible peter sluggyng dreamyng busines came englishe ambassador malos abidyng wynde firste inuented cause commyng kepte theim long communicacion pertracte tyme till men meane season conu ighed th rle almoste halfe ded sure sanctuary within toune whiche nowise might bee violated beyng deliuered continual feare dredful death recouered hys health good plight brought duke man may euidently perceyue olde greke prouerbe bee trew man man shall sometyme god yong erle henry without desert deliuered death sodaynly labor ihon cheulet fauor good prince preserued saued deliuered god graunt examplesmay doctrine yrror ruler aboue lackyng counsaylers monish warne duetie office thei remembryng thys good acte may learne take counsayl amilie well truly admonishe warne likewise good mynde glad entent folowers thesame english oratours complayned murmured spoyled money marchandise requyring peter landoyse wise returne deluded without pray penney treasorer effectuously promised erle either surely kept sentuary escaped negligence layed charge el agayn duke house put prison shoulde nede feare hym hys shadow kyng england hys money purchased keping enemye space iii dayes kyng edward meane season sore belongyng know effect hys ambassade toke duke britayne therefore euery houre trobled vnquieted harkenyng lokynge last certefied thence howe erle rychemond deliuered poynt brought home hym prisoner captiuitie escaped first lamented hys purpose haue prosperously succeded beyng somwhat molified apeased hard sauelykept prison determined clerely hereafter banishe care hys mynd fantasye employe hys whole study diligence kepynge hys house beutyfull fashion liberall proporcion accustomed sufficiently stored hys cheste treasure remembryng hys honor lest peraduenture noted spot nygardshyp shewed hym selfe lyke liberall beneficiall prince hys common lyke good profitable kynge comon wealth poore people hys realme dominion xvi yerethe xvi r euen kyng edward sought inuented studied dayly howerly bryng hym selfe quietnesse rest hys realme continual amitie perpetual peace lykewyse thesame tyme charles duke burgoyn whose wit neuer loued peace yet wery abhorred troble whose intollerable paynes warres hym pleasure especially thought new seignorie obteine el reuenged auncient enemyes olde greues displeasure done desyre rule mixt hatred malice cobined auarice kyndeled prouoked excited hys courage thys yere whose bragging audacitie nede brydell refrayned spurre pricked forward partly reuenged duke lorayne swytchers partly couetous desyre certayn lades lyeng betwene hys lowe countreys brabant flauders hys duchie haut burgoyn assembled great army mighty puyssance beseged towne called granson lorayn receyued without mercy lyke tyrant caused inhabitates cruelly put death wherof heryng switcher mafully encoutered hym disconfited hys whole armye duke lost bothe honor prayse abundaunce ryches prince hys tyme able shew iuels many suche high price value cotent chauces euer hope reueging fought switcher agayne morrat wherof xviiim good warre lost xm besyde wounded hurt yet fierce couragious capitayne coragious circuspect gathered agayn new army contrary myndes hys whole counsaill depe wynter beseged toune nancy belongyng duke lorayn encoutered sayd duke switcher agayne ouercome disconfited slayne thus one yere lost iii great battayles fyrste grantson lost honor hys ryches second morrat lost honor almost hys men thyrd nancy loste lyfe honor ryches men worldely felicitie uigile epiphany yere lord writer mcccclxxvi mcccclxxvij thys ende valiant hart stout courage duke charles burgoyn hys tyme could neuer agre peace cocord tyll death puyssant lyfe maye resiste broughte hys bodye quietnes perpetual tranquilite body entered church sainct george nancy leuyng behynd one sole doughter lawfully begotten heyre afterward maryed maximiliaen arch duke austrice battayl taken anthony bauldwyn bastarde bretherne duke charles whome french kyng bought duke lorayne entent shoulde withstande hys pretensed purpose flaunders yf man sory duke burgoyns death may sure inwardly sory frenche kyng hart ioyous glad hauyng peace englande knew creature able matche hym earnest game would lese tyme vnder couler wome able enioy thyng hath ben aperteynynge croune fraunce toke yong damosel burgoyn tounes moundedier perone abbeuyle monstreul roy tounes ryuer besyde thys great payne obteyned hesdyng arras toune bulleyn countye bullonoys whiche kynge charles hys father engaged empledged duke philip burgoyn mencioned thys wyly wytty kyng lewes comyng toune bulleyn perceyued fortefied garrison onely yl neyghbor tounes caleys guysnes also port necessa ie conuenient hys subiectes either enemy assayled stormy tempestious wether driue narrow sea wherfore cast sure ancker knowynge lord bartrame de la toure erle auluerie trew vndubytate heyre sayd toune countie fyrst obteyned righte title thesame rewarding greater summe yerely value reuenewes countye forest place entent haue port euer open vpo englad annexed thesame toune bulleyne countie bullonoys partes adiacent croune regalitie fraunce fornamed towne countye holden rledom artoys chaunged enure solemply auowed holde thesame toune coutie lady bulleyn therof homage image great church called lady church bulleyn offring hart gold weiyng iim crounes ordenyng farther hys heyres successor entrie estate dignitie royal self deputie offer hart lyke weight value releue homage done made thesame toune countie maye sure kyng england would haue suffered french kyng haue edefied couert nest nere toune caleis territory thesame except hys leage bound hym much affyance french kyng whose hart doble whose wit euer incostat surely hope prefermet daughter brought hym blyndnes dotage let doynges ouer passe se politikely french kyng wrought aduantage duryng gaynes lowe partes caused duke lorayn enter hygh burgoyn great army whiche policie promise brought whole duchie vnder obedience french kyng claymed haue order mariage yonge lady pupille ward orphane aperteyning croune fraunce title rose smal mischief troble flaunders cou trey thereaboute let v leaue whyle speke outward busines retourne awne pthe xvii yer yere xvii yere kyng edward fel sparcle priuy malice betwene kyng brother duke clarece whether rose olde grudge tyme passed newly kyndled set fyre quene bloud euer mistrustyng priuely barkynge kynges lignage desirous reigne hys brother men haue thereof made large inquisicion suche small authoritie dayes certayntie therof hyd coulde truely disclosed coniectures often c yue imaginacions fantastical folke declare treuth conclusion fame kyng quene bothe sore troubled folysh prophesye reason therof bega stomacke greuously grudge agaynst duke effect whi h king edward reigne one whose first letter hys name shoulde g deuel wot wytchcraftes wrappe illaqueat myndes men delyte deuelyshe fantasyes sayd afterward prophesie lost hys effect kyng edward glocester vsurped hys kyngdome allege cause death late olde racor betwene beyng newly reuiued betwene creature vehement betwene bretherne especially f rmely radicate duke beyng destitute wyfe meanes lady margaret duches burgoyn hys syster procured haue lady marye doughter heyre duke charles husbande bee geuen hym matrimony mariage kynge edward enuyenge felicitie hys brother bothe agayne sayed disturbed thys priuy displeasure openly appeased inwardly forgotte outwardly forgeuen withstandyng seruaunt duke sodainly accused say treuth vntruely suspected duke enemyes poysonyng sorcery inchauntment therof condempned put taste paynes death duke whiche myght suffer wrongfull condemnacion hys man conscience adiudged yet forbere paciently suffer vniust ha delyng hys trusty seruaunt dayly dyd oppugne wyth yll woordes murmur doyng thereof king muche greued troubled hys brother dayly querimonye contynuall exclamacion caused hym aprehended cast towre beyng taken adiudged traytor priuely drouned malueseyg orge duke cl rence oun tow sure although kyng edward consentyng death destruccion yet muche dyd bothe lamente hys infortunate chaunce repent hys sodayne execucion asmuche person sued hym pardon remission malefactor condempned punyshment death woulde accustomably saye openly speke infortu ate brother whose lyfe one creatoure woulde make openly spekyng apparantly meanynge meanes nobilitie brought hys confusion thys duke left behynd yonge infantes ngendered body daughter rychard late erle warwy ke whiche chylderne awne merites olowynge steppe theyr cetours succeded misfortune emblable yll chauce edward hys heyre whome kyng edward created erle warwycke thre twenty yeres tyme kynge henry vii attaynted reason towre hyl behedded margarete hys sole daughter maryed syr rycharde pole knyghte beyng mu h bounde kynge henry vii auauncemente mariage besyde manifolde hym receyued obliged excellent prince kynge eight restoryng aswell ame title countesse salisbury possession thesame forgetting miserable chaunce father lesse remembryng kynd e kyndred sayd souereygne lord comm ed agaynst hys maiestye hys realme abhominable de estable treason whiche open par iament adiudged attaynted two sixty yeres ter father put death towre grene within thesame place axe suffered execucion whose person died surname plantagene geofrey platagenet longe bloud royall thys realme florished contynued death thys duke reason great vntemperate ayer happened soo fierce quycke pestilence xv yeres warre paste consumed thyrd parte people onely foure monethes miserably dispatched brought th sepulture xviii yerethe xviii yere haue harde longe frenche kynge onely claymed ule gouernaunce mariage yonge prince damosell burgoyn also wyth policie orce plucked ayrest feather tayle meane whole haut burgoyne stronge tounes pycardye tyme come myght lyke happen proue yll neyghbours english nacion thynges pollitikely pondered maturely digest wi e cousaylers england first considered olde amitie betwene house englande flaunders quotidiane entercourse trafficke commutacion smal season ben practised frequented excercised tually frendly betwene subiectes nacions hauynge resort either sayd countreys saw open eye frenche kynge either force mariage charles erle angulesme whome promised hys good wyll obteynyng yonge prince get vpper hande damosel seignories dominion ensue whole realme englande bothe vtterynge commodity partes also impedyment st ppe course recourse besyde new imposicions gabels set within sayde countreys vpon marchauntes goodes ware wherfore whole nobilitie sage father made humble request tokynge edwarde helpe ayde yonge ladye pry ce burgoyne allegynge fa coulde er eyue mariage hys doughter dolphyne dissimuled fayned treaty cocluded pycquegnye betwene hym kyng lewes apoynted agreed openly frenche kynge within yere folowynge shoulde sende ladye elizabeth entiteled dolphynesse uyen conueyed fraunce whiche yere foure passed gone without worde speking sendynge goynge fraunce quene englande also wryten thys season lady garet duchesse burgoyne prefermente brother anthony erle ryuers mariage yonge damosell counsayll flaunders consyderinge erle meane estate greatest enheritrice christendom tyme gaue deafe hearynge soo vnmete request whiche desyre fleminges geuen good eare wyth gentell wordes delayed suyte bothe bene succored defended good number susteyned soo greate losse dyd whether kynge edwarde content wyth thys refusall trusted frenche kynges promyse hys counsayll coulde se cause lothe lese hys yerely tribute fifty thousande crounes woulde wyse consent sende army flaunders agaynst frenche kynge sent ambassadours kynge lewes louynge gentle letter requyrynge hym conclude reasonable peace el least take certayne truce wyth hys request ambassador englande wer highly receiued bountefully fested liberally rewarded answere desire thei none shortely frenche kyng would sende ambassador hostage pledge kyng england master concludyng per ormaunce thynges dependyng betwene theim twoo souereigne lorde thei haue good cause contented pleased faire wordes wer onely delay protracte tyme meane season wynne tounes coutreys damosell aide succor could administred beside staie kyng edwarde takyng parte wrote hym would ioyne hym aide personally make warre parte lady territory dominion kyng edward haue enioye hym heires whole countie countrey flaundersa greate offer made frenche king kyng edward iiii discharged homage superioritie resorte claimed frenche kyng h ire successor farther haue whole duchie brabant whereof frenche kyng offered awne charge co e conquere foure chief strongest tounes within thesaied duchie theim quiet possession deliuer kyng englande grauntyng farther paie hym tenne thousande angel toward charge besides municions warre artilerie whiche promised lende hym men cariage conueighaunce thesame kyng englande answered tounes flanders small strengthe litle quantie verie vneasie bee kepte thei wer conquered lesse force duchie brabant subiectes bothe lothe verie willyng haue warre consideryng theth r one common trafficques ventes merchaundice frenche kyng would make hym partener conquest picardy renderyng hym parte tounes ready gotten gained boleigne mounstrell abbeuile would surely take parte aide hym men awne costes charge matter answeryng repliyng frenche kyng spoyled young prince oftounes region best capitaines father lefte lorde cordes wherefore pure necessitie aide strengthe maried maximilian sonne frederike emperor whiche power sore resisted frenche kyng makyng inuasions flaunders wife landes seigniory prince conceiued husbande first yere mariage faire lady called margaret kyng lewes phantesied either haue publique peace maximilia father whiche might staie warre hostilitie betwene meane peaceably enioy countryes tounes hym stollen faintly conquered el imagenyng onely damosell conclusion conioyne whole countrey flanders dominion therunto apperteinyng croune fraunce fewe tymes attempted assaied clerely forgettyng promes made written sworne kyng englande mariage daughter solicited priuily lordes flanders haue thesaied lady margarete bee conioyned matrimonie dolphin sonne writynge sendyng kyng englande faire promise flatteryng letter purpose clerely vanished englande fixed flanders shall hereafter well vnderstande pthe xix yerethe xix yere kyng edward xix yere reigne forgettyng aswell exterior inuasions ciuill warre intestine trouble whiche tyme aboundantly tasted willyng bothe felte continuall experience beganne firste accustomed serche penall offence aswell chief nobilitie gentleman beyng propritaries greate possession aboundantly furnished goodes beside merchauntes inferior persones reason wherof men adiudged doubted consideryng newe fame rich gready appetite money treasure would proue hereafter sore exstreme prince emongest subiectes immaginacion especiall wandred heddes men brother duke clarence put death saie men stande liue feare hym vnbrideled doubte man newe inuented practise auaricious inuencion forein outwarde affaire abbreuiatyng day transitorie world whiche wer within twoo yeres consumed toke greate effecte experience teacheth prosperitie ofte tymes greate trouble greate mischief vnquiet profite possessioners rich suche haue fruicion thesame pouertie aduersitie profitable laudable persones whiche pacient stomacke meke harte beare suffre stormes surge euill fortune peruerse mischaunce pthe xx yerethe xx yere kyng edward hauyng thynges brought effect whiche long desired except age daughter charles dolphyn muche studied lesse desired haue affinit accordyng appoyntmet made concluded accomplished solempnized therfore onely wrote sent diuerse messenger frenche kyng performaunce thesame frenche kyng whiche neuer intended haue mariage take effecte consideryng dolphin muche younger lady elizabeth cause sent ambassador kyng england faire woordes friuolous delay makyng excuse sent kynges daughter maried sonne dolphin accordyng league treatie concluded occasion greate trouble busy warres enterprised high burgoin lowe countreys disgarnished aswell nobilitie menne honor receiue realme accordyng estate degree promisyng faithfully shortly sende conueigh suche pompe royall traine bee bothe honor laudes high contentacion kyng englande quene whiche lesse husbande desired sore longed se conclusion thesaid mariage take effect ambassador well feasted likewise rewarded toke leaue within conuenient season sent orator whiche neuer englande intent predecessor beyng ambassador saied concluded thyng although thei wer authorised yet might turne frenche kynges preiudice damage thei might without blame excuse themselfes ignoraunce matter affirmyng thei commissio common el enterprise medle matter perceiued thyng like concluded whiche sounded pleasure profite would sende ambassador greate haste sende another newe instruccions nothyng dependyng olde fashion kyng lewes vsed prince sente ambassador whiche copassed many thynges purpose losse moste thus dalied kyng englande concernyng mariage onely intent kepe hym still amitie aboue prince truthe kyng englande beyng suspicious nature muche trusted gaue hym muche confidence thought sunne would soner haue fallen circle kyng lewes either would haue dissimuled broken promise hym soner breaketh promes mooste trusted soner deceiueth moste credence attributed part sone begiled least mistrusteth soner falleth casteth perill nothyng mistrustyng smal lightnes muche trustyng muche foly wherefore kyng edward either muche trusted mistrusted frenche kynges faire promise would dooen deede croune fraunce increased possession dominion greate glory strength realme prince burgoyne plucked hared spoyled faire tounes castle whiche chaunce beyng destitute frendes without comforte defender pacience perforce compelled suffre sustein profite nacions get faire promise frechmen thus league made lewes frech kyng fraudulently glosed dissimuled thus oth made sworne vpo holy euangelistes violated contrary woorde honor prince broken falcefied whiche vntrue dealyng couert dissimulyng especiall trustie frend men maie facilie se apparauntly myrror perceiue verie natural condicion frenche nacion pleasuntly flatter plentifully reward gloriously glose til thei haue obteined pretensed purpose haue ambicious desire accomplished satisfied gain gotten side neither othe holdeth frendship continueth yet humanitie kyndnes shewed regarded remembred wherefore myne aduise let men trust thei fynde xxi yerethe xxi yere verie season iames iii name kyng scottes sent england solempne ambassage haue lady cicile kyng edwardes ii daughter maried eldest sonne iames prince scotlande duke rothesay erle caricke kyng edward counsaill thinkyng affinitie bee aswell honorable profitable realme onely graunt desire demaud also hande disbursed certain somme money onely intent mariage herafter neither interrupted broken vpon condicion thesaied matrimony accedentall meane tyme come take successe perfeccion kyng edward would notifie kyng scottes counsaill pleasure determined haue thesaid mariage infringe dissolued prouost merchauntes toune edenborough bee bounde repaiment thesaied al thynges wer great deliberacion concluded sealed hope cotinual peace infringible amitie kyng iames beyng man sharpe wit wedded awne opinio reason would scace bere would neither geue credite theim spake contrary awne phantesie imagined opinion thintet man find fault doynges reprehed actes promoted made counsailers menne basse lignage lowe bloud especiall cochrane compaignie whose euill aduise mischeuous instigacion punished greued nobilitie bothe emprisonment exaccions death voluntarie went exile fainyng cause departe fled landes straunge countreys duke albanie called alexander brother kyng iames exiled fraunce passyng englande taried kyng edward shall heare ther e mar wise pollitique counsailer edenborough bee hedded beside forgettyng othe promise affinitie concluded kyng edward caused army bee made englande spoylyng burnyng killyng kynges faith full subiectes whiche vnprincely dooyng kyng englande beyng litle moued chafed determined reuenged hym battaill dent sworde yet notwithstandyng kyng iames craftely excusyng hymself alleging mischief late comitted attempted doen perpetrated without concent knowlege counsail matter lightly pacified blowen ouer duke albanie beyng kyng edward incesed entised prouoked hym make warre scottishe kyng brother bothe reuenge iniuries late thesaid kyng doen contrary lawes armes princely demeanure also helpe restore thesaied duke possessios dominion whiche kyng brother dispossessed reiected promisyng kyng edwarde greate aide assistence armie entered confines scotlande kyng edward beyng thus perswaded duke trustyng aide somwhat agreable inward remembraunce kyng iames supported hym men money olde enemie kyng henry sixt also trustyng alexander duke albanie adie vanquishe brother obtain croune scotland would alwaies hym sure faithfull trustie whiche enflame corage set harte fire determined al diligence armie royall inuade countrey scotlande make kyng knowe neither honorably truly kept league promise wherfore al winter season mustred souldiers prepared ordinance rigged shippes left nothyng apperteignyng warre vnpurueyed vnloked beginnyng yere al thynges wer prepared nothyng missed xxii yerethe xxii yere thynges apperteignyng furniture suche enterprise put readines ready bee sette forward kyng edward appoynted cheuetain hooste lieuetenaunt generall brother richarde duke gloucester hym associated henry iiij erle northumberlande thomas lorde stanley lorde steward houshold lorde louell lorde greystocke diuerse noble men knightes valiaut capitaines set forward maie made suche diligence pollitique coueighaunce souldiers beside troubelous cariage ordinaunce thei came toune alnewike northumberlande aboute beginnyng iuly thei firste encamped theimselfes marshalled hoste forward led therle northumberlande vnder whose standerd lorde scrope bolton sir ihon middelton sir ihon dichfeld diuerse knightes esquiers souldiers nombre sixe thousande seuen c men middell ward duke gloucester hym duke albany lorde louell lorde greystocke sir edwarde woduile nombre fiue thousande eight c menne lorde neuell appoynted folowe accompaignied iiim men lorde stanley led wyng right hande duke battaill iiiim men lancashire chesshire lefte wyng guyded lorde fitz hewe sir willyam parte sir iames harryngton nombre iim men beside thousad men appoynted geue attendance ordinaunce royall armie intendyng slepe geue scottes knowlege arriuall party came sodainly water side toune berwicke force feare greate armie toke entered toune therle bothwell beyng capitain castle would nowise deliuer neither flatteryng wordes manacyng bragges wherefore capitaines deliberately consultyng together planted strong siege enuironed rounde aboute siege thus laied twoo duke souldiers except lorde stanley sir ihon elryngton threasorer kynges house sir willyam parre iiiim men lefte behinde kepe siege castle departed fro berwicke toward edenborough marchyng thetherward brent destroyed tounes folowyng edryngton paxton fishewike brandike hooton heton hall mordyngton bastile plome horne toune bhroweshed steple brome hill bastile edram estrusbet blakater branke kallow kamorgan whitsonelawes brynlenyn ryselaw elbanke hockas betroside erneslaw bastill hilton whitsome mykyll swynton bastile litle swynton bastill somprone harden croffirge whitside edyngham whitmere newtowne duryng whiche tyme erle northuberland brent tounes yatham yatham brymsed bastell low house bastell cheritrees hoyepe cliffton coto hawmon hawmon grawnge hawdon marbotell bastile lynton bastile part cawarden brent chedworthe craylam bastill neskot neskett olde rokesborough ednam bastill wonne ednam isle benlaw ousnam long puolo deliuered croke ashewes mydpropes bastell cossemaynes bastell weddon bastell thynges doyng kyng iames scotlande hauyng small cofidence commonaltie lesse trust nobilitie voluntarely incarcerate enclose hym selfe strong castell maydens edenborough perfitly trustyng doubtes daunger except famyn treason caused hym violently ope porte gate whereof duke glocester entered toune especial request desire duke albany saued toune thenhabitantes thesame fier bloud spoyle takynge onely presentes merchates gentelly offered capitaynes causing gartier principal kyng armes make publique proclamacion high crosse market place edenboroughe warned admonished iames kyng scottes kepe obserue performe promise copactes couenantes agrementes concluded sealed high mighty prince edward grace god kyng england c also make co digne sufficient recompence subiectes great tyrannye spoyle crueltye people perpetrate committed cotrary league within march territory realme englande firste daye august nexte ensuynge farther without delay restore high mighty prince alexander duke albanie naturall brother estate office possession authority ample liberall maner occupied enioyed thesame high valiaunte prince rychard duke glocester leuetenaunt generall chiefetayne kyng england redy hand destroy people cou trey slaughter flame famyn kyng iames would make aunswere neither woorde writing knowing power fayled either performe request demaunded defend countrey puissant armye inuaded lordes scotland lyeng hadyngton great puyssaunce hearyng kynge englandes reasonable desyre determined firste practise wyth duke glocester peace haue castell berwycke parte meanes allure duke albanye english amitie vpon mocion ii day august wrote duke glocester mariage betwene prince england shoulde accomplisshed poyntes according couenantes agreed instrumentes therof engrosed rquyryng farther peace then urth might louyngly concluded betwene bothe realmes duke glocester wisely circumspectly certefied agayn touchyng article mariage take effect betwene prince lady cicilie england knew determinat pleasure king master brother either affirmaunce deniace thesame desyred full restitucion summes money sayd mariage time ben disbursed prested loue sayd lordes desyred haue peace concluded thensfurth betwene sayd realmes fyrst required haue castell barwyke deliuered lest agre sayd peace siege lyeng sayd castel hereafter wise neither troubled vexed molested ye king scottes none subiectes procurement prouoking ayde comfort assist victayle ordinauce wise capitayne constable souldiers sayd castel durynge siege lordes prelate baron estate realme scotlande perceyuing wel pondering bothe answer demaundes duke glocester sent sufficiently enstructed conclusion reuerend father andrew elect murray lord ihon de nele thus answered sayd duke desyred repayment ye summes money delyuered part payment contract mariage made betwene prince scotland kynges daughter england tyme lawfull contract mariage yet come minoritie said prince princesse faute hereof day apoynted money payed contract began king brother woulde demaunde farther assurance either contract made payment money promised therunto accordinge reason agre secondarely touching castel berwike sayd al know wel ynough olde enheritance croune scotlande many hundred yeres past souereigne lorde hath right thereunto alleged belonged realme england conquest well knowen standeth scotland ouer scottish ground duke withstandinge saiynges would codiscend peace without castel barwyke rendered kyng england messenger departed thesame day archebishop sainct andrewes bishop dukelle colyn erle argyle lord cambell lorde andrew lord auandale chaunceler scotlande wrote vnto duke albanye solempne autenticall instrumet signed sealed seales binding body landes goodes sayd duke would hereafter obedient kyng scottes kepe obserue fayth promise made sayd lordes shoulde onely restored landes hereditamentes office possession whiche enioyed day departure scotland also haue enioy seruauntes familiers fre general pardon restitucion pardon thei likewise promised ra fied approued kyng iii estate assembled next parliament duke beyng glad restored agayne olde estate possession especially awne natiue countrey receyued offer truly performed toke leue duke glocester thankyng hym lesse bounde greate labour traueyll peyne taken hys awne person restitucion promised bothe word writing awne hande performe thinges tyme sworne promised kyng edwarde notwithstanding agremet made made lordes scotland performance theffect sayde scedule agayne toke corporall othe ye duke glocester sealed writyng thyrd day august ye english cape leuyngton besydes hadyngton anno mcccclxxxii departed hys awne possession thus restored reconciled lordes scotland proclaymed hym great lieuetenaut scotland kynges name made proclamacion shoulde redy vpon peyne death within viii dayes craushaues rayse siege castell recoueringe agayne towne barwyke duke albanye wrote preparacio duke glocester hubly requiring hym haue mistrust hym promising kepe othe promise made kyng edward hym duke glocester wrote hym agayne shoulde neither honorable commendable hym helpe reise siege layeng whereof counsayler partener yet reward ye king england displeasure kyndnes costes expeses hym hys extreme necessitie louingly shewed liberally exhibited assured hym woord prince power scotland attempted come rayse siege planted ye castell barwyke hym selfe hys armye woulde defende besegiers el dye quarell counsayl scotlande sagely poletiquely sawe shoulde come reyse siege duke glocester woulde shortly encouter lost felde stregth realme brought imbecilitie noble sore minished castell lost taken side obtayned victorie nothyng gotten pore towne barwyke thei likely sone inuaded greater power shortly agai wherfore sent lyon kyng armes duke glocester offering hym thought two offer reasonable one would promise honor subuerte cast doune toune walles barwyke would likewise race clerely deface walles towres porte castell el duke glocester put capitayn garrison men warre towne duke albanye likewise castell tuycion thesame farther forsayd lyon desired abstinece warre take tyll two duke might haue comunicacion grauous matter concernyng welthes bothe realmes duke glocester refused bothe offer saiyng long mainteined siege castell barwyke small waste exhaustyng hys brother treasure ryches great trauayle payne lordes gentilmen men warre continuallye made abode dayly residens sayd seige wherfore sayd poynt fermely resolued departe tyll castel yelded apoyntement taken force el hys siege power scotland reysed hys armye vanquished wherfore would meane harken peticion scottishe lordes concernyng abstinence warre tyll either vanquished possessed castell barwyke whiche answere herault departed thereof made relacion lordes counseyll scotland whe duke answere well digested euidetly perceyuing castell barwyke onely maker ye peace deliuery thesame norice continuer warre hostilitie consideringe farther nobilitie common scotland dyd draw together one lyne sorted one leuell electyng chosyng better parte reiectinge auoydynge worse agreed determined deliuer castell barwyke english partie shoulde truce abstinence warre taken concluded determinate season thervpo sent duke glocester league indeted dated xxiiii day august yere lorde mcccclxxxii contracted agreed betwene duke glocester lieutenaut general kyng englande alexander duke albanye lieuetenaut iames kyng scottes especial abstinence warre kept obserued betwixte realmes england scotland people thesame aswell sea lade begyn viii day september next ensuyng endure tyll iiii day nouember next folowyng meane season towne castel barwyke occupyed ye reall possession suche kyng englandes deputie apointed assigned singuler boundes limites territory english uacion last vsed possessed castell towne subieccion englishman march boundes beyng difference betwene sayd realmes stande holden lyke case condicion last truce concluded duke glocester well perceyued scottes graunted hys demaudes relieue awne necessitie gratefie hym kyng hys brother poynt like wyse counseyler toke hys aduantage offered especially thynges made hys longe desyred purpose fyrst deliuery castell barwyke voluntarely without counsayl praye priuely gotten accepted alowed onely cause dyd refuse abstinence warre gentely agreed touching possession kept landes dependyng variance betwene realmes comenly called batable grounde woulde durst conclude duke albanye without hauyng farther intelligence kyng hys souereigne lordes pleasure counsaill meanynge thereby euer kepe sueters hym farther seke theim meane season let matter suspence whe sealed fyrst two article sent agayne lordes scotlande gladly receyued good embrased likewyse truly performed thesame castell barwyke incontinent deliuered lord stanley thereto appoynted whiche therein put bothe englishe men artilerie sufficiente defence scotland vi monethes meanes haue harde englishman repossessed agayn towne castell barwyke whiche xxi yeres kyng hery vi scottes haue hard geuen vp deliuered lest peraduenture duke glocester might thynke duke albanye dyd thynges set forward prefer auance hys fyrst requestes demaundes made requyred lordes scotland especial one assurance made repayment kyng england suche summes money beforehand prested disbursed kynge scottes mariage solempnised consummate betwene chyldern rehersed therfore sayd duke albanye caused prouost burgess edenborough make sufficient instrument obligatorie kynge edward trew satisfaccion contentacio thesame money also sent thesaied prouost duke glocester alnewyke copy hereafter foloweth knowe men thele present letter v walter bartraham prouost towne edeboroug scotland whole felowship marchautes burgess communaltye thesame towne bounde oblished presentes vnto excellent mighty prynce edward grace god kyng englande commoned agreed betwene hys excellencie ta parte right high mighty prince souereigne lord iames king scottes parte mariage matrimonie haue ben solempnised betwixt mightye excellent prynce iames first begotten sonne heyre apparant soueraigne lord foresayd right noble prince cicilie daughter sayd edward kyng englad sayd mariage haue ben performed certayne diuers great summes money ben payed contented excellent prince vnto oure soueraigne lorde forsayd certayn wrytynges betwixt sayde prince thereupon made large playnly appeares pleasure sayd edward kyng england haue sayd mariage performed completed accordynge sayd communicacion writing shall well truely without fraude disceyte collusion obserued keped accomplished partie souereigne lord foresayd noble spirituall temporall realme scotland pleasure sayd excellent prince edward kyng england haue sayd mariage performed completed walter prouost burgess marchantes co mon abouenamed towne edenboroughe v shall pay content kyng englande foresayde summes money payed sayd mariage syke lyke termes dayes immediatly ensuen refusall sayd mariage syke lyke maner forme sayde summes afore deliuered contented payed obligacion bond voyd stregth prouided alwayes sayd edward kynge england shall geue knowlege hys pleasure eleccion premiss taking refusing ye sayd mariage repaymet said summes money sayd souereygne lord lordes hys counsayll v sayd prouost merchautes v within realme scotland beyng tyme betwixt feaste alhalowes next come whihc payment well truly made bynde oblishe v euery v heyres succession executor goodes merchaundises thynges whatsoeuer bee euer place water lande syde sea beyond shall happen founden leage truse sauegard made made notwithstanding wytnes wherof thys oure present writyng letter bonde sayde prouost burgess merchauntes commontye haue set common seale sayde towne edenborough fourth daye august yere god ccccxxii geuen presence right mighty prince richarde duke gloucester alexander duke albanye reuerende father god iames bishop dunkeld ryght noble lord henry erle northumberlande colyn erle argile thomas lorde stanley master alexander english c duke glocester thus obteyned hys purpose receyued writynges signed sealed performance thesame sent instrumentes kyng edward hys brother whiche muche comended bothe hys valiaunt manhode also hys prudent pollicie conueyng hys busines bothe hys awne purpose also profit realme kyng edward littel mused much debated wyth hys counsayl whether profitable honorable hym hys realme suffer sayde mencioned mariage take effect procede conclusion el requyre repaymet redelyuery summes money apprompted layde thesame purpose long consultacion considered case realme ye kyng scottes stode wel knowen hys nobilitie great discord haue hearde considered farther nobilitie preuayled gat souerayntie lyne succession iames thyrde likely totally extirpate disinherited euer also alleged prince scotlande neuer condiscended hymselfe sayd woulde agre thys mocioned mariage thynges thus debated kyng great aduice refused reuoked thynges done forwardnes sayde matrimony elected chose repayment suche summes money occasion sayde betrusted mariage payd hand contented deliuered accordynge woordes obligacion made towne edenborough sent gartier hys principal kyng armes northumberland herault declare intimate prouost burgess edenborough determinate refusall future matrimony eleccion choyse repayment money nd duety farther ouerture whole conclusion gartier instructed writyng saye declare conuenient iorneys came towne edenborough viii dayes feast sayntes openly sayde foloweth gartier kynge armes seruaunt proctour messenger vnto hygh mighty prince dread soueraygne lord edward grace god kyng englande fraunce lorde ireland vertue certain letter procuracie redy shewed sayd souereygne lord made geuen make notyce geue knowlege vnto prouost burgess marchauntes communaltie towne edenborough scotlande sometyme commoned agreed betwene sayde soueraygne lorde one partie righte hygh mighty prince iames kyng scottes partie ye mariage matrimony haue solempnised betwene iames first begotten sonne said kyng scottes lady cicilie daughter sayd souereygne lord kyng england sayde mariage haue ben performed certayne dyuers greate summes money ben payed contented sayde souereygne lord whiche summes money cace refusall sayde mariage sayde souereygne lorde made declared ye sayd prouost burgess marchauntes communaltie euery one bounde obliged letter vnder youre comon seale toune ede borough repaye vnto hys hyghnes vnder lyke forme suche termes fyrst payed kyng souereygne lord woulde make notice knowlege hys pleasure eleccion talkyng refusynge sayde mariage repayment sayde summes money feast alhalowes nexte come lyke sayde letter bearynge date edenboroughe fourthe day august last past conteyned large pleasure eleccion sayd souereygne lord dyuers cause consideracions hym mouynge refuse accomplishement sayde mariage haue repayment suche summes money occasion sayde betrusted mariage hys hyghnes payed sayd repaymente prouoste burgess merchauntes communaltie euery youre heyres successours accordynge bonde obligacion afore rehersed therefore geue notice knowlege thys writynge whiche deliuer within terme sayde letter lymitted expressed entente effectes therof maye ensue gartier thus declared al thinges geuen charge prouost burgess made aunswere knowynge kynges determinate pleasure woulde accordynge theyr bonde prepare repayment sayde summes gentelly enterteynyng gartier coueyghed hym barwyke whece departed new castell ouke glocester makyng relacion hym hys doynges whiche duke spede returned shrythuton abode shortly gartiers departynge duke albanye thynkyng obteyne agayne hygh fauoure kynge hys brother deliuered hym captiuitie pryson wherin certaine space continued without duke assente whiche besieged hym castell edenborough littell set large whome vtwardly receyued great thankes inwardly nothynge reuengyng confusion kynges stomacke incorporate shortly kynges presence icopardye hys lyfe improuided dread death coacted take small balynger sayle fraunce shortly tydynge men armes encontered tylt lewes duke orliaunce frenche kyng mischarging speare fortune peruerce countenaunce pytyfullye slayne broughte death leauyng hym one onely sonne named ihon whiche beynge banished scotland enhabited maried fraunce died dolorous sorowfull wryte muche pencifull remember chaunces infortunites happened within twoo yere englande scotlande betwene naturall bretherne kyng edward set suche enuied estate duke clarence forgettyng nature fraternall amitie consented deathe hys sayde brother iames kynge scottes puttynge obliuion alexander hys brother onely organe instrument whome obteyned libertie fredome seduced led uyle malicious person whiche maligned glorie indifferent iustice duke albanye imagened compassed hys deathe exiled euer pernicious serpent venemous tode pestiferous scorpion deuelishe whelpe called priuye enuye agaynst fortres defend caue hyde wood shadow foule escape beaste auoyde poyson stronge neuer man authoritie coulde escape bytyng tethe scrachyng pawes blastyng breath defoulynge tayle wherefore let euery indifferent persone serche history rede chronicle looke aucthores aswell holy prophane thei shall apparauntly perceiue neither open warre daily famyne accustomed mortalitie muche enemie greate malle destroye suppeditate high power nobilitie roted malice inwarde grudge dissimuled hatred although kyng edwarde wer glad ioyous prosperous successe enterprise realme scotlande yet euen feuer tercian whiche languished sore sithe voyage royall fraunce sodainly turned vncurable quartain tossed betwene hope dispaire sometyme hote sometyme colde matrimonie daughter charles dolphin come solempnizacion accordyng leage betwene freche kyng concluded picquegnie cast indissoluble melancoly continuall cold lorde hawarde whiche returned fraunce many faire wordes painted promise without tribute conclusio marige certified kyng awne knowlege beyng present sawe lady margarete austrice daughter duke maximilian sonne emperor fredericke receiued fraunce pompe emperiall duke burbon lorde dalbret many lordes magistrate realme greate triumphe conueighed amboyse dolphin laie hym contracted espoused kyng edwarde beyng certain frenche kyng pleasaunt language colourable answeres foded hym furthe allured hym geue credence dissimulyng woordes neither meanyng saied shewyng meante determined hymself longer suffre apparaunt wrong intollerable iniurie wherfore called nobilitie together declared manifold wrong whiche receiued late handes frenche kyng vntruly vnprincely broken league amitie bothe deniyng paiment tribute also refusyng accomplishmet mariage daughter accordyng treatie concluded requiryng therfore study reuenge punishe greate shame opprobrious taunt offered natiue countrey nobilitie litle glad mocion answered whole desire fight frenche men thei ofte time vanquished profligated battail dignitie fame conntrey thei would let nothyng vnatempted offeryng hym instant ready harnes fulfill mynde desire knewe toward myndes subiectes temporaltie moued spiritualtie ecclesiasticall lawes thei prohibited weare armure aide hym money mainteinaunce warres suppressyng enemy xxiii yerethe xxiii yere beholde intentiue amployed whole labor diligence industrie furnishe setforward warre whiche newly attempted begonne whether melencoly anger toke frenche kyng vntruthe vnkyndnes superfluous surfet whiche muche geuen sodainly fell sicke gr uous maledy taken yea greuously taken vitaill spirites began faile waxe feble whiche debilitie perceiued called together noble whiche tyme wer aboute london vpon one daie diuerse tymes commen thus effect theim saied welbeloued lesse betrusted frendes counsailers alies wee mortall men would daily hourely self reuolue intetiuely harte engraue mindes grauously poder fraile fadyng imbecilitie humain natur caduke fragilitie thesame wee apparauntly perceiue beyng called reasonable creature predicament compared ioyned angelles bee worthy numcupate de ed persones vnresonable rather bee associate name brute beastes called vnreasonable wohse life death creature speaketh rather poynt bee tesembled angelicall societie reasonable compaignie health v florisheth prosperitie abundeth glosyng worlde laugheth whiche reasonable v saie erre truthe weke remebred fatall ende prescribed terme enduryng prouided labor study otherwise set stedfast sure ordre securitie profite continuanuce either possession dominion sequele posteritie whiche hym shall naturally succede suche blyndnes fraile fragile nature euer geuen carnal concupiscence mundain delectacion daily ob uscate seduced lothargious deceiable serpent called hope long life wee put obliuion duetie present lesse remembre pollitique purueighaunce thynges come blyndly walke fraile life till fall grouelyng iyes sodainly vpon death vanity worlde bee v agreable begin liue esteme life whole worlde whiche ouerpassed sheweth better dust driuen way puffe wynde speake self selfes sore samentyng inwardly bewailyng performe finally cosumate suche pollitique diuises good godly ordinaunces long life paciffique prosperitie whiche fully determined haue begonne set forward completly haue finished whiche extreme paine torture angrie maladie small terme naturall life neither performe neither yet liue see either take effecte short take conclusion god call record harte fully sette mynde deliberatly determined haue decorated realme wholesome lawes statute ordinaunces haue educated brought vp myne enfantes child vertue learnyng actiuitie pollicie royall puyssaunce frendly assistence proudest prince europe durste attempte moue hostilitie realme oh lorde thynges long tyme haue mynde reuolued immagined stelyng thief death goeth subuerte momet houre clerely suppeditate wherefore men saie beyng driuen verie hard wall hauyng perfect confidence sure hope approbate fidelitie constaunt integritie whiche haue euer experimented knowen bee radicate planted harte louyng body toward myne maie saie aduowe neuer prince bearyng scepter croune ouer realmes region hath found proued faithfuller counsailers trewer subiectes haue doen neuer potentate gouernor put affiaunce truste vassal seruauntes sith adepcion croune fermely haue fixed circumspect wisedomes sober discresions verie force compelled liyng dubious hope betwene liuyng diyng betwene remembraunce obliuion require instauntly moue haue found faithfull obediet requestes desire healthe conuersant diligent intentiue death hope sure anchor grounded myne
