taken clerely proued impedimente let kynge mary wherefore shortely grafton beside stonystratforde maried lady elizabeth grey verie priuely enemy wife praied hartely losse whiche god loued better graunte bone wife crouned quene father created erle riuers sonne created marque dorset whe erle warwike vnderstode mariage toke highly therof ensued much trouble greate bloudshed declared story edward iiii haue rehersed mariage somewhat length might thereby better apere vpon slipper ground protector builded colour whiche pretended kynge edwarde child bastardes inuencion simple liked theim suffiseth haue somewhat saie sure compelled larger profe theim selues liste make nowe returne left beganne shewe protector counsaill concluded doctor shaa sermon paules crosse signifie people neither king edwarde hym selfe duke clarence wer lawefully begotten wer child duke yorke begotten vnlawfully persones aduoutry duches mother dame elizabeth lucy wife kynge edward prince edward child begotten quene wer bastardes accordyng deuise doctor sha sondaie paules crosse greate audience alwaie greate numbre assembled preachyng came pulpit takyng theme spuria vitulamina dabunt ad esaltos sapien iiii saie bastarde ppes shal neuer take depe rootes whereupon shewed greate grace god geueth secretely infoundeth right generacion lawes matrimony declared child comenly lacked grace punishement parentes ye part vnhappy wer gotten baste specially aduoutry whiche though ignorauncie worlde truthe hid knowlege haue enherited season mennes landes yet god alwaie prouideth continueth bloude longe truethe commynge lighte rightefull enheritoures bee restored bastard ppes plucked vp bee rooted depe laied proofe confirmacion sentence example taken oute olde testamente aunciente history began discende praise lord richard duke yorke callyng hym father protectour declared title croune biinheritaunce also entaile authorised parliament death kynge henry sixte shewed lorde protector onely righte heire body lawfully begotten declared kyng edward neuer lawfully maried ye quene wife god dame elizabeth lucy child wer bastardes besides neither kyng edward hym selfe duke clarence emongest wer secrete duke yorkes houshoulde neuer reconed surely bee child noble duke fauoures resembled knowen menne hym whose verteous condicions saied also kyng edwarde farre lorde protector quod veraye noble prince speciall patrone knightly prowes aswell princely behaueour liniamentes fauour visage representeth ace ye noble duke father quod father awne figure awne countenaunce verie printe visage sure vndoubted ymage playne expresse likenesse noble duke nowe deuised speakynge wordes protector shoul e haue come emongest people sermond ward thende wordes metynge presence mighte haue taken emongest herers though holy ghoste put theim preacher mouthe shoulde haue moued people euen haue cried kynge richarde mighte haue sayed specially chosen god maner miracle deuise quayled either protectoures negligence preacher ouer hasty diligence protectoure founde waye ta iynge leaste shoulde haue preuented woordes doctour fearynge shoulde come sermon coulde come woordes hastynge matter thereto come theim paste theim entred matter protectour came beheld commynge sodainly lefte matter whiche hand without deduccyon therunto ordre frame began repete woordes agayne noble prince especiall patrone knightely prowes whiche aswell princely behaueoure liniamentes fauour visage representeth veray face noble duke yorke father father awne figure countenaunce print visage sure vndoubted image plain expresse likenesse noble duke whose remembraunce neuer die liueth wordes speakyng protectour accompaignied duke buckyngham wente people vp place wher doctor stande harde oute sermond people wer far ynge kynge richarde stoode turned stoones wonder shamefull sermonde whiche ended precher gat hym home neuer durst loke shame kept hym sighte owle asked old frendes people talked although awne consciece well shewed hym talked good yet answered hym euery mannes mouthe hym muche shame spoken strake hym harte fewe dayes withered awaie tuesday next foloyng sermond beyng xvii daye iune came guyld hall london duke buckyngham diuerse lordes knightes happely knewe message thei brought east ende hal hoystynges kepte duke maire lordes sat downe alderman also common citee beeynge assembled standynge theim scilence commaunded vpon agreate pain protectoures name duke stode vp well learned nature merueilously well spokenthe os ion duke buchingham made ci n lodo sayed people cleare lowde voyce frendes zeale hertie fauoure beare bee come breke matter righte greate weightie lesse weightie pleasyng god profitable realme parte realme profitable citezens noble citee thynge haue long lacked well knowe sore longed would haue geuen greate good tha woulde haue gone farre fetche thynge come hether bryng without labour pain coste auenture eoperdye thynge certes surety awne body quiete wiues daughter sauegarde goodes whiche thynges tyme passed stoode doubte coulde recon hym selfe lorde awne good emongest many gynne trappes wer set therefore emong muche pyllyng pollynge emonge many tax talliages whiche neuer ende oftymes nede yf grewe rather riote vnreasonable waste necessary honourable charge daily plucked pilled good honeste menne greate substaunce goodes lashed emong vnthriftes far furthe fiftenes suffised vsuall termes knowen tax vnder easy name beneuolence good commissioner muche euery manne toke eneuolence manne woulde good haue geuen though name beneuolence signified euery manne shoulde paie hym selfe good lust graunte kyng good wil lust take neuer asked litle euery thing haunsed aboue measure amerciamentes turned ines fine raunsomes smalle trespaces mesprision mesprision treason thynke manne looketh shall remembre example name though burdet forgotten whiche worde spoken hast cruelly behedded burdet marchaut dwellyng chepesyd ye signe roune signe flowre de luse ouer soper lane man merely ufflyng tyme kyng edward iiij rage saied awne would make heritor croune meaning awne house wordes kyng edward made mysconstrued interpreted burdet meante croune realme wherfore within lesse space iiii houres apprehended iudged drawen quartered chepesyde misconstruynge lawes realme prince pleasure lesse honoure merkam chiefe iustice lost office rather would assent iudgement dishonestie either feare flattery gaue iudgemente nede speake syr thomas cooke alderma mayre noble citceof syr thomas cooke ye reade either negligence wotteth forgetfull remembreth harde harted pitieth worshipfull mannes losse speke losse wonderfull spoyle vndeserued distruction onely happened fauour prince fauoured nede reherse mo name sithe doubt many present either theim selues nighe frendes aswell goodes persones greately endaungered either fained querels small matter aggrauated heinous name also ther crime great whiche could lacke pretexte sithe king preuentyng tyme inheritaunce attained croune battail suffised riche manne pretext treason haue kinred aliaunce nere familiarite longer acquaintaunce wer tyme kynges enemy whiche one tyme another half realme thus wer nether goodes neither landes surety yet broughte body ieoperdye beside comen auenture open warre whiche albeit euer well occasion much mischiefe yet neuer mischeuous wher people fal deuision distaunce emong selues realme earthly dedly pe let happeneth emongest v emong v neuer continued long discencion many battailes season cruell dedly foughte wer kyng day dedde god forgeue solle whose tyme whose occasion aboute gettyng garlande kepyng lesyng winnynge againe hath coste englishe hath twise winnynge fraunce inwarde warre emongest ourselues hath greate effusion aunciente noble bloud realme scarcely half remaineth great enfeblyng noble lande beside many good towne ransaked spoyled theim haue goyng felde returnyng thence peace much urer warre tyme whiche menne money greate menne landes feare displeasure perel mistrusted mistrusted awne brother spared kylled awne brother coulde suche maner folke moste fauoured doo somewhat shall honoure spare speke howbeit ye wo e well whose best bare euer lest rule suite day shore wife vile abhominable strompet lordes england excepte vnto made proctour simple woma yet well named honest tyll kynge wanton luste sinfull affection berefte husbande right honest manne substanciall emongest thai poinct whiche good faithe sory speake sauynge vaine kepe counsaill thyng menne kuoweth ye kyng gredy appetite insaciable euery ouer realme intollerable wome young old poore riche sette yie vpo thynge liked either persone beautie speche pace countenaunce without feare god respecte honour mermure grudgyng worlde would importunately pursue apetite haue greate distruction many good woman greate doloure husbandes frendes whiche beyng honest people theim selues much regarded clenesse house chas itee wiues childre theim leuer lose thei haue beside haue suche vilanie dooen theim albeit importable dealing realme euery place anoyed yet specially citezens nobilitie emongest moste plentie suche thynges minister matter suche miuries nerest hande sithe nere aboute moste common abidyng yet ye people singuler cause wel truly intreate part realme onely prince noble citee speciall chambre renoumed cite realme muche honourable fame receiueth emongest nacions also without greate coste fondrye fauoures ieoperdyes warres bare euer especiall fauoure parte whiche kynd myndes borne house yorke sithe hath nothynge worthely requited house nowe whiche god grace shall make full recompence thyng shewe whole effect errande shall wore well nede reherse vnto al redy haue hearde hym better tell sure ye better beleue reason bee proude looke therefore receiue wordes great aucthorite preathers woord god namely man comminge wise manne wotteth better doo saie therto good vertues would saie thing wist saie pulpit namely honest manne cometh lie honourable preacher ye well remembre substancially declared paules crosse sondaie laste paste righte title moste excellent prince richard duke gloucester protector realme whiche hath vnto croune kyngdome worship u man made perfectely groundely open vnto child kynge edward fourth wer neuer laufully begotten muche kynge liuynge verie wife dame elizabeth lucy neuer laufully maried quene mother whose bloud sauyng set volupteous pleasure honour ful vnmetely bee matched mynglyng two bloudes together hath ff sion greate parte noble bloud realme wherby maye well bee seen mariage well made whiche muche th efe growen lacke lawefull copulacion also thynges whiche saied worshipfull doctor rather signified fully explaned whiche thyng shall bee spoken thyng euery manue forbeareth saie knoweth aduoidyng vispleasure noble lorde protectoure bearyng nature requireth fil reuerence duches mother cause remembred saie lake issue lawfully commynge late noble prince richard duke yorke whose royall bloud crounes england fraunce high au horite parliamet enta ed right title course enheritaunce accordyng common lawe lande deuoluted come vnto moste excellent prince lord protectoure verie lawfull begotten sonne fore remembred noble duke yorke whiche thyng well considred knightely prowesse many vertues whiche noble persone singulerely dooe habounde noble common realme specially north partes willyng bastard bloud haue rule land abusions vsed exercised longer continue haue fully condiscend vtterly determined make humble peticion vnto puisaunte prince lorde protecto r maye like grace humble request take vpon hym guydyng gouernaunce realme wealthe increase accordynge right uste title whiche thynge wor well bee loth take vpon hym whose wisedome well perueiueth laboure study bothe mynde body shall come therwith hym whosoeuer shall occupye rome dare saye take warrant rome childes office greate wise man well perceyued sayed vae regno cuius rex puer est woo realme whose king child wherfore muche cause haue thanke god noble personage righteously entitled therto sad age ther great wisedome ioyned greate experience whiche albeit bee lothe haue saide take vpon hym yet shall peticion behalfe graciously encline yf ye worshipful citezens citee beyng chief citee realme ioyne v noble saied requeste whiche owne weale doubte ye yet neuerthelesse praie doo whereby ye shall doo greate profite realme beside chosyng good kynge shall bee selfe speciall commodite maiestie shal euer beare muche tendre fauour howe muche shall perceiue prone beneuolentely mynded toward election wherin dere frendes mynd haue require plainely shewe v duke saied loked people hoped maire framed shoulde flatterynge preposicion made haue cried kynge richarde kynge richarde still mute one woorde answered wherwith duke maruelous abashed takynge maire nere hym wer aboute hym priuy matter saied vnto theim softely meaneth people still sir quod maire percase thei perceiue well shall wee amende quod wil helpe therwith somewhat lowder rehersed matter ordre woordes well ornately neuerthelesse euidently plaine voice gesture countenaunce comely conuenient euery man muche marueiled hard thought neuer harde liues euill tale well tolde wer wonder feare eche loked shoulde speake firste one worde answered people stoode still midnight muche rounyng emong theim whiche thei mighte seme common doo maire sawe parteners counsaill drewe aboute duke saied people customed spoken recorder whiche mouthe citee happely hym answere recorder called thomas filz wyllya sadde manne honeste newlye come office neuer spoken people lothe matter begyn notwithstandyng vnto commaunded maire made rehersall common whiche duke twise purposed hym self recorder tepered tale shewed euery thyng duke woordes parte owne chaunge made people wiche alwaie one stoode amased vpon duke rouned maire sayed marueileous obstinate scilence turned people woordes deare frendes wee come moue thyng whiche parauenture wee greately neded lordes realme common partes might haue suffised sauyng suche loue beare muche set woulde gladly doo without thyng whiche bee parteners weale honoure whiche v semeth se waye fore wee require geue v answere one whether ye bee mynded noble realme bee haue noble prince protector bee kyng wordes people began whisper emong selfes secretely voyce neither loude base like swarme bee till laste nether ende hal bushement duke seruauntes one nashfeelde belongynge protectoure prentice laddes thrusted hall emongest preace began sodainly mennes backes crye lowde could kynge richard kyng richard threwe vp cappes token ioye thei stoode cast backe heddes marueilynge therat nothyng thei saied duke maire saw maner thei wisely turned purpose saied goodly crie ioyfull euery manne one voyce manne saiyng nay wherefore frendes quod duke sithe perceiue al whole mindes haue noble manne kyng wherof shall make grace effectuall reporte doubt shall redounde greate wealth commodite therefore require morowe ye go v wee noble grace make humble peticio request maner remembred therwith lordes came downe compaignie dissolued departed parte sad glad sembleaunce merie came duke hable dissemble sorowe fain euen backe turne face wall doloure harte braste yies morowe maire aldremen chief commoner citee best maner appareled assemblyng theim together paules resorted baynardes castle protectoure laie whiche place also accordyng appoin tment repaired duke buckyngham diuerse noble hym besides many knyghtes gentleman vpon duke sente woorde lorde protectoure beyng greate honourable compaignie moue greate matter grace vpon protectoure made greate difficulte come doune theim excepte knewe parte errande thoughe doubted partely mistrusted commynge suche numbre hym sodainely without warnyng knowlege whether came good harme duke shewed mayre thei mighte se litle protectour loked matter sente messenger suche louynge message humbly besoughte hym vouchsafe thei mighte resorte presence purpose entent wich thei woulde none persone parte disclose last came chambre yet doune theim galary ouer theim bishop euery hande hym thei beneth might se hym speke hym thoughe woulde yet come nere til wist meante vpon duke buckyngham firste made humble peticion hym behalfe theim grace woulde pardon theim licence purpose vnto grace entent commyng without displeasure without whiche pardon obteined durste bee bold moue hym matter whiche albeit meante muche honoure grace wealth realme beside yet thei sure grace would take would wise offende protectour verie gentle hym selfe also longed sore apparantly knowe meante gaue hym leaue purpose hym liked verely trustynge good minde bare none theim thyng woulde entende hym warde wherewith thought bee greued duke leaue pardon speake wexed bolde shewe hym entente purpose cause mouyng theim thereto ye haue harde finally beseche grace taht would like hym accustomed goodnesse zeale vnto realme yie pitie beholde long continued distresse decaie set gracious hande redresse amendemente thereof takynge vpon hym croune gouernaunce realme accordyng right title laufully disceded vnto hym laude god profite surety lande vnto grace much honor lesse pain neuer prince reigned vpon people wer glad liue vnder obe sauce people realme vnder protector harde proposicion loked strangely therat made answere albeit knewe partely thynges theim alleged bee true yet suche entiere loue bare kynge edward child muche regarded honour realmes aboute croune one whiche neuer desyrous could finde harte poinct incline th desire al nacions truth wel knowe shoulde parauenture bee thoughte awne ambicious mynde deuise depose prince take hym selfe croune infamy would wi e haue honour freined oune whiche euer perchaunce perceyued muche labour pein pleasure hym would vse would worthy haue notwithstandyng onely pardoned mocion made hym also thanked loue harty fauoure bare hym praiyng theim sake beare prince vnder would contente liue labour counsaill far like kyng vse woulde doo vttermoste deuo er sette realme good estate whiche redye litle tyme protectourship lauded bee god wel begon malice occasion contrarie newe entended bee wer nowe partely good policy partely god speciall prouidence mannes prouision repressed put vnder upon answer geuen duke buckyngham protector licence litle rounded well noble men aboute hym maire recorder london vpon like perdo desired obteined shewed aloude vnto protectour finall conclusion realme apointed kynge edwarde line longer reigne vpon bothe far gone suretee retreate thei thought weale vniuersal take ye waie although thei yet begon wherfore would like grace take croune vpon would humbly beseche therunto yf would geue theim resolute answere contrarye whiche thei would bee lothe must seke shoulde faill find noble manne would wordes muche moued protector whiche euery man small intelligence maie wit woulde neuer haue enclined thereto sawe none waye muste take el bothe go saied lordes common sithe wee perceiue well realme sette wherof bee sory suffre wise kynge edwarde line gouerne theim man earthely gouerne willes also perceiue manne whome crowne c n iuste title appertaine selfe righte heire laufully begotten body moste dread dere father richard late duke yorke whiche title ioyned election noble common realme whiche title possible take mooste effectuall wee bee contente agree fauourably encline peticion request accordynge take vpon v royall estate preheminence kyngdome twoo noble realmes englande fraunce one daie forwarde v heires rule gouerne defende god grace youre good helpe get subdue establishe euer dewe obedience vnto realme englande auauncemente whereof neuer aske god longer liue entende procure sette furthe greate cry shoute criyng kyng richard lordes wente vp kynge daie called people departed talkynge dyuersely matter euery man fantasye gaue hym muche thei marueiled maner dealyng matter bothe partes made straunge though neuer one parte commaun parte thereof thei wiste manne dull hearde theim perceyued well ynough matter made betwene howbeit excused saiynge thynge muste bee doen good ordre menne muste sometyme maner sake bee aknowen knowe consecracion bishoppe euery manne perceiueth paiment bulles entendeth bee one yet twise asked whether bishop muste twise saye naie aud thirde tyme take vpon hym compelled thereto awne stage plaie people knowe right well plaieth sowdaine percase souter yet yf one acquaintaunce perchaunce litle nurture shoulde call hym name standeth maiestie one tourmetours might fortune breke hed marryng plaie saied matter bee kynges game staige playes moste parte plaied vpon scaffoldes whiche poore menne bee looker wise bee med ferther steppe vp cannot plaie partes disorder plaie theim selues good tragical doynges kyng richard thirde lothe remembre abhore write miserable tragedy infortunate prince fraude entered tyrannye proceded sodayn deathe ended infortunate life yf declare flagicious factes euyll prince well haue done notable actes verteous kinges shoulde neither animate incourage ruler royalmes countreyes seigniory folowe steppe profitable progenitor atteyne type honour wordly fame neither yet aduertise prince proane vice wickednes aduoyde expell synne mischiefe dread obloquy worldly shame contrary set contrary apparaunt whyte ioyned black maketh fayrer shewe wherfore procede actes accustomed vsage richard third name vsurped croune englad openly toke vpon hym bee kyng nyntene daie iune yere lord thousand foure hundred lxxxiii xxv yere lewes leuenth beeyng french kyng morow proclaymed kyng great solempnite rode westminster sate seate roial called iudges realme straightely commaundynge theim execute lawe fauoure delaie many good exhortacios folowed one departed towarde abbaye churche doore mett procession abbot hym deliuered scepter faincte edwarde went offered saincte edwarde shrine monkes sang te deum faint courage churche returned palice lodged till coronacion sure enemy thoughte sent fiue thousand men north coronacio whiche came vp eiuil appareled worse harneissed rusty harneys neither defensable skoured sale whiche mustered finesbury felde great disdain looker fourth daie iuly came tower water wife fifth daie created edward onely begotten sonne childe x yere olde prince wale ihon haward man great knowlege vertue aswell counsaill battaill created duke norffolke sir thomas hawarde sonne created erle surrey willyam lorde barkeley created erle notingham fraunces lorde louell made uicount louel kynge chamberlain lorde stanley deliuered oute warde feare sonne lorde straunge whiche lancasshire gatherynge menne menne saied sayed lorde made stauarde kynge housholde likewyse archebishop yorke deliuered morton bishop ely deliuered duke buckyngham kepe inwarde whiche sente hym manoure brecknoke wale whence escaped kyng richarde confusion nighte kynge made seuentene knightes bath nexte daie roade london greate pompe especiall duke buckyngham richely appareled horse trapped blew beluet enbroudered naues carte burnyng gold trapper borne fotemen grounde suche solemne fassion menne muche regarded morowe beeyng sixt dare iuly kynge came toward coronacion westminster hall chapell prelate mitred receiued ordre procession passed forwarde procession folowed therle northumberlande poinctelesse sword naked lorde stanley bare mace co stableshippe therle kente bare seconde sword righte hand kyng naked lorde louell bare sworde lefte hand folowed duke suffolke scepter erle lyncolne ball crosse theim folowed newe erle surrey sword estate riche skabard right side hym wente duke norfolke bearynge crowne folowed kynge richarde circot robe purple veluet vnder canabie borne barones fyue porte gooynge betwene bishoppes bathe duresme duke buckingham rod high stuarde englande bare kyng train hym folowed therle huntyngdon berynge quenes scepter uicount lisle bearyng rod doue erle wilshire bare quenes croune folowed quene anne daughter richard erle warwike robe like king betwene two bishoppes canabie ouer hed borne barones porte hed riche coronall sette stone pearle folowed coutesse richemond heire duke somerset whiche bare vp quenes trayne folowed duchesse suffolke norfolke countess baroness lady many faire gentlewoman ordre passed throughe palayce entred abbaye weste ende came seates estate diuerse songes solemply songe bothe discended highe altare shifted robe diuerse place open middle vpward whiche place thei anointed bothe kyng quene chaunged theim clothe golde ascended seates cardinall cauntorbury bishoppes theim crowned accordynge olde custome realme geuynge hym scepter lefte hand balle crosse right hande quene scepter right hande rod doue lefte hande euery side kyng stoode duke stoode erle surrey sweard handes euery side quene standynge bishoppe lady knelynge cardinall song masse paxe kynge quene discended high altare bothe houseled one hoste deuided betwene theim masse finished bothe offered saincte edward shrine kyng lefte crowne saincte edward putte owne crowne ordre came departed westminster hal chambres ceason duryng tyme duke norffolke came hall horse trapped grounde clothe gold high marshall voyded hall aboute foure clocke kyng quene entred hal kyng satte midle quene lefte hand table euery side floode countesse holdynge clothe pleasaunce liste drynke right hande kyng satte bishop countorbury lady satte one side middle hall table againste satte chauncelloure lordes table next cupborde satte maire london table behinde lordes satte barones porte bordes satte noble worshipful personage persones sette duke norfolke erle marshall erle surrey constable daie lorde stanly lorde stewarde syr william hopton treasourer sir thomas percy comptroller came serued kyng solemply one dishe golde another siluer quene gylte vessell bishop siluer seconde course came hall sir robert democke kynge champion makynge proclamacion whosoeuer woulde saie kynge richard lawefully kynge woulde fighte hym vtteraunce threwe downe gauntlet al hal cried kynge richarde three partes hall one brought hym cup wine couered dronke cast drynke departed cup herauldes cried largesse thrise hall went vp staige ende diner maire londo serued kyng quene swete wyne eche theim cuppe golde couer golde tyme dooen darkenight king returned chambre euery manne lodgyng feaste thus fineshed kynge sente home lordes countrees woulde departe excepte lorde stanley reteyned till harde sonne lorde straunge wente aboute suche wente home gaue straighte charge commaundemente see countrees well ordred wronge extorcion shoulde bee doen subiectes thus taughte execute iustice equitee contrarye whereof daily exercised also greate rewardes geuen northrenmen whiche sent coronacion sente home countree greate thankes whereof diuerse theim nature gredy autoritee specially thynke haue comforte fauoure tooke theim highly wroughte suche mastries kynge faine ride thether firste yere putte execucion staie countree el small mischiefe ensued incontinente sente solempne ambassade lewes frenche kynge conclude league amitie hym trustynge also obtayne tribute whiche kynge edwarde brother fraunce frenche kyng abhorred hym crueltie would neither se heare ambassador vayne returned nowe triumphante coronacion fell mischifes thicke thicke thynge eiuill gotten neuer well kepte throughe tyme vsurped reigne neuer ceased cruell murther death slaughter til awne destruction ended finished best deathe mooste rightewyse saie awne beganne mooste piteous wicked meane lamentable murther innocente nephewes younge kynge tendre brother whose deathe finall fortune hath neuerthelesse far come question remained longe doubte whether day destroied parkin warbek many folkes malice mo folkes folly longe space abusynge worlde aswell prince poore people reputed taken younger twoo also thynges couertely demeaned one thynge pretented another mente nothynge plaine openly proued yet common custome close couerte dealynge menne euer inwardly suspecte many well counterfet iewelles make true mistrusted hobeit concernynge opinion menne maie se conueighaunce thereof lyfe noble prince kynge henrye vii processe parkyn meane ceason presente matter shall reherse dolorous ende two babe euery waie haue harde waie haue hard suche menne suche meanes thinketh hard shoulde true kyng richard coronacion takyng waie gloucesterthe destruction kynge edward chyldren visite newe honour towne bare name old deuised roade fulfill thyng whiche intended forasmuch mynd gaue hym nephewes liuynge men woulde recon coulde haue righte realme thoughte therefore without delaie rid theim thoug killynge kynsmen mighte ende cause make hym kyndely kyng vpon sent ihon grene specially trusted vnto sir robert brake bury constable tower letter credece also sir roberte wyse put two childre death iohn grene dyd errand brakenbury knelynge oure lady towre plainly answered woulde neuer put deathe dye therefore answere grene returned recomptyng kynge richard warwyke yet iourney wherewith toke suche displeasure thoughte nighte sayde secrete page ah shall man truste haue brought vp selfe went woulde haue moost surely serued euen fayle commaundemente wyll nothynge syr quod page lieth one palet chambre dare wel say grace pleasure thing right hard would refuse meanyng iames tirel whiche man goodly personage giftes nature worthy haue serued muche better prince yf well serued god grace obteyned haue muche trueth good wyll strength wytt man high harte sore longed vpwarde risyng yet fast hoped beynge hindered kepte vnder sir richarde ratcliffe sir willyam catesbye longyng parteners prince fauour namely whose pride thei knewe woulde beare pere kept secrete driftes al secrete trust whiche thynge page well marked knowen wherefore occasion offered speciall frendship spied tyme set forwarde suche wyse hym good enemy except deuil could neuer haue done muche hurte shame vpon page woordes kyng richard arose communicacion sittyng drafte conuenient carpet suche counsail came palet chambre dyd fynde bed sayd iames tyrell sir thomas tyrell persone like brother bloud nothyng kynne condicions sayd kyng merely syrs bed sone called vp iames tyrell brake secretely mynd mischeuous er found nothing straunge wherfore morowe sent brakynbury letter commaunded delyuer sayd iames keyes towre night thende might accomplishe kynges pleasure suche thynges geuen commaundement lettre liuered keyes receyued iames appoincted next night ensuyng destroye deuisyng preparyng meanes prince assone protectour toke vpon hym kynge left name protectoure thereof aduertised shewed reigne vncle haue croune word prince sore abashed beganne sighe sayd ala would myne v cle would let haue life although lese kyngedome tolde hym tale vsed good woordes put hym best conforte coulde furthewith brother bothe shut vp remoued one called blacke wyl willyam slaughter onely except wer sette serue iiii see sure whiche tyme prince neuer tyed pointes thyng roughte hym selfe young babe brother lyngered thoughte heuines tyll trayterous dede deliuered wretchednes iames tirrell deuised shoulde murthered beddes bloud shed execution wherof appoincted myles forest one foure kepte felowe fleshe bred murther tyme ioyned one iohn dighton awne horsekeper bygge broade square strong knaue al beyng remoued mile forest iohn dighton aboute mydnightking edwardes chyldren urthered sely child liyng beddes came chau bre sodenli lapped vp amongest clothes bewrapped entangled kepyng doune force fetherbed pillowes harde vnto mouthes within thei smored yfled breathes failyng gaue vp god innocet solles ioyes heauen leauyng tourmetours body dead bed whiche wretch perceyued firste strugglyng panges death long liyng styl throughly dead layd body vpon bed fetched iames tirr see whiche sawe perfightly dead caused murtherers burye stayre foote metely deepe groude vnder great heape stone rode iames tirrel great hast kyng richard shewed maner murther gaue great thankes menne saye made hym knighte allowed buriall vile corner sa yng would haue buried better place kynges sonnes lo honorable courage kyng would recompece detestable murther solempne obsequy wherupon priest sir robert break nburies toke vp buried place secretely occasion death shortely whiche onely knewe trueth coulde neuer yet wel perfightly knowen saye kynge richard caused priest take vp close lead put coffyne full hole hoked endes ii hokes yro cast place called blacke depes theme mouth neuer rise vp sene agayn trueth vnknowe reason ye sayd priest died shortly disclosed neuer person would vtter trueth sir iames tirrell towre treason committed kynge henrye seuenthe bothe dighton examined together poincte confessed murther done maner haue hard whether body remoued bothe affirmed thei neuer knewe thus haue learned muche knewe litle cause lye two noble prince innocente tendre child borne mooste royall bloude brought vp greate wealthe likely longe liue reigne rule realme trayterous tirannye taken depriued estate shortely shut vp prison priuely aine murthered cruel ambicion vnnaturall vncle dispiteous tourmentours whiche thynges euery parte well pondered god gaue world neuer notable example either vnsurety standeth worldes weale mischiefe workethe proude enterprise highe harte finally wretched ende ensueth suche dispiteous crueltie fyrste begynne minister myles forest end murtherers kynge edward chyldren sainct mar yns le graunde pece meale miserably rotted awaye iohn dighton lyued caleys longe lesse disdayned hated poincted dyed great misery sir iames tyrrel beheaded towre hyll treason kynge richarde selfe slaine felde hacked hewen enemy handes haried horsbacke naked beynge dead heere dispite torne tugged lyke curre dogge mischiefe toke lesse thre yeres mischiefe dyd thre monethes comparable yet al meane tyme spente muche trouble payne outwarde much feare dread anguishe within haue harde credible reporte suche secrete chamberers abhominable deed done neuer quiet mynde neuer thought selfe sure wente abroade body priuely feinted eyen wherled aboute hande euer dagger countenaunce maner lyke alwaies stricke againe toke euill reste rightes laye long wakyng musyng forweried care watche rather bred slept troubled fearefull dreamesfrom beginnynge king edvvard fifte hetherto sir thomas more sodeinly somtyme stert vp leap bed loked chambre restlesse harte continually tossed tombled tedious impression stormy remembraunce abhominable murther execrable tyrannye kyng richard abommable mischyef scelerous act thinkyng hym self well releuyd bothe feare thought would haue kept counsaill day caused ronne common rumor ii chyldren sodanlie dead entent demyd none heyre male beynge liue kynge edwardes body lawfully begotten people would content paciet hart quiet mynd obey hym suffer rule gouernaunce fame detestable facte reueled devulged hole realme ther fell generally dolor inwardsorow harte people feare crueltie set syde euery towne streate place openlie wept pitiou ye sobbyd sorowe sumwhat mitigate ther inwarde grudge could refrayne crye plate publike also priuate furiously saieng creature creature y malicious obstinate enemye either god christian religion humayne nature whiche woulde haue abhorred lest absteyned miserable murther execrable tiranye murther man much odious kyll woman manner vnnaturall slaie destroye innocent babe young enfantes whole world abhorreth bloud earth crieth vengaunce mightie god common people cried assure frendes quene child made lesse exclamacion complainte loude voyce lamentable comme crieng sayenge la thus shamefully murdereth awne bloud cause desert wyll saue slaith poore lambes committed trust se behold cruel tyranny hath inuadyd comon wealth se neither hope iustice trust mercie abundance crueltie thrust innocente bloude newes wer first brought infortunate mother dead child yet sanctuary doubte strake harte like sharpe darte death first enformed murther ii sonnes sodainly amasyd greatnes crueltie feare sounded fell doune groud lay great agonye like deade corp came memory reuyued agayne wept sobbyd pitefull scriches repleneshyd hole mancion breste puncted fayre pulled peces ouercome sorowe penciuenes rather desyred death life callyng name diuers tymes swete babe accomptyng self madde deluded wyle fraudulente promyses delyuered younger sonne sanctuarie enemye put death thinkynge nexte othe made god broke dewtie allegiaunce toward childre violated creature poyncte seduced disceaued longe lamentacion sawe hope reuengynge otherwyse knelyd downe cried god take vengeaunce disceaytfull periurie saide tha nothyng mystrusted would remember y liuyng remember beholde ii noble enfantes deseruing shamefully murthered wil abhorre fact ye moued tormented pitie mercie yet worlde frayle nature blynde fewe sturred suche example obliuiouslie forgettynge littell consyderyng oftentimes offence parentes perpetrate committed synne punished lyne posterite chaunce might happen innocet child king edward ther father parent offended staynyng conscience made solempne othe gate citie yorke haue harde promised sware one thing worde thinkyng cleane contrarie harte dyd appere afterward death duke clarence brother incurred likelyehod great displeasure toward god murther perpetrated visited towne gloucester old dignitie bothe loued ample liberty priuileges endewed decorated toke iorney towarde countie yorke people abusyng lawfull fauoure bothe fauoured trusted hart late presumed attempte diuers route riottes co trarie lawes enfryngyng peace vpon hope mayntenaunce elated lord neuer great power could either pacifie rule tyll kyng hym selfe came personally thether set concorde vnitie countree bridell rule rude rusticall blusterynge bolde people region long iourneyinge came citie yorke citezens receyued hym great pompe triumphe accordyng quality educacion quantitie substaunce habilitie made diuers day playes pageates token ioy solace wherefore kyng richard magnified applauded northe nacion also shewe hym self apparantlie habyte roy l scepter hande diademe hed made proclamacion persones resorte yorke daie assencion oure lorde men shoulde bothe beholde se hym quene prince high estate degree also good wylles shoulde receyue many thankes large benefites muni icente rewardes daye appoincted hole clergie assembled cope richely reuested reuerente ceremonie went aboute citie procession whome folowed king croune scepter appareilled circot robe royall accompaignied small nomber ye nobilitie realme whome marched order quene anne wife likewyse crouned ledinge lefte hande prynce edwarde sonne hauing hed demy crowne appoyncted degree prince kynge triumphe suche honour common people northe reioysed extolled praysed hym far aboue starres solempne feaste glorious pompe kepte greate counsailles well orderynge countree tyme come brydellynge punyshinge suche mysgouerned selfes farther gentilmen contrie augmented nomber hys domesticall minister seruauntes persones put hys whole trust affiaunce thynges thus discretely ordered returned nothyngha came london whome dread loue cytezens receaued greate compaygnies thus kynge richard new inuented crueltie late practised tyrannye obteyned grewe high prayse honoure admiracion iudgemente common multitude moost estemed exalted heauen couertly intelligece like lose estate could meanes haue long contynuaunce v urped power assuredly death kynge edward chyldren blusteringe wynde per lous thunder terrible tempest chansed apparantly like happen sodainly people hauinge freshe memorie facinorous acte kynge prince woulde openly crye make vocyferacion god dyd take vengaunce punishe pore englishemen cryme offence vngracious kynge whome blamed accursed wysshed haue extreme torture although kynge richard harde ofte slaunderous wordes malicious sa ynges knewe wel persones spoke yet dirst strong hande fyrste inuentours reuenged knowinge tyme wisedome refuse disdaigne tell ruler deutie declare hym mysbehauour toward common wealthe counsaill hym amende chaunge yll life great felicitie fell great feare penciuenes mynde coulde meanes either correct amend thinges passed determined doyng deutie al thinges common obliterate put oute memorie note infamie whiche fame iustely spotted slayned cause people co ceyue good opinion thece forth calamyte trouble adiudged happen commo wealth either negligence mysgouernaunce althoughe difficile strange shortelie tourne plucke suche quality vsages haue longe tyme ben encorporate man mynde rooted maners condicions therfore whether performaunce former entent amendement common fame slew brode toke repentaunce myscheuous actes scelerate doynges tourned ouer leffe began order new life pretended haue name good vertuous man bi reason shewed hym selfe iuste meker familiar liberall especially mongest poore people accustomed meanes firmelye trusted fyrst obteyne god forgeuenes offence crymes leuie take waie enemye inwarde grudge common people bare myndes towarde hym conclusion obteigne frendelye loue assured fauour farthermore began enterprised diuers thinges aswel publike priuate beyng preuented sodayne deathe dyd neither accomplishe bryng conclusion begon founde college hundreth prestes foundacion founder shortelye toke ende please common people also high courte parliamente enacted dyuers sondrie good lawes profitable estatutes especiall one againste stranger foren wrought ware transported realme whiche commodius acte common wealthe yf lyued fullye purposed haue auaunsed fet forwarde put execucion afterwarde euidentlie persones appeared onely feare whiche maister longe office continuall aucthoritie iustice caused kynge rycharde verie tyme waxe better amende synnefull life shortelie goodnes man whiche payncted fraudulent sodainlie wexed coulde vanished awaie thence forth onely counsailles doynges procedynges sodainlye decayed sorted none effecte also fortune beganne froune turne whele douneward much lost onely begotten sonne called edwarde iii moneth created hym prince wale pthe ii yere shortely ii yere vnquieted conspiracye rather confederacye betwene duke buckyngham many gentleman ye shall heare ye occasion duke kynge fell diuerse folke diuersely pretended duke haue harde assone duke gloucester death kyng edwarde come yorke solempne funerall seruice done kyng edward sent secret seruaunte called persall suche message haue harde duke buckyngham came ccc horse northampton still continued hym partener chiefe organe deuices tyll coronacion departed semyng frendes gloucester whence assone duke came home highly turned highly conspired man woulde marueill wherof chaunge grewe shorte space say occasyon litle coronacion duke required kynge amongest thynges restored erle herfordes landes forasmuche tytle whiche claymed inheritaunce somewhat interlaced tytle lancaster whiche house made title croune enioyed thre discentes al men knewe tyll house yorke depriued third kynge whiche henry sixte kynge richarde somewhat mistrusted conceiued suche indignacion reiected duke request many spitefull minotary wordes whiche wounded duke harte hatred mistrust could neuer endure loke right king richard euer feared awne lyfe farre foorth protectoure ryde coronacio feigned hym self sycke would hym honoure takyng euill part sent word ryse ryde woulde make hym caried whereupon gorgeously apparelled sumpteously trapped burnynge carte naues golde embrodered roade kyng londo euill woorse harte notwithstandynge roase daye coronacion feast feignyng selfe sicke kyng richard sayd done hate spighte therefore men sayd eche euer lyued continually suche hatred dystrust duke looked verely haue bene murthered gloucester whiche fayre maner departed surely suche righte secrete bothe affirme vntrue wyse men thynke vnlykely deepe dissymulyng nature bothe menne well considered nede grene worlde protectoure duke perel duke stoode yf fell suspicion tyraunte either protectour woulde geue duke occasyon displeasure duke protectour occasion mystruste surely men thynke yf kyng richard suche opinion conceyued hym woulde neuer haue suffered auoyd handes escape power true duke buckyngham highe mynded man euill coulde beare glory another haue heard saw tyme corune set vpon protectours hed eye could neuer abyde sight therof wryed hed another way men said well ease bothe kynge richard well knowen well taken demaude duke request vncurteously reiected gently deferred bothe great giftes high hestes mooste louynge trustye maner departed kynge gloucester thus euery man iudged thought soone commyng home breckenocke hauyng kyng richardes commaundemet doctor morto bishop ely haue haue harde taken counsaill towre waxed hym familier whose onely wysedome abused pride owne deliuerauce duke distruction byshop man greate naturall witte well learned honourable behaueour lackyng wyse wayes wynne fauoure fyrst vpon parte kyng henrye whyle parte wealthe neither lefte forsoke woo fled realme quene prynce whyle king edward kynge henry prison neuer returned felde barnet whiche felde lost vtterly subdued parte takynges extynguished kyng edwarde fast fayth wysedome onely contente receyue hym also wooed come hym thensforthe bothe secrete truste speciall fauoure nothynge deceyued beynge kynge edwardes deathe fyrste taken tyraunte truethe kynge founde meane set duke toppe ioyned gentleman together ayde earle richemonde whiche named kynge henry seuenth fyrste deuisyng mariage betwene lady elizabeth daughter kynge edwarde fourth whiche faithfull true seruice declared bothe maisters infinitie benefite realme coniunction bloudes lancaster yorke whose funerall title longe iniquieted realme man afterwarde escaped duke fled realme neuer returned wente rome neuer myndynge medle worlde tyll kynge henry seuenth sent made hym archebishop cauntorbury chaunceloure englande made cardinall liued well men iudgementes died well retourne former purpose longe often alternate proofe well prosperitee aduerse fortune gotten greate experience mother mastres wisedome depe insighte pollitike worldly driftes wherby perceiuyng duke common hym ed hym fayre woordes many pleasaunte prayses perceiuynge grefe communicacions duke pryde nowe balke litle brayde enuy toward glory kynge thereby felynge hym easye fal yf matter well handeled craftely sought wayes prycke hym forward takynge alwayes occasyon commyng also kepynge hym selfe close within bandes rather semed folowe hym leade hym duke beganne fyrst prayse boast kynge shewe howe muche profite realme shoulde take reigne byshop morton answered surely lorde folye lye sure yf woulde swere contrarie ye woulde beleue yf worlde woulde haue begone would haue wyshed kynge henry sonne crowne kynge edwarde would haue bene true faithfull ubiecte god ordeyned hym lose kynge edwarde reigne neuer madde dead man striue quick euer kyng edward faithfull true chapeleyn glad would haue bene child haue succeded howbeit yf secret iudgemet god haue otherwyse prouided purpose spurne pricke labour set vp god pulleth doune late protector nowe kyng worde lefte sauynge sayd already medled muche world would day medle booke beades longed duke sore heare would haue sayde ended kyng sodaynly stopped exhorted hym familierly betwene bothe bolde saye whatsoeuer thoughte whereof faithefully promised shoulde neuer come hurte paraduenture good woulde wene hym selfe entended vse faithefull secrete aduice counsayle whiche sayd onely cause whiche procured kynge haue hym custodye might recon hym felf home el bene put handes haue founde like fauour byshoppe right humblie thanked sayd good faythe lorde loue muche talke prince thyng perell although word without faute yet must pleaseth prince construe euer thinke isopes tale lyon proclaymed paine death shoulde horned beastes come woode one beast bonche fleshe growyng heade fled greate pace foxe sawe hym flye hast asked hym whether fled faith quod neither wote ne recke hence proclamacion made horned beastes foole quod foxe lyon neuer ment whiche thou haste horne thy heade mary quod wote well ynough yf say horne duke laughed merely tale said lorde warraunte neither lyon bore shall pycke matter thynge spoken shall neuer come nere eares good faith syr sayd byshop yf dyd thyng aboute say taken aswell god mente coulde deserue thanke yet taken wene woulde might happen turne lytle good lesse longed duke muche wete whereupon bishop sayd good faith lorde late protectoure sith nowe kyng possession purpose dispute title wealthe realme whereof grace hath nowe gouernaunce whereof self poore membre aboute wishe good ability wherof hath alredy right many litle neadyng prayse yet might haue pleased god better store haue geuen hym suche excellente vertues mete rule realme lord hath planted person youre grace lefte agayne duke somewhat maruelynge sodaine pause though thei parenthesis high coutenaunce saied lorde euidentelye perceyue lesse note often breathyng sodayne stoppynge comunicacion intelligence wordes neither come dyrect perfect sentence conclusio wherby either myght perceyue haue knowlege inward entent toward kyng affection beare toward comparyson good quality ascribed v bothe whiche selfe knowlege recognise haue none loke prayse creature maketh lyttell muse thynkynge haue preuie imaginacion loue grudge engraued emprinted harte whiche feare dare childeshe shamefastnes abashed disclose reuele especially beynge frende whiche honoure assure secrete case deffe dumme person singer tree hunter byshoppe beynge somewhat boulder consyderynge duke promyse moste ammated encouraged knewe duke desyerous exalted magnified also perceyued inwarde hatred pryuie rancor whiche bare towarde kyng richarde nowe bol ened open stomacke eue bottome entendyng thereby compasse howe destroye vtterly confounde kynge richarde depryue hym dignitee royall el sett duke fyer desyer ambicion hym selfe might bee safe escape daunger perell whiche thinge brought shortely conclusion bothe kynges destruction duke confusion awne sauegarde fynally high promocion sayed vpon truste confidence duke promyse bishoppe saiede synguler good lorde sithe tyme captiuitee whiche beynge grace custodie maye rather call liberall libertie straight emprysonmente voydynge ydelnes mother norissher vice redynge bookes aunciente pamphlettes haue found sentence wrytten man borne fre libertie hym selfe onely one parte duetie oweth shoulde owe parentes procreacion naturall instincte filiall curtesie another parte frendes kynsfolke proximitie bloude naturall amitie dothe verie dewtie chalenge demaunde natiue countrye tasted fyrste swete ayers pleasaunte flatterynge worlde natiuitie demaudeth debt natural bonde neither forgotten yet put obliuion whiche saiynge causeth consider case realme natiue countrye standeth estate assueraunce tyme hathe contynued gouernour haue ruler myghte haue plainely perceyue realme beynge case muste nedes decaye broughte vtter confusion fynall exterminion one hope haue encorporate breaste consider mynde diligentely remember dayly beholde youre noble personage iustice indifference eruente zele ardente loue towarde natural contrey lyke maner loue contrie towarde greate learnynge pregnaunte witte goodly eloquence whiche muche dothe abounde persone youre grace muste nedes thynke realme fortunate ye twyse fortunate whiche hath suche prynce store mete apte gouernoure whose persone beynge endued many princelye quality consisteth resteth vndoubted similitude image trew honoure syde call memorie good qualites late protectour nowe called kynge violated subuerted tyrannie thaunged altered vsurped aucthoritee clouded shadowed blynde infaciable ambicion ye sodainlye maner metamorphosis transformed politike ciuilitie detestable tyrannie must nedes saie iustlie affirme neither mete kynge noble realme famous realme mete gouerned suche tyraunte firste interprise obtaine crowne begonne incepted murther dyuers noble valiaunt trewe vertuous personage holy begynnyng come myscheuous endyng dyd secondarelie procede contrarie al lawes honestie shamefully agaynst awne naturall mother beyng woma much honour vertew declaryng openlie woman geuen carnall affection dissolute liuinge whiche thynge yf bene trewe dede uery good naturall childe would haue rather mummed haue blasted broade especially beyng lyue declarynge farthermore hys ii brother ii nephewes bastardes borne auoutrey yet whith contente obteyned garlande whiche longe thristed caused two poore innoces nephewes committed hym especiall truste murthered shamefully kylled bloud whiche sely lyttel babe dayly crye god earthe vengaunce ala harte sobbith remember bloudy boutcher cruel monster suretie shall realme person life goodes vnder suche cruell prynce whyche regardeth destruction awne bloude lesse losse especially oftentymes chaunceth couetous cruell prince taketh suspicion smaleste swaruynge possible yf thynge mysconstered maye cause destruction many gyltles persones especiall noble wealthy personage hauynge greate possession rich suche lorde lucifer entred harte proude prynce geuen couetousnes crueltie nowe lorde conclude meane towarde noble persone saye affirme yf loue god lynage youre natyue contrye muste yower selfe take vpon crowne diademe noble empyre bothe mayntenauns honoure whiche longe hath floreshed fame renowne also delyueraunce youre naturall countrey men bondage thraldome worse captiuitie egypte cruell tiraunt arrogante oppressor thus dare saye yf foren prynce potentate ye turcke hym selfe woulde take vppon hym regiment crowne common woulde rather admit obey hym lyue vnder suche bloud supper child kyller muche ioyfull glad would lyue vnder grace whome knowe ruler mete conuenient louing obedient subiectes mete lyue vnder suche gouernour dispise forsake manifeste occasion louingly offered yf self knowing payne trauaill apperteyneth office kynge consideracion refuse take vpon crowne scepter realme adiure ye faithe owe god youre honoure othe made saincte george patron noble ordre gartier whereof compaignion loue affection beare natiue contrey people deuise waie realme miserie may high discrecion pryncely policie brought reduced suertie conueniente regiment vnder good gouernour excogitate ye verye patron helpe refuge conforte poore amased desolate common realme yf could either deuise sett vp linage lancaster auaunce eldest doughter kynge edward highe puyssaunte prince onely newe crowned kynge shall smal tyme enioy glorie dignitie also al ciuile warr cease domesticall discorde slepe peace profite quietnies set forth embrased bishoppe thus ended saiyng ye duke sighed spake greate sore abashed bishop made hym chaunge couler thing duke apperceiued saide afrayde lorde promyses shall kept morow wyl comon let v go supper night commoned litle iniquietacion bishoppe whiche nowe enen desirous knowe duke mynde entent duke longed daye knowe opinion meanyng nexte daie duke sente byshoppe rehersed hym maner bothe wyttie eloquente communicacion betwene paused lytle ceason puttyng bonett sayde lorde god creator thinges howe muche realme englande people bounden thy goodnes vexacion trouble greate stormes oppressed sayling tossyng desperate shippe without good maister gouernour thy healp good lord trust long tyme passe shall prouyde ruler shalbe thy pleasure also securite sauegarde noble realme put bonett saiyng byshoppe lord ely whose trewe harte syncere affeccion towarde tymes haue euidentlie perceyued knowen nowe moste last preuie comunicacion secrete deuisynge must nedes hart thinke mouthe confesse saie sure frende trustye counsailour vigilante foresear louer countrey naturall countreyman whiche kyndnes parte moste louinglye render hartye thankes nowe wordes hereafter trustyng recompence remunerate dedes yf life power shall serue sithe oure last communicacion haue disclosed opened secretes priuities stomacke touchinge duke gloucester nowe vsurper crowne also haue littel touched auauncemet ii noble famelyes yorke lacaster shall likewyse onely declare manifeste vnto open actes attemptes doynges also preuie entente secrete cogitacions entent haue vnbuckeled bogett preuie meanynges secrete purpose shall clowdy workynge close deuises secrete imaginacions clere reueled opened made lightesome beginne declare kynge edwarde disseaced whome thought selfe littell nothynge beholden thoughe ii maried two systers neither promoted preferred thoughte worthy deserued nether fauored regarded accordynge degree byrthe surely hym lytle aucthoritee le e rule effecte nothynge caused lesse fauor chyldren founde small humanitie none par nte beganne studie mature deliberacion ponder consyder howe maner lme shoulde ruled gouerned fyrste remembred olde prouerbe worthy memorye often ruithe realme chyldren rule woman gouerne olde adage sanke settelled heade thought great errour extreme myschyefe hole realme either suffer younge kynge rule qu ne mother gouernour ouer hym consyderynge brethrene fyrst chyldren thoughe extracte highe noble lynage toke vpon exalted selues reason quene dyd kynges brethrene duke realme conclusion turned confusion beinge persuaded whith self poyncte thought necessarie bothe publique profitable welthe realme also myne awne commoditie emolumente take parte thee duke eloucester whome assure thoughte cl ane withoute dissimulacion tractable withoute iniurie mercifull withoute crueltie nowe knowe hym perfectely dissembler withoute veritie tyraunte withoute petie yea worse tyraunte phaleres destitute trutghe clemencie meanes fyrste counsaill holden london suspected thynge happened lorde knowe well ynough made protectoure defender bothe kynge realme whiche aucthorite gotten two chyldren partelie policie broughte vnder gouernaunce beynge moued gnawynge couetous serpet desyered reigne neuer ceased priuelie exhorte require yea tymes minatorie termes persuade lordes aswell spirituall temporall myghte take vpon hym crowne tyll prynce came age foure twenty yeres able gouerne realme mature sufficiente kynge whiche thynge sawe somewhat stycke straungenes example presidente bene sene also remembred men ascended highest type honour aucthoritee wil gladlie discende agayn brought instrumetes autentike doctours proctoures notary lawe deposicions diuers wytnesses testifieng kyng edward child bastardes deposicios thought trewe knowe fayned testifyed persones rewardes vntruelye subornate saide deposicions v redde diligently harde stoode vp bare hedded saiyng wel lordes euen sage discrete counsailers woulde nephewe shoulde haue wronge praie nothynge righte witness saiynges famous doctor trew onely vndubitate heire lord richard plantagenet duke yorke adiudged heire crowne realme aucthoritee parliamente whiche thinges learned men v verite declared caused take lawfull vndoubted prince souereigne lord well knew duke clarence sonne reason attaynder father disabled inherite also duke hym self named bastarde selfe haue harde spoken vpon greate presumpcions tymes one agayn ayde fauour protectour made kyng subiecte made gouernour tyme promysed fidelite laiyng hand myne baynarde castel ii young prince lyue would prouide mayntaine honorable estate ye realme ought content crouned king full possession hole realme cast way old codicions adder doeth skynne verefieng old prouerbe honoures chaunge maners parishe prest remembreth neuer parishe clerck self sued part earle ha fordes landes whiche brother kynge edwarde wrongefully de eyned helde also required haue office highe constable shyppe englande diuers noble anunceters tyme haue longe discente continued thys fyrst suyte shewynge good mynde towarde dyd onely fyrste delaye afterwarde denay gaue suche vnkynde woordes suche tauntes retauntes ye maner checke checke mate vttermooste profe pacience though neuer furthered hyndered though put hym downe sett hym vp yet vngratitudes vndeserued vnkyndnes bare closlye suffered pacientelie couertly remembred owtwardely dissimulynge inwardelie thoughte payncted countenaunce passed laste summer last compaignie withoute many faier promyses withoute good dedes credibly enformed death ii younge innocentes awne natural nephewes contrarie faith promyse whiche god iudge neuer agreed condiscended lord veynes panted howe body trembled harte inwardely grudged much abhorred sighte muche compaignie hym coulde lenger abyde courte excepte shoulde openly reuenged ende wherof doutfull fayned cause departe mery countenaunce dispiteful harte toke leaue humbly hym thinkyng nothynge lesse displeased returned brecknock iourney returned whyther inspiracion holy ghost melancolous disposicio diuers sundrie imaginacions howe depriue vnnatural vncle bloudy butcher royall seate princely dignitie fyrst fantesyed yf list take vpon croune imperiall scepter realme tyme propice conuenient nowe waie made plaine gate opened occasio geuen whiche neglected paraduenture neuer take suche effecte conclusion sawe disdaigned lordes temporall execrate accursed lordes spiritual detested gentilmen despised communaltie saw chaunce perfectely sawe awne image glasse person ben gredy attempte enterprise could haue wone ryng gott gole poyncte rested imaginacion secretely wt self ii day tewkesberie thence iornyeng mused thought best coueniet take vpo coquerour knewe especially nobilitee would power stande bothe rescuyng possession tenours also subuertyng ye hole estat lawes customes realme suche power hathe conquerour knowe well ynough lord last doutfull case ther sprange new braunche hed suerly thought haue broughte forthe ayer flower sonne hotte turned drye wedes sodainly remembred lord edmond duke somersett grandfather kynge henrye sixte ii iii degree ihon duke lancaster lawefully begotten thought sure mother eldest doughter duke edmonde nexte heyre kynge henry syxte house lancaster title pleased well suche made priuye counsaill muche encorraged foulishe desyer eleuated ambicious entente muche clerely iudged myne awne mynd determynath resolued ye indubitate heyre house lancaster vpon concluded make fyrst foundacion crecte newe buyldinge whyther god ordeyned fortune chaunced e co clude sodaynlie title sett open mongeste common people kepe secrete se chaunce ro e betwene worceter brigenorthe encountered ladye maxgariete countesse richemonde nowe wyfe lorde stanley whiche daughter sole heyre lorde ihon duke somersett grandfather elder brother whiche cleane mynde thoughe neuer sene sonne earle richemonde bothe bulwarcke portecolice betwene gate entre may ie royall gettynge crowne commoned litle concernyng sonne shal shewe departed oure ladie worceter towarde shrewsberie newe chaunged maner amased began dispute selfe title considerynge thus earnest turned euen tittyl good estamen estsones imagened whyther beste take vpon elec ion nobilitie commonaltie whiche thoughte easy done vsurpor kynge thus beynge hatred abhorred hole realme take power whiche standeth fortune chaunce difficle acheued broughte passe thus romblynge tossynge waues ambiguitie betwene stone sacrafice considered fyr e office deutie payne kyng whiche suely thinke mortal man iustely truely obserue excepte called elected pecially appoyncted god kynge dauid diuers haue farther remembred yf toke cepter gouernaunce realme two extreme enemy dayly sure one trusty rend nowe day begone pilgrymage nether assuered credible asserteyned suche worldes mutacion manifestely perceiued daughter kynge edwarde alies frendes whiche small nomber beynge bothe sake muche beloued also greate iniurie manifeste tyrannye done newe vsurper muche lamented pitied woulde neuer cease barcke yf cannot byte one syde semblable cousyne therle rychemonde aydes kynsfolke whiche lyttell power wyll surelye attempte lyke fierce grandhounde byte perce syde lyfe ru e shoulde euer hange heare neuer quiete euer doubte death deposicion yf said ii linage yorke lancaster longe haue stryued imperiall diademe ioyne one suerly mated game gotten wherefore haue clerely determined selfe cocluded vtterly relinquishe suche fantasticall imaginacions concernynge obteynynge croune al plague calamity trouble feared suspected myght haue chanced yf taken rule regimente realme shall reredemayne make rebounde comen enemye calleth hym selfe kynge th beste stopper hath tenyce shall well stoppe without faulte tolde countesse richemonde returne newe named kyng metyng high way praied fyr e kinred sake secondarily loue bare gradfather duke humfrey whiche sworne brother father moue kynge good sonne henry erle richemod licence fauor returne england yf pleasure promised erle sonne mary one kyng edwardes daughter appoinctement kyng without thing taken demaunded saide espousal onely kynges fauour whiche request e ouer passed gaue fayre wordes departed lodgyng called memorie deliberate studie dyd circumspectely ponder fully adiudged ye holy ghoste caused moue thynge ende wherof coulde consider bothe securitie realme also prefermente childe destruction finall confusion common enemye kyng richarde whiche thing neither thought sure wordes coulde make coniecture selfe cast desyer profitable realme perceiue suche lord god litle sparcle kyndelith great fyer fynally declare conclusion bent sette mynde power purse shall helpe erle richemond heyre house lancaster querell linage father grand father lost ther lyues battayle shal take wi e lady elizabeth eldest daughter kyng edward whiche mariage bothe house yorke lancaster maye obteyned vnite one clere stablyshement title crowne noble realme conclusion yf mother bothe party especially erle hym selfe ladye wyll agre doubte braggynge bore tuskes raiseth euery man skyn shall onely brought confusion hath deserued empire shall euer certaine vndubitate heyre shall ciuile intestyne war cease whiche longe hath contynued paring many me crownes realme shalbe reduced agayne quietnes renoune glorie inuencion duke many men thought imagened inward hatred bare kynge rycharde fauor bare erle rychemond doubtfull matter best iudge erryng farre mynde entent auctor whatsoeuer entended deuice opened kyng rychard occasion ye rounded shorter whole head without attaynder iudgement duke sayd bishop fauored euer house lancaster wonderous ioyfull muche reioysed deuice nowe came wynde euen would haue hys imaginacio teded effect haue kyng richard subdued haue lynes king edward kyng hery ye vi raysed auaunsed lord reioysed thynke ye mariage linage yorke lancaster conioyned one stedfa ne publique wealthe realme lest duke courage swage hys mynd agayne alter ofte may easely perceiue hys awne tale thought set vp sayles entent ye ship hys pre ensed purpose myghte come shortly suer port sayd duke lord sigh god hygh prouision youre incoparable wysedome pollicie noble coniunction fyrs e moued nowe conueniente ye nece arie consider personage frendes shall fyrste make preuie high deuice polliticke conclusion truthe quod duke wyll begyne ladye rychemonde therles mother whiche knowethe either captiuitie large brytaine harde aie duke brytaine restored libertie immediately death kyng edward whose meanes restrayned syth yow wyl begyn way said byshop haue old frend ye countesse sobre secrete well wytted called reignold bray whose prudet pollicie haue knowe haue copassed thiges great importauce shall secretly send yf pleasure doubt wyll gladly come good wyll lyttel diligence byshop wrote letter reignold bray requyrynge hym come brecknocke wit spede great vrgente cause touchynge maistresse thing declared letter messenger rode lancashire bray coutesse lord thomas stanley husbad deliuered letter red e toke signe presage good fortune come messenger came castel f brecknock duke byshop declared thing deuised set realme quiet stedefastnes also high preferment earle richemond sonne lady maistresse wyllyng fyrst copasse obteyne good wyll quene elizabeth also eldest daughter bearing name secretl send sonne britaine declare high honour prepared hym would sweare mary lady elizabeth assone kyng royal possession realme reignold bray wt glad hast gettyng nothing geuen hym charge great hast good sped retourned countesse lady mastresse whe bray departed great doutfull vessell sett broche bishop thrustyng nothing lybertie whe sawe duke pleasaunt well mynded towarde hym tolde duke yf yle elye coulde make many frendes ferther ther enterpryse yf ther iiii day warnyng lyttell regarded malice kyng richard country strong duke knew well trew yet lothe byshop shoulde departe knewe well longe bishoppe sure politique aduise sage counsayl circumspect proceding gaue byshop fayre wordes saiyng shortely departe well accompaigned feare enemyes byshop beiyng wyttye duke wylie dyd tarie tyl duke compaignie assembled secretlie disguysed nyghte departed duke great displeasure came see ely founde monye frendes sailed flaunders dyd earle richemonde good seruice neuer retourned agayne tyll earle richemoude beyinge kyng sent hym shortely promoted hym see cauntorbury thus bishoppe wound hym self fro duke moste nede ayde yf taried still duke made many blabbes counsaill put muche confidens welshemen yet temerariously set forwarde oute knowlege frendes dyd whiche thynges sodanie ouerthrowe knewe dyd reporte reignold bray declared message preuie instruction countesse richemonde maftres meruell though ioyous glad good newes also obteynyng suche high frende sonnes cause duke wherfore wyllyng slepe matter farther vttermost power abilitie deuised meanes howe breake matter quen elizabeth sanctnarie westminster vpon hauynge familie tyme preseruacion healthe certayne welsheman called lewes learned phisicke whiche grauitie experiens well knowen muche estemed amongest great estate realme whome vsed somtyme liberally familiarlye talke nowe hauynge opportunitie occasion breake mynde vnto weightie matter declared tyme come sonne shoulde ioyned mariage lady elizabeth daughter heyre kyng edward king richard beyng take reputed men comon enemye realme shoulde honour estate deiected rule kyngedome clerely spoyled expulsed required hym goo quene elizabeth home facultie counsaill messenger one came frendelie visite consolate tyme place require make preuie deuise thig cocluded purpose imagened phisician dyd long lynger accomplishe desyre good diligens repaired quene still sanctuary westminster saw tyme propice conuenient purpose saide vnto madame although imaginacion verie simple deuyce folishe yet entier affection beare toward childre bold vttre vnto secrete preuie coceite haue cast compassed fantasticall brayne well remembre lesse considre greate losse dammage haue su eyned deathe noble louyng husband great dolour sorowe th h ue suffred tollerated cruell murther innocente chil ren lesse bounden deutie christian charite daily studie hourely ymagen onely howe bryng harte com orte gladnes also deuyse howe reuenge ghteous quarel child bloudy blood pper cruell tyraunte kyng richarde firste considre battaile man aughter mi hie e hath risen realme dissencion betwene ii noble house yorke lancaster whiche ii family haue contryued ioyned one thinke ye doubt line shalbe agayne restored pristmate estate degree great ioye comforte vttre confusion mortall enemie vsurper kynge knowe well madame house lancaster er e richemond next blood lyuynge iusty young batcheler house yorke daughter nowe heires coulde agree inuent meane couple eldest daughter young erle ric emod matrimony doubte vsurper realme shortely deposed heire againe right restored quene heard frendely mocion farre thought man rude people saie moone lorde howe spirites reuyued heart lept body ioye gladnes firste geuynge lawde almightie god chiefe aucthore comforte secondarely maister lewes deuyser good newes tydinges instantely besought bene rst inueter good entreprise would relinquishe desiste folowe thesame requirynge hym farther apperteynynge countesse richemonde mother erle henry woul e diligente celerite resorte lodgyng husbandes place within cyte london clare quenes behalfe countesse frendes fautoures kyng edward husbande ke parte earle richemonde sonne woulde take corporall othe kyngedome obteyned espouse take wife ladye elizabeth daughter el lady cecile yf theldest daugh er lyuynge master lewes dexteritee sped busynes made concluded finall ende determinacion entreprise betwene ii mother phisician oute al suspicion mysdemynge common daylye messenger betwene theim aidynge settynge foorth inuented conspiracye againste kynge richarde ladye margarete countesse richemonde broughte good hope prefermente sonne made reygnolde braie moost faithefull seruaunte chiefe soliciter preuie procu er conspiracie geuynge hym charge secretly enuegle attracte suche personnes nobilite ioyne take parte knewe ingenious faythefull diligente actiuitie reygnolde breie within fewe day broughte vnto lure firste takynge euery person solempne othe true secrete sir gyles daubenei sir ihon cheiney knight richard guylforde thomas rame esquyers diuerse coun esse richemonde diligente parte quene elizabeth vigilaunte syde made frendes appoyncted councelers set forwarde auaunce busynes meane ceason countesse richemond toke seruice christopher urswike honeste wise priest othe hym secrete taken sworne vttred hym mynde councell adhibityng confidence truthe al life fauoured taken part kyng henry vi special uell put seruice sir lewes physician mother studious ye prosperite sonne appointed christopher urswike saile britayne erle richemond declare demonster pactes agrementes betwene quene agreed concluded sodainly remebryng duke buckyngha one first ueters secrete founder entreprise determined sende personage estimacio chapelain elected messenger hugh conwey esquier sent hym britayne great monei sonne geuing charge declare erle great loue especiall fauour moost parte nobilite realme bare toward louing harte beneuo ent myndes whole comminaltie awne frewill frankely offred liberally exhibited willyng aduisynge neglecte good occasion apparantly offred al spede diligence addicte settle mynde full entencion howe retourne home againe england bothe wished looked geuynge farther monicion councell take land arriual ye principalite wale doubte fynde bothe aide comforte fredes richard guylford least hugh conwey might fortune take stopped plimmoth enteded take nauiga ion sent oute kent thomas rame thesame instruccios bothe made diligence wynde wether one land caleys water plimmoth within lesse houre bothe arriued duke britaynes courte spake erle richemond deathe kyng edward went pleasure libertie hym counted manifested cause effecte message ambassade earle rec aued ioyefull message whiche pleasaunte vnloked rendred iesu sauiour mooste humble hearty thankes beynge ferme credence beleue suche thynges busy mynde laborious entente wished desyred coulde neuer haue taken effecte withoute helpe prefermente almightie god nowe beynge put comforte long longynge dyd communicate breake duke britayne secretes aud preuy message whiche hym declared aduertisynge hym entred sure stedfaste hope obteyne get crowne kyngedome realme england desyrynge bothe good frendely helpe toward acheuynge offred entreprise promysynge hym came entended purpose rendre hym agayne equall kyndenes condigne gratulacion although duke daie thomas hutton ambassador kyng richard bothe money praiers bene solicite moued put agayne safe custody erle richemonde neuerthelesse promysed faithfully ayde promes truely performed pthe iii yere wherupon erle wt diligence sent england agayn hugh conwey thomas rame whiche shoulde declare commynge shortely englande thentent thinges whiche councell might purpose prouided shoulde accelerate hasted thynges doubtfull shoulde frendes prudently forseen aduoydyng al engins snare kyng richard might haue set disturbauce purpose meane ceason would make abode still brytayne till al thinges necessary iorney prepared brought aredynes meane ceason cheuetaynes coniuracion englande began together many entreprises conueniente fortress put strong garrison kepte armed men preuely thentente haue knowlege erles landynge thei would begynne sturre vp warre dyd secretely moue sollicite people rise make insurrecion emongeste whome ihon morton bishop ely beynge flaunders chefe peruie letter cloked messenger dyd sturre inuite newe coniuracion al certeynely knewe haue roted hatred beare cankard malice toward kyng richard procedynges although greate entreprice neuer preuely handeled secretely emongeste circumspecte persones treated compassed conueyghed yet knowlege therof came eares kynge richard whiche odayne chaunce lyttel moued astonned host ready prepared conscribed secondarely yf shoulde reyse army sodaynely knewe mete enemy whether goo arie wherefore determined dissimule matter though knewe nothynge till assembled hoste meane ceason either rumour common people diligence exploratours espialles inuestigate search oute councelles determinacions entente compass close aduersaries elles craftie pollecie intercepte take person thesame coniuracion con erynge secrete hyd espyall whiche lurketh dissimulacion knowlege intelligence hidden name sha owe countre te humanite feined kyndenes knewe duke buckyngham chiefe h ayde con uracion thoughte yt moost necessary plucke hym parte either fayre promyses open warre whereupon addressed louynge letter duke full woordes humanite familiarite erior cogitacion preuy meanynge full malice rancor poyson geuyng farther charge messenger caryed letter promes duke beh lfe golden hilles syluer ryuers gentle pl asaunte meanes persuade exhorte duke come courte duke wylie kynge mystrustyng f yre flatteryng woordes gaye promyses hym sodayuly withoute cau e offered knowynge craftie caste kynge richardes bowe whiche diuerse affayres ore tyme sene practised requyred kynge perdon hym exculynge hym selfe deseased stomacke skante coulde take either refeccion rest kynge ri harde beynge contente excuse woulde wise mytte thesame incontinente directed duke lett r rough hawter sorte without minatorie termes checkynge woordes commaundynge hym excuse set aperte repaire without delaie royall presence uke made messenger determynate aunswere woulde come mortall ennemye whome neither loued auoured ymmediately prepared open warre agaynste hym perswaded complices partak euery man shoulde quarter diligence yse vp people make commocion meanes almoo e one momente thomas marque dorcet came oute sanctuarye sith begynnynge richardes day contynued whose onely helpe sir thomas louell e quyer preserued daungier perell troubleous worlde gathered together greate bande men yorkeshire sir edwarde courtney peter brother bishop exsetter reised another army deuoushire cornewall kente richarde guylforde gentleman collected great companye souldyoures openly beganne warre kynge richarde whiche meane tyme gotten together greate strengthe puissaunce thynkynge yt moost parte beneficiall disparse deuyde greate armye small branch particulerely persecute one coniuracion hym selfe determined beynge set asyde hys whole puyssaunce set chiefe hed whiche duke buckyngham remouynge london tooke iourney towarde salsburie thentente iourney mighte set duke army yf myghte knowe hym place encamped ordre bataylle araied kynge skace ii day iourney salsburie duke buckyngham accompanyed greate power wilde weleshmen whome beynge man courage sharpe speche maner agaynste willes rather therto enforced compelled lordely streite commaundemente liberall wayges gentle reteynoure whiche thinge verie occasion lefte hym desolate cowardely forsooke hym duke power mershed forest deane entendyng haue passed riuer seuerne gloucester therto haue ioyned army courtneys westernmen confideracy affinite done doubt kyng richard bene greate ieopardie either priuacion realme losse life se chauce could attayne seuerne side force continuall rayne moysture ryuer rose high yt ouerflowed countrey adioyning somuch men drowned beddes howses extreme violence ouerturned childre caried aboute feldes swymmynge cradelles beastes drowned hilles whiche rage water lasted continually x dayes somuche countrey adioynyng call yt daie greate water duke buckynghams greate water innudacion passage closed neither duke could come ouer seuerne complices hym durynge whiche tyme welshemen lyngerynge ydely without money vitayle wage sodaynely scaled departed duke faire promyses manaces enforcementes woulde wise neither goo farther abide duke thus abandoned left almost post alone necessite copelled flye flight sodeyne oif fortune meruelousely dismayed beinge vnpurueyed councell shoulde take waie shoulde folowe like man dispeire knowynge verie truste confidence conueyghed hym selfe house homfrey banaster seruaunt
