beside shrewsburie whome tendrely broughte vp whome aboue men loued fauoured trusted nowe doughtynge hys extreme necessite shoulde fynde hym faythefull secrete trusty entendynge couertely lurke till either mighte reise agayne newe armye elles shortely saile britayne earle richemond knowen adherentes whyche readye geue battayle hoste scaled hd lefte hym almoost alone fled coulde founde sodaynely amased striken soden feare euery man like persones desperate shifted hym selfe fled wente sanctuarye solitarie place fled see whereof mooste parte within fewe dayes arryued sauely duchye britayne emonge whiche nombre persones peter courtney bishoppe exce sir edmonde courtney brother kynge henrye vii created earle denoushire thomas marque dorcet ihon lorde welles sir ihon burchier sir edmonde wooduile valyaunte man armes brother quene elyzabeth sir roberte willoughby sir gyles dabeney sir thomas arundell sir ihon cheyney twoo brother sir wylliam barkeley sir wylliam brandon thomas brother sir rycharde edgcombe moost parte beynge knyghtes ihon halwell edwarde pownynges pollytike capitayne verie ceason ihon morton bishop ely christopher urswike priest another companye noble men soiourned flaunders letter messenger procured manye ennemyes agaynste kynge rycharde whyche vsynge vigilaunte iye quycke remembraunce beynge newely come salsburye hauyng perfight notice knowlege howe duke fled howe complices entended passe oute realme fyrste sente men warre nexte porte passage kepe streightely see coast person shoulde passe outwarde take lande realme withoute assente knowlege secondarely made proclamacion person coulde shewe reuele duke buckyngham shoulde highely rewarded yf bondman enfraunchised set libertie yf fre blood shoulde haue generall perdon remunerate thousand poundes farthermore vnderstoode thomas hutton whiche haue harde newely retourned oute britayne fraunces duke brytayne onely refused kepe therle richemonde prisoner contemplacion sake also readie aide succoure thesaide earle menne money thinges necessarye transportyng england wherfore rigged sent shippes warre wel furnished decked artillary skoure kepe part see lieth agaynst britayne thentet yf erle richemond woulde auenture faile toward england either shoulde taken captyue profligate dryuen coast englande moreouer thentent euery coste waye passage corner shoulde diligently watched kepte set euery dubious suspected place men warre seke searche enquyre yf creature coulde tell tydynges duke buckyngham confederacyon adherentes fautoures partaker busy searche diligentely applied put execucion homfrey banaster feare losse lyfe goodes attracted prouoked auaricious desire thousande poundes bewrayed gest master ihon mitton shriefe shropshire whyche sodaynely stronge power men harnes apprehended duke lytle groue adioynynge mansion homfrey banaster greate hast euyll spede conueighed appareled pilled blacke cloke cytie salsburie kynge richarde kepte housholde whether banaster bewreyed duke feare couetous many men doubt sure shortlie betrayed ye duke master sonne heyre waxed mad dyed bore stye eldest daughter excellent beautie sodaynelie stryken foule leperye seconde sonne meruelously deformed limnes made decrepite younger sonne small puddel stragled drouned beyng extreme age arraigned foud gyltie murther clergye saued thousande pounde kyng richard gaue one farthing saiyng would vntrew good master would false al howbeit saie ye smal office ferme stoppe mouthe al duke beyng certayne kynges councel diligently vpon interrogatory examined thynges knewe preiudicial ye kynges person opened declared frankely frely coniuracion dissimulynge glosynge trustynge truely playnly reueled confessed thinges hym required haue lycece speake ye kyng whether sue perdon grace whether beynge brought presence would haue sticked hym dagger men iudged sore desyred requyred confessed whole facte conspiracye vpon allsoulen daie withoute arreignemente iudgemente salsburye open merker place newe skaffolde behedded put deathe deathe reward duke buckyngham receaued handes kyng richard whome hys affaire purpose entreprises holde susteyned set forward aboue godes forbode thys men maye easelye perceaue onley loseth bothe laboure traueyle industire ferther steynethe spotteth ligne perpetuall ignomony reproche whiche euyll mishiefe assisteth aydeth euyll disposed person considerynge moost parte frendely fauoure shoulde receaue greate displeasure infortunate chaunce beside god iustice conclusion appoyneteth hym condigne peyne affliccion merites desertes thynges thus hadeled ordred englande henry earle richemond prepared armye fyue thousande manly brytons fortie well furnyshed shippes thinges prepared aredynes daye departynge settynge forwarde appoynted whiche xii daye moneth october yere incarnacion oure redemer mccccxlviii seconde yere kynge richardes reigne whole armye wente shipboorde halsed vp sailes prosperous wynde tooke see towarde nyghte wynde chaunged wether tourned houge terrible tempeste sodaynely roase verie power strengthe storme shippes disparcled seuered seperate sondre force dryuen normandye compelled retourne agayne britayne shippe wherein earle rychemonde associate onely one barcke nyghte tossed turmoyled mornynge rage furious tempeste assuaged ire blusterynge wynde deale appeased aboute houre none thesame daye earle approched southe parte realme englande euen mouthe hauen pole countie dorcet mighte playnely perceaue bankes shore garnisshed furnyshed men warre souldioners appoynted deputed defende arryuall landynge mencioned wherefore gaue streyghte charge sore commaundemente person shoulde presume take lande goo shore vntill suche tyme whole nauye assembled congregate exspected lyngered tariyenge purpose sente oute shippe bote towarde lande side knowe whyther whiche stoode suche nombre well furnysshed apparell defensyue hys capitall foe ennemyes elles frendes fautoures comforter sente exploracion message instantely desyred men warre kepynge coast whiche thereof instructed admonished dissende take lande affirmynge appoyncted duke buckyngham awayte tarie arryuall landyng erle rychemond conduicte sauely campe duke ferre laye encaped populous armye host great strength vigor thentent duke erle ioynynge puyssaunces force together mighte prosecute chace kyng richard beyng destitute men maner desperate fugityue meanes awne laboures industrie obteine ende entreprise whiche begonne erle richemonde suspectynge flatterynge requeste fraude yt dede perceaued none shippes apere sight ed vp ancors halsed vp sayles hauynge prosperous strenable wynde freshe gale sente euen god delyuer hym perell ieopardie arryued safe securitie duchy normandye teshe solace souldyours people tooke recreacion space iii dayes clerely determyned parte companye passe lande agayne britayne meane ceason sent oratoures frenche kynge called charles viii whiche newely succeded father kynge lewes xi longe departed god requirynge hym safe conduicte licence passe throughe countrey normandye brytayne younge kynge hauynge compassion misfortune vnfortunate chaunce earle richemonde onely gently graunted assigned hym pasporte also liberally disbursed departed hym conuehtente money conduicte expense necessary hys longe iourney passage erle trustynge frenche kynges humanitee auentured send shippes home britayne set forwarde hym selfe lande iourney makynge greate hast till messenger retourned whiche beynge benefite comforted hope prosperous successe encouraged mershed towarde britayne al diligent celerite entendyng consulte farther louers fredes affaire entreprises retorned agayn britayne certified credible informacio duke buckyngham lost hed marque dorcet great nombre noble men england lytle enquyred searched nowe retourned uanes heard newes thus reported first sorowed dolorously lamented first attempte settyng forward frendes especiall nobilyte haue fortunatly succeded secondarely reioysed theother parte god sent hym many valiaunte prudent captaines compaignions mertiall entreprises trustynge surely nothinge doubtynge awne opinion busynes shoulde wisely compassed brought good coclusion wherfore determinyng al diligece accelerate set forward newe begonne busynes departed renes sent certayne preuie seruitours conducte bryng ye marque noble men presence knewe sauely retorned britayne lord howe reioysed applauded tyme myssed hym knewe parte worlde make inuestigacion searche hym thei doubted lesse feared least taken land englad fallen handes kynge richarde whose person knewe well neither mercy compassion wherefore spedy maner galloped toward reuerentely saluted metynge great ioye solace smal thankes gratificacions geuen rendred bothe partes consulted aduisedely debated commoned great busines weightie entreprise whiche ceason solempne feaste natiuite oute sauiour christ happened whiche daie al thenglishe lordes went great solempnyte chiefe churche citee eache gaue faythe promyse erle hym selfe fyrste tooke corporall othe honoure promysynge incontynente possessed crowne dignytie realme iof englande woulde conioyned matrymonye ladye elizabeth daughter kynge edwarde fourthe companye sware hym fealtie hym homage though bene tyme crowned kynge anoynted prynce promisynge faythefully fermely assurynge woulde onely lese wordely substaunce also priuated lyues worldely felicitee rather suffre kynge rycharde tyraunt lenger rule reigne ouer theim whiche solempne othes made taken earle rychemonde declared communicated doynges fraunces duke britayne desirynge mooste hartely requyrynge hym ayde hym greater armye conduicte hym countreye whiche sore longed loked retourne whiche parte nobilite comminaltie called desyced whiche goddes ayde duke comforte doubted shorte tyme obteyne requirynge hym farther prest hym conueniente money affirmynge somes money receaued hys especiall frendes spente exhausted preparacion laste iourney made towarde englande whyche somes money entreprise acheued woorde prynce faythefully promysed repaye restore agayne duke promysed hym ayde helpe vpon confidence whereof rigged shippes set foorth nauy well decked ordynaunce warlykely furnyshed al thinges necessary thentente saile forwarde shortely se conuenient tyme slackely ouerpassed pretermitted meane ceason kynge richarde apprehended dyuerse partes realme certeyne gentylmen earle rychemondes faccion confederacion whiche either entended saile britayne towarde hym el landynge assiste ayde hym emongeste whome sir george browne sit roger clyfforde iiii put execucion london sir thomas sentliger whiche maried duches exceter kyngs awne suster thomas rame diuerse executed exceter beside persones diuerse houshold seruauntes whome either suspected doubted great crueltie put shamefull death called parliamente whiche attaynted erle richemond al persones whiche fled realme feare cause enemy hym naturall countrey landes goodes possession con iscate seased ye kynges vse yet contente praye whiche doubte small valour moment laied people neckes greate taxe tallage surely necessite acte manet compelled purgyng declaryng innocencie concernyng murther nephewes towarde world coste obtayne loue fauoure comminaltie whiche outwardely glosed openly dissimuled gaue prodigally many great rewardes nowe bothe lacked skace wist honestely howe borowe troubleous ceason nothinge merueled lord stanley bene taken reputed enemy king considerynge workynge ladye margarete wife mother earle richemonde forasmuche entreprise woman hym reputed regarde estimacion lord thomas husbande purged hym selfe sufficientely innocente doynges attemptes perpetrated committed yt geuen charge kepe lecrete place home withoute hauynge enie seruaunte companye thence foorthe shoulde neuer sende letter messenger sonne nay frendes confederate whyche kynge myghte molested troubled hurte preiudice mighte attempted againste realme comminaltie whiche commaundemente put execucion accomplished accordynge dreadfull commaundemente yet wilde worme vengaunce wauerynge hed coulde contented deathe diuerse gentleman suspected treason also muste extende bloudy furye agaynste poore gentleman called collyngborne makynge small ryme thre vnfortunate councelers lord louell sir richarde radelyffe myscheuous mynion sir wylliam catesbey secrete seducer whiche metre rat catte louell dogge rule englande vnder hogge meanynge hogge dreadfull wilde bore whiche kynges cognisaunce fyrste lyne ended dogge metrician coulde obseruynge regimentes metre ende seconde verse bore called bore hogge poeticall schoolemayster corrector breues longes caused collyngborne abbreuiate shorter hed bee deuyded foure quarter kynge richarde beynge thus turmented tossed awne concepte imaginacion called remembraunce consideracions amiti honeste bondes pa te made conc uded appointed betwene prince politique gouernours cause efficiet esp cia l introduction lmes country ortified munited double power saie awne strength ayde frendes deuysed selfe prac se league amitie kynge scottes longe made diuerse incursion roodes realme englande although garte lyttel yet surly lo much thereupo sued haue treuce peace concluded whiche euen kyng richarde wished wherefore commissioner assigned bothe partes mete nothyngham vii daye next ensuynge tyme came thether kynge england ihon bishop lyncolne chaunceller englande richarde bishop saincte asse ihon duke norffolke henrye erle northumberlande thomas lorde stanley george stanley lorde straunge ihon gray lord powes richard lord fyt hughe ihon gunthorpe keper kynges preuie thomas barowe master rolles sir thomas bryane chie e iusti e common place sir richard ratelyffe knyght william catesbey richard salkeld esquiers kynge scottes deputed colyn erle ergile lord camplell lorde chaunceller scotlande willi bishop aberdene robert lorde lyle l urence lorde olyphant ihon drummond stobhall arch balo qwhitelator rchedeacon lawdene secretorie kynge iames lyon kynge armes duncane dundas councellers yuerse tymes mette longe debatynge demaundynge denyenge ende september fully concluded made determinacion effecte whereof foloweth article firste appoynted concluded perfight itie mu olable peace shoulde kepte betwene realmes englande scotlande space iii yeres begynne sonne risyng xxix daie september yere lord mcccclxxxiiii endure settynge sonne xxix daye september yere christes incarnacion mcccclxxxvii item duryng said yeres none bothe prynces mynisters shall make warre inuade ye realme dominion se land vexe perturbe molest subiectes va e either shall geue councell excite moue persone make warre inuasion territory thesaid prince item toune castell berwike boundes thereto belongynge englishe mennes handes deliueraunce thesame toune kyng henry vi kyng scottes shall peaceably remayne possession kyng england durynge thesai e truce item castelles holdes fortress shall peaceably remayn handes ye possessor owner without chalenge demaunde durynge thesaide truce castell dumbarre onely excepte whiche delyuered thenglishe mennes handes apoyntement duke albany fled fraunce item yf kynge scottes intymate declare kynge england within space xl day next ensuyng ye date herof suffre thesayde castell dumbarre possessed thenglishe nacion aboue terme vi monethes thesaid vi monethes neither thenglishmen garison dumbarre scottes dwellyng inhabityng aboute limites thesame shal hurte preiudice dammage thesaide party thesayde terme contynuynge item yf thesayde vi monethes variaunce warre shal arise betwene thesaide twoo prynces either recouerynge defendynge thesayde castell dumbarre yet thesayde truce league amitie rightes possession shal stande force effectuall shalbe leful eache thesaid prince shall thinke necessary bothe obteinyng defendyng thesaid castell dumbarre thynge conteyned treaty peace notwithstandynge item concluded apointed betwene party aforsaid durynge thesaide truce none bothe prince aforsaide shal receaue realme territory dominion treytoure rebel theother prynce shall maintayne fauoure de comforte rebell treytour already fled herafter shall flye either thesaid prince dominion suffre theim tarye make abode item yf suche rebell treytoure shall fortune herafter arryue realme territorie thesayde prince thesayde prince whose dominiou thesaide treytour rebel arryued ye instance reques theother prynce whome ye offence cryme committed shalbe bound incontinently delyuer thesaid rebel treytour thesaide demaunder without fraude male engyne item scottyshmen nowe inhabityng englande sworne kyng englande shal maye inhabite tarye name within xl day date league certefied kyng scottes chauncelour kyng englad warden march item yf duryng thesaide amitie peace shall fortune wardeyns thesaid prince without commaundement assent knowlege souereigne lord master inuade reise armeye dominion theother prince sley burne spoile ye thesaide prince whome thesaide wardeyn shalbe subiect vassalle shal within vi dayes next facte done perpetrate declare thesaide wardeyn treytour rebell therof shal make certificate prince iniurie committed within xii day thesaide declaracion made denounced item euery saueconduyete graunted either thesaid prynces clause added prouided alweies obteyner saueconduyte treytour rebell prince item yf durynge amitie truce subiectes either prince presume attempt aide helpe mainteine serue ani prince againste thesaide contractoures yt shalbe leful ye prince subiectes whome shewed hym selfe enemy aduersary apprehende attache thesaide subiecte goynge comyng taryeng acte article clause league contrary comprehended notwithstandynge item agreed apointed accorded treatie amitie shalbe comprehended frendes obliged confederate bothe prince yf lift entre accepte league thereupon declare pleasure within vi monethes next ensuinge specially kyng england part named confederate kyng castell lyon kyng arragon kyng porsyngall archeduke austryche burgoyne dyuke britaine part kyng scottes named cofederates charles french kyng ihon kyng denmarke norwey duke g ldres britayne item yt agreed concluded betwene party aforesaide lordship lorne realme scotland iland londay liynge ryuer seuerne realme euglande shal taken comprised within league stand large item concorde peace amitie shalbe published proclaymed deuulged first daie october next ensuynge moost notable famous city tounes bothe realmes region conseruators apoynted sure obseruacio league amitie bothe partes whose name folowe kynge englande ihon erle lyncolne henry erle northumberland raufe lord neuell raufe lorde greystocke richard lorde fitz hugh ihon lord scrope thomas lorde scrope massam sir christopher moresby william clapton esquier homfrey lord daker sir richard ratcliffe sir ihon conyers sir edmond hastynges sir robert donstable sir hugh hastynges sir william euers sir ihon huldeston william musgraue esquier richard salkeld esquier kyng scottes dauid earle crafford lorde lynsey george earle huntley lorde gorden badzenath ihon lorde dorneley ihon lorde kynedy roberte lorde lile patricke lorde hale lawrence lorde oliphaunt willam lorde borthwike sir ihon rosse halkehed sir gilbert ihonson elphynston sir ihon lundy sir iames ogilly arly sir robert hamilto fingalto sir willia balze lamyngto sir ihon kynedy blarqhon sir ihon wemes sir william rochewen edward crochton kirke paty ihon dundas ihon rosse montgrenane iii last esquyers item yt farther condiscended agreed commissioner whose name ensue shal mete loughmabastane xviii day nouember next ensuynge aswell redresse certayne offence done westmerches also declaryng publishynge peace amitie commissioner englishe parte lorde dacre lorde fitz hugh sir richard radclyffe sir christopher moresby sir richard salkeld thre theim commissioner scottishe part lorde kenedy lorde mountgomory lorde lile ihon maxwell stuarde annerdale robert crechton sanquhane thre theim item like commissioner assigned mete roydon borne east march fyrste daie december also mete haldanestanke iiii daie sayde moneth middle march commissioner kyng englande erle northumberlande lorde greystorcke lord scrope massam sir william gastoyn sir robert conestable commissioner kyng scottes erle huntley erle angus erle ergile chaunceller scotland lorde wandale lorde seton lorde olyphaunt te lorde stobhill item yt agreed ye commissioner aforsaid shal depute assigne certeyne persones viewe declare boundes lymites apperteignyng toune berwike according true meanyng league item agreed apoynted person england scotland shal duryng thesaid truce build eare sowe landes groud beynge within boundes batable ground suffre thesame continewe condicion nowe remayneth league amitie thus concluded finished sealed dewe circumstaunces thereunto requyred although kynge richard iudged demed hym selfe somewhat stronger quyeter force newe amitie concluded confederacie yet augemnte familiarite begonne betwene kynge scottes hym haue double strynge bowe entreated new aliaunce mariage concluded betwene prince rothsaye eldeste sonne kyng scottes lady anne de la poole daughter ihon duke suffolke lady anne suster kyng richarde whiche suster muche fauoured studyenge weies whiche might auaunce offprynge lignage onely procure seke meanes howe make daughter pryncesse consequentely quene also deathe sonne proclaymed ihon erle lyncolne nephew sonne heyre apparaunt ye crowne england dishenetityng kynge edwardes daughter whose brother haue heard shamefully killed murthered kynge scottes hauynge nede frendes muche nede kynge richard whiche necessite compelled seke aiders entreteyne fautours one fauourynge flatterer base borne persones theother onely tyrannye vnnaturall homicide also vsurpacion crowne beynge realme detested disdayned gladly accepted ioyousely concented kynge richardes deuyce coniuncion amitie perfightely remembrynge emongest bondes obligacions loue amitie neither surer perfighter locke knote coniuncion sacramente matrimonye whiche begynnynge firste age man ordeyned instituted holy place paradise terrestiall god hym selfe reason whereof propagacion succession humane nature stablished vpon sure seate lawfull matrimony betwene prynces maye norishe peace concorde vnite aswage breake furyous rage truculente mar terrible battayle encreace loue fauoure familiarite wherfore thesayde prynces sente ambassadours councelours agayne toune nottyngham thesayde mariage writinges instrumentes couenauted codiscended agreed affiances made taken procters deputy bothe par e ymediately called pryncesse rothsay whiche name shortely loste shorte life kynge richarde louyng vncle maye well noted vnnaturall loue disordered affeccion whiche kynde kynseman shewed blood remembryng tyranny executed brother sonnes wrong manifest iniury done brother daughter bothe takynge theim dignyte possession lyuynge thoughte yt shoulde redounde greately honoure fame yf promoted susters chylde whome nothynge bounde conscience make restitucion dignyte quene rather preferre brother daughter whome vntruely force dishenerited righte depryued mariage meane esquyer suche fraternall kyndenes towarde brother suche large conscience towardes brother child league mariage thus concluded agreed kyng scottes disdeignynge stronge castell dumbarre remayne thenglish mennes handes possession wrote gentle letter kyng richard delcaryng hym league concluded betwene theim yt agreed appoyncted within xl dayes nexte ensuynge expresse declare opynion meanynge concernynge castell dumbarre whether sayde castell shoulde occupyed stande still handes thenglishemen durynge whole tyme truce elles terme sixe monethes onely nowe certefyed kynge rycharde letter contente shoulde enioye possessyon thesayde castell quyetely peaceably durynge thesayde truce amitie neuerthelesse requyred hym loue familiarite nowe bothe treatie alyaunce spronge knyt betwene theim woulde redelyuer thesayde castell handes whiche vntruely possessed thenglishe nacion delyuerye rebelles treytours contrarie righte equitie conscience kynge richarde dalyed pleasaunte letter fayre woordes foded foorth kynge scottes neuer dumbarre delyuered kynge richarde lyued whose deathe whether yt treason apoyntemente castell rendred kynge scottes greate contentacion reioysyng albeit league amitie thus couenaunted concluded mighte manifestely seme person coniuracions confederacy agaynst kynge richard extinct put scylence especial considerynge ye duke buckyngham alyes made oute waye death banyshment exilynge farre countreies region yet kyng richard doubtyng trustyng awne people frendes contynually vexed tossed vnquyeted feare retourne erle richemond complices fauroures dailye dread hourely agony caused lyue dolefull misery euer vnquiet maner incontinual calamitie wherfore entendynge releued haue dolorous imaginacion alleuyated determyned clerely extirpate plucke al mater grounde feare doubtes wherefore longe deliberate consu tacion nothinge purpose entente thought either necessary expedient agayne price praier rewardes attempt ye duke britaine whose territorie erle richemond abode deliuer thesaide erle hades whiche onely meanes shoulde discharged feare perel brought ot rest quietnes bothe body mynd wherfore incontynent sent certeine ambassadoures duke britayne tooke vpon theim beside great ample rewardes ye brought theim britayne kyng richard yerely paie aunswer duke al reuenues rente profites seignories lades possession aswell belonging apperteigning erle richmod noble gentleman whiche erles company yf tyme would kepe theim continuall pryson restreine theim libertie oratoures furnished instruccions arriued britayne came duke house hym coulde haue maner communicacion concernynge weightie affaire reason beyng fatigate weakened longe daily infirmitie beganne lytle waxe ydle weake wyt remembraunce cause peter landoyse chiefe treasouter man bothe pregnaunt wit great authorite ruled adiuged al thinges p easure commaundemet cause men set high authorite best beloued excited prouoked malice euell ye nobilite britayne afterward diuerse great offence durynge authorite perpetrate committed meanes brought death cofusion thenglishe ambassadoures moued message request peter landoyse hym declared master commaundemente instantely requiringe humbly disirynge whose powre laie thing britayne woulde fren ely assent request kyng richard offering rewardes landes thei haue offered duke peter whiche lesse disdeyned hated almost people britayne thoughte yf dyd assent satisfie kyng richardes petycion desyre shoulde powre habilite sufficiente withstande ell malicious attemptes disdeynfull inuencions enuious aduersaries wherefore feithefully promysed accomplishe kyng richardes request desyre kepte promise might hable withstande cancard louse secrete enemy acte promised nay grudge malice bate earle richemonde haue heard delyuered perell deathe saynct malos great doubte life ieopardie cause riseth euer offende cursed hungre golde execrable thirst lucre inward feare losse aucthorite driueth blynde myndes couetous men ambicious persones euilles misch e innumerable remembryng losse name obloquy people conclusion punyshement god merites desertes fortune fauourable publicke wealth realme englande deadly dolorous compact tooke none effect place postes ranne letter sent frotor ye finisshyng great entreprise betwene kyng richard peter landoyse ihon morton bishop ely soiornynge flaunders al craftie coueighaunce certified secret sure fredes wherfore sent christopher urswike whiche verie ceason come britayne flaunders declare erle richmod howe al deceipte craftie working conueighed compassed geuyng charge councell aduise ye erle al hast possible wt al copany retire britayne frauce newes brought erle kept house uannes incontinent dispatched agayne christopher urswike charles french kynge requyring might sauely passe fraunce whiche desyre impetrated obteyned messenger shortely returned lorde prince erle well perceauynge expediente necessarie al spede diligence loke weightie mattre callynge verie fewe councell made exploracion searche secret weyes sent noble men though certayne familiaritee kyndenes visite comforte ye duke recreacion chaunge ayre laie border confynes fraunce secretely gaue charge earle pembrooke leader conducter compaigny approched march lymites britayne dyuerte take next weye fraunce noble men somewhat suspicious thinges newely imagened without tariyng iorney ga ynge scouryng weies fast horse would ronne conuenientely might beare susteyne came oute duchy britayne duchy angeou dominion fraunce exspected earles commynge ii day departed oute uannes onely accompaignied v seruytoures though gone secretely visite familier frende small village adioynynge man suspected woulde departe considerynge greate multitude englishemen lefte contynued citee passed directly fyue myles forward sodaynly turned solitarye wood nexte adioynynge clothinge hym selfe symple cote poore seruaunte made apoynted saide mynister leader master small compaignye humble page dyligently folowed serued countrefeate gouernoure neuer restynge theim selues refreshynge excepte baytyng horse till thei wayes vnknowen nowe waie nowe turnynge waye came company abidyng theim angiers fourthe daye earle richemonde thus departed craftie marchaunte peter landoyse trustynge still praye promised kyng richard ready set forwarde crew souldyours whiche preuely consigned certayne trustye capiteynes onely purpose appoynted elected performe acheue pretensed entreprise dissymulynge feignynge theim conducted hyred hym serue earle richemond hym conduyte retourne towarde natiue countrey meanynge none thynge apprehende hym theother noble men retynue whiche suche fraude suspectynge yet treason ymagenynge vnware vnprouided destitute ayde theim cast detrude sodaynly continual captiuite bondage tente facinorous naughtie acte mighte satisfie charitable request louynge desyre good kynge richard awne profite kyng richards gayne crafty dissymuler peter landoyse whiche wylyer olde foxe perceaued earle departed thynkynge trewe ymagened lorde howe currioures rane euery coaste howe lighte horseman galloped euery streyt folowe deteyne hym yf possibilite coulde subsecuted ouertaken hym incarcerate brynge captyue citee uannes horseman made suche diligence celerite set forward iorney nothing likely thei haue obteined ye seazed praie erle richmond entred realme fraunce scace one hour folowers came lymites confines britayne durst auenture farther veinely without desyre sorofully ourned whiche season left uannes aboute nombre iii englishemen beynge called councell vnware entreprice knowynge erles sodeyne departure incontinently astouned maner thei al dispayre awne securite sauegarde fortune tourned saile otherwyse yt happened feare theim encombred duke britayne nowe beyng somewh recouered sore displeased nothinge contented erle richmonde dominion vncurteously tracted entreated fraud vntruthe compelled leaue flye oute duchye countrey contrary honoure wherfore tooke greate displeasure peter landoyse treasourer although knewe ygnoraunte drifte dryuen deuysed hym laied faut imputed cryme wherfore sent edward wooduile edward pownynges valiaunte esquyers england delyuered vnto theim monye sufficiente conduyte wyllynge theim conuey rest thenglishmen beynge brytayne earle richemondes presence earle thus furnyshed apoynted trusty company escaped daugerous labirinthes snare set meruel though io unde glad ye prosperous successe happened affaire wherefore lest seme blotted note ingratitude sent dyuerse gentleme duke britaine publishe declare hym behalfe erle onely benefite fauoure conserued delyuered imminente daunger like trapped wherfore time rendred hym moost hartie thankes woordes trustyng doubtyng tyme come liberally recopence actes dedes erle tooke iourney charles french kyng lyeng lange vpo riuer leyre whome great thankes geuen manifolde gratuytes erle shewed disclosed manifested cause occasio accesse repaire person requyred hym helpe succour thentente immortall benefite tyme shewed might sauely retourne nobilite realme whome generally called take vpon croune scepter realme muche hated abhorred tyranny kyng richard kyng charles promysed aide comfort bad good courage make good chere assured would gladly shewe beneuolent mynd bountefull liberalite kyng thence remoued moutargis leadyng erle ofn richemond al noble personage retynue faccion erle thus attendaunte french court ihon vere erle oxforde haue heard kyng edward kepte prison within castell hammes persuaded ihon blount capitayne thes e fortresse six ihon fortescewe porter toune caleys hat hym selfe onely dismyssed set libertie lso abandonynge leauynge fruitefull office condiscen goo fraunce earle rychmonde parte iames blount like wise capiteyne wyfe remaynynge castell departure forte thesame bothe newe inuencions newe souldyours earle richemonde sawe erle oxforde rauy ed incredibile gladnes beyng man highe nobil e suche knowlege practise feates warre constante trusty assured whiche alweie studied maintenaunce preferment house lancaster nowe goddes prouision delyuered captiuite imprisonmet time necessaty couenient come aide succour auauncement whome surer mighte put truste confidente take lesse peyne trauayle awne person hid fro hym euer take part wt kyng edward time came hi seruice either malice thei bare kyng richard elles feare tyme vnder truculent rule tempestious gouernaunce man often tymes personally fought mortal battayle querell kynge henry vi iudged deuyne powre heauenly inspiracion delyuered oute captiuite emprisonment onely purpose shoulde haue man awne faccion schoole whome might surely faithfully communicate credite thinges awne propre person therfore beyng en amed immortall ioye earles commynge beganne haue good hope happie successe pretensed entreprises longe frenche kyng retorned agayn paris whome erle richmond folowed entending solicite mattre conclusion whereupon besought kyng charles take vpon whole tuicyon defence cause compaigny beynge meanes ayded comforted shoulde confesse saye wealthe victorye auauncement haue flowed budded foorthe bountyfulnes liberalite whiche would god wyllyng shortely reacquyte meane ceason diuerse englishemen whiche either fled englande feare parys learne studie good litterature verteous doctrine c voluntarely submitted theim selues earle rychemonde vowed sware take parte emongeste whome richarde foxe priest man great wyt lesse learnynge whome erle incontinent receaued secret familiarite briefe tyme erected auaunced high dignitees promocions conclusion made bishop wynchester meane ceason kyng richard crediblye aduertised promyses othes erle cofederates ha made sworne together renes erles meanes henglishme passed oute britayne fraunce wherfore ge sore dysmaied maner desperate craftie cheuesa tooke none effect brytayne ymagened deuysed howe disturbe erles purpose another meane lady elizabeth nece pretende clayne tytl croune thought mariage fayled erles chiefe com ad bene clerly cut beynge blynded amb n desyre rule tyme obteynynge kyngdome p petrate done many flagicious actes detestable tyranny ye rdynge olde prouerbe let take bul stale away ye calfe thought factes hym committed tymes passed sma l moment regarded comparison mischeuous ymaginacion whiche nowe newely beganne attempted came hys vngracious mynde thinge onely detestable spoken remembraunce man muche cruell abhominable put execucion reuolued wauerynge mynde howe greate founteyne mischiefe towarde hym shoulde sprynge yf erle richmond shoulde auaunced mariage nece thinge hearde saye rumour people small nombre wise wittye personage entreprised compasse brynge conclusion clerely determined reconcile fauoure brother wife quene elizabeth either faire woordes liberall promise firmely beleuynge fauoure obteined woulde sticke commite louyngly credite rule gouernaunce daughter meanes erle richemonde affinite nece shoulde vtterly defrauded beguyled yf ingenyous remedye coulde otherwise inuented saue innumerable mischiefes whiche euen hand like falle yf yt shoulde happen quene anne wife departe oute presente worlde selfe woulde rather take wife cousyn nece lady elizabeth lack affinite whole realme runne ruyne said yf fell estate dignite ruyne realme must nedes shortely ensue folowe wherfore sent quene beynge sanctuarie diuerse often messenger whiche first shoulde excuse purge thinges againste attempted procured shoulde largely promes promocions innumerable benefites onely also sonne lord thomas marque dorcett brynge yf yt possible wanhope men saie fooles paradise messenger beynge men bothe wit grauitie persuaded quene great pregnaunte reason fayre large promise began somewhat relent geue theim deffe eare somuche faithfully promised submyt yelde selfe fully frankely kynges pleasure putting obliuion murther innocente child infamy dishonoure spoken kynge husbande lyuynge auoutrie leyed charge bastardyng daughter forgettyng also feithfull promes open othe made countesse richmon mother erle henry blynded auaricious affeccion seduced flatterynge wordes first deliuered kyng richards hades v daughter lambes agayn committed custody rauenous wolfe sente letter marque sonne beynge parys earle richmonde willynge wise leaue earle without delaie repaire englande hym prouided greate honoures honorable promocions asserteignynge hym ferther offence bothe party forgotten forgeuen bothe highely incorporate kynges hearte surely inconstancie woman muche merueled yf woman bene founde constante let men speake yet wemen verie bonde nature folowe awne kynde kynge rycharde thus glorious promyses flatterynge woordes pleased appeased mutable mynde quene elyzabeth knewe nothing lesse moost entended caused al brother daughter conueighed paleys solempne receauyng though newe familier louyng entreteinement shoulde forget myndes obliterate olde committed iniurie late perpetrate tyrannye nowe nothinge contrariant obstacle pernicious purpose mancion voide wife whiche thynge anywise adiuged necessary done one thyng muche feared dragged hym commyttynge abhominable murther haue hearde beganne countrefaycte ymage good wel disposed person therfore afeard leaste sodeine immature death wife openly knowen lese good credible opinion whiche people without deserte conceaued reported conclusion euyll councell preuailed witt lately mynded mischiefe tourned goodnes vngracious desyre ouercame honest feare first entre gate ymagened entreprise absteyned bothe bed companye wife compleyned dyuerse noble men realme infortunate sterilite barennes wife brought foorth non fruyte generacion bodye especiall accompted thomas rotheram archebishop yorke whome lately delyuered oute warde captiuite impedymentes quene dyuerse thinkyng woulde enucleate open thinges trustynge sequele herof take effecte herynge grudge husband takyng therfore inwarde thought woulde longe lyue worlde bishoppe gathered whiche well knewe complexion vsage kyng quenes dayes short declared certeine secrete frendes procured common rumour woulde haue author knowen published spred abroade emonge common people quene ded thentent takyng coceipte straung fame fall sodayne sicknes greuous maladye proue terward fortune way lese li e whyther people would impute death thought sicknes therof would laie blame whe quene heard tell horrible rumour death sprong emongest comminaltie sore suspected iuged ye world almost ende sorofull agony lamentable countenaunce soroful chere repaired presence kyng husband demaundynge hym yt meane iuged worthy dye kyng aunswered fare woordes dissimulynge blandimentes flatteryng lesynges comforted biddynge good comforte knowlege shoulde haue none cause howsoeuer fortuned either inward thought pensyuenes hearte intoxicacion poyson affirmed moost lik ly within day quene departed oute transitorie lyfe dewe solemp ite buried churche int peter westminster thesame anne one daughter erle warwyk haue heard request lewes french kyng maried prince edward sonne kyng henry vi kyng thus accordyng long desire losed oute bodes matrimony beganne cast foolyshe phantasie lady elizabeth nece making much suite haue ioyned lawfull matrimony men mayden selfe moost al detested abhorred vnlawfull maner vnnaturall copulacion determined prolonge deferre matter till quietnes verie reason oppressed great weightie vrgent cause busyness euery side considerynge dailye parte nobilite sailed fraunce erle richmond preuely fauoured aided certeine coniuracion shorte ende fewe none doubte ye common people moost part brought desperacio many theim rather reputed taken ye nobre enemy abide chaunce hazard haue goodes taken spoile victorie enemy emongest noble men whome moost mystrusted principall thomas lorde stanley sir william stanley brother eylbert talbot vi hundred whose purpose although kyng richard ignoraunt yet gaue neyther confidence credence one theim least lorde stanley ioyned matrimony lady margarete mother erle richmond afterward apparauntly ye maie perceaue thesayde lorde stanley woulde haue departed countrey visite familie recreate refreshe spirites openly sayde truth thentent persight readines receaue erle richmod first arriual englad kyng wise woulde suffre hym departe left hostage courte george stanley lorde straung first begotten sonne heire kynge richard thus troubled vexed ymaginacions tumulteous time lyke come lo euen sodeinly herde newes fyer sprong oute smoke warre recently begonne castell hammes deliuered handes earle rychmonde meanes earle oxenforde also iames blount capiteine castel fled fraunce aide earle henry wherfore thynkynge yt great pollicie withstand fyrst brunt sent moost part garrison caleis recouer force castell hammes whiche castell perceauing aduersaries approche prepared municions engins defence sente also earle richemonde aduertise hym sodeine obsession requirynge hym hasty ayde spedy succoure erle epynge first begonne au e sent earle oxe forde elected company souldioures reise siege kewe castel whiche first arryuynge pitched campe farre enemy kyng rychardes men gaue vigilaunt iye weytynge least earle oxforde shoulde take adua ntage theim la e side castell thomas brandon xxx approued men warre marishe whiche laie theother syde entred castell souldioures within greately animated muche comforted newe succour aide greued thenemies shortyng fro walles accustomed castell vexed enemy foreparte earle oxenforde lesse molested vnquiet theim theother parte whiche occasion kyng richardes men offred awne mere mocion licence beynge within castell departe sauetie bagge baggage nothinge excepted whiche condicion earle oxenforde commynge purpose delyuer louynge frendes oute pe ell daunger chiefely olde hostesse iane blount wife iames blount capteine would wise repudiate refuse leauynge castell bare vngarnysshed bothe vitaile artillary came safe erle richmond soiournyng parys duryng tyme kynge richard credebly informed explorators espialles erle richmond wt longe suyte courte fraunce sore fatigate weried desyryng greate de coulde obteine small releue muche thyng went farre backward suche thinges great diligence lesse deliberation purposed determined set forward nowe dasshed ouerthrowen ground kynge richarde eyther beynge light credence seduced deluded hys craftie taleteller grea ly reioysed though obteyned ouerhand enemyes triumph victorie thought hym selfe neuer surely delyuered reare dreadfull ymaginacions neded nowe cause eyther wake breake golden slepe wherefore called home againe shippes warre whiche apoynted kepe narowe see dispatched al souldioures deputed kepe certeine garrison stoppe certeine passage haue heard yet least might lacke prouisyon sodeinly trapped streightly charged gaue commaundemet noble men especiall suche inhabited nere see coaste frontier wale accordyng vsage countrey thei kepe diligent watche stronge warde ye entent ye aduersaries wise haue place apte oportune easely ke lande withoute defence rebuttynge back custome countreyes adioynyng nere see especially tyme warr euery hill high place erect bekon wt greate laterne toppe maie sene discerned great space noyes bruted enemy approche nere land sodeinly put fyer lanthornes make showtes outrage fro toune toune village village ronne post fro place place admonisshyng people ready resist ieopardy defende perell pollecy fame sone blowen euery citee toune somuche aswell cytezens rural people short space assembled armed refell put back newe arryued enemy nowe retourne purpose kynge richarde thus alleuiate accustoned pensiuenes beganne somewhat merier toke lesse thought care outwarde enemy woont saie polletique prouision shoulde withstand desteny whiche hong ouer hed ordened briefe tyme sodeinly fall suche force puissaunce deuyne iustice euery man shal lesse regarde lesse prouide lesse doubte al thing moost nerest punishment next mischaunce offence crymes aboute ceason erle richmonde desirynge ayde frenche kynge certeine noble men apointed rule realme fraunce durynge minorite kyng charles emongest theim selfes one opinion whiche dissencion lewes duke orlyaunce chiefe sturrer maryed lady iohanne suster frenche kynge tooke vpon aboue rule administracion whole realme reason whyche controuersie one manne suffred rule al wherfore erle rychemond compelled make suyte euery one councel seuerally one another requiringe desirynge theim aide releue weightie busynes cause prolonged deferred durynge whiche ime thomas marque dorsett haue heard entised mother retorne againe englad partely despayring good successe erle richmod partely onerate vanquesshed faire glosynge promise kyng richard secretly night ceason stale oute parys diligent expedicion tooke iourney toward flaunders relacio departure made erle richmond theother noble men maruell though astonnyed greatly amased yet wt stadyng thei requyred frech kyng thast yt might lefull theim name commaundement take steye copaignion confederate partaker councel place within realme territorye euer coulde fynde hym peticio obteined thei sent oute currier euery parte emongest whome homfrey cheiny pl iyng parte good blood hounde foloed tract flyer euen ye sent ouertooke appreheded hym farre copeign reason wt fa promise beyng persuaded retourned againe copaignions earle richmond vnburdened misauenture least procrastinacion day prolongyng time might lese great oportunitee thing offred ministred also least shoulde ferther wounde molest myndes feithfull assured frendes daily aspect tarie comyng determined lenger protract deferre tune al diligence scelerite attempte begonne entreprice obteinyng kyng charles small crewe men borowyng certeyn somme money diuerse pryuate frendes whiche left debter likelyer pledge hostage lord thomas marque dorsett whome halfe mistrusted sir ihon burchier departed french courte came citee roan taryed makyng prouisio harflete mouth ryuer seyne thinges necessary nauy nauigacion tydynges brought hym kynge richard beynge wt child wydower entended shorte mary ladye elizabeth brother daughter preferre ladye cicile suster man founde cloude vnknowen lignage familie tooke newes matter small momente thynges considered yt lesse importaunce tooke yt thyng tooke aweie compaignions hope courage obteine happie enterprice therfore maruell though nypped hym verie stomacke thought possibilite might attayne mariage kynge edwardes daughter whiche strongest foudacion buyldyng reason whereof iudged frendes england woulde abandon shrynke hym wherefore makynge many councell dyuerse consultacions determined yet set forwarde tarye attempte howe get ayde frendes stronger succoures emongest al yt thought moost expedient allure affinite ayde compaignion armes sir walter herbert man aunciente stocke greate powre emongest welshemen whyche wyth hym faire ladye suster age mature ripe coupled matrimonie acheuynge purpose messenger secretely sent henry eearle northumbreland whiche maried another suster sir walter herbertes gto thentent shoulde set forward deuyce purpose weies narowly watched many spy laide messenger proceded iourney busynes meane ceason ther came earle ioyfuller message morgan kydwelly learned temporall lawe whiche declared ryce ap thomas man lesse valyauntnes actyuitee ihon sauage approued capteyne woulde powre partaker quarell reignolde breye collected gotten together small money payment wage souldioures men warre admonisshynge also make quicke expedicion take course directely wale earle richmonde woulde lenger lynger weery hys frendes lyuynge continually betwene hope feare determyned conueniente hast se f forwarde caried shippes armoure weapon vitayl ordinaunces expedient warre shortely speake thynges prepared whiche wont necessary profitable variable chaunces incerteine accidentes ieopardies warre whiche requyreth preparacio many instrumetes thinges chargeable erle made humble peticion deuoute praier allmightie god besechynge hym sende moost prosperous wynde sure passage iourney also effecteously desyrynge goodnes aide comforte necessite victorie supremitie ouer enemy accompaignied ii thousand menne small nombre shippes weyed vp ancres halsed vp failes calendes august sailed harflet prosperous wynde vii daye departure arryued wale euenyng porte called mylford hauen cotinet tooke land came place called dalle heard saye certeine company aduersaries leyed garrison defende arryuall last wynter earle sonne rysyng remoued harfford west beyng distant dalle fully ten myle applauded receaued people greate ioye arryued sodeinly come entred toune thesame tyme cytezens knowlege commynge heard newes whiche vntrue thei truly reported hym normandie rice ap thomas ihon sauage wyth body goodes determined aide kyng richard compaignie somewhat appalled newe tydynges came message thinhabitauntes toune pembrooke refresshed reuyued frosen heartes daunted courage arnold buttler valiaunt capitain first askynge perdon offence tyme committed erle richmond obteyned declared hym penbrochians ready serue geue attendaunce natural immediate lord iasper erle penbrooke erle richmond hauyng armie thus encreased departed herforde west toune cardygan beyng v myle distant thence souldioures refresshyng trimmynge theim selues campe straunge tydynges spronge emonge theim wtoute certeine authour sir walter herberd laie wt greate crewe menne carmarden nowe greate armye ready approche hyd theim battaile newes armie sore troubled euery man assaied armure proued hys weapon prest defende enemy timerous doubte certeine horseman erle sent make exploracion searche retourned reported countrey bee quiete let impedimente laied cast iourney euen tyme whole armye greately recomforted reason commynge rycharde gryffyth man greate nobilite whiche notwithstandynge conferate wyth sir walter harbert richarde app thomas yet verie instant came earle richemund compaignie whyche great nomber hym thesame daie came ihon morgan wyth men earle auaunced forwarde good hast makynge repose abode one place thentent passe forwarde sure short expedicion assauted e ery place ennemies set men warre whiche small force lesse difficultie briefely dyd expugne vanquishe sodeynly espialles asserteyned sir walter harbert rice app thomas harnes hym ready encountre wyth hys atmye stoppe passage wherefore lyke valyaunt capteyn firste determyned sett theim eyther destroye take theim fauoure powre puyssaunce geue battaile mortall enemye kynge richarde thentent frendes shoulde knowe wyth dexterite attempted entreprice proceded forwarde sente moost secrete feithfull seruauntes letter instruccions ladye margarete hys mother lorde stanley brother talbote trustie frendes declarynge theim succoured holpen ayde releue frendes entended passe ouer ryuer seuerne shrewsburie passe directely citee london requirynge theim especiall truste confidence perplanted hope fidelite woulde occurre mete hym waye diligent preparacion thentent thei tyme propice place conuenient might communicate together profundyte depnes dubious weightie busynes whe messenger disparcled commaundementes admonicions marched forward toward shrewsbury passynge met saluted rice ap thomas goodly bad welshman whiche makyng othe promyse erle submitted whole ordre commaundement erle richemond ii day made promes woulde sweare take part obedient hym woulde make hym chiefe gouernour wale whiche parte feithfully promised graunted obteyned possessed realme diademe liberally performed accomplished meane tyme messenge sent diligently executed thinges geuen theim charge laden rewardes theim whome thei sent retourned hym thesame daye entred shrewsburie made relacion hym frendes ready poyntes thynges either thei ought might erle hery brought good hope pleasaunt message continued foorth entended iourney came litle towne called newporte pitchynge campe lytle hill adioynynge reposed hym selfe nyghte euenynge thesame daie came hym sir george talbott wyth whole powre younge earle shrewsburye beynge warde whiche accompted nombre twoo thousande men thus powre encreasynge arryued towne stafforde pawsed whome came sir wyllyam stanley accompaignied fewe persones earle communed longe tyme together reuerted souldioures whiche congregate together serue earle whiche thence departed lichefelde laie withoute walles camp nyght nexte morenynge entred towne honour lyke prynce receaued daie twoo lorde stanley hauynge hys bande almoste fyue thousande men lodged thesame towne herynge earle richemonde marshynge thetherward gaue hym place dislodgynge hym hys repaired towne called adrestone abydynge commynge earle wilye foxe acte aduoyde al suspicion beynge afraied least yf shoulde sene openly bee fautoure ayder earle sonne lawe daie battayll kynge richarde whiche yet dyd vtterly put diffidence mystruste woulde put cruell deathe sonne heire apparaunt george lorde straunge whome kynge rycharde haue heard kept hym pledge hostage thentent lorde stanley father shoulde attempte nothing preiudiciall hym kynge rycharde ceason kepynge howse castell notyngham infourmed earle richemond bannysshed men fled oute englande hym nowe arryued wale thynges necessarie entreprice vnprouided vnpurueyed verie weake nothynge mete withstande powre suche kyng apoynted resiste rumour enflated minde maner disdeignyng speake poore compaignye determined first take lytle regarde small sparcle declarynge earle innocente vnwyse temerariously attempted suche great entreprice small thynne nombre warlyke persones therefore gaue definityue sentence came poynte shoulde compelled fight agaynst eyther shoulde apprehended lyue elles likelyhode shoulde necessite come shamefull confusion trusted shortely done sir walter harbert rice ap thomas whiche ruled wale egall powre lyke aucthoritee yet reuoluynge castynge hys mynde small warre begonne wynked regarded maye tourne greate broyle tumulteous trouble yftwas prudente pollecie asperne disdeyne lytle small powre weakenes ennemye yt neuer small thought yt necessarye prouyde clappes might happen chaunce wherefore sent ihon duke norfolke henry earle northumberlande thomas earle surrey hys especiall trusty frendes nobilite whyche iudged muche preferre esteme wealthe honoure awne rich priuate commodite willynge theim mustre viewe al seruauntes tenentes elect choose moost courageous actiue persones whole nomber theim repaire presence spede diligence also wrote robert brakenbury lieutenaunt towre commaundynge hym powre come armye brynge hym felowes armes sir thomas butchier sir walter hungerforde diuerse knightes esquiers whome cast small suspicion thus ordrynge affaire tydynges came earle richemond passed seuerne come shrewsbury withoute detrymente encombreaunce whiche message sore moued broyled wyth melancolye doloure cried askynge vengeaunce theim contrarye othe promes fraudulently deceaued hym whyche cause beganne haue diffidence muche determined hym selfe oute hand thesame daye occurre resyste hys aduersaries hast sente oute explorators viewe espie waie enemy kept passed dilygentely doynge dewtie shortely retourned declarynge kyng earle encamped toune lichfelde perfighte knowlege earle armye soiournynge hauynge continuall repaire subiectes hym beganne contynently withoute delaie marshall collocate order battailes lyke valyaunt capteine polletique leader firste made battayles set forward foure foure ranke marchynge towarde waie enemyes hym reported entended passe myddle parte armye appoynted trafficke cariage apperteignynge armye enuironed satellytes yomen crowne frownynge countenaunce truculente aspect mounted greate whyte courser folowed footemen wynges horseman coastynge rangynge euery syde kepyng araye greate pompe entred toune lecester sonne set earle rychmonde reised campe departed lychefelde towne tomwoorth therto nere adioynynge myd waie passynge saluted hym sir walter hungerforde sir thomas burchier knightes dyuerse whiche yelded submitted theim selfes pleasure beynge aduertised kynge rycharde theim suspicion gealosye lytle beyonde stony stratforde left forsooke prcuely capteyne robert brakenbury nocturnall wandryng maner vnknowen p thes vncerteine way searchyng last came earle henry diuerse noble p rsonages whiche inwardely hated kynge richard worsse toade serpent lykewyse resorted hym wyth powre strength happened progression earle richmond straunge chaunce worthy noted albeit man hau e valyaunte courage army encreased dayly waxed puysaunt stronger yet lytle afeard wise coulde assured father inlawe thomas lorde stanley whiche feare destruction lorde straunge sonne haue heard yet enclyned neyther partie yf gone earle notefied kynge rychard sonne shortely executed wherefore syth earles feare sprange nothynge accompaignyed twenty lyght horseman lyngered iourney man disconsolate musyng ymagenynge best done aggrauate melancoly pensyuenes yt shewed hym kynge rycharde hand stronge powre populous armye whyle thus pensyue dragged behynde hoost whole armye came toune tomwoorth depe darcknes coulde perceaue steppe theim passed wandred hether thether sekynge compaygnie yet herynge noyse whysperynge theim dyuerted lytle village beynge aboute iii myles armye takynge greate thought muche fearynge least shoulde espied trapped kynge rychardes skoute watche taried nyght auenturynge aske demaunde question creature beynge amased wyth ieopardye perell passed wyth thys presente chaunce sore feared shoulde bee pronosticacion prodygall sygne infortunate plague afterward succede mery beynge absent hys compaignie lykewyse armie muche marueled lesse mourned sodeyne intempestious absence next morenynge early dawnynge daye retourned conduyte good fortune espied came armie excusynge hym selfe haue gone oute hys waye ignoraunce pollecie deuysed none went campe receau glad message ecrteyne hys preuy frendes secret alies excuse made preuely departed agayn host toune aderstone lorde stanley sir william brother bandes abidynge earle came firste fatherinlawe lytle close saluted hym sir william brother diuerse congratulacions many frendely embracynges eache reioysed state sodeinly surprised great ioye comfort hope fortunate successe affaire doynges afterward consulted together howe geue battaile kynge richarde yf woulde abide whome knewe farre houge army euenynge thesame daye sir ihon sauage sir bryan sanforde sir symon digby many leuyng kyng richarde turned came parte erle richmond elect company men whiche refusall kyng richardes parte men suche experience augment encreace bothe good hope puissaunce erle richmond mean ceason kyng richard whiche appoynted nowe finyshe last laboure deuyne iustice prouidence god whiche called condigne punyshemente scelerate merites myscheueous desertes marshed place mete twoo battayles encountre village called bosworth farre leycester pitched felde refreshed souldioures toke rest fame went thesame night dreadfull terrible dreamethe dreame kyng richard iii yt semed hym beynge slepe sawe diuerse ymages lyke terrible deuelles whiche pulled haled hym sufferynge hym take quyet rest whiche straunge vision sodeinly strake heart sodeyne feare stuffed hed troubled mynde many dreadfull busy imaginacions incontynent heart beynge almost damped pronosticated doubtfull chaunce battaile come vsynge alacrite myrth mynde countenaunce accustomed came toward battaile least might suspected abasshed feare enemyes cause looked piteously recyted declared hys famylyer frendes morenynge hys wonderfull visyon terrible dreame thynke dreame punccion pricke hys synfull conscyence conscience muche charged aggrauate offence greater heynous degree whiche prycke conscience allthough strike waye yet last daie extreme life wonte shew represent v faultes offence paynes punishementes whiche hand ouer heddes comittyng thesame thentent instant desertes penitent repentaut may bee copelled lametyng bewalyng sinnes like forsakers worlde iocund departe miserable life retorne againe oure purpose next daie kyng richard beyng furnished wt men abilimetes warr bringyng al men camp plaine ordered forward marueylous legth appointed horseman footman thentet emprynte harte loked farre sodeine terror deadlie feare great multitude armed soldiours fore frount placed archer like strong fortifi trench bulwarke ouer battaile captain ihon duke norfolke whome thomas erle surrey sonne log vatgard folowed king richard hi self wt strog copaigny chosen approued warr hauyng horsmen wynges side battail therle richmond departed comunicacio frends haue harde began better stomake valiant courage wt al diliges pitchid feld iuste cap enemy lodgid night mornyng e tyme caused men put armure appareyl selfes redy fight geue battaill sent lord stanley come wt bade place indifferently betwene armes requiryng wt approche nere army help set souldiours array swered therle set awne good order battaile would array copaigny come time conuenient answere made otherwi e therle thought would haue ruoged considerynge oportunite time waite busynes although wt litle vexed beganne somewhat hang hedde yet wtout time delaiyng compelled necessite maner instructed ordered men made forward somewhat syngle slender accordyng small nober people frouut placed archer whome made captain iho erle oxford right wyng battaill appoynted sir gylbert talbott leder left wing assigned sir ihon sauage wt aide lord staley accompaignied therle penbroke hauyng good compaignie horsmen small nomber footman hole nober exceded v thousaide men beside powr stanley wherof iii thousande felde vnder stadard sir william stanley kynges nomber doble muche morethe oracio kyng richard iii bothe army thus ordered al men redy set forward kyng richard called cheuetains together sayde faithfull assured felowes trusty welbeloued frendes elected captain whose wysedome policie haue obteyned crowne type famous realme noble regio whose puissauce valiauntnes haue enioied possessed thestate roial dignite ysame maugre yl wil sedicious attemptes cancarde enemy insidius aduersaries whose prudet politike cousaill haue gouerned realme people subiectes haue omitted nothing appertainig office iuste price haue pretermitted nothing belogyng dewtie wise sage counsailers may saie truely affirme approued fidelite tried constancye maketh beleue firmely thinke vndoubted kyng indubitate prince although adepcion obteinyng garlade seduced prouoked sinister cousail diabolical temptacio commyt facynerous detestable acte yet haue strayte penaunce salt teryes trust expiated clerely purged thesame offence abhominable cryme require frendship clerely forget dayly remember deplore lament thesame wil diligently cal remembraunce case perplexitie stand doubtful perell intricked doubt hart thinke wyth mouth confesse yf euer amitie faythe preuailed betwene prynce subiectes betwene subiecte subiecte yf euer bond allegians obliged vassall loue serue naturall souereigne lorde yf obligation dewtie bounde prynce aide defende subiectes loues bondes deuties necessite daie experimented shewed put experiece yf wyse men saie trew pollycie gettyng muche kepyng one beyng fortune chaunce high wyt pollicie whiche cause must nedes daye take labour payne kepe defende force preheminence possession prudent deuises haue gotten obteyned doubt knowe howe deuell continuall enemie humane nature disturber concorde sower sedicion hath entered harte vnknowen welshman whose father neuer knew hym personally sawe excitynge hym aspire couet oure realme crowne dignitie thereof clerely depryue spoyle v posterite se farther compaigny traytors thefes outlawes ronneagates awne nacion ayders partaker feate enterprise redy hand ouercomme oppresse v se also nober beggerly briton faynt harted frenchman hym arriued distroy v wyfes child imminent mischifes apparaunt incoueniences wil withstond refel must liue gether like brethern fight together like lios feare dye together lyke men obseruyng kepyng rule precept beleue fearefull hare neuer fledde faster gredy greyhoud sylye larke sparowhauke symple shepe rauenous wolfe proud bragging aduersaries asto ned amased sight manly visage wil flee ronne skyr felde yf yow consider wisely ponder althings mynde shall perceyue haue manifest cause apparant token triumph victorie begyn earle richmond captaine rebellion welsh mylkesoppe small courage lesse experience marcyall actes feates warr brought vp brother meanes myne like captiue close cage court fraunces duke britaine neuer saw armie exercised marcial affaire reason whereof neyther able awne wit experience guyde rule hoste wyt pollecie capitaine consisteth chefe adeption victorie ouerture enemyes secondarely feare put waie doubtes traitor runagates realme shall see v wt banner displaied come remebryng oth promise fidelitie made vnto v ther souereigne lord anoynted kyng thei shal pricked stimulate botome scrupulous conscience thei remorce dread diuine plage ethe shamefully flye humbly submitte selfes grace marcie frenshme brytons valiatnes y suche noble progenitor valiaunt paretes haue oftener vaquished ouercome one moneth thei beginny g imagened possible copasse fynishe hole yere wil make bragger wtout audacite dronkards wtout discrescion rybaudes wtout reason cowardes wtout resistyng conclusion effeminate lasciuious people euer shewed selfes frunt battaile ten tymes coragious fly escape ons assaut brest stronge populous army wherfore consideryng al auautages expell thought al doutes avoide mindes al feare like valiaunt chapions auauce furth standard assaye whither enemy decide trie title battaile dent swerde auaunce say againe forward captain whome lacketh neither pollicie wisdome puissaunce euery one gyue one suer stripe suerly iorney preuayleth hadfull hole realme desiryng loue beare affeccion haue natiue naturall coutrey sauegard prince selfe wyll day take accustumed corage couragious spirites defence sauegard v assure daye wil triuphe glorious victorie suffer death immortal fame thei h eed palice fame disgraded dieg wtout renoune much preferre exaltey perpetual honor natiue coutrey ther awne mortal transitorie life sent george borowe let v set forwarde remeber wel shal wt high auauncementes rewarde preferre valiaunt hardy chapions punishe turment shameful cowardes dreadfull dastardes exhortacion encouraged faroured hym suche present dreade loue kyssed openly whome thei wardely hated sware outwardely take part suche whose death thei secretely compassed inwardly imagened promysed inuade kynges enemy whiche fled fought fyrce courage kyng stode stil loked entendynge take parte wt victor ouercommers people hym vnsure vnfaithfull ende nephewes vntrew vnnaturall beginnyng therle richmond knewe forriders kyng nere embattayled rode armye ranke ranke wyng wyng geuyng comfortable wordes men finyshed heynge armed peces sauyng helmet mounted lytell hyll people myght se beholde hym perfitly great reioysyng man great stature formed decorated gyftes lyniamentes nature semed angelicall creature terrestriall personage cou tenaunce aspecte cherefull couragious heare yelow lyke burnished golde eye gray shynynge quicke prompte redye aunswerynge suche sobrietie coulde neuer iudged whyther ware dull quicke speakynge suche hys temperaunce ouer loked hys army ouer euery syde pawsed lowde voyce bolde spirite spake compaignions lyke wordes folowyng euer god gaue victorie men fyghtynge iust quarellthe oracio kyng henry vii yf euer ayded suche made warre welthe tuycyon ther awne naturall nutritiue countrey euer succoured whyche aduentured lyues relefe innocentes suppressynge malefactores apparaunt offender doubt felowes frendes hys bountefull goodnes wyll daye fende v triumphaunt victorye luckey iourney ouer prowde enemyes arrogant aduersaries yf remember consider cause iust quarell shall apparantlye perceyue trewe godly vertuous whiche doubte god wyll rather ayde v ye fyght v se v vanquished profligate suche neyther feare hym lawes yet regarde iustice honestie cause iuste enterprice vertue bothe lawes diuine iuile honest goodly godly quarell fight agaynste capitayne beynge homicide mutderer hys awne bloude progenye extreme destroyer hys nobylytie hys oure countrey poore subiectes deadly malle fyrye brande burden vntollerable beyde hym consyder bande compaignye suche murther vntreuthe committed agaynste awne kynne lynage ye agaynste theyr prynce souereygne lorde haue disheryted wrongefully deteyne vsurpe ouer lawefull patrymonye lyneall inherytaunce calleth hym selfe kynge kepeth crowne regymente noble realme countrey contrarye iustice equitie lykewyse hys mate frendes occupie landes cutt downe woddes destroy manner lettynge wife child range brode ther liuyng persones ther penaunce punishment doute god goodnes eyther deliuer handes great gayne booty cause beinge greued compuncted pricke ther corrupt conscience cowardely flye abyde battaill besyde assure yonder great battaill men brought thyther feare loue souldiours force compelled wt good assembled person desyer rather destruccion saluacion ther master captayn fynally multitude wherof parte frendes lest parte enemy truely dout whiche greater malice souldiours towarde captain feare hym conceyued people suerly rule y infallible il men daily couyte destroy good god appoynteth good confounde yll worldly goodes greatest y suppresse tirauntes releue innocence wherof one euer muche hated y beloued trewe clerkes preche spare younder tyraunt richard duke gloucester vntrewely callyng hym self kyng consideryng hath violated broken bothe lawe god man vertue hym whiche confusion hys brother murtherer nephewes mercy hym sleythe hys trustie frendes aswell extreme enemyes haue confides putteth diffidens yf haue redde haue hard clerckes saie tarquyne proude vice body lost kyngdome rome name tarquyne bannyshed citee euer yet fault detestable facte cruel nero whiche ew awne mother opened entrayles holde place conception beholde younder richarde whiche bothe tarquine nero ye tyraut nero hath murdered nephewe beyng kyng souereigne lorde bastarded noble brethern defamed wombe verteous womanly mother also compased meanes way coulde inuent stupra e carnally know awne nece vnder pretence cloked matrimony whiche lady haue sworne promysed take make wyfe know beleue cause iuste quarel godly let god geuer vyctorie iudge determine haue thankes geuen christe escaped secrete treason brytaine auoyded subtyll snare fraudulet enemy passed troublous see good quiet sauegarde resistence haue penetrate ample region large countrey wale comme place whiche much desyred long haue sought furious bore haue found wherfore let v feare enter toyle may suerly sley hym god knoweth haue liued vale myserie tossyng oure shippes daungerous stormes let v dread set vp sailes fayre wether hauyng v bothe hym good fortune come conquer wale acheued yt praise bene great gayne yf wyn battaill hole riche realme england lordes ruler shall oures profit shall oures honour shall oures therfore labour gayne swet right brytaine small liuynges lytle plentye welthe welfare tyme come gett abundaunce rich copie profit rewarde seruice merite payne reme ber selues v ennemies ether syde v suche nether suerly trust greatly beleue backwarde cannot fly stande like shepe folde circumcepted copassed betwene enemy doubtful frendes therefore let feare set syde lyke sworne brethern let v ioyne one daie shalbe thende trauayle gaine labour eyther honorable death famous victory trust battaill shall sowre profyt shalbe swete remember victorie gotten multitude men courage harte valiauntnes myndes smaller nombre glorie v yf vanquishe ouercome yet laude attributed victor consyderyng x men fought agaynst one yf dye glorious death good quarell nether fretyng tynne cancarding obliuio shal able obfuscate race boke fame ether name godly attempte one thyng assure iuste good cause notable quarell shall fynde daye rather dead carion vppon coold grounde fre prisoner carpett laydes chamber let v therfore fight like inuincible gyantes set enemy like vntimerous tiger banish feare like raping lion auauce torward trew men traytors pitifull persones murtherers trew inheritor vsurpers skorges god tirau te display banner good courage marche furth like stronge robustious champion begyn battaill like hardy conquerers battaill hande victorie approcheth yf shamfully recule cowardly flye sequele destroyd dishonored euer daie gayne time losse get daie victorie coquerers lese day battail villain therfore name god saict george let euery coragiosly auauce forth stadard cherefull wordes sett forthe suche gesture body smylyng coutenaunce though redye vanquyshed hys enemy gotten spoyle scantly finyshed saiengethe battaile betwene kyng richard kyng henry vii one armye espyed lord hastely souldioures uckled healmes quikly archer bent ther bowes frushed theire feather redely byllmen shoke bylles proued staues redy approche ioyne terrible trompet sownde bluddy blast victorie deathe betwene bothe army ther great marrysse therle richemond left right hand entent syde defence parte doyng sonne backe face enemy kynge richard saw earles compaignie passed marresse commaunded al hast sett vpon trompettes blew souldiours showted kyngs archer couragious let fly arrowes erles bowme stode still paied home againe terrible shot ons passed army ioyned came hande stroke nother swerde byll spared whiche encounter lord stanley ioyned therle erle oxforde meane season feryng lest co paignie fightyng thei compassed circuuented wt multitude enemy gaue comaudemet euery ranke hardy go aboue x fote standard whiche comanndement ons knowen thei knyte selfes together ceased littel fro fightyng aduersaries sodainly abashed matter mystrustynge fraude deceate began also pause left strikyng wylles many whiche leuer haue kyng destroyed saued therfore thei fought faintlye stode stil therle oxforde bryngyng bend togither one parte set ennemies freshly agayne aduersaries perceiuyng placed ther men slender thyne thicke brode behynde begynnynge againe hardely battaill two forwardes thus mortallye fought eche entendyng vanquishe conuince ye kyng richard admonished explorators espialles therle richmod accompaignied small nomber men armes farre approched marched toward perfitely knew personage certaine demonstracions token whiche learned knowen inflamed ire vexed wt outragious malice put spurres horse rode syde range battaile leuyng auantgardes fightyng lyke hungery lion ran spere rest toward hym therle richmonde perceyued wel kyng furiusly commyng towarde cause hole hope welth purpose determined battaill gladlye proferred encountre hym body body man man kyng rychard sett sharpely first brout ouerthrew therles standarde slew sir william brandon standarde bearer whiche father sir charles brandon kynge hery viii created duke suffolke matched hand hand wt sir ihon cheinye man great force strength would haue resisted hym saied ihon hym manfully ouerthrowen makyng open passage dent swerde went forwarde therle richmond stode violence kept hym swerdes poincte without auantage longer compaignions though iudged beyng almost dispaire victorie sodainly recomforted sir william stanley whiche came succour iii thousande tall men whiche instant kynge richardes men dryuen backe fledde selfe manfully fyghtynge mydell enemy slayne brought death worthely deserued meane season therle oxforde aide lorde stanley long fight disconfited forward kyng rychard whereof greate nomber slayne chace flight greatest nomber whiche compelled feare kyng mere voluntarie mocion came feld gaue neuer stroke hauyng harme domage sauely departed whiche came thyther hope se kynge prosper preuaile shoulde shamefully confounded brought ruyne battaill died fewe aboue nomber thousande persones nobilitie slayne ihon duke norfolke whiche warned dyuers refrayne felde muche nyghte shoulde set forwarde towarde kynge one wrote gate iack norffolke bolde dykon thy maister bought solde yet notwithstandynge regarded othe honour promyse made kynge richarde lyke gentleman faythefull subiecte prynce absented hym selfe hys mayster faythefully lyued vnder hym manfully dyed hym hys greate fame lawde slayne besyde hym water lorde ferrers chartley sir rychard ratclyffe robert brakenburie leutenaunt tower many gentleman mo sir willyam catesbey learned lawes realme one cheffe counsailers late kynge diuers ii day behedded leycester amongest ranne awaie sir fraunces uicou louell humfrey stafforde thomas stafford brother toke sanctuary saynct ihones gloucester captiues prysoners greate nomber deathe kynge rycharde knowen publyshed euery man manner vnarmynge hym selfe castynge waye abilimentes warre mekely submitted selfes obeyssaunce rule therle richemond whiche parte gladly done beginnynge yf myght haue conueniently escaped kyng richardes espialles whiche hauynge clere eye lynx open eares mydas raged serched euery quarter amongest henry iiii erle northumberlande whiche whither commaundement kyng rycharde puttynge diffidens hym dyd loue fauor bare vnto earle stode still greate compaignie intermitted battaill whiche incontinently receyued fauour made counsail thomas haward erle surrey whiche submitted hym selfe ther taken grace cause father cheffe cousailer greatly familiar kyng richard comitted tower londo long remained conclusion deliuered treuth fidelity promoted high honor office dignites therle richmods part slain scace one hundred persones amongest whome pryncipall sir william brandon standard bearer battaill fought bosworth leycester shire xxii daye august yere redempcion mcccclxxxvi hole conflicte endured lyttell aboue twoo howres kyng richard fame wente might haue escaped gotten sauegarde fliynge thei whiche next person saw perceyued first ioynyng battaill ouldiours fayntly nothyng couragiously set enemy also wt drewe selfes pryuely prease departed beganne suspect fraude smell treason exhorted determinatly aduysed hym saue hym selfe flyght losse battayle imminent apparante brought hym swyfte lyght horse conuey hym awaie ignorant grudge yll como people bare towarde casting awaye hope fortunate successe happy chauce come answered men saye daye woulde make ende battailes el ther finyshe lyfe suche great audacitie owte stomake reigned body suerly knew day decided determined whither peaseably obteyne enioye kyngdom duryng lyfe el vtterly go depryued much hardines beyng ouercome hastely closed helmett entered fiercely hard battail thentent obteine day quiet reigne regiment el finyshe vnquiet life vnfortunate gouernauce miser poinct like chaunce fortune happeneth suche whiche place right iustice honestie folowyng ther sensuall appetite loue vse embrace mischiefe tiranny vnthriftines suerly example vehemencye man tonge expresse feare astune suche yuell persones wil lyue one houre vacant fro doyng exercisyng crueltie myschiefe outragious liuyng therle thus obteigned victorie slaine mortal enemie kneled doune rendred almighie god harty thakes wt deuoute godly orison besechyng goodnes sende hym grace auaunce defende catholike fayth mayntaine iustice cocorde amogest subiectes people god gouernauce comitted assigned praier finyshed replenyshed wt incomperable gladnes ascended vp topp littell mountaine praysed lawded valiaunt souldiours also gaue vnto theim harty thankes wt promyse codigne recompen e fidelite valiaut factes willyng commaundyng al hurt wouded persones cured dead carcase deliuered sepulture people reioysed clapped hades criyng vp heauen king henry king henry lord stanley sawe good gratuite people toke crowne kynge richard whiche
