founde amongest spoyle felde sett therles hed though byne elected kyng voyce people auncient tymes past diuers realmes hath accustomed first signe token good lucke felicite must put remembraunce howe kynge richarde puttynge diffidence lord stanley wt hym hostage lorde straunge eldest sonne lord stanley haue hearde ioyned firste sonne lawes armye feare kynge rycharde woulde haue slayne lorde straunge heyre kynge rycharde come boswoorth sent purseuaut lord stanley commaundyng hym auaunce forward hys compaignie come presence whiche thynge yf refused sware christes passion woulde stryke sonnes hedde dined lorde stanley aunswered pursiuaunt yf kynge dyd sonnes lyue come hym determined kynge richarde harde aunswere commaunded lorde straunge incontinent behedded whiche season bothe armyes sight eche counsaillers kyng rycharde ponderyng time cause knowynge also lorde straunge innocente father offence perswaded kynge tyme fight tyme execucion aduisynge hym kepe lorde straunge prisoner tyll battayll ended leyser pleasure myght accomplished god woulde kynge rycharde enfrynged hys holy othe lorde deliuered kepers kynges tentes kept prisoner whyche felde done master slayne proclamacion made knowe childe thei submitted selfes prysoners lord straunge gently receyued brought newe proclamed kyng hym father receyued greate ioye gladnes hole campe remoued wyth bagg baggage thesame nyght euenyng kynge henry great pompe came towne leycester aswell refreshynge people souldioures preparynge thynges necessarie hys iourney towarde london rested reposed hym selfe twoo dayes meane season deade corp kynge rycharde shamefully caryed towne leycester gorgiously daye pompe pryde departed owte thesame towne bodye naked despoyled skyne nothynge left aboue hym muche clowte couer hys pryue member trussed behynde pursiuaunt armes called blaunche senglier whyte bore lyke hogge calfe hed armes hangynge one syde horse legges syde spryncled wyth myre bloude brought graye fryer church within toune laie lyke miserable spectacle suerly consyderyng mischeuous actes facinorous doynges men maye worthely wonder caytiue sayde church lesse funeral pompe solempnitie enterred woulde done beryng innocent nephiwes whome caused cruellie murthered vnnaturally quelled death knowe lamented many reioysed proude braggyng white bore whiche badge violently rased plucked doune euery signe place myght espied yll lyfe men wished memorie hym buried carren corp reigned ii yeres ii monethes one daie small litle stature body grraiely deformed one shoulder higher otherthe discripcion kyng richard iii face small co tenaunce cruel man first aspect would iudge sauor smel malice fraude deceite stode musyng woulde byte chaw besely nether lippe sayd hys fyerce nature cruell bodye alwaies cha ed sturred euer vnquiete beside dagger ware would studied hand plucke vpp downe shethe middes neuer drawing fully wit pregnaunt quicke redy wyly fayne apte dissimule proude mynde arrogat stomacke whiche accompaignied death whiche rather desyrynge suffer dent swerde beynge forsaken destitute vntrewe compaignions woulde cowarde flight preserue saue vncertaine liffe whiche malice sickenes condigne punishement might chaunce shortly comme confusion thus ended prynce mortall life infamie dishonor whiche neuer preferred fame honestie ambicion tyranny myschiefe yf continued still protectoure suffered nephewes haue lyued reigned doubt realme prospered muche praysed beloued nowe abhorred vilipended god whiche knewe interior cogitacions hower deathe remitte punyshment offence committed lyfe politique gouernaunce kyng henry vii consideryng haue sufficiently declared mischiefe kyng richard third wrought realme ye death noble brother kyng edward fourth nobilite hys kyngdom maligned conspired hym abandoned left maner desolate day hys nede tribulacio also miserable ended lyfe toune boswoorth vnreueretly enterred ye toune leicestre doubt sufficiently declared vnto resteth shewe happened fall confusion bothe vanquished depriued princely powre royall dignitie kyng henry obteyned triumphant battaile plain boswoorth malicious enemy kyng richard also glorious victory gatt diademe possession thestate royall princely preheminence famous empire renoumed kyngdome hauyng ingenious forcast subtyl serpent also fearyng burnynge fyre like infant litle synged small slame farther vigilantly forseyng prudently prouidyng doubtes might accid ntally ensue deuysed studyed compassed extirpate eradicate interior sedicions apparant presumpcions whiche might moue tumulteous route sedicious coniuracion within realme tyme come obsist first likely mischiefe sent departure leycestre sir robert wylloghby knight maner sheryhutton county yorke edward plantagenet erle warwike sonne heires george duke clarece beyng age xv yeres kyng richard kept prysoner durynge tyme vsurped reigne surely ye kyng afeard without cause much mistrusted least youge man duill disposed enuious persones glory auauncemet might inuent new occasion renuyng battaill beyng euen infancy many encombrances trouble vexed endaungered desired nothyng hartely nowe lyue quyetnes peace tranquilite sir robert willoghby accordynge hys commission receaued conestable castle erle edward conueighed london youngelynge borne perpetuall calamitie incontynent towre london putt vndre safe sure custody beside thesame castell sheryhutton lady elizabeth eldest daughter kyng edward kyng richard foolyshly phantasiyng deuelyshly dotyng entende mary haue heard damosell dy alonly disagre repudiate matrimony abhorred detested greatly abhommable desyre whiche importunate detestable cocupiscence comon people realme muche grudged maligned attribute ye faute cryme kyng much culpate blame preuy coucellers whiche dissent consent pernicious counsaill shamefull conclusion god hys goodnes preserued christe mynde verteous immaculate virgin flagicions facinerous acte graciously protect de ende whiche lady longe accopa yed great nombre aswell nobleme honorable matrones good spede conueighed london brought mother meane ceason kyng remoued forward iorneyes toward london euen passed rusticall people euery syde wayes assembled great nombres great ioye clapped handes showted criyng kyng henry kyng henry whe approched ere cytie mayre senate magistrate thesame beyng clothed vyolet met shordiche saluted welcomed oue voyce generall euery person perticul ly preased aduauced hym selfe gladly touche kysse victorious handes whiche ouercome monstruous cruell tyraunt geuyng la de praysynges almightye god rendryng immortall thankes whose meane industry comen wealth realme preserued fro finall deslruccion perpetuall calamite aucthores mischiefe ublated plucked awaye great pompe triumphe roade cytie cathedral church paule wher offred iii standardes one ymage george secod red firye drago beaten vpo white grene sarcenet ye third yelowe tartern peinted done owe praiers saide te deum song departed bishoppes palays soiourned ceason duryng whiche tyme playes pastymes pleasure shewed euery parte cytie thentent good mynd toward god put obliuion caused general processios solemply celebrate rendre yelde god creator redemer hartye humble thankes whiche deliuered fro miserable captiuite restored libertie fredome besyde fauoured loued kyng inwardly ioyous se perceaue aduersaries back frendes ready like suppeditate ouerthrowen solempnities grati ications done passed accordyng kynges accustomed cogregated together sage councelers realme cousail like prince iust faith true promes detestyng intestine cyuel hostilite appoynted daye ioyne matrimony lady elizabeth heyre house yorke noble personage heyre lyne lancastre whiche thyng onely reioysed comforted harte noble gentleman realme also gayned fauour good myndes co men people much extollyng praysyng kynges constant fidelyte polletique deuyce thinkyng surely daye come seede tumulteous faccions fountayne ciuyle dissencion stopped euacuate clerely extinguished great pompe coueighed westmynster thirty daye octobre ceremonyes accustomed enoynted crouned kyng whole assent aswel comons nobilite named kyng henry vij name yere redempcion mcccclxxxvi frederyke iij beynge emperour almayne maximilian sonne beyng newely elected kyng romanes charles viij reignyng ouer frenche nacion iames iii rulyng realme scotland kyngdome obteyned enioyed thyng god elected prouided especiall fauoure gracious aspecte compassed acheued muche comonly reporte viicxcvii yeres passed heauenly voyce reueled cadwalader last kyng brytons stocke progeny reigne land beare domynion agayn wherupo men persuaded awne opinion heauenly voyce prouided ordeyned longe enioye obteine kyngdom whiche thyng kyng henry vi also shewe haue heard declared wherefore beynge right iust tytle temporall inheritaunce prouision deuyne purueyauce thus crouned proclaymed kyng first vsyng antique example athenienses whiche perdon put memory crymes offence tyme agaynst hym lawes perpetrated comitted called high courte parliamet westmynster vii daye nouembre thestablishyng thinges aswell cocernyng preseruacion maintenauce royall person admynistracion iustice preferment comon wealth realme domynion thewhich caused proclaymed menne perdoned acquyted clerely discharged offence peynes death execucions restored landes mouable goodes whiche would submyt selfes clemency othe obliged truly serue obeye hym souereigne lorde woulde obstinate refuse returne parte accepted taken publike enemy hym countrey reason proclamacion great nombre came diuerse sanctuary priuileged place obteyned grace forgettynge clerely diuersite faccions voyce partakyng beganne remembre especiall frendes fautours whome auaunced honoure dignite enriched possession goodes euery accordyng desert merite begynne iaspar vncle erle penbrooke created duke bedforde thomas lorde stanley moted erle darby lord chandew briteine especiall frende made erle bathe sir eyles dawbeney made lord dawbeney sir robert willoughby made lord brooke degree bar n peeres realme edward stafford eldest sonne henry late duke buckyngham restored name dignitie possession whiche kyng richard dyd cofiscate attaynted beside parliamet notable acte assented concluded foloweth pleasure almighty god wealth prosperite suretie realme england synguler comfort kynges subiectes thesame aduoydyng ambiguyties question ordeyned established enacted present parliamente inheritauce croune realme england also fraunce pr hemynece dignitie royall thesame apperteignyng seigniory kyng belongyng beyond sea appurtenauces therto wyse dewe apperteignyng shall rest remayne abyde royall person nowe souereigne lord kyng henry vii heires body lawfully comyng perpetually grace god endure none beside acte al attainder kyng enacted kyng edward kyng richard adnichilated recorde thesame adiudged defaced put memory al person attaynted cause occasion restored goodes landes possession coclusion diuerse actes made tyme kyng edward kyng richard adnulled reuoked expedient vtilitie comen wealth subrogated concluded thynges necessary discretely ordred parliamente tyme dissolued kyng thought necessary put obliuion hys frendes hostage beyng beyonde sea wherfore diligent redemed marque dorcet sir ihon bourch er lefte pledge parys money borowed sent also flaunders ihon morton bishop ely actes perfourmed stablished house graue counsaill wyse pollitique men whose iudgement ordre determinacion people might gouerned accordyng iustice equitie cause might finyshed ended without great bearyng expence longe ute hearyng decydynge cause iustly spedely sware hys counsaill dyuerse noble discrete persones whiche pollecy wytt synguler grauitie highly estemed renoumed whose name folowe iaspar duke bedfoorde ihon erle oxenforde thomas stanley erle darby iho bishop ely sir wyllyam stanley lorde chamberleyn housholde sir robert willoughby lord brooke lord stuard houshold gyles lord dawbeney ihon lord dynham made tresorer england sir reignold brey sir ihon cheiney sir richard guyldforde sir richard tunstall sir richard egecombe sir thomas louell sir edward pownynges sir iho risley diuerse wyse men whiche tyme requyred called hys counsayll seruyce nowe one nowe another although eleccion wyse graue councellers thinges semed brought good perfight conclusion yet lacked wrest harpe set strynges monacorde tune matrimony fineshed betwene kynge lady elizabeth daughter kyng edward lyke good prynce accordyng othe promes dyd solempnise cosummate brief tyme saye xviii daye ianuary reason whiche mariage peace thought discende oute heaue england consideryng lynes lancastre yorke beyng noble famylies equiualet ryches fame honoure brought one knott connexed together whose twoo bodyes one heyre might succede tyme peaceable rule enioye whole monarchy realme england thynges thus passed albeyt apparauntly thynges semed reduced good poynte set sure steye kyng henry beyng made wyse expert wyth trouble myschiefes past remembred yt wisdome feare prouide crafty wyles lurkyng trappes secret enemyes remembryng moost parte embrued exercysed plantyng dyuision sowynge dissencion lightely leaue pestiferous appetite sedicious occupacion wherfore sauegarde preseruacion awne body costituted ordeyned certayn nombre aswell good archer diuerse person hardy stronge agilitie geue dailye attendaunce person named yomen gardethe first yomen garde president men thought learned frenche kyng frauce men remembre kyng england tyme whiche vsed furnyture daily souldyours yet forasmuche auoyde eschewe doubtfull daungers perelles vnloked lytle auayleth ourward warre except sure staye stedfast backstande home aswel sauegarde securite good gouernauce left behynde therfore sommoned agayne hys great courte parliament wherto would elected prudent grauous person euery countie cytie porte borogh especiall suche daungers calamity misery tumulteous affaire vsed trusted fauoured parttakers councelers compaignious woo aduersitie also triumphe gloryous victory whose myndes studyes perfightly knewe fixed set poletique regunent prudent gouernauce publique wealthe realme domynion orgettynge hauyng freshe memory cause principally sore desyred instantly called englishe nacion hys naturall countreymen estemynge yt chiefe principall parte hys ductie se realme bothe adourned decored good profitable lawes statute also florishe verteous operacions good cyuile maners ccasyon cause men hope thynge would continually amend euyll good good bettre bettre best sure foundacion kyng henry layde begynnyng reigne entendyng theron contynually buylde yere newe kynde sicknes came sodenly whole region eue first entryng kyng isle sore peynfull sharp lyke neuer harde mane remembrauce tymethe sweatyng syc ne sodenly deadly burnyng sweate uaded bodyes vexed bloud ardet heat infested stomack head greuously tormentyng vexacion sicknes men sore handled peynfully pangued yf layed bed beyng hable suffre importunate heate cast away shetes clothes liyng bed apparell vesture would put garmetes euen shirtes drye dranke colde water quenche importune heate insaciable thirst coulde least woulde abyde heate styntche dede sweate great strong sauoure caused clothes layed vpon theim asmuche coulde beare dryue oute sweate yf might maner assone sweate toke within short space yelded vp ghost sickened ther one emongest hundreth escaped somuche besyde great nombre whiche deceased within cytie london twoo mayres successiuely dyed thesame desease within viij day vj alderman person fully completely sweat xxiii hou e long strength plague hold clerely delyuered hys desease yet cleane ryd yt might shortly relaps fall agayn thesame euyll pyt yea agayne twyse agayne many one dede dyd whiche thyrd tyme dyed thesame length study phisicians experience people dryuen therunto dreadfull necessytie remedy inuented suruyued consyderyng thexstremytie peyne deseased deuised thynges mere cotrariaunt resyst withstande furious rage burnynge furnesse luke warme drynke temperate heate measurable clothes person relapsed agayn flame fyrst delyueraunce obserued diligently marked suche thynges dyd theim case cofort fyrst vexacion vsyng thesame remedy medicine peyne addyng euer somewhat therto sanatyue wholsome yf person euer fell sicke agayn obseruyng regymet emongest people deuysed could shortly helpe selfe easely tempre auoyde strength malyce sweate great losse many men learned present spedy remedy thesame desease malady thewhiche thys man daye tyme plagued sweate shoulde streyght lye downe clothes garmetes lye styll whole xxiiii houres nyght taken ryse bed space xxiiii houres caste clothes myght wyse prouoke sweate lye temperately water myght distille ute softly awne accorde absteyne meate yf might longe susteyne suffre hungre take drynke neither hote colde wyll moderately quentche delaye hys thrustye appetyde amendynge one poynte diligently aboue obserued attended neuer put hand foote bed refreshe coole selfe thewhich lesse peine short death may pleynly see emedy daily experience excogitated inueted thys straunge vnknowen desease thewhich tyme vexed greued realme england euery toune village yt dyd dyuerse tymes lv yere sayled flaunders germany wher destroyed people innumerable lack knowledge englishe experience cotagious euell plague chaunced first yere kyng henryes reigne token playne signe vaine iudgem people whiche comonly comen fantastically wisely faith credite geue attributed kyng henry haue harde sore begynnyng truly yf vayne snpersticion set furth truthe pretended signifyed kyng henry extreme poynte ende naturall life neuer haue spirite mynde quyet consideryng nowe begynnyng newe obteyned reigne yo shall shortly heare sedicion comocion people troubled vexed vnquyeted maner manifest profe herafter lyue small rest great mystrust suche rebelious sedicious cospiracies phantasticall iudgementes vnlettred person whiche ouerpasse retourne purpose thinges kyng appeased london set appoynted affaire good ordre sure state self coiectured thought best make peregrinacio take progresse quarter realme might wede extirpate purdge myndes spotted cotaminate cotagious smoke dissencion preuy faccions especially countie yorke preuy faut ures coforters cotrary parte without cause kyng richarde loued estemed regarded northern subiectes within hys whole realme thyng kyng henry vnknowe wherfore studied kepe dew obeisaunce faithfull obsequy knew long custome haue borne harte fauourable myndes aduersaries therfore pryme tyme yere toke iorney towardes yorke feast ester approched diuerted cytie lyncoln taryed duryng solepnite high feast makyng abode certified lord louel homfrey stafforde departed sanctuary colchestre place whether man yet could tell cause kyng lytle regardyng tale went forthe appointed iorney yorke assone receaued settled bruted openly shewed kyng selfe fraunces lorde louell hand stronge mightye powre menne woulde diligence inuade cytie also forenamed homfrey stafforde thomas hys brother worcettre shyre raysed great bande rude rusticall people cast lotte parte assaute gate mene scale walles cytie worcestre kepe passage lettyng reskewes aiders first heryng kyng estemed vaine vncertain therfore litle moued certified letter credece sent fro frendes true comen voice spoken published afflicted smal feare surely without cause wisely cosidred neither competet army ready prepared harneys weapon present also doubtfull place nether might could coueniently gather hoost together cosideryng thesame cytie memory kyng richard mortall enemy yet recent lyuely forgotte hys frendes matter requyred dilygent celery ie least longe tariyng powre aduersaries daily aide might encreased multiplied comaunded duke bedforde iii thousand men strongely armed great entrepryce brest plate moost parte made tanned lether encountre set vpon hast diligence made preuy selfe entended doo kyng congregated together hoost euery place might retayne theim duke settyng forwarde fassion eger fierce captaine came nigh tentes campe enemyes consulted comunycated mynde certayne capitaynes sage souldiours compaigny waye might treyne allure peace without battaill bloodsheddyng whiche deliberacion aduysement yt decreed herauldes proclayme openly haue grace pardon would cast downe weapon harneys faithfull subiectes submyt selfes naturall scuereigne lord thewhich proclamacion auayled muche proffited lord louel either feare diffidence people souldyours fearyng hym selfe awne behalfe fled preuily night compaignye left without head flocke shepe without shepard whiche departure armye disclosed put armure came directly duke euery man humbly submittyng hym selfe desiryng pardon offence wholy trustynge kynges mercye fauourable goodnes pollitique wisdome ingenious meanes good duke great rage fierce route sturdy valyaut traytours prepared kyng lyke haue aughter many man pacefyed repressed brought good conformytie obedient subieccion lorde louell cheueteyne chiefe leader tumult rebellion fearyng perell daungier desiryng renoune fame cheualry neuer tariyng ye doubtfull chaunce battaile fled post haste lancashire certayne space loytred lurked sir thomas broughton knyght whiche quarter bare great swynge great aucthoritie homfrey stafford also hearyng myschaunce happened lord louell great dolor agony feare lyke maner fled tooke sanctuary village called culnaham two myles abyndon sanctuary sufficient defence proued iustices kynges benche traytoures taken force place brought towre thence conueyghed tyborne put execucion younger brother thomas perdoned remitted thought haue done yt awne wyll malicious mynde thorowe euell counsaill mischeueous persuasyon eldre brother kyng thus pollecy cousaill appeased repressed tumulteous sedicion whiche greately vexed vnquyeted spirites reduced reason coformitie rude bablyng people north party especiall thinhabitautes countye yorke returned london shortly wynchestre quene elizabeth wife deliuered fayre prince named arthur baptymethe birth prince arthur whiche name englishemen nomore reioysed outwarde nacions foreyne prynces trymbled quaked muche name nacions terrible formidable wynchestre returned back agayn london meane tyme smal matter thesame altogether beyng false feyned ther open pathe apparaut high weye made greater inconueniency ensue matter subtyl iuggelyng craftie coueighaunce thesame lesse deceytfull ligier de mayne hand iuggeler estemed emogest wyse men first bold ouer presumpteons acte atteped ye tyme well weyed considred mostreous worthy great wonderyng admiracion cosyderyng many person late either borne wobe cotinuall dissencion norished mylke suckyng pappes ciuile sedicio could lyue well rest lesse forbeare vsual custome mouing strife daily debate somtime sittyng home copassyng ymaginyng hurte da mage toward suche harte disdeyned somtyme remembryng libertie priuilege warrea prouerbe fishe cometh net euer delitynge spoylyng robbyng reuynge vehemetly thristyng distruccion losse thei would reueged willyng lyue without lawe tyme peace warre wisshyng world neuer bettre staye person dedicate geue mischiefe scelerous inuencios either hatred euell wyl malice fauoured emolumet proffite comoditie thought set vp auaunce fraude couyn crafty collusio prone ready disquyet euery day kyng whole realme thinking heaue much peace quietnes hel litle trouble vexacion furtherers setter none lackyng much xx person woulde soner pricke forward sharpe spurre one plucke back wt dull snaffle emong mo stres lymbes deuell one sir richard symond priest mane base obscure familie fro byrth delited fraude craftie conueighyng yet well learned well learned wilye wilye vngracious sir richard symond elected scoler called lambert symenell one gentle nature pregnaut wyt organe conduyte would conuey false feigned enterprice attempt deuel chiefe master mischiefe put wicked mynde venemouse brayne moost pernicious disloyall trayterous person comence feigne deuyse might make childe scolar lambert right inheritour croune england therof make kyng promote self chiefe archebishopricke high potestate w realme chiefe foundacion occasion thewhich bolde fame went many menne surely supposed kyng edwardes chyldre dead fled secretly straunge place liuyng edward erle warwike sonne heire duke clarece either put death shortly rumoures although friuelous vayne likelyhode verite truthe animated encouraged priest much thinke iudge tyme come lambert might assume take vpon hym person name one kyng edward fourthes chyldren clayme make title realme kyngdome hauyng sure knowledge neither frendship want aide lacke consideryng cancard hatred rooted founded vpo facinorous faccions sedicious deuysions perdurable maner euerlastyng neuer clerely extirpate digged rotte harte wylle hand foote toothe nayle pretensed entreprice poore priest brought foolishe paradice awne fantasticall ymaginacion informed taught chyld diligetly oxenforde went scoole instructyng princely behaueour ciuyle manner fruitefull litterature declaryng high parentage noble progeny lyncally descended thus persuadyng teachyng hym lesson clerckly craftely purpose people hearyng chyld thus rehersyng stocke sagely might rather geue credite deceytfull pretece false coloured inuencion sone rumour blowen abroade edward younge erle warwike broke pryson whe sir symod heard intedyng therby bryng mueted purpose coclusion chauged childes name baptime called edward name youg erle warwike ye one yeres one stature wt pupille sailed irelad openyng mynd declaryng mattre certain irishe nobilitie knew trewe fame reporte beare litle fauour kyng henry partaker hauyng othe promes aide sworne made shewed saued preserued duke clarece sonne fro death good brought hym countrey region knew kyng edward stock fauoured loued aboue matter beleued straight nobilitie shewed publyshed feigned fable ymagined iuggelynge one another tyll last yt accopted true gospell without cotrouersye ambigiutie question much lord thomas gerardyne chauncelour country defrauded illusion vndre colour plaine truthe receaued hym castell honoure reuerence entreteyned one descended fro high progeny sangue royall begane much aide helpe first callyng together frendes louers suche bande affinitie declaring first comyng childe affirmyng croune sceptre realme right apperteyned youge prynce sole heyre male lefte ligne richarde duke yorke exhortyng desiryng theim bothe childes sake awn true inheritoure croune helpe assyst hym obteine garland possession thesame graundfather lyneally descended communicatyng thesame matter nobilitie euery man promysed accordynge hys powre aide monye menne municyons thys meanes shortely bruted throughout irelande euery man willynge take parte submyt selfes callyng al handes kynge newe secte thus compassed sortyd thought haue place compaignyons furtherers malicious purpose pestiferous faccion straight foorth sent england certayne preuy messenger desire theim whome knewe haue true faythfull trendes kyng richarde cotinue accustomed loue faithfull frendship toward nephewe helpe childe treasure substaunce farre conueniently might powre might stronger ouercome enemyes obteyne pretensed purpose confederate sent messenger flaunders lady margaret syster kyng edward late wyfe charles duke bourgoyne purpose al powre helpe duke charles hauyng chyldren lady margaret left one sole daughter named mary behynd begotte first wyfes daughter duke burbone whiche maried maximilian lonne frederick emperour whiche wife engendred two child one philip margaret whiche two chyldren deathe lady mary mother lady margaret late wyfe duke charles entierely beloued tenderly brought vp motherly norished beside dailye payne toke ordrynge affaire busynes mayntenaunce honoure preferment proffite motherly loue toward youge child also good administracion iustice intheir country highly reputed estemed bare great aucthoritie swynge flaunders lowe country therto adi cet lady margaret although knewe familye stocke house yorke maner distroyed vtterly defaced brother kyng richard yet beyng saciate content longe hatred continual malice parentes subucrted ouerthrew almost progeny lignage kyng henry vi house lancaster yet remembryng newe affinitie stronge alliaunce lately concluded thewhiche heyres bothe house progeny vnited comoyned together lawful matrimony lyke one forgettyng god charite inflamed malice diabolicall instinctio inuented practised mischiefes displeasure damage could deuyse kyng england farther fury frantyke moode accordyng saiyng wise man malice equiualent aboue malice woma wrought wayes possible sucke bloud copasse destruccion principal head aduerse parte contrary faccion though dewe sacrifice host immolated mutuall murder amefull homicide comitted perpetrated brother progeny vehe et full poyson stronge powre ciuyle dissension preuye harted sometyme wyll auert withdrawe wisest moost sapient men goodnesse honestie bounden allegeaunce therfore lady knowyng tumulteous secte conspiracy prepared sodenly deuysed kyng henry although knewe feigned peinted mattre woorth two strawes yet hauyng suche occasion worke malice vpon promised gladly messenger mainteyne aide succoure purposed entent money substauce laboure peyne might encourage stomacke entyce many aiders assisters partaker thesame conspiracy shortely ioyne cheueteines thesaide enterprice whe kyng henry certefied doynges messenger sent england meruell although none wise occasion sore vexed moued cosideryng disc ate fraude suche dongehyll knaue vyle borne villeyne great sedicion excited sturred agaynst neuertheles lyke circu spect ingenious prudent prynce well consideryng pollitiquely forseynge ymagined entreprice came passe finall ende would bluddy darte mortall warrre yf ioyne combate open battaile moost parte large campe mischiefe commonly opened shewed many innocent menne partes perishe come ruyne confusyon without desert offence reason thynges determyned attempt proue yf might without anye battayle stroke stryken thende whereof euer ambiguous doubtful pacefye reduce rebel rule reason dewe subieccion euell newly planted wede straye wander ouer good herbes whole realme therfore called whole cousaill together chartrehouse besyde royall manner called richemonde consulted pacefye sodeyne rage secretly begonne withoute disturbaunce open trouble whiche mocion menne thought mete necessary proffitable ayed prosecuted celerite effecte thynge attempted begonne generall pardon published al offender content receaue thesame would true louyng obedient kyng souereigne lord accordyng bounden dutie allegiaunce thinkyng pardo lenger space procrastened prolonged meane ceason prouerbe sayth taryenge draweth ieopardeth perell sir thomas broughton knyght whiche hyd kept lorde lou kyng great ceason hand diuerse frendes troubleous perelous tyme vtterly dispeiryng pardon remission men without hope grace settynge vi vii sodeynly moue newe insurreccion vnquyet hym place left least resistauce although thought haue conferates iurates newe conspiracy yet sure profe apparaunt argument therof yt supposed moost proffitable tyme present extende maner extremyt e crueltie agaynste theim anye coloure pretence partely suche lenytie gentle sufferaunce rebellyous powre augment r ace partely hereafter shoulde bee founde drawe backe negligent doynge due duetye allegiaunce pollitique prouision rewarded punyshmet accordyngly deserued accordyng comen saiynge suche breade bake suche muste eate whereupon kynge gaue generall pardon throughoute englande without exception offence yea euen commytted high treason agaynst hys maiestie royall person furthermore longe consultacion thynges maturely decyded thought whole senate tyme present moost necessarye conuenyent auoyde erronyous rumoure rumblynge blastynge abroade sonne duke clarence englande personally shoulde shewed abroade cytie publique place whereby vntrue opinyon falsy affyrmynge irelande mighte emongest comynaltye repressed put downe accompted comment vayne ymagyned fable solempne counsaill dyucrse many thynges realme debated concluded emongest yt determyned lady elizabeth wyfe kyng edwarde iiii shoulde loase forfeyte landes possessyons voluntarely submytted selfe daughter wholy handes kyng richarde contrarye promes made lordes noble thys realme begynnyng conspiracy ymagyned agaynst kyng richa desyre request lefte england fled kyng henry briteyne receaued corporall othe mary eldest daughter offre abode made yt frustrate voyde whose double doynges yt lyke haue succeded neyther mariage coulde take place yet noble men whiche request toke kyng henryes parte might returne agayne without ieopardie lyfe lyue styll perpetuall banyshement myserable exyle greueous offence heynous cryme howbeyt sequele thereof well dygested yt thought man deserued equytie iustyce great losse great punyshement surely dyd great hurte hynderaunce kynge henry hys confederate reconciliacion kynge richard tenne tymes proffyted theim auaunced theyr cause submyssyon made hym heglectynge goddes lawes onest order christyan relygion presumynge accumulate myschiefe vpon myschiefe desyred mariage daughter hys naturall nyece whiche thynge woulde haue thought lykely haue obteyned quene daughter styll feare contynuyng sanctuary whiche vnlawfull desyre consyderynge entent yd hys wyfe oute worlde prouoked ire god swoorde vengeaunce agaynste hym whereby hys fynall ruyne fatall falle shortely ensued succeded hys myserable confusyon exaltacyon kynge henry auauncemente hys whole company hereby manne may perceaue wycked maligne persones brought ruyne hande temporall iudge wyll god led thereto apoynted menne make hast approche come ende haue deserued thys foly inconstancy quene incurred hatred displeasure many men th cause lyued abbey barmandsey besyde southwarke wretched myserable lyfe many yeres deseassed buryed husbande wyndsore suche worldly chaunces nowe prosperyte aboundaunce mutable chaungeable full inconstancy aduersitye often chaunge euell good bettre entent wealthe flowe aboundaunce thynges shall thynke theim selfes suretye tary styll degree state misery calamytie shall despayre mystrust god lyue hope bettre daye comforte gayne wyll apere come yet although fortune ruleth many thynges wyll pleasure yet one woorke quene hathe made cannot bee forgotten put obliuion tyme kyng edward husband reigned founded erected notable college vniuersyte cambridge fyndynge schloers desyrous good litterature learnynge endued yt sufficient possession longe mayntenaunce thesame whiche daye called quenes college name surely mete suche place wherin scholers diligently studyeng doctryne science proue excellent clerckes come great honoures thynges counsaill seriously concluded agreed kynges mynde returned cytie london geuynge commaundement nexte sonday ensuyng edward younge erle warwike brought towre moost publyke vsuall rete london cathedrall churche saynt paule younge gentleman comaunded shewyng selfe openly euery body procession tyme taried high masse hauynge communicacion openly many noble men theim especially suspected thought haue partaker commocio agaynst kyng purpose effect myght perceaue fonde iryshemen vayne shadowe vntrue tyccyon vnaduysedly excytate moue warre realme without iust cause laufull occasion howbeyt euell dysposed persones brayneles men thys medecyne nothyng auayled proffyted erle lyncolne sonne ihon de lapoole duke suffolke elizabeth syster kyng edwarde fourth thinkyng mete neglect omyt open occasion new trouble mi chiefe offred exhibited determined vpholde fortefye bolster enterpryce irishemen least might se uced caused de yst leaue incepted enterpryce attempted purpose doubteles man beyng great wyt intelligence small iudgement halfe infected venemous sk bbe late ciuyle battaile coulde quyet mynde suffer kyng henry beynge principall head contrary faccion reig e quyet co ultyng sir thomas broughton certeyne trusty frendes purposed saile flauders aunte lady margaret duches bourgoyne late wyfe duke charl trustynge healpe make puyssaunt army men ioyne compaignyous newe raysed sedicio therfore kyng di olued parliament whiche holden fled secretly flaunders lady margarete fraunces lorde louell landed certeyne dayes beyng altogether euery man accordyng mynde reasoned argued debated best doo longe comunycacion fynall conclusyon agreed vpon erle lyncolne lorde louel go irelande attende vpon countrefeacte nephewe honor kyng powre irishemen brynge hym england sendyng frendes without delaye geue battaile kynge henry yf doynges good prosperous successe forsayde lambert mysnamed erle shoulde consent counsaill deposed edwarde true erle warwyke delyuered oute pryson aucthoritie aide frendes nobilitie published proclaymed anoynted kynge kyng henry thynkyng noble well appeased syght edward sonne duke clarence nothynge mystrustyng man folishe muent feigne countrefeate thynge hym mad vndiscrete especially hys realme beleue lambert edward onely myndynge suppressyng flagicius irisheme studied subdewe represse bolde entreprice sedicious coniuracion hearyng sodeynly erle lyncolne fled gone aduersaries beynge therwith sodeynly moued thought euen stronge hand marciall powre ouercome hys enemyes euell wyllers whose maliciousnes could counsaill pollecy eschewe auoyde beyng thus determyned commaunded certeyne capitaynes prepare hoste men oute euery parte hys realme bryng conduyte one place assygned aduersaries come forwarde might populous multitude great powre sodeynly set theim ouercome vanquishe altogether mystrustyng would folowe erle lyncoln flaunders caused east partes border theraboutes diligently kept none myght escape geue succoure comynge toune saynt edmondes bury certifyed lord thomas marque dorcet comyng excuse purge hym selfe certeyne thynges suspected haue done lightely fraunce kyng send erle oxenford intercept ridyng iorney conueigh towre london trye truth proue paciece frende dede miscontented suffre lytle reproche rebuke prince pleasure frend tary sauetye might damage hurt thence kyng went furth norwiche tariyng christmas day departed walsyngham comyng churche oure lady prayed deuoutly made supplicacios almighty god diuine powre intercession lady might eschew snare preuy workynges enemy preserue selfe country imminet daungier reduce agayne streiynge shepe right folde true shepard amysse orysons fyn shed thence cambridge returned shortly london meane tyme erle lyncolne lorde louell gotten aide lady margaret aboute twoo thousand almanyes matyne swarde noble man germany marciall feactes verye expert cheuet yne sailyng ireland cytie dyuelyn caused younge lambert proclaymed named kyng england solempne fassyon thoughe heyre bloud royall lyneally borne discended great multitude beggerly irishemen allmost naked vnarmed sauynge skaynes mantelles lord thomas gerardine capiteyne conductor sayled england newe founde kyng landed purpose pyle fowdrey within lytle lancastre trustynge ayded mony sir thomas broughthon one chiefe compaignious vnhappy conspiracy kyng slepynge matter mystrustyng smellyng storme folowed enemyes arryued dispatched certeyne horseman throughout west partes realme chiefely attende comyng arryuall enemyes secondarely wayte suche espialles came ireland apprehend compell shew declare secretes enemy gathered hoste together ouer thewhich duke bedforde erle oxenforde chiefe capiteynes went couentry beynge light horseman accordyng duetie returned certefyed ye erle lyncoln landed lancastre new king thewhich kyng vnderstode consulted nobilitie councellers knowe best encountre theim oute hand let dragge awhile mattre bothe requyred counsaill also celerite layed heades together well debated matter determyned set vpo theim without delaye least powre longe sufferaunce delaiyng tyme myght augmented greatly multiplyed aduysemet take remoued nottyngham lytle wood called bowres pytched feelde shortely came lorde george talbot erle shrewsbury lorde straunge sir ihon cheyny valeaunt capitaynes many noble expert men warre kyng comaunded geuen charge person county adioynyng hable strengthe cary weapon ready houres warnynge case nede requyre therfore pycked felowes hardy personage suche lyke menne chosen ha e sorte great armye coacted gathered together kynges army wondrefully encreased tyme tyme greatly augmented space erle lyncoln beyng entred yorkeshire passed softely iourney without spoylyng hurtyng man trustyng therby haue company people resorte vnto perceaued fewe none folow purpose returne backe consydryng enemyes ready set vpon determined firmely trye fortune battaile remembryng chaunce mar dothe stand euer vpo vi vii kyng henry ii yeres small powre men vanquished kyng richard mightie army herupon puttyng sure confidence vpo compaigny directed waye yorke newarke vpo trent thentent trusted augmetyng hys co paigny might set vpon kyng knew ii day iorney albeit came kyng henry bosome knewe euery houre erle came night fought newarke approched nere hys enemyes soner loked tariyng lytle went iii myles pitched feelde lodged night erle lyncolne certefyed commyng nothynge afearde kepte styll hys iorney lytle village called stoke nygh kyng army planted hys campe next daye folowynge kynge deuyded hys whole nombre three battailes good arraye approched nigh toune stoke equall playne place bothe party darreigne battaile place apoynted ordeined trye vttermo stroke battailethe oke erle set furth army geuyng token compaignye set vpon aduersaries manly courage desirynge souldyours daye remembre honoure awne lyues armyes ioyned fought earnestly sharply muche almanyes beynge tryed expert menne warres marciall feates thynges aswell stengthe pollecye egall equyualent englishemen martyne swarde theyr chiefe capitayne leader many englyshemen bothe valyaunt courage stoute stomack strengthe agilyte body compared resembled hys manhoode othersyde iryshemen although foughte hardely stucke yt valyauntly yet manner theyr countrey almoste naked without harneys armure stryken downe slayne lyke dull brute beastes whose deathes destruccyons great discouragynge abash ment residue company thus fought space sore egrely bothe partes man coulde well iudge whome victory lyke enclyne length kynges orward beynge full people well fortefyed wynges whiche onely bothe beganne contynued fyght set vpon aduersaryes suche force violence fyrst oppressed kylled suche capitaynes one one resysted theyr myght puyssaunce put fearfull flyght thewhiche eyther apprehended captyues prysoners theyr flyght runnynge awaye elles slayne brought confusyon small moment battaile fynished fought oute extremytie yt well apered high prowes manly stomakes courageous harte valyaunt courage kynges aduersaryes chiefe capiteynes erle lyncolne lorde louell syr thomas broughtonmartyn swarde layne martyn swarde lord gerardyne capiteyne irishemen slayne founde dead howbeyt affyrme lorde louell toke horsse would haue fled ouer trent hable recouer fartherside highnes banke drowned ryuer kylled battaile fyue capiteynes reherced partye aboute foure thousand kynges parte halfe fougthe forward gaue onset slayne hurt lambert yonglynge falsely reported duke sonne clarence master sir richard symond prieste bothe taken neither put death lambert innocet poore soule chylde age suche entreprice awne deuyce priest yet thentet might remebre stone ofte tymes falleth head hym casteth ayer many man maketh rod awn tayle entendeth another preist penaunce comitted perpetual pryson miserable captiuitie lambert coclusion made kynges faulkener turne broche executed vile officies kynges kytchyn suyllarye space thus high entrepryce lady margaret deuised set furthe tyme turned naught brought none effect euell coclusion chaunce aduertysed enformed countrye flaunders sorye harte much lamented deplored ymagined purpose sorted suche infortunate ende effect incontinently deuisyng practisyng ymagenyng greate difficile enterpryce thewhich might vexe perturbe yet agayne kyng england whole region whiche purpose euen inuented yt set yt forwarde shalbe shewed herafter plainly kyng henry thus asswaged appeased matter beynge great moment weight great mocion tumulte trouble escaped defaced apparant ymminet perell small conflict great daungerous brunt ieopardy also repressed suppeditate cyuile dissencion inte ior stryfe maner woulde haue wyshed might thynke hymselfe one tyme cleane ryd delyuered two euelles together feare present also come certeynly pondred diligently consydered aduersaries whose puissaunce nombre force farre surmount precell poynte fiercely ioyne byd battaile much suspected lesse mistrusted preuy fautoures secret coucelers tyme place requyre expostulate would strength aide succoure assyst agaynst puyssaunce perceaued sawe hoost enemyes manifestly vanquished put flight comaunded kyll sleye erle lyncolne brought hym alyue thentent might shewe bewraye foutayne originall begynnyng also confederate aiders comforter late practysed sedicious cospiracy fame souldyours woulde fearynge least paradueture sauyng lyfe yt haue dede lyfe many haue lost least ieopardye battaile fought saturdaye beyng xv daye iuyn yere lord thousand foure hundreth lxxxix towarde thende second yere reigne kynge whiche yere also thomas burchier archebishopp cauntourbury dyed whose rome ihon moorton late bishop ely manne egall learnyng vertue pollecye hys predecessours whome alexander name vi bishop roome created cardinall kynge preferred hym thoffyce highe chauncelour england returne purpose victory obteyned kynge gathered collected prayes spoyles feelde together buryed theim slayne remoued lyncolne reposed hymselfe thre dayes c used euery daye one processyon celebrate rendre humble thankes almightye god tryumphant victory ouerthrowe enemyes dyd execucion suche rebelles traytoures taken felde either battaile chace shortely went yorkeshyre costed country ouerthwart searchynge exploratours preuy enquyries hys aduersaryes gathered theyr army agaynst hym entendyng earnestly wede oute purge hys land sedicyous seede double harted fruyte yf yt possyble suche founde culpable anye one poynte commytted pryson mulcted fyne extinct deathe pthe thirde yere myddest august entrynge iij yere troubelous reigne iorneiyng arryued new astell vpo tyne propre towne ituate heth r part northumberland taryed remnaunt somer beynge sent ambassade scotland kyng iames thyrde kyng scottes richard foxe whiche longe made bishoppe excettre syr richard edgecombe kynght comptroller hys housethe summarye commyssion conclude truce tyme longe league amytie kyng henry estemed bothe honorable proffytable yf myght haue pertyght peace assured amytie prynces adioynyng next neighboures kyng iames scotlande thentent subiectes hauynge knowlege amytie despairyng vtterly haue refuge comforte succoure scottes neighboures circumuosyn adioynyng cotrary olde vsage trust expectacion might tre cotinued faithe duetie loyaltie towardes prynce souereigne lorde ambassadours whe come scotland kyng gently entreteined louyng fassyo receaued fully harde fyrst shewed good hart true mynde tendrez le fraternall affeccio hym selfe contynually bare yet dyd entende shewe towardes kyng henry although subiectes contrary mynde opinyon playnly protestyng declaryng vasselles bothe nature wylfull disposicion diuerse cotrary euer english nature english nacio thinkyng surely part would neuer cosent longe agree englishman accordyng olde vaffrous varietie wherfore least ye offend ministre cause occasio dede frendes scotlad tyme desired ambassadours cosent wt truce abstinece warre uen yeres onely open audience honor promys mely secret communicacion secret concession made priest parte would kepe contynuall peace kyng england durynge lyues apparauntly promysed vii yeres passed fully fyneshed would ue agayne truce vii yere kynge henry lyue peace concorde moste assured amitye duryng naturall lyues dyd kyng iames conclude kyng henry knewe hym selfe actes yea hys name suche despyte hatred parte hys dysloyall people nothynge whatsoeuer dyd estemed regarded well spoken anye pryce suche malicious hartburnynge scottes agaynst naturall lorde ambassadours perceauyng hartye mynde faithful beneuolence kyng towardes master kyng henry accepted assented offre ratefyed thesame returnyng home shewed kyng matter ordre yt pro oned assented concluded whiche tydynges perccauynge kyng scottes good mynde towardes hym apparauntly perceauyng tempestyous stormy ceason requyred yt hys small commoditie proffyte reioysed meruelously hys ambassade came good effecte shortely reculed backe agayne newcastell yorke towarde cytie london waye beynge leycestre dyuerse ambassadours sent charles frenche kyng came hys presence whiche declared shewed hym theyr kyng charles recouered manye tounes cyties garrysons whiche tyme possessed holden maximilian kynge romanes archeduke austryce nowe moued battaile agaynst fraunces duke briteyne kepte ayded succoured territorie dominion diuerse noble prynces high personage realme fraunce whiche treytoures rebelles agaynste hym realme seigniory thewhich chiefe leader lewes duke orlyaunce therfore desyred hym olde frendshyp familiarite practysed betwene would either aide assyst helpe hym elles stand neuter betwene party neither helpynge hurtyng bothe partes lyke cypher algorisme ioyned figure onely occupieth place kynge henry well remembryng although founde muche frendshyp frenche kynges hand necessitie hym partely obteyned kyngdome yet forasmuche espyed vpon vnsure ground querell begonne brytones message well contented yet pleased whiche sawe farre frenche kynges brest hys phi cion dyd vryne knewe perfightly neyther occasyon iust tytle inuade duchy briteyne yet displeasure mynistred hym reason whereof might iustly haue shadowe make quarell duke briteyne onely delate amplifye propagate farther aucthoritie domynion possession frenche kyng counsail knewe well duke fraunces impotent man lytargious sore deseased well stryken age neuer anye heyre male inheret possede hys duchy wherefore determyned meanes easely compasse duchy bryteyne breuely come vndre liure subieccio withoute grounde without cause reasonable demonstracion vncompelled intymated made open warre duke brytanicall nacion kyng henry perceauynge newe attempted enterprice nothyng sounded proffit emolumet callyng mynd consyderynge yf duchy briteyne people whiche euer frendly louyng thenglishe nacion alwaies entrecourse realme necessary proffytable come vndre thraldome subieccion frenche kyng dammage poffite likely ensue folowe determyned selfe aide take parte duke perceauyng well affaire nowe perell set broyle hasard occasion moued therunto kyndelyng paternall loue tendre affeccion whiche duke euer shewed hym sith fyrst arriuall entryng briteyne fidelite alwaye apparauntly shewed durynge tyme hys abydynge resydence parte remembred greate benefyte accepted receaued frenche kynges hand bountyfull pryncely liberalitie thought bothe necessary honest consonant reason forgett vngrate offence agaynst duke briteyne commytted perpetrated persuade aduyse frenche kyng desyste vexynge inuadynge duke briteyne least anye scruple sparke ingratitude might insurge kyndle betwene two matter doubtfull full ambyguities kyng longe consultacion lefte questyon doubte vnasked vndiscussed yet aunswere conclusyon coulde satisfye please hys doubtfull mynde gentle harte lothe offende anye theim whome receaued eyther benefite frendship conclusion fell ful determacion battaile nedes succede folowe duetie bounde obliged denye forsake duke briteyne much beholdyng aide assist comfort powre openly kepe hym wronges iniuries defende resiste aduersaries enemyes yet meane season least parte make high frend exstreme enemy aunswere ambassadoures would take trauayle study great peyne cost betwene frenche kyng souereigne lorde duke briteyne beyng hys indifferent frendes gentle pacificacion amicable accorde might concluded accepted assone kynges ambassadours dimyssed sent message christopher urswike charles frenche kynge first gratulate behalfe victory obteyned vpon maximilian kyng romanes secondarely declare tumulte insu reccion england howe mere force manhood vanquyshed repressed rebelles traytours eyther dystroyed brought subieccion whole rablemt nombre thyrdly offryng sefle meane intercessor peace amytie betwene frenche kynge charles duke briteyne geuyng hym farther charge yf perceaue frenche kyng geue open eare request enclyne hys desyre shoulde withoute delaye resorte duke briteyne desyre contented desyre endeuer self honorable peace concorde rather warre dubyous dissencion peace goddes grace lytle doubted duke beynge wyllyng shortely compasse brynge conclusion whyle christopher urswicke traueylynge thys comissyon kyng henry returned great tryumphe cytie chambre london hauynge victory ouerhand hys enemyes rebellious aduersari whereof cytezens glad reioysed hartely consideryng damage oppression perel losse thought haue susteyned death disturber peace traquillitie kyng late ouercome cleane take away auoyded suppressed also kyng hym self trustyng faithfully brades mischiefe kyndled victory vtterly extinguished brought ash could mery reioyce cause shewed selfe lowely courteous towardes rewardyng promotyng bountifully liberally persones hasarde goodes possessios liuynges substaunce also lyues bodyes defense quarell longe delyuered lord thomas marque dorset towre london acceptyng high fauour olde familiaritie truth fidelitie tryed proued sondry dyuerse argumetes assay pastyme kyng perfyght loue syncere affeccion bar quene wyfe lady elizabeth caused crouned enoynted quene saynt fatherynes daye nouembre withall solempnytie suche high esate degree apperteignyng meane ceason christopher urswike come frenche kyng liyng tholouse louyng frendely fassyon coulde receaued entreteined affone shewed declared message frenche kyng shewed hym selfe outwardly althoughe inwardly otherwyse entended therewith contended well pleased kyng englande shoud meane peace arbiter indifferent betwene duke answere made english ambassadour tooke iorney streyght thece comauded briteyne shewed duke vpon hys master behalfe thynges geuen charge comissyon duke self bene longe sycke therby memory wyt decayed appaired appoynted heare message hys councelers lewes duke orleauce whiche fled thether frauce duke hearde ambassadours declare message perceauynge touched peace whiche thought sounded neither hys proffyt pleasure wherfore beyng somwhat tyckeled message answered sayed e conuenient kyng henry consideryng remembryng great kyndenes humanitie receaued duke hand shoulde powre strength might helpe duke briteyne beyng frencheme inuaded yron fyre bloude attempt procure fryuelous vayne composycion cocorde yea although neither receaued remembred benefyte done duke yet consydre countrey briteyne maner bullwerck stronge wall englishman defence frenchemen yf yt come handes frenche nacion continuall enemyes next gate realme whiche thyng would suffre remebred prouerbe sayth thy neighboures house fyer thy staffe stadeth nexte dore thus muche duke orlyaunce beyng french bloud enemy hys naturall countrey beynge next bloud royal croune fraunce repulsed chiefe estate gouernaunce realme kynges suster put highest authoritie durynge minorite kynge abandoned awne natiue countrey hauynge onely refuge duchy brytayne hys awne sauegarde profyt emolumet spake woordes declared opened wel knew kyng henry therof ignorant neither profitable comodious realme england haue duchy briteyne possessed gaul considering sea costes bothe countreys lye directelye one agaynst returned christopher agayne frauce taried certayne dayes declaryng kyng charles aunswer made hym briteynes shortly returned england agayn whyle thinges thus doynge freche kyng beseged great puissaunce stronge citie nauntes briteyne gredyer hys purpose hast made gayning hys praye moch exhorte ye kyng england letter writynges blandymetes sondrie diuers messenger treate conclude peace vnytie concorde betwixt duke briteine hym fearing least almost wonne hys race kynge henry woulde put hym beside sadle whome halfe suspect backe frende hys prone ready take brytones parte wherfore sent ambassade bernarde scotte borne caled lord daubeney hast kyng henry desire hym wise make ende whatsoeuer warre controuersy therupon kyng beyng desirous thesame whiche rather al thinges might ended peace rather dynt sweard least driuen take parte brytons agaynste french nacio elected emong iii oratours first ihon sainct abbot abyndon ihon lilye borne luke bishop rome collector doctor lawe rychard edgecobe knyght age prudent fagacitie fatherly wyse graue personage renuyng olde amitie commaunded first go repaire frenche kyng duke briteyne whome gaue longe commission sufficient instruccions euer ambassadours proceded ouer iorney ihon lilie fel sicke gowte able traueyle long iorney weightye busynes whome elected choosen christopher urswike iii sayled fraunce thei comaunded communed space frenche kyng concernyng forme peace concorde concluded rychard egecombe christopher urswike departed streight duke briteine thinkinge ye nothing doubting shoulde knyt vp knot finall conclusio ambassade according awne request desyre hope vayne turned vanitie duke vpon great deliberacion consiantly repudiated refused euery condicion offred demauded thinges succeded accordyng exspectacion ambassadours deposinge relinquisshynge hope esperance peace concord sorte good effect purpose reculed backe frenche kyng agayne detrauded spoyled entent purpose hym declared aunswer finall resolucion yet makyng abode fraunce intimated kyng england letter actes exployt letter came kynges hades lyr edward lord wooduile vncle quene valyaunt capitayne bolde chapion either abhorryng ease ydlenes inflamed ardent loue affeccio toward duke britayne desyred earnestly kynge henry yt hys pleasure conuenient number good men warre woulde transport hym selfe briteine ye aide defence duke fraunces kynges assured proued frende least sowe kyndle dissencio ingratitude betwene frenche kyng sayde woulde steale priuely ouer without licence pasporte though man shoulde thinke doubte fled abandoned realme without fraude male engyn kyng firme confidence peace made polletique prouision wyse muencion hys elected ambassadours woulde nowise geue brydle hys hote hasty wilde desire streyghtly prohibited hym attempte anye suche strategeme enterprice thinkynge ode hys honor offende frenche kyng whome woulde shewe muche amitie humanitie might suche matter coulde neither greatly profite brytonnes yet cause hym surceas e appoynted inuasion pretensed enterprice yet lord wooduise hauyng playne repulse denyall kynge coulde thus rest determined worke hys busynes secretly without knowlege kyng went streyght isle wight wherof made ruler capitayne gathered together c ewe tall hardye personage number iiiic prosperous wynde wether arryued briteyne ioyned hym selfe brytons ag yn frenche power nacion rumor thys doyng sone blowen courte frauce whiche made ambassadours englande smally abashed knowing perfightly ye frenche harte prone ready tymes reuenge outrage suche displeased sodainly afraied least commo people coulde withoolde hades quer ling fraiyng albeit lawe armes treuth selfe defende preserue iniury while oratoures perplexite fear daungier while frenchman suspected facte done cau ell kyng henry came new messenger french kyng purdge hymself frend suspected ingratitude certefiyng hym declaring euident token appar argumentes lord wooduile without knowlege consent sayled ouer britayne small number men smal handful neither becomed prince sende set forward neither yet coulde brytaynes great aide succoure message excuse albeit frenche kynge adhibited small credence yet mitigate angre furious agony dissimuled matter accordyng frech nature flatteryng countenaunce ambassadours renuynge leagueand amitie betwene kyng hym xii monethes returned englande againe shewed kyng al thinges either heard sene kyng england well perceyued report hys newly returned oratoures taht frenche kynge wrought hys factes subtyll craft cloked collusion treatyng mocionynge peace concorde desyred nothing much discord warre purpose auaunced set forwarde sayle ower vttermost poynt habilite wherfore kyng henry beyng assured french kynges actes cogitacios determined celerite set forth hand al thinges cocluded cocerning warre britayne haue heard wherfore called high courte parliament fyrst consulted peres comynaltie hys realme aidyng duke britayne maintenaunce warres diuers summes money grauted geuen beside certayne decree actes made vtilite common wealth assone parliament ended caused mustres certayne place hys realme souldiours mete warre put redynes yet least peraduenture might seme willingly breake amitie betwene frenche kynge hym sente diuers notable ambassadoures fraunce certefye frenche kynge late hadde kepte solempne parliamente whiche condiscended agreed lordes temporall spirituall knyghtes couuties magistrate city boroughes realme onely consideryng relief comforte aide receyued duke hande bothe sauegard lyfe recoueryng hys enheritaunce kyngdome also remembryng brytayne auncient tyme subiect vassal realme englande countrey also hath frendly aiders english nacion vexed bothe foreyne power domesticall sedicion aide comforte assist brytishe nacion strength might habilite againste enemyes frendly admonishyng hym either desist hys warre brytayne newly incepted el greued agre reason woulde myndes iudgement determinacion prince prelate hys realme assuryng hym woorde kynge hys armye onely discende duchy britayne inuade make warre frenche kynges realme territoryes onely defend duchy britayne profligate expell intrudors inuasours french nacion whiche miustly occupied muaded brytannicall tytles seignories commaundemetes english ambassadours departed declared frenche king mynde kyng souereigne lord whiche message dissimuled litle regarde bytyng flee thoughe englishman battaile whiche knewe hande coulde enterprice happened dede either necessary feared worthy remembred cause hys saiyng thys knowynge hys army puissaunt stronge britayne britaynes englishman lorde wooduile whome passed litle seyng englad yet sent army thether duke succour iudged surely hys army woulde gyeat exployte dede either duke shoulde purueyed aide ministred imagened folowed frenchman sore oppressed countrey britayne brent distroyed city beseged toune fogeres duke britayne encouraged duke orliaunce rebelles frenche kyng manfully fight geue battaile ye frech army xxv daye iuly set forward came toune whiche frenchman gotten called sainct aulbyne frenchman ignoraunt commyng put theim selfes redynes whiche armye capitaynes lorde lewes tre oyle vyscount thonars gascoyn adryan lorde mountfalcoysse brytones parte cheueteynes lewes duke orliaunce prynce orenge whiche frenchemen horsebacke mistrusted brytones least woulde moost nede flye wherfore discended fote duke prynce put selfes battaile almaynes marshal rieux appoynted vauntgarde middle warde delyuered lord dalebret rereward lorde chateaw bryand make frenchemen beleue great number englishman notwithstandynge foure hundreth lorde wooduile appareled thousand seuen hundred brytons cote red cross english fasshion bothe armyes approchyng ordinaunce shot terribly suche violence sore dammaged encombred bothe party shot finished bothe vantgardes ioyned together suche force maruell beholde englishman shot fast frechmen forward fayne recule battaile horseman rereward french men seyng thys fyrst discositure began flye capitaynes retired men together agayn horseme set fiercely ye brytaines slewe moost parte foteme forward brytones perceaued horseme almaines came forward prouided selfes fled thought haue refuge succour conclusio frenchme obteyned victory slew ware red cross supposyng englishme thys coflict slayn almost englishman six brytones emogest whome sounde dead lorde wooduile lord iames galea borne napels brytones slayne lord leon lorde mountsort lorde pontlabbe many noble notable persones british nacion french nacio slayne xiic persones prynce orenge duke orliaunce taken prysoners duke although next heyre apparaut croune frauce haue lost hys head lady iane hys wyfe syster charles frech king obteined pardo remissio trespasse offence howbeit log kept prysoner great toure bourges berry infortunate metyng chauced ye britaynes moday beynge xxvii day iuly ye yere redepcio mcccclxxxviii ye iii yere kyng henry vii newes brought englande kynge vigilantly forseyng like chaunce thought necessary accelerate mattre concluded wherefore spede sent robert lord broke syr ihon cheyny syr ihon middelton syr raufe hilton syr rychard corbet syr thomas leighton syr richard laton syr edmond cornewall lusty courageous capitaynes viii men well armed warlike furnished ayde assist brytones agaynst frenchemen iolymen warre suche prosperous wynde arryued britayne euen woulde wyshe desyre recreated spirites refreshed selfes litle labour iourney puttynge selfes good ordre battaile marshed forward toward enemyes farre encamped selfes frenchman knew landyng whome knew small experience especially long freshe lusty maner inuincible beginnyng blanke feare kept selfes craftely polletikly within campe sent forth smal company lighte horseman whiche wery fa gate stoute stomackes haute courage english army made diuers place army skyrmisshes outeryes alaromes certayne space vsed thys kynde daliyng wt englishman euer losse turned frenchman bare woorse away reason archer sore galled theyr horsses arowes braggyng incursion sone left done beholde mutacion worlde whyle warre thus set forward fraunces duke britayne departed life englishman doubtfull labirinth great ambiguyte chiefe ruler britaynes beyng corrupted money sturred desire deuision cotrouersie fell deuision emonge selfes semed tenore defence proteccion naturall countre rather mynded distruccion vttre confusion thesame whiche deuision englishman perceauyng also consideryng ye middest wynter whiche tyme wholsome men lye frosty moyst feeldes compelled maner necessitie within v monethes went forward returne backe agayn englande thys charles frenche kynge hauyng thus vpper hand brytones perceauyng maximilian kyng romanes laboured haue mariage anne sole heire frauces duke britain younger suster late dead whiche thoughte neither hys profyte aduantage concluded peace brytones whiche treatie lady deliuered hys possession deliueraunce refusyng repudiatynge mariage ye lady margaret daughter forsayd kyng romanes espoused lady anne duches brytayne whiche meanes duchye britayne annexed croune fraunce shall appere toke effect whiche two yeres pthe iiii yere nowe mony layde concernynge sumpteousnes thys battaile decreed iii estate haue heard englande souldioures sent britayne expence warre euery man taxed assessed hys substaunce paie tenth penny hys gooddes maintenaunce warre britayn money moost parte dwelt bishoprike durham yorkeshire refused vtterly paye either thinking selfes ouercharged greatnes thesame therewith greued excited procured euell counsayll sedicious pe asion certayne persones whiche preuely conspired agaynst kynge put new trouble busines therfore suche kynges co maundement made collectoures gatherer summe taxed coulde get money accordynge extractes commissioner deliuered made complaint preuely henry iiii erle northumberland chiefe ruler northeparties immediatly vpo knowlege therof signefied kynges grace hys letter people greatly grudged murmured makynge open proclamacion haue ben charged late yeres innumerable incommodities oppression without defaut desert houge requyred neither hable satesfie great demaunde yet woulde consent paye one peny sayde summe requyred kynge commaunded erle wyse distresse otherwise accordyng hys discrecion exacte money people copulsion enforce suche payment whyned moost least yt might appere decree actes statute made confirmed hys high courte parliament shoulde hys rude rusticall people infringed despised vilepended rude rashe vnaduised people hearynge aunswer kynge violently set vpon erle procurement symple felowe called ihon chambre whome erle intreated fayre woordes come reason laiyng hys charge chiefe author principall causer thys taxe tribute paiynge hym diuers hys housholde seruauntes furiously shamefully murthered kylled diuers afferme northenmen bare agaynst thys erle continuall grudge sith death kyng rychard whome entirely loued highly fauoured whiche secret serpet caused fury wade farther reason coulde retract restreyne althoughe thys offence great heynous yet ther succeded mischief greater inconuenience incontinent northenme cloke homicide manslaughter violence put armure assembled ockes elected theim capitayne called syr ihon egremonde knyght person lesse sedicious faccious desirous trouble ordred selfes lyke men warre passynge countreys published declared thei would byd battail kynge onely tuicion defence common libertye fredome whiche woulde plucke hys extreme power take bereue fro cause discided blowes handstrokes fury asswaged refrigerate harte heeles theyr stomackes coulde stone euery one wished yt tumult retracted queched al ready smokynge enflamed coclusion euery man tanne awaye way way men amased lacke counsail skatered dispersed diuers place euery returned mattre ended imagened diligently laboured saue life flight thei sought awne destruccio moost parte punyshed death imprysoment thesame offence kyng heryng tumulteous busynes sent forth thomas erle surrey whome log deliuered ye toure receaued grace especial fauour wit fidelite wel worthy copetent crewe north partes skyrmished wt certayne copany discofited toke lyue ihon chabre first beginner rebellio kyng hym self roade erle yorkeshire whose coming slaues sturdy rebelles abashed afrayed thei fled lesse afterwarde apprel ended greuously punished accordyng demerites deseruyng yet kyng hys magnificent mynde er oned innocent rural people pl ged executed ye inuenters mischief furtherers thesame ihon chabre hanged yorke vpon gybbet set vpon square paire gallowes lyke archetraytoure hys complices lewde disciple ha ged lower gallowes roude mayster terrible example syr ihon egremod whome sedicious person preferred capitayn fled flauders ye lady margaret duches butgoyne whiche euer enuied prosperite kynge henry folishe enterprice thus quenched kyng gaue co mission charge syr rychard tunstall knyght man great wyt pollecie discrecion gather receaue subsidie hym dewe people hym selfe returned shortely london leauynge erle surrey rule northpartes perceauynge well englishman muche grudge paymente taxe tribute grone excessyue importable vpon assessed remembryng olde prouerbe loue litle loue longe thys yere lorde mccccxc fourth yere thys kynges reigne tyme maximiliaen kynge romanes whiche haue heard tyme kynge edwarde iiii contrary mynde french kyng espoused lady marie daughter heyre lewes frenche kynge issue sonne called philip margaret whiche affied charles vii frenche kyng hym repudiate forsaken sore offended greatly greued flemynges moost eauntoys brugians kepyng perforce hys sonne heyre duke philip whiche neither gentle request cruell menace woulde deliuer sonne hys natural father lawful parent wherfore king maximiliaen assembled company almaynes ouerlanders greatly put hys confidence brabanders hollander made sharpe warre flemynges whiche litle preuayled fleminges sent frenche kynge aide succour whiche beyng glad request nt philip de creuecure lorde desquerdes commonly called lorde cordes confines flaunders great army men aide succour fleminges trustynge meanes obteyne bothe possession ye yong enfaunt duke philip whole countrey flaunders wherfore maximilian entending allure flemynges frenchman beganne first practise bruges whiche toune grauous men sone condiscended astipulat reason requyringe hym come toune sent hym request scult called peter longoll diuers aduertise hym hys co mynge thither fynde hym conformable hys pleasure request upon trust wherof entred toune finally accompanyed came toune thinkyng lordes senate woulde ioyously haue receaued welcomed hym whole turned cleane contrary light witted person whome peace treason concord venemous poyson takyng occasion theim offred cryed harneys whiche brought kyng toune sawe tumult people man came relief left lord post alone fled corner warden smythes chief route bad kyng take pacience whyle haue gentle enprysonement conueighed hym house ihon grosse iudge audience almaynes banished toune lordes gaut sent taried longe praye espected fyrst diuers citezens whiche thought fauourable maximiliaen beheaded mathew spert one hys chief counsailours trusty frendes sent gaunt put death iames dudenezell iames ii wyse burgeses notwithstandynge priestes religious toune made intercession theim bruges executed ihon capenoll busy merchaunt woulde ha e haue rydden induct french kyng souereigne lorde wh moest parte woulde nowyse stipulate consent yet entended disheneryt yonge duke philippe hys graundfathers inheritaunce e ecucion done wyse sad counsaylers ye newe made ler caused theyr prynce kynge maximilian broughte toune house layed hys charge obserued treatie gaunt bruges concluded wt french kyng secondarely alledged put high almaynes officies great authoritie whiche without assent woulde haue chaunged inhaunced coyne money greate preiudice detrument many ridiculous article layde hym whiche care euery honest creature knowynge duetie subie hys prynce woulde abhorre floccipend whiche wisely boldely aunswered parte asswaged malice mitigated rage much gentler entreated hys aunswer displeas unt menaced one woorde thinke fury woulde haue dispatched hys lyie lande gau toy woulde haue deliuered hym frenche king brugias woulde assent gaunt desyred haue custody gaunt ye citezens bruges vtterly denied hys deliuery wherfore eauntoyes great displeasure departed whose departure brugians content set hym libertie diuers y nobilitie sweare holy sacrament onely pardon forgeue offence p petrated committed flaunders also shoulde sweare promes neither bre reuege thesame thys othe sware great church bruges lord raues called philip mounseur lord beners diuers sware thesame addyng therunto attempt thynge cotrary hys othe promes sware ke parte good tounes flaunders agaynste hym hys adherentes vpon thys promes deliuered fra kly set libertie frederick emperour coulde forget reproche despite shewed hym hys sonne great iniury wrog done hys sonne partely hys dishonour scourged flaunders sharpe warre mortall affliccions maximilian liyng quyet nothyng attemptynge philip mounseur lorde ra ton whiche toke hys othe kyng maximilian shewe warre renouate without hys knowledge assente forsooke maximilian hys lord toke tounes ypere sluse castels thesame hauen manned viteyled kept two yeres agaynst power maximilian till rendred theim syr edward pownynges sent thether kynge englande shall hereafter well perceaue beside foresayde philip onely exacted stirred gauntoys brugians tounes flaunders rebell agaynst souereygne lorde also sent lorde cordes aide hym conquere suche tounes flaunders opinion confederacy lord cordes vntruly reuolted duke charles burgoyne beyng hys brynger vp chief preferrer lewes frech kyng haue heard glad thys sent aide fleminges viiim frenchman willyng take conquere tounes waye betwene fraunce bruges caleys bruges capitaynes folowynge hys deuice beseged litle walled toune called dipenew whome came iiiim flemynges vitayle artillary sent philip mounseur layed siege northsyde toune marishe groude beyng drye depely dyched campe highly trenched trenche layed ordinaunce maner impossible entre campe displeasure dammage kynge englande dayly aduertised doynges whiche nothing lesse desyred haue euglish pale territory enuyroned french fortress perceaued well frecheme gate dipenewe would afterward assaile newport grauelynge cosequently wt force corrupcion rewardes purpose haue possession duke philip flaunders whiche shoulde profite hym hys subiectes wherfore v yere sodeinly great expedicion sent ouer lord dawbeney caleys lord morley crewe valiaunt archer souldiours number men preuy instruccions shoulde laded published sayed came defende english pale frenchemen flemynges would attept mastryes enterprice otherwise tuesdaye shuttyng gate nyghte lorde dawbeney chefetayne army lorde morley syr iames tyrrell capytayne guysnes syr henry willoughby syr gylbert talbot syr homfrey talbot marshall caleys diuers knightes esquyers garrison hammes guysnes caleys numbre two men aboute issued preuely oute caleys passed water grauelynge mornynge tymes left stale kepe passage syr homfrey talbot vi skore archer came newporte founde ye soueraygne flauders vic almaynes commoned paused nyght next day came secretly toward dipinew se ye chauce place execucion nere high waye gautoys come army spye appreheded dipenew led hangyng emongest englishme knew syr iames tyrrell called hym comfort succoure promisynge hym woulde saue hys lyfe woulde guyde theim shoulde entre gauntoys honour aduauntage would first assaylaunt company hys promes regarded request made borough master capitaynes toune perdoned deliuered next daye ye mornyng ordred army guyde conueyghed theim southgate toune high banke set willowes gauntoysses coulde wel espie secretly came ende campe enemyes paused lorde daubeney commaunded al men sende horse wagon backe lord morley sayde woulde ryde tyll came handstrokes deceaued passed tyll came lowe bancke depe dyche ordinaunce laye archer shote altogether euery man arrowe fell prostrate ye groud enemyes discharged ordinaunce atones ouershot archer roase shot agayn bet ordinauce almaynes lept ouer dyche morishe pykes englishman forefront waded dyche holpen vp almaynes set enemy slew toke many prisoner englishman hasted cawsey entre northgate campe lrod morley horsoacke ryche coate slayne gonne hys death knowen euery man kylled hys prysoner flew withstad number viiim men somuch iim came bruges flemysh chronicle reporteth came home hundred slayne sayd place two chief capitaynes george peccanet anthony nyewnhome english parte slayn lord morley hundred moo englishman toke ordinaunce sent newport al spoyle great horsses waye hearyng certayne frenchme ostend made thetherward frenchman fled burned parte toune came agayne newport lord dawbeney left englishman hurt wounded caryed hym dead corpus lorde morley buryed honorably caleys thys felde profitable englishman went forth clothe came home sylke wet foote came home great horsses suche chaunce victory lorde cordes beyng yper xxm men sore discontent ouerthrowe wherfore thynkyng reuenged came beseged toune newport strogely capitayne mo seur de merwede capitayne dipenew gentelmen westflaunders thre principall city flaunders viteyled frenche hoost wel thinges good chepe without shot walles brake many place within sore greued without artillary englishman hurt dixmewe felde might eyther stand drawe bowe neuer came walles one daye frenchman gaue great assaute towre perforce entred set vp banner lorde cordes god woulde time assaute arryued caleys barke lxxx fresh englishe archer came streight towre wome toune perceiuinge englishman come cryed lamentable loude voyces helpe englishman helpe englishman shote englishman shote englishman helpe wounded hurte men courageous harte new come archer stoute stomackes diligency woman fast englishman strake doune enemyes woman ready cut theyr throtes wanne agayne towre slewe frenchman ret banner lorde cordes set vp penon saynct george frenchme supposyng great aide englishemen haue bene come toune sea left assaulte night folowyng coueteous lord cordes sore loged caleys yt would commonly saye woulde gladly lye vii yeres hell yt caleys possession frenchman brake vp hys siege shamefully returned hesdyng englishman glad victory returned agayne caleys yere also realme scotlad suffered infeccious mortall plage name iames thyrd kyng scottes odyous hated disdayned whole nobilitie realme scotlande chiefly perceaued set vile borne vileyns light persones prince noble hys realme haue declared history kyng edward iiii mischiefe vngrate discommoditie thei tollerated paciently suffred smal tyme great grudge displeasour thought expediet purpose welfare euen force armes recouer pristinate libertie auncient freedome therefore makyng preuely coniuracio cospiracy together agaynst prynce soueraigne lorde
