copassed death destruccion yet mighte thoughte intende destruccion natyue countrey made kynges sonne named hys father iames prince rothsay chylde borne goodnes vertue capitayne maner agaynste hys openly protesting purposed confusion affliccion deposyng euell kynge wretched prynce subuersion destruccio coutrey craftie ymagened inuecion might eyther cloke propulse suspicion purposed vntruthe shamefull disloyaltye wherof kynge beynge credibly informed pensyfe sorie carefull vexed sore formeted mynd thys cause especiall haue cyuile dissencion hys awne subiects natiue country men yee agaynst awne sonne beynge made capyteyne vntrewe peruerse company whome next selfe loued fauoured honoured ymagenynge selfe comocyon sounded none effect hed fight stryue wyth mebres partes naturall body yet syde resyst shortly theyr newe incepted entreprice might easely encourage inflame malicious heartes domesticall enemyes boldenes audacite attept farther mischef incoueniece therfore tent make plaster sore healed fyrst apease assuage fury rumour people beyng rage prepared army sent ambassadours sonne nobilitee assembled loue peace concorde quiet ne vnitee concluded emongest also sent letter ye kynge englande french kynge requyringe woulde vouchesafe good godly counsail helpe assaye mitigate asswage furious enormitie rude sauage people incepted begonne thorough perswasion procurement certeine pernicious sedicious persones besides wrote bishop rome innocet thesame matter earnestly obtested desyred prayed would goodnes fayth charite sende one legate rebelles nobilitie charge commaunde settynge aside warre hostilite embrace quietnes rest vnitee miserable decrepite aged kyng thinkynge bothe delaiynge continuaunce time also entreating hartye prayer hys frendes alies would quenche mollefie inordinate wildenes furious rage persuade sobriete good conformite rather sembleable medecynes remedie yonge springyng sore woulde haue experimented tryed cyuyle battaile intestine destruccion thought thing bothe vngodly vnnatural execrable medecyne cousail wholsome preceptes could appease pacefie angry myndes ragynge wittes scottishe nobilitie much addicted bent folye vnreasonable madnes much messenger sent beyng soueraygne lorde made vnreasonable vnhonest aunswer yf would resigne tytle croune realm depose selfe hys royall dignite would comen hym peace el eares stopped heryng entreatie perswasion thesame aunswer broughte ambassadour englande fraunce prince whiche sore lamented deplored peruerse fortune mischaunce frede scottish kynge though bene partaker hys affliccio adria bishop rome legate whome speake hereafter came late saye daye faire nothynge coulde moue perce stony harte frosty myndes nobilitie scotland conclusion met together pitched feclde great slaughter many men poore sely kynge fled myll succoure whether folowed prosecuted shamefully murthered vnreuerently lyke prynce crouned kynge left starke naked lyke stinkyng caryon prynces scotland beynge saciat filled blood slaughter soueraygne lorde kynge thynkinge well reuenged olde displeasure theim done committed kyng iames thirde set vp trone estate royall prince hys sonne named hym iames iiii name tyme haue heard innocet bishop rome sent legacy adryan castella man hetouria borne toune cornere called olde tyme newcastel haue gone scotlande haue pacefied hys authoritie commaundement thys troublesome busynes moued sturred betwene kyng hys subiectes yet man although made many great iourneys came england enformed kynge whome hadde certayne commaundementes message saye romyshe bishop came late accomplysh commission hys legacy asserteynynge scottishe kynge dead gentely aduisinge hym moue one foote ferther tary still englande wehre past twoo dayes playnly certefied bishop scotlande kynges death adryan taryed certayne monethes englad made muche highly commended lawded kyng ihon morton bishop caunterbury whiche good learnyng vertue humanite sawe perceaued shewed hym poyntes humanite frendshippe frende might frende vpon hys commendacion kynge thynkynge thys man woorthy looked vpon mete kynge pleasure muche phantasied fauoured legate adryan somuche oratour solicited cause bothe innocet also alexander sixt bishop rome diligent seruyce loued fauoured made bisshop herford shortely resigned geuen ouer promoted hym bishoprike welles bathe longe adryan returned honoures rome promoted successiuely degree spiritual dignitees colledge societee cardinalles innocent fyrste made collectour england also one vii prothonotaries alexander vi hym one hys priuye counsayll promoted degree cardinall praye meruell aswell maye geue fooles dyzerdes wise well learned men another prayse adrian thesame maner eternall manne profounde learninge knowlege vulgare straunge newe difficile especial manne ripe iudgement electinge chosynge concinnate termes apte eloquente woordes whiche firste tyme golden worlde tully moued men hys writynge imitate foloe moost approbate allowed authours eloquecte taught trade phrase speake fyne pure freshe cleane latyn soo hys example documet eloquece flourisheth houre place christendome wherfore iudgemet woorthie put obliuion purpose vi yere britishe affaire meane ceason discorde pacefied appeased beganne agayne nowe flowe trouble set thynges newe broyle busynes maximilian kynge romaynes beynge without wife tyme made uite frauces duke briteyne haue mariage lady anne hys daughter whiche request duke gentely condiscended one whiche proxie wooed entent lady shoulde performe promysed fayth honour vsed new inuencio tricke maner lady take chambre night affiaunce layed naked bridebed presence diuerse noble matrones prynces called thether witness procuratour deputie husbande whiche represented person layde place husbande put one hys legges bed vp harde knee sight compaigny many noble personage said virgin bene carnally knowen matrimouy perfighte consummate two man wyfe thys fonde new founde ceremony little regarded lesse estemed hym onely studyed watched howe surrept steale thys turtle oute mewe lodgynge charles frenche kynge blame hym desyrous gredy coupled mariage wyth great inheritoure reputynge mariage made maximilian validite effect busely incessantly made sharpe warre skourged brytones thentent might bothe haue lady dominion also hys pleasure imagined kynge englande woulde caste trumpe hys waye impediment hys purpose sendynge britayne newe army englishemen intelligence preuy fautours kynge henry ferdinando kyng spaygne fully decreed aide assist defende duches duchie briteyn al ieopardies aduentures thentent agaynst wil affeccion force compelled submit selfes subieccion ponderous yoke frenche kynge whiche cause two prince ioyned league confederacy resist propulse thys manifest wronge apparant iniurie wherfore sent post hast lord frauces luxenborough charles marignane aud robert gagime ministre bone home trinitee kyng henry peace confirmed whe came kynges presence accepted entreteyned best maner thei demaunded theffect legacion request kyng charles chiefe supreme lorde ouer seignorie duchye briteyne might without spot ingratitude imagined conceaued kynge henry lawfully ordre dispose wil pleasure mariage lady anne briteyne hys ward orphan without let disturbaunce kynge englad alies confederate kyng hery thereto would condiscende still harped thys stryng virgyn whiche lawfully combyned matrymony maximilian kynge roman shoulde nto compelled agaynste wil promes beynge contrary lawe right equitie take person hym spouse husband clerely repugnaunt veritie lawe god man lyngred tyme consumed many dayes vayne argumentes superfluous reason without rquestes obteyned longe debatyng consultacion resolued poynte least shoulde thoughte legacion bene vayne brought efficacie purpose forme league amitie shoulde drawen condicions clause couenauntes farther furtheraunce purpose thoughte necessary expedient kynge englande shoulde sende ambassadours frenche kynge whiche hys name authoritee might breuely conclude finishe league treatie communicacion incepted begonne whereupon kynge henry dismissed frenche ambassadours laden ample large rewardes countrey dispatched sent streyghte hys commission authorite thomas erle ormond thomas goldeston prior christes churche cauntourbury hys orator ambassadours charles french kyng instructing fully thinges would haue either moued determined meane space alexander bishop rome ye vi name whiche succeded innocent man full diligece wit pregnant sent lyonell bishop concorde legate frenche kyng certaine matter emong thinges gaue charge conclude peace vinitie betwene king charles king henry whe declared message french kynge fully easely obteyned thinges requyred beganne moue vnto french kyng hys noble longe prolixe exhortacion make conclude perpetuall peace betwene kyng englande perceaued frenchemen make greate denyall hys request determyned attempt moue kyng hery concente agree thesame desyre peticion toke hys iourney towardes england caleys encountred ambassadours bothe englande fraunce receaued hym toune caleys many ceremony great reuerece communed matter certayn space cocerning affaire busynes departed toward frech kyng bisshop transported england kyng honorably receaued gentely entret yned orator lyonell gaue good eare hys uculent eloquent oracion wherin persuaded many flatteryng glosinge woordes entre league amitie kyng charles fraunce frenche nacion whiche request kyng made aunswer woulde glad ioyous might compassed brought aboute loge trouble pernicious dissencion lyue peace mutual amite christeme bishop lyonel perceauyng kynges mynde intent reculed agayn fraunce spede diligence mete decent bishop concord determined extirpate dryue oute kynges memory olde reconynges iniuries done heretofore plant might hart minde goodly gracious greyne concord vnitie englishe ambassadours beynge frenche kynge purposed setforth article conclusion peace frenchman prudently made aunswer bothe party matter pollitiquely artificially proponed oppugned englishe ambassadours thentent might assente obtayne fewe thinges whiche muche desired required demaunded many great diuerse thinges frenchman side mynding assent one demaund thend denye repudiate thenglishmens desyres condicions sore angry moued great requestes high demaundes meane ceason trustyng coffer cheualry maner theyr countrey obteyn purpose spare disburse launche treasure giftes rewardes innumerable whiche cause conquere crounes gold speare shylde dynt swerde battaile shortely frenche kyng sent ye noble men briteyn great many rewardes solicityng exhortyng praiyng al become subiectes vassal especiall allured enticed moost flatrerynge woordes trappynge termes lady anne honorable matrones lady gouernaunce educacion confirme self true due obedience loue disdeyne coupled noble mariage high mightie prynce kyng charles least perauenture damosell fearyng rigour ecclesiasticall lawes woulde consent hym offending conscience infringyng promes aduoyde scruple caused diuerse inculcate put hed tyttle eare mariage made maximilian stregth lesse efficacy considrynge concluded made without consent agrement chiefe lorde ought haue gouernaunce ouer warde whole duchy briteyne assuring deluded mariage maximilian neuer consummate perfight cause sure concorde peace could concluded agreed betwene two prynces frech kyng long kept hym lady margaret daughter maximilian solemply espoused amboys sayde mariage might lawfully dissolued agayne lady age coulde neither geuen yet taken mariage whiche cause might lawfully repudiate honestly put crafte perswasion led entised fayre mayde suspectyng none euell brought thys poynt conclusion beyng proclaymed diuers prynces briteyne subornate corrupted mede contrary duetie allegeauce content condissende agree frenchman demaunded onely submit selfe french kyng also take make husband reason whereof warre mighte ceasse whiche violencie impression thesame infested afflicted whole countrey mariage agreed nobilitie briteyne helde french parte thinkinge verily auauncement common weale ease trust power maximilian va puyssauce thought veyne efficacy frech kyng composed ordred hys matter fassion preuely lady anne accelerated mariage expedicion diligence possible english ambassadours returned agayn cou trey nothing doen agreed vpon matter kyng henry still paciently forbearynge suffryng till time perceaued playnly way worlde went vnderstandyng returne hys ambassadours frenchman ned none playne guyle fraude deceipte determined peaseable legacions ope warre finish determyn controuersies displeasure betwene french kyng wherfore sommoned courte parliament declared first cause iustly prouoked make warre agai st frenche kyng desyred beneuolent aide men money maintenaunce thesame cause battaill euery man allowe approbate settynge foorth thesame promysed industrie labour could make kynge commendynge true louynge harte thentent might aggraute common people paiynge great tax summes money whome mynde euer kepe fauour woulde fyrst exacte money litle litle beneuolent mynde ryche sorte kynde exaccion first excogi ated kyng edward iiii apereth story therfore consulted frendes inuent howe gather together great summe money published abrode open giftes woulde measure searche beneuolent harte louing myndes towarde hym gaue mooste shoulde iudged mooste louyng frende gaue litle estemed accordynge gifte man maye apparauntly perceaue great common wealth thinge practised vtilitee prynce broughte president matter recorde maye turned great preiudice people ruler authoritie adiudge determyn thys meanes kynge gathered innumerable summes money grudge people extremitee shewed commissioner dyuerse place haue heard philip mounsure lord raueston aide bruges gaunt taken toune ii castels sluys become aduersarie maximilian reason iii chiefe cytyes flaunders ye shall vnderstand onely fortefie wel municions men toune ii castels also gat hauen diuerse shippes barkes meanes spoyled toke prysoners nacions passing eyther sea land mart antwarp brabant zeeland frisland euer plentifully viteyled fraunce pycardy great dammage englishman spoyled dayly taken prysoners thinge maximilian kynge romanes coulde wel remedy kyng england without great coste losse men behoued army bothe sea lande set lande fled sea chaced sea soughte refuge hys twoo stronge tower euer succour bruges gaunt nowe litle toune two myle bruges toward sea calle damme whiche bulwerke bruges hedsprynge sluys kynge romanes oftentymes attempt apprehendinge toune entent brugians haue recourse haue sluys sluysians haue succour toune bruges slayne great number gentleman germany within made signe defence tyl enemy daunger slewe confuted theim greate duke almayne called duke albert vpper saxony greate frende kyng romanes whiche made hym selfe neuter neuer intermitted wyth affayres flauders man lesse pollecy valyaunt hardynes duke requyred lordes bruges might enter peaceably toune accordynge estate certayne numbre menne armes communicate dyuerse matter great weyght small importaunce sent hys cariages herbingers make prouision estate bruges little doubted admit small numbre populous company ye though numbre duplicate especially harde saye woulde lodge toune night wherefore man thought craftie stratageme inuented hys elected warlike company entred cytie good ordre folowed went inquyred ynnes lodgynges though woulde repose selfes nighte went foorth still ordre askynge lodgyng till came gate goeth directly towarde forsayde toune dam distant bruges flemysh myle called bulwerke bruges capitaynes inhabitauntes toune damme suspecting harme come bruges thinkinge frendes knowynge sodeyn chaunce comming haue sent aide succour nothinge mistrustinge let entre take toune damme toune whiche coulde wonne force armes sleight pollecy attrapped surprised great detriment displeasure toune bruges recourse sea stop continuyng doubte toune bruges must nedes fall ruyne vtter exterminion duke albert saxony gotten dam certefied ye king england ye would besege sluyse lad pleased maiestie ministre aide sea king hery wise forcasting affaire remebryng sluyse denne theues trauerse sea toward east party incontinet dispatched syr edward powniges valiaut knight hardy capitayn wt xii shippes wel furnished wt bolde souldiours strog artillary syr edward sayled ito ye haue kept philip mousure fro stertig ye sea duke saxo beseged ye one castel liyng church ouer agaist ye englishme assauted lesse castel dayly issued ye shippes although stode water knee yet neuer gaue enemy one daye repose playe space xx dayes euery daye slewe aduersaries englishe parte slayne uerte brother erle oxforde fifty moo lorde philip rauestone made bridge boates betwene castels one might succour ye bridge englishman night set fyer perceauinge must nedes lese castels force fleminges could aide yelded castels syr edward powninges toune duke saxony vpon certayne condicions duke english capitayne met toune betwene great salutacions syr edward kept castels whome almaynes demaunded stipend salary duke nothynge paye two capitaynes hadled bruges content onely submit selues lord maximilian also paye dispatche almaynes syr edward pownynges taried longe space returned kynge boleyne reasonable ordre would gouerned vnreasonable condicions broughte conformyte ordre vi daye aprill present yere kynge commaunded nobilite hys realme assemble cathedral church sainct paule london te deum solemply songe cardinal caunterbury standynge steppe queer dore declared people famous citie granado many yeres bene possessed moore mawritane nacion beyng infideles vnchristened people late beseeged great tyme donfernando elisabeth hys wyfe kynge quene spayne arragon castell thesayde infideles reason siege brought great penurye miserie lacke viteile necessary viand perceauyng succour clerely estopped propulsed brought vtter despaire aide comforte longe consultacion emongest determyned rendre selues citie thesayde kyng vpon diuerse couenauntes condicions therupon sent hym diuerse senatours citie fully in ructed mynd purpose kyng spayne counsail considering sagely ponderinge wynter approched hande christen hoost long lyen feeldes sore tempestes greuous stormes gladly suffred christes sake whose cause quarel thei made present warre remembrynge also cytie suche ryches fame estimacion conteyned hundred fifty thousand house name beside small house cotages replenisshed people innumerable furnished lxx thousand good fightyng men finally perceauyng might enioye nowe possession thesame without assaulte effusion christen blood aduyse hys counsayll accepted accorded agreed theyr offres xxv nouember yere christes incarnacion mccccxci beyng daye saynct katheryn composicion royall citie granado holdes fortress realme towres castels alpussarare rendred handes thesayde kyng speygne kyng granado become subiect vassall kyng speygne relinquishe forsake vsurped name kyng euer men warre franckly departe citie none ther remayne artificer merchauntes thinges done xxv day ianuary tyme anticipate moore first daye ianuarij sent vic notable personage citie chyldren hostage campe kynge spayne thentent put diffidece mistrust citezens might peaceably quietly hys people entre cytie take possession thesame whiche hostage distributed lodged tentes pauylions spanyshe armye third daye ianuary lorde gutterins cardenes greate master gouernour lyon ordre sainct iames departed frome armye nobly triumphatly accompanied fyue hundred horseman three thousande footemen towarde citie approched nere suburbes issued dyuerse noble valiaunt capitaynes moore makyng hym humble obeysaunce conducting palace adioyning citie called palace anaxaras thence conueyghed hym palace royall thesame cytie called alhabra wherof toke quiet peacesable possession behoue kinge speigne whome moore promised confessed take obey kyng souereygne signe token thei thought harte promysed mouth prostrated humbled selues thesayde great master dolorous lamentacion salt teares deliuered keyes thesayd palace whe keyes also possessed stronge magnificent place first dispatched house moore paganes appoynted garrison valyaunt noble christias kepe defende thesame thesame daye caused masse solemply celebrate place thesame palace called melchita done finished toke possession fortress towres holdes thesayd citie toune granado belonginge apperteyning caused eleuated exalted vpon highest wre palace might best sene signe token crosse wheron christe v synners suffred bitter passio reysing wherof present archebishop thre bishop prelate whiche deuoutely sange antheme ocrux aue spes vnica thesayde crosse iii tymes deuoutly eleuate euery exaltacion ye moore beyng within cytie roared howled cryed prosternyng selfes grouelynge grounde making dolorous noyes piteful outcryes army encamped without citye seynge thynges humbled selfes mekely crosse rendrynge almightie god moost humble hartie thankes kyng spayne beyng mounted horsoacke perceauynge ereccion crosse discended genet kneled doune bare grounde rendred god laude honour praysing noble triumphant victory crosse thus set vppon high towre banner sainct iames kynges banner pitched fixed vpon turret pynacles cytie herault standyng top high towre proclaimed published woordes folowynge saynct iames saynct iames saynct iames castil castil castil granado granado granado hygh mighty power lorde ferdinando elizabeth kynge quene spayne haue wonne fro infideles moore cytie realme granado helpe lorde god moost glorious virgyn mother verteous apostle saynct iames holy father innocent viii togethers aide succour great prelate knyghtes gentleman borne comons realmes coutreys herault finished artillary sounded mynstrelles blewe people applauded clapped handes gladnes earth semed trymble quake vndreneth thys ioye ended issued citie maner procession vii hundred mo christian aswell men woman chyldren whyche bene prysoners lyued bondes seruitude miserable capt wher moost parte naked wounded maner famyshed hungre whome kyng great liberalite gaue bothe apparell vyand money poore prysoners commynge oute cytie sange psalme benedictus dominus deus israel quia visitauit fecit redem prionem plebis sue blessed lord god israel hath visited redemed people singynge foorth whole psalme went churche sainct feith kyng ferdinando caused moost sumpteously edefied tyme siege beynge distant granado twoo three myle poore procession passed hoost one espied hys sonne another sawe hys brother sonne perceaued father father founde daughter whiche nowe deliuered miserable seruitude bondage coulde refrayne brydle selues distillynge teares sobbynge seynge theyr parentes kynsfolke restored libertie fredome whe people sayde orysons churche saynct feith come army kneling kyng kyssed fote criynge one voyce god graunt kyng speygne euerlasting lyfe next daye lord euerus de mendosa erle tediglie kyng made capitayn house royal principal towre citie granado called alhambra hauynge hym appoynted assigned one thousand men armes twoo thousand fotemen unto whiche erle great master delyuered keyes thesaid palace towre porte fortress saturdaye viii daye ianuary yere lorde mccccxcii ferdinand kyng speyne granado quene eldest sonne done ihon prince speyne lord peter medosa archebishop toleto patriarche alexandry cardinal speyne lord peter prynce lyon duke gaditane marque uillena moya erle capre erle uinenna cifnentes many erles barones noble whereof englishemen whose name haue wih x thousand horseme fifty thousand footemen wyth greate tryumphe royaltie entred cytye granado thereof tooke reall possessio season caused masse songe great place called meschita caused solepne churche buylded honoure god hys mother whe masse ended kynge quene repayred palace royall alhambra whiche wonderfull bothe quantite sumpteous buyldynge whyche house adourned ryche arras tapestry euery chambre erle tendiglie capitaine palace feasted kynge quene nobilitie hys awne costes charge kynge speygne remayned tyll countrey reduced good confromytye ordre dyuerse castelles fortress made sauegarde tuycion realme thys victory obteyned glory god publique wealth christianite thesayde cardinall caunterbury declared people kyng sent hym noble thether daye onely notefye declare verite fact also exhorte geue laudes praysinges almighty god deliuering goodly cytye plentiful countrey notable regio hades enemy persecutours faith religio declaracio ended archebishop clergie noble ye cominaltie moost deuout maner wet general processio redring god greate acheued enterprice glory honour moost reueret harty thankes aboute ceason maximilian kyng romanes hauyng vpper hade fleminges aide kyng englad haue hearde entended reuege self ye frech king repudiate daughter lady margaret sent home entedig thought take wife ye lady anne briteyn sufficiet habilite self susteyne furnish warre determined desyre kyng henry take parte hym whereupon sent iames contibald ambassadoure man great grauitie exhorte requyre kyng england entre company societee armes faythfully promising hys honoure would sembleable matter take parte x men least space ii yeres whensoeuer requyre hym chaunce trye fortune battaile intimate warre promised certefie kyng henry vi monethes would inuade occupie territory hys enemy message maximilian greatly inflamed set fyer kyng heryes hart beare mynded time haue hard aide assist britones extremetie perill reconed time come must collect army helpe pynche moost perell daungier thentet restore agayne britishe nacion auncient libertie expulse frenche nacion thrusted blood death destruccion poore brytones clerely duchy country ardently therunto encouraged perceaued maximilian selfe earnestly set bent toward enterprice therfore made aunswere iames ambassadour woulde ashamed foude slacke vnprouided tyme maximilian felow compaignio armes matter well brought effect party kyng dimissed ambassadoure hys presence vii yere thys ceason charles frech kyng receaued lady anne pupille hades great solempnite espoused hauing dower whole countrey briteyne meane brytones became subiect french kyng maximilia beyng certefied fell great rage agony cotent forsaking refusing daughter lady margaret also take rauished away hym assured wife lady anne duches britayne calling vpon god vengeaunce ponishmet heynous execrable facte cryed rayled hym wishynge thousande deathes yet pacefied came hym selfe agayne gathered hys wyttes together thought moost expedient vindicate reuenge hys honour dignitee manifestly touched dynt sworde beyng mynde sent certain ambassadours kyng henry hys lettres desyringe diligence prepare army hym selfe woulde likewise inuade french kynges realmes fyer swoord blood kynge henry hearyng putting diffidence promes maximilian whome knew haue deadly hatred loge grudge agaynst french kyng caused muster made partes hys realme put hys men warre redynes armed weaponed accordyng feates beside rygged maned vyteiled nauy ready set forward euery houre sent curryers euery shyre accelerate hast souldiours sea side message declared came without delai houge army men aswell lowe sorte commonaltie noble men harnyssed armed battaile partely glad helpe price seruice partely buckle frenchman whome englishman willingly desyre cope fight ope battaill immediately monicion geuen euery man hys bande souldioures repayred london army arrayed euen readie set forward wherof cheuetaynes leader iasper duke bedford iho erle oxforde beside kynge sent christopher urswike hys aulmoner syr ihon ryseley knight maximilia certefie kyng redines woulde shortely arryue continent land assone aduertised maximilian hys men ready prepared ioyne hym ambassadours sayled flaunders message done sent ii letter hast kyng henry whiche onely sore vnquyeted vexed hym also caused take thought care study hym declared prynce coulde vnprouyded destitute men armure lackynge thynges apperteignynge warre maximilian laye lurkyng corner sore sicke fluxe ye pursse neyther men horse municions armure money neuerthelesse mynd good power habilitee correspodet therfore trust put aide puissaunce letter bothe appalled made sorowfull kyng englad like prudent prynce well consider ponder ieopardous costly alone enterprice great warre parte desist leaue pretensed purpose might call hym cowarde recreant prynce beside thoughte awne nacion woulde take tariyng home good fauourable parte cosideryng ye syth geuen large money preparacio thinges necessary conueniet thesame might conceaue heddes ymagen vnder coloure pretece dissimuled warre exacted notable summes money treasure payed ye warre done cofers well enryched commos enpouerisshed thys tyme doubted cast perels euery side parte beside litle sory maximilia authour warre absent selfe defraude societe assistece studied mused counsaill shoulde best take suche doubtfull sodeyne case like graue prynce remembring saiyng wiseman woorke counsayll thou shalt repet assembled together lordes hys priuate counsayl whose myndes concluded determined shoulde manfully couragiously perceauer procede thys broched begonne enterprice recordynge well selfes affirming playnely cheualry marsial prowess di icile heard attayne renoumed glory fame immortall vanquisher obteyner therfore counsayl frendes senate made proclamacion euery man set forward fraunce yet openynge howe iudas maximilian deceaued hym least knowynge whole fact shoulde courageous go towarde battaile procede forward iorney therfore prouide forse perels daungiers might accidently ensue strengthened multiplied augmented army numbre toke ship awne powre might discourage ouercome whole puissauce aduersaries thus gathered assembled armye sayled caleys vi daye october encaped selfe tariyng certaine space se men harnessed appareled neither weapo engyne necessary iourney neglected place army knowlege ambassadours whiche newly returned flaunders knowe maximilian coulde make preparacio lacke money therfore succour exspected hys hand report englishman nothing abashed dismayed trusting muche awne puissauce copany yet meruayled wondered greatly heard related maximilian receauyng great vilany loge hand kyng charles present pricke forward crye call moue excite englishman ye vi hundred bodyes put hasard rather leaue englishme setting vpon dayly enemyes deadly aduersaries albeit maximilia lacked hart good reuenged yet lacked substauce cotinew warre could neither haue money men dronke fleminges yet crakyng brabanders vngrate people souereigne lorde meane ceason although frenche kynge well courage replenished men furnished mete trye battaile yet al notwithstading made semblauce asthough desired nothig peace beyng ignorat peace obteined smal valure price yet determined make expece getting peace settinge foorth warre hostilitee regarded muche lesse treasure dispensed acquyrynge vnitee concord asmuche afrayed beyng diligent resist inuasion englishman britones wherof moost parte bare yoke subieccio contrary harte myndes woulde sodeynly rebell set selfes libertie plucke heddes hys colour set vp another duke gouernour thesame tyme inuited desired lewes sforcia duke millayn warre agaynst ferdinand kynge napels whose desyre prest ioyous thinkynge occasion sent hym god longe thristed sore wished whiche kyngdome pretended dewe hym succession entended long acquyre coquere force armes hys right inheritauce rene duke angeou last kyng scicile departed without heire male hys wyfe lawfully begotten adopt heyre realmes dominios lewes xi father iii kyng charles thentet deliuer quene margaret daughter hades kyng edward iii haue wel perceaued wrogfully without cause disheneriting hys cosyn godsonne heyre rene duke lorayne barre cause busily procure labour amitie fauor fredship neighbour roud hym whe al thiges appeased set good slaye home might better employe whole force puissauce warre italy wherfore beyng much desirous haue thinges pacefied set perfite cocorde securitee sent philip creueceur lord cordes chiefe counsailer diliget officer entreate moue persuade kyng englande reconciled made agayne new frende french kyng forgetting message sent letter kyng henry passed sea arriued ferme land notefied hym yt boude duetie obseruauce ought kyng hys master proffite realme woulde take payne inuent excogitate mean waye highnes kyng charles master beyng disseuered amitie made exstreme enemyes onely cause maximilian newly elected kynge romanes reducted brought agai pristyne estate consuete familiaritee doubting bring ship porte desired might stand pleasure sende cousailers confynes border english pale adioyninge fraunce reasonable offres demonstrated proffered whiche condicions peace reasonable ample doubted might hys great honoure breake vp hys campe retire hys army backe agayne hys owne seignory dominion kynge englande maturely consideryng britayne clerely lost maner irrecuperable beynge nowe adioyned croune fraunce mariage whyche duchy hys whole mynde defende protect conferme maximilian lacke money mistrust hys awne subiectes laye styll lyke dormouse nothynge doynge perceauynge also bothe hys people profitable hym greate honour determyn great warre without losse bloodshed appoynted commissioner bishop exceter gyles lord dawbeney passe sea caleys comen lorde cordes article peace agreed vpon concluded commissioner met ingeniously effecteously proceded great affaire agreed amytie peace assented concluded condicions league egall indifferent acceptable bothe partes shalbe declared commissioner thus consultinge march fraunce kynge englande haue heard arryued caleys prepared thinges necessary iorney thence remoued iiii battailesboleyn beseged nere toune boleyne pytched hys tentes toune place propice co ueniet determined geue great assaute toune fortresse suche garrison warlike souldiours valiauntly defended toune thesame replenyshed artillary municious warre losse englishman assautyng toune greater dammage realme england coqueryng gaynyng thesame emolument proffite howbeit kynges daily shot rased defaced walles thesaide toune euery man prest ready geue assaute sodeyne rumoure roase army peace commissioner taken concluded whiche brute pleasaunt mellifluous frechme english nacio bitter sowre dolorous prest ready tymes set enemyes refused neuer attempt enterprice whiche might seme either laude profyt thei great fume angry euel content rayling murmuringe emongest selfes occasion glorious victory manifestly offred certayn condicions man yet kyng commodious profitable refused putte shamefully slacked aboue dyuerse lordes capitaynes encoraged desyre fame honour trustyng iourney haue wonne spurres whiche set selfes band gorgeously forward mutuate borowed dyuerse sondry summes money repayment thesame morgaged impignorate landes possession sore grudged lamented sodeyne peace returne vnthought spake largely agaynste kynges doynges saiynge affirmyng man fearyng dreading force puissaunce enemyes concluded inconuenient peace without cause reason kynge wise man moost prudent prynce assuage indignacion pacefie murmoure people declared dammage detryment losse perdicio many noble capitaynes stronge souldiours must necessitee happen ensue assaute toune especially soo well fortefied men municious toune boleyn present tyme protestyng farther might iustly accused condempned iniquite vntruthe except preferre sauegard lyues hys awne wealth health aduauntage thus prudently cosolate appeased myndes hys warre returned backe wt whole army ye toun caleys beganne smell certayn secret smoke whiche lyke turne great flame without well watched polletiquely sene craftie inuencion deuelishe ymaginacio pesteferus serpent lady margaret duches burgoyne new ydoll set vp flaunders called richard plantagenet secod sonne kyng edward iiii though bene resulcitate death lyfe whiche sodeyne newes stacke fretted stomack battaile set late forward payne without great ieopardie hym selfe appeache queche newe spronge conspiracy makynge peace frenche kyng enemy content accept receaue offre geue honest condicions peace enemy proffred oblated except woulde one tyme make warre bothe home owne countrey also foreyne externe nacions wherfore kynge henry forseynge thinges without great counsayll concluded french kyng thentet beyng deliuered al outward enuytie mighte quickly prouide ciuyle domestical comocions perceaued wel buddyng conclusion peace thus peace continue bothe lyues frenche kynge shoulde paye kynge henry certayne summe money hand accordyng co missioner shoulde appoynt charge susteyned iourney whiche kynge certefied mayre london hys letter ix daye nouembre amounted summe viicxlvm ducates whiche sterlynge money iclxxxvimiicll also yerely certayne space paye cause paide money kynge england sent exspended tuycio aide britones xxvm crounes yerely tribute frech kynge afterwarde vexed troubled warres italy ye rely satisfied contented payde euen tyme hys sonne kynge henry viii thentent pay whole duetie tribute coseruacion stablishyng league amitie betwene bothe realmes shortely kyng henry taryed conuenient space transfreted arryued douer came maner grenewiche yere lorde mccccxciii ye vii yere troubleous reigne also soiournynge besegynge boleyne whiche spake fewe none kylled sauyng onely ihon sauage knyght goyng preuely hys pauylion syr ihon riseley roade walles viewe se strength sodeynly intercepted taken hys enemy beyng inflamed yre although captyue hys high courage disdeyned taken suche vileynes defended life vttermost manfully saye wilfully slayne oppressed albeit syr ihon riseley fled fro theim escaped daunger kynge henry returned england first thinges elected societe saynct george vulgarely called order garter alphose duke calabres sonne accordyng desire whiche alphonse sonne heyre ferdinand kyng napels kyng thesame realme til ouercome kyng charles kyng sent christopher ursewike ambassadour wyth gartier coller mantell habiliamentes apperteyninge companyons thesayde noble ordre ambassadoure arryuing napels deliuered duke whole habite ceremony dewe circumstaunces therunto belonging whiche duke reuerently receaued reuerence reuested selfe wt thesame solempne presence thinkyng apparell inuestiture made frende compaygnion ordre king england whose frendship obteyned feared nothing assautes inuasions hys enemy cause desyred muche compaygnion noble order fermely beleuyng kyng england souereygne ordre aider mainteyner hym agaynst frenche kyng whome knew woulde passe moutaynes make warre hym custome assistece ordres eyther neuer begonne clerely abholished oure tyme haue bene many noble men italy compaignios well golden flese burgoyne ordre sainct mighel fraunce haue bene banyshed profligate naturall countrey yet haue bene aided souereygne co panyons thesame order surely statute ordinaunces thesayde order dothe oblige bynde case certayne poyntes duke dimissed ambassadour rewardyng hym moost pryncely shortely thys charles frenche kyng concluded league ferdinand kyng spayne also beyng entreated solicited oratoures diuerse prince persuaded mollefied stony hart frosen prince caused come communicacion treatie maximilian kyng romanes coclude peace hym season entet might without disturbaunce hys neyghboures adioyninge prosperously safely make warre ferdynand kyng napels italy mynded excogitated charles beyng furnished men armes horseman fotemen nauye aide italian passed italy rome without great laboure wanne citie napels obteyned victory hys returne beynge assailed uenicians toune fornouoe great daungerous victory lyke conquerour great triuphe returned realme countrey hym lewes xii beyng kynge founde oportunitee sawe gappe open inuaded italian agayne recouered agayn realme napels whiche frederyck sonne kyng alphonse longe gotten french nacion subdued conquered whole duchy millayn albei ot long fortune turnynge whele lost bothe kyngdome napels fayre citie duchy millayne together frenchman warrynge vpon italian better successe coquestes parentes predecessours heretofore haue ben accustomed vndoubtedly many place thei vexed sacked murder spoylinge many conclusion enoble decorate blood slaughter small recompece little profited lesse releued robbed spoyled goodes substaunce ryches thys spanyardes arryued italy puttynge flighte frenchemen obteyned possession realmes napels scicile possesse enioye houre length certayne nacion germany called swytsers called partaker spoyle italy wane certayn tounes possesse enioye present tyme warre tumulteous busynes italy terrible sorest plague man remembre nacion person place priuate house noble familye capitayne prynce oppressed either heapes dead carcass bloud hys frendes subiectes el suffred affliccion iniurie detryment insome wise one tyme another euery man tast suffre mischeues apperteyned victory gotten enemyes defacynge blottyng beutye countrey sometyme called quene earth floure worlde chaunced awne selfe awne cause desert italian awne suckyng chyldren opened gappe made waye destruccion tyme thus chaunced potetates seignories italy perceaued thinge vnder succeded euen woulde desire wishe great exultacion reioysinge reason whereof sate still home lyke sloggardes woman accustomed skoldynge brawlyng exercisyng practisyng preuy displeasure malice agayn enemyes accustomed emong selfes one another castinge memory drownynge auncient renoune glory honoure desyre rule appetite reuenged destroyed common weale subue ted olde monumentes actes forfathers predecessor thinkynge selfes force puissauce sufficient inough bring purpose effect reuenge quarell entysed stirred procured giftes rewardes promyses straungers foreyne nacions aide assistence seynge desirous haue helpe partely moued giftes partely desyre rule spoyles prayes gathered together great company entred italy distroyed spoyled possessed better parte italian men wit thought one noye hurte another hatefull warryng destroyed natyue cou trey beynge nature enclosed mu yte hygh hilles mayne sea rounde aboute opened waye straungiers vttre ignominy finall destruccion thei might haue kept daunger bene awne fredes loued awne wealth commodite therfore maye saye progeny aswell wicked vngodly hath discorde dissencion pleased much thou wouldest vtterly extinguishe confoude glory honour thy natiue countrey conclusion thou thy selfe art come depest pyt wretchednes thou perceauing ruyne thou hast caused procured thou arte repentaunte begynninge glad desist leaue accordynge thy desert thou hast thy penaunce guardon grand capitayne beginner thys mischief sforcia whiche tyme ruled y duchy millayne vndre duke ihon galea nephew truthe lewes ruled al duke nothing wherfore alphons duke calabre kyng napels grudgynge duke ihon sonne lawe de rauded superiorite dominio threatened sore lewes sforcia fearyng put authoritee solicited great entreatie procured charles french kyng inuade realme napels reason whiche procurement alphonse duke calabre whiche succeded father ferdinand kingdome napels also haue heard made knight f garter first depryued kingdome thesaide kynge charles shortely lyfe lewes sforce longe ioye deathe hys ennemy betrayed taken swytzers whiche warred vnder kynge lewes twelfth beynge frenche kynge caryed fraunce castell lothes miserably finished hys lyfe accordynge saiynge gospell woo hym whome slaundre begynneth thys mischiefe beganne tyme charles came thether contynueth yet yere oure lord mdxliii example straungers inuited prosperous countrey lothe departe swete sauoure therof tasted yere borne grenewiche lord henry seconde sonne kyng whiche created duke yorke prynce wale conclusion succeded father croune dignitee nowe let v returne newe founde sonne kynge edwarde coniured mennes policy death lyfe first declare hys lignage beginning must vnderstad duches burgoyne norished broughte vp sedicious scelerate faccions false contryuers founder discorde coulde neuer cease quyet lyke vyper ready burste superfluyte poyson except infest vnquyet king england desert displeasure hym committed onely propagate desceded house lacastre euer beyng aduerse enemy lyne lynage cause compassed ymagened inuented cast scorpio bosome infect whole realme pesliferous discorde thentent beyng vanquyshed brought confusion boylynge heate malicious harte mighte fully saciated hys innocent bloude also auauce preferre darlyng faccion empire rule dignitee principally remembring taht erle lyncoln set foorth al copany small fortune worsse successe progression enterprice contrary hope expectacion lyke dogge reuertynge olde vomyte beganne deuyse spynne new webbe lyke spyder dayly weueth hys calle torne deuell prouydeth venemous sauce corrupt banckettes purpose espyed certayne younge man visage beutiful countenaunce demure wit subtile crafty pregnaut called peter warbecke dastard cowardnes englishman derision called perkyn warbeck accordyng duche phrase whiche chauge name peter perkyn yogelinges strength courage timerous harte pusillanimitee whiche younge man traueylyng many countreys coulde speake english many language basenes stocke birthe knowen none almoost gayne hys lyuyng childehoode necessitee compelled seke frequet dyuerse realmes region therfore duches thinkyng haue gotten god foote whe deuell tayle adiudging youg man mete organe conuey purpose one vnlike ye duke yorke sonne brother kyng edward whiche called richarde kept hym certayne space preuely hym diligece instructed bothe secretes common affaire realme england lignage dissent ordre house yorke like good scholer forgettyng lesson coulde tell taught promptly without difficultie signe subornacion besides kept pryncely countenaunce coutrefeare stie royall men maner fermely beleue extracted noble house familie duke yorke surely gift geuen noble progeny nature roote plated sequele lyne stock study deuyse equyualent honoure fame forefather noble predecessor diabolicall duches framed cloth mete ye market ymagened thinges ready prepared co usion kyng henry sodeynly enformed thesayde kynge england prepared puissant army agaynste charles frenche kyng considering oportunitie tyme would ye tyme wished daye desyred acheue brynge passe malicious cancarde muencions alwayes nothinge lesse mynded peace tranquilite nothing desired dissencion ciuile warre destruccion kyng henry wherefore sent perkyn werbeck new inuented mawmet first portyngall craftely realme ireland thentent beynge bothe witty wilye might moue inuegle prouoke rude rusticall irishenacion beyng nature enclyned rebellion reasonable ordre new conflict sedicious commocion worshipfull perkyn arriuyng ireland whether hys crafty witte malicious beastly exhortacion saluage irish gouernours within short space entred farre fauoures seriously perswaded allured purpose greatest lordes prynces coutry adhibited faith credite woordes thing bene true indede whiche vntruly false demonstracions setfoorth diuulged though bene sonne kynge edwarde honoured exalted applauded hym reuerence dewe honoure promisyng hym aide comforte assistence thinges feat warre necessary apperteynyng meane eason newes related charles frech kyng beyng displeasure kyng henry without delay sent perkyn irelande entent sende hym agaynste like kynge england whiche inuadyng frauce haue heard flemyng perkyn litle ioyfull thys message thinkinge onely request exalted heauen called familiarite acquayntaunce kynges prynces diligence sayled fraunce small nauy small smally furnished commynge kynges presence hym royally accepted princely fassion entreteyned garde assigned wherof gouernour lord cogreshal hym parys resorted syr george neuell bastard syr ihon tayler rouland robynson hundred englishe rebelles peace sayde appointed concluded betwixt kynge england thesayde kynge charles dismissed younge man woulde l nger kepe hym men saye whiche attendynge hym fearynge kyng charles woulde deliuer hym kynge englande beguyled lorde congreshall fledde awaye parys nyght whether departed without frenche kynges consent disassent deceaued expectacion maner despayre returned agayn lady margaret first foolishe foundacion duches thinkynge euery houre departure whole yere vntill suche tyme heard hym effecteously desiring knowe whiche waye lady fortune turned whele herynge hym repudiate abiected oute frenche courte greate agony muche amased appalled asserteyned hys arryuall flaunders lesse reuiued hathe steade sworde execucion perdon restauracion hys lyfe degree hym delyuered shewed hys commynge presence receaued hym wyth suche gladnes suche reioysyng suche comforte dede coulde dissemble alone aboue though neuer sene knowe newly cropen oute hys mother lappe agayne trust preferre hym prehemynence ymagened hope destroye kynge henry fell suche vnmeasurable ioye almost lost wytte sens thys gladnes might notified made apparaunt euery man first reioyced nephewes health welfare secondarely much thrusted sore longed dyuerse sundry tymes open audience solempne presence hym declare shewe meanes preserued deathe destruccion countreys wandered soughte frendshippe finally chaunce fortune came courte presence entent open declaracion feyned phantasy people myghte persuaded geue credite belefe true begotten sonne brother kynge edwarde thys assigned hym garde thirty persones murrey blewe highly honoured hym great estate called hym whyte rose prynce englande reason whereof nobilite flaunders hym diligent dewe reuerence dyd pleasure laye powre officies shorte thys poeticall feyned inuencion shadowed pretence sincere veritie faythe vndubitate credence adhibited muche many one thought hym preserued onely mightie powre almightie god conueyghed fyrste daungier faythfull frende kyng edward father strauge country escaped violet tyranny hys vncle kyng rychard whiche vndubitately hereafter recouer father possession kingdome fame bruyte iuggled myracle almoost one momet blowe ouer coutry flauders territory therabouts england blased euery place soner man could thinke deuise coutrey place receaued infallible veritie moost sure truthe onely comon people also diuerse noble worshipfull men small estimacio sware affirmed true coment fable phantastically ymagened deuulgacio rychard sonne kyng edward yet liuyng great honour emongest fleminges began sedicion springe euery syde none otherwise ye pleasaut time vere tree wote budde blossome onely sanctuaryes great heynous offence committed also many falle debte doubtyng brought captiuitie bondage assembled together copany passed ouer sea flaunders coutre cate richard sonne kynge edwarde otherwise named perkyn warbeke many noble conspired together rashnes temerite induced therunto beyng earnestly perswaded awn coceipt though knew perfightly perkyn vndubitate sonne king edward iiij solicited sturred allured opinion al fredes fau oures house yorke indignacio enuye aua e euer grudginge thinkynge condignly rewarded paynes partes taken kynges behalfe quarell whome greued vexed see worlde stande still one staye men lyue peace tranquilitie desyrous chaunge ranne hedlinge fury madnes sedicious co iuracion rumour vayne fable twise borne duke richard deuyded englad brewe realme partakynges seuerall faccions myndes men vexed either hope gayne preferment feare losse confusion man quyet awne mynde braynes sens daily laboured bet great weightie matter euery man according intelligece podering weiyng egal balauce incomoditie daungier might hereof ensue gayne commoditie thesame might obteyned gotte albeit kyng hys cousayl hys faythfull frendes litle mer ayled person beynge hys ryght wyt coulde induce hys mynde fynde hys hart falsely thynke fraudulentlye ymagen suche pernicious fable ficcion beyng onely strauge marueylous also prodigious vnnaturall teyne dead man renated newely borne agayne whiche open allax vntrue surmyse setfoorth palliated vesture garment professed veritee many noble men well perceued toke reputed whiche folishely maliciously setfoorth vnquyet perturbe hym realme thinge true iust vnfeyned sawe farre lynce bright eye newe inuented coment poeticall peynted fable woulde make broyle discorde hys realme except manifestly published openly declared fayned fable sedicious fraude craftye imagened mischiefe persones whome warre sedicion stryfe pleasaunt delicate vyand epicure liuynge ioyous newes beleuinge fraude deceate hid cloked vndre golden tale whatsoeuer fame voice ranne abrode reputed syncere true ope playne thing thinking redounde aduauntage co moditee hygh preferment honoure whiche thinge greatly animate encourage set vp sayles lanchefoorth ower pernicious detestable entreprice matter weighty requyred great aide assistence therfore determined sende messenger lady margaret knowe rychard dnke yorke might come conueniently england thentent beyng thereof certefied might redynes helpe succoure hym hys first arryuall viii yere common consent agrement coniured confederate syr robert clifford knight william barley sent flaunders enucleated duches secrete entente preuy counsayles fre de fautoures new founde duke duches thys message gladly accept louyngly embrace tydinges litle ioyous easely persuasion inducynge heddes thinges spoken duke rycharde true vnfeyned afterwarde brought sight perkyn countrefeated coutenaunce maner fassion rychard duke yorke praising vertues qualitees endued aboue mone thesayde syr robert clifford sene w l aduised youg man beleued surely extracted blood royall sonne kyng edward iiii therof wrote lettre credite confidence england co pany felowes cospiracy put doubte affirmed yt knew kinge edwardes sonne face lyniamentes body lettres came england heuetaynes busynes entent styrre people newe commocion tumult set foorth cause mattre apparaunt caused opely diuulged published true feigned spoken saide abroade duke yorke done secret crafte coulde tell authoure founder rumoure kyng perceaued vayne fable vanyshed oute mad breynes commen people thought expedient bothe sauegarde hym selfe also hys countrey whose hurtes ioyned mixed together prouyde remedy represse immynent mischaunce litle suspectynge conspiracy bene concluded agreed syr robert lyfforde late fled preuely flaunders wherefore sent certayne knyghtes wre chosen picked men warre bonde sou dioures euery parte kepe shore sea costes surely man might passe ouer foreyn lande bey od ye sea repasse thys realme without serche pasporte saue coduyte hym geuen streytes passage pathes kept searched man vnapprehended coulde passe sea coaste make conuenticle assemble without espyed taken thentent many men beyng england place malyce new inuencion enflamed indurate shoulde farther ronne freneticall madnes secretly sent wise espialles cytyes gaule belgique lowe countrey within archedukes dominion confynes thesame searche pryeou e progeny thys misnamed rycharde dissended propagate promysynge highly rewarde thanke suche persones whiche woulde manifest open secrete doubtes deuyses thesame matter besyde thys wrote hys trusty frendes thesame sailynge fraunce deuided seuered selfes euery man lymyte prouynce certayne repayred toune turnay certefied testimony many honest person feigned duke came lowe stocke base parentage named peter warbecke shortely kynges inquisitoures returned englande reportynge kynge knowen hearde whiche thynge kynge also plainly certefyed hys trusty faythefull frendes letter trusty messenger wherupon seyng nowe fraude openly apparautly manifested espied determined haue published declared wt diligent celerite realme englande also partes beyonde sea prouynces foreyn prynces straunge potetates thesame cause sent philip archeduke burgoyn hys counsayl er yet mature age apte conuenient take regimet hys countreys igniories syr edward pownynges valyaut knight syr william warram doctour lawes man great modestie learnyng grauite opely declare yoge man beyng lady margaret discended bsse obscure parentage falsely vntruly vsurped name richard duke yroke whiche long murthered hys brother edwarde towre london commaundement kynge rychard vncle many men lyuynge testefie thinke saye otherwyse thys apertly knowen hyghest poynte degree madnes asmuche probable inuincible reason argument infallible kyng rycharde naturall vncle dispatching destroiyng prynce edward eldest sonne kyng edward brother suertie realme vsurped dominion permitted richard youger sonne lyue continew might next heyre hys brother haue lawfully iust title claymed sceptre diademe royal whiche hys father diuoluted hys elder brother therfore shoulde desyre archeduke prynces cou sayl woulde please geue credite selfes suffre blynded seduced suche mere imposture craftie illusion beyng full vntruthe apparaunte falsehed yet aide assist suche craftye merchaut whiche falsely feigned hys name stocke especially yeres passed succoured releued maximilian lorde beynge sore oppressed almost ouercome bothe extort powre puyssaunce frenche kyng also cyuyle discorde intestine rebellion awne subiectes vassal commaundementes ambassadoures ayled flaunders getely receaued louingely enterteyned archeduke philip cousayll commaunded declare entent legacion docter william warram priest made theym pleasaunt luculent oracion shewyng therin discretely mynde entent desyre kynge hys master later ende hys oracion litle rebuked lady margaret hyt thombes saiynge nowe olde age within fewe yeres produced brought foorth two detestable monster saye lambert whome rehersal made perkyn warbeck beynge conceyued two greate babe delyuered eight nyne monethes nature dothe requyre woman commonly hundreth lxxx monethes brought foorth wombe bothe least fittene yeres age woulde broughte bedde shewe openly newly crept wombe infau te suckyng chyldren lusty yongelinges age sufficient byd battaile kynges although tautes iestes angre trouble lady margaret yet perkyn vexed encombered thinges declared thys oracion especial fraude false feigned iuggelinge brought light opened yet duches beynge therwith incensed quenched nothyng refreignynge olde malice cancard hatred entendyng caste whote sulpher newe kyndled fyre determyned clerely arme fetforward prety perkyn agaynst kyng engeland speare shilde might mayne ambassadours done message archedukes counsayll longe debated whether perkyn true sonne kynge edwarde fourthe aunswered ambassadours entent haue loue fauoure kynge engelande assuredly tyme archeduke woulde neither aide assist perkyn hys complyces cause quarell yet notwythstandinge lady margaret persistynge contynuynge roted malice towardes kynge woulde hym aidynge helpynge power let withstande landes assigned dower might frankely freely ordre thynges awne wyll pleasure without contradiccion gouernour ix yere thys aunswer geuen theym returned agayne englande kyng henry loking circumspectly matter purposed pacefie stormes blastes perceaued growyng rather pollecy counsayll dubious warre manslaughter nobilite woulde therunto condiscende well co sidred one busynes riseth another one small sparcle commeth great flame therefore straight sent foorth certayne espialles flaunders shoulde eigne selues haue fledde vnto duke yorke meanes searche foorth inuestigate whole intent coniuracion waye entended procede thesame sent also allect entice syr robert clyfford william barly retorne englande promisynge theim franke free pardone offence crymes committed promocions rewardes obeynge kynges request exploratours traueyled affaire busynes brought passe thinges master desyre first perfight knowledge name certayne conspiratours agaynst kyng persuaded syr robert clifford leaue foolishe opinion whiche sure grounde foundacion staye selfe vpon albeit william barley coulde deduced hys begonne enterprice woulde go forwarde hedlynge thesame whiche taryed longe deuelish opinion within two yeres thys repentynge hym hys foly beyng reclaymed hauinge perdone geuen hym kyng repaired home natiue coutrey detesting hi hys foolish blindnes whe espialles sped purpose one another stale away preuely feyned duke returned englande bringynge name certayne chiefe conspiracy taryed still behynd accompany syr robert clifforde returned agayne england whose tariynge meruelously debilitated appalled courage harte coniuratours thei perceaued dayly enterprice feynted little little dampnified hurted yet saw man whome might perfightly put diffidece yet mistrust kyng knowledge chief capitaynes tumulte ouerture hys espyes returned caused apprehended brought london presence chief ihon ratclyffe lord fitzwater syr symonde mouforde syr thomas twhaytz knightes willia dawbeney robert ratclyffe thomas cressenor thomas astwood also certain priestes religious men syr william richeforde doctor deuinitee syr thomas poynes bothe freers sainct dominikes order docter william sutton syr william worsely deane paules robert layborne syr rychard lessey giltye thesame cryme hearyng many company taken fled toke sanctuary taken condempned al treason hedded syr symond mounforde syr robert ratclyffe willia dawbeney aucthoures chiefe capitaynes busynes perdoned priestes also ordre sake taken fewe liued log also syr ihon ratclyfe lord fitzwater pardoned life came caleys layde holde behedded corrupted kepers many promise haue escaped thesame enteding thought haue gone perkyn kyng henry england partely greued kyng romanes breakyng promes shoulde haue associated hys iorney agaynst french kyng partely displeased fle mynges principally lady margaret kepyng settyng forward perkyn warbeck onely banished flemyshe ware marchaundises hys realme dominion also restreyned english merchautes repaire traffique landes territory kynge romanes archeduke hys sonne causynge marte merchaundises commoditees realme kept hys toune caleysthe marte wherfore sayde kynge hys sonne banyshed oute landes seigniory englishe clothes yarne tynne leade commodity vpon great forfeytures penalities restreint made king sore greued hindred merchauntes beynge aduenturers force thys comaundement occupiynge beare charge supporte contynuaunce credyte yet one thinge sore nypped harte easterlynges whiche libertie brought realme ware wont accustomed serued customer throughe oute whole realme reason whereof master beynge destitute sale commutacion neither reteyned many couenaut seruauntes apprentice accustomed especiall mercer haberdasshe clothewoorkers yet gaue seruauntes great ipende salarie restreynte vsed whiche cause thesayde seruauntes entendyng woorke malice easterlynges tuesdaye sayn edwardes daye came styl ard london made vpon easterlinges beganne rifle spoyle chambres warehouse could get easterlynges muche withstande repulse theym oute gate whe gate fermed closed multitude russhed bete gate clubbes leuers haue entred easterlynges helpe carpenter smythes whiche came aide water oute borough southwarke strongly shored fortefied selfes coulde preuayle mayre london hearynge thys ryot assembled ye magestrates officiers citie together beynge furnisshed bothe weapon set forward towarde stylyard assone comynge ye mayre intymate knowen ryotous persones fledde awaye lyke flocke shepe howebeit apprehended diuerse malefactours committed theim seuerall prysons vpon inquiry kynges commissioner founde gyltie aboue lxxx seruauntes apprentice one housholder whyche confederate together make attept sworne wyse discouer reuele thesame whereof cheueteynes beginner mischeuous riot sent towre longe continued conclusion none master inuented culpable thys naughtye acte kynge hys goodnes remitted offence restored libertie pthe x yere shortely syr robert clyfford partely trusting kynges promes partely mistrustyng thing knewe diuerse accused partaker faccion conspiracy put execucion therfore perceauyng could pernicious desperate begonne thinge deuelishe enterprice returned sodeynly agayn england kynge beynge certefied coming went streight towre london morow daye epiphany taryed til suche tyme syr robert clyfford presented hys person thinge vsed vnder pretence syr robert clifforde accused nobilitie partaker vngracious fraternitie diabolical comuracio euery person might called thether without suspeccion euell streight attached cast holde go farther wil shew opinion tyme ranne many men heddes knyghtes goynge flaunders men helde opinion kyng henry polecy dyd sende spye flaunders el woulde haue sone receaued grace fauour agayn neuerthelesse like true diuerse reason apparaut argumentes firste attempt begonne syr robert smal daugier himselfe litle noted hys fame blemished also hys frendes suspected gealosy secondarely great fauour estemed kynge tymes past blotted marked cryme offence therfore bearing fauoure house yorke entendynge beginning administer displeasure kyng hery sayled lady margaret beyng seduced brought belefe perkyn sonne kynge edward purpose syr robert came presence kynge knelyng knee humblye beseched hym grace pardone whiche shortely obteyned beynge requyred maner ordre comuracion done flaunders opened euery pointe knowlege disclosed name aswell aiders fautoures inceptors begynners emongest whome accused syr william stanley whome kynge made hys chiefe chamberleyn one hys preuy counsayll sayde ye kyng greatly dismayed greued shoulde partaker greueous offence considerynge first gouernaunce chambre charge comptrolment suche next hys bodye also callynge remembraunce manifolde gratuity whiche receaued hys hande especiall forgettynge benefite aboue onely aide succoure vanquished ouerthrowen mortall enemy kynge rycharde wherefore begynnynge coulde wyse induced persuaded beleue preuy conspiratoure malicio offender cryme openly proued probably affirmed king caused hym restrayned libertie awne chambre within quadrate towre appoynted hym preuy counsayll examined whiche examinacion nothinge denyed wisely seriously astipulate agree thinges layed hys charge theim culpable blame woorthy reporte offence communicacio betwene hym syr robert clifforde cocerning perkyn whiche falsely vsurped name kyng edwardes sonne syr willia stanley sayde affirmed would neuer fight beare armure agaynst young man knew truthe indubitate sonne kyng edward iiii thys poynte argueth proueth hym tyme beynge moued melancholy beare great good kyng henry wherof suspicion first grewe ensued accusacion syr robert clyfforde kyng doubtinge cosulte breath hym selfe sodeyne chaunce feared least brother lorde thomas stanley whome founde great frendship woulde take mattre greueously remit fault abusynge lenyte mercy would bolder offende treaspace highly albeit last seueritee tooke place mercy put backe arreigned westmynster adiudged dye accordinge iudgemente broughte towre hill xvi daye february hys head ryke occasion cause syncere faythfull mynde syr william allways bare kyng henry turned cancarde hatred dispite especiall fauoure kynge bare towarde hym transmuted disdeyne displeasure dyuersemen alledge dyuerse cause affirmynge kynge henry mutuall benefites one receaued wyll nowe pretermyt ouerpasse battaile whiche bereft kynge rycharde bothe hys life hys kyngdom beynge associate accompanied small numbre circu uented kynge richardes army great ieopardy lyfe thys syr william beynge sent lord standley hys brother good company stronge hardy men whiche lorde stanley nere felde great army came sodeynly fortunately succour kynge henry saued hym destruccion ouerthrewe kynge rychard haue heard surely thys benefite aboue benefites remembred kyng hery onely preserued alyue also obteyned croune kingdome great benefite kingdome obteyned neither forget yet left vnrewarded lord thomas stanley inuested swoorde countie darby beside great giftes officies geuen willia stanley made chiefe cha berleyn syr william although great fauoure kyng great high estimacion remebring benefite done kyng rewardes gratuitees liberalite receaued thinking vessel oyle according gospel would ouerflowe brymmes saye desiryng erle chestre therof denyed began grudge disdeyne kyng high fred one thing encoraged much rich treasure kig richard onely possessed ye conflict boswoorth reason haboundance ryches greate powre people set naught ye kyng souereign lord mastre king perceaued stomack began canker waxe rusty litle displeased bothe harte enflamed melancoly bothe loste fruite longe cotmued amitie fauoure often chaunceth men cosider yet regard great benefites exhibited rendre agayne hatred liberalitee breade geuen yelde agayne scorpion nowe returne matter thys tyme kyng thought best ye necessary onely take hede also vse sharpe punyshmet correccio offence subiectes thetent late begon sedicion might soner repressed cause specially person voyde honest feare reuerent dread take courage audacitie feared speake euell kyng souereign lord moost spiteful contumelious wordes though thei neither feared woulde obey preceptes comaundementes expecting dayly hourely arryuall landing feyned rychard duke yorke lately rysen death lyfe knowlege slaunderous opprobrious woordes brought kynges eares caused dyuerse persones suffre condigne punyshmet heynous offence wherby coplices wel perceauyng entreprice prosperous successe toke good effect especially temerariously began make mastries farther seyng preparacion made prouyded agaynst theyr tumulteous commocion frantique enterprice awne swynge pacefied selfes beganne turne kynge naturall liege lorde xi yere death syr william stanley gyles lord dabeney man great fidelitie circumspeccion elected made kynges chiefe chamberleyne kynge thus polletiquely weded euell corrupt harte english subiectes pacefied brought realme monacorde quyet lyfe perceaued necessary also purge clense realme irelad thentent venemous sede sowen planted ii yeres past emogest wilde la age irish person perkyn warbeck might cleane cradicated plucked vp wherfore sent syr hery deane late abbot langtonye man great wyt diligece whome made chau celour e syr edward pownynges knyght army men ireland searche purge tounes place perkyn receaued releued fauoured espied hys affinitee faccion would punished al extremitie terrible example woulde enclyne vnfortunate parte first arryuall irelande called kynges name nobilitee country cou sayll beyng assembled together chauncelour gentle exhortacion requyred first persist due obedyence fidelitie towardes kynge aide hys capitayne syr edwarde pownynges might powre strength agaynst rebelles whiche eyther blyndnes folye elles desyre appetide euell lusteyned aided perkyn harneys menne money euery man promysed openly helpe powre might promysed quickly performed slowely fewe none either aided assisted woulde saye loued english nacion outward cou tenaunce inwarde harte myndes heard syr edward pownynges come persecute al suche fautoures frendes perkyn warbeck man although litle contamynate wyth edicious infeccion fled oute hand woodes mari defence sauegarde selfes consultyng together maner countrey place might best lye wayte infest skyrmyshe englishman el nede shoulde requyre fighte hand hande ireland two kynd men one softe gentle ciuile curteous people mooste rychest best nurtured person dothe many merchaunt men countreys adioyning daily resorte frequent contract bergayne make marchaundise moost resorte thether english nacion irish men folow coutrefeate ciuile maners honest codicios reason ye como trade entrecourse betwene haue learned ye english toug speake vnderstad kynde people vnder subieccio dominio ye kyng englad kynde cleane cotrary fro wilde rustical folish fierce vnmanerly behauior rude fassios called wild sauage irishman men haue many gouernours seuetall ruler whiche kepe continual battaile dayly warre emongest selfes cause thei fierce bolde hardy theother irishme thei desyrous newe thinges straunge sightes gasynges robbery theft rapyne nothyng much delytyng tumulteous sedicion continual strife wilde coaltes perkyn shewed hym selfe first easely persuadynge theim beleue thesame verey person whome falsely fayned countrefeated wherfore sir edward pownynges accordynge commission entending punishe suche haue bene aiders auauncers perkyns foolishe enterprice whole army marched forward wilde irishman yt beynge culpable offence fled resorted theim succoure defence thentent bothe together might hable resist defye enemy sawe purpose succeded wisshed bothe irysh lordes sent hym succour accordynge promise also considerynge nombre sufficiente set wilde people beynge dispersed emongest woodes mounteyns marishes necessitee compelled recule returne frettyng vexed stomacke suspected ye geralde erle kyldare beyng kynges deputie cause occasion yt succoures ayde sent enformed suche bare erle good therfore sodeinly caused erle apprehended prisoner brought hym company england examined certeine matter treason layed charge auoyded theim clerely suche wytt innocencye quit hym selfe layed burden mennes neckes whome kyng dimissed sent hym ireland agayne deputie lieutenaunt kyng like polletique prince many greate weightie consideracions whiche refreyned hym vsynge seueritie extremitie againste earle contrary myndes willes malicious aduersaries one great aucthoritee swynge bare emogest iryshe nacion also condicion state tyme wherin fauoured sedicion bee brewyng chiefely assured hope affiaunce conceaued nowe kyng beyng oute feare battaile dyd take progresse lancasshire xxv daie iuyn recreate spirites solace selfe mother lady margarete wife earle darby whiche laye lathome countrey thinges thus done england perkyn warbeck beyng flaunders although taken great care sorowe craftie conueighaunce espied openly knowen also kyng henry afflicted punished diuerse confederate alyes therby despaire ayde succour hym promysed appoyncted yet determined leaue hope trust conceaued mad head obteyne crowne realme englande gatherynge greate armye valyaunt capiteyns nacions banqueroutes false englyshe sanctuary men theues robber vacaboundes whiche leauynge bodely laboure desyrynge lyue robbery rapine came seruauntes souldioures beynge furnyshed rablemente knaues tooke suche shippes hys frendes prouyded hym departed oute flaunders entendynge arryue englande whersoeuer winde brought hym chaunce fortune dryuen vpon kentyshe coaste see calmed cast anchor made abode sent certeine retinewe lande signifie countrey furnyshed thinges mete couenyet entreprice doubte victory woulde enclyne parte meanes make exploracion enquirye whether kentishmen woulde take parte folowe hym capitayne whiche tymes tymerous afraide awne mynde troubleous season moue warre againste theyr prynces kentyshmen hearynge feyned duke come heard peinted ymage doubtyng space doo whether helpe resist powre last remebryng euell chaunces forefather howe smal profite haue rebelled haue gayned thought yt neither expedient profitable theim aide assyst hym came rather spoyle destroye wast countrey conquere wealthe comoditee thei firmely coniectured none alienes straunge people would take accompte euery church toune chapell house euery priuate man pray lucre natyue countrey wherfore thei fearyng sequele determyned st abide trewe kyng prince fall vpon suche newe come land shippes andwhile thei assemblyng theim selues together fayre promise fredly woordes allure calle vnto theim great nombre shippes geue theim battaill vsyng guyle imposture thei promised folowe fight vndre banner howbeit prolongyng time draue perkyn suspicion wel remebred comminaltie accustomed sagely cosult sodeinly temerariously ronne hedlyng euer rebellion newe flirred comocion wherfore perkyn determined set foote oute ship tyll sawe al thing sure wtout scruple ambiguitee although mynded take land selfe yet permitted certeyne souldiours go land persones beyng prety waye fro shippes sodeinly circuuented compassed kentyshmen one stroke vanquyshed dryuen backe shippes ther take prisoner hundred lx person whereof v named capticins mountforde corbet white belt quyntine otherwyse genyn whiche rebelles brought sir ihon pechy shreue ket londo railed rope like horse drawyng carte vpon arraynement confessed offence executed london tounes adioynynge see coaste wherfore perkyn failyng purpo e fled back flaunders taried consultyng frendes vntill suche tyme better prepared thinges come prudently done tyme veri ceason departed god cicile duches yorke mother kyng edward ye fourth kyng richard castel barkamstede woman small stature muche honour high parentage buryed husband colledge fodringey kyng beyng aduertised enemy made entreaunce realme left progresse purposed returne london beyng certified ye next daie ye lucky spede fortunate chauce continued wet foorth progresse sendyng theim sir richard gylforde bothe praise idelite manhoode people also rendre theim moost harty thankes good seruice done wt faithfull promes forget theim herafter sutes requestes peticions also thei might haue successe herafter partes kyng comaunded watch kept aloge see coastes bekons erected accordyng aunciet vsage custome countrey peter capiteins takyng coucel together flaundres one assent resolued poinct nothynge surer theim procede quickly wt celerite incepted entreprice thei perceaued neither people toune coutrey england would associate theim phantas ical frenesy nothyng mitigated least protractyng tyme longe space kyng henry might fortefie munite daungerous place passage wt souldiours men warre thinge thei heard saye yt neither forgate fors owed beside yt litle afeard yt loge tariyng appalle discoforte preuy frendes wtin realme england wherfore gathered together vngracious copany determined first sayle ireland augmet nober fro thence yt possible saile west partes england yf let obstacle place determined saile streight scotlad knowyng seldome neuer perfight cocorde amitie betwene ye scottes ye english nacio getle coucel dissolued wynd wether serued set vp sayles hauyng prosperous gale phantasy sayled ireland reposed hym selfe space remembryng yt hope victory cosisted whole irysh nacion beynge naked men wtout harneys armure hable cobate englishme wherfore wynde serued hym departed fro corffe arryued scotlad commyng kyngs presence great solempnite framed tale forme fassion folowyng thinke yt vnknowen moost noble kyng puissaut prince ruyne stock house familie edward ye fourth name kyng england nowe late brought falle eyther goddes permission deuine punishement whose vndubitate sonne yf knowe ready powre almightie god preserued yue houre mighty tyraut father kyng edward dyed appoyncted brother richard duke gloucester oure gouernour protectour defendor whome loued studied auaunce promote better thought would loue fauoure tendre chyldren ala infortunate chaunce may saye howe hath trust bee turned treason hope turned hindreaunce men knowe feele oure vncle tutoure preseruer stocke lynage confounder destroier bloude progenye tyraunt blynded glutted cupiditie rulynge souereigntie commaunded edward brother slaine dispatched oute mortall lyfe wherupon person whome weightie cruell charge committed geuen oppresse destroye v poore innocent enfantes gilteles babe abhorred heynous bocherly offence feared co myt yt waueryng mynde dubious doo legth willynge parte saciate blody thrust vnnatural tyraunt parte absteyne facinerous detestable homicide destroyed brother preserued lyke good prieste iosada saued lytle ioas child blude royall commaunded athalia quene slayne vtterly destroyed farther thentent lyfe might suretie apoincted one conuey straunge countrey furthest moost nede comfort forsooke sodeinly think apoincted left desolate alone without frende knowlege reliefe refuge kynge richarde dyd obteyne croune praye mischeueously gotten dispatchynge awaye brother thus escapynge reason tendre infancy gate almost self knewe wel long wanderyng countrey countrey fro citee citee perceaued learned lytle litle state degree conclusion came mine awne anute lady margaret liyng flaundres whiche sometyme maried charles duke bourgoyne whiche ioyfully receaued welcommed yf come oute hell heauen type garland noble stirpe lynage forasmuche beyng dowager ye duchy bourgoine hauyng nothing dowre propre vnto self powre helpe wt men munimetes warre woulde gladly haue done recouery father realme rightfull inheritaunce therefore dryuen seke farther ayde succoure therefore councell aduertisement small handfull men warre souldioures repayred presence succour whome publike fame spred ouer whole worlde neuer man wrong iniurie profligated dryuen oute countrey region inheritaunce extorte powre tiranny kept thesame selfe myne infancie haue bene whose request frustrate repulsed hand therefore maieitie realme countrey desyre heartly prayer beseche exhorte helpe releue extreme necessite yf yt chaunce ayde succour recouer possede father realme dignitie kyngs lynage shall
