obteyne thesame shalbe muche obliged bounde vnto must nedes thynke doynge al pleasure benefites thei yet al thankes geuen great kindenes neuer equiualently recompensed thus saide kyng bad hym good comforte promysed hym whatsoeuer ware yt shoulde neuer repent hym commynge hym kynge assembled councell together demaunded euery man seuerally sayde thynges whych perkyn enucleated requyred whether woulde take farther deliberacion aduyse theim selfes great weyghtie matter greatest experience mysest sorte proue many apparaunt argumentes saiynges dreames fantesies force truthe therefore thought yt conuenient encombre theim selfes lengre consultation another sorte great neyther wyt experiece greater nomber estemed matter profitable common wealthe consideryng yt ministred theim occasion make warre englande although thei knowlege good successe perkyn enioyed al former attemptes yet estemed nowe thynges shoulde succede accordynge expectacion yf cause although yt lyght fether assumed taken hand defended consideryng warre intimate begonne yf perkyn preuayle woulde deny nothynge conuenient frendes helper elles least thei doubted kyng henry woulde make theim large ample offer condicions peace rather kyng iames shoulde take parte aduersary mortall ennemye councell geuen nomber yt well accepted skottishe kyng whether blynded errour el dyd dissimule matter beganne haue perkyn great honour caused hym openly called duke yorke also might apparaunt people dede caused lady katheryn daughter alexandre erle hutley nigh kynsman high lignage scotland espoused affinite caused made ende purpose partly yt might extenuate ye euell malice lyke succede matter might notoriously blasted knowen abroade yt peace amity wt king englad partly least might accused much light crede ce perki foud proued another reported thyngs prepared ordred apoyncted warre perkyn swellyng ioye awne phantasye made scottes partaker thentent put diffidence sequele entreprice encourage theim pronounced suerly haue great succour aide frendes england sent euen farthest part therof assone euer trompet warre blowen scottes although thei lytle confidence lesse trust wordes yet puttyng hope ye gayne spoyle gainyng victory battayle armed theim selfes hast marched toward confines border albeit scottish kyng myndyng rashe mystru englishman knowyng perkyn arryued scotlad army ye defence frontier sent certeine light horsmen espie searche yf husbandman coutrey assembled armure defende enemy horsme rangyng ouer feldes playnes belongyng enemy seyng thinges quiet returned kyng certified tyme moost apte co ent inuade realme set english nacion ye scott kyng marchyng toward england puyssauce first pro med openly al suche pardoned would take parte submit theim selfes rychard duke yorke fight cause quarell thentent appalle danute harte poore common feare thei enforced submit theim selfes newe founde mawmet uell deadly warre lyke men whose nature sla ghter men mercifull impotent sycke person brent tounes spoyled house kylled child allected swetnes spoyle prayes wasted al countrey northumberlad gone foorth farther perceaued aide succoure come oute england attende vpon newe duke souldiours beynge fully laden blood spoyle refused go one foote farther tyme countrey roase euery parte whiche made kynge suspecte army approche wherfore determined rather retourne assured gaine tary nuncupatiue duke vnsure vncerteine victory rec led scotland worlde remember place certein kynde ridiculous mercy foolish copassion perkyn sore moued yt semed hym regarde nothyng commodite another man wile scottish kyng thus vexed haryed poore inhabitautes border northuberland nothing heard torynge wepyng lamentyng newe muented duke beyng returned scotland euen lyke hym selfe wrought thynge wt fraude deceyte perceauyng concurse resorte englishman shewed theim selfes ope apparaunce ministre aide succour fearyng lytle boxe crafty dealyng bagge secrete coutrefeatyng elucydate set open glasse reason wherof floccipended cotempt disdeyg e scottish people though bene theruto prouoked naturall inclinacion paternal pitie thentent hide palliate subtyl subornacion cryed openly oh stony heard frosen harte arte moued yet afflicted wt losse slaughter many thyne awne naturall subiectes vassales glorious sighynge beseched scottish kyng fro thece foorth woulde afflicte p age people deforme deface naturall realme countrey terrible fyer flame hauocke woulde saye beynge ouercome wt perfight loue natiue region beganne nowe haue compassion lament cruell destruccion thesame scottish kynge whiche beganne perceaue whiche waye wynde blewe answere againe sir thinketh take much peyne much imagen howe preserue realme another prince youres thinke would gladly haue mynd geueth farre obteygnyng thesame nere soyle aspect countrey consideryng cal england land realme thinhabitauntes therof people subiectes yet one neither gentle man yoman shewe hym selfe aide assist ye warre begonne cause name wtin realme bothe saye inheritoure people accereited vocated vnto kyng reproued lightnes younge fond foundelyng euery daie neglected lesse phantesied gaue credite nothyng well wisely neyther woordes deedes sequele factes hys promise neither agreable consonant noble inhabitynge north partes herynge clamour commen people perceauynge thei fled aduoyde crueltie scottes sodeinly abasshed fortefied holdes manned fortress ready defende enemy laiyng embushementes ye way thei imagened yt enemy would resorte wtout delay certified kyng scottes inuasion entreprice kyng litle abashed sodeyne chauce pricked also wt awn domestical busines alonely fearig outward enemy also awne noble naturall subiectes least theim would steppe theother parte put hym farther trouble vexacion wherefore assone heard newes considering matter small importaunce mete vigilantly forsene diligence prepared oportune remedy resist withstand ye first brunt great sourge newely begonne sodeine retreyte scottes agayne assuaged englishe mennes swift acceleracions spedy prouisions thei laden prayes spoyles returned home agayne thenglishme coulde assemble together pthe xii yere king truly certified yt scotishe kyng returned geuing praise captaines inhabiting bordures realme whiche duly truly serued time desiste leaue occurre repugne malicious inuasions scottishe kynge yet fearynge least enemy shoulde encouraged indated great gaine spoyles prayes determined ent sworde mortall warre reuenge reforme manifest iniurie apparaunt wrong hym kyng iames people done committed wherefore assemblynge courte parliament declared cause instant warre remedy hym selfe inuented deuised persuadynge many strong argumentes reason inuincible shoulde profite vtilite publique common wealthe prosecute folowe warre mortall enemy begonne attempted opinion nobilitee whiche lesse offended proude bragg scottish nacion hym selfe dyd wyllingly agree gladly assent maintenaunce warre towarde charge thesame certeine subsedy taxe money one assent whole parliament liberally frely geuen graunted whiche payment although easy small yet many comon people euer abhorre tax exaccions grudged sore paye thes parliament also conuocacion ther certeyne lawes t statute confirmed made thought moost necessary expedient publique weale realme thus kyng dissoluynge courte parliament prepared warre hand meane ceason kynge scottes slepinge hys matter perceaued well englishman wold shortely reuenge theyr losse harme lesse diligence gathered hoost puyssant army either might withstand resist english powre inuadyng realme countrey el freshe entre vpo bordres goyng foorth spoyle robbe make hauoke ageyne twoo valiaunt prince mynded nothyng lesse one hurt preiudice theother kyng england sore prycked wouded iniurie committed sore moued scottysh kyng would procrastinate deferre one houre tyl reuenged prepared puissaunt vigorious army inuade scotland therof ordeyned cheuetayne gyles lord dawbeney chiefe chamberleyn man lesse wytt pollecy lesse pollecy hardines lord dawbeney army assembled together iourney forward scotlande sodeinly stayed reuoked agayne reason newe sedicion tumult begonne within realme england subsedy whiche graunted last parliament defence scottes diligence celeritee whiche moost parte truely satisfied payde cornyshe men inhabityng least parte realme thesame sterile without fecunditee compleyned grudged greatly affirmyng hable paye suche greate somme theim demaunded angre sorowe forgettynge due obeysaunce beganne temerariously speake kyng selfe leuyng matter lamentyng yellyng criyng maliciously sayd kyngs cousayll cause pollyng shauyng beyng rage menaced death aucthoures thei imagened myschiefe sorowe whome thei threatened shortely dispatche worlde beyng aroare ii thesame affinitee ye one called thomas flamocke gentleman learned lawes realme theother mighell ioseph smyth high courage stoute stomackes toke vpon theim captaynes vngracious flocke sedicious company although thei perceaued copany accensed inflamed wt fury malice ynough yet augmet encreace madnes thei cast oyle pitche fyre ceased prouoke prick theim forward like frantique person mischiefe cryenge openly pronouncynge shame smal comocion made scottes asswaged ended moment thought poore folishe ignoraunt fooles ye al thinges ended asswaged whe eue whottest feruent thei exacted polled suche great exaccions layed vpon neck especially ye cornyshmen thei affirmed bee poore men beyng sterile vnfruitefull countrey gate lyuyng hardly minynge diggyng tynne metall oute grounde bothe daye night labouryng turmoylyng therefore rather dye suffre extreme punyshment lyue suche calamitee wretchednes laide faulte cause exaccion ihon morton archebyshop cauntourbury sir reignold breye chiefe kinges preuy cou sayll suche rewardes haue thei great aucthorite wt kyngs prince yf thinge succede well accordinge mynd pleasure commynaltie euer referred gratified kyng gouernour contra iwise yf thing done either chaune councell soundeth well theyr eares contrary opinion fantesy laye streight councell saynge haue persuaded therfore men woulde well remembre diligently pondre theyr myndes reward guerdone fewe would laboure affectcously de yre moute high aspyre place dignitee mattre capiteynes exhorted common people put harneys earde folowe theim quarell promisyng theim shoulde damage creature se ponyshement correccio done person aucthours causers people molested vexed vnreasonable exaccions demaudes yf perceaued person espied many dede dyd impugne reproue theyr mad vnreasonable sedicious councell affirmynge hyghest poynct madnes put life hasard thing ought mekely humbly requyre desyre hys prince souereigne lorde called theim dastardes fooles cowardes taunted rebuked theim moost shamefull reproches contumelious inu ccions vnhappy capiteynes nothinge desyred bringe theyr flocke theim selues small perdicion vttre confucion bragges mocyons great part people eleuate encouraged condescended capiteynes moost multytude woulde agree appoynct capiteynes preysinge muche hardynes people thinges prepared mete theyr vnfortunate iourney set forwarde theyr army came tawnton ewe prouost peryn whiche one commissioner subsedy thence came welles entendynge go london kynge iourned kynge aduertised collectours officiers doynges attemptes meruelously astoned especially one tyme enuyrored double warre externe intestyne perell dyd depende bothe great doubte moost regarde musynge mattre asserteyned ames twichet lorde awdeley diuerse nobilitee associate cornishemen great hast good spede marchyng towarde london kyng pe ceauyng cyuile warre approche drawe nerer nerer almost hys gate determined wyth whole powre resyst represse thesame tumult appeased suppeditate would wt expedicion set vpon scotlad wherfore reuoked agayn lord dawbeney haue heard puyssaunt army goyng scotland whose army encreaced multiplied many pycked freshe warryers might better lesse laboure ouercome rebelles also mystrustynge scottes myght nowe hauynge good oportunitie seynge troubled ciuile discorde inuade realme agayne spoyle robbe violate destroye borderer appoincted lord thomas hawarde earle surrey puissaunt polletyke capyteyne whyche taken prisoner ouerthrowe kyng rycharde haue hearde set libertie within twoo yeres next made high treasourer englande deathe ihon lorde dynham gather abonde men countye palantine durham aide helpe inhabitauntes adioynynge borderer driue expell scottes border yf fortune agayne inuade vntyll time cornyshemen beyng subdued pacefied whiche thought easye done might sende theim forsaide lorde dawbeney wt powre army noble realme heard tumul eous busynes terrible comocion came london euery many warre thei could put aredines aide kyng yf nede bee company erle essex lord mongey diuerse tyme ceason charles french kyng returnynge warres yt napels sent ambassadoures enforme kyng prosperous successe victorye obteyned italye gaue theim charge desyre kyng england nothinge muche contynuaunce amitie fauoure towarde master souereigne lord french kyng sore desyred contynue perfight peace amitie wt kyng england without cause vexed combred selfe people italian snare craftie engynes day beyng yere lord thousand vcxliiii successor cannot cleane ryd delyuered kyng enformed kyng charles orator come calys sent certeine nobilitie honorably receaue theim coueigh theim douer polleey make abode tyl rebellion extinct suppressed one woorde therof sounded eares ambassadours commaundement circumspectly kept obserued nowe cornyshmen departyng fro welles thei receaued chiefe capiteyne iames lord audeleigh went salsbury thence winchester ket thei looked helpe thei deceaued expectacion erle kent george lord burgemy ihon brooke lord cobham sir edward pownynges sir richard guldeforde sir thomas burchier ihon peche wyllyam scott great nombre people prest ready defende countrey mischiefe destruccion also bent determined fight combate suche woulde obedient naturall souereigne lord lawes preceptes also kentysh men theim selues partely remembryng commocions haue bene dammage great hindreaunce partely beyng vnder defence nobilitee vnder erle would much come nere rebelles yet either make coutenauce speake theim thentent kynge shoulde wise conceaue poynct vntruth treason poorest theim whiche thynge appalled dismayed harte courage many brute rurall cornyshmen whiche seynge theim selues deceaued defrauded chiefe hope succour fearynge euell chaunce might happen theim thei saue theim selfes fled preuely night awne company copaignios capitaynes rebelles perceauyng coulde haue aide kentysh people puttyng hope awne powre fortitude surely men great strength lesse force valiaunt courage brought theim black hethe iiii myles fro londo playne vpon toppe hill ordred battailes eyther ready fight kyng woulde assayle theim elles assaulte beate citee london thought verely kyng afraied puissaunce minded nothinge lesse encountre armie therefore beyng enflamed arrogancy nothyng mystrustyng fermely beleuynge victory sure handes thei determyned entre cytee london assaute towre wherin kyng thei thought pr uely enclosed hym selfe kynge henry wrought cleane contrary mynde expectacion neuer thought geue theim battaile tyll theim farre domesticall habitacions natiue region hope aide comforte long tedyous iourney weried tyred furye somewhat assuaged fell repentaunce mad commocion frantike progressio lack heth woulde place conuenient purpose circumuent enuyron theim auauntage destruccion dyd dede afterward meane ceason great feare thorough citee cryes made euery man harneys harneys ranne gate mounted walles parte vndefended continual watche kept magestrates citee least rebelles beyng poore nedy woulde dissende campe inuade cytee spoyle robbe rich substauce marchautes kyng deliuered purged harte feare perceaued cornyshmen daye ready fight vpon hill sent streight ihon earle oxforde henry bur erle essex edmond de la poole earle suffolke sir rye app thomas sir homfrey stanley noble warryers great company archer horsmen enuyron hill right syde left thentent ye hywayes beyng stopped forclosed hope flight taken theim incontinent beyng well encouraged manly stomacke desire fight furnished wt populous army copie artillery set forward cytee encaped hym selfe sainet george felde frydaye nyght lodged saturday mornynge sent lorde dawbeney greate compaignye set theim early morenyng fyrst gate bridge detforde strande whiche manfully defended certeyne archer rebelles whose arowes reported length full yarde erles set theim euery syde lorde dawbeney came felde copany wtout longe fightyng cornyshmen ouercome first thei tooke lord dawbeney prisoner whether feare hope fauoure let hym go libre wtout hurt detriment slain rebelles whicht fough resisted ii thousand moo take prisoner infinite nobre emogest theim black smyth chiefe capiteins shortely put death mighell ioseph surnamed black smyth one ye capiteins donge hill draffe sacked ruffian stowte stomack haute courage thesame time drawen herdle toward death sayd men reporte myscheuous facinorous acte haue name perpetual fame permanet immortal may perceaue desire ambicious cupidite vaine glorie fame enflameth encourageth aswel poore meane persones heartes great lord puyssaunt prince trauayle aspire thesame affirme kynge appoyncted fight rebelles monday anticipatyng tyme pollecie set theim vpon saturday beinge vnprouided arraye battaile pollecy obteyned felde victory battaile ended kyng wanted iiic company slayne present conflicte also capiteynes apprehended taken pardoned sauyng chiefe capiteynes firste aucthors mischiefe whome would neither shewe mercy leuyty caused lord audeleigh drawe newgate towre hil cote awne armes peinted vpon paper reuersed al torne behedded ye xxviii day iuyn thomas flamock myghell ioseph commaunded fassyo treytours drawen haged quartred quarter pytched stake set vp diuerse place cornewale yt sore punyshemetes terrible execucions treytorous attemptes foolish hardy entreprices might warnyng herafter absteyne committyng lyke cryme offence certified countrey men beynge home cornewale skourge litle mollefied quieted ready moue againe begynne newe commocions conspiracy yf vngracious euell mynded person would eyther moue pricke theim forwarde turned purpose caused theim set vp london place least suche meanes wrappe self trouble time went aboute witt councell represse assuage domesticall ciuile sedicion thentet might seriously intentifely set forward puissaunt army agaynst braggyng vnfeithful scottes beyng content tune fortune smyled syde pthe xiii yere busines thus handled england kyng scottes beynge certefied espialles none army reysed england either withstad powre destroye countrey herynge also kyng henry noble vexed sore troubled commocion cornyshemen ciuile discorde ssencion emongest theim selfes wherfore thought necessary anticipate warre hand wel knewe assone kyng henry subdued ouerturned aduersaries woulde whole puissaunce inuade realme dominion therfore inuaded frontier realme englande wastynge countrey burnyng tounes murtheryng people sparyng neither place person light horseman ridyng forrage destroye byshoprick dutham burned another company went aboute expugne assaute castell norham standyng ryuer twede deuideth england scotland byshop durham time richard foxe well furnyshed men municions vigilantly forseyng imagenyng scottish kyng assone knewe ciuile discorde vnnatural warre moued wtin realme england would powre inuade harrythe border coutreyes adioynyng land richard foxe called bishop excetter singuler vertues great grauitie made bishop bathe welles last promoted exalted bishoprick durham bishop tyme tyme aduertised kyng thinges chaunced londo sent al po hast earle surrey come ewe yorkeshire collected greate army warlike compaigny earle heard newes perceauyng thinges voyde reopardy made longe ta iyng wt diligence marched forward folowed noble oute quarter northe euery one bringyng many coulde gather defence naturall countrey region emogest whome chiefe ruler leader whose name ensue raufe earle westmerland thomas lord dacres raufe lord neuell george lord straunge richard lord latyner george lord lumley ihon lord scrope henry lord clifford george lord ogle william lord conyers thomas lord darcy knyghtes thomas baron hylton sir william percy sir william boulmer sir william gascoyne sir raufe bygod sir raufe bowes sir thomas parr sir raufe elerker sir ihon constable sir ihon ratclyffe sir ihon sauell sir thomas strangueys many well proued warlike men whiche although degree peregall great lordes knyghtes yet manhoode pollecyes warre valiaunte courage theim feactes equiualent nobre lytle lesse xx thousand men besyde nauie wherof lord brooke admyrall scottes dyuerse dayes assauted beaten castell norham lytle detryment dammage therof coulde make batrye entre thesame determined theyr awne minde reyse siege returne muche soner heard saye earle surrey within ii dayes iourney theim great puissauce wherfore king iamy thought yt small purpose tary lenger besegyng castell rcysed siege returned awne realme earle knewe kynges retourne folowed wt hast possible trustyng surely ouertake geue hym battayle erle entred scotlande prostrated defaced castell cawdrestenes towre hetenhall towre edington towre fulde sent norrey kyng armes capiteine hayton castell whiche one strongest place betwene berwyke edynborough delyuer castell denied affirming sure spedy succour swift aide erle perceauyng denial layed ordinaunce castel contynually bet two clocke till v nyght suche wise within rendred vp fortresse lyues saued erle receaued scottes miner rased ouerthrewe castell playne grounde scottishe kynge within mile siege bothe knewe yt sawe smoke yet would set foote forwarde saue reskewe castel erle laye hayton kyng scottes sent marchemount another heraulde desyryng hym eleccion eyther fight wt whole puissaunce againste puissaunce elles ii fight person person hand hand requyring victory falle scottish kyng erle shoulde delyuer raunsome towne berwyke fyshegarthes thesame erle ioyously lyke courageous capiteyne receaued message made answere ready playne felde abyde battayle hys whole army praiyng come forward puissaunce thanked hartely honoure offred hym surely thought hym selfe much honoured noble prince would vouchefaue admit poore erle fight wt body body asserteining hym ferther yt toune berwyke kyng master hys neyther ought woulde laye pledge gagewithout king assent would put body pledge precious al ye tounes world promisyng honour toke kyng prisoner ye singuler combate would release hym parte fyne raunsome yf chaunced kyng vanquishe apprehende hym would pay gladly raunsome mete conuenient degree erle rewarded dismissed herauldes set army redines abiding commyng ye kyng scottes stoode daye scottysh kyng regardyng offres performyng great crake boastes beyng afraied cope wt englishe nacion shamefully sodeinly fled ye night ceason powre company erle knewe yt kyng reculed bene scotland vi vii day beyng dayly nightly vexed continual wynde vnmeasurable teyne coulde cause people contynue tempestious vnfertile barayne region good aduise retreated agayn wt whole army toune berwyke dispersed army euery countrey tariyng selfe tyll knewe pleasure kyng furtherynge protractyng warres scotland meane ceason one peter hyalas man lesse learnyng prudet witt pregnant pollecy sent ambassadour fro ferdinand kyng speyne vnto king scottes moue entreate peace vnitie betwene kyng england kyng ferdinand elyzabeth wyfe woman none comparable tyme nothyng desyred wisshed coniunccion mariage betwene arthure prynce wale heyre apparaunt kyng henry lady katheryn daughter kyng ferdynand quene elizabeth newe affinitee aliaunce might knyt begonne betwene realme england countrey speine also fauoured somewhat kyng scottes whiche cause offred selfe meane mediatour peace betwene bothe prynces territoires dominion peter hyalas sollicited moued honest meanes deuyces kyng iames assent vnitee concorde wt longe solicityng conceaued good hope growe weighty busynes wrote vnto kyng englad would please send one nobilitie councel associate concludyng wt scottysh kyng kyng england euer yt dishonour hurte detriment louer peace also norisher furtherer amity quietnes specially tyme vexed ciuile sedicion awne propre shepe flocke comitted charge weighty matter richard foxe bishop durham whiche laye thenglish border castell norham bisshop accordynge kynges appoyntement went honorably scotland peter hyalas towne iedwoorth reasoned scottish commissioner cocernyng peace sixe hundred codicions purposed one parte theother loge protractyng tyme much debating arguyng one accepted allowed one thinge aboue dashed whole treatie kynge henry instantly requyred haue perkyn warbeck founteyne chiefe cause tumult vnquietnes perturber whole realme kyng scottes fermely denyed cosent article might sounde reproche dishonour also nowe beganne smel sauour iuggelyng false countrefeatyng newe gest perkyn warbeck yet perkyn alied holy sacrament matrimony thought yt bothe vnhonest vnreasonable vnnaturall betrey alye deliuer death cofusio wherfore reasoned matter diuerse vrgent weighty cause diuerse day metyng yt contrarietie opinion ferme peace could cocluded steade peace truce cocluded certeine yeres vpon condicio iames kyng scottes conuey perkyn warbeck realme seigniory dominion thinges reasoned ye last cocluded cofines england scotlad kyng hery caused ambassadoures frech kyng brought presence theim receaued wt al benignitee shewed stopped douer iourney vntyll time insurreccion cornish men suppressed extinguished lyke entreteinement embraced ceason lord camphire orator philip archeduke austrich duke burgoyne coming conclusio cotinuauce amitie haue english marchautes resorte countrey agayn fro thence prohibited forbydde request verie agreable quietnes tranquilitee realme especially time dyd fauourably graunte benyngly assent vnto beyng confederate alied treatie league wt al neighbour marchynge euery side realmes region gratefied wt moost hartie thankes kyng ferdinand quene wife thei mediator organes instrumentes truce concluded betwene scottishe kynge hym rewarded peter ambassadoure moost liberally bountefully englishman resorted agayne archedukes dominios receaued andwarp generall processionthe english merchauntes andw rp wt generall pro ssion glad toune thei returnyng whiche absence sore hindered empouerished time vnitie concorde made whiche ye yere lorde thousand iiiiclxxxxviii xiii yere kyng henryes reigne iames kyng scottes seynge nowe perc aued howe perkyn manifestly deluded accordyng feithfully promised nowe duly performed callynge presence theforsayde perkyn warbecke declaryng hym benefites comodities receaued princely liberalitie gentlenes gentely requiring departe oute realme countrey might make abode surely quietly vntil tyme fortune woulde prouyde prosperous winde set forwarde sayles purpose desyre declaryng vnto copelled maner necessitee cocluded league cocorde wt kyng englad treatie refuge haue coutrey prohibited forbidden also agreed condiscended neither kyng scottes procurement name make warre king england warre gladly tooke hand perkins sake hauyng sure confidece perfight trust haue bene aided assisted wt perkyns frendes england perceaued al vayne yt wordes wynd exhorted displeased departe least ariyng might detrimet breakyng ye treatie betwene hym kyng henry lately concluded wherfore many fayre wordes desyred hym departe perkyn knowyng kinges pleasure sore amased seyng helpe loked herafter scotland alb remebryng great benefites receaued hertofore scottysh kyng thought self neuer hable requyte deserue might seme hym ingrate wyllynge folowe desyre content intercession departe shortly sayled irelad wife family determynyng wt selfe either sayle flaunders duches burgoyne ioyne take parte cornyshmen howe euer laye ireland doubtyng intelligence certeyne messenger cornyshmen disconfiture plage appeased sore grudge murmoure kynge henry thei prone ready renue warre agayne kynge prynce entendyng forsake faire occasion manifestly offred hauing iiii smal shippes aboue vi skore men sayled cornewale landed moneth september came toune called bodman dyd sollicite prouoke stirre mutable wa eryng people fayre woordes large promise gathered hym aboue thre thousand persones whyche immediately called hym capiteyne sayde thei would take part folowe hym death al thinges obey preceptes commaundementes perkyn well encouraged made proclamacions name kyng richard iiii sonne kyng edward last died aduise iii councellers ihon heron mercer banquerupt richard scelton tayler ihon asteley skreuener men dishonestie honest estimacion determyned first assaulte beate walled stronge townes fortress theim receaue possession seignyorie farther securitee defence entreprice acheued woulde augmet hoost marche forwarde persones durst offre theim selfes withstand hym imprudent counsayll fully resolued poincte conclusion good ordre went streight excetrer next citee coulde approche beseged yt lacked ordinauce make battrye rase deface walles studied weyes possible breake infrynge gate castyng stone heuyng yron barres kyndeling fier vnder gate omitted nothyng yt could deuised furtheraunce vngracious purpose cytezens perceauynge towne nuyronned enemy lyke enflamed beganne first sore abashed let certeyn messenger cordes downe ouer walle certefie kyng al necessitee trouble takyng theim lusty heartes manly courage thei determined repulse fyer fier caused faggottes brought inward part porte posternes set theim fier thentent fier beyng enflamed sydes gate might aswel exclude enemy entryng include citezens fro ronnyng fliyng thei meane ceason might make trench rapayres defende enemy stede gate bulwerkes thus doynges attemptes rebellious people euell successe first entreprice thus fyer citee preserued flame burnynge perkyn beyng necessitee compelled leaue gate assaulted toune diuerse weake vnfortefied place set vp laders attempting clime ouer walles take cytee thinkyng suerly compell cytezens either feare lacke succoure rendre theim selfes yelde toune cytezens nothing mynded courageously lyke valaut chapions defended walles slewe aboue iic sedicious souldiours assaute assone messenger excetter came kyngs presence shewed instruccions hasted hoost towarde excetter wt asmuch hast grauitie cause requyre expostulate sent lord daw eney light horsmen certefie men commyng hand meane ceason lord edward corteney rle deuou hire lord william sonne man great force valiantnes accompanied sir edmond carewe sir thomas trenchard sir william courteney sir thomas fulforde sir ihon halewel sir iho croker water courteney peter egecobe willia setuaure spede came cytee excetter holpe citezens last assaute erle hurte arme arowe many company fewe slayne perkyn lewde capiteyns sawe citee excetter well fortefied bothe men municions theim maner impregnable fearynge sequele matter departed excetter lowsy army next great toune called tawnton xx daye september mustered men though ready fight nober sore minished ore nedy people sawe great defence whiche made excetter men honour yet honestie drewe hym contrary promes assuraunce made hym coucelers theim begynnyng drewe theim selfes sondry secret compaignyes prouidyng awne sauegarde thinge perkyn perceaued put small trust lesse confidence remnant army afterward dyd appere moost parte souldioures harnessed right arme naked body neuer exercised warre marciall feates spade shouell kynge heard gone tawnton hastened al spede thether came kyng edward duke buckyngham younge prince greate courage synguler good witt folowed great compaignie noble men knightes esquyers prepared redy thinges necessary felde battayle emongest nomber sir alexader baynam sir mawrice berkeley sir robert tame sir ihon guyse sir robert poyntz sir hery uernon sir ihon mortimer sir thomas tremayle sir edward sutton sir amise pawlett sir ihon byckenel sir ihon sapcotes sir hugh lutterell sir fraunces cheyney many knyghtes esquyers valyaunte personage kynge approched nere toune tawnton whether woulde de erre put battayle whether doubtynge turne fortune whele sent hym robert lord brooke lord stuarde house gyles lord dawbeney chiefe chamberlayn sir rice app thomas set enemy begynne battaile powre folowed thentent army couped ioyned together either wt newe succour refreshe awne army elles set backe enemy coulde espie hym albey kyng great nede vse suche pollecy yf knowen sequele ensued assone perkyn enformed enemy ready geue battayle nothynge lesse mynded fight open felde kynges puissaunce dissimuled day time wt company though nothyng coulde make afeard aboute mydnight beyng accompanyed lx horsmen departed fro tawnton poste sanctuary toune besyde southhampton called beaud ley ihon heron registred theim selfes persones priuileged whether perkyn dyd feare least men shoulde forsake hym cowardenes awne tymorous courage asmuch vncerteyne probable sure kynge tooke hys flight greate commoditee quietnes reason enforced fight cornysh men whose hart courage encreased inflamed deadly desperacion earnestly determined stedfastly bent either winne victory ouercome enemy lles one theim lyue daye houre lenger kyng henry knew perkyn fled departed sent lord dawbeney wt vc horsme toward see side intercept come perkin whome matter touched quick made haste swiftnes horse sharpenes spurres farre passed way person could tell tydynges regestred disclosed hym self sanc uarye hys chiefe capiteines whiche fled coulde craftely escape moost parte theim apprehended capitues wretch miserably presented kynge resydewe common people could neyther see perkyn yet standard guyd home capiteynes knowynge become doubtyng whether fraudulently slayn fearfully fled wist councell aske waye moost surest folowe take thei asserteined moost shamefull flight euery person oppressed common mischiefe common feare common perell castyng awaye armure submitted theim selfes kyng holdyng vp handes askyng mercy offeryng promisynge hym faythe loyaltie obeysaunce whome kynge moost gentle heart leuytee graunted perdon receaued theim hys fauoure kynge b ynge conquerour withoute manslaughter effusion christen blood roade triumphantly cytee excetter lauded preised cytezes excetter also redred theim moost hartie thakes aswell duety done valiauntnes also afflicted put execusyo diuerse cornishman aucthoures sturrers vp newe insurreccion false conspiracy horsmen yt sent wtout stoppe obstacle shorte space came saint mighelles mounte chaunce founde lady katheryn gorden wife perkyn brought streight lyke bondewoman captyue kyng kyng wonderyng beautie amyable countenaunce thought praye mete chiefe capitaine meane souldioures beganne lytle phantasie person sent incontinently accompanied wt goodly sorte sad atrones gentlewome youge woman london quene true vndoubted token hys triumphe victory reposed hym selfe excetter iudged nothyng wonne yet plucked vp roote sedicious rebellion excepte coulde get possession chiefe h type pestiferous faccion busynes wherfore enuyroned sanctuary whiche perkyn rounde aboute ii compaignies light horseman well wytted vigelant person thentent bereue plucke perkyn hope flight capynge awaye attempted younge foundelyng trusty polletique messenger yf hauyng perdon remission mischeuous heinous offence done kyng realme woulde gladly submyt hym selfe kynge hym feithfull true obedient perkyn beynge nowe destitute hope faylynge dwellynge place lacking comforte aide refuge considerynge nowe brought verie poyncte pricke extremytee wist whether howe fly countrey succour also vttre despayre haue herafter prosperous chaunce fortunate successe enterprice often attempted many time defoyled vanquished wherefore hauyng perdon hym offred trustynge ope promes awne franckly frely departed sanctuary committed hym selfe kynges pleasure meanes great heate quenched appeased kyng verey glad warre ended toke iourney imediatly towarde london withoute great concurse people metynge hym oute euery quarter see perkyn monstre beynge alien abilitee poore parentes although yt wise talked dissimuled durst inuade noble realme yt infecte suche lye lesynges chiefly al crafty subornacions persuaded diuerse aswell noble ignoble without cofusion vndoyng many theim beleue saye thesame verey person feigned peynted hym selfe bee kynge come london appoyncted certeyne kepers attende whiche shoulde breadth nayle go person thentent mighte neyther conueigh hym selfe oute land flye whether yet prouoked procured shoulde hable agayne newe sedicion sedicious tumult within realme countreyes tidynges came lady margarete flauders perkin dere darlyng good lucke losse bothe entreprice great studious furtheraunce brought captiuitee well pleased theim wepte lamented hys vnlucky spede cursed infortunate chaunce thinges brought passe accordynge kynges mynde dyd forget delectable pleasaunt thinge larger reyne mischiefe geuen vulgare people haue sure hope trust thei maye offende wtout punishment corr ccion wherfore thentet herafter obserue people dewe obeysaunce filiall subieccion shortly caused inquyries made diuerse offence wherupon diuerse persones aswel merset shire deuonshire accused presented aided wt mony cornysh treytours dis ofiture returnyng homeward also marchyng forward entedyng make battaile kyng beyng souereigne liege lord offeders determined plague skourge according qua titee crime offece wt great fine sore assesmetes therfore comitted charge thomas lord dar amis paulet knight robert sherborne deane paules afte bishop chechester comissioners like whirlewynde tossed perced cofers substauce althe inhabitauntes countres thentent person beyng embrued spotted wt ynk abhominable crime shoulde escape peyne whiche worthly deserued gentle remisse great nobre specially offended cohercion feare rather malicious heart uio mynde yet thei none fauourable thei thought defaultes worthy punishmet equite therin wel ius ly executed pthe xiiii yere yere sod yne chaunce ye thinge moment worthy regarded almost kyndeled agayne olde displea ure grudge betwene kyng henry kyng iames etlad thei could scace kepe hades bridle courage warre fightynge first mocion displeasure thus certeine young men scottes came armed vnto norha castel behelde woderous circumspectly though thei bene desyrous knowe done wtin kepers castel could perceaue ho ilitee dammage towardes seyng theim departe awne accorde determined coueniet mo e questio theim stirre oute whe thei came agayn next daye viewed likewyse kepers thesaide castel suspectynge fraude lurcke lookynge demaunded theim entent vewed aduised castel scottes euen like theim selfes aunswered theim proudly rustically many disdeynfull woordes insomuch blusteryng blowyng aunswers made thenglishmen beyng vexed moued ther al replied theim hard manly stroke many sore blowe geuen taken partes diuerse scottes wounded slayne scottes oppressed wt multitude thenglish people fled fast horse would carye theim came home certified kyng thesame therewith sore moued angry sware swete sainct ninyan nothyng inconstant vnstedfast obseruyng league kyng england sent woorde king henry hast marchemount heraulde kyng england nothynge embraced desyred quyet tranquilitee perfighte loue amitie prynces beynge neyghboures borderer thentent might lyue later dayes honest quyet lyfe many labou e vexacions euen infancye drawen exercised made hym aunswere done defaulte neither councell knowledge rather temerarious folly kepers castell requyrynge cause thinke league infringed promisyng woorde kyng enquyer truth malefactoures offence founde begone partie kepers castell assured hym mede fauoure eskape peyne punishement aunswere although reasonable could mittigate assuage scottes angre outrageousnes cause rycharde bishop durham heauy discorde renued agayne betwene twoo prynces occasion castell kepers therfore thought yt best first assuage coole furious rage skottyshe kynge wrote many letter hym requyrynge hym peace vnitie kynge perceauynge bothe good constant grauytie bishop appeased fury aunswered gentely bishop letter writynge agayne hym saiyng many secret preuy thinges mynde would communicate touching cause nowe variaunce therfore requyred hym take peyne come countrey trustyng thynke labour well bestowed byshop glad sent woorde kynge master kyng iames desyre estemed request cause bothe iust reasonable therfore willed hym accomplishe ye scottish kynges honest desyre came scotland receaued humanitee coulde thought kyng selfe abbey called mellrose kynge countenaunce complayned muche crueltie aughter vsed towardes hys men late norham asely remitted offence perdoned began secretly comen without witness arbitters nere hand bishop alone first declared olde uste cause haue moued seke al auce amitie kyng henry whiche desyred muche haue confirmed cor oborate farther mayntenaunce loue encrease frendship thing doubted shoulde sorte ortunate effect good coclusion ye kyng england would vouchsafe geue matrimony first begotte daughter lady margaret vpo point determined log agone sende amba sadors englad thing would soner knew bishop mynd entet ready louing purpose bishop auswered fewe wordes sauing returned king master would best ye matter yt laye powre wordes animated much kyng put good hope sende oratours kyng england sue thesaide matrimony concluded bishop taken leaue come king declared ordre comunicacio betwene king iames request pleased king much whome peace euer souereygn cordiall determined su ely minister casio warre man woulde haue prynce prouoke hym thesame began fatall daye death perkyn warbeck edward erle warwicke approche facte done comitted one fierce strog waue deuoured swalowed lyues long asonder shal heare ye cotinuaci story perkyn whether greued kept inwarde el in igated en ised olde fredes sturre cole begin new sedicious faccio least woulde wilfully wast cast away selfe studied escape flye away hauing perfight hope fynd occasio bring al thi ge wel passe could coueigh selfe englishman handes although ignoraut neither coulde ymagyn thing kyng woulde bothe heare knowe yet seduced wt hope euasion skapyng whiche chiefe coforte captiuitie leuer put thinges profe hasarde rather leger tollerate suffre present calamyte dayly misery deceauyng kepers toke heeles brought selfe streyghter custody pryson wrapped selfe torture punyshmentes came sea coastes gone litle forwarde iourney rumour flight spreade abroade euery byway lane set abroade kinges garde custody body wherefore beyng sore abashed wtthe clamour searched made inquyrie beyng maner destitute wit counsail altered necessite fro pretensed iourney came house bethlem called ye priory shene beside rychemod southrey comitted sel e pryor ye monastery requyring godssake aske desire life perdo kynges maiestie pryor hys verteous quality great estimacion moued calamytie infortunate state thys man came kynge shewed hym perkyn whose perdon humbly craued franckely obteyned incontinent thys perkyn brought court agayne westmynster many curse reproche one daye set fettered payre stockes dore westmynster hall stoode whole daye without innumerable reproches mockes skorninges next day caryed thorough london set vpon lyke skaffolde chepe stadard like gynne stockes occupyed daye stode al daye red openly awne confession written hys awne hande copy wherof hereafter ensueth first knowen borne toune turney flaunders father name ihon o eck sayd ihon osbeck coptroller thesayde toune turney mother name katheryn de faro one grauntsires vpon father side named diryck osbeck dyed whose death grauntmother maryed vnto withinnamed peter flame receauer forenamed toune turney deane botemen towe vpon water ryuer called leschelde grautsire vpon mother side peter de faro whiche hys kepyng ye keyes gate sainct ihons wtin thesame toune turney also vncle called master ihon stalyn dwelling parish sainct pya within thesame toune maried father suster whose name ione iane whome dwelled certain ceaso afterward led mother andwerp learne flemishe house cousyn myne officier thesaid toune called iho stie beck wt space halfe yere returned agayn turney reason warres flauders wtin yere folowing sent wt merchaut sayd toune turney named berlo master name alexader marte andwarpe fell sycke whiche sickenes contynued vpon fyue monethes thesayde barlo set boorde skynners house dwelled besyde house englishe nacion hym thence caryed barowe marte lodged signe olde man abode space twoo monethes sayde barlo set merchaunt middelboroughe seruyce learne language whose name ihon strewe dwelled frome christmas tyll easter went portyngale companye syr edwarde bramptones wyfe shyppe whyche called quenes shippe come thether put seruyce knyghte dwelled lushborne whiche called peter ua z de cogna whome dwelled whole yere whiche sayde knyght one eye desyred see countryes toke lycence hym put selfe seruice bryton called pregent meno brought ireland arriued toune corke toune arayed clothes sylke sayde maistres came vnto threped vpo ye duke clarece sonne tyme deuelyn forasmuch denied brought vnto ye holy eua gelist crosse ye mayre toune called ihon le wellen ye presence toke myne othe ye truth foresaid duke sonne none hys blood came vnto englisheman whose name stephen poytron wt one ihon water laide swearing great othes knew wel kynge rychardes bastard sonne auswered like othes aduysed fearde take vpo boldely woulde would aide assist wt powre kyng england assured well erles desmod kyldare thesame thei forced party thei toke yt might reueged vpo kyng englad made learne english taught shoulde saye called duke yorke secod sonne kynge edward iiij king rychardes bastard sonne ye hades king englad vpo ye said iho water stephyn poytron ihon tyler hughbert burghe many forsayd erles entred false quarell within shorte tyme french kyng sent ambassadour ireland whose name loyte lucas master stephyn frya aduertise come frauce thece wet frauce fro thece flauders fro flauders ireland ireland scotland england night thesame daye xv day iuyne come partely kyng perdoned life partely ronne awaye put king doubt mistrust misfortune come comitted towre lodo hys wickednes boylinge hoate within hys cancarde stomacke woulde suffre hym escape punishment vengeaunce god shortely moost iustly worthely put death hereafter shalbe shewed xv yere edward plantagenet erle warwike whome ye haue heard beyng kept towre almost fro tender age saye fro first yere kyng thys xv yere al copany sight beastes much coulde decerne goose capon comen reason open apparauce could awne doynges seke death destruccio yet dryft offence another man brought ende cofusio freer augustyn border suffolke called patricke thentent bring erle dis ayn hatred certain skoler called raufe wiltord whome greatly fauoured whose hed euer distilled enfused folishe fatastical coceipte would folow cousail aduise would casely couey kingdome englad skoler like good disciple denye folow master discipline cousail desired put master remebrauce performe accoplish wt spede thing awn liberalite promised assured saiyng mecocke dastard sore afearde trasgressing ye law tymerous punishmet obteine kingdo wil attept suffre thinges possible assayed tasted whe thei betwene selfes secretly take crafty deliberacio cousailed enterprice deuised folish wittes brought passe wet together kent countrey auncient tyme hath bene dul settinge foorth newe phantastical fantasyes beganne younge mawmet tel preuely many erle warwike lately gotten oute towre helpe thys freer patricke whiche saiynges freer perceaued hope geuen declared openly pulpet desyred men helpe head thys sedicion sommer topped coulde haue tyme sprynge higher master skoler beyng bothe apprehended caste pryson attaynted whiche twoo skoler hanged shrouetuesdaye sayncte thomas waterynges freer condempned perpetuall pryson captiuitie tyme englande muche reuerence attributed holy order priest althoughe committed hygh treason agaynste hys souereygne lorde offender murder rape theft receaued iii higher holy order lyfe geuen punyshmente death released chief cause thys fauoure bisshoppes longe tyme ceason dyd take knowlege intermit selues serche punyshment suche heynous detestable offence reason whereof disgrade depryue holy order suche malefactours wycked persones whiche without ceremony canonicall lawe coulde put deathe furthermore shoulde man saye also vsed coulde onely reade ye althoughe vnderstode redde howe heynous detestable cryme soo euer committed treason onely except shoulde likewise affine alyes holy order saued committed bishoppes pryson thentent escape agayne taken comitting lyke offence lyues perdoned ordeyned murtherers brent brawne left hande hote iron signed lettre theues thesame place wt lettre yt signed wt markes token reiterate like cryme offence suffre paynes punishmentes merited deserued deuise enacted established ye parliamet kept ii yere kynges reigne taken coiecture frenche nacio wonte take offender cut one eares sure token marke hereafter hys euell doyng charge kepyng offender onely imprisoned offence soundeth spirituall religion committed bishop ruler spiritualtie penalitee set vpon prisoner afterward escape whiche acte priuilege norish encreace aboudantly swarme theues murtherers tyme hudred wayes practised inuented one time another deliuer conuey pryson captiuite makig purgacio sleight meanes thei care offence conuinced founde gyltye man present laye excepcions thesame partie offended hurte absent day purgacio making thefe murderer truly founde gilty beginning shall excused set libertie oftentymes soner bishop would lese great summe hudred poude escape poore knaue skant woorth dandyprat nowe returne oure mater agayne perkyn whome rehersall made beyng nowe holde coulde leaue destruccion selfe cofusio associate selfes bega study wai flye escape false persuasion liberall promise corrupted strangweyes blewet astwood long rogier hys kepers beynge seruauntes syr ihon dygby lieutenaunt muche araynmet openly proued enteded haue slayn thesayde master haue set perkyn erle warwyke large erle made preuy enterprice therunto naturall creature loue libertie hys destruccion assented craftie deuice subtil imaginacion beyng opened disclosed sorted none effect beyng repulsed put backe fro hope good lucke wyth hys complices confederate ihon awater sometyme mayre corffe irelande one hys fou ders hys sonne sixten daye nouembre arreyned condempned westmynster three twenty daye thesame moneth perkyn ihon awater drawen tyborne perkyn standyng litle skaffolde redde hys confession whiche haue heard toke hys death true ihon awater asked kyng forgeuenes dyed pacietly rewarde pernicius alye coment perkyn warbeck whiche life false persuasion vntrew surmise broughte many noble personage death vtter perdicion death brought thesame sorte vndeserued ponyshment emogest edward erle warwicke whiche fame went consented breake pryson departe realme perkyn prysoners high treason xxi daye thesayde moneth arreygned westmynster erle oxforde high constable england thesaide reason whiche whether enticemet awne frewill many men doubte hys innocency confessed fact submitted hym selfe kynges mercy vpon hys confession indgement accordyng therunto xxviii daye nouembre mccccxcix brought skaffolde towre hill behedded fame hys death sprange abroade ferdinand kyng spayne woulde neuer make full conclusio matrimony betwene prynce arthur lady katheryn hys daughter sende england aslonge erle lyued imagened longe erle warwicke lyued england neuer clensed purged cyuyle warre preuy sedicion muche name warwyke region feare gealousy next yere great plaguea great death whereof men dyed many place sore specially moost citie lo dyed yere thirty thousand also yere burned place kynges called maner shene situate liynge nygh thamys side buylded agayne sumpteously co ly chaunged name shene called rychemond hys father erles richemonde kynge perceauynge plague contagious disease rather encrease diserease whether aduoyde occasion sicknes allure archeduke philip burgoyne comme hym personally toke ship douer beginninge may sayled caleys thentent prouide see watch whiche haue bene accustomed diligently kepte maynteyned agaynst incursios aduersaries made polletique ordinauces streyte lawes kyng laye thus caleys archeduke philip sent diuerse notable personage alonely gratefie welcome hym partes also declare thesayde archeduke offred repaire personally presence suche numbre kynge shoulde appoynt within walled toune fortresse diuerse tynnes made denyall frenche kyng entre walled tounes gladly woulde come toune caleys might president ye frech kynge desyre like meting chaunce therof might fall euery coulde iudge kynge gentely entreteyned ambassadours thankefully accepted archedukes offre appoynted place sainct peter churche without caleys upon tuesday pentecost weke archeduke came thether conuenient co pany kyng quene many lusty lorde lady rode thether welcome hym kynge approched duke lightnynge offred holde styrope whiche kyng wise would suffre done kyng dissended horsse archeduke embraced eache moost princely familiaritie quene noble saluted hym banquettynge myrthe passe tyme passe ouer conclude communicacion mariages treatynge farther corroboracion league requestes tolles flaunders mynished many thinges touchynge thentreprice traffique bothe realmes thinges set ordre two prince louingly toke leaue departed king caleys archeduke saynct omers departing frenche kyng lewes xii sent visite kynge lorde gronthouse gouernoure picardy lorde merneiliers bayly amyas whiche declared kyng getting millayn takyng duke whiche lordes highly feasted great rewardes departed pthe xvi yere sone plague slaked kyng returned agayn england ende iune beynge come england sone came one gasper pous spanyard bothe learning good behaueour excellent sent alexander bishop romea yere iubile whiche shewe englishman right waye heauen therfore yere called yere iubile whiche yere lorde thousand fyue hundred thentet people farre country might cased laboure traueyle commyng thether charitable father sent hys legate euery country destribute heauenly grace called christen people whiche either letted warre enemyes infirmitie weaknes tediousnes longe iourney hable performe iourney holy cytie rome thys beneuolent liberlitie francke frely geuen holy bishop alexander helping lokynge health mennes soules thought somewhat hys awne priuate commoditie singuler wealth therfore limitted set certayne pryce hys grace pardon thende king hyndre let hys purpose offred parte gayn vnto kyng people might soner mynishe purse enryche hys chestes promysed woulde begynnyng yere make warre hast agaynst great turcke thys meanes pollecy thys alexander gat accumulated heaped vp great summe money yet battayle begonne agayne turcke meane ceason take coquered destroyed many region city tounes belonging christen men god amend amisse aboute thys tune dyed iii bishop england ihon morton bisshop caunterbury thomas langto bishop winchester thomas rotheram bishop yorke hym succeded thomas sauage bishop london whose place succeded doctor willia warham whome made mencio hery deane bishop salisbury made archebishop cauterbury also rycharde foxe bishop durha prefected bishoprike winchestre also yere two notable mariages cocluded agreed vpo neither solepnised cosummate shal afterwarde king hery graunted daughter ladye margaret iames iiii kynge scottes ferdinad kyng spayne gaue daughter lady katheryn arthur prynce wale sonne heyre apparaunt king england considred kyng henry ioyne affinitie kyng scottes without cause desiringe nothing passe ouer remanant life peace rest tranquilitee ymagened selfe coniunccion couplemet matrimony warre hostilitee hereafter attempted either agaynst hym hys dominion scottishe kyng hys nacion hauyng sure trust none hys enemyes hys rebelles hereafter receaued maynteyned dominion territory hys sonne lawe emongest article thys concluded appoynted englishman entre scotland without letter comendatorie awne souereign lord saueconduyte wardeyn march prohibicion lyke maner geuen scottes xvii yere haue heard mariage agreed betwene prynce arthur england lady katheryne spayne kyng father promysed sende great honoure england nowe yere accordyng hys promes conueyghed wt puissaunt nauye toward england arryued porte plymmoth seconde daye october beyng saterday kynge certefied arryual incotinet sent price arthur sonne wale repaire londo sent diuerse great lordes knyghtes couey triuphe toward spouse husband vpon xii daye nouembre conueyed fro lambeth thorough london triuphe honoure coulde deuised ymagened bishop paleys cathedrall churche paules tedious passe ouer wyse deuises prudent speches costly woorkes conninge portratures practised set foorth vii goodly beutiful pageauntes erected set vp diuerse place citie leaue also goodly ballade swete armony musicall instrumentes sounded heauely noyes euery side strete omit farther costly apparel goldsmythes woorke embraudery ryche iewelles massy cheynes rynge horsses beautifull bardes glitteryng trapper bothe belle spangle golde pretermit also ryche apparell pryncesse straunge fasshion spanyshe nacion beautie englishe ladyes goodly demeanure youg damosel amorous countenauce lusty bachelers passe ouer also fyne engrayned clothes costly furres citezens standynge skaffoldes rayled gracechurche paules speke oderiferous skarlettes fyne veluet pleasaunt furres massye chaynes mayre londo senate sitting horsebacke litle conduyte chepe ware bodyes neckes molest wt rehersyng ryche arras costly tapestry fyne clothes bothe gold siluer curious veluettes beautiful sattens pleasaunte sylkes hange euery strete passed wyne yt ranne continually conduytes graueling rayling stretes nedeth remembred prince soiorned recreacio bishop paleys londo without visitacio kynge quene kinges mother erected body saynct paules church long brydge made tymbre extendynge west doore church steppe entrynge quere whiche sixe foote grounde thesayde bridge staige euen directly consistory churche eleuate place lyke mounte eyghte person stande vpon copassed rounde steppe assende dissende whiche couered fyne redde worsted likewyse rayles thesayde staige northside mount place furnished kyng quene thei apoynted southside thesame mount stoode mayre magistrate london preparacion made al thinges set ordre upon daye saynct erkenwalde beynge sundaye thesayde lady ledde thesame mount prynce arthur openly espoused bothe beynge cladde whyte lusty amorous age fiftene age xviii aboutes kynge quene standynge preuelye stayge matrymonye celebrate prince wife went vp quere herde solepne masse song archebishop cauntourbury associate xix prelate mytred masse fynished bryde led homeward bishop palace duke yorke beyng goodly youge prince legate spayne next folowed lady cicile suster quene supporting treyne spouse whome folowed aboue c ladyes getlewome gorgeously appareyled richely adourned kept day sumpteous feast yet sumpteous populous yet populous licate delicate thinges aboudaut reherse valew iiii cupbordes day shewed set foorth beside plate occupied declare ryches hanginges canapies clothe estate set foorth numbre disshes serued iiii course banquette deliuer daunsinge costly disguisinges assure soner fayle copye mattre haboundaunce honoure euery daye endeth nyght ensueth night come lusty prince beautifull bryde brought ioyned together one bed naked dyd acte whiche performaunce full consummacion matrimony requysite expedient muche familier seruitours neither cause rewarde lye fayne declared openly mornynge h called drynke whiche tymes accustomed whiche thinge one hys chambrelaynes meruaylynge requyred cause hys drouth whome auswered merely saiyng haue thys nyght bene middest spayne whiche hote region iourney maketh drye thou haddest bene vnder hote clymate thou wouldest haue bene dryer shortely kynge quene new wedded spouse went baynardes castell water westmynster whome mayre comminaltye london barge garnished standardes stremers penons deuice gaue attendaunce paleys suche marciall feates suche valiaunt iustes suche vygorus turneys suche fierce fight barreyers tyme man remembraunce thys royall triumphe lorde edwarde duke buckyngham chiefe chalengeour lorde thomas grey marque dorcet chief defendoure whiche wyth aydes compaygnions bare theim selfes valyauntly obteyned great laude honoure bothe spanyardes countryman durynge tyme iustes triumphe receaued london erle byshop dyuerse noble personage sent kynge scottes england conclusion mariage betwene laqdy margaret kynges daughter hym whiche erle porxie name kynge iames hys master affied contracted sayd fayre lady assurauce published paules crosse daye conuersion saynct paule reioysynge wherof te deum songe great fyers made citie london whiche thinges haue hearde beynge ully fynished accomplished ambassadours aswell spayne scotlande tooke leaue kynge without great rewardes departed countryes habitacions ambassadours departed kynge entendynge auaunce honour reputacion prynce hys sonne furnisshed hym men money largely sent hym agayne wale kepe liberall hospitalitee mynystre rude welshemen indifferent iustice least reason lacke experience might erre appoynted hym wyse expert cou saylers syr rychard poole hys kynsman hys chief cha berlayne whome associate syr henry uernon syr rychard croftes syr dauy philip syr willia udale syr thomas englefelde syr peter newton knyghtes ihon waleston henry yon docter william smyth president hys counsail docter charles bothe hym associate one afterwarde bishop lyncoln bishop herford one fountayne commeth often bothe ioye sorow leaue speake ioye mariage consideryng chaunce shortely su ded fewe monethes maryage prynce arthur edmonde poole erle southfolfe sonne ihon duke southfolke lady elizabeth suster kyng edward iiii beyng stoute bolde courage wyt rashe hedy endited homicide murther sleyng meane person rage fury although kynge perdoned whome might iustly haue condempned offence yet brought kynges benche barre arrey ed facte reputed great mayme blemysh hys honoure tooke seriously shortely thys displeasure sledde slaunders without lycence saueconduyte geuen hym kynge lady margaret hys awnt mother side neuerthelesse whether urred hys preuy frendes thereunto moued kynge whether trustynge hys vnuiolated truthe feared daungier penaltie returned agayne excused hym selfe kynge thoughte gylteles inculpable cryme coulde obiected hym therefore permytted go frankely hys libertie pleasure thys mariage prince arthyr kept london great pompe solempnitie nobilitie set pleasure solace kynge hym selfe pryncipally geuen ioye reioysynge edmond either ben great excessyue charge thesame tryumphe solempnytie reason therof sore charged debte either sollicited allured prouoked olde venemous serpent duches burgoyn euer beyng sower sedicion begynner rebellion agaynst kyng england el stimulate pricked enuy could paciently open eye se beholde kynge henry beynge aduerse lyne lignage longe reigne wealthe felicite conclusion hys brother rycharde fledde agayne flaunders thys sad chaunce thinke happened emonge great ioyes solace kynge henry least mighte ouermuche gladnes sod ynly forget hym selfe whiche displeasure another tyme haue chaunced manifest well knowen kynge vnderstode certaynly erle departed returned agayne litle vexed vnquyeted mistru tynge newe tumulteous busynes shoulde begonne agayn chiefly therfore blamed hym selfe folishe folye geue hym hys pardon hys offence lately committed although manifest enough dyd purpose might dissemble wyncke matter longe vntyll suche tyme sure token perfight knowlege hys coniuracion whiche perceaued nowe urely attempted begonne assone edmonde de la poole erle suffolke fled agayne flauders syr robert curson whome kynge promoted ordre knyghthod made capitayne ammes castel valeaunt circumspect man dissimulyng hym selfe one conspiracy went flauders doubtlesse espye done lady margaret agai st kynge henry thys opynion setteled euery mannes head fyrst brochynge matter yet contynu th groundyng vpon thys prynciple neyther vexed molested wyth poynte displeasure iniurie hys prynce fled kynges enemyes thynges knowe opened pacefied suppressed willyngely returned receaued hygh fauoure kynge hys master souereygne lorde howebeit kynge lyke wylye foxe knowynge faythfyll entent thys syr robert ente dynge put hym oute gealousy suspicio lady margaret edmond de la poole caused thesayde erle thesayde syr roberte curson fyue persones accursed paules crosse fyrst sondaye nouember enemyes rebelles hys realme howsoeuer chaunced whether easing hys hart preuy pollecye kynge mariage hys sonne prynce arthyr vigilant circumspect intentyue espyed tryed oute suche knewe partely mu nters mischiefe agaynst hym partely beare good wyll sincere affeccion towarde person coulde redely name reherse name surname wherof great parte fewe dayes apprehended taken monge lorde william courtney sonne edwarde erle deuonshyre man great nobilite estimacion vertue whiche maryed lady katheryne daughter kyng edward lorde william brother edmond erle southfolke syr iames tyrrell syr ihon wyndham williams rehersed rather taken suspicion gelousy nere blood coniurators proued offence cryme wherfore lorde william sonne erle deuonshire death kynge henry vii deliuered set abroade libertie noble famous prynce kyng henry viii sonne thesayd kynge whome great fauoure estimacion shortely beganne exercise selfe marciali feates warlike studye syckened disease called plur si whiche malady strauge rare phisicians england kynges manoure grenewiche desessed leuynge one sonne behynde hym continue hys stirpe familie lorde william brother edmonde erle southfolke also greater fauoure shewed pryson syr iames tyrrell ihon wyndham w traytours attaynted vi daye maye towre hyll behedded erle southfolke heard frendes put execution committed perpetuall pryson captiuitie great agony feare hym selfe beig clerely desperate haue fortunate successe pretesed enterprice wandred germany fraunce aide succoure prouynge coulde fynde aide succoure handes perceaued stedfast groud catche chor holde vpon thentent conclusion might vnderstade shameful death dewe man offence crymes cannot mannes helpe mannes reason either eschewed diuerted hym submitted selfe vnder obeysauce defence philip archeduke austricke burgoyn erle flauders rychard hys brother beyng experte polletique man craftely coueyed wisely ordred hym selfe thys stormy tempest attrapped eyther net snare kyng yet beynge doubte domestical sedicion ciuile discorde studyed busely howe restreyne kepe streyte closure diuerse malefactours beyng partaker cospiracy fled sondry sanctuary tariyng till fayre day came auauce foorthward enterprice wherupon deuised kepe gate sanctuary place priuileged shut wel locked none issue thence perturbe vnquyet hym hys realme people entent bothe wrote sent ambassadours alexander bishop rome desyrynge authoritie adiudge decerne englishman beynge fled sanctuary place treason enemyes christes fayth scismatiques christen religion commen perturbers quyet people capitaynes prouokers trayterous rufflinges intreditynge prohibityng refuge priuilege sanctuary suche person enioyed immunitie liberte thesame fled ef sone returned agayne whiche thinge bishop graunted greatly quyetnes comforte kyng hery many feare reproche ignomony conuerted selues goodnes dewe subieccio price also securite perel daunger durst hasard selues feare galtroppes slippynge fyer kyng high pollecy compassed framed affaire thus hys purpose sodeynly happened lamentable chauce lachrimable losse kynge quene people noble prince arthur kynges yrst begotten sonne bene maryed lady katheryn hys wyfe v monethes departed transitory lyfe hys castel ludlowe great funerall obseq buryed cathedrall churche worcettre whose death name prince belonged brother duke yorke hys brother disseasyng without issue without creacion oughte called except cause apparaunt let obstacle thesame howbeit sayde duke vpon suspicion hys brother wyfe chylde doubtfully thoughte expert sage men prynces counsayl moneth delayed hys title name preheminence season truthe might wome easely apere reported lady katheryn thought feared suche dolorous chauce come e braced father taken leaue noble prudent mother sayled towardes england continually tossed trumbled hyther thether boysterous wyndes rage water contraritie wyndes ship prohibited diuerse tymes approche shore take lande xviii yere next yere quene elizabeth liynge within towre lodo brought bed ayre daughter candelmas daye whcihe christened named katheryn xi daye thesame moneth thesayde moost verteous prince gracious quene desessed funerall pompe caryed thorough cytye london westmynster intimulate whose daughter also taried small ceason mother death noble prince great vertue commenly called good quene elizabeth departed syr gnold breye knight gartier father coutry sage graue person feruent louer iustice muche thinge bene done good law equitie would huble fassio pla reprehende king geue good aduertisement orme offence circuspect another lyke case thesame vertue honest playnnes ihon morto archebishop ca terbury whiche bishop dyed shewed aboue two yeres ii person euer cohibetors refre er kinges wilfull skope vnbrideled libertie rude ignoraunt people saye affirme e counsayll infected corrupted kynges clene immaculate conscience contrary hys pryncely disposicion naturall inclinacion suche euer errour comon people surely long kyng would obeye warned hym hys office royall kyngely duetie coulde wyse erre swar e aside tyme also dyed henry archebishop cauntourbury whose rowme doctor willia warram bishop london supplyed bishoptick london elected william barnes whose death succeded rycharde fitziames man good lignage great learnyng vertue yere xviii daye february kyng palace westmynster solepnite created hys onely sonne hery price wale erle chestre c noble yogling succeded father inheritauce regalite also equypolet honour fame learnyng pollecye maximilian emperour hearinge quene elizabeth deceased sent england solempne ambassade lord ca imire marque brandenburgh hys cosyn accopanyed bisshop erle great nuber gentleme well appareyled principall ambassadour triuphantly receaued londo lodged crosbyes place ambassade sent iii cause one visite comforte kyng beyng sorowful sad death good quene spouse ii renouacion olde league amitie iii apparaunt moue kynge mary emperours daughter lady margaret duches dowager sauoye first ii toke effect kyng vpon passion sunday roade paules great triuphe said marque iding lefthand bishop made king excellet cosolatorie oracio cocerning death ye quene also ye kyng opely sware kepe new renouate league amitie ii lyues ye third request whether ye let ma parte womas syde neuer sorted effect conclusion thinges done ambassadours returned sumpteously honorably rewarded wynter preparacio made conueya ce lady margaret affied kyng scottes scotland whe thynges ready prest kyng remoued last daye iuyn rychemond hauyng hys copany hys sayde daughter came colyweston co tesse rychemond motherthen laye certayne dayes solace ended kynge gaue hys blessynge fatherly exhortacion committed coueighaunce kynge husbandes presence erle surrey erle northumberland apoynted wardeyn march deliuer confynes march thus fayre lady conueyghed great company lordes ladyes knyghtes esquyers gentleman tyl came berwicke thence village called lambreton kyrke scotland wherethe kyng floure scotlad ready receaue erle northumberland accordynge commission deliuered scottes daye assure behynde farre aboue bothe apparell ryche iewels massy chaynes aboue erle northumberland ryches hys cote beyng goldsmythes worke garnyshed perle stone costly apparel hys henxmen galaunt trapper horsses besides iiii hundred tall men well horssed appareled hys cooler estemed bothe scottes englishman lyke prince subiect lady conueyed toune edenboroughe daye kynge iames iiii presence hys nobilitie espoused thesayde faire prince feasted english lordes shewed iustes pastymes honourably fassion rude countrey al thinges done finished accordynge commission erle surrey englishe lordes ladyes returned countrey geuynge prayse manhoode good maner nurture scotlande xix yere thys yere kynge kepte hygh courte parliament whiche diuerse actes concluded whyche thought necessary expedient preseruacio publique weale emonge thinges determined theues murderer duely couicted lawe dye burned hand comitted bisshops custody haue declared certayne money graunted kynge whole parliament goodes men outlawed forfeyted confisqued also called maner congregacion clergie thentent wt treasure money might auauce preferre comon wealth realme hetherto haue shewed rough sharpe battailes pernicious sedicious strife tumulte death many noble meane person nowe therfore let v rehearse contencion familier thinges g awynge harte freating myndes vowes promise requestes made diuerse persones kyng henry drawynge age tyme euer punched stimulated pricked scrupulous stynges domesticall sedicion ciuile commocion muche detested abhorred intestine priuate warre death thynge terrible wherfore determyned pollitiquely prouyde cause suche vnquyetnes mischief come shoulde eradicate ext rped ymaginacion purpose doubted compasse brynge effect made lowe abated courage hys subiectes vassalles especially rychest sorte remembrynge olde prouerbe men throughe aboundaunce ryches waxe insolent hedstronge robustius nothynge men acceptable desyrous aboudaunce treasure plentye money whiche people either feare lo ynge hope gaynynge worldly ryches desyre euer either peace warre thentent men might thinke reporte whiche kynge constituted god reuenge iniuries theym done committed oppresse wrongfully polle exact money hys subiectes deuysed wyth hym selfe honest meane myght performe thus deuisyng hym selfe came hys hed englishman dyd litle passe vpon obseruacion kepynge penall lawes pecuniall statute made enacted preseruacion commen vtilitee wealthe therefore inquisicion suche penall statute fewe noble men merchauntes fermers husbandemen grasyers occupyers shoulde founde transgressours violator thesame statute taken thys counsayll soughte oute penall lawes put execucion thei founde offender easely beginnynge fyned scourged apointed ii master surueyers forfaytes one syr richard empson edmond dudley bothe learned lawes realme twoo person contended whiche theim mooste bryngyng might please satisfye mastres desyre appetide wherefore beginnynge armed companye accuser commonly called promoter whyche brought theim name offendours estemed regarded muche gayne money clerely forgate banyshed oute remembraunce duetye present peril might ensue thanke good might haue obteyned yet warnynge greate sage person close handes suche vncharitable doynges cruell extremitie accordyng adage extremitie iustice extreme iniurie pthe xx yere kynge gotte large ample sume money hauyng pitie people whiche crye od dayly ende pilf ynge gracious goodnes towardes ende thought thus determyned two extreme h ul e depryued office money whome vniu ly acted extorted wholy restored deliuered agayn hich beyng preuented death commaunded last testament duely truly performed meane eason many men co er emptied xxi yere ceason yere lord md vi elizabeth quene ca e l wyfe ferdinande kynge arragon dyed without issue e reason whereof th heritaunce castel kyngdomes partible discended lady iane eldest daughter ferdinando whiche maryed philip archeduke austrich burgoyne erle flaundres kyngdome obteyned wyfe possession thesame named reputed taken kynge castell lyon wherefore ye e folowynge aboute vi daye ianuary hauyng great nauy prepared sayled flaunders wyfe toward spayne sayled great waye vygorous tempe reason contra ete wyndes sodeynly arose whole nauy tossed chased waues sodayne sourges muche wynde hauynge mastry dispersed separated shippes asondre diuerse place coast englande kynges ship two vesselles blowen tempest west parte realme porte weymouth dorset shyre kynge philip expert frequented sea beynge fatigate vnquyeted bothe mynde body entryng ship boate refreshe repose hym selfe litle came lande contrarye mynde hys counsayll capitaynes whiche forsawe knewe well thesame landynge shoulde bee occasion lenger tariynge knowen straunge shyppes arryued came thether greate number aswell noble men rurall person dwelleth aboute coaste repulse beate awaye hym enemy perceaued theyr frende louer dryuen thether force wether syr thomas trenchard knyght chiefe company went philip kynge castell humanytie lowlynes inuytynge desyrynge hym woulde vouchesaufe vysyte hys maner mancion whyche euen nygh hand trustyng therby haue great thakes kynge hys master coulde protract cause hym tarye vntyll suche tyme kyng henry certefied hys arryual whome diligent celerite sent dyuerse postes notefie hys grace kynge philippes landynge rumour beynge farther blowen abr ade straunge prince comming short space assembled together great multitude people longe sea coast emonge came first syr ihon carew wyth goodly band picked men whiche syr ihon syr thomas trenchard entreated kyng castell depart vntill suche tyme spoken kyng henry hys louinge faythfull frende allye assuryng hym woulde repayre thether within ii iii dayes king philip excused selfe necessitie weightie enterprice importunate cause affermyng log tariyng matter grauytie dubious ought excluded wherefore alledged protractynge tyme myght turne hym great preiudice denyenge first exspect tarye commynge kyng england yet beyng perswaded reason hym selfe might let interrupted woulde proffre go aborde hys shyppes agayne gentle desyre louinge contemplacion assented humble peticion request kynge henry informed hys landynge replenyshed exc dynge gladnes partely renew olde familiaritie acquayntaunce whiche vsed last metynge partely trusted hys landynge england turne hys proffite commoditie therefore first wrote many diuers letter syr ihon carew syr thomas trenchard wyllinge warnynge withall kyndenes humanitie enterteyne kyng castel tyll person approched place mete conuenyent entreuiewynge entreteignynge noble personage beside sent erle arundell many lordes knyghtes accompany attende vpon hym whiche erle accordynge kynges letter receaued hym iiic horsses torche light great admiracion straungiers kynge philip seyng remedy must nedes tarie abide woulde lenger gase kynge henryes commynge tooke hys iourney towardes wynsore castell kynge laye fyue myle wynsore prynce wale accopanyed fyue erles dyuerse lordes knyghtes numbre fyue hu dred person moost gorgeously appareled richely mounted receaued moost honorablest fassion entreteinmet within halfe myle wyndsore kynge accompanyed duke buckyngham great parte nobilitie hys realme saluted welcommed hym conueyed hym castell wynsore besyde many triumph pastymes shewed made co paignion noble ordre gartier hym came wynsore hys wyfe quene iane suster prynces dowager late wyfe pryn arthur two concluded renouate olde league made perpetuall peace continuall amitie together kynge henry desyred hym haue edmod de la poole e le suffolke hys rebell deliuered handes possession whome kyng castell aunswered within hys rule dominion therfore laye powre rendre deliuer although considred heynous great offece occasio authour death g st came succour receaued vnder proteccion defence yet perceaued neither excuse yet reasonoble argumente coulde accepted allowed kyng ry promised faithfully hys awne offre pardon edmond de la poole paynes execucios death promysed graunted accomplishe kynge henryes desyre request incont ent caused thesayde edmod secretly sent kyng henry entending protract tyme till might possesse praye sore desyr coueyed kyng castell vnto citie london might see hed citie hys realme led baynardes castell chepe barkynge returned watlynge strete agayne tyme shot wonderfull peale gunnes oute towre whiche would ntre haue heard auowed ntre fortresse yn prince garison maynteyned tariynge litle space returned backe rom london kyng brought richemond many notable eates armes proued bothe tylt tourney barrier meane ceason edmond de la poole whiche euer feared mi ru ed arriuyng england kyng philip shoulde hys finall de ruccion perceauinge well fart er hope foreyn prince potentate trustynge life hym grauted kyng henry would briefly set hym libertie redome maner content returne agayne hys natiue countrey castynge hys mynde farther hope trust defrauded refelled yet last
