sure ende hys li e buryed countrey first entred variable worlde pa te couenauntes betwene kinges england castell appoynted couenaunted agreed kynge philip toke hys leaue kyng henry rendryng hym moost hartie thankes high chere princely entreteynmet beyng accompanied diuerse lordes england came citie excettre fulmouth cornewale tooke shippe sayled sp yne shortly beynge taken sodeyn disease departed oute transitorie life beynge xxx yeres age hys wyfe quene iane vi child two men childre charles ferdinand foure daughter eleanor isabel mary katherin man stature conuenient countenaunce amiable louelythe descripcion kynge philip body somewhat crasse corpulet quycke wytted bold hardy stomaked tempest kyng castell wonderfull straunge many men violencie wynde blowen doune egle brasse beynge set shewe manifest parte wynd blew fro pynnacle spire paules church fallyng thesame egle brake batered another egle set vp signe tauerne dore chepeside vpo studious straunge token monstreous wonder dyd take opinion emperour maximilian whiche tyme gaue egle armes haue great losse whyche happened dede lost hys onely begotten sonne philip newly called kyngdome castell also shortely departynge kyng philip king englande beganne suspect syr george neuell lorde burgeyny syr thomas grene grenes norton knyght con edered fautours partaker beginnynge edmond de la poole vpon thys suspicion thei comaunded towre shortly ben tryed purged suspicio cryme commaunded theim bothe set libertie syr thomas grene fell sycke contynued towre hope restored aswell health hys libertie dyed lorde burgeyny hys modestie wyt probitie kynge founde hym lyke hym selfe always true faythfull co stant hys souereigne lorde estemed fauoured regarded pthe xxii yere aft r kynge hauynge peace aswell foreyne pr ce terme iij yeres burdened purified domesticall sedicion beganne disea ed certayne infirmitie wekenes body whiche thryse yere especially sprynge tyme sore vexed tormented hym parte harme euell chaunceth prynce parted communicat hys subiectes people olde sweatynge whereof heard emongest common realme came agayne howbeit reason remedy inueted death many creature beginnynge dyd lesse hurte displeasure people tyme nowe thyrde plague egall pestilence ensued woorkynge master aytures kynge appoynted shewed whose meanes many ryche welthy person exstremyte lawes realme condempned brought misery mattre wonderfull heard pitefull miserable done yet called law rather peruerse abuse disordre lawe polletiquely beginnyng inuented cause people soner conforme selues demaund right craftely practised vtter confusion many vntrue officiers man put aduersary suyte iudges whiche coplaynt accio neither thinketh hath knowlege appere last callyng exigent whiche called shyre neuer came appere ignoraunt prosecucion cause dwell iic myles fro place doeth forfet hys substaunce mouables hys body captiuitie enemy rebel lawes hys countrey yet prynce shall enioye goodes confiscate party copleynaut playntife wronged recouereth one myte yet loseth bothe hys payne costes suche person condempned adiudged called outlawes depryued lawes lande whiche custome countrey inheritable aries olde recognisance peace good aberig escape ryottes innumerable statute penal put execucion called vpon empson dudley euery man spiritualtie temporaltie hauinge either lande substaunce called pluckyng bancket accordinge psalmist saiyng declyned fell together man although neuer clere gyltles conclusion durst auenture tryall eynge experience pas two wolues suche garde false periured person apperteig ynge commaundemet empanyeled eu ry quest king sure wynne whosoeuer lost learned men lawe requyred aduice would saye agree best counsayll geue vndewe anes couetous persones illed kynges cofers enryched selues vnreasonable extorte doynge noble men grudged meane men kycked poore men lamented preacher openly paules crosse pla e exclamed rebuked detested yet would neuer amende howebeit good kynge last dayes coserued pardoned poore subiectes vncharitable yoke ponderous burden laden withall season alexader bishop rome departed world hym elected frauces borne sene nephiewe pius second called pius third whome kyng henry made litle proctoure realme courte rome king beyng glad high promocion dignitie sent syr eylbert talbot knyght rychard bere abbot glalc nbury doctor robert sherborne ane paules declare gladnes ntred kynges hart hearde tell hygh pre erment honour bishop pius espect tary gratulacios ambassadours within moneth ter rendred hys debt nature hauyng small pleasure promo io tyme also dyed gyles lorde dawbeney kynges chiefe chamberleyn whose office charles bastard sonne henry la ke somerset occupied enioyed man good wyt great experience xxiii yere sone kyng caused guy ubald duke urbyne elected knyght ordre gartier noble warriour greke latyn tounges excellently lea ned honour high dignitie duke desired instantly haue might equyualent degree honour nobilitie father duke frederick prince tyme high renoune estimacion whiche receaued chosen ordre kyng edward iiii noysed iuly seconde ianuway borne death pius elected bishop rome kyng entendinge stoppe two gappes one bushe sent syr gylbert talbot two ambassadours principally bishop iuly theim sent also duke urbyne whole habite coller noble ordre gar ier duke guy reuested habit taken othe accordinge statute ordre sent syr balthaser de castellio knyght mantuane borne oratour kynge henry whiche enstalled according ordinaunces famous ordre thinges doynge lewes frenche kynge mistrus ing neuer haue manchilde maried eldest daughter lady claude frauces de ualoys dolphyn uyen duke angulesme whiche lady promised litle charles kyng castell kynge henry knew thought best mary daughter lady mary charles kynge castel beyng almost bothe one age therefore ambassadours e sent ro last mariage concluded confirmed meanes bishop wynchester chiefe ambassadoure king c l y lady mary beyng age x yeres promysed kyng charles conclusion whiche mariage lord barow diuerse great ambassadours sent england fro emperour maximilian great rewardes returned pthe xxiiii yere nowe approched ende terme iii yeres peace spake whiche tyme kyng henry thought fatal daye hand sickenes encreased daily might easely perceaue death farre tariyng hys praye therfore lyke good prynce desiring exhibite gratuitie hys people might memory disease grauted great liberalite general pardon men offence done perpetrate agaynst hys lawes statute murtherers theues onely offender also excepted pardo paide also fee prisoner ye gayles aboute londo abyding duety payde also debtes al person laye counter londo ludgate xl vnder releued condempned xl thys goodnes pitie shewed hys people beynge sore vexed inquysitors pollers promoter general processio daily euery citie parishe praye almighty god restorynge hys healthe longe contynuaunce thesame neuertheles consumed hys longe malady nature coulde lenger susteyne hys lyfe departed oute thys worlde xxii daye aprill hys palace rychemond whiche yere oure lorde mdix hys corp conueyed wyth funerall pompe westmynster buryed good quene wyfe sumpteous solempne chapell long caused buylded reygned xxiii yeres vii monethes lyued lii yeres hys quene elizabeth viii chyldren iiii men iiii wemen chyldren whyche iii remayned alyue behynde hym henry prynce wale whyche hym succeded kynge lady margaret quene scottes lady mary promysed charles kyng castell man body leane spare albeyt mighty stronge therwiththe descripcion kynge henry vii personage stature somewhat hygher meane sorte men bee wonderfull beutye fayre complexion countenaunce mery smylyng especially hys communicacion hys eye graye hys teethe syngle heare thynne wyt thynges quycke prompt pryncely stomacke haute courage great perels doubtful aff ire matter weighty importaunce supernaturall maner deuyne suche thynges went aboute dyd aduisedly without great deliberacion breathynge thentent emongest men hys wyt prudence might noted regarded spoken ignoraunt hys actes doynges specially noted marked wyth eye many person therefore prynce oughte far e surmounte meane personage wysedome poll precell th state dignitie geue credite regard hath proued light wilde lastiuious condicions besides sobre moderate honest affable curteous bounteous muche abhorring pryde arrogancy euer sharp quicke noted spotted cryme man hym beynge neuer muche fauoure hauing neuer muche aucthorite either durst coulde thing awne phatasye serue hym without consent agrement shall say although mother neuer wise bothe witty wise yet brydled doynges restrayned regimet said kept thetent worthely might called king whose office rule ruled also indifferet sure iustici r one thing allured harte many people lyued quietly rest al oppressio molestacio nobilite riche persones also seuerite ioyned annexed certayn merciful pitie often shew offended lawes hindred mersed subiectes fined amerced iustices great empouerishing one tyme another helpe releue set forward wherby apered would haue thesame penalty ce crymes reuyued stirred vp plain argumet vse rygour sayd selfe bring low abate high harte stoute stomackes wylde people norished brought vp sedicious faccios ciuile rebellion gredy desire rich hunger money althoughe suche afflicted would crye say done loue desire gayne profite prudent pollecy pollitique prouision surely good modest prince deuoure cosume substauce ryches hys realme highe pollecy meruelously enriched hys realme selfe yet left subiectes high wealth prosperitie profe wherof manifestly apparaut great abou daunce golde siluer yerely brought realme plate money bullio merchautes passing repassing ito realme merchaudise whome selfe awne goodnes let money largely without gayne proffite thentet merchaudise beyng craftes chefe arte men bothe profitable necessary might pletifuller vsed hauted employed realmes dominios kyng lyuyng hys tyme fauour fortune high honour ryches glory hys noble actes prudent pollecies worthy registred booke fame gaue vp ghost ye last vndoubtedly assended celestiall mancion hath sure fruicion godhead ioy prepared shall sit right hande sauyour euer worlde without ende finis pthe triumphaunt reigne kyng henry viii novv yere death noble prince henry viii sonne kyng henry vii beganne reigne xxii daie aprill yere lorde xviii yere bodily age maximilian beeyng emperoure lewes xii reignyng fraunce fernando beeyng kyng arragon castell kyng iames fourthe rulyng ouer scottes whose stile proclaimed blast trumpet citie london xxiii daie thesaied monethe muche gladnes reioysyng people thesame day departed manour richemond tower london remained closly secrete counsaill till funeralles father finished ended thesame daie alsoempson dudley attached six richard empson knight edmonde dudley esquier greate counsailers late kyng attached brought tower litle reioysyng many persones whiche wer greued whiche attachement thought bee procured malice theim authoritie late kynges day wer offended el shifte noyse straight execucion penall statu late kynges day punishement persones moters satisfie appeace people thesame daie also wa attached lorde henry stafford brother duke buckyngh sent tower cause thought great sone deliuered thesame yere created erle wilshire thesame daie also doctor ruthall named bushoppe dures sone apprehended diuerse called promoter belongyng empson dudley canby page smith diuerse derbie wright sympson stocton whiche moste part ware paper stoode pillorie bee moste craftiest knaue called ihon baptist brimald escaped came westminster toke sanctuarie xxv daie aprill proclaimeda generall pardon kynges grace ratefied pardones graunted father also pardoned suche persones suite offence soeuer treason murder onie onely excepte thynges necessary interment funerall pope late kyng sumpteously prepared done corp said defunct brought priuie chambre great cha ber wher rested thre day euery daie dirige masse song prelate mitered thence conueighed halle also three day like seruice thre day chapell euery thre place hearce waxe garnished banner ix mourner geuyng attendance seruice tyme euery daie thei offered euery place chaunged blacke clothe upon wedinsdaie ix daie maie corp putte chariot couered blacke clothe golde drawen v greate corsers couered blacke ueluet garnished cusshions fine gold ouer corp image representacion late kyng laied cusshions golde thesaied image appareled kynges riche robe estate croune hed ball scepter handes chariot garnished banner pecelles tharmes dominion title geanealogies chariot thusordered kinges chapell great nombre prelate set forward praiyng folowed kynges seruauntes blacke folowed chariot chariot ix mourner euery side wer caried long torch shorte nombre vic ordre thei came saincte george felde richemond met theim priestes clearkes religious men within citee without whiche went formoste kynges chapell maior brother many commoner clothed blacke met corp lo bridge gaue attendauce thesame citee good ordre compaignie passed citie whereof stretes euery side wer set long torch stalles stode young child holdyng taper greate reuerence chariot brought cathedrall churche sainct paule body taken caried quire set vnder goodly herce waxe garnished banner pencelles cusshions soung solempne dirige masse sermon made busshoppe rochester duryng whiche tyme kynges houshold mourner reposed theim busshoppes paleis nexte daie corp like ordre remoued toward westminster sir edward haward bearyng kynges banner courser trapped armes defunct westminster curious herse made ix principalles full lightes whiche lighted commyng corp whiche taken chariot sixe lordes set vnder herse image representacion liyng vpon cusshyn large palle golde herse double railed within firste railes satte mourner within seconde raile stoode knightes banner sainctes without thesame stoode officer armes mourner set gartier kyng armes cried soule noble prince kyng henry vii late kyng realme quire beganne placebo song dirige whiche beyng finished mourner departed palaice thei voyde reposed night next daie wer three mass solemply song busshoppes last masse offered kynges banner courser coate armes sworde target helme thende masse mourner offered vp riche paulles cloth gold baudekin quire sang libera body put yearthe lorde treasorer lorde stewarde lorde chamberlein treasorer comptroler kynges houshold brake staues caste theim graue gartier cried loude voyce viue le roy henry le hu esme roy dangliter de fraunce sire dirland mourner geuen attendance funerall obsequie departed palaice thei greate sumptuous feast wonder write lamentacion made prince emongest seruauntes wisest sort ioy made death suche troubled igor lawe yet towarde hope whiche poyntes appered young kyng bothe repaire comforte heuie harte whiche lost wise sage prince also put myndes suche releued thesaied kynges deathe olde grudge rancor confirmed newe ioye newe graunte pardon funeralles late kyng wer thus honorably finished greate preparacion made coronacio new kyng whiche appoynted midsomer daie nexte ensuyng duryng whiche preparacion kyng moued cousail honorable profitable realmethe kynges mariage doubtefull beginnyng take wife lady katherin late wife prince arthur brother disseased least hauyng greate dowrie might mary realme whiche vnprofitable hym reason whiche mocion kyng beyng young vnderstandyng lawe god espous thesaied lady katherine third daie iune whiche mariage dispensed pope iuly request father kyng farnando contrary opinion cardinal rome beyng diuines mariage brother wife muche murmured beginnyng euer searched learnyng scripture laste determinacion best vniuersities christendo adiudged detestable plain contrary goddes lawe shall xx yeres declare pain labour diligence taylers embrouderers golde smithes tooke bothe make deuise garmentes lordes lady knightes esquire also deckyng trappyng adornyng courser ienetes palffreis wer long rehersse suretie riche straunge curious workes hath seen wer prepared coronacion xxj daie moneth iune kyng came grenewiche tower ouer london bridge grace churche came many well appareled gentleman especiall duke buckyngham whiche goune goldsmithes worke costly kyng rested till saterdaie next ensuyng fridaie twentie twoo daie iune euery thyng beeyng eadines coronacion grace quene beeyng tower london made knightes bathe nombre twentie foure obseruaunces ceremony thesame belongyng morowe folowyng beyng saterdaie xxiii day thesaid monethe grace quene departed tower citie london whose comyng streates grace passe hanged tapistrie clothe arras greate parte southe side chepe clothe gold parte cornehill also streates railed barred one side ouer grace churche vnto bredstreate chepeside euery occupacion stode liueries ordre beginnyng base meane occupacions assendyng worshipfull craftes highest lastly stode maior alderman goldsmithes stalles vnto ende olde chaunge beeyng replenished uirgins white braunches white waxe priestes clerkes riche cope cross censer siluer censyng grace quene also thei passed feature body goodly personage amiable visage princely countenaunce noble quality royall estate euery man knowen nedeth rehersall consideryng lacke cunnyng cannot expresse giftes grace nature god hath endowed hym yet partly discriue apparell bee noted grace ware vpperst apparell robe crimosyn ueluet furred armyns iacket cote raised gold placard embrowdered diamodes ruby emeraudes greate pearles riche stone greate bauderike aboute necke greate balas trapper horse damaske gold depe purfell armyns knightes esquire body crimosyn ueluet gentleman chappell officer houshold seruauntes wer appareled skarlet baron fiue porte bare canaby clothe estate resite vnto greate estate name ordre goyng nombre lordes spirituall temporall knightes esquire gentleman costly rich apparell seuerall deuises fashion tooke vp horse best richest besene would aske long tyme yet omitte many thynges faile nombre thei verie many wherefore passe ouer dare well saie lacke scarsitie clothe tissue clothe golde clothe siluer broderie golde smithes workes plentie abundaunce hath seen redde tyme thereto many greate nombre chaines golde bauderikes bothe massy greate also kynges highnes rode twoo gentle menne richely appareled aboute body trauers thei beare twoo robe one duchie guyon duchie normandie hattes heddes poudered armyns estate thesame nexte folowed twoo persones good estate one bearyng cloke hatte appareled bothe golde smithes woorke broudery horse trapped burned siluer drawen ouer cordes grene silke gold edge border apparell beyng fretted gold damaske came six thomas brandon master kynges horse clothed tissue broudered rose fine gold trauerse body greate bauderike gold greate massy horse trapped golde leadyng rayne silke kynges spare horse trapped barde wise harneis broudered bullion golde curiously wroughte golde smithes nexte folowed nyne child honor vpon greate courser appareled body blewe ueluettes embrouderie gold smithes worke next folowyng ordre came quenes retinew lordes knightes esquire gentle menne degree well mounted richely appareled tissue clothe golde siluer tynsels ueluettes embroudered freshe goodly behold quene name katheryne sittyng litter borne twoo white palfreis litter couered richely appareled palfreis trapped white clothe gold persone appareled white satyn embrodered heire hangyng doune backe great length bewtefull goodly behold hedde coronall set many riche orient stone next sixe honorable personage white palfreis appareled clothe golde chariot couered lady therein appareled clothe golde another sort lady another chariot lady next chariot ordre euery degree clothe gold clothe siluer tynselles ueluet embrouderies euery couplement thesaied chariotes draught harnesse wer poudered armin mixt clothe gold muche ioye honor came westminster high preparacion made aswell thesaied coronacion also solempne feast iustes thervpon doen morowe folowyng beyng sondaie also midsomer daie noble prince quene time conuenient vnder canabies borne baron fiue porte went thesaied palaice westminster abbey vpon clothe called vulgarly cloth ray whiche clothe cut spoyled rude common people immediatly repaire abbey accordyng sacred obseruaunce auncient custome grace quene annoynted crouned archebusshop cantorbury prelate realme present nobilitie greate ultitude common thesame demaunded people whether thei would receiue obey take thesame moste noble prince kyng greate reuerence loue desire saied cried ye ye whiche solempnitie coronacion finished lordes spirituall teporall hym homage returned westminster hall quenes grace euery one vnd r canabies lorde marshall tipped staues made rome euery lord noble men accordyng tenure ore claimed vewed seen course trump ttes blew vp came duke buckyngham mounted vpon greate courser richely trapped enbroudered lorde stewarde likewise horse trapped clothe golde idyng seruice whiche sumpteous many subtlety straunge deuises seuerall pose many deintie dish kynges fete vnder table wer certain gentleman likewise quene continued long royall feast speake write supteous fine delicate meates prepared high honorable coronacio prouided aswel party beyond sea many u dery place within realme god abudantly hath sent suche plentie foyson honorable ordre seruices cleane handelyng breakyng meates ordryng dish ple tifull abundaunce none estate beeyng lacke honorable worshipfull persone went vnfeasted seconde course beyng serued haule doore entered knight armed poyntes base rich tissue embroudered great plume supteous oistriche fethers helmet sittyng great courser trapped tissue embroudered tharmes england fraunce herauld armes hym passyng halle prese ted hymself humble reuerence kynges maiestie garter kyng herauldes cried said loude voyce sir knight whece come pretence knightes name sir robert dimmocke champ kyng tenure enheritaunce answered thesaied kyng armes effecte maner sir place come form materiall cause repaire hether concernyng matter place cou trey onely commaunded heraulde make oyes saied knight kyng armes shal ye cause commyng pretence commaunded awne herauld proclamacion saie persone estate degree soeuer saie proue kyng henry eight rightfull enheritor kyng realme sir william dimmoke champion offre gloue fight querell persone thutteraunce whiche proclamacion made sundery place halle euery tyme gaun lette caste doune maintenaunce therof whiche seuerall proclamacios doen offer made thesaid knight champion eftsones repaired kynges presence demaundyng drinke kynges grace sent cup gold wine wherof knight droke demau ded couer thesaied cuppe whiche hym also deliuered doen departed halle thelaid cup couer awne maner tenure coronacion kyng shall go armarie cuppe gold couer awne vse departure thesaied champion kyng armes herauldes officer armes made pl clamacions seuerall place halle criyng largesse briefly passe ouer high long solempnitie honorable coronacio feast honorable great cesar many historiographer high set magnified latin englande promoted auaunsed dignity promocions onlesse thei firste poore clerkes party beyond sea exalte set furthe estes chronicle natiue countreys high laude praise parte truth small mede reward doo put writyng either englishe latin tongue noble triuphes chiualrous feates valiant actes victorious battailes noble iestes realme especiall tyme knowlege moste valiant goodly prince appere muche honorable story promocion benefice putte awaie laboure payne albeit greate parte theim saie high cure charge edifie people word god takyng cure soules replie displeasure perceiue thei take greate cure profite pursses pleasure huntyng haukyng besides pastymes thei come best promocion small kepyng hospitalitie whiche predecessor muche worse parte pastymes spent writyng settyng furthe iestes actes deedes nobilitie englande manyfold commodity thesame muche ennoble prince thereof seyng daily experience busshoppes archebusshoppes abbottes clarkes party beyonde sea aswell learned high knowlege better linage verteous thei daily enforce theimselfes auaunce prince realmes natiue countreis aswell latin vulgare toungue returne thende honorable feast table auoyded wafer brought sir stephen ieny tyme maior london kyng satte doune dynner dubbed knight whiche beganne erles table daie rose place satte serue kyng ipocras cuppe golde whiche cuppe grace dronken therof couer geue vnto thesaid sir stephen like predecessor maiors thesaied citie wont haue coronacion kyng surnap laied kynges grace b quene wasshed euery vnder clothes estate table beyng auoyded went vnto camber honor ennoblyng triumphaunt coronacio prepared bothe iustes turneis dooen palaice westminster kynges grace quene framed faire house couered tapissarie hanged riche clothes arrais thesaied palaice made curious fountain ouer castle toppe thereof greate croune emperiall imbatellyng rose pomegranetes gilded vnder aboute thesaied castle curions uine leaues grape thereof gilded fine golde walles thesame castle coloured white grene losengis euery losenge either rose pomegranet sheffe arrowes el h k gilded fine gold certain arch turrettes gilded support thesame castle targettes armes defendauntes appoynted thesaied iustes vpon sumpteously set seuerall place thesame castle aswell daie coronacio thesaid day iustes turney mouthes certain beastes gargels runne red white claret wine thenterprisers iustes thomas lorde haward heire apparaunt erle surrey sir edward haward admirall brother lorde richarde brother marque dorset sir edmod haward sir thomas kneuet charles brando esquire tropettes blew feld fresh yog galates noble menne gorgeously appareled curious deuises cuttes embrouderies aswell coates trapper horse gold siluer tynsels diuerse goldesmithes worke goodly behold first entered feld takyng vp turnyng horse netly freshly folowed deuise caried strength menne prouision framed like castle turret wrought fine clothe gold roppe wherof spred rose pomegranettes hangyng doune euery side thesaied deuise wherein lady bearyng shilde christall named pallas thesaied lorde haward compaignions folowed armed poyntes bass bardes trapper grene ueluet beaten rose pomegranetes golde brodered fringe damaske golde thesaied deuise turret beyng brought kyng lady pallas pre ented thesaied persones named scholers kynges highnes besechyng thesame accept scholers wer desirous serue hym encrease honor whiche saied scholers foote nombre hundred persones freshely appareled ueluettes sundery coloures hose bonettes accordyng thesame thesaied ladie desired kyng might please grace saied scholers might defendauntes al commers whiche request graunted came bende horse men freshly well appareled clothe golde siluer goldsmithes worke brouderie nomber three score trapper accordyngly garmentes greate bauderikes collers cheines golde aboute neckes trauerse body euery man coyfe golde hedde greate plume f thers therevpon one coloure enteryng felde drome fife greate nombre euery man takyng vp horse best maner aswell lady also laude praise bee geuen folowed good nombre foote men ueluettes silkes cutte embroudered hose thesame accordyngly bonettes furniture freshe lustie fashion nexte theim came horse backe eight persones whose name sir ihon pechy sir edwarde neuell sir edwarde guildeforde sir ihon carre sir wyllyam parre sir gyles capell sir griffith dun sir roulande armed also poyntes shyldes awne armes riche plume deuises hedde peces base trapper tissew clothe golde siluer veluet nexte theim gentle manne horsebacke coate blewe ueluet embroudered golde horse trapped suite spere golde thigh thesame presented quene saiyng enformed knightes compaignie dame pallas presented sixe scholers kyng whether thei came learne teache feactes armes thei knewe declared knightes come doo feactes armes loue lady wherefore besought grace license knightes proue theim selfes dame pallas schollers case schollers brake speres thesaied knightes viewe iudges report herauldes thesame knightes dooe theim thesaied scholers pallas knightes haue spere gold prise knightes brake speres dame pallas schollers thesaied knightes haue christall shilde whiche request theim graunted iustes beganne euery manne acquite hymself well valiauntly price knowe night commyng iustes ended next daie approched foresaied defender schollers pallas horsebacke armed cape pie one side base bardes horse white ueluet embroudered rose gold embrouderies side grene ueluet embroudered pomegranetes golde euery one theim hedde pece heare flatte golde damaske presented theimselfes kyng ready tourney immediatly parte came indiana knightes fore named eighte knightes ready armed bass bardes horse grene sattyn embroudered freshe deuises bramble branch fine golde curiously wroughte poudered ouer theim greate nombre horne blowen menne apparelled grene clothe cappes hosen like suite forsters kepers pagente made like parke paled pale white grene wherein wer certain fallowe dere thesame parke curious tree made crafte busshes fernes thynges likewise wroughte goodly beholde whiche parke deuise beeyng brought quene certain gate thereof opened dere ranne thereof palaice greye houndes lette slippe killed dere whiche dere killed presented quene lady foresaied knightes crocheman whiche daie broughte spere golde declared thesame knightes seruauntes diana beeyng pastyme huntyng newes brought vnto theim dame pallas knightes come party doo deedes armes wherefore thei lefte huntyng chase repaired also thether encounter knightes pallas fight loue lady thutterance saiyng pallas knightes vanquished made leue feld thei haue dere killed greye hou de slewe case diana knightes ouer came thei haue swordes none thyng whereupon quene lady sent kyng haue aduise pleasure behalfe grace conceiuyng grudge displeasure betwene theim thynkyng suche request wer theim graunted inconuenience might ensue would vnto agre appeasyng thereof awarded bothe party tourney togethers geuyng certain stroke whiche dooen thei departed iustes brake vp price geuen euery desertes yere kyng pardoned lorde henry brother duke buckyngham beeyng committed tower vpon suspicion treason laied vnto hym proued sone parliament created hym erle wylshire also yere kyng ordeined fiftie gentle menne bee speres euery theim haue archer dimilaunce custrell euery spere haue three greate horse bee attendaunt persone whiche bende erle essex lieuetenaunt sir ihon pechie capitain endured apparell charge greate none theim thei horse appareled trapped clothe golde siluer golde smithes woorke seruauntes richely appareled also yere also greate pestilence toune caleis muche people died muche kyng request counsaill caleis consideryng weakenes toune sent thether sir ihon pechie three hundred menne tary continued vnto suche time plague ceassed newe souldiours admitted suche roumes vacant returned englande furthermore yere kyng somoned parliament monethe nouembre whiche began moneth ianuari ensuyng whereof sir thomas inglefelde chosen speaker whiche session emonges thynges enacted ordeined aucthoritie parliament sir thomas empson knighte edmund dudeley esquire late counsailers kyng henry seuenth wer attainted hault treason thesame yere plague greate reigned diuerse partes realme kyng kept christemas richemond xii daie ianuarie diuerse gentleman freshely appareled prepared self iuste vnknowen kynges grace whereof beyng secretly informed caused hymself one priuie chambre called willya compton bee secretly armed litle parke richemond came iustes vnknowen persones vnloked kyng ranne neuer openly wer broken many staues greate praise geuen twoo straungers specially one whiche kyng howebeit course misfortune sir edward neuell esquire brother lorde burgainie runne master cumpton hurte hym sore likely dye one persone knew kyng cried god saue king al people wer astonied kyng discouered hymself greate comforte people kyng sone came westminster quene train tyme beyng grace therles essex wilshire noble menne nombre twelue came sodainly mornyng quenes chambre appareled shorte cote kentishe kendal hodes heddes hosen thesame euery one bowe arrowes sworde bucklar like lawes robyn hodes men whereof quene lady al abashed aswell straunge fight also sodain commyng certain daunces pastime made thei departed shroue sunday thesame yerea banket kyng prepared goodly banket parliament chambre westmin ter ambassadours whiche wer diuerse realme countreis banket beyng ready kyng leadyng quene entered chambre lady ambassadours noble menne folowed ordre kyng caused quene kepe estate satte ambassadours lady thei marshalled kyng would sit walked place place makyng chere quene straungers sodainly kyng gone shortly grace erle essex came appareled turkey fashio long robe bawdkin powdered gold hattes heddes crimosyn ueluet greate rolles gold girded two swordes called c teries hangyng greate bawderikes gold next came lorde henry erle wilshire lorde fitzwater twoo long gounes yelowe satin trauarsed white satin euery bend white bend crimosen satin fashio russia ruslande urred hattes greye hedes either hauyng hatchet handes bootes pykes turned vp came syr edward haward admyral hym syr thomas parre doblettes crimosin veluet voyded lowe backe cannell bone lased breastes chaynes siluer ouer shorte clokes crimosyn satyne heades hattes dauncers fashion feasauntes fethers theim appareyled fashion prusia spruce torchebearers appareyled crymosyn satyne grene lyke moreskoes theyr face blacke kyng brought mommerye quene lordes ladyes would played sayd mommers departed put thesame apparel sone entred chamber vsuel apparell kyng made great chere quene ladyes ambassadours supper banket ended table auoyded kyng beeyng communicacion ambassador quene lady toke place degree began dausyng euery man toke muche hede daused kyng perceyuing withdrew hym selfe sodenly place certayn person appoynted purpose within litle whyle came drumme fi e appareiled white damaske grene bonettes h sen thesame sure certayn gentelmen folowed torch apparayled blew damaske purseled ames grey facioned lyke awbe heddes hodes robbes longe tippettes thesame blew damaske visarde came certayne number gentelmen wherof kyng one apparayled one sewte shorte garmentes litle beneth poyntes blew ueluet crymosyne log eues cut lyned clothe golde vtter parte garmentes powdered ca el shefes arrowes fyne doket gold vpper partes hosen lyke sewte facion nether partes scarlet poudred tymbrelles fyne golde heades bonets damaske syluer flatte wouen stole therupon wrought gold ryche fethers visers entred vi ladyes wherof twoo appareyled crymosyn satyne purpull enbrowdered golde vynye te ran oure delices golde maru ylous ryche stra ge heades two ladyes crymosyne purpull made lyke long slop enbroudered fret gold antike fashion ouer garment short garment clothe golde scant knee facioned like tabard ouer small double rolles flatte golde damaske fret frysed golde theyr heades skayus wrapper damaske golde flatte pypes straunge beholde two ladyes kyrtels crymosyne purpul satyn enbroudered vynet pomegraneltes golde garmetes cut compasse wyse hauing demy sleues naked doune elbowes ouer garmentes vochettes pleasantes rouled crymsyne veluet set wt letter golde lyke carectes heades rouled pleasauntes typpe lyke egipcians enbroudered golde face neckes armes handes couered fyne pleasaunce blacke call lumberdynes marueylous thine thesame lady semed nyg ost blacke more foresayed vi ladyes lady mary syster vnto kyng one name kynges grace ladyes daunsed certayne tyme departed euery one hys lodgyng yere kyng henry vii executours made restitucion great summes money many person taken good consc ece sayde kynges vse forenamed empson dudley thys yere also came ambassadours kyng arrago castell realme hyghly entertayned royally receyued repayred muche courte happened daye certayn noble men made wager runne rynge party taken whych partye atteyned toke awaye ringe oftenest certayne course wynne wager wherof kynges grace hearing offered one partye vi companion ambassadours hearynge therof muche desirous se fhys wager tryed specially ambassadours spaigne neuer seen kyng harneys daye apointed king mounted godly courser trapped purpull veluet cutte inner syde wherof wrought flatte golde damaske stoole veluet syde cut letter gold appered though enbroudered certayne reason poyses ueluet betwene letter fastyned castels shefes arrowes doket golde garmet eues compased ouer hys harneys base thesame worke great plume fethers hys head peace came doune arion hys sadell great company freshgentelmen came grace rychely armed decked many right gorgeously appareyled tro pettes goodly beholde wherof many straugers specially spagniardes much reioysed neuer seen kynge tyme armed syde came bende gentelmen freshely appareyled pleasaunt beholde appareyled clothe golde chekered flatte golde damaske poudered rose euery man ranne conclude pryce geue vnto king euery man dyd runne xii course kyng dyd beare awaye rynge v tymes atteyned iii course thus fynished spanish ambassadours desyred haue badge deuises whiche kynges trapper hys grace therof knowynge commaunded euery take therof pleased effect toke parte beginnyng thought bene counterfait golde yere diuers realmes countreys came many ambassadours fraunce denemarke scotlande realmes whych hyghly enterteyned pthe ii yere may daye next folowyng ii yere hys reygne hys grace beynge yonge willyng dell rose mornynge early fetche may grene bow hym self freshe rychely appareyled clothed knyghtes squyers gentelmen whyte satyn hys garde yomen croune whyte sarcenet went euery bowe arrowes shotyng woode repaired courte euery man grene bough cappe returnyng many hearynge gooyng maiyng desirous se hym shote tyme grace shotte strong greate length hys garde came hys grace certayn man bowe arrowes desyred hys grace take uster hym se hym shote tyme hys grace contented man put hys one fote hys bosome dyd shote shote good shote wel towardes hys marke whereof onely hys grace greatly merueyled kynge gaue hym reward hys doynge whiche person afterwardes people courte called ote bosome thesame yere feast pentecoste holden grenewyche say thursday thesame w ke hys grace two hym chalenged commers fighte theim barrier targot casting spere viii fote long done grace sayde two aydes fight euery xii stroke twohanded swordes agaynst commers none except beyng gentelma kyng behaued hym selfe wel deliuered selfe valiauntly hys hardy prowes greate strength prayse laude geuen hys grace hys aydes notwithstadyng diuers valyaunt stronge person assayled hym hys aydes thence whole courte remoued wyndesore begynnyng hys progresse exercisyng hym self dayly shotyng singyng dau syng wrastelyng casting barre plaiyng recorder flute virginal setting songes makyng balettes dyd set ii goodly mass euery fyue partes whiche songe tentymes hys chapel afterwardes diuers place whan came okyng kept iustes turneys rest thys progresse spent huntyng hawkyng shotyng kyng beyng thus hys progresse harde euery daye complayntes empson dudleyempson dl ehedded wherfore sent wryttes shyrifes london put execucion xvii day august behedded towre hyl body buryed heades sayde progresse finished grace quene al whole trayne moneth october folowyng remoued grenewyche kyng mynded se yong gentelmen vnexpert marcial eates caused place prepared within parke grenewyche quene ladyes stande se ighte battaill ax shoulde done king hym self armed fought one gyot gentelman almayne talle man good man armes done marched alwayes two two togethers dyd feates enterprise euery man wel albeit happened sayde gyot fight syr edward haward gyot hym stryken grounde morow enterprise done kyng quene came towre london thentent displeasure malice borne gentelmen fought axe agaynst kyng gaue vnto certayn summe golde valewed cc marke make banket emongest selfes whiche banket made fishemongers halle teames strete met number xxiiii appareyled one sute liuery almain fashion say vtter garmentes yealow satyne yealow hosen yealow shoe gyrdels scaberdes bonettes yealow fethers garmentes hosen cutte lyned whyte satyn scaberdes wounde bought satyne banket ended thei went torche light towre presentinge selfes kynge toke pleasure beholde thence viii daye nouember grace remoued rychemond willed declared noble men getelmen hys grace two aide wit mayster charles brandon mayster compton duryng two dayes would answer al commers spere tylt one daye turney swordes accomplishe enterprice xiii daye nouember hys grace armed peces hys two aydes entred feelde base trapper clothe gold set redde rose ingreyled gold brouderye counterparte came freshly appareyled euery man deuise iustes king brake staues therfore pryce turney likewyse honor second night diuers straugers maximilian emperours court ambassadours spaygne yng supper supped kyng willed go quenes chamber meane season kynge xv appareled almayne iackettes crymosyne purple satyne log quar ered sleues hosen thesame sute bonettes whyte veluet wrapped flat golde damaske visers white plume came mo mery certayne yme played quene straungers departed sodenly entred vi mynstrels rychely appareled plaiyng instrumentes folowed xiiii persones gentelmen appareyled yealow satyne cut like almaynes bearyng torch came vi disguised whyte satyne grene enbroudered set letter castels fyne golde bullion garmentes straunge facion also straunge cuttes euery cutte knytte wyth poyntes yne golde tassel thesame hosen cutt tyed likewyse bonettes clothe syluer wounde golde fyrst vi kyng erle essex charles brandon syr edward hawarde syr thomas kneuet syr hery guylforde parte getelmen bearing torch departed shortly returned whome came vi ladyes appareled garmentes crymosyn satyn enbroudered trauessed cloth gold cut pomegranettes yoke strynged facion spaygne sayde vi men dauced vi lady dau ced season lady toke men visa wherby knowen whereof quene straungers moch praised kyng ended pa ime noted tyme quene great childe shortly pastyme toke chamber richemond whiche cause kynge kept hys christmas newyeres daye first day ianuary quene deliuered prince great gladnes realme honor whome fyers made diuers vessel wyne set suche woulde take therof certayne streates london generall procession thereupon laude god touchynge preparacion prince christening ouerpasse honorablie done whose godfather fout archebishop caunterbury erle surrey godmother lady katheryne countesse deuonshire daughter kynge edward fourth agaynste xii daye daye epiphanie nighte banket hal richemond pageaut deuised like mou tayne glisteringe night thoughe golde set stone top mountayne tree golde braunches bowes frysed golde spredynge euery side ouer mountayne rose pomegarnettes mountayne vice brought vp towardes kyng thesame came ladye appare led cloth golde chyldren honor called henchemen whiche freshely disguised daunced morice kyng done reentred moutaine drawen backe wassaill banket brought brake vp christmas shortly quenes churchinge kynge rode walsingham quene beyng churched purified kyng remoued rychemonde westmynster preparacion solempne iustes honor quene kyng beyng one thre aydes grace beyng called cure lo al ye lorde william erle deuonshire called bon volo sir thomas kneuet named bon espoir sir edwarde neuile called valiaunt desire whose name set vpon goodly table table hanged tree curious wrought called le quater chiualers de la f rrest saluigne foure runne tilte agaynst comer certayne article coprised said table place pallayce prepared kynge also quene rychely hanged inner parte cloth golde vtter ryche clothe arras iustes beganne xiii daye february quene trayne ladyes taken place pallays conueyed pag aut great quantite made like forest rockes hilles dale diuers sundrie tree floures hathornes fer e grasse six forsters sta dynge within thesame forrest garnyshed cote hodes grene ueluet whome lay great number speres tree herbes floures thesame forrest made grene ueluet grene damaske silke diuers colour satyn sercenet middes forrest ca ell standing made golde castel gate sat gentelman freshly appare led makynge garlande rose pryce forrest drawen strength twoo great beastes lyon ant lop lyon floryshed ouer damaske golde antelop wrought ouer siluer damaske hys beames horne tuskes golde beastes led certayne men appareiled like wilde men woodhouses body heddes face handes legges couered grene sylke flosshed either sayde antelop lyon sate ladye richely appareiled beastes tyed pageant greate chaynes golde horse carte pageant rested quene forenamed forsters blew horne deuise pageant opened side issued foresayde foure knyghtes armed peces euery spere hande horsebacke great plume heddes bass trapper clothe gold euery name enbroudered hys basse trapper parte great noyse aswell trompettes dro me entred felde erle essex lord thomas hawarde many cleane armed trapper bass crymosyn satyn enbroudered braunches pomegarnettes golde posy wyth many freshe gentelman rydynge theyr fotemen also well appareiled iustes beganne endured daye morow beyng xiii daye february dynner tyme conuenient quene ladyes repaired see iustes trompettes blew vp came many noble man gentelma rychely appareiled takynge vp horse whome folowed certayne lordes appareiled horse cloth golde usset tynsell knyghtes clothe golde usset ueluet greate number gentelmen fote russet satyn yealow yomen russet damaske yealow nether parte euery man hosen skarlet yealow cappes came kynge vnder pauilion clothe golde purpul ueluet enbroudered poudered h k fyne golde compas pauilion aboue enbroudered rychely valenced flat golde beten wyre imperiall croune top fyne golde hys base trapper clothe gold fretted damaske gold trapper pedant tail crane chafron stele frount chafro goodly plume set full muser trimblyng spangle golde folowed three aydes euery vnder pauilion crymosyn damaske purple poudred h k fyne golde valenced frynged golde damaske top euery pauilion greate k golde smythes worke number gentelmen yomen attendant fote appareiled russet yealow clxviii next pauilions came xii chyldren honor sitting euery great courser rychely trapped enbroudered seuerall deuises facions lacked neither brouderie goldsmythes worke euery chyld horse deuice facion contrary whiche goodly beholde counter part entred syr charles bradon fyrst horsbacke long robe russet satyn like recluse religious person hys horse trapped thesame sewte without dromme noyse mynstrelsye puttinge byll peticion quene effect wherof would please licence hym runne presence woulde gladly woulde departe came hys request graunted put hys sayde habyte armed peces ryche base horse also rychely trapped runne hys horse tylte ende diuers men fote appareiled russet satyn awaited next came alone young henry guylford esquier hym selfe hys horse russet cloth golde clothe siluer closed deuice pageant made lyke castel turret wrought russet sercenet florence wrought set golde hys worde posye al men russet satyn white hosen thesame bonettes like color demaunding also licence quene runne whiche graunted toke place thende tylte came next marque dorset syr thomas bulleyn like two pilgrems sainct iames aberdes blacke ueluet palmer hattes helmettes wyth long iacobs staues handes horse trapper blacke ueluet taberdes hattes trapper set scaloppe schelles fyne golde strippes blacke ueluet euery rip set scalop shell seruautes blacke satyn scalop shelles gold breastes sone came lord henry buckyngham erle wylshire hym selfe horse appareiled cloth siluer enbroudered posye worde arrowes golde posye called la son du refuge made crymosyn damaske broudered rose arrowes golde tope greyhonde siluer bearinge tree pomegarnettes golde braunches thereof large ouer sprede pagent partes entred syr gyles capell syr roulande many knightes rychely armed appareiled thus beganne iustes whiche valiauntly acheued kyng aydes emoges whome hys grace atteyned ye price iustes fynished euery man drew kynge disarmed time couenient quene heard euesong night ambassadours supped kyng great banket soupper hys grace quene lordes ladyes came white hall within sayde pallays whiche hanged rychely hall sca olded ray ed partes interlude gentelmen hys chapell grace diuers freshe songes done hys grace called hym great man lord irelad called odouell whome presence sayde ambassadours made knyght mynstrels beganne playe lordes ladyes beganne daunce moste pastyme persones moste atte tyue beholde daunsyng king sodenly gone vnknowen moste parte people oneles quene certayne within littell hys departing trompettes thende hall began blow deuice pageaut vpo wheles brought pageaut issued ge telman rychelye appareiled shewed howe garden pleasure arber golde wherin lordes ladyes moche desirous shew pleasure pastyme quene ladyes might licenced aunswered quene desyrous se theim pastyme great cloth arras dyd hang thesame pageaut taken awaye pageaunt brought nere curiously made pleasaut beholde solempne ryche euery post piller therof couered frise golde therin tree hathorne eglantynes rosiers uynes pleasaunt floures diuers colour gillofers herbes made satyn damaske silke siluer golde accordingly natural tree herbes floures ought arber vi ladyes appareiled white satyn grene set enbroudered full h k golde knytte together lace golde damaske garmentes replenyshed glytteringe spangle gylt ouer heddes bonettes opened iiii quarter ouerfrysed flat gold damaske ye ellettes rolles wrethed lampas douck holow golde shewed thorow ye lapas douck ye fassis head set ful new deuised facions garde also kyng v appareiled garmetes purple satyn cuttes wt h k euery edge garnished frysed gold euery garmet ful poysees made letter fyne gold bullyo thicke might euery persone name like letter massy gold fyrst cuer loyall secod bone volure iii bone espoier iiii valyaut desyre fyst bone foy vi moure loyall hose cappes cote full poyses h k fyne gold bullio groude could ace apere yet euery voyde place spagels gold whetime come sayd pageat brought forth presence disceded lord lady coples mynstrels disguised also dauced lorde ladyes daunced pleasure beholde meane season pagiaunt conueyed ende place tary till daunces finished haue receyued lordes ladyes againe sodanly rude people ranne pagent rent tare spoyled pagent lord stuard head officer could cause abstaine excepte shoulde haue foughten drawen bloude soo pagent broken kyng hys copaignions dauced appoynted ladyes gentelwomen ambassadours take letter garmentes token liberalitie thyng common people perceyuyng ranne kyng stripped hym hys hosen dublet hys compaignions likewise syr thomas kneuet stode stage defence lost hys apparell ladyes likewyse spoyled wherfore kynges garde came sodenly putte people backe el supposed inconuenience ensued kyng quene ladyes returned chamber great banket hurtes turned laughyng game thought taken awaye honor large triumphe ended myrthe gladnes banket shipeman london caught certayn letter sould goldsmyth iiilxiiiisviiid reason wherof appeared garmentes great value great ioy came sorowfull chaunce young prince borne vpon newyeres daye last past vpon xxii daye february beyng eue sainct mathy departed world rychemonde thense caryed westmynster buryed kyng lyke wyse prynce toke dolorous chaunce wonderous wysely comfort quene dissimuled matter made great mourning outwardely quene lyke naturall woman made much lamentacion kynges good persuasion behauior sorowe mytigated shortlye thys yere also moneth februarie came fro kyng ferdinado kynges father law kynge arragon castell certayne ambassadours whiche made request kynge behalfe kyng mayster haue ayde kynge xvc archer valyaunt capitaynes gouerne conduyte hys entent make warre moore beynge infideles enemy god law kyng counsayl hearing request thoughte muche honorable ayde christian prynce especiall hys frende father lawe agaynste infideles enemyes christes lawe wherfore kyng gentely graunted request tydinges spread courte iorney agaynst infideles lorde thomas darcye knyght order gartier made hu ble suyte kynge capitayne general crewe armye kyng hys counsayll hys great valiantnes approued wysedome graunted hys request many lordes knyghtes made suyte thesame iorney kyng answered retayned still greater consideracions purpose apoynted go sayd lord darcie lord anthony grey brother marque dorset henry guyldeford westo broune wiliam sydney esquyers kynges house syr robert costable syr roger haystynges syr raufe elderkare diuers gentelme capitaynes lord darcie capitaynes toke leue kyng went countreys prouide thinges mete necessarie voiage kynge thys tyme moche entysed playe tennes dice appetite certayn craftie persones hym perceyuynge brought frenchman lombardes make wager hym lost moch money perceyued crafte exchuyd compaignie let go kyng beyng lustye young coragious greatly delited feates chyualrie moch made chalenge iustes agaynst comer proclaimed mannoure grenewyche holden iii first dayes may next ensuyng noble courage yonge persones highly praysed auncient father moch doubted consideringe tender youth kyng diuers chaunces horse moch openly spoken stele stronge might broken horse coulde sure fote maye fall yet doubtes lusty prince proceded chalenge first daye maye kynge accompaignied many lusty batchelers greate well doyng horse rode wodde fetch may man might haue seen many horse raysed highe wyth galope turne stoppe meruaylous behold iii syr edward haward charles brandon edward neuel chalengers kyng shyfted selfes cote grene satyn garded crymosyn ueluet parte earles essex deuenshyre marque dorset lorde haward crymosyn satyn garded pouced garde grene ueluet retornyng hyll mete shippe vnder sayle master hayled kyng noble compaignie sayde maryner come many straunge porte came hither se dedes armes done countrey whiche mighte make report thereof countreys heraulde demaunded name shippe aunswered called fame laden good renoune sayde heraulde wil bring shippe bay hard ne must double poynt ge ne shall se compaignie medle merchaundise sayd kyng sythen renowne merchaundyse let v bye shippe shotte pele ennys sayled forthe kynges compaignie ful flagges banner till came tylte year e nonne kyng thre felowes entred felde bardes base crimosyn blew ueluet cut quadrat cuttes embroudered full pomgranettes wayters sylke thesame colour partie crymsyn satyn grene ueluet beganne trompettes sounde horse runne many spere brast many great strype geuen trueth kyng exceded nuber staues euery daye iii dayes wherfore iii day quene made great baket kyng iusted baket done gaue ye chefe pryce kyng ii erle essex iiii erle deuoshyre iii lord marque dorset ye herauldes cryed lordes noble feates armes god sende loue lady ye desire pthe iii yere king euer desirous serue mar bega another iustes ye xv day ye sayd moneth ye kyng bend grene sylke ye erle essex bende blew garded gold speres paynted thesame colour good runing many spere brast sport euery man feared lest yll chauce might happe kyng fayne would haue loker rather doer spake therof much thei durst courage noble would euer one ende passe tyme lord darcy appoynted vyage agaynst moore barbaria instaunce dopefernado rather quene made suche diligence people ready plymmouth middes may mustered souldiers lorde broke kinges commissioner sayde lord darcie capitayne generall ordeyned hys prouost marshal henry guylford esquier lusty yongma wel beloued kyng winde serued purpose armye set aborde shippes whiche vytaled prest poyntes capitayne departed plymmouth haue monday rogacio weke iiii shippes royal wynde fauourable firste daye iune beynge euen feast pentecost arriued porte caleys southspayne immediatly aduice counsayll dispatched kyng arragon two gentilmen called ihon barthelmew william symonde letter certefie king counsayll arriuall payne taken come countrey fulfilling kyng maisters commaundement messingers moch came kyng beside citie cyuill lay declared hym lord darcie kyng maisters apoyntement come thither xvic archer mo according sayd kyng arragons request laye still caleys know pleasure kyng arragon aunswered gentelly lord darcie come hys best beloued sonne welcome hartely thanked theim paynes prayed messenger retorne capitaine shewing hym kyng haste would sende cousail departed kyng made reporte lord darcie kept shippe great estate would lade onely suffered sicke feble go lande englishme went lande fell drinking hote wynes scace maisters theim selfes ranne stewes brake hegges spoyled orchardes vyneyardes orynges ripe many outragious dedes wherfore che e toune caleys came complaine lorde darcie hys shippe sent forth prouost marshal scacelie peyne rayned yomen archer hote wil ull yet comaundement policie brought borde shippes saterdaye viii daye iune bishop kynges counsayll arryued caleys abode tyll wednysdaye beyng euen corpus christi daye lord capitayne toke lande honorably receyued kynge arragons counsayl morrow highly fe ed dynner supper supper bishop declared kynge arragons pleasure saiyng lord capitayne kyng maister moste humble wy geueth thankes greate paynes trauell mo though proceded pretensed enterprice aduice counsaill circumspectly considering suertie awne realmes dominion hathe perfectie knowlege aduersarye fraunce prepareth inuade hys coutreis hys absence wher ore entending leue realmes voyde men shippes whiche might great comfort enemyes inuade therfore hathe taken abstinence warre moore tyll another time well saieth lorde darcie sythe fully concluded shall seruice maister maye saye agaynst determinacion cosidering sent surely agaynste hart whiche euer hath desired fight agaynst god enemyes conclusion myne must content said bishop kyng maister geueth like thankes kynge sonne though proceded iorney shall haue wage souldiers shall please come court shall receyue high thankes kyng made desire sayed lorde darcie men shal say brought cou trie selfe pleasure leaue theim without hedde men men forsaken nay nay lorde kynges banket desire lordes departed night next day mornyng sent wage conduict tharmie england diuerse giftes geuen lord darcie gentle men yet ye notwithstandyng highly displeased beit like wise man dissimuled ye matter thesame daie beyng xiiii daie iune fridaie englishe manne desired maide baker bye bread maistres store sell haue lofe money aunswered none sell said would haue one folowed perceiued cried force force tounes men caleis caleis male sodainly rong common bell toune went harneis fewe englishman wer lande wet bowes spaniardes cast dartes sore anoyed hurt englishman thei likewise hurte slew diuerse spanyardes capitaines englande parte lordes counsaill parte toke suche pain fraie seased one englisheman slain spanyardes diuerse slain englishe menne commaunded go aborde shippes lordes spayne came lorde darcie saiyng sir praie sithe knowe kynges pleasure haue wage people go shippes awaie perceiue owe v displeasure boldly answered saiyng would worlde knewe able condu menne homewarde bryng theim countrey without kyng arragos wage sauyng honor raie without knowlege night men went aborde shippes iorney come poynt henry guilforde westo browne willyam sidney young lustie esqutres desired license see courte spayne whiche theim graunted thei departed caleis came courte kyng arragon thei wer highly entertained dubbed henry guildford west n browne knightes gaue sir henry guilforde canton granado sir westo browne egle scicile cheffe augmentacion armes william sidney excused made knight thei soiornied thei tooke leaue kyng quene returned fraunce england thei demained theselfes thei kynges fauoure notwithstandyng thought contrary duryng whiche season lorde darcie xvii daie iune made saile towarde englande arriued plimmouthe came kyng wyndsore august thus ended voyage duryng tyme lorde darcie spayne ladie margaret duches sauoy daughter maximilian themperor gouernor countreis flaunders brabant holland zelade lowe countreis apperteinyng charles yong prince castell beeyng tendre age sent thende maij kyng england haue xvc archer aide duke geldres sore trobled coutreis aforsaid kyng tendrely regardyng request noble lady also communicacio hangyng tyme mariage betwene young prince charles lady marie sister moste iently grauted request appoynted sir edward pounynges knight garter coptroller house valiant capitain noble warrior lieuetenaunt conducter thesaid xvc archer whiche accopaignied lord clynto sonne lawe sir mathew broune sir ihon dighby ihon werton richard whethrill sherley esquire diuerse tal gentleman yomen well knowen men tried thesaid nombre xvc toke shippyng mile beside sadwiche xviii daie iuly landed armew xix daie without troble reason litle storme sent lancastre herauld auertise lady arriuall whiche sent lord bresley knight toyson diuerse welcome conduited barow lorde toune made greate chere thesame day noone came lady margaret barow capitain vnder capitaines receiued gate welcomed hartely souldiers whiche stode long reinged strete saterdaie beyng xxvi daie iuly sawe copaignie shote thesame night capitain toke leaue morowe beeyng sondaie departed rossindale thursday last daie iuly came buldike daie ladie margaret came thether next day whole armie almaines flemynges apperteinyng thesaied lady met thenglishemen without buldike set furth ordre lady margaret beyng present toke leue capitaines departed buldike sir edwarde pounynges conduited toune gate returned tharmie tharmie nombre xm lady part xvc englishman passed brabant came x daie august beyng laurece daie litle castle stadyng higher side riuer mase called brymuoyst strongly bulwarked whiche wer c men belongyng bastarde gelders capitain called lankessell van gelder whiche robbed spoyled party brabat thei within shot fiercely tharmy passed litle hurt thesame night thomas hert chief gouernor theglish part made approch ordinauce mornyng bet doune much might beaten doune bulwarkes next daie beyng xi august castle assaulted valiantly take force capitain lxxx odde men wer slain xix taken xi wer hanged ihon mor capitain c englishme one guiot esquire burgoin criyng burgoyne george one englisheman slain thursdaie xiiii daie tharmie feried oeur riuer mase land geldres soiornied litle churche ladie daie assumpcion night nexte daie thei came toune called aiske belongyng bastarde geldres people wer fled vndermined caste doune litle castle standyng thesaid riuer newly edified xx august thei brent toune aiske brent al cou trey aboute came last toune called straulle strong toune double diked walled within iiiclx good men warre beside inhabitauntes whiche firste commyng shot gonne fiercely hurte many thei planted siege sir edward pounynges whiche euer forward archer caused fagottes made trench digged cast men wer diligent trenche mornyng approched nye toune gate thei within wer halfe dismaied desired speake lordes thei barthelmewes euen sixe men sent toune treate sixe hostage deliuered theim agreed men warre departe white sticke handes orfet thynges toune dweller bee prisoner prince castle next daie men warre wer departed erly mornyng sir ihon dighby knight ihon norton esquire toke possession toune cc englishe menne none admirall flaunders sir edward pounynges lorde discilstain chief capitaines tharmie noble men trupettes arthoys lancastre ostriche officer armes coates armes theim gorgeously appareied entered toune toune hall toke thothe thinhabitantes night returned armie xxvi daie thesame moneth sir ihon dighby ihon norton came toune englishman entered capitain called yonker otes ccl almaines kepe garrison whiche daie armie went uenlow sent artoys trumpet somon toune thei would speke shot gunnes theim xxviii daie armie remoued vnto northside uenlow part went ouer water made trench water capitain englishemen made trench euen toune diche artilerie bet doune tower walles euery daie skirmishe xxix daie certain englishemen went foragyng happened x sir ihon dighbes men go v mile armie mete xxiiii horsmen geldres set thei withdrew themselfes litle garden shot enemy slewe twoo horseman v horse gauled hurte many discomfited remnant brought two greate horse tharmie euery man sore hurte perell death thaked god siege thus continuyng without skirmish xxix day sir edward pounynges sir ihon dighby dined monsire de rony englishe capitaines petie capitaines dined almain called clene anderlyne except sir mathew broune ihon fogge whiche kepte felde richard wethill whiche kepte trenche sore besette dinner tyme thei toune issued thenglishemen hurte toke one sheldwiche ca terbury prisoner one mile thenglishmen hurt slewe many theim compelled theim returne force arrowes thei reculed one prisoner mile whiche led betwene two gelders perceiuyng rescue commyng came hill thurst two gelders doune hill hym ranne backe compaignie thyng two gelders led hym perceiuyng ranne sheldwiche slew burgonions perceiuyng sir edwarde pownynges displeased chaunce exhorted hym menne assault toune whiche thaduise bastard emery answered cause maisters gatte toune assault kyng master haue thei would geue assaulte would ioyne theim whiche thyng thei would thei kinsemen frendes within toune sauyng one daie fewe almaines assaulted bulwerke wer slain taken englishe capitaines perceiuyng thei laye vain co sideryng strength toune also armie nombre enuiron toune euer thei one gate open wrote kyng whiche willed spede returne thei sir edward pownynges went court burgoyn highly enterteined young prince lady margaret aunte receiued great thakes giftes pain cacapitaines sir ihon norton sir ihon fogge sir ihon scot sir thomas lind made knightes prince lady margaret perceiuyng coates souldiers bee foule liyng ground euery man lay tent gaue euery yoman cote wollen clothe yelowe red white grene coloures litle laude praise emong thenglishmen sir edward pounynges highly feasted praised men valiantnes good ordre people returned copaignie england lost warre sickenes fully c persones englishemen departed geldres issued daily made skirmisshes fray burgonions asked archer wynter beganne sharpely approche aboundaunce rayne riuer masse roase high trench drouned force menne compelled remoue capitaynes considered strengthe towne howe fortified victayled manned howe rysyng ryuer made stronger thei determined rayse siege burne destroye uillages townes aboute whiche toune uelow haue succor winter mete prime tyme yere thus siege raised countrey wasted spoyled euery capitain returned home iune kyng beyng leicester tidynges wer brought hym andrew barton scottishe manne pirate sea saiyng kyng scottes warre portingales rob euery nacion stopped kynges stremes merchauntes almost could passe toke thenglishemenes goodes said thei wer portyngales goodes thus haunted robbed euery haues mouthe kyng moued greately craftie pirate sent sir edmond haward lord admirall england lorde thomas haward sonne heire therle surrey hast sea whiche hastely made redy two shippes without abode toke sea chaunce wether seuered lorde haward liyng dounes perceiued andrew making toward scotlade fast thesaied lorde chased ouer tooke hym sore battaill thenglishmen wer fierce scottes defended manfully euer andrew blewe whistell encorage men yet al lorde haward men cleane rength entred mayne decke englishemen entered side scottes foughte sore hatch conclusion andrewe taken whiche sore wounded died remnaunte scottes wer taken shippe called lion al lord admirall chace barke scotlande called ienny pirwyn whiche wont saile lion compaignie muche laied hym borde fiercely assailed hym scottes hardy well stomaked men defended lorde admirall encoraged menne thei entered barke slewe many toke thus wer two shippes taken brought blacke wal seconde daie august scottes sent bishoppes place yorke remained kynges charge til direccion taken theim kyng sent bishop winchester certain counsaill tharchebishop yorkes place scottes wer prisoner bishop rehersed wher peace yet betwene england scotland thei contrary theues pirate robbed kynges subiectes within stremes wherfore thei deserued die law hanged low water marke said scottes knowlege oftence aske mercie lawe priest also prisoner said lordes appele kinges iustice mercy bishop asked wer aucthorised say thei cried al yea yea said shal find kinges mercy aboue iustice wher wer ded ye law yet mercy wil reuiue wherfore shal depart realme within xx day vpon pain death bee founde xx daie praie kyng thei passed countrey kyng scottes hearyng death andrewe barton takyng twoo shippes wonderfull wrothe sent letter kyng requiryng restitucion accordyng league amitie kyng wrote brotherly salutacios kyng scottes robbery euill dooynges andrew barton became one prince laie breache league another prince doyng iustice vpon pirate thiefe scottes taken deserued dye iustice extended mercie answere scottishe herauld departed home duryng season began greate warre betwene pope iuly frenche kyng loys xii occasion beganne one ihon bentiuoyle greate lorde italie whiche kepte citee boloignele grace pope whiche aide frenche kyng gatte thesaied citee forenamed ihon bentiuoyle afterward thesaid pope iuly tooke peace uenecians frenche kyng turned pope made warre hym behalfe ihon bentiuoyle toke hym thesaid citee boloigne kyng englande wrote often kyng loys fraunce desist persecutyng pope whiche frende confederate whiche writyng gaue litle regard wherefore kyng sent hym woorde deliuer hym lawfull enheritaunce bothe duchie normadie guyan countreis aniow mayne also croune fraunce el would come suche power fine force would obtein purpose writinges frenche kyng still made warre italie kyng could hym haue certain determinate answere wherefore greate deliberacion aduise counsaill determined make warre frenche kyng countreis called hym maximilian emperor ferdinand kyng arragon diuerse prince made preparacion bothe sea lande fortified frontier fraunce set furth shippes sea defence merchauntes whiche wer daily ieoperdy vnder pretensed peace frenche kyng lewes xii kyng yere kep reast christmas grenewiche wher suche abundaunce viades serued comer honest behauor hath fewe time seen newyeres night made halle castle gate tower dungion garnished artilerie weapon moste warlike fashion frount castle written le fortresse dangerus within castle wer vi lady clothed russet satin laide ouer leues golde euery owde knit lace blewe silke golde heddes coyfes cappes gold castle caried hal quene behelde came kyng fiue appareled coates one halfe russet satyn spangeld spangels fine gold halfe riche clothe gold heddes cappes russet satin embroudered workes fine gold bullio vi assaulted castle lady seyng lustie coragious wer content solace vpon farther communicacion yeld castle thei came doune daunced long space lady led knightes castle castle sodainly vanished sightes daie epiphanie night kyng xi disguised maner italie called maske thyng seen afore englande thei appareled garmentes long brode wrought gold visers cappes gold banket doen masker came sixe gentleman disguised silke bearyng staffe torch desired lady daunce content knewe fashion refused thyng commonly seen thei daunced commoned together fashion maske thei tooke leaue departed quene lady xv daie ianuarij began parliament bisshop cantorburie began oracion verse iusticia pax osculate sunt vpon whiche declared iustice bee ministered peace bee nourished meanes iustice put peace nrned warre vpon shewed freche kyng would iustice restoryng kyng right enhe auce wherefore lacke iustice peace necessitie must turne warre parliament graunted twoo fiftenes temporaltie clergie twoo dismes duryng whiche parliament one newbolt yoman kynges garde kyng highly fauored slewe wilfully seruaunt lorde willoughbies palaice westminster wherefore kyng abhorryng deede settyng side al affeccion caused hym haged palaice westminster hong twoo day example season one iherome bonuise whiche borne luke factor london merchauntes nacion plaied bankroute conueighed realme debt nowe suche fauor pope iuly made hym collector proctor englande kept greate porte resorted kyng cousaill pope affaire whiche sore troubled frenche kyng knewe bothe pope counsaill kynges falsly vntruly resorted nighte frenche ambassador liyng london theim discouered kyng pope entended whiche closly doen king knewe laied taken commonyng one thesaid ambassador vpon londo wall midnight brought tower remained till suite frendes deliuered shortly shame voyded realme concluded body realme high courte parliament assembled warre bee made frenche kyng dominion kyng diligence caused newe shippes made repaired rigged old caused gonne bowes arrowes artilery instrumentes warre made suche nombre quantitee wonderfull se thynges wer doen bothe sea lande shorte space kyng arragon whiche also warre french kyng hearyng sonne kyng england would make warre frauce write hym duchie euyan true enheritaunce whiche adioyned coutrey biskey wherfore kyng englande would entende recouer duchy first send armie men biskaye begin bayon whiche keye guyan would aide ordinaunce horseman beastes cariages necessary apperteignyng thesame kyng counsaill puttyng affiaunce promise kyng arragon prepared noble armie otemen smal ordinaunce trustyng kyng arragon aide horseman greate ordinaunce thesame made capitain noble lorde thomas grey marque dorset assigned many gentleman shall next yere pthe iiii yerethe iiii yere kyng greatly studiyng furnishe furthe warre whiche begonne frenche kynge caused sir edwarde hawarde admirall diligence take sea whiche spede possible made ready diuerse goodly tall shippes souereigne nombre xviii beside litle shippes compaignie capitaines sir weston browne griffith doune edwarde cobham thomas wyndam thomas lucie willyam pirton henry shirborne stephen bull george witwange ihon hopton willyam gimstone thomas draper edmond coke iho brodet diuerse shipped thei sailed douer skowred sea came portesmouthe aboute middes maie third daie maie gentleman flaunders called guyot guy came kyng vc almaines white whiche cutte small could soace hold together thei mustered blacke hethe kyng made hym knight gaue hym greate chayne yerely pencion sent hym band southampton midde maie lorde marque noble men appoynted kyng iorney biskay lorde hawarde sonne heire erle surrey lorde broke lorde willoughby lorde ferrers lorde ihon lorde anthony lorde leonard grey three brother marque sir griffith app rice sir morreis barkeley sir willyam sandes baron burfford sir richard cornwall brother willyam huse iho melton willyam kyngston esquire sir henry willoughby diuerse souldiours nombre xm men came southampton mustered se lordes gentleman well armed richely appareled clothes gold siluer ueluettes sundery coloures pounsed enbr udered petie capitaines satin damaske white grene yomen clothe thesame coloures baners penons standerdes gittons freshe newly painted sundery beastes deuises pleasure behold sir willyam sandes knight appoynted threasorer warres paied wage euery man commaunded shippe haue seen byndyng male fardelles trussyng coffer trussers manne idle xvi daie armie wer shipped spanishe shippes vitailed iorney passed nedles wight thesame daie lorde admirall whiche laie abidyng wynde portesmouth toke course britain speke wynde serued marque compaigne well whole armie arriued biskay porte called passagh southe west fountrabie thirde daie iune lorde marque faire compaignie landed tooke felde hym wisely embattailed sauegard biskaynes brought vitaile armie saied souldiours sir bee arriued trust kyng arragon helpe ordinaunce cariages preparacion maketh neuer sent v worde prepare commyng whiche wee maruell muche wordes ranne daily hoste whiche made many men sad muse biskanes sore feared least thenglishemen would destroye countrey kyng kepte promise theim marque made suche streight proclamacion souldiour durste iniurie within three day armie lien feld came erle another noble man welcome hym compaignie lorde capitain remoued felde toke another place nerer fountraby plenteous water woodde pitched felde euery daie lookyng aide kyng arragon harde none called counsaill deuised thei might haue beastes draw ordinaunce cariages one sir ihon stile englisheman caused bought twoo c mulettes ass suche price spanyardes gayned greatly thei putte cary thei would neither bere drawe thei wer beastes whiche wer exercised fore lorde marque muche lamented chaunce redy two hundred drawyng beastes might haue runne greate waie guian power whiche fortified neither men warre municions artilarie frenchemen bayon hearyng englishemennes campe made greate askry betwene riuer sainct maria bayon englishman perceiuyng thesame passed ye riuer good ordre battail beyng foote lacke horseman kyng arragon promised arrowes chased frenchemen horsebackes thei fled many horse foundered many man brosed thei came bayon whiche thenglishmen laughed lamented firste se cowardnes second remembre thei might haue doen thei horse mete purpose yet notwithstandyng thei retired campe suche ordre spanyardes wondered muche bothe fierce corage sobre ordre kyng nauar hearyng puissaunt armie englishemen liyng biskey nere countrey sore troubled wondered muche matter meane wherfore sent lord marque bisshop diuerse shewe hym cou saill pleased countrey sende victaill thynges necessarie money pleasure thei could whiche might pleasure hym armie realme sure inuacios made people marque beyng capitain generall aduise lordes counsaill muche highly thanked kyng nauer good wil aide comfort thynges onely thei required pleased hym people maie victaill v shall onely paie theim also warraunt passyng repassyng v oures sauetie v preiudice shalbee dooen realme concent whiche answere kyng nauer ioyous suffered people victaill resort hoosie thynges necessarie belongyng thesame greate windes stormes tyme happened muche wind raine whiche sore encombered souldiours laye nightly bare grounde euery man tent pauilion whereof lame deffe disease armie lien xxx day seconde campe came kyng arragon bisshop noble cou saill whe knowen thesame bisshop made answere lorde darcle caleis male haue hard last yere many saied came good delay required lord marque take pacience shortly suche prepare bee made see proue bee honor master greate renoume marque answered vpon confidence kyng arragons promise thei lacke beastes mete drawyng horseman kyng england sent hym compaignions thether whereof haue trusted sithe firste hether commyng whiche thynges wee dooen enterprise haue doen haue lien campe greate charge master kyng england profite losse greate hurt arriuall cou trey guyan whiche came vnprouided men warr municions ordinaunce reason whereof thynges accomplished part master trusted might haue whiche came commission folowe kyng master bee sent assure would haue dooen wise frenchemen haue fortefied victailed manned tounes wee haue spent tyme dooen nothyng al lyngeryng kyng master losse v greate blemishyng honour bisshop perceiuyng englishe capitaines couragious discontent idle abode flatteryngly desired theim tary best backe enemie saied bee regarded saied lorde marqu capitain generall knewe kynges entent would suffice v saied bisshop shall knowe shortly departed armie tharmie lyngeryng euer desirous busines thei came victaile muche part garlike englishemen eate garlike meates dranke hote wynes hote wether eate hote frutes thei could gette whiche caused bloudde boyle belies fell sicke three thousande flixe thereof died xviii hundred men lorde marque capitaines perceiuyng mischief sent kyng arragon certain lordes hooste knowe pleasure whiche answered gentle fashion counsaill englande counsaill taken ordre thyng late duke dalua greate prince spain shortly armie royall ioyne theim procede enterprise whiche answere small chere lordes englande departed made report capitain accordyng whiche thought verie sleight euer regarded master commaundement counsailed lordes content thesame armie liyng thus still sickenes slaked people beyng idle euill disposed persones saied euery capitain alowed viiid common souldier whiche vntrue thei alowed onely vid began together compaignies lordes perceiuyng toke theim trustie seruauntes toke beginner mischief whiche wer retinue lorde willoughby put warde thei wer arrested like euil disposicion began crake face whiche thyng beyng perceiued lorde marque aduice capitaines caused serche bee made founde beginner mischief whiche deliuered willyam kyngston esquire prouost marshall put death terror duryng tyme armie laie thus lyngeryng frenchman diuerse tymes came behold englishemen thei sawe parte armie remoue toward theim incontenent thei fled englishe archer euery daie went forragyng border guian almoste bayon brent many pretie vilages euer thei desired haue
