iorney geue example folow beyng durham aduertised kyng scottes hys greate ordinaunce rased teh walles castell norham made thre great assaultes thre dayes together capitayne valyauntly defended hym spent vaynely muche hys ordinaunce bowes arrowes municions laste lacked vi daye compelled yelde hym symply kynges mercy castell thought impregnable bene well fu nished scottes vndiscrete spendynge capitayne toke sixe dayes thys chaunce sorowfull erle bishoppe owner thesame nyghte wynde blewe corragiously wherfore erle doubted least lorde hawarde hys sonne greate admyrall englande shoulde perishe nyght sea promised lande newcastell thousand men accompaynie hys father whyche promyse accomplished erle harde masse appoynted prior saincte cu erdes banner cu erde banne daye beynge thyrty daye august came newcastell thither came lorde dacres syr william bulmer syr marmaducke constable many substanciall gentelmen whome reteyned wyth hym counsayllers determined sundaye nexte ensuynge shoulde take f lde bolton glendale many souldioures repayrynge hym lefte newcastell entent folowed shoulde haue rome come alnewyke thyrde ye september hys souldi r come reason foule waye ayne tarye fourthe daye beynge sundaye whiche daye came hym lorde admyrall hys sonne compaignye valyaunt capitaynes able souldiars maryners whiche came sea commynge hym muche reioyced hys father wyse hardy greate credence experience erle hys counsayll greate deliberacion appoynted hys battayles order wynges ryders necessarie pfyrste forwarde capitayne lorde hawarde admyrall englande suche came sea hym syr nycholas applyarde syr stephen bull syr henry shyreburne syr william sydney syr edwarde echyngham lorde clyfforde lorde co yers lorde latymer lorde scrope upsale lorde egle lorde lomley syr william bulmer power bishoprycke durham syr william gascoyne syr christopher warde syr ihon eueryngham syr thomas metham syr water gryffith many pof wynge righte hande forwarde capitayne syr edmonde hawarde knyght marshall hoste hym bryan tunstall raufe br arton ihon laurence rycharde bolde esquyers syr ihon bothe syr thomas butler knyghtes rycharde donne ihon bygod thomas fitzwilliam ihon claruys bryan stapulton robert warcoppe rycharde cholmeley men hull kynges tenauntes hatfelde pof wyng left hande capitayn syr marmaduke constable hys sonnes kynnesmen syr william percy lancashere thousand men pof rerewarde capitayne erle surrey hym selfe hym lorde scrope bolton syr philippe tylney syr george darcy syr thomas barkebey syr ihon rocliffe syr christopher pykeryng rycharde tempest syr ihon stanley bisshop elyes seruauntes syr bryan stapulton lyonell percy abbot whitbyes tenauntes christopher clapham syr willia gascoing younger syr guy dawney master magnus master dalbyes seruauntes syr ihon normauyle citiezens yorke syr nynyan markanuyle syr ihon wylloghby pof wyng right hande capitayne lorde dacres hys power pon leftehande wynge syr edwarde stanley knyght wyth residue power countye palantyne lancaster men appoynted knewe erle hys counsayll concluded determined emonge thynges sende rouge crosse pursiuaunt armes trompet sende rouge crosse pursiuaunt armes trompette kynge scottes certayne instruccions signed thesayde erle conteynynge woorde woorde foloweth fyrst hathe bene suy e made kyng scottes elyzabeth heron wyfe william heron forde nowe prysoner scotlande castynge doune house castell forde thesayde elizabeth reporteth vppon communicacion thesayde kynge hath promysed condiscended thesayde elizabeth tyme none fift daye september woulde brynge deliuer vnto hym lorde iohnstowne alexander hume prysoners tyme englande contented agreed thesayde house castell shall stande without castynge doune brennynge spoylynge thesame whereunto thesayde erle content vppon thys condicion thesayde kynge wyll promytte assuraunce thesayde castell maner forme aforesayde vnder hys ale deliuer thesayde lorde iohnstowne alexander hume immediately vppon thesame assuraunce case thesayde kynge content delyuer thesayde heron oute scotlande thesayde erle shall cause deliuered sayde kynge two gentelmen two syr george hume william carre farther thesayde erle woll rouge crosse shewe sayde kyng contrary hys othe league vnnaturally agaynste reason conscience hathe entred inuaded thys hys brother realme englande done great hurte castynge doune castelles tower house brenninge spoylynge destroiynge cruelly murderynge kynge englande hys brother subiectes wherefore thesayde erle wyll readye trye rightfulnes matter wyth king battaill frydaye nexte commynge farthest hys noble courage wyll geue hym tarienge abode within thys kynges realme longe tyme thesayde erle promiseth true knyghte god kynge englande hys master rouge crosse shoulde departe thesayde instruccions thesayde lorde admyrall gaue hym credence shewe thesayde kynge hys commynge parte hys compaignye sea hym hadde soughte scottyshe nauye beynge sea coulde mete theim edde fraunce coste irelande asmuche thesayde kynge hadde diuerse many tymes caused thesayde lorde called dayes true make redresse andrew barton pirate sea longe vanquyshed thesame lorde admyrall nowe come hys awne proper person uauntgarde felde ius ifie deathe thesayde andrewe agaynste hym hys people woulde se coulde ayed hys charge thesayde daye none hys compaignye shoulde take scottshe noble man prysoner shoulde dye came hys daunger oneles kynges awne person sayde usied none curtesye handes scottes thys maner shoulde fynde hym uauntgarde felde grace god sayncte george trew knyghte yet departynge rouge crosse thesayde instruccions credence thoughte e le hys counsayll thesayde kynge woulde fayne imagen message sende heraulde hys thesame onely uiew ouer se maner order kynges royall armye ordinaunce artillerie beynge erle wherby myghte haue ensued greate daungier thesame exchuynge thereof hadde commaundemente suche message sente bryng person commynge therewith within three two myle elde nyghest thesayde erle woulde come heare would saye thus departed rouge crosse trumpet apparayled hys cote armes mondaye daye september erle tooke hys felde bolton glendall hadde appoyncted al noble men gentelmen met ynewes number six twenty thousande men aboute mydnighte next ensuyng came trompette whiche went rouge crosse declared kynge scottes message done hym rouge crosse accordynge hys instruccions thesayde kynge detayned hym sent ilay harauld hys wyth hym vnto erle declare hym thesayde kynges pleasure whome erle sente yorke heraulde armes accompaignie thesayde ilay uillage called mylo twoo myles felde vntyll commynge thether thesayde erle next morow sixt daye september early mornynge erle accompaignied moost parte lordes knyghtes gentelmen felde euery man hauynge hym one man holde hys horsse thesayde heraulde met erle b reuerence declared hym come hys master kynge scottes whiche woulde knowe whither erle sente anye suche message rouge crosse erle iustified thesame saiynge farther rouge crosse hadde thesame message hym writynge signed hys awne hande whereunto thesayde ilay sayde touchynge sauynge brennynge destroiynge castynge doune castell forde deliueraunce thesayde prisoner kyng hys master woulde thereto make aunswer abydynge battayll betwene frydaye nexte folowynge kynge hys master badde hym shewe earle welcome noble man englande vnto thesame kynge bene home hys towne edeborough receyuyng suche message thesayde erle woulde gladlye haue come fulfylled thesayde erles desyre heraulde assured erle kynge hys master behalfe thesame kynge woulde abyde vattayll daye prefixed whereof thesayde erle righte ioyous muche praysed honourable agrement thesayde royall kynge estemed thesame procede hygh noble courage promysynge heraulde good su rtye hym shoulde bounde ten thousande pound sterlynge kepe thesayde daye appoynted kynge woulde fynde erle hys thereto good suerty hym bounde lyke summe per ormas thesame farthermore erle bad heraulde say hys master hys parte kepte hys appoyntemente content scottes shoulde ba ull hym whiche great reproche amonge scottes vsed man openly periured make hym image paynted reuersed hys e vpwarde hys name wonderyng cryenge blowing hym horne moost dispitefull maner token worthy exi ed compaignie good creature ilay deliuered earle littell cedule wryten kynges secretary hande vnsigned tenor whereof foloweth pa cause alleged oure commynge englande agayne oure bande promyse alleged thereto aunswer ower brother bounde also farre v hym sware laste hys ambassade presence oure counsayll expressed specially oure othe woulde kepe oure brother oure brother kepte v nat elles sweare oure brother brake fyrste v sythe hys breke haue requyred dyuerse tymes hym amend lately warned oure brother dyd v brake thys take oure quarell goddes grace shal defende thesame youre affixed tyme whiche goddes grace shall abyde asmuche thesayde kynge kepte styll rouge crosse hym yet returned thesame earle caused thesayde ilay kepynge syr humfrey lysle yorke heraulde thesame vyllage vntyll tyme seruaunt thesayde ilay myghte ryde haste royall kynge scottes deliuerynge thesayde rouge crosse erle ioyous kynges auswer returned hys campe fet forwarde fyue myle place called woller hawgh suche order battayll euen haue fought lodged nighte three littell myles kynge scottes betwene kynge hym goodly large corne felde called mylfelde whiche conuenient fayre grounde twoo hostes fight euery hoste myghte perceyue morowe beynge wednysdaye vii daye moneth kynge scottes caused hys greate ordinaunce shotte englishe armye hurte neither man beast kynge scottes sawe ilay deteyned sent awaye rouge crosse erle whome border aduertised kynge laye vppon syde hyghe mountayne called floddon edge cheuyot one narow felde man ascende vp thesayde hyll hym foote hyll laye hys ordinaunce one syde hys armye greate marrishe compassed hylles cheuyot soo laye stronge approched syde excepte englishman would haue temerariously ronne hys ordinaunce whiche matter well considered erle hys sonne counsayll called theim rouge crosse sent hym nexte daye kynge scottes willinge hym shewe kynge sayde erle dyuerse kynges noble subiectes hadde avaunced selfes geue battayll hys grace trustynge accordinge hys promise woulde auaunce hym selfe hys armye ioyne battayll whiche yet hath done wherefore desyred kynge myghte haue knowlege noone daye whether hys noble courage woulde discende hyll lay geue battayll saye shall knowe hys entent wyll saye kepe grounde shewe hym perceyueth well place indifferent grounde twoo armyes fighte therefore looke mo delayes daye beynge oure ladye daye natiuite rouge crosse departed kyng scottes whiche woulde heare hym speke sente one hys seruitours heare hys message whiche seruitour hadde disclosed kynge made aunswer besemed erle maner handle kynge woulde vse sorcery trust grounde haue hearde howe ilay scottishe heraulde returned rouge crosse ne rouge grosse returned discharged taryed yorke english herauld makynge good chere returned mornyng rouge crosse came hys message wherefore rouge crosse tromp trust grounde haue harde howe ilay scottishe heraulde returned rouge crosse sone rouge crosse returned discharged taryed yorke englishe heraulde makynge good chere returned mornynge rouge crosse came hys message wherefore rouge crosse hys trompet detayned seruaunte ilay whiche daye went rouge crosse assurynge ilay came home none liuinge shoulde haue heddes stryken rouge crosse offered hys seruaunt shoulde go ilay would excepted hap ilay came home none shewed gentell enterteynynge rouge crosse deliuered came englishe armye made reporte haue hearde englishemen remoued felde water tyll forthe ouer many hylles streytes marchynge toward scottes another syde sight scottes burned certayne poore uyllages othersyde marishe englishemen alwayes leauynge scottishe armye left hande toke felde vnder wood syde called barmer wood two myle scottes betwene two armyes ryuer tyll littell hyll saued engliishmen gonneshotte whiche hyll lorde admyrall perfightly saw discouered euenynge thesame daye concluded betwene erle hys counsayll parte armye thereto agreed uauntgarde ordinaunce shoulde passe ouer agayne water tyll bridge called twysel bridge ix day september rerewarde passe ouer mylforde puttinge theym selfes nye coulde betwene scottes scotlande geue battayll scottes hyll called floddon hyll frydaye sayde nynth daye lorde admyrall lyke valiaunte knyghte passed ouer twysell bridge uantgarde marchyng towarde hys enemyes lyke diligence made erle passynge ouer mylfforde rerewarde saiynge hys capytaines good fellowes lyke englishemen day take parte lyke men whiche parte kynges parte wyste would awne person fighte kynge scottes rather dye honourably hys crueltye lyue shame reproche shoulde layed hereafter whome aunswered woulde serue kynge hym truely daye englishe armye daye hadde vitayle fastynge two dayes afore onely dronke water coulde ace get anye sustenaunce money yet kept array horsebacke fyue clocke mornynge tyll foure clocke none alwayes sighte scottes kynge scottes perceyuinge englishemen marchinge towarde scotlande thought would haue entered scotlande burne fortay plentifull coutray called marche made beleue englishema named gyles musgraue whyche familiar kynge scottes dyd pollecie cause hym come doune hyll wherefore sayde kynge caused hys tentes remo hyll greate haste least englishemen shoulde haue taken thesame hyll theyr departinge sette fyer theyr litter fylthy ordure accordynge theyr custome fyer smolder dyd ryse suche smooke thicke darke one host coulde perceyue ynde driue smoke betwene twoo armyes sco te euer kepyng heygth hyll edge cheuyot e glishemen passed forward styll lowe grounde euer smoke muche bothe hostes ery ere together within space quarter myle one hem perceyue another smoke englishemen passed lyttell brooke called sa dyfforde whyche step ouer smoke passed ayre fayre cleare eche army myghte playnly see one hande th n lord admyrall perceyued foure great battayles scottes longe speres lyke moorishe pykes whyche scottes warlike bent theim forwarde whiche lord admirall whiche perceyuynge sent hys fa er erle surrey hys ag u h nge hys brest hast woulde ioyne battayll euen wyth bro brest antgarde forwarde alone able encountre whole battayll scottes erle perceyuynge well saiynge hys sonne seynge scottes ready discende hyll aunsed hym selfe hys people forwarde broughte theym egall grounde wyth forwarde left hande euen bro brest thesame foote hyll called b amston englishe army stretched east west theyr barkes northe scottes southe theim forsayde hyll called bramston oute brast ordinaunce bothe sydes wyth fyre flamme hydeous noyse master gonner englishe parte lewe master gormer scotlande bet hys men theyr ordinaunce scottishe ordynaunce dyd harme englishemen englishemens artyllerie shotte myddes kynges battayll slewe many persones whyche seynge kyng scottes hys noble men made haste come ioynyng foure battayles man r discended hyll shotte done whiche defended pauishes came handestrockes encontred seuerally shall fyrst englyshe syde next west syr edmonde hawarde knyghte marshall ho e chief capitayne wyng ryghte hand oure vantgarde encountryd chamberlayne scotlande wyth hys battayle sperys foote number ten thousande least whiche foughte valiauntly force caused litle wynge flye thesame syr edmonde thre tymes felled grounde left alone sauynge hys standarde berar twoo hys seruauntes whome came ihon heron bastarde sore hurte saiynge neuer noble man ne lyke loste thys daye hurtes shall lyue dye wyth thesayde syr edmonde hawarde great daunger ieopardy hys lyfe hardelye escaped yet goynge body uantgard met dauy home ew hym hys awne hande came uantgard secondely eastwarde sayde battayle lorde admyrall uantgarde whome encountred erles crafforde montroos accompaigned many lordes knyghtes gentelmen sperys foote lorde admyrall hys compaignie acquyted selfes well pure fighting brought ground great number erles slayne thirdely eastwarde lorde admyrall erle surrey capitayne generall whose standarde kynge scottes hys awne person marched beynge accompaigned wyth many bishoppes erles baron knyghtes gentelmen realme great number common chosen men speres foote assuredlyest harnesed hath bene sene tallest goodlyest personage abode daungerous shot arrowes sore noyed yet except hit bare place dyd nurt shotte endyd battayll cruell none spared kynge hym self fought valiauntly noble triumphant courage thys kyng fyghte battayll meane souldier auayled hys stronge harnes puyssaunce hys myghtye champion wyth whome descended hyll whome soo muche trusted hys stronge people great number men able thought haue vanquished day greatest prynce world ben erle surrey el thought hygh enterprice hym selfe hys person surnount enterprise prince soeuer happened god gaue stroke regarded poore souldier went one way awne battaill none escaped syr william scot knight chauncelour syr ihon forman knight seriaunt porter whiche taken prisoner wt great difficultie saued may great myrror prynces aduenter selfes battail forthely eastward syr edward stanley knight capitayn left wyng sayde erle clame vp toppe hyll called bramston scottes wiste encontred erles huntley lenoux argile great number scottes whiche sore fought whiche perceyuinge erle huntley toke horse saued hym selfe taryed bene likely haue go e compaignie fled sayde syr edward people folowed ouer thesame grounde erles battell first ioyned founde ther scottes whiche erles battail slayne sodainly left chase fell spoyling spoyled kyng scottes many slayne battail knew found crosse certayn thinges reason wherof sayde slayne wyng whiche could true prisoner scotlad testified kinges battaill fought onely erles battels truthe wyng valiauntly wherfore thought said syr edward might daye haue bene missed iiii battels maner fought one tyme determined effect littell distance beginnyng endynge one sauyng syr edward stanley whiche last fought came vp toppe hyll fought scottes valiauntly chaced theim doune hyll ouer place kynges battail ioyned besyde iiii battayles scottes twoo battayls whiche neuer came hande stroke thus thorough power god friday beyng ix daye septeber yere lord mdxiij iames iiii kyng scottes slayn bramstone chiefly power erle surrey lieutenaunt kyng henry viii kyng england lay sege tornay sayde kyng slayne archebishop saynct androwes kynges bastard sonne bishop iles abbot chaffrey abbot kylwenny erles erle mountroos erle crafford erle arguyle erle lennoux erle glencarte erle katnes erle castelles erle bothwell erle arrell constable scotland erle addill erle athel erle morton lordes lord louet lord forbos lord elueston lord roos lord inderby lord sentelere lord maxwell iiii brother lord daunl lord seympyll lord borthyck lord bogony lord arskyll lord blakkater lord cowyn knyghtes gentleman sir ihon dowglasse cutbert home lord fastcastell sir alexander seton sir dauy home master ihon graunt sir dunkyn caufelde sir saunder lowder sir george lowder master marshall master keye master ellot master cawell clerck chauncery deane ellester mack kene mack clen many gentleman whiche vnknowen officer armes scotland would come make serche theim yf daie bene le ger iii houres iiii clock none battailes ioyned englishman vitayles myght haue bidden still together alonely made greatest distresse scottes death takyng lyke hath bene sene one daye also within litle might haue put realme scotland suche miserie troble euer haue ben ware enter realme england specially kyng absent englysh men wanted good wyll scottes slew xiim lest best gentleman flower scotlad englysh syde slayne taken xvc men appered boke wage whe souldiours paied thus therle surrey accomplished promise daye prefixed wt kyng scottes great fame honour feld fought scottes fledde many englyshmen folowed scotland farre wyst whiche waye returne taken prisoner scottes ii battayles fled fyrste neuer faught also dyuerse taken lorde chamberlayne scotlande whych fought wyng sir edmond haward caried wyth hym nomber lx scottes fled passed ouer water twede ca destr foorde dry march tyme fighte nyght many men lost horse suche stoffe left ther tentes pauilyons robbars tyndale ty idale lord cre companye stode styll daye vnfoughten feld done skoute watch brought woord ther apperaunce scottes returned thearle thanked god humble harte called hym certayne lordes gentleman made knyghtes syr edmond haward sonne lorde scrope syr wylliam percy many therle lorde admirall departed barmer wodde appoyncted sir phylippe tylney knyghte wyth compaignye lorde admirall compaignye lorde scrope bolton lorde latymer olde sir marmaduke constable sir wyllyam percy sir nycholas applyard companyes fewe kepe place felde sauyng englyshe ordynaunce ordynaunce taken scottes whiche v greate curtalles twoo greate culuerynges foure sacres syx serpentynes fayre ordynaunce hath ben sene bysyde smalle peces well knowen fought also reported prysoners scotlande theyr kynge take ayne hys body founde tyll nexte daye bycause meane people aswell scottes englyshe strypped oute theyr apparell laye felde yet laste founde lorde dacres knewe hym well hys pryuye tookens place battayle erle surrey hys fyrste ioyned together thys kynge dyuerse deadely woundes especiall one arowe another wyth byll apered naked bodye kynge scottes fownde broughte barwycke earle shewed yt syr wyllyam scott hys chaunceller syr ihon forman hys seriante porter whiche knewe hym fyrste sighte made greate lamentacyon bodye bowelled embawmed cered secretly amongest stuffe conueyed newcastell thesame daye lorde admyrall came felde ther scottes apered hyl wyllyam blackenall whiche cheffe doa ruler ordynaunce shott suche peale scottes fledd el lorde admyrall ben greate ieopardye ordynaunce broughte sauetye castell cytell remayned tyme thys noble vyctorye therle wrote fyrste quene whiche raysed greate power resiste sayde kynge scottes wynnynge battayle bodye kynge scottes fownde yet beynge towne buckyngham woorde nexte daye kynge scottes slayne parte hys coate armure sente whiche victorye thanked god earle northe parte sett quietnes returned queene deade body scottyshe kyng broughte richemond nowe lett v returne kynge englande lyenge tournaye whyche xxv daye september receyued gauntelett letter earle surrey knewe dealynge bothe party thanked god highly praysed earle lorde admyrall sonne gentleman common valiante entrepryce nowebeit kynge secrete letter cheshyre men fledde syr edmond hawarde whyche letter caused greate harte burnynge many woordes kyng thankefully accepted al thynge woulde man dispraysed mondaye nyght xxvi daye september lorde harbarte earle shrewsburye made greate fyers armyes token vyctorye triumph teusdaye xxvii daye tente cloth gold sett vp kynges chapell sange masse te um byshoppe rochester made sermond shewed deathe kynge scottes muche lamented yll deathe periurye hym kynge englande lyenge thus tournay caused hys greate ordynaunce bee planted rounde aboute cytee dyuerse trench cast rampiers made lorde lysle lorde wyloghby appoyncted mayntayne ordynaunce wyth ther bendes therle kent lodged gate called port ualencyen cytizens coulde issue ayde coulde come ordynaunce dayly bett gate tower walles whiche made greate batterie fewe englyshmen assaulted port coquerell nomber yf ben nomber taken towne tournosyns confessed cytyzens tournay consyderynge estate came together counsayll prouost sayde frendes bretherne thys noble cytee cannot muche prayse youre treuth fidelite youre souereigne lorde kynge fraunce considerynge howe manfully haue defended cytee sythe beginnynge siege ala allthough wrytten gate grauen sto e iammes ton ne perdeu ton pucellage saye thou haste neuer lost thy maydenhed yet yf thys cytee ben well furnyshed euer daie appoyncted suer reskeue coulde haue contynued nowe se reskeue fayleth gate rased tower betyn downe chiefe towar lyke fall yf thys perilous siege contynue el yf ennenies assaute v able defende v wherfore nowe thynges consydered woulde knowe whyther wyll treate wyth kyng englande adyde chaunce whiche last counsayll cryed warre warre nowe cryed peace peace yet agreed one wyseman sayde sir yf towne assawted agayne greate nomber suerly taken sawe thexperience last aute consider yf taken force saye life entretie kynge englande mercyfull wee maye fortune saue bothe lyfe goodes fynally agreed treate prouost sente kyng trompett desyerynge saufeconduyte hym certayne come speke wyth hym whyche request hym graunted prouost cytee accompanyed wyth eleuen wyth hym best cytee came armye spake lordes counsail broughte kynges presence prouost kneled downe compaignye sayde ryght highe myghtye prynce although cytee tournay stronge well walled well replenyshed wyth people vytayles artylerie ye people feare dread nothynge yet knowe agaynste greate puyssaunce yt contynue long although yt ten tymes stronge wherefore wee knowynge reporte honoure wysedome iustyce noble harte contente become subiectes vassalles maye haue enioye oure olde lawes customes lyberties franchesses vnder haue thys done vnder prynces kynge aunswered haue well harde petycyon wyll common wyth oure counsayll make aunswere communed wyth counsayll aunswered sayenge sir asketh mercye v shall denyed seynge come treate remytte oure counsayll wente tente counsayll tournasyns fell poyncte conclusion yelded cytee ten thowsande pound sterlynge redempcyon theyr lybertyes departed cytee makynge relacion kynge hys noble corage thursdaye xxix daye september kynge hys ryche tente cloth golde vnder hys clothe estate whome came cytezens cytee sworne hym became subiectes kynge appoyncted lorde lysle lorde burgayny lorde wylloghby take possession whiche six thowsand men entered cytee toke markett place walles serched howses feare treason master thomas wolsey king almoner called citizen young old sware kyng england nober whereof iiii skore thousand thus kyng england conquest came possession cytee tournay sondaie ii daye october kyng entered cytee tournay porte fountayne iiii chiefe cytee ouer hym bare cannapye armes england euery person best apparell ladyes gentlewoman lay wyndowes beholdynge kynge nobilite euery citizen hande stafe torche kynge hym selfe rychely appereilled ryche armure barded courser henxme beryng peces warr axe spere courser barded tharmes england fraunce ireland kynges dominion ryche embraudery thus kyng hys nobilite richely apparelled swerde borne hym herauldes seriantes armes trumpettes mynstralsy entered cytee came ladye churche ther te deum song kyng called presence edwarde guldeforde wylliam fitzwilliam ihon dauncye william tiler hon sharpe william huse ihon sauage cristopher garnyshe diuerse valiaunt esquyers gaue order knyghthode went lodgynge none came market place prepared hym place caus proclamacion made hys name kyng england fraunce man shoulde greue citizen duryng proclamacion turnesyns scace loked vp shewed hym anny amiable countenaunce much marked cry myshed kyng departed campe leuynge cytee saue kepyng weke kyng rode see castel morton ther grace toke greate pleasure kyng remembrynge greate chere prynce castell lady margarete made hym lysle xii mile english tornay desyred thesayd prynce lady diuerse come hym cytee tornay made preparacion thesame appoincted iustes wherof hym selfe woulde one caused tilt made market place thynges preparyng kyng counsaill ordered suer kepyng cytee tornay ordeyned sir edward pownynges knyght order gartier hys lieutenaunt iiiic archer capytaynes horseman artilerie conuenient haue ayde henawde kyngs frindes adioynyng garde left iiiic archer ordinau ce appoyncted defence thesame mondaye xi daye october kyng without towne receyued prynce castel lady margarete dyuerse noble countreys brought tornay greate triumphe noys went lord lysle made request mariage ladye margarete duches sauoy doughter themperour maximilian whiche tyme departed kyng many riche giftes money borowed whether profered mariage fauored highly prynce duches soiorned great solace space x ayesa iust duryng whiche tyme xvii daye october began ius e kyng lorde lysle aunswered commers vppon kyng attended xxiiii knyghtes foote coates purple veluet clothe gold tent cloth gold sett place armorie releue kyng base trapper purple veluet bothe sett full fyne bullio lord lisle thesame suyte ther many speres broken many good buffet geuen stranger lord walon lorde emery dyd right well iustes wer done kyng al vnhelmed rode tylt dyd great reuerence lady herauldes cryed lodgyng night king made sumpteous banket c dish prince castell lady margarete lordes lady banket lady daunsed came kyng xi maske richely appareled wt bonettes gold passed time pleasure garmentes maske cast amongest lady take could take xx daye october prynce castell lady margarete many great giftes geuen returned lyle trayne kyng enformed direccions taken euery thyng put order suer kepyng citee tornay tooke thesame sir edward pownynges knight valiantly kept good order iustice kyng counsayll consydered frechmen woulde geue battayle wynter aproched time ly siege townes concluded kepe tournay sauely breake vp campe winter begyn agayn war spryng yere full conclusion taken kynge counsayl kynge people excepte suche appoyncted syr edward pownynges departed tournay xx daye september kyng noble men made suche spede shortely came caleys thyther came lorde admyrall whome kynge hartely thanked paynes euery man paied wage conduyte money shippes prepared passage xxiiii daye septeber kyng priuy copany toke shippe thesame daye landed douer shortely people folowed small company rode rychemonde post quene suche louing metyng euery creature reioysed season began greate mortalite london place muche people dyed thys wynter kynges nauy kept see robbed spoyled frenchemen theyr costes kynge thus returned forgatt good seruyce many gentleman dyd battayle bramston wherefore wrote louing letter thankes fauorable wordes euery man thought hym selfe well rewarded daye purificacion lady lambeth kynge created earle surrey duke norffolke augmentacion armes scotlande sir charles brandon uiconte lisle created duke suffolke lorde haward high admirall created earle surrey sir charles somersett lorde harbert hys chiefe chamberlayne created earle worcester nother daye made sir edwarde stanley good seruice lorde montaygle marche folowyng master thomas wolsey kynges almoner consecrate bisshop lyncolne ther named newers daye man borne ypswyche good philosopher eloquente full witte pryde couetous ambicion excelled shall tyme kynge henrye seuenth father kynge henrye eyght concluded betwene sayde kyngethe discripcio thomas wolsey whiche afterward made cardinall kynge phylyppe castell sonne maxymilian themperour kynge castell wyfe charles hys eldeste sonne shoulde marye lady mary doughter kynge englande dowrye appoyncted whyche tyme bothe younge nowe kynges retourne tournay made preparacyon sende thesayde ladye hys syster prynce castell counsayll flaunders aunswered concernynge selfe woulde gladly receyue bee espowsed prynce fayrest ladyes worlde concernynge article dowar coulde fulfyll without thassente kynge arragon realme castell whyche sayde mynded haue hym maryed spayne kynge lyke louynge broother woulde sende hys syster wyldely wythoute dowar assured tooke fyrste agremente betwene kynge father kynge phylyppe hys father bee none effecte syth spanyardes woulde conferme ther cause reason kynge phylyppe naturally borne kynge kynge ryghte wyfe bounde hys agreementes made withoute consente thus kynge englande reteyned still hys syster preparacion done conueyaunce whyche verye costely season lady margarete quene scottes late wife king iames iiii slayne bramston syster kyng wrote kynge haue compassion two nephewes sonnes feare left woulde haue inuaded realme kyng moued brotherly copassion sent word yf scottes kept peace woulde kepe peace yf thei would haue warr would likewise haue warr aunswere messenger departed sprig tyme yere kyng wrote hys letter noble men gentilmen woulde shortely passe agayn fraunce awne person wherfore euery prepared self mete iournay fle mynges heryng therof made puruiaunce wagans vitaile thynges torned great losse viage brake shall season sir richard whethill syr ihon tremayle kept thenglishe pale frenchemen durst medyl yet spoyled base bollen time townes aboute london islyngton hoxston shordysh enclosed common feldes hedge diches nother young men cytee might shote auncient persones might walke ther pleasure feldes excepte either ther bowes arowes broken taken waye honest sustanciall person arrested indited saieng londoner goo cytee high wayes sayeng sore greued londoner sodainly yere great nomber citee assembled selfes mornynge turnar fooles cotte came cryenge cytee shouels spade many people folowed wonder within short space hedge aboute townes cast downe diches filled euery thinge made playn woorkemen diligent kynges counsayll heryng assembly came gray frears sent mayre counsayll cytee knowe cause whiche de lared noysaunce done citezens ther commodytees liberty taken though would yet commonaltie young person dampnified noysauce would pluck vp remedy kynges counsayl harde answer thei dissimuled matter commaunded mayer see thyng attempted call home citezens thei done ther entreprice came home kynges counsayll mayer departed without harme doyng feldes neuer hedged pthe vi yere moneth maye kynge newe duke suffolke defender tilt al commers kynge scopelary mantel hatt clothe syluer lyke whyte armite duke appareilled lyke black armible blacke veluet ther berdes damaske syluer ridden tylt shewed selfes quene thei threwe ther apparell sent lady large kyng black duke white black staues staues written white letter vvho hold vvyl avvay poyse iudged made duke suffolke duches sauoy iustes duke longeuyle lord cleremond ther kyng duke dyd valiantely obteyned price iustes broken cxiiii speres short season kyng season sent agayne flaunders performaunce mariage young prynce castell fayre lady mary syster shewed prepared thinges necessary conuenient suche high estate counsayll flaunders aunswered woulde receyue yere many subtyl argumentes reason wherof perfite loue betwene england low countreys much slaked xix daye may receyued london capp mayntenauncethe capp mayntenauce swerde sent pope iuly great compaignye noble gentleman presented kyng sonday next ensuyng great solempnytie cathedrall church sainct paul time warres yet contynewynge betwene england fraunce prior ihon whome haue harde iiii yere great capitayne frenche nauy galeys foystes charged great dasylyskes greate artilery came border sussex came land nyght poore village sussex called bright helmston watch coulde escrye sett fyer towne toke suche poore goodes founde watche fyred bekyns people began togather whiche seynge prior ihon sowned trompett call men aborde tyme day vi archer whiche kept watche folowed prior ihon sea shott fast thei bett galyme shore prior ihon hym selfe waded foyst thenglishemen went water put back pickes el entered foyst shott fast thei wouded many foyst prior ihon shott face arrow likely haue dyed therfore offered image wax lady bolleyn englysh arrow face myracle lorde admirall england hard newes contente sent sir ihon wallopp sea incontinente diuerse english shippes whiche sayled cost normandy ther landed brent xxi village townes great slaughter people bret shippes boates hauens treaport stapils euery place sir ihon wallopp quyt hym self men marueled entreprises consyderyng viiic men toke land ther often moneth iune lord powntremy capitayne tyrwyn banner displayed great ordinaunce great army came pycardy nere arde sir nycholas uaux capitayne guysnes cosyderyng ye frenchman ordinaunce thought ye woulde haue beseged guysnes wrote therof kyng incontinente prouided greate armye reskewe euery thyng redy army forward lord pountremy reysed hys campe departed without many doyng al kyng sent ouer sir thomas louell knyght vic men caleys strength towne townes castelles beyng wt english pale march frenche kyng yere appoyncted richard dela pole traytor england danyshed realme xiim lanceknyghtes kepe normandie also entre england conquere thesame made suche ryott many slayn fayn carye sente malos britaigne take shippe frenchman woulde fayne haue bene rydde thei cared condicions vyle shamefull reason french kyng suyd peace iornay toke effect french kyng heraulde wrote king england marueled greatly made hym sore warr brent toke townes slew robbed people oute cause geuen parte wherfore requyred kyng graunt saufconduyte ambassadours whiche shoulde entreate cause whereupon iune french king sent commission president roan generall boyer certayne noble fraunce entreate peace allyaunce betwene bothe prynces farther cause thei knewe mariage broken betwene prynce castell lady mary haue hard desyered thesayde lady espowsed french kyng affirmyng greate dower suertes wt greate treasure much offered kyng moued cou sayl specially bishop lyncolne wolsey consented vpon condicion yf thesayde french kyng loys dyed pleased retorne england agayn dowar rich suche entretie indenture sealed peace proclamed vii daye august kyng presence french ambassadours sworne kepe thesame likewise ther sente ambassadeou england see french kyng swere thesame dutchman heryng newes sory repeted thei receyued lady spake shamefully mariage feble old pocky man mary fayre lady voys people lett prince purpose conclusion peace duke longuyle prysoners delyuered payeng ther raunson thesaid duke affied lady mary name kyng lewes mayster duke highly interteyned england many noble men great chere thei came fraunce quene would scace knowe thinges redy conueyaunce noble ladye kyng brother moneth september wyth quene hys wyfe hys sayde syster court came douer taryed wynde troblous wether fowle muche shipp th kynges called libeck ixc tonne dryuen shore sanga e brast vic men antely escaped iiic yet parte hurt wrecke wether fayre wardrobe stable ryches shypped suche appoyncted geue attendaunce duke norfolke marque dorsett bysshop durham earle surrey lorde delawar lorde barnes lord mantaigle marque iiii brother sir morice barkeley sir ihon peche sir william sandes sir thomas bulleyn sir iho cart many knightes squyers getlemen lady al went ship thesayde lady toke leaue quene castell douer kyng brought sea syde killed betoke god fortune see gouernaunce frenche kyng husband thus ii daye october hower foure clocke morenynge thys fayre ladye tooke ship noble compaignie ayled quarter see wynde rose seuered shyppes caleys flaunders shippe greate difficultie brought bulleyn great ieopardy entryng hauen master ran ship hard shore botes redy receyued noble lady landyng sir christopher garnyshe stode water toke armes caryed land duke uandosme cardynall many estate receyued ladyes welcommed noble men countrey quene trayne came bulleyn ther rested thense remoued dyuerse lodgynges tyll came wythiniii myle abuyle besyde forrest arders ther kynge loyes vppon great co set mett would haue alyghted woulde suffer welcommed hys countrey sene beauty long desyred talked wt litle space returned abuyle secret waye wt great triuphe procession pagiantes receyued toune abuyle viii daye october dolphin receyued wt great honor appareilled cloth siluer horse trapped goldsmythes woorke rychly folowed xxxvi lady al ther pal reys trapped crymsyn vel et embraudered folowed one charyott clothe tyssue seconde clothe golde thyrde crymsyn veluet embrawdered kyngs armes full rose folowed greate nomber archer wagon laden wt r stuf great rich plate iuels money apparel hangynges lady brought frauce mo day beyng daye saincte denyse thesame kynge lewes maried lady mary great church abuyle bothe appareled goldesmyths woorke masse done ther great banket fest ladyes englande hyghly entreteyned tewesdaye beyng x daye october thenglishmen excepte fewe officer thesayde quene discharged whiche greate sorowe theim serued longe hope prefermente honest rome lefte serue nowe seruice caused take thought muche dyed way returnyng sone fell mad ther remedy english lordes done commission frech kyng wylled take lenger payne gaue good rewardes toke ther leaue quene returned dolphyn fraunce called lord frauncys duke ualoys hys wyfe duke brytaigne honoure mariage thenglishmen departed abuyle caused solempne iustes proclaymed shoulde kept paris moneth noue ber next ensuyng ix aydes shoulde aunswere al commers beynge gentleman name armes fyrste ronne v course tylt peces auantage also v course randon sharpe speres twelfe stroke sharpe swordes done aydes ight barrier al gentleman name armes fyrste syx foynes hand speres eyght stroke auantage yf spere long held twelfe stroke swerde yf man vnhorsed felled wyth fyghtynge foote hys horse armoure rendered officer armes euery man chalenge muste sett vp hys armes name vpon arche triumphante whiche shalbe made place iustes shalbe farther shall wryte poynct wyll aunswere one al proclamacion reported englande noble men returned mariage duke suffolke marque dorsett foure brethrene lorde clynton sir edward neuel sir gyles capell thomas cheney sued kynge chalenge whiche request graciously graunted lordes knyghtes prepared thynge necessarye entreprice shypped horse harnesse dyd muche iournay came parys ende moneth october whiche hartely welcomed kyng dolphyn frech quene lay sainct denyse yet crowned entred paris dolphyn desyred duke suffolke lord marque dorsett whose actiuite knewe wel reporte two immediat aide therto assented therfore erected arche widnes tournelles besyde strete sainct anthony directly ye bastel sett iiii targettes scutchios one siluer sett name vnder shylde runne tylt accordyng article put name vnder golden target ronne sharpe speres fight sharpe swerdes put ther name black shilde fight foote speres swerdes one hand touched tawney sheld shoulde cast spere foot targett arme fight ii hand swerde arche aboue stode armes kyng quene benethe stode armes dolphyn aydes vndernethe stode iiii scochions haue harde vnder al armes name suche set ther name thesayde iiii scochions thynges preparynge lady mary england v daye nouember beyng sondaye wt great solempnitee crowned quene fraunce monasterye sayncte denyce dolphyn al season held croune ouer hed greate waight greuaunce whiche coronacyon lordes england accordynge ther degree wel enterteyned mondaye vi daye nouember thesayde quene receyued cytee parys order foloweth first garde cytee met oute sayncte denyce coates goldesmythes woorke shippes gylt mett prestes relygious whiche estemed iiim quene chyre couered ouer person white cloth golde horse drewe couered cloth golde hed coronall greate perles necke brest full iuels wente garde almaynes ther fascion al nobleman dolphyn duke alanson duke burbon duke uandosme duke longeuyle duke suffolke marque dorsett v cardynalles greate nomber estate aboute person rode kynges garde whiche scottes thus quene receyued paris coueyed cathedral churche ther offered thence pallayce offered holy chapel thence went lodgyng nyght whome prouided great supper herauldes cryed large geuen ship siluer gylt pla e valewe iic marke supper began dausyng pastyme morowe bega iustes dolphin wt aydes entered feld apparell bardes cloth golde cloth syluer crymsyn veluet kanteled together one sute shewed self kyng quene goodly stage quene stode men might see wondered beautie kyng feble lay couche weakenes entered cou ter parte rayle combryng place iustes contynued iii dayes whiche aunswered iii hundred v men armes euery man ran v course sharpe speres dyuerse slayne spoken english lordes knyghtes dyd well best randon tournay duke suffolke hurt gentleman like dye marque strok mounsire grew albanoys spere per ed hed pece put hym ieopardy duke suffolke tornay ouerthrewe man armes horse man dyd lorde marque another yet frenchman woulde wyse prayse tornay dolphyn hurt hande coulde performe hys chalenge barrier put one ayde rome nexte daye began fight barrier dolphin present duke suffolke lorde marque dorsett daye began feld toke barrier speres hand abydyng commers dolphyn brought secretly al court fraunce tallest strongest man almayne put place person haue duke suffolke rebuked great almayne came barres fyersly face hyd would knowne bare hys spere duke suffolke strength duke receiued strength put hym strong stroke barrier ende spere strake almaine staggared al almayne strake strogly hardly duke iudges suffered many mo stroke foughten appoincted whe saw almayne rele staggar let fall rayle betwene lorde marque dorsett thesame time euen barre fought gentleman fraunce lost spere maner drewe rayle let fal two noble men put vp vysers toke ayer tooke swerdes poynct edge abated came barrier almayne foughte sore duke imagened person sett nonce duke pure strength tooke hym necke pomeled aboute hed bloud yssued hys nose departed almayne conueyed dolphyn le knowen twoo noble men englande daye fought valiantly diuerse feates frenchman likewise nobly defended happened lord marque one time put aide gest brother called lorde edward grey age xix yere hym put gentleman fraunce greate stature strength thentente plucke hym ouer barres yet younge lorde suche strength powre pollecy stroke aduersarie disarmed hym al face bare thus entrepryces fynished loude al party thenglyshmen receyued muche honoure spott rebuke yet priuely sett many ieopardies declaracion triumphe sawe tell howe goodly courser trotted bouded quickly turned valiantely men armes behaued selfes howe duke burbones bende apparelled bassed tawny veluet clothe syluer clowdy bende therle sayncte polle apparelled barded purple veluet cutt purple satten enfante arragon sonne frederycke last kynge naples hys bende al clothe golde syluer paled lord young towarde duke uandosme bende clothe golde pluncket veluet dolphyn hys aydes euery daye newe apparelled hys coste one daye syluer golde nother crymesyn veluet yelowe veluet another daye white veluet grene daye myxted satyn daie embrawdered daye pounced golde euery daye chaunge woorkers fantasye coulde deuyse englishemen euer apparell red cross knowen loue ther cou tre thys triumphe countie galea came place ienett trapped blewe satten hym selfe lykewyse apparelled corse spere whiche hed v ynches euery syde square xx ynches bur ix ynches square xxxvi ynches spere massy tymber yet al ra cleane long course slightely auoyded hys great honour also ther another gentleman called anthony bownarme came feld armed body brought sight x speres wyt iii speres set euery styroppe forward vnder euery thygh ii speres vpwarde vnder lefte arme spere backeward x hand came quene let hys horse ronne neuer stopped tyll taken euery spere broken grounde neuer stopped horse tyll broken gentleman highely praysed worthy great triumphe done lordes england toke ther leue highly thanked kynge quene dolphyn lord departed came england christmas nouember quene delyuered prynce lyued long yere december ther one rychard hun marchat tayllor london lollers tower commaundement byshop londonrichard hun comitted lower tower murthered called rychard fytziames doctoure horsey chaunceler whiche man witt preferre byshoppes iurysdicion clergie truth gospell sayde hun fonnd dead hagyng ye neck gyrdle silke win sayd towre beginyng matter must shewed folowig cosequet hu chyld yt dyed house beyng infant curate clamed beryng shete mortuary hun answered infant propertie shete whervpon priest ascited spirituall courte takynge hym good counsayll sued curate preminire prestes hard dyd much malice accused heresy brought lollers tower ther founde deed haue hard man counted honest reputacion man sight people vertuous wherfore vpon matter greate matter folowed byshoppe chaunceller doctour horsey sayde hanged hym selfe temporaltie sayde murthered vpon xii men charged coronour whyche xii elected greate dyscrecion many tymes wyth kynges counsayll hard opynions meane season bysshop london brent dead carcasse thesayde rycharde hun smythfeld abhominacion people matter ben hard iudges kynges counsayll grace beyng present heryng cause openly debated much borne spiritualtie yet last remitted yt tryall lawe vpon good euidence doctour horsey chaunceller belrynger charles ioseph somner endyted murther afterward meanes spiritualty money doctour horsey caused kynges attorney confesse hys arraynement hym gylty escaped wet exetre shame durst neuer come london yet truthe declared abhominable detestable murther shall folow whole inquyry verdicte thenquest woorde woorde v vi daie december vi yere reigne souereigne lorde kyng henry viii wyllyam barnewell rowner londonthe inquity death richard hun daye yere aboue sayde within warde castylbaynerd london assembled quest whose name afterwarde doo appere hath sworne theim truely enquire death one rychard hun whiche lately founde dead lollers tower paul church london wherupon al inquest together went vp thesayd tower found body thesayd hun haging vpon staple iron gyrdell sylke fayre countenaunce hys heed fayre kemed bonet right sittyng vpon heed wt ey n mouth fayre closed withoute staryng gapyng frownyng also without dreuelyng spurgyng place body wherupo one assent agreed take downe body thesayde hun sone bega heue body loose wherby good aduysement perceiued gyrdel knot aboue staple double cast lynkes iron chayne hang staple layd vpon thesame gyrdle wherby hang also knot gyrdell went neck stode vnder hys left eare caused head leane toward right shoulder wt standyng came nostrels ii small stremes bloud quantite iiii dropes saue iiii dropes blode face lippes chinne doublet coler shurt thesayde hun cleane bloud also fynd skyn neck throte beneth gyrdell sylk fret fased awaye thing ye murtherers broken neck also hades thesayd hun wrog wristes wherby perceyued handes bounde moreouer fynd within thesayde prison meane wherby man might hang selfe onely stole stole stode vpon bolster bed tyckle man beast myght touche litle redy fall wherby perceyued yt possible hun myght hange hym selfe stole standynge also gyrdell staple hys necke well part went neck litle heed come therat also possible soft sylken gyrdell shoulde breake neck skyn beneth gyrdle also finde corner somewhat beyonde place wher dyd hang great persell bloud also fynde vpon lyfte syde hun iacket breast downeward ii great stremes bloud also within lappe lyft syde iacket fynde greate cluster bloude iacket folden downe therupon whiche thyng thesayde hun coulde neuer folde hanged whereby appereth plainly v necke hun broken greate plenty blude shed hanged wherefore wee fynde god conscience rychard hun murthered also acquyte thesayd richard hun aune deathe also ende wax candell whyche ihon belrynger sayeth lefte pryson burnyng hun sondaye nyght hun murthered whyche waxe candell founde styckynge vppon stockes fayre put oute aboute seuen eyght foot place hun hanged whyche candell oure opynion neuer put oute hym many lykelyhodes whiche haue perceyued also goynge vp master chaunceller lollars tower wee haue good proofe laye stockes gowne eyther murrey crimosyn grayn furred shankes whose goune yt wee coulde neuer proue neyther bare yt awaye wee fynde master wyllyam horsey chaunceller lorde london hath hys commaundement bothe rule guydynge thesayde prysoner moreouer fynde thesayde master norsey chaunceller hath put charles ioseph office thesayde charles hath confessed would dele vse thesayde prysoner cruelly hym chaunceller would haue hym notwithstandyng keyes delyueraunce chaunceller charles saturdaye nyght hun deathe charles rydyng towne sondaye mornyng ensuyng conuencion made betwixte charles chaunceller colour murther thesame soday charles rode furth came agayne towne sonday nyght kylled rychard hun deposycions iulian littell thomas chitcheley thomas symondes peter tur er doeth appere colouryng murther betwixte charles chaunceller conspired chaunceller called hym one ihon spaldyng belrynger poules delyuered thesame belrynger keyes lollars towre geuyng thesayde belrynger great charge sayeng charge kepe hun straytely hath kepte let hym haue one meale daye moreouer charge let body come hym wythoute lycence neyther brynge hym shurt cap kercheffe thynge see yt come hym also hun caried fulham chaunceller commaunded bee put vppon hun necke greate coller iron greate chayne whiche heuy man beast longe endure moreouer well proued hun death thesayd chaunceller came vp thesayde lollers tower kneled downe hun holdyng vp hys handes hym prayenge hym forgeuenesse done hym muste hym sondaye folowynge chaunceller commaunded penytensary poules goo vp hym saye gospell make hym holy water holye breade geue yt hym whyche dyd also ch unceller comaunded hun haue diner thesame dyner tyme charles boye shute pryson hun whiche neuer dyner whan belrynger fet oute doye belrynger sayde thesame boye come hyther mete hym vntyll morowe noone mayster chaunceller hathe commaunded shall haue one meale daye thesame night olowynge rychard hun murthered whiche murder coulde haue done wythoute consente lycence chaunceller also wittynge knowelege ihon spaldynge belrynger coulde man come prysone keyes beyng ihon belryngers kepynge also lorde london booke doeth appere ihon belrynger poore innocente man wherefore wee doo perceyue thys murther coulde done commaundement chaunceller wittyng knowing ihon belrynger charles ioseph wythin tower london hys awne free wyll vnconstreyned sayde master chaunceller deuysed wrote awne hand suche heresyes layd hus charge recorde ihon god ihon truy ihon pasmar richard gybson wt many also charles ioseph sayeth whan rychard hun slayne ihon belrynger bare vpp steyre lollars tower waxe candell hauynge keyes dores hangynge hys arme charles went nexte hym master chaunceller came vp last whan wee came vp founde hun lyenge hys bedde mayster chaunceller sayde lay handes thefe murthered hun charles put gyrdell aboute hun necke ihon belrynger charles dyd heue vp hun master chaunceller pulled gyrdell ouer staple hun hanged deposycion lian littell late seruaunt charles ioseph fre vvill vnconstrayned vi yere oure souereigne lord kyng henry viii vvithin chapell lady bethlehem shevved thynquest fyrst iulian sayeth wednesdaye nyght death rychard hun charles ioseph master came home hys supper iulian sayde hym master yt tolde ye pryson charles aunswered merye turne penye supper charles trussed persell goodes helpe iulyan bare master porter howse kepe done charles sayde iulian iulian yf thou wilt sworne kepe counsayll wyll shewe mynde iulian aunswered ye yf neyther felonie treason charles toke boke oute purse iulian sware hym therupon sayde charles iulian haue distroyed rycharde hun ala master sayde iulian howe called honest man charles aunswered put wyre nose ala sayde iulyan nowe ye cast waye vndone sayde charles iulyan truste thou wylt kepe counsayll iulyan aunswered ye godes sake master shifte selfe charles sayde leuer hundred pound yt done done vndone moreouer charles sayde iulyan vpon sondaye whan rode cousyn baryngtons house taryed made good chere daye tyll yt nyght yet mydnyghte london kylled hun vpon next day rode ye ther agayn dyner sent neyghbours made good chere ulian asked charles set horse nyght came towne wherfore came ye home charles aunswered came home feare bewraiynge iulian asked charles wyth kyllynge hun charles aunswered wyll tell iulyan saythe vpon thursdaye folowynge charles taryed daye house great fere vpon frydaye folowyng erly mornynge daye charles went foorth sayde wente poules commyng agayne great fere sayenge hastely get horse great feare hast made hym redye ryde bad mayster porter lad lede hys horse felde backsyde charles put hys sleue hys mase masor wyth plate borowed masteres porter bothe golde syluer howe muche sure charles wente felde hys horse iulyan brought hys booget hym also vpon fryday christmas weke folowyng charles came home late nyght brought hym iii baker smyth stratforde nyght caried charles howse hys goodes feld syde bell shordyche erly morenynge conueyed yt carte stratford moreouer iulyan sayth saturdaye nyght death hun charles ame home broughte hym gurnard sayenge yt hun charles boye telled iulian also ordeyned pece freshe salmon whiche ihon belrynger also charles sayde thesayde iulyan vngratious trouble coulde brynge lorde london dores heretyques london bothe men woman ben worthe thowsand pound aferd vngracions mydwyfe shall bewraye v also charles sayde vnto maistres porter lykewyse larger sayeng best london maistres porter answered best london lord mayer charles saide skuse quyte taketh matter whote charles ioseph sayeth laye necke hill harlott man wyfe baryngtons house thesame nyght abode vntyll morowe xi clocke rycharde hun murthered whereupon brought kynges counsayll hys purgacion orsayde baude baryngtons wyfe also foresayde harlott whiche purgacion haue proued vntreue right largely may appere well deposicion iulian littell thomas chytcheley taylor ihon symons stacioner robert ihonson peter turner deposycion thomas chitcheley taylor thesayd thomas sayeth thesame monday richard hun found dead within quarter hower vii clocke mornyng met wt charles ioseph comyng pouls ye nether north dore goyng toward pater noster row sayg good morow master charles thesayd charles answered good morow turned hys back whan withoute churche dore loked vpon thesayde chitchelay deposicion thomas symondes stacioner sayeth mornyng hun founde deed ye quarter hower vii clock mornynge charles ioseph came sayd good morow gossyp symons symons sayd good morow agayne wyfe thesame symons dedly cotenaunce hasty goyng charles thesayd thomas bad wife loke whither charles gothe coulde perceyue charles went ale howse standyng pater noster rowe aley ledyng rode northerne aley whither could well tell deposicion roberte ihonson vvife dvvellyng bell shord che vvhere charles ioseph sett horse nyghte came toune murther richard hun thesayde robert sayeth charles ioseph sent hys horse hys house vpon holydaye nyght iii wekes christmas boy horse albeswet albe myred thesayd boye sayd let father horse stand sadelled tell whether father wyll ryde agayne nyghte thesayde horse stode sadell nyght morenynge folowynge charles came ed spurred aboute viii clocke asked yf hys horse sadelled seruaunt aunswered ye thesayde charles lepte vpon hys horse prayed hoste let hym hys backe gate myght ryde feld syde whyche host dyd vncertayne daye asked hym yf hard speke death hun tyme aunswered nay shortly dyd neuerthelesse peter turner charles sonne law brought horse nyght bell robert ihonsons house confessed ame night hun founde dead mornyng moreouer frydaye hun deth peter turner sayde honest woman waxe chaundelers wife dwellyng sainct mary spitel gate day seuen night hun haue mischeuouse death daye none hun founde dead thesayde peter came thesame wyfe tolde hun hanged sayenge told also iames chauncelers cooke frydaye hun death sayde v honest men hun dye christmas el would dye hym mondaye hun founde dead thesayde iames came thesame men sayde tolde hanged thynquest asked peter turner iames cooke wher knowlege hun shortely dye thei sayd master chauncellers place euery man deposicion ihon spaldyng belrynger fyrste thesayde deponent sayeth saturdaye seconde daye december anno mdxiiii toke charge pryson foure clocke none commaundemente master chaunceller toke keyes wherupon gaue commaundement deponent let maner person speke wt prysoner excepte knowlege v clocke daye thesayde deponent wente prysoner hym selfe alone sawe hym cheryshed hym gaue thesayde deponente pece fresh salmon hys wyfe thesayde deponent sayeth went master commissary supper felowe remembred left hys knyfe thesayde prysoner wherupo counsayll master commissary went prysoner fetched hys knyfe founde prisoner sayeng beades thesayde deponent requyred knyfe thesayde prisoner thesaide prisoner deliuered knyfe thesayd deponent gladly de parted nyght sonday next folowyng thesayd deponent came prisoner ix clock asked mete would haue diner aunswered morsell thesaide deponet departed went chaunceller quere comauded take penytensary vp prysoner wt hym make hym holy water holy bread made thesaide deponent departe prison house whyle brought hym dyner locked charles boye hym dyner vnto hower clocke let lad agayne asked would haue supper answered meate ynough departed vntyll vi clocke thesayde deponente broughte hym quart al tyme one wyllyam sampson went thesayde deponent see prysoner sawe hym spake together hower vi foresayde vnto twelfe clocke morow thesaide deponent came whan came met chaunceller doctoures goynge se prysoner hanged deposicion peter turner sonne lavv charles ioseph fyrste sayeth father lawe rode toune vpon sonday iii day december anno xvc xiiii vi clock mornynge weryng cote orenge tawny horse cooler grysell trottyng sayeth sondaye next one button wyfe gaue knowlege thesayde deponente hys father shoulde bee arested dyuerse sergeantes assone coulde taken thereupon thesayd deponente gaue knowlege thesayde father lawe blacke fryer water syde wherupon auoyded thesame nyghte mayster chaunceller gaue keyes ihon belrynger gaue charge prysoner thesayde sondaye thesayde deponente wyth ihon belrynger serued thesayde prisoner diner xii ye clocke ihon belrynger sayde deponet would come hym vnto morowe lord comaunded prisoner haue one meales mete daye notwiths adyng thesayde ihon belrynger shut poules church dores went foresayde prisoner another vii clock nyght thesayde sonday sayde deponent sayeth came monday hower eyghte clocke morenynge seke ihon belrynger coulde fynde hym taryed vntyll hye e poules done yet coulde fynde ihon belrynger ihon belryngers felowe one wyllyam delyuered keyes thesayde deponent thesayd deponent two officer lordes beyng somners went serue thesayd prison wh n came prisoner saide hanged face wal warde vpo thesayde deponent immediatly gaue knowelege chaun e ler wherupon chaunceller went vp wt master rolles master bdeane doctoures vnknowen nomber en seruauntes deposicion ihon enderby barber sayde ihon enderby sayth frydaye death richard hun betwixte viii ix clock mornyng met wt ho belrynger est hepe asked master hun fared thesayd belrynger aunswered sayenge ordeyned greuouse penaunce men shall haue great maruel therof wytnesses hard ihon belrynger saye woordes ihon rutte skreuener william segar armourer also thesayd ihon e derby sayth thesame mondaye rychard hun founde dedd met thesayd ihon belrynge ye codyth gracious strete ix clock mornyng askyng ayd belrynger master hun fared thesayde belrynger aun wered ayeng fared wel day mornyng betwixte v vi clock howbeit sory hym body come vntill come haue keyes dorees gyrdel shewed keyes sayd enderby deposicion alen cresvvell vvax chaundeler thesayde alen sayth ihon grandger seruaunte wt lorde londo lord londos kechyn time thesayd alen seryng hun coffen grandger tolde present ihon belrynger thesame sonday night richard oudeded morowe whan keper sett hym stockes muche thesayde hun desyred borow kepers knyfe keper asked would knyfe aunswered leuer kyll self thus entreted deposicion thesayde alen wyll proue farforth christen man may saieng erandger shewed hym woordes awne frewyll mynde without question enquiry made thesayd alen moreouer thesayd alen sayth euenyng grandger great feare depos cion richard horsnayle bailyfe sanctuary tovvne called good esture essex thesaide richard sayth fryday christmas daie last past one charles ioseph somner lord lodo became sanctuary man theaforsayde frydaye regestred name sayde charles sayenge yt sauegarde hys body certayne men london extreme agaynst hym deathe richard hun dare abyde london howbeit sayde charles saithe knowlegeth hym selfe gyltles hun death delyuered keyes chaunceller hy hun life also sayde balife sayth charles payd deuty thesayde regestryng sir ihon studely uicar copye lorde london letter sent lorde cardinall beseche good lordshipp stande good lord vnto poore chaunceller nowe inwarde endited vntrewe quest ye death richard hun vpon accusacion charles ioseph made payne duraunce intercession may please kynges grace haue matter duly sufficiently examined indifferente persones discrete counsayll presence party done cause vpon innocency saide chaunceller declared may please kynges grace ward plackard vnto attnoray confesse saide enditement vntrewe whan tyme shall requyre assured chauceller tryed xii men london thei maliciously set fauorem heretice pra tati wyl cast condempne ony clerke though innocent abell uare sipotes beate pater adiuua infirmitares nostras tibi perpetuum deuincti erimus ouer hu ble wyse beseche maye haue kynges gracious fauour whome neuer offended willyngly good meanes might sp ke grace myne shal pray prosperouse estate long continue humble oratour r l vvoordes lord london spake lordes parliament chamber memorandum byshop london sayde parliament chamber byll brought parliamente make iury charged vppon deathe hun true men sayde tooke vpon conscience false periuried catyfes sayde lordes ther beynge loue god loke vpon matter yf ye dare kepe myne awne house heretiques sayde thesaide rychard hun hanged hym selfe yt hys awne dede man el sayde came man hys howse whose wyfe appeched heresye speke hym sayde mynde speke thesame man man spake reported seruauntes byshoppe yf hys wyfe woulde holde styll opinion woulde cutte throte awne handes woordes sentence quest subscribed crouner inquisicion intendid taken cytie london parishe sainct gregorie warde baynard castell londo vi daye december yere raigne kynge henry viij vi yere afore thomas barnewell rouner soueraigne lorde kynge within citie london aforesayde also afore iames yarford ihon mondey sheriffes thesayde citie vppon sight bodye rychard hun late london taylour founde hanged lollars towre othe profe lawfull men thesame warde iii wardes next adioyning ought custome ci ie aforesayde enquyre maner wyse thesayde rycharde hun came vnto hys death vpon othe ihon bernard thomas sterte william warren henry abraham ihon aborow ihon turner robert alen william marler ihon burton iames page thomas pickehyll william burton robert brigewater thomas busted gilbert howell rychard gibson christopher crofton ihon eod rychard holte ihon pasmere edmonde hudson ihon aunsell rycharde couper ihon tynie sayde vpon othes sayd rychard hun commaundement rycharde bishop londo enprisoned brought holde pryson sayd bishop called lollars towre lyeng cathedral churche saincte paule london paryshe sainct gregorie warde baynerd castell aforesayde william horseley london clercke otherwise called william heresie chauncelour rycharde bishop london one charles ioseph late lodo somner ihon spaldyng lo otherwise called ihon belrynger felonyousely felos lord kynge force armes againste peace oure soueraigne lorde kynge dignitie hys croune iiii daye december yere reygne soueraigne lorde vi aforesayd great malice parishe saincte gregorie aforesayde vppon sayde rycharde hun made fraye thesame rycharde hun felonyously strangeled smodered also necke breake thesayde rychard hun felo yously slew murthered hym also body sayd rycharde hun afterwarde iiii daye yere place parishe warde aforesayde proper gyrdell thesame rychard hun sylke blacke coloure value xii death vpon hoke dryuen pece tymber walle pryson aforesayd made faste hanged hym agaynst peace oure soueraigne lorde kynge dignitie hys croune thesayd iury hathe sworne vpon holy euangelist sayde william horsey clercke charles ioseph ihon page duplicate page duplicate sp ldynge set malice felonyously kylled murthered thesayde rychard hun maner forme abouesayde agaynste peace soueraigne lord kyng croune dignitie subscribed maner thomas barnewell crouner citie london chri temas newyeres night king duke suffolke ii mantel clothe siluer lyned blew veluet syluer pounsed letter veluet might sene mantel great cape like portingal opys hosen dublettes cote thesame fasshio cut thesame stuffe iiii ladyes gounes fashio sauoy blew veluet lyned clothe golde veluet cutte mantel like typpettes knytte together al siluer heddes bonettes burned golde iiii torche b arers satten white blewe straunge apparell pleased muche euery person especial quene thus iiii lordes iiii ladyes came quenes chamber great light torch daunsed greate season put visers well knowen quene hartelye thanked kynges grace goodly pastyme kyssed hym likewise twelfe night kyng quene came hall grenewyche sodainlye entered tent clothe golde tent stode iiii men armes armed poinctes swerdes handes sodainly noyes trompettes entered iiii person armed ran foure great fear e fight sodainly came oute place lyke wood viii wyldemen apparayled grene mosse made slyued sylke uggly weapon terrible visage foughte knyghtes viii viii long fighting armed knightes draue wylde men place folowed chace oute hall whe departed tent opened came vi lordes vi ladyes rychely apparayled daunsed great tyme daunsed pleasure entered tent conueyed hal kynge quene serued right sumpteous banquet iii daye februarie kynge made solempne iustes marque dorset would aunswer commers apparell bardes blewe veluet clothe siluer cutte suttell knottes rychely embraudered al seruitours white blew sylke counterparte whiche xiiii number richely apparailed veluet clothe golde brouderie euery man ter hys awne deuice kynge daye highly praysed brake xxiii speres besyde attayntes bare doune grounde man armes hys horse lorde marque dyd valiauntly hadde muche prayse euery man passinge well seldome sene suche case kynge suertie exceded iiii daye october kynge remoued lambeth morow beganne hygh courte parliamet syr thomas neuel speaker parliament diuerse actes made especiall two muche spoke one acte apparayll acte laborer ii actes muche co monynge muche busynes arose laborer woulde wyse labour daye taske grette therefore muche trouble fell courte especial haruest tyme husbande men coulde scace get workemen helpe haruest thys parliament contynued tyl easter dyuerse subsidy graunted kynge towarde hys greate costes charge bene hys vyage royall fraunce easter xix daye moneth aprill kynge delitynge set forth youge gentelmen called nycholas carew fraunces bryan caused dyuerse younge gentelmen counter parte lent horse harnes encourage youthe seke dedes armes yere dyed rome poyson reported archebishop yorke cardinallcardinal brick poysened rome called doctor benbrycke whyche kynges ambassadour wise ioly courage kyng gaue thesayd archebishoprike thomas wolsey bishop lyncoln tyme bare rule aboute kyng sayd obeyed place whe archebishop studyed daye night cardinal caused kyng frenche kyng wryte rome requestes obteyned purpose shall afterwarde tyme much comoning verely appered entended kyng person woulde passe sea caleys march thesame frenche kyng quene come se kyng brother thesame iornay many costely workes wrought much ryche apparel prouided much preparacio made next spring death last ende thinges let iornay next spring frenche kyng dyed citie parys first daye ianuary whe ben maryed lxxxii dayes kyng aduertised death frenche kyng caused solepne obsequie songe cathedrall churche poule wt costly herse many noble men beynge present sent letter comfort quene sister requyrynge knowe pleasure whither woulde continue still fraunce returne englande agayne aduertised purpose retorne england sent duke suffolke syr rychard wyngfeld doctor west goodl bade yomen blacke parys whiche well receyued newe frech king frauces first name declared according couenauntes made tyme mariage betwene kynge loyes ladye marie sister king englade demauded haue thesayde quene deliuered ower shewed comission receite cousaill frauce accordinge apointmentes assigned dower duke suffolke put officer endenture deliuered duke behaued selfe obteyned good wil husbande therupon wrote kyng brother mekely besechynge hym pardon request hublye requyringe hym hys wil co sent thynge kyng staied last meane frenche quene selfe great frendes duke parte log suyte agreed duke suffolke bring england vnmaryed hys retorne mary england doubte chaunge maryed secretely parys sayde pthe vii yere duke suffolke receaued frenche quene dower apoynted apparell iuels housholde stuffe deliuered quene toke leaue freche kyng leauing doctor west nominate bishop ely conclusion newe league made betwene kyng englande newe frenche kynge called fraunces first passed thorough fraunce caleys honorably enterteined great honour maried lord charles brandon duke suffolke opely howbeit sayd maryed priuely parys house cluigny mariage many men grudged sayd great losse realme maryed prynce castell wisest sorte cotet cosideryng ben maryed agayn realm haue caried much rich brought euery yere realme ix xm markes whatsoeuer rude people said ye duke behaued selfe fauour kyng people hys wytte demeanour suche king quene accopanyed many lordes ladyes roade high ground shoters hil take open ayre thei passed waye espied copany tall yomen clothed grene grene whodes bowes arrowes iynge nuber iic one called selfe robyn hood came kyng desyring se men shoote kyng cotent whisteled al iic archer shot losed whisteled agayne likewyse shot agayne arrowes whisteled crafte head noyes straunge great muche pleased kynge quene company archer kynges garde thus appareled selues make solace kynge robyn hood desyred kynge quene come grene wood outlawes lyue kyng demaunded quene ladyes durst aduenture go wood many outlawes quene sayde pleased content horne blewe tyl came wood vnder shoters hil arber made boowes hal great chaber inner chamber well made couered swete herbes whiche kyng muche praysed sayde robyn hood sir outlawes brekefastes venyson therefore must contente suche fare vse kyng quene sate doune serued venyson wyne robyn hood hys men theyr great contentacion kyng departed hys company robyn hood hys men condu cted returnynge met ii ladyes ryche chariot drawen v horse euery horse hys name head euery horse sate ladye wt name write fir cours r called cawde sate humidite humide ii courser called meme n roade lady vert iii called pheron sate lady veg taue iiii called rimphon sate lady pleasaunce v called lampace sate swete odour chayre sate lady may accopanyed lady flora rychely appareled saluted kinge diuerse goodly songes brought hym grenewyche maiyng great nubre people beholde great solace confort thesame none king duke suffolke marque dorset erle essex bardes base grene veluet cloth golde came felde great courser whome wayted diuerse getleme sylke thesame colour side entred xvi lordes getleme al appareyled richely deuises rane course appointed rane volat one might ouertake another goodly ght se al done departed went goodly banquet somer kyng tooke progresse westward visited tounes castels harde c play te poore cominaltie euer roade huted liberally departed veny myddes septeber came maner okyng thether came hym archbishop yorke whome hartely welcomed shewed great pleasure soiourned ther letter brought ye archebishop fro rome certefiyng elected cardinal incotinet shewed thesame kyng disablinge hym self wordes though entet otherwise king encourage willed take ye order called lorde cardinal hat bul ceremonyes yet come moneth nouember kyng assembled hys hygh court parliament westmynster diuerse actes made p rliamet vi yere amended altered especially acte apparell acte labourer booke statute plainly apereth ende parliament archebishop cautourbury perc auing archebishop yorke medled office chaunc lourship became suffer except would aueture kynges displeasure seynge also thesayd bishop yorke cou ted beare rule haue whole authoritie consideringe also awne great age gaue vp kinges hades hys rowme chauncelour deliuered kynge greate seale whiche deliuered thesame archebishop yorke made chauncelour assone chaucelour directed comissios al shire put statute apparell statute labourer execucion selfe one daye called gentelma named symon fyzrichard tooke olde iacket crymosyn veluet diuerse brooch whiche exstreme doyng caused greatly hated exsample many cruell officiers malice euell intreated dyuerse kynges subiectes muche one shynnynge mayre rochester set young man pillory wering ryuen shert ende moneth sent england cardinalles hatthe cardinal ha recea receaued gentelmen kent brought london suche triumphe though greatest prince christendo bene come realme sonday peter church westmynster receaued habite hat piller vaynglorious tryfles apperteygnyng ordre cardinall perfite cardinal loked aboue estate almost hated hym disdayned hym parliamet syr edward pouninges laboured discharged ye keping citie torney euer sickly discharged syr willia blunt lorde moutioye sent thether marshal apoynted syr sapson norto lord mountioye come thether syr sampson norton happened ryot citie great ieopardy ye cause vnknowen souldiours except kynges garde rebelled put lord moutioye ieopardy life coclusion appease people syr sapson norto banisshed toune euer citie appeased euery thing thought forgotte diuerse executed diuerse banished toun fled banyshed bothe england toune parliamet ended kyng kept solepne christmas maner eltha xii night hal made goodly castel woderously set certeyn ladyes knyghtes kyng quene set came knightes assailed castel wher many good strype geuen last assaylantes beate awaye issued knightes lady castel ladyes ryche straungely disguysed theyr apparel braydes gold fret mouing spangels syluer gilt set crymosyn satten lose fastened men apparell thesame suyte made lyke iulys hungary ladyes heddes bodyes fassion amsterdam daunsing done banquet serued iic dyshes great plety euery body yere new league betwene kyng french kyng openly proclaymed thorough cytie london tropet yere also margaret quene scottes wife iames iiii slain bramston v yere kyng elder syster kyng death late husband maried archibald douglas erle angus without kyng brother assent cousail scotlad whiche wel cotent fell stryfe betwene lordes scotlad husband lyke banished persones came england wrote kyng mercy cofort kyng euer enclyned mercy sent theim apparell vessell thynges necessary willyng lye still northumberland till knewe farther pleasure laye still harbotell quene deliuered fayre lady called margaret countrey commaunded kyng pleasour yere xviii february grenewyche borne fayre prynces christened great solempnitie named mary yere dyed kyng arragon father quene whome kept solempne obsequy cathedral churche paules pthe viii yere ye haue harde laste yere quene scottes wt husband come succour englad laye harbottell northumberland tyll kynges pleasure send lyke natural brother sent husbande come courte solace kyndnes erle hubly thanked kyng promised geue attendauce quene hys wyfe courte wherupo kyng sent william blacknall esquyer clerck hys spycery siluer vessell plate thynges necessary conueyauce sent maner officiers estate couenyent whe ready departe asked husband departed scotland left alone thing remembringe promes sodeyn departyng muche made muse howbeit lordes england greatly encoraged kepe promyse kynge brother somewhat appeased set forward euery toune wel receaued iii day may made entry lodo riding white palfreye ye quene england sent behynde syr thomas par richely besene wt great copany lordes ladyes roade thoroughe citie baynardes castel fro thence coueyghed grenewiche receaued ioyously kyng quene freche quene syster highly feasted kyng hearde erle angus husband departed sayd done lyke scot quene sometyme courte sometyme baynardes castel contynued englande yere kynge honour syster xix xx daye maye prepared ii solepne dayes iustes kynge hym selfe duke suffolke erle essex nicholas carew esquyer toke aunswer comer apparell horse blacke velu couered ouer brauches hony suckels yne flat gold damaske lose worke euery lete brauche mouing embroudery coning sumpteous kyng atteding one uyte horseback lord marque dorset erle surrey ye lord burga lord hastinges syr ihon pechy ye lord ferreys syr william fitzwillia xii knyghtes frockes blewe veluet ga ded ryche cloth golde horse trapper blew veluet rynged golde foote xl person blewe sattyn garded clothe golde entered felde wyth rompettes dro siades myns relsey came coutreparte richely appareled nuber xii daye euery wel kyng best adiudged night ceassed came supper kyng next day copany appareyled horse purple veluet set ful leaues cloth gold engrayled fyne flat gold damaske embroudered like rose leues euery lefe fastened pointes damaske gold border letter gold bullion kyng wayted v lordes xiiii knightes frockes yelow veluet garded boude riche clothe golde
