xxx gentelme like apparel fote xl officiers yelow satyn dged cloth gold thus great triuphe entred ye felde coutrepartie entred al clothed barded white sattyn trauersed wt cloth gold richely dai many great stripe geue kyng syr willia kyngsto rane together syr willia strog tall knight yet ye king stregth ouerthrew ye groud ye king aide performed course thei rane volat al comer pleasaut sight se whe night approched disarmed wet quenes chaber great banket welcome quene scottes thys moneth may sent england xiic mason carpenter iiic laborer citie torney kyng cousail cosidering garrison kept chargeable therfore determined shoulde buylded castel chastice citie rebelled minyshe garrison therfore workemen sent thether whiche yere began strong castell wrought still yere cardinall men called accompt occupiyng kynges money warres el euery man contentacion ound arrerages saued selfes pollecy brybory waxed ryche innocentes punyshed truthe punyshed periurye open punyshment open paper werynge tyme lesse vsed punyshed also lordes knyghtes men sortes ryottes beryng mayntenaunce countreyes poore lyued quyetly man durst beare feare imprisonement hym selfe seruautes well punyshed therfore poore people perceaued punished ryche complayned without number brought many honest man trouble vexacion cardinall last perceaued theyr vntrue surmyses fayned coplaintes parte wexed wery heryng cause ordeyned kynges comissio diuerse vnder courtes coplaintes byll poore people one kept white hall kynges almoner doctor stokes ey learning discrecio iudge third kept lord treasourers chaber besyde starre chaber iiii rolles noone courtes greatly haunted tyme last people perceaued muche delay vsed courtes matter ended ended boud law euery wery resorted como lawe moneth october came england mathew bishop sedono cardinal called comonly cardinal swyshes fro emperour maximilia cardinal wise great boldenes wel entreteyned courte ye king coteplacion olde loue ye king let ye emperour maximilia great sume money wherof ye copany friscobalde antony caueler geneuoy vndertoke thexchage thei payed ye emperour day wt stading thei receaued ye money ye king friscobald anthony caueler meanes rewardes geue great lordes cousaill borowed king xxxm log dayes paymet friscobald shortely cosumed anthony caueler coulde sene kig payd dayes many english merchautes vndone spent liberally euery man goodes yere king kept christmas maner grenewiche xii night according old custome quene came hall set quene scottes also entred hall gardeyn artificial called gardeyn esperace gardeyn towred euery corner rayled wt rayles gilt al bakes set wt floures artificial silke golde leues cut grene sattyn semed floures middest gardeyn piller antique worke al golde set wt perle stone toppe piller vi square louer arche embowed crouned golde within stoode bushe rose red white sylke golde bushe pomegranate lyke stuf gardey walked vi knyghtes vi ladyes richely appareyled discended daunsed many goodly daunses ascended ye gardeyn agayn conueighed oute hall kynge serued great banket christmas kyng exercised self muche hawkynge ceason genowayes frenchemen straungiers say e boasted selfes suche fauour kyng hys counsayll set naughte ruler citie multitude raungers great aboute london poore englishe artificer coulde skace get lyuynge moost straungers proude dis ayned mocked oppressed englishemen whiche beginnynge grudge amonge thynges carpenter london called willyan son whiche bought two stockdoues chepe abou e paye frencheman tooke oute hys hande sayde meate carpenter well sayde englishman haue bought payd therefore haue naye sayde frencheman haue theim lorde ambassador better worse frencheman called englisheman knaue went awaye stockdoues straungiers came frenche ambassadour surmysed coplaynt agaynste poore carpenter ambassadour came lorde mayre sayde muche carpenter sent pryson yet contented complayned kynges counsail kynges commaund ement layde hym syr ihon baker knyght worshipfull persones sued ambassadour hymthe pr de frenchem n auswered body god english knaue shoulde lose lyfe sayde englisheman shoulde deny frenchemen required aunswer none also frencheman slayne man abiure realme crosse hande sodeinly came great sorte frechmen aboute one sayde constable led hym syr crosse price kyll englishman costable somwhat astonyed aunswered sayde another frencheman pryce woulde banyshed masse thys saiyng noted spoken spitefully howebeit frenchemen alonely oppressor englishman lombarde called fraunces de bard entised mannes wyfe lombarde strete come cha bre husbandes plate whiche thynge dyd husbande knewe demaunded hys wyfe aunswer made shoulde haue demaunded plate lyke maner aunswer made shoulde neither haue plate wyfe whe sewed accion agaynste straunger guylde hall straunger faced englisheman faynted hys sute lombarde arrested poore man wyfes boorde kept fro husbad chaber mocke much noted many oppression done encreased suche malice englishe mennes harte laste brast oute amongest sore grudged matter broker london called ihon lyncoln whiche wrote bill easter desyring doctor standyche hys sermon sainct marye spyttell mondaye easter weke moue mayre alderman take parte comminaltie agaynst straungiers doctor aunswered became hym moue anye suche thynge sermon hym departed came chanon sayncte mary spittell doctor deuinitie called doctor bele lamentably declared hym howe miserably common artificer lyued skase coulde get woorke fynde wyfes chyldren nuber artificer straungers tooke awaye lyuynge maner also howe englishe merchauntes coulde haue vtteraunce merchaunt raungers brynge sylkes clothe golde wyne oyle iron suche merchaundise man almoost byeth englisheman also outwarde carye muche englishe wolle tynne leade englishman auenture outwarde haue lyuyng whiche thynges sayd lyncoln hathe bene shewed counsayll cannot heard farther sayde straungiers compasse cytye rounde aboute southwarke westmynster temple barre holborne sayncte martynes sayncte ihons strete algate towre hyll sayncte katherynes forstall market good thynge commeth market whiche cause englishemen want sterue thei lyue haboundantly great pleasoure wherefore sayde lyncolne master doctor syth borne lodon se oppression straugers great misery awne natyue countray exhorte cytiezens ioyne one agaynst straungers raueners destroyer countrey master doctor hearynge thys sayde muche lamented case lyncoln hadde declared yes sayde lyncolne muche dutcheme bryng ouer iron tymber lether weynskot ready wrought nayles locke baskettes cupbordes stooles table ches e gy dels poyntes sadel e painted clothes wrought englishman might haue worke lyuynge besyde growe multitude looked vpon sawe sondaye lent vic strau giers shotyng popyngaye crosoowes kepe assemblyes fraternity together make gathering co mon boxe euery botcher holde plee citye lodo wel sayd doctor reformacion matter asmuche priest may receaued lincolnes byl studyed purpose lyncoln ioyous hys enterprice went man man saiyng shortly shoulde heare newes daily excited younge people artificer beare malice raungiers ester came doctor bele preache twesdaye ester weke came pulpit declared brought pitiful bill red thys wyse al worshipful lordes master citie wil take copassion ouer poore people neyghbours also great importable hurtes loss hynderaunces whereof procedeth extreme pouertie kynges subiectes inhabite within citie suburbes thesame alyens straugiers eate bread poore fatherles chyldren take liuynge artificer entercourse merchauntes wherby pouertie muche encreased euery man bewaileth misery craftes brought beggery merchauntes nedynes wherefore premiss considred redresse must common knyt vnyte one parte hurt dammage greueth men muste men set willyng power remedy suffre thesayd alyens highly wealth naturall borne men region come confusion letter doctor red farther began coelum coeli domino terram autem dedit fil hominum vpon thys text intreated lande geuen englishemen byrdes woulde defende nest oughte englishemen cheryshe defende selfes hurte greue alien common weale vpon text pugna pro patria brought howe goddes lawe lawfull fight cou trey euer subtellye moued people rebell agaynst strau giers breake kynges peace nothynge regardynge league betwene prince kynges honoure sermon many light person tooke courage openly spake straungiers deuell woulde sundaye grenewiche kynges gallery fraunces de bard whiche harde kept englishe man wyfe goodes yet coulde haue remedy domyngo anthony caueler many mo straugers ther talkynge syr thomas palmer knyght iested laughed howe fraunces kepte englishemans wyfe saiynge mayres wife london woulde kepe syr thomas sayd sir haue muche fauour englande diuerse englishe merchauntes harde laugh content somuche one william bolt marcer sayd wel eson lombardes reioyse laugh masse one daye haue daye come saiynge merchauntes affirmed tale reported aboute london younge euell disposed people sayde woulde reuenged merchaunt straungiers well artificer straungiers monday morow kyng remoued hys maner rychemonde pthe ix yere vpon rumour xxviii daye aprill diuerse youge men citie assauted alyens passed stretes strike buffeted throwen canel wherfore mayre sent diuerse persos ward stephyn studley skynner bettes stephenson diuerse one couter another newgate sodeynly comen secret rumour could tell began may daye next citie would rebell slaye alien somuche diuerse straungers fled oute citie brute ranne farre came kynges cousayl insomuch cardinall beyng lord chaucelour sent ihon rest mayre citie counsail citie demauded mayre case citie stode whome aunswered wel good quyet nay sayd cardinal informed v youg ryotous people ryse distresse straungiers heare ye thing surely sayd mayre trust gouerne kynges peace shalbe obserued dare vndertake brother alderman may suffered wel sayd ye cardi al go ho e wisely forsee matter suche thing preuent mayre came cardinal none may euen demauded officiers diuerse aunswered voyce people ben ii iii dayes heryng mayre ent al brethre guylde hall great hast almost vii clocke assemble wasset declared master brooke recorder kynges cousail reported cominaltie night would ryse distresse alies straungers yt inhabited citie lodon alderme auswered harde say mistrusted matter yet sayd wel done forsee sayd recorder best substacial watche set honest person housholders whiche might withstand euell doer alderman sayde euell rayse men harneys suche thinge entended coulde tell woulde take parte another alderman sayd best kepe younge men asonder euery man shut hys doores kepe hys seruauntes within opinion recorder sent ye cardinal viii clocke suche kynges counsaill hys place commauded wyse watche shoulde kept euery man shoulde repayre hys awne house kepe hym hys seruauntes tyl vii clocke mornynge whiche commaundement sayde rycharde brooke serge unt lawe recorder lyr thomas moore late vndershrife lo kynges cousaill came guy de hall halfe houre ix clocke shewed commaundemet kynges counsayl hast euery alderman sent warde man styrre ix clocke house may day kepe hys doores shut hys seruauntes within tyll vii clocke mornynge commaundement syr ihon mondy alderman came hys warde founde two young men chepe plaiynge buckelers great company young men lokynge commaundement skace knowen ix clocke master mo dy seyng bade leaue one younge man asked hym sayd thou shalt know toke hym arme haue counter youg resisted alderman toke master mondy cryed prentyses clubbes euery doore came clubbes weapos alderman fled great daung er people arose euery quarter oute came seruynge men water men courtier xi clocke chepe vi vii hundreth oute paules churcheyarde came iii hundreth wist place gathered brake vp counter tooke prisoner mayre thether committed hurtynge straungers came newgate tooke studley petyr committed thether cause mayre shrifes present made proclamacio kynges name nothynge obeyed thus ranne plump thorow sainct nycholas shables saynct martyns gate met syr thomas moore desyrynge theym go lodgynges intreatyng almost brought staye people aynct martynes threwe oute stone battes hurte dyuerse honest persones persuadynge ryotous people ceasse bade holde handes still threwe oute bryckes hoate water sergeaunt armes called nycholas dounes whiche master moore entreatynge beynge sore hurt fury cryed doune misruled person ranne dores wyndowes saynct martyn spoyled founde caste strete lefte fewe house vnspoyled ranne hedlynge cornehill leaden hal house one mutuas frencheman pycarde borne whiche greate bearer frenchemen pyckpursses howe euell disposicion soeuer within hys gate called grenegate dwelled dyuerse frenchman kalendred worsted contrary kynges lawes borne thesame mutuas yt durst medle wt wherfore sore hated people found fury would haue striken head whe foud hym water men certayn young priestes fell rif ynge ranne blachechapelton brake straugers house threwe shooes bootes strete x xi clocke continued ryotous people durynge whiche cyme knight called syr thomas parr great hast went cardinall tolde thys ryot incotinent strengthened house men ordinaunce knight roade kyng richemod made ye report much wherfore king hastely sent lodo truly aduertised matter ryot ceassed many doer appreheded ruffling cotinued syr richard cholmeley knyght lieutenaut towre great frende co citie frantyke fury losed certayn peces ordinaunce shot citie whiche litle harme howbeit good wil apered iii clocke ryotous person seuered went place resorte waye taken mayre heddes citie sent towre newgate counter number iiic fled specially waterman priestes seruyng men poore prentises taken fyue clocke erles shrewesbury surrey whiche harde ryot came london suche strength dyd innes court diuerse noble men came ryot ceased many taken haue heard prisoner examined sermon docter bele called remembraunce taken sent towre ihon lyncoln ryot cardinall sore displeased iiii day may oyer determiner londo mayre duke norffolke erle surrey citie thought duke bare grudge lewde priest yere slayn chepe much duke fury sayd pray god may haue citezes daungier duke also thought bare good wil wherfore came citie wtith xiiic men harneys kepe oyer determiner vpo examinacio could neuer proued metyng gathering talking conuenticle daye tyme day chauce happened wtout matter prepensed creature sauing lyncoln neuer honest person maner taken onely proclamacions made wome shoulde come together bable talke men kepe wyues house stretes notable stode ful harnessed men spake many opprobrious wordes citezens greued sore woulde haue bene reuenged worsse citezes iic one lyke true subiectes suffred paciently lordes set prisoner brought thorough stretes tyed rope men laddes chyldren xiii yere great mourning father frendes chyldren kyn olke emong prisoner many citie priestes husbandman laborer whole prisoner clxxviii person cause treason kyng amitie christen prynces broke tru league cotrary statute kyng hery v treaso diuerse endited yt tyme lordes departed next day duke came agayn erle surrey iim armed men kept stretes whe mayre duke erle shrewsbury surrey set prisoner arreigned xiii founde giltye high treason adiudged hanged drawen quartered execucion wherof set vp xi payre galowes diuerse place offence done algate blachechapel gracious strete leade hal euery couter one newgate marteus aldrisgate bishopsgate sight sore greued people se galowes set kynges chaber ye prysoners iudged brought place execucio executed rygorous maner lord edmod haward sonne duke northfolke knight mershal shewed mercy extreme cruelty poore yo gelinges execucio likewise duke seruautes spake many opprobrious wordes bad hage bad drawe bad set citie fy suffred thursday vii day may lyncoln shyrwyn two brethre called bet diuerse adiudged dye lyncoln said lordes meant wel knew mischief ensued realme straugers would remedy many tymes haue coplayned called busy felow lord haue mercy thesayd person layd hardels drawen standarde chepe first ihon lyncoln executed rope neckes came commaudemet fro kyng respite execucion people cryed god saue ye king oyer determiner deferred tyll another daye prisoner sent agayn warde harnessed men departed oute london thynges quyet xi daye maye kynge came maner grenewiche recorder london diuerse alderman came speake grace al ware gounes black coloure percea ed king comming priuie chambre chabre presence kneled doune ye recorder sayd natural beninge souereigne lorde knowe well grace displeased v citie lodon great ryot late done assertein grace none v honest person condesendynge enormitie yet oure wyfes chyldre euery houre lament fauour shoulde taken v forasmuche light ydle persones doer thesame moost hubly beseche grace haue mercy v negligence compassion offendours offence trespasse truly sayd kyng haue highly displeased offended v ye oughte wayle sory thesame ye saye substanciall person concentyng thesame appereth contrary neuer moued let theim sturred fight theim whiche saye small numbre light persones wherefore must thynke cannot deny dyd wyncke matter tyme graunt neither fauor good thoffenders mercy resort cardinall lord chaucelour shal make answer declare pleasure answer ye lodoners departed made relacio maior xviii day moneth quene scottes bene courte baynardes castell whole yere kynges charge richely apoynted thinges mete estate iewells plate tapissry arras coyne horsses thinges kynges gift liberalitie departed london toward scotland great ryches albeit came englande muche pouertie entred scotland xiii daye iuyn whome husband receaued berwick englishman smally regarded charge within realme comminge courte returnynge kynges pursse thursdaye xxii day may kynge came westmynster hall whome vpper ende set clothe estate place hanged arras cardinal duke northfolke suffolke ye erles shrewsbury fo essex wilshyre surrey many lordes kinges cousail mayre alderme al chief citie best liuery according cardinal apoynted ix clock kynge comaunded prisoner brought foorth came poore youglinges olde false knaues boude rope along one another shertes euery one halter neck nuber iiiic xi wome whe come kinges presence cardinal sore laied mayre cominaltie negligece prisoner declared deserued death offence al prisoner together cryed mercy gracious lord mercy lordes altogether besought grace mercy whose request kyng pardoned al cardinal gaue vnto good exhortacion great gladnes herers whe generall pardo pronouced ye prisoner shouted atonce altogether cast vp halter hall roffe kyng might perceaue none discretest sorte noted diuerse offender take hering king inclined mercy came wel appareled westmynster sodeynly stryped shertes wt halter came emog prisoner willingly partaker kynges pardon whiche doyng well knowen one iho gelson yoman croune first began spoyle exhorted dooe thesame fled taken came rope prisoner pardon compaignie called blacke wagon galowes within citee taken doune many good praier saied kyng citezens toke hede seruauntes ne kyng hym diuerse ambassador solace prepared costly iustes hymself xii duke suffolk xii base bard one halfe clothe siluer halfe blacke tinsell siluer curious lose worke white veluet embraudered golde cut siluer euery cut engrailed golde side golde siluer veluet blacke tynsell side blacke veluet embraudered golde cut euery cut engrayled flat gold damaske base barde broudered greate letter massy golde bullion full pearles stone merueilous riche al compaignie wer like suite sauyng thei iuelles kyng hed lady sleue full diamondes kyng attended ge tlemen armourer officiers nomber cxxv persones white ueluet white sattyn horse harneis horseman cappes hosen footemen white kinges cost royally kyng compaignie waiter came tiltes ende entered duke suffolke marque dorcet erles essex surrey viii bande bardes base white ueluet crimosin sattin losenged set full letter c gold charles mary thei toke ende tilt trompettes blewe kyng duke ranne fiercely together brake many speres harde saie best course ronne thei ranne volant one another bothe reporte sir edwarde gylforde master armury also iudges heraldes iustes wer broken fiue hudred sixe speres kyng thesame night made ambassador sumpteous banket many ridelles muche pastyme greate triumphe kyng appointed gestes pastyme sommer sodeinly came plague sickenes called swetyng sickenes turned purpose malady cruell killed within three houres within twoo houres mery diner dedde supper many died kynges courte lorde clinton lorde grey wilton many knightes gentleman officiers plague mighelmas terme adiourned malady continued iuly middes december kyng kept hymself euer small compaignie kept solempne christmas willyng haue resort feare infeccion muche lamented nomber people one toune halfe people died toune thirde parte sweate feruent infeccious pthe x yere beginnyng yerethe ix yere trinite terme begon oxenford continued one day adiourned westminster yere came calice fro pope leo legate de latere called laurence campeius commonly called cardinall campeius exhorte kyng make warre turke likewise thesaied leo sent iii legate furth tyme thesaid purpose one frauce another spain third germany cardinall yorke knewe commyng legate englande whiche haue greater preheminence cardinall whose ambicion neuer satisfied caused bisshoppe certain docters passe sea calice welcome hym shewe hym would haue pope purpose take effecte englande wise sende poste rome haue thesaied cardinall yorke legate also ioyned commission hym whiche thyng doen without good rewardes thirtie fiue day bull broughte calice duryng whiche tyme cardinall yorke sent legate calice redde cloth clothe seruauntes whiche commyng calice meanely appareled thynges ready passed sea landed douer kept furthe iorney toward londo euery toune thei passed receiued procession accompaignied lordes gentleman kent came black heth met hym duke norffolke great nomber prelate knightes gentleman richely appareled waie brought riche tente clothe golde shifted hymself robe cardinall edged ermyns toke moyle ridyng toward london night came london cardinall yorke furnishe carriage cardinall campeius sent hym twelue mulettes emptie cofers couered redde whiche twelue mulettes wer led london emongest mulettes campeius whiche eight xx mulettes passed stretes though thei full treasure apparell necessary thei came chepe one mulettes brake keper ouerthrewe chestes ouerturned twoo three mulettes cariages whiche fell suche violence diuerse theim vnlocked fell olde hosen broken shoen roasted fleshe peces breade egges muche vile baggage whiche sight boyes cryed see see lorde legate threasure muleters wer ashamed tooke vp stuffe passed furth thre clock none xxix day iuly thesaid legate entred cite sothwarke met hym clergie london cross sensers cope sensed great reuerence maior alderman occupacions citee best liueries stode stretes hym highly honored sir thomas made brief oracio name citee whe cam paules ther receiued bishop mitred vnder canapy entred churche whiche canapy seruautes toke fee offred gaue benediccion al people toke mule al train aforsaid conueighed bathe place rested welcomed cardinall yorke sondaie next ensuyng twoo cardinalles legate toke barge came renewiche eche beside cross two pillers siluer two litle ax gilte two cloke bagges embroudered cardinalles hattes borne thei came kynges hall cardinall yorke went right hande kyng royally appareled accompaignied met uen though bothe come rome brought bothe vp chamber presence solempne oracion made italian declaryng cause legacy twoo article one aide god enemy second reformacion clergie masse doen thei chamber serued lordes knightes muche solempnitie dinner thei toke leaue kyng came london rode citee together greate pompe glory lodgynges cardinall yorke thus legate set vp court called court legate proued testametes hard cause great hinderaunce bishop realme visited bisshopes clergie exempt exempt vnder colour reformacion gat muche treasure nothyng reformed came mi hie exaple pride priestes spiritual persones wexed proude thei ware veluet silke bothe gounes iackettes doblettes shoe kept open lechery highly bare theselfes reason aucthorities faculty durst reproue thyng feare bee called heretike thei would make hym smoke beare faggot cardinall hymself elated thought hymself gall kyng said masse made duke erl rue hym wyne say taken holde ba lauatories thus pride ambicion cardinal clergie high maner al good person abhorred disde ed yere french kyng wrote kyng england wer pleasure would send ambassade england comon kyng counsaill redemyng citee turney thynges whiche answered messenger ambassade frenche kyngs right hartely welcome french king sent england lorde boneuet hygh admyral fraunce bishop parys chiefe ambassador accompanyed many noble men young freshe galates courte fraunce nubre lxxx came great nubre rascal pedlers iuellers brought ouer hattes cappes diuerse merchaudise vncustomed vnder coloure trussery ambassadours noble men landed douer thei receaued noble gentleman countrey conu igh lodgyng lodgynge tyll came blackheth went cariages people great numbre summe xiic one whiche thought many ambassade e ge tlemen fraunce freshe monday xxvii day september erle surrey hygh admyrall englande coate riche tyssue cut cloth siluer gr courser richely trapped great whistell gold set stone perle han yng great massy chayne baudryck wise accompanyed clx gentleman rychely appareled goodly horsses came blackheth amiably receaued ambassador frauce youg gala e frauce coates garded one colour cut x xii partes richely beholde al englishme accoupled selues frenchman louingly together roade lo ii admyrals folowed xxiiii freche kynges garde whome accompanyed xxiiii kynges garde great numbre archer nubre iiiic order passed thorough citie taylers hal chiefe ambassador lodged renaunt marchautes house lordes lodgynges frech harder opened ware made taylers hal lyke paunde marte doynge many englishma grudged auailed last day septeber frech ambassador toke barge came grenewiche admyrall goune cloth siluer raysed furred ryche sable al copany almost new fassio garmet called shemew effect goune cut middle getleme frauce brought kynges presence wher bishop parys made solepne oracio beyng ended auswer made therto kyng highly entreteyned admirall hys company dyd english lordes gentleman ambassadours beyng dayly counsail grenewiche gentleman daunced passed tyme quenes chabre lady gentlewoman long cousailing muche desyring french kyng counsayll agreed citie tourney deliuered frenche kynge payenge vi hundred thousande crounes citie iiii hundred thousand crounes castell ye kyng buylded fully performed also pay xxiiim l tourney whiche summe citezens citie turney ought kyng england liberty fraunchises upon agremetes performed cocluded citye tourney deliuered french kyng frenchman soner come purpose made pretece mariage betwene dolphyn sonne heyre freche kyng lady mary kynges daughter agreed vpo codicion cosented lawful age ferme stable el young matter concluded erle worcester bishop ely apoynted go fraunce deliuery citie tourney performyng agrementes sure payment summes money payde kyng england vpo thesayd agrementes iiii gentelmen realme fraunce left englande hostage whose name mounsire memorancy mousire monpesart mounsire moy mounsire morret iiii ii fyrst named noble blood ii last meane house youg auncient gentleme apoynted gouernours thinges cocluded sealed kyng ambassadours richely appareled ii legate roade soleply church saynct paul fro bishop durhas place made fro west doore quere doore churche egall highest step hautepace tymber xii fote broade kyng ambassador might sene cardinall yorke sange hygh masse hys cloth estate tyssue hys cupboord set basos gilt couered place v steppe high first lauatory iii erles serued secod ii duke marque saye taken gaue hym wyne water masse done cardinal campeius gaue people sayd cleane remission done docter pace kynges secretory man eloquent made goodly oracion prayse peace done kyng noble ambassador went bishop palace dynner highly feasted dynner kynge roade agayne bishop durham place night cardinal yorke made ambassador solempne baket accopanyed many lordes ladyes englande banket done came vi mynstrels richely disguysed folowed iii gentelmen wyde log gounes crymosyn sattyn euery one hauing cup golde theyr handes first cup ful angel royal second diuerse bale dyce iii certayn payres cardes getleme offred playe mochaunce whe played length first boorde mynstrels blew vp entred chabre xii ladyes disguysed fyrst kyng selfe french quene secod duke suffolke lady dawbeney lord admiral lady guyldford syr edward neuel lady sentliger syr henry guyldford mastres walden capitayn emery mastres anne carew capel lady elizabeth carew nycholas carew anne broune fraunces brian elizabeth blont henry norrys anne wotton fraunces poyntz mary fyenes arthure poole margaret bruges copany attended xii knightes disguysed bearing orches xxxvi person disguysed one suyte fyne grene satyn ouercouered clothe golde vnder tyed together lace gold maskyng whoodes heddes ladyes tyers made braydes damaske gold wt long here whyte gold masker dauced one tyme daunced put vizers knowe admyral lordes frauce hartely thanked kyng pleased viset disport kyng copany banketed high chere departed euery man hys lodgynge viii day october grenewiche song solepne masse bishop durha masse docter tustal master rolles bishop londo made loquet preposicio praise matrimony betwene dolphyn lady mary day ye straugers feasted night thei brought halla pageaunt rock ful al maner stone artificially made top stood v tree first oliue tree haged shild ye armes church rome ii pyneaple tree wt armes emperour iii rosyer wt armes englad iiii brau che lyly bearing armes frauce v pomegranet tree bearing ye armes spayn toke v potetates ioined together one league enemy christes fayth vpon middes rock sate fayre lady richely appareyled wt dolphin lap rock lady getelme appareled crimosyn sattyn couered ouer wt floures purple satyn embroudered wt wre thes gold knyt together golde lace euery floure hart gold mouing lady tyer fassio inde wt kerchiefes pleasauce ha h wt fyne gold set letter greke golde bullio edge kerchiefes garnished wt haging perle getleme ladyes sate ye neyther parte rocke caue thesaid rock came x knightes armed poyntes faughte together fayre tournay whe seuered departed disguysers dissended fro rock dauced great space sodeynly rocke moued receaued ye disguysers ymediatly closed agayn entred person called reaport appareled crymosyn satyn ful toges sitting flyeg horse wt wynges fete gold called pegasus thys person freche declared meaning ye rocke ye tree ye tournay pastyme ended kyng ambassadours serued bancketa banquet iic lx dyshes voydee spyces wt lx spice plate siluer gilt great ease might beare nyght cupboord hall xii stage place pla e euery man ben plenteou taken vp kynge quene departed lodginges diuerse iustes ambassador kynge lordes syr thomas londo made costly dynner dynner highly praysed wel ordred whe tyme came toke leaue kyng quene kynges counsaill deliuered kynges possessio iiii hostage haue harde whiche departing kyng gau admyral frauce garnishe gilt vessel payre couered basons gilt xii great gilt bowles iiii payre great gilt pottes stading cup gold garnished wt great perle also gaue cheynes gold riche apparel greate h r ryche bardes euery gentlema wel rewarded straugiers much praysed al truss departed toward sea toke ship laded boleyn sone departing erle worcester beyng ky ge chaberlayn bishop ely lord ihos syr syr ihon p hy syr thomas bulleyn ambassadour king nglande accompanied lxx knightes getlemen yome nuber iiiic aboue passed sea stormes came calys passed thorough picardy great kynde entreteynmet place till came parys nobly receaued euery matched wt lyke pere brought freche kynges presence bishop ely made solepne oracio cocerning mariage peace suche bolde spirite frenchemen muche praysed audacitie coclusio peace hery kyng englad frau ce kyng frenchemen charles kynge castel sworne perpetual peace lyues happen iii violate league point moue warre ii ioyne together make warre agaynst violater breaker peace thinges cocluded frech king made banket house ba il parys betwene iiii olde walles house couered coardes strayned craft euery coarde woud aboute boxe layd crosse wise one ouer another fret metynges great knop gilt gold foyle ouer coardes streyned wollen clothes light blew roofe lxxx fote high euery side iii age high pillers stage couered antique workes brestes stage curiously wrought armes fynettes brauches roofe set ful starres gilt furnished glass betwene fretes house iicxii brauches gilt haged euery braunche great number lightes white waxe euery diuers sortes maskes shewed night also shewed euery side palace great cupboord massiue pla e muche greatnesse euer frenche kyng welcomed lordes ambassadours good countenaunce diuerse feastes iustes bankettes made englishe ambassadours bishop ely sir thomas bulleyn sir richard weston sent frenche kyng konyack see dolphyn well receiued theim shewed fayre young childe seen departed fame went frenche kyng tyme sonne colour frenche kyng howbeit proued wise ceason earle worcettre sir nicholas uaux sir iho pechy sir edward belknap many knightes tooke leaue frenche kyng roade tourney well receiued began capitaines souldiours mourne knowyng toune yelded french kyng many young gentleman many tall yoman wished thei spent heir tyme next day sayd erle discharged sir richard iernyngham office capitaine comaunded euery man obedient kinges pleasure prepare returne england viii day february lord chatileon came nere citie tournay xxi hundreth menne harneys erle worcettre sent sir edward belknap knowe commission shewed commission whiche receiue citie tourney sir edward belknap desired sende commission earle worcettre whiche refused saiyng sufficient shewe well sayd sir edward belknap must vnderstand haue commission kyng master deliuer citie day appointed wherfore must shewe kyng england comission aucthoritie receiue fro frenche king also indenture sealed seale armes shall confesse receiue citie gift rendred right kyng master el sure citie shall deliueredthemaner delyuery tourn lorde chastileon wonderous wroth better beleued daily great message sent citie erle worcettre answer wer sent englishe part daye approched ful answere must delyuer commission also seale indenture el englishman woulde nto put hym possession towne commission otherwyse french capytaines perceauyng yf disagreed daye doubtes might folowe wherfore sent commission sealed indenture sent lykewyse mornyng came forward banner displayed whereof hering earle sent woord citee neither yelded gotten delyuered cofederacion mariage therfore thei entre banner displaied wer frenchemen angry remedy rolle vp standerdes banner thei came gate commission indenture wer solemply red openly frenchemen entred drumslades minstrelsy without banner monsire castileon deliuered castle ordeined watche warde euery part thus citee turnay deliuered eight daie february x yere reigne kyng many tall yoman lacked liuyng fel robbyng would labor returne duryng tyme remained frenche courte nicholas carew fraunces brian diuerse young gentleman englade thei frenche kyng roade daily disguysed paris throwyng egges stone foolishe trifle people whiche light demeanoure kyng muche discommended gested young gentleme came englande hei wer al frenche eatyng drynkyng apparell yea frenche vice bragges estate englande laughed lady gentlewoman wer dispraised nothyng praised frenche turne whiche turned displeasure shall kynges ambassador wer returned tournay deliuered frenchemen vpon condicions aforesaid hostage lefte paiment greate somes performaunce condicions comprised league one mariage toke none effect citee turnay redeliuered vpon repaiment thesame thesaied hostage knewe case thei stode thei knewe thei wer heuy sorowful howbeit thei dissimuled matter best wise thei could kyng vsed familiarly foure hostage vii daie marche prepared disguysyng caused greate chambre grenewiche staged greate ightes set pillers wer gilt basons gilt rofe couered blewe sattin set full press fine gold flower vnder written iammes meanyng wherof flower youth could oppressed chamber came kyng quene hostage goodly commedy plautus plaied doen entred chamber eight lady blacke veluet bordred gold hoopes fro wast douneward sleues ruffed plited elbowe plain middes full cuttes plucked euery cutte fine camericke tired like egipcians richely whe lady passed aboute place came eight noble personage long gounes taffe set flower gold bullion vnder apparell cote blacke veluet embroudered golde cut plucked cu te white sarcenet euery man buskin blacke veluet full agglettes gold eight men daunced eight lady beyng viserd sodeinly men cast large gounes vnder apparell seen whe al dooen euery lorde lady put visers knowen kyng duke suffolk frenche quene wer ther whiche wer present plaie tyme viii daie marche solempne iustesa iuste kyng eight young gentleman based barded blacke veluet embraudered gold duke suffolk eight bande white satten droppes golde daie thei ranne exceadyng well whiche straungiers highly commended ende marche kyng sent yomen garde wer come tourney many good wordes geuen th grauted iiiid day without attendaunce except thei wer specially comaunded yet cominaltie said kyng euil counsailed geue away citee tourney mainteining garrison haue norished brought vp yo ger brother feates war great strength defence realme yere xii daie february died emperour maximilian kyng caused solempne obsequy dooen paules churche noble realme knightes gartier beyng present whiche ordre thesaied emperour one pthe xi yere beginnyng yerethe xi yere kyng knightes ordre beyng englande roade double horsses henxmen folowyng king colbroke winsore gorgious apparell kept greate solempnitee feast george dined hall bishop wynchester prelate ordre sat boordes ende alone king solempnly serued surnap cast like feast coronacion thynges wer plenteous straungiers resorted thether masse requiem offered banner hachementes honor belongyng maximilian emperor late deceased feast ended kyng came richemond grenewiche laie maie whiche moneth kynges counsaill secretly communed together kynges gentlenes liberalitee persones whiche thei perceiued certain young men priuie chamber regardyng estate degree familier homely hym plaied suche light touch hym thei forgat themselfes whiche thynges although kyng getle nature suffred rebuked reproued yet kynges counsail thought mete suffred kynges honor therfore thei altogether came king beseching al enormity lightnes redresse kyng answered chosen counsaill maintenauce honor defence thyng might blemishe wherfore thei sawe hym misuse theimselfes committed reformacion kynges counsaill caused lorde chamberlein cal carew another yet liueth therfore shall tyme named diuerse also priuy cha ber whiche frenche courte banished court diuerse consideracions laiyng nothyng perticulerly charge thei office wer commaunded go office discharge courte greued sore harte young menne whiche called kynges minion foure sad auncient knightes put kynges priuie chaber whose name wer sir richard wingfeld sir richard iernyngha sir richard westo sir willian kyngston diuerse officer wer changed place sir ihon pe hy made deputie cali sir richarde wingfeld therof discharged nicholas carew made capitain rice banke commaunded go thether whiche sore hym displeasant young minio thus seuered kyng fraunce highly praised frenche kyng court maner thei thought litle kyng court comparison thei wer high loue frenche courte wherefore fall litle mo ed emong wise men yere moneth iune elected emperor charles kyng castell nephew quene whole asset elector thempire although frenche kyng sent great master cause hym elected high maiestie empire yet ambassador great master houshold called gonffier lord boisy brother willyam gonffier lorde boneuet admirall fraunce whiche ambassador englande laste yere haue hard message toke effect kyng whiche set docter pace secretory auauncement nephewe kyng castell dignite imperiall duchie ostrik many seigniory almain ioyous eleccion caused solepne masse song paules vii daie iuly whiche masse present cardinall campeius cardinall yorke duke buckyngha norffolk suffolk ambassador spain fraunce uenice scotlande masse doen quier sang te deum lordes departed baynardes castle dinner night wer solempne fiers made london greate plety wine geue italy duchmen spaniardes newes sommer quene desired kyng bryng mannour haueryng bowe essex gentleman frauce beyng hostage welcomyng purueyed thynges moste liberallest maner especially made kyng suche sumpteous banket kyng thanked hartely straungers gaue greate praise kyng liyng shote hunte ronne daily hostage greate ioye yere september kyng laie manour newhal essex otherwise called beaulieu kyng newly buylded costly mancion welcome quene lordes frenche gentleman made sumpteous banket log chamber sat ladie lorde knight whiche plenteously serued banket ended noyse min relles entered chamber eight masker white berdes long large garmentes blewe satten pauned sipres poudered spangle bullion golde thei daunsed lady sadly comuned lady fassion masker behaued theimselfes sadly wherefore quene plucked visours appered duke suffolk erle essex marque dorset lorde burgainy sir richard wyngfeld sir robert wyngfelde sir richard weston sir willyam kyngston wer sowhat aged youngest man fi tie least lady good sporte se auncient persones masker thei wer departed kyng foure hostage fraunce erle deuonshire vi young gentleman entered chamber whiche sixe wer al yelowe sattin hosen shoen cappes sixe wer like maner grene yelowe sattin freted siluer damaske grene richely behold euery masker toke ladie daunsed thei daunsed commoned great visers wer taken lady knewe king gaue many brooch proper giftes lady doen quene made banket kyng lordes thother stragers moneth nouember kyng came lambith westminster hall starre chamber hym lorde ogle lorde haward sir mathew broune sir willyam bulmer ihon skot camerwell diuerse riottes misdemeanor offeces especially kyng rebuked sir william bulmer knight beyng kynges seruaunt sworne refused kynges seruice became seruaunt duke buckingham saiyng would none seruauntes hang another mannes sleue aswel able maintein duke buckyngha might thought departyng might bee supposed duke retainyng would declare knight kneled still knee criyng kyng mercie neuer noble man durst entreate hym kyng highly displeased hym yet last matter wer hard kyng moued pitie forgaue thesaid sir willyam offence saiyng wee none seruauntes shalbe long person v wil subiectes repine grudge suche wee fauoure pleasure wil haue ca e v liketh one wil fauor another suche tyme v shall like therefore sir willyam serue v hartely shall forgotten tyme pardon likewise pardoned lorde edmod haward sir mathew browne th ir offeces whiche wer indicted riottes mainteinaunce bearynges diuerse misdoers within countie surrey lorde ogle humbly beseched kyng mercie answered sir matter concerneth murder subiecte whiche greate offence onely v god therfore remit common lawe rose went barge waie made iames yarfford maior citee london knight counsaill came lambeth iiii gentleman hostage fraunce daily resorted courte greate chere wer well enterteined euery tyme thei moued stirr required kyng passe sea mete frenche kyng master thei preised highly affirmyng king might familierly common together suche constant loue rise encreace betwene theim whiche afterward neuer faile request often tymes hard litle regarded yet meanes cardinall last ende february agreed kyng person passe sea castle lord ip guisnes maie next commyng betwene guisnes arde kyng frenche kyng mete fully concluded kyng wrote letter suche lordes lady gentleman gentlewoman geue attendaunce hym quene whiche continent put theimselfes redines ter moste costliest fashion furniture thesame metyng sent guysnes vnder rule sir edward belknay three artificer whiche buylded yearth plain castle guysnes moste goodlyest palaice timber euer wrought thesame place curiously garnished without within beside prouisions wer made within realme england flaunders vitaill wine thynges necessary thesame beside orleaunce kyng armes fraunce came court england made proclamacion kyng englande frenche kyng campe betwene arde guysnes xviii de iune next ensuyng abide al commers beyng gentleman tilt torney barrier like proclamacion made clarenseaux kyng armes englande courte fraunce courte burgoyn diuerse courtes place almain italy furnishyng iustes deuised tilte thynges necessary enterprice goodly plain betwene guysnes arde duryng tyme preparacions newes brought king charles nephew elected emperor almain would shortly epart spain sea come englande go germany receiue firste croune acon wherefore kyng caused great prouisions made euery haue receiuyng welbeloued nephew frend daily prouisions wer made side noble metynges high prince especially quene englande lady dowager fraunce made greate cost apparell lady gentlewoman first daie february beyng candelmas euen kyng quene wer come euensong manour grenewiche quenes chamber blewe trompet sodainly entred quenes chamber foure gentleman appareled long large garmentes blewe damaske bordred gold brought tricke waggon sat ladie richely appareled canapy ouer hed iiii corner waggon wer iiii hed peces called armites euery p ce beyng sundery deuice thesaied lady put vp bill kyng effect whereof iiii gentleman present would loue lady answer al commers tilt day kyng appoynted whiche daie appoynted shrofetide next ensuyng whiche daie forsaid gentleman valiantly accoplished entreprice greate laudes kyng quene lady yere kyng beyng infourmed realme irelande ordre discharged erle kildare office deputie therunto meanes cardinall men thought appoynted therle surrey lorde admirall cardinall owe best fauor wherfore thesaied erle surrey beginnyng aprill tooke leaue kyng duke norffolke father passed irelande diuerse gentleman garrison tourney one hundred yomen kynges garde nomber thousande menne manhod wisedom brought erle desmonde diuerse rebelles good conformitie ordre continued great hardnes two yere whiche space many battailes skirmish wylde irishe concluded kynges englande fraunce mete haue hard bothe kynges committed ordre maner metyng many day thei mete preheminence eche geue cardinall yorke whiche set thynges certaintie made instrument true tenor whereof ensueth thomas archebishop yorke cardinall c albeit treatie metyng right high right puyssaunt prince henry grace god kyng englande frauce lorde irelande souereigne lorde fraunces thesame grace kyng fraunce right christened made concluded london eight daie october yere lorde thousande fiue hundred xviii emongest thynges concluded accorded thesame metyng shalbe place indifferent subiect thesaied prince neuertheles wee consideryng honour profite vtilitie shall redound enteruieu thesaid two prince onely saied twoo prince realmes subiectes also christendom declaracion thereupon thesaied prince also consideryng thesaied illustre kyng englande souereigne lorde passyng sea retinue shall sustein great costes expences dispose hymse greate labor daungers leuyng realme puyssaunce certain tyme wee haue thought estemed wholy satisfied thonor dignitie thesame right illustre kyng england souereigne lorde haue rega condigne labor dangiers thesaied enteruew metyng ter first treatie bee place indifferent wherefore desiryng weye egally thonor dignitie thesaid twoo kynges vertue power commission v geue tenor shalbe hereafter declared haue made declared ordeined certain article accepted approued prince respectiuely whiche thei obserue presentes make declare ordein foloweth firste declare ordein thende monethe maie next commyng thesaid illustre kyng englande shal come personally castle guysnes bed elowe quene sister dowar fraunce semblaby right christened kyng fraunce shall come persone ca le arde quene mother daie houre tyme within iiii day moste thende maie shalbe assigned commissioner thone partie aid kyng englande issue castle guysnes halfe mile long without shall issue limit demain guisnes shall come towardes thesaid castle arde within territorie thesaied castle uisnes al rest place fortified walled nere l ites fraunce thesaied commis ion r assigne aboue said thesaid right christened kyng partyng ca le arde ome towardes thesaid kyng england thesame daie place time houre tary hym within demain guisnes said whiche shall bee set dres ed pauilions tentes thesaid twoo kynges beyng horsebacke retinue shalle one thother salute eche speake together familiarly common sort maner long shall seme theim good thesaied salu acion comunicacion finished tyme aied illust e kyng englande shall returne castle gui ne thesaid right christened kyng castle arde tem asmuche wee thynke bee satisfied touchyng labores dangiers honoure thesaied kyng englande souereigne lorde mu thesaied right christened kyng firste speakyng shall come forwarde vnto within territorie guysnes kepe honor thesaied kynges therfore declare ordeine morowe firste enteruew thesame kynges shall mete together place indifferent betwene arde guysnes shalbe assigned thesaied commissioner salutacion made one partie thesaied right illustre kyng englande shall go castle arde se salute visite quene fraunce also sister thesaid christened kyng shall dine priuely likewise thesaid right christened kyng shall go castle guysnes visite salute quene englande dowares fraunce shall dine whiche place thesaied prince shalbe receiued familiarly amiably vnto mutuall loue also honor thesaied prince item thesaied serene prince englande fraunce like force corporall beautie gifte nature right experte hauyng knowlege arte militant right cheualrous armes flower vigor youth whereby semed v right assembly decore illustre thesame assembly shewe force armes thei shall take counsaill dispose themselfes faire feate armes aswell fote horsebacke commers declare ordein place shalbee thesaied fight feate armes shalbee chosen betwene guysnes arde assigned commissioner one partie suertie persones thesaied kynges compaignie thesaid place shalbe apparreled diched fortified kepte one partie equall nober men armes respectiuely committed deputed duryng tyme thesaied iustes feates warre thesame kynges quenes retinue shall se eche familiarly conuerse speake together euery daie towardes euenyng iustes triumphes bankettes familiar communicacions dooen thesaied kynges retinue shall returne castle saie kyng england castle guysnes thesaid right christened kyng castle arde thus thei shal daily duryng thesaied fight feate armes item wee declare ordein thesame kyng englande quene bedfelowe dowares fraunce sister retinue shall go territorie entrie thesaied right christened kyng superioritie preheminence shalbe geuen thesaied kyng englande quene bedfelowe retinue respectiuely duryng tyme thei shall tary semblaby thesaied right christened kyng quene bedfelow right illustre ladie mother retinue shall come territorie entrie thesaid illustre kyng englande superioritie preheminence shalbee geuen thesaied right christened kyng quene bedfelowe mother retinue duryng tyme thei shall continue abide item muche castle place thesaied entervewe shalbe bee litle narowe entree license come thether geuen would go thether diuerse anoyances trouble impechementes folowe wherefore cardinall abouesaied presentes declare ordein none retynue thesaied kynges quenes lordes noble estate qualitie condicion thei shal come thesaid assemble greater nomber persones horse shalbee written letter subscribed thesaied kynges whiche shall conteigne estate condicions persones aswell men woman nombre seruauntes horse except common consent license thesaied kynges item forasmuche perauenture shall come thesaid prince lordes gentleman houshold seruauntes shall se conuerse together familiarly ende maie engender betwene amitie firme stable cause surely agreably thei maie bee together aswell daie night without danger feare whiche desire prouide declare ordein two gentleman sufficient compaignie equall like nombre bee committed depute respectiuely thesaied kynges kepyng suretie way watch shalbee made continually duryng assembly thesaied kynges whiche gentleman compaignies shall ordein depute explorators spy valeis forestes wooddes tounes borowes village castle passage way place dangerous suspect tyme tyme houre houre well towardes flaunders picardie artoys englande exployte watche founde suspect theim repulse take awaie thende onely thesaied prince gentleman houshold seruauntes maie surely without fea e visite one said also shall bryng vitailes necessarie thesaied assembly maie without daunger trouble impechement noysaunce go come whiche explorators shalbe bounden euery daie mornyng euenyng make reporte thesaied prince saied counsailors respectiuely thei haue found estate way declare ordein men armes warre one partie shall approche nerer twoo iorneyes place thesaid enteruewe shalbe except retinewe men warre bee committed deputed kepe bullein caleis thesame men warre none duryng assembly thesaid prince shall presume come nerer onlesse co sent accorde license thesaied prince item cardinall aboue saied expresse aucthoritie power v geuen presentes bynde thesaied prince fulfill accomplishe euery thynges aboue saied conteined item declare ordein eche thesaied kynges partie shall ratifie confirme approue euery chapiter article aboue saied letter patentes sealed handes thesame lettres ratificacion thei shalbee bounde accomplish good faith worde kyng euery thynges aboue saied whiche letter made subscribed sealed said thei shall geue one shall chaunge citee london within one moneth next daie presentes made twelfe marche yere lorde mcccccxix pthe xii yere moste noble puisant kyngthe xii yer kyng hery viii kyng englande fraunce yere lorde iue hundred xx bodily age xxix yere xxii daie aprill began xii yere reigne ouer realme englande halowed daie sainct george maner royall grenewiche noble knightes garter robe order kyng intendyng perseueryng purpose mete france frenche kyng greate riche prouisions made wherfore noble kyng quene noble courte remoued twentie one daie man beyng mundaie maner grenewyche towardes sea side fridaie beeyng twentie fiue daie maij arriued citee cantorbury intendyng kepe pentecoste sone whiche cominyng cantorbury tidynges wer brought charles emperor electe sea sight coast englande wherefore officer kyng sent greate diligence castle toune douer redines arriuall emperor reuerent father god lorde cardinall came toune douer hast noble repaire abidyng commyng emperour whiche emperour saterdaie beyng xxvi daie arriued nauie shippes royall coast kent directe toune porte hieth thesaied daie noone hailed noble knight sir willyam fitzwillyam vice admirall englande sixe kynges shippes well furnished whiche laye safegarde passage betwene douer caleis costes charge kyng englande calmenes wether lacke wynde caused emperoure might sone take lande porte douer would haue dooen notwithstandyng towardes euen departed shippes entered boate commyng towardes lande commyng land sea reuerent father lorde wolsay cardinall legate mette receiued hym suche reuerence noble prince apperteigned thus landed emperoure charles vnder clothe estate blacke egle splaied riche clothe golde retinue hym many noble menne many faire lady bloud prince princess one ladie chief bee noted prince auinion many noble whiche landed hym high sumptuous maner great rich apparell greate ioye made people england see emperour see benyng maner mekenes high prince emperour thus taken lande reuerente father lord cardynall conducte thesame noble emperour shore douer vnto castell person chered best towne might departyng themperour lande nauy apparell euery ship shewed flagges banner stremers targetes mighty ordinaunce euery brake oute force fyer though see brente maruelous noyse gonne emperour beyng thus castell douer hast tidynges came kyng cantorbury hasted hym towards noble emperour came riding early morning castell douer within castell kyng alighted emperour heryng kyng come came chamber mete wt kyng met stayres coulde come vp whereche embraced right louingly kyng brought emperour hys chamber communyng gladnes sone two noble prince whitsonday early morenynge tooke horse rode cytee cantorbury solempne feast pentecost specially see quene england aunte intent emperour noble personage realme england quene beautiful trayne lady receiued welcommed charles elect emperour whose person kyng coueighed faire pleasant chamber thesayde emperour apparelled hym right richely noble retynue thesayde emperour aswell lordes ladyes lodged aswell myght ioye muche gladnes cantorbury soiorned emperour hys trayne kyng vntill thursdaye thesame weke last daye may beyng thursday emperour toke leaue kyng ladyes gaue great thankes rode sa dewiche toke shippes wynd hym likyng wherby sayled flaunders thesame daye kyng englande made saile porte douer noble apparaile londed calys hower xi clock hym quene ladyes many noble realme kyng receiued checker rested great repayre noble men came towne caleys french court se kyng salute whiche grace princely entretayned mondaye iiii daye iune kynges grace noble aswell quene trayne ladyes whole nober noble remoued cali lordship royall guisnes noble royall lodgyng sene palays palays quadrant euery quadrant thesame palays iiicxxviii foote longe syse compasse xiiic xii foote aboute palayce sette stage great connynge sumpteous woorke enteryng palays ate playne grene buylded fountayne enbowed woorke gylte fine golde bice ingrayled anticke woorkes olde god wyne called baccus birlyng wyne whiche conduyctes therth ranne people plenteously red white claret wyne ouer whose hedde written letter romayn gold fa cte bonne chere quy vouldra hande syde gate set pyller auncient romayne woorke borne iiii lyon golde pyllers wrapped wrethe golde curiously wroughte intrayled sommet thesayde pyller stode image blynde god cupide bowe arrowes loue redy semyng stryke younge people loue forgate thesame palays place greate mighty masonry sight arched tower euery syde thesame porte r red great crafte inbattayled gate tower fenestres wyndowes image resemblynge men warre redy caste greate stone also thesame gate tower set compassed image auncient prynces hercules alexander entrayled woorke rychely lymned wyth golde albyn colour well warly made ouer gate loups enforced battaylementes thesame gate lodge porter whyche apered sumpteously apparayled lyke vnto kynges officer thesame gate people passed large courte fayre beautiful court appered much outward beutie place firste water table raysyng resun piece bay wyndowes euery syde myxed clere story curiously glased postes monyelles euery wyndow gylte thus outwarde parte place lumyned eye beholder reason sumptuous woorke also tower gate semed buylded greate maso ry great engyne man witt sundry countenauces euery image appered shotyng sum castyng sume ready strike firyng gonne whiche shewed honorably also thesayd quadrantes bayes edifice roially entrayled farre vnto thesame court appartayned dyr te gate deuised hallpas thentry staier image sore terrible coutenaunces armed curious woorke argentyne bay thesame halpas pendant crafte trimmer vnder ye trimmer anticke image gold enuyroned wt verdour oliffes cast compas mounsteryng countenaunces towardes enteryng palaice staier thesaied halpas caste passage w ntes brode steppe first foote lowest steppe persone might without pain goo vnto highest place thesame halpas euery hande chamber doores enterynges chamber thesame palais whiche long large well proporcioned receiue light aire pleasure roofes theim place place chamber chamber wer siled couered cloth silke moste faire quicke inuencion tyme seen grounde white ingrailed inbowed batoned riche clothes silkes knitte tret cuttes braides sundery newe caste thesame clothes silke shewed like bullion fine burned gold rose lossenges thesame rofe kyndly course furnished mannes sight liuyng creature might ioye beholdyng thereof iawe pece thesaied selyng whiche pece guilte fine golde woorkes paan paled walles crest encounteryng clere story creste whiche large depenes worke antique knottes boss cast wrought cunnyng write whiche workes ouerages gilte set glory florishyng bise comparable riche ammell also foote thesame palaice another rest fine sette gold whereon hanged riche maru ilous clothes arras wrought golde silke compassed many auncient story whiche clothes arras euery wall chamber hanged wyndowes richely couered passed sightes seen euery chamber place conuenient clothes estate greate large clothe golde tissue riche embroudery chaiers couered like clothe pomelles fine gold great cushyns riche woorke turkey makyng nothyng lacked honourable furnishement also thesame palais rered chapell twoo closettes quire thesaied chapell siled clothe golde thereon frete ingrailed bent clothes silke silke golde aultars chapell hanged riche reuesture clothe gold tissue embroudered pearles ouer high aultare hanged riche canaby merucilous greatnes aultare appareled fiue paire candelstickes golde aultare halpas thereon stode corpus domini e golde thesame halpas stoode twelfe image bignes childe foure yeres age gold coopes uestementes riche might prepared bought citee florens cope u stementes wer one p ce wouen purpose cloth ti ue poudered redde rose purled fine gold orfrys sette pearles precious stone walles deskes chapell hanged right clothe golde three riche greate cross ready borne festiuall tymes basyns sensers gospeller pax crewetes holy water vessel ornamentes gold also firste closet trauerse kynges person cloth golde within kynges place chaire cusshins clothe golde trauerse altare presence whiche aultare adourned clothe brouderie riche pearles precious stone set goldesmithes woorke fine golde aultare deske halpace whereon stoode patible cruci ix fine golde image trinitee image lady twelue image fine golde precious stone twoo paire candelstickes fine golde basens crewettes pax ornamentes hesaied closet hanged tappettes embraudered riche worke fret pearles stone rooffe thesame closet siled woorke inmouled gylte fine golde napar bice seconde closette quenes persone whiche trauerse riche clothe golde aultare richely appareled lacked neither pearles stone rich aultare twelue g eate image golde closet hanged clothe golde iewelles missall suppose neuer suche like seen rooffe thesame closet siled like worke kynges closet rehersed palaice place mightie strong fotresse castle royall uisnes galery secrete passage kynges persone secrete lodgyng within thesame castle kynges ease also palaice house office suche honourable courte apperteigne wete lorde chamberlaine lorde steward lorde thresourer houshold comptroller office grene clothe wardroppes iuell house office houshold seruice ewery pantrie seller buttery spicery pitcher house larder poultrie office large faire officer might marueiles craft viandes ouens harthes reredorses chimnayes range suche instrumentes ordained palaice ye haue heard kinges grace lodged al noble degree toune guysnes litle noble menne might lodged thei sette vp tentes felde nomber twentie eight hundred sundery lodgynges whiche goodly sighte thus kyng palais royall guysnes fravnces frenche kyng noble realme fraunce come toune arde whiche prepared co myng many tentes hale pauilions set pight felde french partie also thesame toune arde buylded frenche kynges lodgyng full well finished muche prouisions picardy euery part french kyng co maunded lodgyng made litle toune arde territorie old castle whiche war old tyme beate thesame place edified house solas sporte large mightie compas whiche chiefly sustained great mightie maste wherby greate rope takell strained thesame maste staied roffe thesame house hong thesame maste takell strained borne supporter thesame maste tree colour thesame blewe set starres gold foyle orbes heauens crafte colour roffe curiosly wrought maner like sky firmamet cresant strained sumdell towardes toune arde cresant couered frettes knottes made iue busshes boxe braunches thynges longest would grene pleasure tyme reuerent father lorde thomas wolsay cardinall legate latere kynges high ambassador rode noble repaire lordes gentleman prelate toune arde french courte frenche kyng thesame lorde cardinall highly enterteined noblenes cardinall frenchemen made bokes shewyng triumphant dooynges cardinalles royaltie nomber gentleman knightes lordes crimosyn veluet marueilous nomber chames golde greate horse mule courser cariages whiche went cardinalles comyng arde sumters cofers great cross pillers borne pillowe bere cace broudered twoo mantelles ceremoniall office greate honourable nomber bishoppes geuyng attendaunce mightie greate nomber seruauntes yomen gromes clothed scarlet redeth frenche boke shall finde wonderfully set furthe kyng englande beeyng castle guysnes newe palais many noble men frenche court resorted grace se kyng englande quene salute kyng englande well entertained lorde cardinall soiourned arde french court space twoo day high vrgent princely cause counsaill declared lorde cardinal toke leaue french kyng frenche courte repaired vnto castle guysnes founde kyng englande souereigne lorde thesame kyng letter patentes geuen full power aucthoritie thesame lorde cardinall concernyng matter bee debated touchyng kyng realme also gaue vnto thesame cardinall full strength power aucthoritie affirme confirme bynd vnbynde whatsoeuer bee question betwene hym frenche kyng though kyng proper person presently lordes frenche counsaill sawe high greate aucthoritie cardinall thei shewed vnto frech kyng incontinent commaunded commission made like power aucthoritie kyng englade geuen vnto thesaid lorde cardinall thesame power aucthoritie thesame reuerent father geuen fraunces frenche kyng affirmed counsaill royall fraunce hastely sent kyng englande frenche kynges patent lorde cardinall saied humbly frenche kyng would suche power receiue without consent kyng englande souereigne lorde kyng englande counsaill seen vewed frenche kynges patent well considered sent thesame patent power lorde cardinall full assent lorde cardinall power receiued muche gladnes highly estemed taken greate loue frenche kyng geuen greate power kyng englandes subiect thursdaie seuenth day iune vale andren within lordeship royall guysnes daie set pight royall rich tent clothe gold riche embroudery kyng englandes diuerse hale pauilions thesame riche tente gold within hanged richest arras newly cotriued made euer seen presence kynges estate two chayers riche cusshyns therein ground spred carpettes newe turkey makyng full beautie noted meane season feldes bothe nigh far wer many frenche gard ridyng beholdyng maner englishe parte kynges gard duke burbons gard admirall frau ce gard whiche slily marked conueighaunce people englande houre metyng appoynted lordes englande set people seruauntes good arraie battaill plain felde directly castle guysnes kyng englande commau ded garde bee set breste battaill bend footemen doen battaill footemen conducted selfes ordre firste laste neuer persone footemen brake place arraie kepte theimselfes well neuer seruyng menne theimselfes better demeaned seruyng menne thus set ordre felde left hande kyng englande somewhat towarde marres long thus abidyng whiche tyme castle guysnes shot warnyng pece toune arde likewyse toune arde gaue warnyng castle guysnes gathered frenche kynges repaire lorde marshall constable fraunce lordes gentleman set ordre thus bothe twoo high mightie prince intendyng mete assemble many woordes tale suspect demeanynges arose englishe partie great loue englishemen prince caused ignoraunt people worthy knowe pretence prince suspecte frenche partie monsire chatelion lorde fraunce rigorous cruel maner threwe doune foure pennon white grene whiche wer set richard gibson commaundement kyng suer marke metyng place twoo kynges ground thei encounter wordes rose betwene monsire chatelion richarde gibson farre became deede commaundement erle marshall tyme whiche noble erle essex kyng englandes cosyn wrong v englishemenne paciently suffered thus tyme tyme watche watche vewe vewe houre drewe nere bothe prince appoynted metyng encountre wherefore kyng englande souereigne lorde court noble englande mounted horsebacke marched towardes valey andern honourable ordre gentle menne squiers knightes baron roade kyng bishoppes also duke marque erles gaue attendaunce next kyng muche wise could haue tolde shewed rich apparell emongest lordes gentlemenne englande clothe golde clothe siluer ueluettes tinsins sattins embroudered crymosyn sattens marueilous threasor golde worne chaynes bauderickes greate weightie manifolde colers greate golde innumerable demyng bee summed noble menne gentlemenne squiers knightes euery honest officer kyng richely appareled chaynes golde greate meruelous waightie bee saied surely emong englishemenne lacked rich beautifull apparell aray alwaies kyng englande horseman marched pace pace marched moste goodly battaill bend foote men defensable apparell euer trowe seen frenche kyng partie marched towardes encountre ruffelers gallantes frenche courte whiche tyme came frenche kyng reporte caused hym tarry light horse frenche menne doubtfull staye still rested vntill lorde fraunce called monsire morret thesaied morret came frenche kyng shewed hym fidelitie kyng englande whereby frenche kyng mounted horsebacke better couraged marched towardes place appoynted encountre thus marchyng thone kyng kyng england came lorde george neuell lorde aburgheny openly saied sir ye kyng souereigne wherefore aboue bounden shewe truthe let none haue frenche partie thei mo nomber double many ye bee erle shrewesbery lorde stewarde ready saied sir whatsoeuer lorde burgheny saieth selfe haue frenchemenne bee feare youre subiectes youre subiectes bee wherefore saied erle wer worthie geue counsaill grace marche forwarde intende lorde saied kyng officer armes cried afore shorte kyng banke andern euery gentleman thei roade toke place stoode still side side regard face towardes vale andern kyng englande shewed hymself somedele forwarde beautie personage moste goodlicit prince euer reigned ouer realme englande grace apparelled garment clothe siluer damaske ribbed clothe golde thicke mighte bee garment large plited verie thicke canteled good intaile suche shape makyng marucilous beholde courser whiche grace roade trapped marueilous vesture newe deuised fashion trapper fine golde bullion curiously wroughte pounced sette anticke woorke romayne figure attendyng kynges grace englande master horse name sir henry guylford leadyng kynges spare horse whiche horse trapped mantellet bront backe place fine gold scifers deuice tasselles cordelles pendaunt sadell thesame sute woorke hedde stall raynes folowed nyne henxce menne ridyng courser naples thesame young gentleman appareled riche clothe tissue courser harneis marueilous fashion scaled fine golde bullion workes subtile sighte could contriue thesame horse harneis sette full tremblyng spanges large faire lorde marque dorset bare kynges sweard estate kynges grace reuerent father lorde cardinall attendaunce thus litle tyme abidyng commyng frenche kyng whiche shorte tyme came greate nomber horsemenne freshely appareled frenche kyng retayne put themselfes place appoynted direct englishe partie beholdyng euery bothe nacions frenche menne mused muche battaill foote menne euery frenche menne spake multitude englishe menne whiche semed greate yet thei many frenche partie frenche kyng litle beholden englishe menne put hymself somewhat people hym attendaunt duke burbon bearyng naked swearde vpright lorde admirall fraunce countie cosmen galias master frenche kynges horse mo persones gaue attendance passyng frenche kyng perceiued frech kynges swearde borne naked kyng england commau ded lorde marque dorset drawe swearde estate beare vp naked presence whiche doen vp blewe trumpettes sagbuttes clarion minstrelles bothe side kynges descended doune towarde bottome valey andern sight bothe nacions horsebacke met embrased twoo kynges eache two kinges alighted embrased benyng curteous maner eche swete goodly wordes gretyng sewe woordes twoo noble kynges went together riche tente clothe golde set grounde suche purpose thus arme arme went frenche kyng fraunces firste fraunce henry eight kyng englande fraunce together passyng communicacion twoo prince tente rehersed frenche kyng saied dere brother cosyn thus farre paine haue trauailed se personally thynke verely esteme mai bee aide realmes seigniory shewe might persone sir said kyng englande neither realmes place power matter regarde stedfastnes loyall kepyng promesse comprised charter betwene obserued kepte neuer sawe prince iyen might harte bee loued loue haue passed sea fardest frontier realme se presently whiche dooyng gladdeth twoo kynges serued banket mirthe communicacion banket tyme shewed one pleasure englishe officer went ranne greate pottes wyne bolles frenche menne theim chered best might bee season stoode still noble men englishe partie place moued nothyng thei appointed vnto seruyng men likewise moued ground standyng frenchemen sodainly brake many came englishe partie speakyng faire courte englande lordes kept still arraie twoo kynges ended banket spice wyne geuen frenchemen ipocras chief drinke plentie would drinke open sight came two kynges frenche kyng kyng england tent whiche well perceiued thabiliment royall frenche kyng garment chemew clothe siluer culpond clothe golde damaske cantell wise garded bordours burgon bendes ouer cloke broched satten gold purple coloure wrapped aboute body trauerse beded shulder waste fastened lope first fold said cloke richely set pearles precious stone frenche kyng hed koyfe damaske gold set diamondes courser rode couered trapper tissue broudered deuise cut fashion matell wise skirtes embowed fret frised worke knit cordelles button tasseled turkey makyng raines hedstall answeryng like woorke verely persone thesame fraunces frenche kyng goodly prince stately countenaunce mery chere broune coloured great iyes high nosed bigge lipped faire brested shoulder small legges long fete noble frenche courte garmentes many colour thei knowen braggery thus two kynges wer communicacion diuerse noble men englande wer called presence twoo kynges departed compaignie kyng englande guysnes frenche kyng arde saterdaie ix daie iune place within englishe pale set pight felde called campe two tree muche honor one called aub spine called framboister whiche english hathorne whiche henry raspis berry fraunces significacion frenche twoo tree mixed one together high mountaigne couered grene damaske thesame tree artificially wrought resemblyng nature thesame nigh could leaues grene damaske braunches bowes withered leaues clothe gold body armes thesame clothe golde laied tymber thei heigth fro foote toppe xxxiiii foote assise compasse aboute hundred twentie nyne foote bough bough fourtie three foote tree flower fruites wrought kyndly wise siluer uenice gold beautie shewed farre mountaigne place ha ber wise herrauldes mountaigne rayled railes couered grene damaske thesame daie twoo noble kynges came thesame tree honor greate triumph accompaignied diuerse noble yong valiauntes shildes caried borne aboute listes set highest place shewyng feldes kyng englandes armes within gartier frenche kynges within coller ordre sainct michael close croune flower delice toppe campe length nyne hundred foote bredth three hundred twentie foote ditched rounde aboute sauyng entree broade depe diches diuerse skaffoldes tered aboute campe ease noble rightside felde stood quene englande quene fraunce many lady thesame campe railed bard euery ende strongly twoo lodgynges entery thesame felde twoo kynges richely adourned whiche vnto theim necessarie therein thei armed theimselfes tooke ease also thesame compasse twoo greate seller couched full wyne whiche men large e fountain cause settyng vp twoo greate shieldes armes royall ioye honourable metyng passe tyme idlenes exercise noble feactes armes honoure article iustes turnayes battailes foote barres suche victorious feactes arre realmes proclaimed whiche caused muche people noble courage thether resorte twoo kynges brother armes vndertoke deliuer personage thesame feactes thesame twoo kynges ordre armes ociate duke uendosme duke suffolke countie sainct paule marque dorset monsire de roche sir willyam kyngston mo sire brian sir richard garnyngham monsire cauaan sir giles capell monsire bukkall master nicholas carewe monsire mountafilion master anthony kneuet shieldes noble wer hanged tree thre table chalenges whiche noble menne would answere brought shieldes thesame tree theim presented kynges armes article wrote handes mondaie xi daie iune twoo quenes englande fraunce came campe either saluted right honorably went stage prepared right curiously hanged specially quene englande tapet pearle called huges dike whiche muche loked costlynes thesame houre assigned two kynges armed peces mounted horsebacke attendyng noble persones parteners chalenge frenche kyng sette hymself courser barded couered purple sattin broched golde embraudered corbyns fethers round buckeled fether blacke hached gold corbyn rauen firste silable corbyn cor whiche harte penne english fether frenche signifieth pain stode fether round endles buckels wherwith fethers wer fastened betokeneth sothfastnes thus deuise harte fastened pain endles pain harte fastened endles hed pece bare sleue partenars frenche kynges chalenge like apparell euery thyng correspondent clothe silke embroudered persone attendant horsebacke noble persones foote foure persones appareled purple sattin kyng englande mounted freshe courser trapper clothe golde tissue arson mantell wise brunt trapper bard fashion cutte waues water woorke euery waue rawe wrought frised damaske golde woorke laied lose russet veluet knitte together poyntes golde whiche waues signified lordeshippe narowe sea parteners kynges chalenge wer thesame sute horse aswell persones attendyng kyng horsebacke wer sir henry guilford master kynges horse sir ihon pechie deputie caleis sir edward guilford master kinges army monsire moret freche courte appareled al foure kynges liuery white right side left side gold russet bothe hose garmet hym wer attedant foote sixe honorable knightes xx esquiers officer nombre c xii person whiche nomber knightes gentleman coates one halfe siluer thother clothe gold russet veluet officer cote wer right sattin thesame coloure hosen thesame suite costly thus honour noble courage twoo noble kynges compaignies entered feld theim presented vnto quenes reuerence dooen theim thei roade rounde aboute tilte toke place appoynted abidyng answerer whiche first duke dallencon tenne men armes bed courser barded bardes couered white blacke ueluet fastened one within garded burgon bendes tynsell sattin aswell garmentes bardes entered courser barded twelfe gentleman bende lorde admirall fraunce garmentes bardes russet sattin broched golde white purple sattin deuise pleasure greate plume bendes entered feld thei shewed themselfes tilte reuerence quenes bend duke dallencon tooke firste place thei made theim prest bothe side frenche kyng firste ranne valiauntly brake speres mightely ranne kyng england monsire graundeuile great vigor speres brake kynges hande vantplate sheuers second course gaue thesaied monsire gra deuile suche stroke charnell hedde pece although thesame strong broken suchewise might runne whereby kyng wanted three course ranne duke de vandon mette counter parte right nobely brake speres right valiauntly noble duke suffolke charged course met right valiatly counter parte furnished v course right nobly together like good men armes party chalenge right valiauntly furnished course ranne agayne ii noble kynges dyd valiantly beholder great ioy whiche course herauldes cried disarmy trompettes sounded lodgyng tewsday xii daie iune hower couenient ii quenes toke stage bende chalenge feld prest answere delyuer commers came x gentleman armed barded horse bend mounsire de svvyes ther bardes apparel cloth veluet ful frier knottes syluer thei preseted theim vnto ye quenes toke thende tilte course course ronne chalengers right egerly chalengers partie twoo kynges
