deliuered ende article iustes entered xi men armes bende mounsire de tremoyell horse barded yelowe veluet losenged frier knottes blacke veluet thei saluted ye quenes thei likewise toke thende tilt course course ranne till thei wer deliuered chalenges iustes valiauntly daie finished wednesdaie xiii daie iune twoo hardie kynges armed peces entered feld right nobly appareled frenche kyng parteners chalenge arraied purple sattin broched golde purple veluet embrodered litle rolles white satin wherein written quando bardes garmentes wer set full thesame residue rolles poudered sette letter ell thus l whiche frenche whiche interpreted quando elle whe ensuyng deuise first daie signifieth together harte fastened pain endles kyng englande bende parteners chalenge wer likewise horsebacke appareled trapper loseges russet veluet clothe siluer damaske enbroudered set euery losege braunche eglantine gold apparell persones wer correspondent trapper eglantine tree swete plesant grene kyndely frendly handeled rudely delt pricke pull vp whole tree top handes bee hurte twoo kynges compaignies thus appareled presented themselfes quenes toke ende tilte entered feld monsire leskevv called lorde liskyn hym came xi men armes hymself xii horse barded richely appareled rode aboute tilte saluted quenes toke ende tilte mon de leskevv xi compaignions base bardes blacke clothe gold damaske cut blacke sattin garmentes mantell sleues left arme wast behynde iust shulder whiche praised strangenes frenche kyng rane mousire bewsy damboyes one bend mounsire liskew kyng england charged course rane mounsire liskew furnished course laie right nobly valiauntly breakyng speres stro g thus course course eche counter partie right valiantly two kynges surmounted rest prowesse valiantnes bend thus furnished entred marque de salon bend xii persones ridyng courser barded apparelled white sattin blacke broched gold siluer cuttes culpynes muche tawny blacke sattin billottes atter reuerence done quenes toke thende tilte marque de salon ranne kyng england kyng frauce another bend stil course alter course ranne noble men til marque de salon bend deliuered bare theim right valiantly blew trumpettes retraicte two kinges vnarmed departed frenche kyng arde kyng england castle guysnes thursday xiii day iune noonetyde twoo quenes mette campe toke place people wer come behold honor see two kynges ready armed entred feld receiue deliuer men answere iustes entred erle deuonshyre nere cosyn kyng england bend lorde mountague also cosyn kyng lord harbert lord leonard gray master arthur poole master fraunces brian master henry norres iiii richely apparelled one side blew ueluet enbrodred man hartburnyng lady hand holdyng garden pot stillyng water hart side white sattin enbrodered letter golde compaignie rode tilte reuerence quenes abode thende thesame erle deuonshyre charged spere frenche king likewise charged course mete thesame erle rane hard together bothe speres brake mainteined course nobly ranne kyng england mounsire memoracie encountered bothe bare together gaue great stroke kynges moste noble grace neuer disuisered breathed tyll ranne fiue course deliuered counter partie duke marque knightes esquiers ranne fast euer might none abode course came tyll earle deuonshyre bend deliuered demaundes entered lorde hawarde sonne duke northfolke xi compaignions apparelled barded crimosyn sattin ful flame golde border ribbed crimosyn ueluet muche honor due reuerence done quenes brought heraldes armes aboute tiltes toke place theim appointed right riche apparell ranne frenche kyng encountered lord edmond brake bothe staues valiantly course course encounter ceassed til furnished theyr fiue course lorde edmond deliuered frenche kyng ranne kyng englande strong gentleman named raffe broke brake spere ranne course course till finished course right nobly like prince moste valiance residue ceased til thei ech deliuered chalege friday xv day iune kyng england mouted courser roial person armed piece apparel trapper one side riche cloth gold tissue side clothe tissue siluer clothe gold tissue entered ounde one ye ounde warke wauyng vp doune border well trapper garded letter fine gold side ounde sette signes called cifers finegold whiche set great oriental perles cifers signified letter knit together knot whiche wete god frende realme may deuise reason thereof kynges bend apparelled like apparel frenche kyng likewise armed al pointesmounted courser royal apparel aswel bardes garmentes purple veluet entred one enbrodred ful litle bookes white satten bokes written aboute border bardes border garmentes chaine blewe like iron resemblyng chayne well prison chaine whiche enterpreted liber booke within boke written sayd put two together maketh libera chayne betokeneth prison bondes maketh together englishe deliuer bodes put reason fyrst day second day iii day chauge chaunged second day hart fastened paine endles vvhen deliuereth bondes thus thinterpretacion made whether thinges may say ready two kynges prince theyr retaine abidyng answeres salutacions made quenes beyng theyr stage toke thende tilte ready mounsire florengis xii men armes courser barded bardes apparel crimosyn veluet tawny veluet plunket veluet embrodered border wise shepcherdes hokes cloth siluer honor passed tilte reuerence quenes lady done two kynges theyr speres ready began rushyng speres kyng england day rane freshly many course one best courser dead night band deliuered man man pretence iustes entered bendes mounsire de rambeurs mounsire de pyns eche hauyng xi persones nomber one band white satten enbrodered blacke blacke dropped wt siluer droppes reuerence done quenes end tilte toke place began new encouter hard sore many bare great stroke kynges honor bendes deliuered heraldes cryed lostel prince disarmed went lodgyng saterday xvii day iune frenche kyng small bre came ye castle guisnes hour viii mornyng kyng beyng priuy chambre therof knowlege glad hast went receiue thesame frenche kyng met welcomed frendly honorable maner comunicacion betwene kyng englad departed leauyng frenche kyng ye sumptuous place named busy lord chaberlain lord stewarde officer make ready feast chere long reherse suche feast banquet made long tyme like seen kyng england thus departed toke horse co paignie nobleman rode arde frenche quene nobleman receiued muche honor whiche receiuyng sayd quene lordes brought chamber haged blewe veluet enbrodered flower delice cloth golde wherein great bed like worke whence conueighed another chamber whiche kynges state chamber hanged siled clothe gold enbrodered great cordelles frier knottes cloth siluer thesame chambre two cupbordes either side one furnished great goodly plate gilte noble feastyng made dyner lady dressed daunce kyng glad quene sayd lady departed secretly put xxix persones masker apparell fyrst x yong honorable lordes apparelled maner ry reuel ruseland farre estland fyrst theyr hosen riche goldsatten called aureate satten ouerrouled ye kne skarlet theyr fete shoen litle pykes white nayles estland guise theyr doublettes riche crimosyn veluet cloth gold wide sleues lined cloth gold ouer thei clokes crimosyn veluet short lined cloth gold eueryside clokes ringes siluer wt lace uenice gold heades hattes made ye toune danske purse seales skynnes girdle thesame yong lorde visers face hattes drawen like hatbondes full damaske gold x lordes apparelled long gounes blew satten auncient fashion enbrodred reason golde sayd adieu iunesse farewell youth typpettes blacke veluet hattes hangyng therby theyr heades high violette standyng cappes girdelles silke purse clothe golde auncient maner visers face like auncientie another compaignie x lordes whiche maskery kyng himselfe apparelled long garmentes estate pale riche clothe golde riche gounes whiche lined grene taffata knit pointes uenice siluer wherewith riche clothe together fastened face visers berdes fine wyer ducket gold drunslad plaiers minstrel arayed white yelowe russet damaske minstrel blew plaied passed strete arde noble reuelers frenche court put presece freche quene lady quene beholden reuelers toke lady daunsed passyng tyme right honorably thinstance frenche quene lady masker reuelers disuisered shewyng persones spice fruites ielies banket viandes wer brought done ended ye kyng toke leaue frenche quene lady secrete place euery one visered himselfe vnknowen passed frenche court brought xxx horse trapped damaske white yelowe maskeler passed toune arde felde campe tell feast rich royal presece frenche kyng newe palaice royal daie quene england receiued frenche kyng wt honor accordyng presece larked neither clothes estate rich shewe multitude siluer golde plate vessell daie impossible noble men serued gilte vessel siluer vessell frenche kyng washed estate set right honorably serued thinges nedefull forestes parkes felde salte sea riuers moates pondes wer serched sought countreys delicacie viades well man rewarded could bryng thyng likyng pleasure right honorably frenche kyng entertained degre state frenche kyng washed lady came profered themselues daunce frenche kynges presence whiche done frenche kyng toke leaue quene lady court reuerend father lord cardinal accompanied duke buckyngham great lordes conducted forwarde frenche kyng waie encountred met kyng england companye right valy anderne apparelled maskyng apparell whiche gladded frenche kyng reuerence done sayd two kynges departed night mondaie xviii day iune blew suche stormes wynd wether meruail heare hideous tepest said nosticacion trouble hatred come betwene prince tewsoay xix day iune ii valiant chalengers kynges houre conuenient entred felde armed piece abidyng comer entred mounsire bonyual bend xiiii persones nober wel armed ridyng barded horse apparel blacke veluet cloth golde bylet wise fayre plume heades reuerence done quenes ready beyng stage toke place ende tilte ready speares frenche king charged ranne course course nobly also king england ranne surely lost course till mounsire bonyual bend deliuered kynges retaine cease entered xvii persones royally armed bend duke burbon ridyng barded courser apparell white veluet tawny blacke veluet entred together bordered clothe gold garnished plume thesame colour heades saluted quenes lady toke thende tilte came furnishe thende chalenge iustes kyng england ready strake horse spurres fiersly rane countre partie graund graue gard lose great stroke kyng gaue course course ye kyng lost none euermore brake spere nobly ended iustes royal daie ended kinges great chalenge kyng souereigne lordes doynges men beheld reported doynges valiant wer factes euermore honor renoumed frenche kyng part ranne valiantly breakyng speares egrely well ended chalenge iustes ought euer spoken bend duke burbon pretence chalenge deliuered thei toke leaue departed wednisday xx day iune two kynges began hold turneyes parteners chalenge armed piece frenche kyng bend wer apparelled bard couered purple sattin broched gold purple veluet ouer brodered garlondes frier knottes white satten euery garlond liii paunse flower whiche signified thinke fraunces spake knowen goodly riche apparel kyng england mounted courser naples barded faire bend retaine courser barded bardes apparell one side riche clothe tyssue enbrodered lined wt riche cloth siluer ye outward part cutte otherside russet veluet poudered wt gold purpled golde enbrodered great rocke moutaine picture armed knight courser barded vauncyng vpon hill thesame riche enbrodery picture ladie comyng cloud strikyng knight body arow deadly wound beneth border written letter enbrodered sayd inloue vvhoso mounteth passeth perill deuise kyng england apparelled parteners chalenge quene fraunce quene england place appointed honor iudges stage marke ye kyng heraldes frauce named roy mon ioy england kyng armes garter marke write dedes nobleman euery person toke naked sworde hande trumpettes blewe waityng ride runne frenche kyng kyng england together entred bendes reuereced quenes rode place toke ende felde abode againe souned trupettes ye heraldes brought bede diuers noble wel armed men horse barded wete fyrst duke alanson x men armes bende lorde admyrals bend xii menne armes mounsire gywer ix nomber men armes gentleman mounsire trenoyll xi men armes mounsire liskew xi men armes bende marque de salon xii men armes bend al horse barded naked swordes handes two kynges put doune visers rode encoutre valiantly trouth strake receiued great stroke verely two kynges bet countre party disarmyng departed battail ceased went euermore two two till came kynges againe whiche neded put remebraunce coragiously two kynges newely fought great randon force shewed vigor strengthes nobly couter party none aduautage thus eche fought iiii battailes came mounsire liskew kyng england fought one battail presented kyng horse whiche kyng gently receiued loue incontinent mounted fought v battail right valiantly thus turney deliuered honorably day thursday xx day iune quene england frenche quene come campe royaltie like vnto estate ii kynges felde armed apparelled frenche kyng bend courser barded bardes couered purple broched satten purple veluet right roially without enbroderyng kyng england mounted horse force courage royally nobly apparelled retaine sute like apparell clothe siluer damaske bordered letter cloth golde damaske border bardes apparell litle mountaines springyng braunches basile wrought al fyne gold euery braunche lefe stalke lose waueryng thicke full leaues braunches vneth clothe siluer sene ye reason written border thus breake svvere herbes riche mounte doute damage apparel meruailous freshe fayre thus two kynges retaine toke felde entred therle deuonshire cosyn king england xvi honorable persones bende armed came mounsire florenges xii persoues bend came mounsire de rambeurs mounsire de pyns ix men armes bend came bend mounsire de bonyual xiii men armes bend came bend mounsire de burbon xvii men armes al wel warlike horsed armed euery bendes deuises apparelled right richely ii noble kynges ready either encountred one man armes frenche kyng erle deuonshire kyng england mounsire florenges kyng england bare backe mounsire florenges brake poldron disarmed ye stroke striken battail departed muche praised went swordes doune went visers litle abidyng sir iohn neuell master fraunces bryan sir rouland master robart garnyngham day aydes sor ye hurt persones entertaine fought feruently battail battail none ceased till would entre deliuered pretence chalenge royall pretenced day chalenge turnays article ended noble men deliuered departed felde kinges rode felde honor armes required herauldes cried la fine de turnayes sayd two noble prince xxi daie iune fryday xxii day iune campe sette barrier fight foote also hale kynges england sette place enbrodered cloudes blewe cloudes sunne risyng valence written letter blewe enbrodered dieu er men droit whiche hale lordes entertaine chalenge armed theimselfes nowe noble kynges readye battail foote barrier quenes stage entered bend bend foote preased barrier euery one hande punchion spere wherewith without abode foyned lashed alwayes one another two two lotte fell speres spent swordes theim geuen preased barrier two valiant kynges tariyng fought suche force fyer sprang armure thus bend bend deliuered two noble kynges aydes retaine came bend two hande swordes castyng dartes answere chalenge xii menne well armed whiche presed barrier mightely threwe speares one ready ready none fauored two enemy vtterance euer styll two two till deliuered concernyng chalenge two kinges safe body lymmes ended batbattail day barrier great honor men armes passed departed tyme muche preparacion made settyng vp tentes hale place furnishyng house office chabers estate kynges quenes also thesame night campe rered large frame tymber worke chapell place whiche syled wt riche clothes enbrodered wherin made stage two degree chayre cloth state lorde cardynall alter apparelled iuelles myssall great rich thesame chapel thus finished xxiii day iune beyng satterday houre conuenient sayd lorde cardinal sang high solempne masse note two kynges quenes thesame done indulgence geuen hearer two kynges together associate tooke chamber masse flaunders arose muche communicacion muche common voyce went ii kynges wer sworne together sacrament contrary masse none entent geue indulgence kynges tyme two kynges washed satte meate vnder clothes estate richely serued royaltie fare rich vessell plate iuelles surmounteth witte man expresse quenes another chamber wer serued lesse honor dyner ended sayd straugers royally apparelled presented themselues place estate tell apparel lady riche attyres sumptuous iuelles diuersities beauty goodly behauior day day sithe fyrst metyng assure ten mennes wittes scace declare two noble kynges put themselfes armes bend entered felde foote barrier entered bendes men armes armur right richely ready ii kynges barrier ready fight right nobly day deliuered barrier battail c vi persones ii last battailes kynges kyng england stroke disarmed counter partie frenche kyng likewise bare himselfe right valiantly thus sayd saterday fully ended men deliuered article iustes turneys battailes foote sayd two noble kynges chalenge honorably performed kynges prepared diuers masker especially king england iiii company euery companie x persones apparelled shall heare fyrst persone fyrst x apparelled like hercules shirte siluer damaske written letter purple border en femes et infauntes cy petit assurance whiche englishe muche say woman child litle assuraunce head whode garlond grene damaske cutte leaues like uyne leaues hawthorne leaues hand club couered grene damaske full prickes lyon skyn backe cloth gold damaske wrought frysed flatte golde damaske heeres buskyns gold legges thre apparelled hector alexandre iulius caesar turkay iubbes grene cloth gold wrought like chalet richely heades bonettes turkay fashion cloth golde tyssue clothe siluer rolled cypre kercheffes panyns fashion girdle cloth gold pendantes thesame cut great flame euery one buskyns grene damaske thre like prince iury dauid iosue iudas machabeus thre wer long gounes russet tynsell satten great wide sleues lyned clothe gold pendant great tippettes cloth gold baudericke wise whodes thesame buskyns grene damaske visers berdes fyne gold thre christen prince charlemaine arthur godfry de bulloigne thre apparelled long vesture calendred cloth gold purple clothe gold broched together whoddes cappes thesame visers buskyns grene damaske x apparelled cote crimosyn satten al ouer couered quaterfoyles clothe gold tissue clothe siluer raised gold fringed siluer siluer gold layd lose crimosyn satten euery quaterfoyle knit lace golde ouer sayd x persones euery one large mantle robe crimosyn satten enbrodered full figure gold heades bonettes stoole worke golde damaske euery one viser berde golde wyer whoddes buskyns crimosyn satten ten lady apparelled genowayes fashion ground gounes white satten ouer diapred right crimosyn satten gold damaske heades square bonettes damaske golde rolled lose golde hang doune backes kerchiefes cleres fine cypre x lady attired fashion myllayne riche tyssue cloth siluer raised parted trauers ruffed sleues foresleues pendant knit wt pointes gold caules coyfes gold piped myllaine bonettes crimosyn satten drawen clothe golde thus kyng england xix nobleman sister quene marye dowager fraunce xix lady like masker apparelled haue heard mouted horse trapped veluet white yelow euermore lord lady ridyng together mynstrelsye departed guysnes sonday xxiiii day iune toke way toward arde way banke anderne masker met frenche kyng beyng chariot xxxviii persones richely apparelled maskyng apparell eche compaigny passed without countenaunce makyng disuiseryng frenche kyng compaignie went guysnes kyng england arde maiestie receiued frenche court brought chamber riche apparell instance frenche quene kyng disuisered shewed theyr face al lady england likewyse began feast chere arise kyng england set al ye lady masker england nobly serued many straunge meates dyner began daunces passyng tyme ioyously frenche masker apparell al one suite seueral fashion diuers silkes cut broched plume fayre beautifull sight frenche kyng compaignie guisnes quene englad met welcomed frenche kyng masker shewed themselfes bare faced quene sawe reuerence great chere dyner daunces done frenche kyng drew himselfe secrete chamber put apparel maskery toke apparel vsaunce whiche many fayre emeraudes done toke leaue quene court loked high countenaunce departed lord cardinal duke buckyngham conductyng kyng england tyme duryng arde passed tyme muche solas tyme conuement toke leaue frenchemen freche court visered themselfes rode nobly thus apparelled ye toune arde passed till came campe whereas chalenges finished frenche kyng perceiuyng comyng englishe masker stode still beholdyng kyng england put viser preased vnto frenche kyng two kynges enbrased amiably together communed whiche communicacion either kyngly salutyng tooke leaue remembraunce either gaue giftes kyng england gaue frenche kyng collor iewels precious stone called balastes sanker furnished great diamante perles frenche kyng gaue kyng england bracelet precious stone riche iewels fayre departed sayd two noble kynges sayd xxiiii day iune whiche sonday midsomerday duryng triumph muche people picardie west flau ders drew guysnes se ye kyng england honor vitailes court plentie conduicte gate ranne wyne alwaies vacaboundes plowman laborer bragery wagoner beggers drunkennes lay route heapes great resorte thether came bothe knightes lady wer come see noblenes faine lye haye strawe helde theim therof highly pleased court emperor lady margaretes court flauders brabat burgoyn came neuer persone answere chalenge semed small loue betwene emperor frenche kyng moreouer mounsire fayot capitaine boleyn mounsire chattelon deuoier haue taken toune sainct omer whiche doyng thought goodnes emperor monday xxv day iune kyng england quene court remoued fro guysnes toune caleys made kyng abode concluded metyng emperor kyng wherfore made newe great prouisions tyme triumph mutteryng toune caleys redred frenche kinges hades truth frenchman spake sayd wherwith many englishman wer greued whyle kyng lay thus caleys considered charge noble thought lesse nombre seruauntes would serue tyme abode caused cardynal call ye gentleman whiche kynges name gaue theim thankes muche commendacions eschewyng cost kyng taried emperor commyng licesed send home halfe nombre seruauntes bad long charge liue warely terme warely amongest moste part taken barely whiche saiyng gentleman sore disdained thus caleys rested kyng quene vntil x day iuly kinges grace goodly repaire rode toune grauelyng flaunders night rest se emperor ye kyng waityng lord cardinal duke marquis erles bishop baron knightes gentleman noble emperor passed water grauelyng place called waell met receiued kyng england emperor made suche semblant loue court england wan ye loue thenglishmen passed emperor kyng england grauelyng kyng lodged best might lordes gentleman yomen sortes englishman fro highest lowest chered feasted louyng maner muche praised themperors court grauelyng emperor aunte margarete welcomed kyng noble men realme frenche kyng lordes knowlege ye metyng emperor kyng englad towne grauelynge therewith greatly greued many thinges appeared englishman fraunce disdained suite greatly deferred litle right muche lesse fauor day day still began hartbrennyng coclusion open warre arise betwene two realmes wednisday xi day iuly emperor lady margarete came kyng england toune caleys emperor lady margaret lodged staple hall al gentleman lodged place right well prepared necessary comyng solas builded banquetyng house foote round goodly deuise builded vpo mastes shippes suche maner thinke neuer sene whole spere portrated whiche reason great winde blewe could acheued thesame day night kyng xv persones apparelled blacke ueluet couered cloth gold cut veluet fastened wt knottes gold whiche knottes honge spangels gold like tuftes bonettes thesame clokes crimosyn satten cloth gold wrapped trauers buskyns thesame clothe gold lustie masker went emperor lodgyng wer receiued chambre presens dauced reuelled whiche emperor request kyng theimselues disuisered whereby kyng knowen kyng toke leaue departed night tewsday xii day iulye banquet house could finished emperor lady margaret supped king quene checker thesame night supper reuelled lxxxxvi masker reuelles banquet whiche banquet kyng brought emperor ladie margaret staple withdrewe night viii compaignies masker euery compaignie xii persones gold siluer veluet richely apparelled rome small shewe lesse reuelles put masker apparel diuers gentleman frenche court vnwetyng ye kyng bare rule diuers yong gentleman frenche court fauored frenche partie emperor partie whiche meanes saw muche heard haue done friday xiii day iuly emperor intend haue departed caleys counsail suche departed night charter tyme cocluded redde emperor declared whole article high peace league tripertite whiche frenche kyng assented fully contented exemplificacion thesame sent thelorde de roche letter credece signifie emperor maiestie thesame article frenche kyng promised worde king prince faythfull obserue kepe realme subiectes thus lorde de roche emperor presece king england name master shewed frenche kynges toune caleys many high vrgent cause concernyng prince whereby emperor went calays night whiche abode emperor seruauntes muche doubt emperor persone saterday xiiii day iuly none emperor toke leaue quene england aunte traine lady kyng noble conducted emperor hisway village towardes flauders called wael emperor enbrased kyng betoke almightie god kyng gaue courser naples richely apparelled kyng toke leaue duches sauoye great aunte emperor noble emperor court departed smal tyme calayce kyng made abode goodly hast shipped quene noble safetie tooke lande passed tyme sommer huntyng sportes honorably made great iestes yere yere kyng kept christmas maner grenewiche muche noblenes open court x day february owne person iusted comer xii day grace therle deuonshyre iiii aydes answered turnay comer whiche wer xvi persones noble riche apparel feates armes kyng excelled rest tyme edwarde duke buckyngham accused kyng high treasonthe duke buckingham accused wherfore kynges grace aduise cousail sent directed letter sayd duke beyng maner thornbury countie glocester incontinent come presence excuse layde aside also kyng gaue commaundement sir willyam cumpton sir richard weston sir willyam kyngston knightes kynges body take secret power also seriauntes armes thei wisely take hede duke receiued kynges letter shuld conuey himselfe whiche wisely accomplished sayd duke vpon sight kynges letter remoued iornied tyll came wyndsore offered george alwayes farre awaityng demeanor thesame knightes liyng duke lodged wyndsore night well proued meruailously feared insomuche called vnto seruaunt kynges named thomas ward thesame thomas ward gentleman herbenger kyng demau ded made answered saiyng ther lay office duke perceiued could escape muche spirit troubled breakefast meat would doune yet made good countenaunce shortly toke horse rode till came tothill besides westminster toke barge tyme duke chauncellour taken prisoner kept tower whiche confessed matter high treason concernyng kynges persone duke barge commaunded lande lorde cardinal bridge landed foure fiue seruauntes desiryng see thesame lorde cardinall answered lorde diseased well sayd duke yet drynke lordes wyne passe gentleman lordes brought duke muche reuerence seller duke dranke sawe perceiued chere made chaunged colour departed barge saiyng seruauntes meruail chauncellor cometh knowyng prison duke thus barge comyng towardes london sir henry marney capitaine kynges garde attendyng c yomen kynges garde barge ryuer thames met duke without abode borded duke barge kynges name attached put seruauntes duke brought haie wharfe landed duke seruauntes commaunded go maner rose sainct larence pountnay abide tyll kynges pleasure knowen sir henry marnay brought duke thames strete tower london people muche mused cause might trouth till knowen among theim muche speakyng also attached monke charter house besides bristow called henton also master ihon delaker duke confessor duke chauncellor mencioned al tower prisoner xvi day april duke brought tower ala euer ambicion losse noble man muche kynges fauor lordes may beware geue credence false prophesies false hypocrite monke charter house shewed duke kyng england whiche kynges persone could higher treason ala euer gaue credence suche false traitor xiii yere tyme inquiry made diuers shyres edward duke buckyngham beyng prisoner tower london knightes gentleman endited high treason certaine wordes spoken thesame duke blechy gly lorde aburgenye thesame lorde attached consailement lorde mountague kynges cosyn ledde tower sir edward neuel knight brother sayd lorde aburgeney forbidden kynges presence duke northfolke made kinges letter patentes high steward englande accomplishe high cause appele piere pieres realme decerne iudge cause pier c wherfore shortly made westmynster hall scaffolde lordes presence iudge railed counter railed barred degree duke northfolke chiefe iudge many pieres realme duke suffolke marque dorcet erles worcester deuonshyre essex shrewisbury kent oxford darby lorde ihons lorde delaware lorde fitz warren lorde wylloughby lorde broke lorde cobham lorde harbert lord morley satte peres iudges vpon thesame duke buckyngham lordes taken place sir thomas louel sir richard chomley knightes brought duke barre thaxe tower humbly bareheaded reuereced duke northfolke lordes kinges lerned counsail clarke ye counsail sayd sir edward duke buckyngha hold vp thy hande thou art endited high treason thou traitorously hast conspired ymagined farte thee lay shorten life soueraigne lorde kyng treason wilt thou acquite thee duke answered peres thenditement openly redde duke sayd false vntrue conspired forged bryng death proue allegyng many reason falsefy inditement reason kynges atturnay alleged examinacions co fessions proues witness duke desired witness brought furth brought sir gylbert perke priest chauncellor fyrst accusor thesame duke master ihon delacourt priest duke confessor owne hand writyng layde accusement duke charles kneuet esquyer cosyn duke monke prior charterhouse besides bathe whiche like false ypocrite enduced duke treason diuers tymes sayd duke kyng england duke sayd himselfe neuer consented diuers presumpcions accusementes wer layde charles kneuet whiche would fain haue couered deposicions redde deponentes deliuered prisoner officer tower spake duke northfolke sayd lorde kyng soueraigne lorde hath commaunded shall haue lawes ministred fauor right wherfore haue thing say selfe shallbe hard commaunded withdrawe led paradise house named lordes went counsail great tooke place sayd duke northfolke duke suffolke say sir edward duke buckyngham touchyng high treason duke suffolke answered giltie sayd marque erles lordes thus prince duke buckyngham founde giltie high treason duke marque vii erles xii baron duke brought barre sore chafyng swette meruailously made reuerece paused duke northfolke iudge sayd sir edward haue heard indited high treason pleaded thereto giltie puttyng selfe peres realme whiche haue found giltie duke northfolke wept sayd shalbe l dde kynges prison layde herdill drawen place execucionthe duke bu kynghas iudgement hanged cutte doune liue membres cutte cast fyer bowel brent head smytten body quartered deuyded kynges god haue mercy soule amen duke buckingham sayd lorde northfolke haue sayd traytor sayd vnto neuer none lordes nothyng maligne haue done eternal god forgeue death shal neuer sue kyng life howbeit gracious prince grace may come desire desire lordes felowes pray edge axe turned towardes led barge sir thomas louell desired sytte cusshyns carpet ordained sayd nay went westminster duke buckyngham nowe edwarde bowhen mooste caitiffe worlde thus landed temple receiued sir nicholas uawse sir willyam sandes baronetes led citie desired euer people pray wept lamented sayd thende euil life god forgeue proude prince pitie behaued kyng liege lorde god preserue thus aboute iiii clocke brought cast man tower frydaie xvii day maie xi clocke duke great power deliuered ihon kyeme ihon skeuyngton shyriffes led skaffolde tower hill sayd offended kynges grace negligence lacke grace desired al nobleman beware al men pray trusted dye kynges true man thus mekely e toke death whose soule iesu haue mercy augustine frier toke body head buried ala euer grace truth wtdrawen fro noble man kyng alegeaunce ought haue suche thende ambicion thende false prophesies thende euil life euil counsail tyme fraunces frenche kyng made open warre emperor charles lande sea prouinces aragon castle spayne germany brabant flaunders steades mainteined partie emperor kynges highnes cosideryng ye murder effusion christen bloud trouble might ensue al prince christendome inuasion great turke sent cardinal yorke chaucellor name lord thomas wols toune calayce intreate amitie peace betwene two mightie prince voiage great preparacion made onely also erle worcestre lorde chamberlayn lord sainct iohns lord ferryes lord harbert bishop duresme bishop ely primate armicane sir thomas boleyn sir ihon peche sir iohn hussey sir richard wyngfelde sir henry gildforde many knightes esquiers gentleman doctor learned menne thus honorably accompanied rode london xxv day iuly thomas beckettes house maier alderman toke leaue praiyng god send good spede thus passed catorbury tharchebishop bishop catorbury place receiued pontificalibus brought lodgyng vnder canape bishoppes palayce viii day iulye came douer xx day thother lordes retinue toke passage ariued calayce safetie lord deputie counsail receiued muche honor lodged cardinal staple hall shortly whose ariuall came thether ye chauncelor frauce countie de palays iiiic horse ambassador fro frenche kyng likewise emperor came great ambassador thei satte counsail emperor ambassade shewed commission power euen frenche kynges ambassade whiche larger emperor commission thus grudge declared bothe side emperor ambassador cosented peace frenche kynges would frenche ambassador cosented peace emperor would cardinal would haue knitted emperor kyng soueraigne lorde frenche kyng bishop rome league amitie together ambassador suche commission especially bishop rome wherevpon letter sent rome hast frenchman taried calayce till returned beheld toune whiche counsail calaice wer contented herevpon cardinal rode emperor accompanied ambassador left frenche ambassador calaice abide returne passed grauelyng dukirke newport owdenborow sundry tymes waie encoutred receiued noble men without bruges receiued many noble men many lordes emperor court myle without bruges emperor owne persone met shewed lordes gentleman englad gracious countenauce accompanied cardinal toune great multitude people beheld rode emperor palayce lighted fyrst embrased cardinal lordes knightes gentleman englande suppose emperor knewe commission geuen sayd cardinal whiche kynges power grace present also great seale wt whiche seen el emperor would haue done high honor reuerence englishe lordes knightes esquiers yomen kinges gard beyng nomber iiiiclx horse well lodged euery man degree euery lodgyng furnished fewell bread bere wyne beues mutton ueles lambes uenison maner deintie viand aswell fishe fleshe lacke spice bankettyng dish next day great chere made ye lorde cardinal lordes knightes gentleman lordes knightes england whose presence cardinal made proposicion cocernyng peace betwene sayd emperor frenche kyng declaryng calamity misery wretchednes came warre comodities benefite welth came peace concorde traqulitie whiche proposicion continued great cardinal made ende emperor himselfe answered sayd lawe god byndeth euery man claime aske right thesame lawe byndeth man holde kepe withstande another man right cosyn fraunce doeth withholde rightes patrimony whiche haue princely desired eftsones wil wil rendre v sayd rightes patrimony contented haue peace subiectes trust god right trouble fatherhed rehersed shal come vpon adherentes title regalitie putte bishop rome consider kyng edwarde englande third name noble memory warred iust title recouer realme fraunce philip de ualois whiche title intercession put bishop rome court discusse expended space xxiii yeres vndetermined notwithstading great pursuite labor made haue ended suche like tyme v tedious wherfore entende ayde god folowe title cardinal replied declared league betwene thre mightyest prince worlde say emperor kyng soueraigne lorde henry viii frenche kyng prince fyrst moued warre two enemy vnto sayd beholde mightie power puissaunt realme rich shippes vitailes ordinauce lordes chiualry horseman archer comminaltie high mightie kyng england soueraigne lord fyrst warre beginneth sayd league sayd soueraigne lorde honor may lefully spr baner make warre defence frende thynges soueraigne lorde desire highnes maiesrie consent peace lorde cardinal sayd emperor esteme moste honor dere vncle kyng englande trust assuraunce neither royall person realme power nauye ordinauce shalbe ayde assistyng tried title cosent thyng dishonoryng v empire god defende humble selfe request high honor reserued lorde god may esteme higher iniuries wronges person predecessours louyng subiectes haue endured house fraunce lorde cardinall sayd emperor pride honor may must apprehende ouerthrow help god wordes counsail brake vp lordes menne honor england day dyned emperor court set serued came passe honorable man emperor sat dyner sayd thus thought kynges maiestie englande entendeth make peace ala euer ymagyn thyng muche dishonor emperor kyng vncle come hearyng worlde heareth assent bishoppe rome prince make peace v frenche partie battail gyngate obtained maximilian archeduke osteriche euerye noble manne v fought frenchman quarter naked slewe theim meruailous nomber desired doughter maximilian named margarete wife whiche lady duches sauoy yet liuyng beyng like emperor childe deliuered handes quene realme diuers tounes picardie redred partie high burgonie treasure meruailous sithen thesame maximilian spoused iane doughter heire fraunces duke britaigne whiche lande frenchemen ouer rane spoiled constrained sue vnto charles kyng fraunce safe conduict passe realme maximilian spouse vpon safe conduict graunted sayd ladie iane passyng fraunce small company charles taken ambois maried whervpon forsoke lady margarete sent againe father themperor without redyliuer rendryng againe tounes deliuered duke geldre subiect emperor yet day procurement frenche kyng rebell also iust title realme naples ought vnited croune castle frenche kyng faine iorney holy lande pretendyng title ieniamy brother great turke beyng captiue rome craftie treatie obtained sayd ieniamy passed naples without perill seazed lande handes prisoned thesame ieniamy thus great dammage castle made claime naples margaret quene england late wife henry vi kyng nauerne euermore vassal house aragon castell yet frenche kyng caused rebell hopyng thereby subdue sayd countreys late day frenche kyng false treason caused sir robert de la marche submitte himselfe emperor maiestie receiued vpo othe fidelitie pardonyng offence past false traitor returned frenche partie may court counsail kyng realme consenteth treason periury maintenaunce traitor called honorable hath frenche kyng sworne bounden neuer retaine switcher wage make warre emperor yet doth day albeit maiestie speaketh thinges yet well considereth trust verely sayd noble man god sayeth v e burgoigne euery man heard rehersall knewe true howbeit answered englishe knightes sayd sir haue sayd well god must thus narracion ended season emperor gatte toune mewzon also emperor partie great army arriued duchy mylan also emperor power besieged noble citie messiers capitaine called franciscus suspected treason remoued hoste seage without knowlege emperor emperor made seage volant aboute citie turnay reskue wherof also messiers french kyng made great army selfe person duryng seage frenchemen toke spaniardes ship laden englishemens goodes margate within kinges streames without great slaughter party yet frenchemen clx men spaniardes englishemen xxv kyng denmarke cristianus came se themperor brother law beyng stately prince yet meanes made lorde cardinal spake together without great signe amitie lorde cardinal soiorned bruges space xiii day concluded diuers matter emperor accomplished comission tooke leaue maiestie likewise nobleman england couenient iornies ariued al company calyce thembassadors fraunce taried immediatly ariuyng treated wt peace yet ernestly perceiued well sayd ambassador wrote therof freche kyng yet welth prosperitie ye realmes subiectes highly reasoned betwene cardinal sayd ambassadours especially fishyng wherevpon concluded subiectes prince might freely fishe sea repaire porte thone thother prince without robbyng spoylyng takyng vnto second day february next frenche kyng mightie army person repaired coutrey cambray mindyng passe streites wer wtstanded emperor power yet cotinued fro october vnto nouembre wtout thing doyng great displeasure french kyng duke daleson hearyng made preparacions wt almaynes passe marrys point dassans almaynes made bridge pypes vessel brought thither great ordinaunce emperor beyng toune ualecian therof aduertised caused stronge watche made would haue passed bastarde emery capitaine gaunt xiic men mette great conflicte many men slaine last almaines wer put flight bridge prouisions broken frenche partie wer slaine conflicte xiiiic men burgonians slaine bastarde emery capitaine gaunte iiiic men lord cardinal long treated ambassador fraunce could bryng theim conformitie peace sent emperor lord sainct ihons sir thomas boleyn knight aduertise maiestie therof likewise sayd lorde cardinal sent frenche kyng erle worcester bishop ely exhorte grace peace hard theim gaue theim fewe woordes answere xix xx day hoost tooke leaue returned calyce duryng continuaunce cardinall calayce writtes patentes wer sealed shyriffes chosen lacke presence kyng hungary sent ambassador kynges highnes ayde turke cardinall honorably entertayned duryng abode calayce commyng ayde men sayd frenche kyng lorde cardinal returne englishe ambassador emperour frenche kyng tooke shippyng landed porte douer xxvii day nouember toke iorney blechyngly kinges grace welcomed geuyng also thankes great paine trauail tyme frenche kyng layde seage toune castle hedyng burgonions perceiuyng furnished defence thereof forsoke sayd toune castle fledde flaunders litle reioysyng sayd frenchemen admyrall fraunce named mounsire bonyfet puissaunt armye made signe though would passe nauerne howbeit sodainly reculed hoost beseaged toune fontraby biskay brake fyrst second third walle therof ordinaunce meruailously gaue freshe assault spaniardes notwithstandyng ordinaunce caryed nauerne defence thereof defended theimselfes manfully slewe frenchemen vi hundreth moo spaniardes lx slaine capitaine fontraby made serche vitailes toune founde two meles called inhabitauntes menne warre together declaryng great necessitie sayd battery walles discorages v great necessitie victalles wherfore must like wolfe runneth wood hunger death consideryng great scarcitie vitailes byskay meanes whereof cannot vitailed must nedes rendre toune neuerthelesse kept toune seuen day neither bread fleshe fruite oyles onely herbes water yet last herbes fail also meanes wherof rendred toune composicion frenchemen entered deliuered englishemen goodes toune frenche kyng liyng enbattailed countrey cambray sodainly brake campe muche honor great warres tyme italye muche emperours hoost wanne citie countrey mylan high displeasure frenche kyng lost many noble capitaines men warre thus frenche kyng returned countrey without reskuyng citie turnay neuerthelesse sent letter whiche taken people countye nasson tenour whereof foloweth trustie welbeloued grete well lettyng e dayly v appeareth true faythfull seruices abode within citie turnay great ieopardie muche honor v realme praise manly fame euer v good lorde deme ites high seruices entended relief reskue oure sayd subiectes citie turnay consideryng weale persone realme haue remoued v purpose wherefore may say vnto god mounsire sainct denys succour countie nasson knewe reskew come sent people ordinaunce planted siege party citie capitaine castell prouost citie thei knewe frenche kynges retreite long consultacion amongest rendred citie castle appointment say burgeises haue xv day depart bagge baggage leuyng behynd ordinau ce aswel castle citie thus castle citie turnay rendred emperor handes last day nouember yere lorde god mdxxi yere many goodly gorgious momeries made court great reioysing quene lady noble beyng last day december cardinal accompaignied emperor ambassadours court honorably receiued highly feasted duryng abode many sumptuous gorgious disguisynges enterludes bankettes made season pope leo dyed adryan chosen yere great pestilence death london place realme many noble capitaines died lorde broke sir weston browne sir ihon heron sir edward sir ihon peche muche people bishop london doctor fitz iames likewise deceased yere doctor tunstall preferred thesame benefice lorde thomas hawarde erle surrey came ireland court xxv day ianuary space xx monethes great trauail pain often tymes sore troubled wylde irishe howbeit noblenes manhod brought lordes ireland kynges due obeysaunce many victory perpetual laude praise frenchemen tyme spoiled shamefully robbed kynges subiectes euery coast sea wheresoeuer kyng roade poore subiectes came lamentacions cryes shewyng grace crueltie frenchemen inhumaine dealyng euer frenche ambassadours promised restitucion euery thyng none restored moneth ianuary kyng commaunded shippes warre made readynes whiche done diligece tyme duke albany arriued scotland notwithstandyng frenche kyng sware vnto cardinall neuer come scotlande without kyng souereigne lordes consent comission fro frenche kyng although frenche kyng wrote kyng entred scotlande without assent second day february kyng beyng grenewiche came thether cardinal legacion leo bishop rome also ambassadour waited many nobleman kyng met chamber doore welcomyng though come rome sayd cardinal high victorious kyng hath pleased lorde god indue grace great multitude manifolde grace kyng electe fauor high heauen appeareth presently noble persone formed figured shape stature force pulchritude whiche signifieth present pleasure lorde god wrought noble grace praised wisedome prudence learnyng many goodly wordes praise noble grace finally cardinal declared sayd bishop rome sent highnes acte bull vnder leade declaryng therein grace defendor christian faythdefender fayth successor euermore grace receiued sayd bull caused redde published went chapell heare masse accompanied many noble realme also ambassador sundry prince cardinall beyng reuested syng masse erle essex brought bason water duke suffolke gaue thassay duke northfolke helde towell proceded masse done gaue vnto heard masse cleane remission blessed kyng quene people bull eftsones declared trumpettes blew shalmes saggebuttes plaied honor kynges newe style thus highnes went dinuer middes whereof kyng heraldes compaignie began large criyng henricus dei graria rex anglie francie defensor fide dominus h ernie thus ended dinner muche habundance vitaill wyne maner people x daie february lorde hoote chief baron kynges eschequer gaue ouer office hym admitted cardinall master ihon fitz iames right honorable man well learned tyme muche busines betwene themperor frenche kyng wherefore kyng sent sea sixe good shippes well manned vitailed warre admirall called christopher coo man expert sea saffegarde merchauntes kynges subiectes greuously spoyled robbed sea frenchemen scottes rouers tyme viii daie february lorde dacres wardein march scotlande entered scotlande vc men kynges commaundement proclamed scottes come kynges peace first daie marche folowyng el stande perilles duke albany beeyng within fiue mile mightie power scottes xi daie february sir george neuell lorde burgayny beeyng prisoner tower brought westminster ther kynges beche con essed enditement imprision cause edwarde late duke buckyngham bee true open confession thereof led tower lorde montacute kynges cosyn tyme reco ciled grace fauor whiche prisoner tower sir edward neuell knight sir edward neuell forbidden kynges presence bearyng fauor duke buckyngham yere second marche certain noble men empire arriued englande passe spain honorably receiued honor greate iustes triumphes wer made finished doen thei toke leaue departed iorney also tyme commission geuen throughout realme generall muster bee knowe power might bee made within thesame also men sworne substaunce landes thei wer cardinall aduertised thesame without grudgyng people marueilyng thei sworne awne goodes citee london moneth aduertised commyng emperor wherefore made greate preparacion citezens sent kynges grace one hundred tall men well harnissed furnishe nauie appoynted kepe narowe sea frenche kyng certified kynges highnes letter dated marche graunde capitain fraunce countie de palais monsire de lescue noble men fraunce toune milain whiche true within fiue sixe day euidently knowen frenchemen beaten backe wonne nothyng greate shame reproche moreouer thesame season frenche kyng wrote lettters seignory commonaltie gean sende hym three carectes sixe galeis furnished warres vnto porte breste maintein warres foresaied emperor made hym letter suche reasonable excuse contented spare theim tyme kynges highnes kept yere easter manour richemont caused amner make enquire eight mile rounde thesaid manour poore people euery parishe eschuyng murther moste commonly fortuned euery goodfridaie reason great resort poore people grace caused refre hed almose home house aboute tyme rouer theif scotlande called duncan camell long fight taken sea squier cornewall called master ihon arondell presented kynges highnes committed hym tower london remaigned prisoner long season moneth marche haue hard came certain noble men emperor kyng whiche solace theim enterprised iustes hymself chief one side courser barded clothe siluer denmarke embrodered lll golde vnder letter harte manne wounded greate rolles golde blacke letter whiche written mon nauera put together ell mon ceur nauera hath vvounded harte thesame suite base folowed sir nicholas carewe base barde white damaske whiche embraudered clothe golde prison man lokyng grate ouer prison came prisoner rolle whiche written frenche prison libertie libertie prison apparell garded shakelles siluer folowed therle deuonshire lorde roos one suite apparell white veluet embraudered clothe golde wrought deuice harte trauersed crosse wise chayne whiche deuided bard foure quarter twoo quarter hande golde holdyng spere worlde twoo quarter twoo handes holdyng twoo plume fethers border written harte betwene ioye pein folowed anthony kyngston anthony kneuet apparell harte bounde blewe lace embroudered crimosyn sattin written aboute letter golde harte bounde nicholas darrel bard base blacke sattin embraudered full harte turned broken golde written letter siluer harte broken last bende anthony broune whiche bard siluer full speeres world broken set harte broken al gold written aboute letter b ke remedy without remedy entered duke suffolke bend bardes base russet veluet clothe siluer embraudered braunches paunces golde iustes many speres broken whiche straungiers highly commended thirde daie marche cardinall made kyng ambassador greate co ly banket plaie maske garmentes rui et sattin yelowe one side yelowe face legge side russet shrouetewes aie night thesaid cardinall kyng amba sadors made another supper supper thei came great chamber hanged arras clothe estate many br unches euery braunche xxxii forchettes waxe nether ende thesame chamber castle whiche principall tower whiche cresset burnyng twoo lesse tower stode euery side warded embattailed euery tower banner one banner rent harte lady hand g yng mannes harte third banner lady hande turnyng mannes hart castle kept lady straunge name first beautie second honor third perseueraunce ourth kyndn fifth constance sixte unrie seuenthe mercie ight pitie eight lady millian gounes white sattin euery lady name embraudered golde heddes calles millein bonettes gold iwelles nethe basse fortresse castle eight lady whose name dangier disdain gelousie vnkyndenes scorne malebouche straungenes lady tired like woman inde entered eight lordes clothe golde cappes greate mantell clokes blewe sattin lordes named morus noblenes youthe attendaunce l yaltie pleasure gentlenes libertie kyng chief compaignie compaignie led one crimosin sattin burnyng flame gold called ardent desire whiche moued lady geue ouer castle scorne disdain saied thei would holde place desire saied lady wonne came encoraged knightes lordes ranne c stle whiche tyme without shot greate peale gunnes lady defended castle rose water comfirtes lordes threwe date orenges fruites made pleasure laste place wonne lady scorne compaignie stubb nely defended theim boows ba le till thei driuen place ded lordes toke lady honor prisoner handes brought doune daunced together pleasauntly whiche much pleased straungers thei daunced fill disuisered themselfes wer knowen costly banket doen straungiers tooke leaue kyng cardinall departed flaunders geuyng kyng muche commendacion kyng like prince whiche forseeth thynges sawe warre likely ensue caused erle surtey high admirall put readines nauie bothe conduictyng emperoure englande also defence subiectes whiche daily robbed spoyled sea whiche lorde admiral toke suche diligece helpe sir willyam fitz willyam uice admirall al shippes beginnyng aprill rigged trimmed especial henry grace due kynges greate ship brought riuer thamis dounes redy saile whether god kyng would yere assise kept castle cambridge lent iustices gentleman bailiffes resortyng thether toke suche infeccion whether wer sauor prisoner filthe house many gentleman sir ihon cut sir giles alyngton knightes many honest yomen thereof died moste whiche present wer sore sicke narrowly escaped liues yere also died sir edwarde pownynges knight gartier sir ihon pechy sir edwarde belknap valiaunt capitaines whiche wer suspected poysoned banket made arde twoo kynges met last yere also without pestilence derthe corne whe e sold yere citee londo xx quarter place xxvisviiid thesame yere deceber died leo bishop rome chosen one adria borne utrike emperor schoole master thesame moneth gawan doglas bisshop dunkell scotlande fled scotlande england duke albany arriued scotlande taken vpon hym gouernor kyng realme kyng assigned honest pencion liue king aduertised duke albany arriued scotland taken rule young kyng realme muche doubted sequele matter consideryng duke heire apparant croune scotlande wherefore sent clareseaux kyng armes scotlande commaundement declare duke albany pleasure depart ye realme scotlande twoo cause one promised frenche kyng laste metyng come scotlande second kyng england vncle kyng scottes bonde nature ought defende nephew wherefore nephew beyng young custodie hym dye realme scotlande discende doubted lest might brought waie duke albany serued heires scotlande would auoyde scotlande clarenseaux commaunded defie hym whiche accordyngly defie hym holy rode house edenbrough answered niether ye freche kyng kyng englande let come naturall countrey agrement also touchyng young kyng saied loued hym souereigne lorde hym would kepe protest al clarenseaux reported answere kyng knewe well frenche kynges dooyng wherefore prouided thynges accordyngly erle anguishe scotlande maried lady margaret kyng souereigne lordes sister late wife vnto kyng iames scotlande slain floddon felde duke albany sent coloured ambassade fraunce shortely arriuyng frenche kyng committed prison brother likewise whiche escaped shall heare also vi daie marche frenche kyng commaunded englishemenes goodes beyng burdeaux attached put vnder reste likewise deteined kynges tribute whiche haue fraunce also french quenes dowry kyng sent hym euer gaue faire wordes made delay none paied euer ambassador promised faire pthe xiiii yere kyng yere kept daie ofthe xiiii yere george great solempnitie manour richemond wer elect ordre gartier done ferdinando brother emperor archduke oy trike sir richard wyngfeld knight emperor meanes emperor geuen twoo hundred pound pencion house burgoyn whiche sir edward pounynges emperor gifte duryng warre betwene emperour frenche kyng kyng englande liyng still entreator betwene englishemen robbed bothe side wine wer laden burdeaux ready depart attached merchauntes put prison poore fisherman coast englande sometyme met frenchemen spoyled recompence thei taken merchauntes englande factor burdeau complained kyng englande shewed hym frenche kyng contrary league safeconduit vnder seale people taken goodes emprisoned factor frendes haue remedy likewise complayned merchauntes shippes restrained euery porte fraunce goodes rifeled could haue redresse kyng counsaill sory coplaintes merchauntes concluded sende frenche ambassadours cardinall saied sir chaunce happened haue promised euer name kyng master league promise couenauntes kept ful restitucion bee made euery hurte dammage ferme peace amitie kept contrary saiyng merchauntes robbed spoyled yea although hath graunted safeconduite yet thei bee robbed staied bur eaux peace master hath promised bee kepte amitie sworne kepe woorde kyng strength prince breake safconduite aduised merchantes sue fraunce itucion warrant theim restored haue put theim co e losse thei haue sued long pent goodes without redresse haue emprisoned kept bothe good iustice restitucion procurement see come promise surely maie bee suffered beside kyng enformed kyng master hath spoken hym foule opprobrious wordes yea hearyng englishemen whiche sore greued heare suche wordes able reuenged ambassadour fraunce saied reported well saied cardinall note counsaill englande light tel fable misauised praie often time hath kyng written master restitucion suche robertes hath dooen yet haue redresse wherefore grauted letter marke whiche maie league monsire chas ilion hath taken merchauntes englande prisoner hath lent certain hether rausome open warre peace master president polliot pulteyne french ambassador answered surely matter whiche wer alleged master frenche kyng forged matter true saied fruthe daily courte fraunce complaintes made englishemen greate robbery dooen theim aswell land sea affirmyng doen emperor querell yet frenche kyng loue beareth englande letteth subiectes bee vnhard although daily lament greate iniury doen hym subiectes englishemen ther ore lorde praie beleue suche tale till haue tolde truthe cardinall called ure hostage laie paiment money turney thei foure wer deliuered lorde sainct ihones sir thomas louell sir andrew wyndsore sir thomas neuell euery knight one kepe safe none countrey speake priuely ambassador comau ded kepe house silence come presence till sent whiche ordre sore abashed frenche hostage thambassador remedy commaundement geuen maior london attache frenchman body goodes kepe prison till hard farther kynges pleasure frenchemen london aboute arrested broughte prison al prison aboute london wer full escaped speakyng dutche saied thei wer flemynges borne whiche tried kyng safegard merchautes sent xxviii goodly shippes sea well manned trimmed warres seuen shippes sent toward scotlande whiche entered frithe proferred enter scottishe shippes laie hauen scottes ran shippes land englishemen folowed boates landed set shippes ire lithe toke certain prisoner whiche thei brought englande still kynges great na e kepte narrowe sea neither peace betwene englande fraunce open warre haue hard kyng perfect knowlege charles emperour would kinges toune calice xxiii daie maie passe thorow englande spain wherefore kyng sent marque dor et accompaignied diuerse knightes gentleman receiue hym calice whiche hast sped hym thether likewise cardinal toke iorney toward douer xx daie maie rode london accompaignied twoo erles xxxvi knightes hundred gentleman eight bishoppes tenne abbottes thirtie chapelleines veluet sattin yomen seuen c iorneiyng came douer xxvi daie beyng monday meane season tidynges brought kyng frenche kyng sent great army toward calice men warre laie abuile munstrell bullein aboute nere englishe pale wherefore kyng like prince forsawe entendyng disceiued wrote noble citees tounes prepare certain menne warre readines whiche shortly dooen thei sent nauie tha thei might shortely bee calice nede required sundaie xxv daie maie lorde marque dorset bishop chichester lorde de lawarr noble men water grauelyng receiued emperor name kyng england emperor embraced theim hauyng compaignie many noble men came toward calice turnepike lordeship marke receiued sir edwarde guylford marshall calice fiftie menne armes richely beleen also hundred archer horsebacke passyng forward towarde calice ordinaunce shotte terribly calice receiued procession lorde barne deputie cou saill toune receiued maior alderman toune maior merchauntes staple conueighed checker lodged mondaie al noble spain flaunders germany toke ship calice landed douer foure clocke noone hym duke daluoy prince orenge countie na aw countie uascord lorde ogmond marque brandebrough one ship bote cardinall receiued hym sandes accompaignied three hundred lordes knightes gentleman englande themperor embrased cardinall toke hym arme passed forward toke horse rode together douer castle thei wer lodged thenglishe harbinger di igently lodged emperours train euery man accordyng degree kyng englande come cantorbury xxvii daie maie receiued archbishopp hearyng emperor arriuall smal compaignie wednesdaie eyng assension euen rode douer muche ioye gla ne emperour met taried assension daie fridaie kyng brought emperoure aborde newe ship called henry grace dieu shippe xvc rowed aboute greate shippes whiche laie douer rode emperor lordes muche praised makyng shippes especially artilerie thei saied thei neuer sawe shippes armed thesame daie none two noble prince marched forward cantorbury wher maior alderman receiued without toune solempne oracion emperor secretary answered ornatly prince sweardes borne naked theim emperour right hande entered citee cantorbury procession brought christes churche archebishop twelue prelate mitered receiued vnder canapy thei offered sacrament emperor brought bishoppes palace laie night kyng lodged sainct augustine morowe prince remoued sityngbor e next daie rochester bi op receiued whole couent mondaie thei came grauersede one clocke thei tooke barge wer thirtie barge appoynted straugiers vi clocke thei landed grenew che thesame mondaie ii daie iune emperor kyng newly welcomed al nobilitie halle doore quene prince lady receiued welcomed hym asked quene blessyng fashion spain betwene aunte nephewe emperor great ioye se quene aunte especiall young cosyn germain lady mary emperour lodged kynges lodgyng whiche richely hanged spanyardes wodered specially riche cloth estate nothyng lacked might begotten chere emperor lordes came compaignie highly feasted wednesdaie doo emperor pleasure prepared iustes royall one parte kyng erle deuonshire x compaignions al mounted horsebacke apparell bardes riche clothe golde embroudered siluer letter riche greate plume heddes compaignie tooke felde rode aboute tilte entered duke suffolk marque dorset x barded apparel russet veluet embroudered sundery knottes culpyns golde emperor quene noble stode galery beholde doyng kyng ran duke suffolk viii course euery course brake spere euery man ran course doen ranne together volant fast thei could discharge speres appoynted broken thei disarmed went supper supper emperor behelde lady daunces sodainly came chamber sixe noble appareled crimosin veluet clothe golde mantell taffeta rolled body hooddes bonettes clothe golde heddes veluet buskyns legges masker entred daunced greate lady sodainly entered sixe masker drumslades appareled long gounes hoddes clothe gold whiche nomber kyng duke suffolk prince orenge countie nassow coutie naueray monsire egremond whe masker wer entred auoyded thei toke lady daunsed straugers much praised tyme came euery person departed lodgyng thursdaie thei iusted daie appoynted theimselfes tornay kyng armyng came one george luffkin shewed hym one come fro ambassador fraunce kyng called messenger deliuered letter whiche kyng red saied sir william compton tell emperor haue newes pleaseth hym come hether sir willyam compton went told emperoure whiche without delaye came kyng whiche shewed hym letter fro sir thomas cheney ambassador wherin conteined definitiue answer made aswel sir thomas cheney clarenseaux kyng armes englande frenche kyng kynges requestes shall vnderstande kyng englande ambassador often time demaunded bothe tribute lawfull debte also restitucion bee made subiectes greued farther also league broken makyng warre themperor league kyng englande enemy hym first brake take part yet muche compassion shedyng christen bloud would enter warre shewe hymself mediator entreator betwene theim vpo sir thomas cheney ten moued frenche kyng also moued hym take peace emperor two yeres mediacion peace might ntreated meane season frenche kyng answered haue well considered master desire whiche nothyng agree hold v content request sir said thambassador kyng master shalbe aduertised answere wherefore beseche grace safeconduite returne englande saied kyng officer armes comehether englande lette hym come shalbe hard haue answere whiche thyng sir thomas chency answered reuerence departed xxi daie maie thesaid officer called clarenseaux kyng armes came french kynges chaber lion accompaignied many noble men gentleman clarenseux put cote armes desired license speake libertie according lawe armes whiche hym grauted declared french kyng bound league tripertite kepe peace emperor aud kyng englande whosoeuer firste brake twoo bee enemy hym whiche league frenche kyng sworne whiche league apparauntly broken makyng warre themperor sir robert de la marche hymself persone wherefore kyng league must enemie take parte hym also declared french kyng kept away kynges rete debtes dewe hym also deteined dower frenche quene also contrary promise sent duke albany scot also contrary iustice emprisoned merchantes hauyng safeconduite thei haue gone saftie seyng warre proclaimed betwene hym kyng master article many mo kyng master redy proue naie saied frenche kyng began warre sent robert de lamarche make warre commaunded contrary made warre proper person warre open toune cournay strong besieged touchyng duke albany hath cost xlm frankes kepe hym scotland could let go awne coutrey frenche kyng excused vntruth sir farther charged tell said clareseaux kyng souereigne lorde holdeth mortall enemie ie furth al adherentes well said french kyng loked gre agone sith cardinal bridge loked nother haue doen message ye french kyng rose departed clareseaux conueighed lodgyng shortly sir thomas cheney safeconduite departed came bullein monsire fayett capitain theim bothe staied till ambassador fraunce whiche lien england wer clerely deliuered calice whole circumstaunce demau de deffiaune frenche kynges answere conteined letter whiche brought kyng shewed emperor haue hard kyng emperor loked letter sodein noyse rose emongest bothe subiectes letter defiance sent tem bothe frenche kyng whiche nothyng thus warre open party betwene englande fraunce spain twoo prince matter commoned fill themperor called horse kyng hymself armed bothe bendes tornay mounted horsebacke themperor rich apparell tissew richely trapped brought kyng felde toke vp horse men greate pleasure beholde hym men armes fell turnay brake sweardes seuered came together fought valiauntly tyme herauldes cried disarme assone ht kyng vnarmed emperor wet supper supper kyng brought emperor hall cupperd xii stage set greate mightie plate al golde vpper ende hong three clothes estate hall full greate lightes set gylte braunches twoo prines set quene also entered eight noble menne masker apparell visers garmentes blacke ueluet garded embroudered golde cut woorkes ouer double lumberdy mantelles sattyn folded vp euery shulder curiously embroudered masker halfe englishe lordes traungiers thei toke lady daunsed sodainly entered eight masker apparelled riche tynsell matched clothe golde turkey clokes rebanded nettes siluer betwene knittynges flower golde mantelles crimosyn sattyn bothe masker hoddes crimosyn sattyn lustie masker entered reueled lustely thei doen spice brought wyne persones began drawe reste fridaie sixe daie iune kyng emperour compaignies marched towarde london waie myle sainct george barre set riche tente clothe golde whiche tente twoo lodgynges one emperoure another kyng twoo prince shifted theim herauldes appoynted euery manne roume euery manne set forwarde ordre richely apparelled clothe gold tissew siluer tynsell ueluettes coloures lacked massye cheynes curious collers englishemanne straung er roade euer together matched accordyng degree emperoure kyng borne twoo swordes naked twoo prince folowed coates clothe golde embraudered siluer bothe one suite theim folowed kynges henxinenne coates purple ueluet pieled paned riche clothe siluer theim matched emperours henxe menne equall nomber coates crimosyn uelue two gardes one golde siluer folowed capitaines gardes emperours garde right hande englishe garde lefte hande ordre wete forwarde waie maior ihon milborne brother tine skarlet well horssed met emperoure kyng one sir thomas knight well learned made theim eloquent oracion praise twoo prince peace loue betwene theim comfort subiectes se theim suche smitie maior citezens offered pleasure leruice laye next souereigne lorde dooen thei came southwarke clergie receiued theim cope cross sensers kept one side strete citee thei came marshalsie kynges benche emperoure desired pardon kyng prison r emperours request pardoned agreate nomber theim thei almoste bridge foote staie kyng demaunded cause tolde hym herauldes appoynted twoo gentleman ride together one ambassadour marque mantua emperour citee seine emperour also citee marque frendes emperoure incontinent sente lorde chamberlaine theim saiyng thei would daie doo hym honoure would thanke theim thei would ride thei appoynted praied theim departe lorde chamberlaine tolde message thei rode furth made curtesie thei come drawe bridge set targettes armes emperoure dominion richely paincted side stoode one greate giaunte representyng hercules mightie clubbe hande syde stoode another giaunte representyng sampson iawe bone asse hande twoo gyauntes helde greate table whiche written golden letter emperours stile drawe bridge twoo prince passed middes bridge raised faire edisice tower embattayled gate like masonrie white blacke like touche white merbell aboue buyldyng faire pagiaunt whiche stoode iason harnes hauyng hym golden flece one side hym stoode fiery dragon side stode two bulles whiche beastes cast fyer continually towe one syde stode fayre mayde representyng lady medea whiche straungely richely apparelled aboue pagiant written verse letici quantum mimijs prebebat iason aurea phrixee vellera nactus ouis leticie quantum tulerat pompeius et vrbi hoste tr umphato scipio romulidum tantum tu nobis c sar mitissime princeps intrans henrici principis hospicium beholden pagiant came conduste gracious strete made bastyle two great gate one one side way side ouer gate betwene gate made iii great tower embattailed vauted lope lucanes like masonry curiously wrought middle tower clothe estate vnder whiche sat one representyng emperor third tower represetyng kyng charlemayne hauyng ii swordes gaue emperor sworde iustice kyng sworde triumphant victory sat pope gaue croune thorne thre nayles pagiant sette armes elector thempyre verse table carole christigenum decus et quem scripta loquntur magno duc um carolo habere genus tuque henrice pia virtutis laude refulgens doctrina ingenio religione fide vospretor consul sanctus cum plebe senatus vectos huc fausto sydere gestit ouans pagiant made esterlynges gracious strete esterlinges stode good order two prince came leden halle wher ouerthwart great strete leadeth byshoppes gate erected goodly pagiant wonderfull curiously wrought xxxviii fote broade lxxx length fote pagiant sat ihon duke lancastre called ihon gaunte sonne kyng edward third duke sat rote rote sprang many braunches curiously wrought leaues whiche pollicie dropped swete water euery braunche satte kyng quene noble parsonage descended sayd duke nomber lv image toppe stode emperor kyng england quene thre vi degree sayd duke pagiant made cost italyans muche praised fro thence passed conduite cornehill strete enclosed fro side side ii gate open shitte ouer gate wer arch tower embattailed set vane scutchions armes emperor kyng ouer arch two tower one full trompettes full shalmes shagbuttes whiche played continually betwene two tower palice vnder riche clothe estate sat kyng arthur rounde table serued x kynges duke erles beryng targettes armes emperor kyng commyng thither poet sayd laudat magnanimos vrbs inclita rom catone cantant ha ibalem punica regna suum gentis erat solime rex ingens gloria dauid gentis alexander gloria prima sue llustrat fortes arthurifama britannos illustras gentem c sar ipse tuam cui deus imperium victo precor hoste secundet regnet vt n terris pacis amica qu e sayd came tot stockes quadrant stage herber full rose lyllies flower curiously wrought byrdes beastes thynges pleasure aboute herber made water full fyshe elementes planettes starres place euery thing moued type toppe made trinitie angel singyng trinitie blessed kyng emperor vnder feete written behold louer peace concorde passed poultry great co duite chepe made right hand sayd conduite passed maner quadrant fower tower euery corner one goodly type betwene euery tower gallery whiche galeries hanged clothes golde siluer within couered ouer forefrontes euery gallery hanged white grene sarcenet wrethed great knottes golde let doune maner valence gallery vnder sayd gallery targettes schutchions emperor kynges armes deuises fower tower fower fayre ladyes cardinall vertues richely besene great pleasure behold euery vertue hauyng signe token propertie gallery sat child mixed men woman singyng plaiyng instrumetes melodiously whiche sort one child sayd verse folowyng quinto amplexetur populus te c sar amore testantur varijs gaudia mixta sonis aera tube litui cantus cithare calamis que consona te resonant organon disparibus vnum te celebrant te vnum sic cuncta salutant decus rerum gloria c sar aue came stadard made mightie buildyng tymber wt tower set carbles forced arch buttad al abilimentes embossed lynterelles inhaunsed pillers quadrant vautes orbes crobbes depedyng mosters bearyng vp pillers roffe louer swellyng top wherof baner armes spayne england al pagiant ful scutchions armes ii prince fote pagiat sat alphons kyng spayne richely apparelled brest braunche whiche sprang many kynges quenes prince whiche satte liuely persones richely apparelled euery one scutchion armes shewyng mariages highest braunche satte emperor kyng iust v vii degree fro sayd kyng spayne sayd kyng alphons sayd verse carole qu fulges sceptro diademate sacro tu que henrice fimul stemma iuncta gerens alter germa lux alter clara britannis miscens hispano sanguine vterque genus viuite felices quod vixit secula nestor viuite cumane tempora fatidice pagiant seen verse sayd came litle conduite chepe buylded place like heauen curiously painted cloudes erbes starres ierarchies angel top pagiant great type type sodainly issued cloude fayre lady richely apparelled al minstrel whiche wer pagiant plaied angel sang sodainly againe assumted cloud whiche curiously done aboute pagiant stode apostle wherof one sayd verse ob quorum aduentum tocies gen ipsa britanua supplex dijs superis vota pr ter que dedit quos ta omnis pueri iuuenes que sene que optarunt oculis sepe videre suis venistis tandem auspicio christi marie que pacis coniuncti f dere perpetuo hero saluete pij saluete bea exhilarant nostros minimum vestra lares yet must forget pagiantes citezens well apparelled stode within railes sette left side stretes clergie right side riche cope whiche sensed prince passed stretes richely hanged clothes golde siluer veluet arras euery house almooste mynstrelsy euery strete two verse written letter gold carolus henricus viuant defensor vter que henricus fidei carolus eccleste whiche verse er also written table golden letter ensueth long prosperitie charles henry one fayth churche pricnes moste puissaunt chosen defendant past lytle conduite came west ende poules churche alighted canapie redy vnder whiche two stoode receiued archebishop cautorbury xxi prelate pontificalles offered high aulter returned horsebacke came blacke frier emperor lodged great royaltie noble lodged newe palace brydewell whiche made gallery emperor lodgyng whiche gallery long gallery gallery wer hanged arras kynges palayce richely adorned thynges witte dull deser ue theim rich hangynges sumptuous buildyng giltyng chamber saterday kyng emperor playd tennice bayne prince orenge marque brandenborow prince syde stopped erle deuonshyre lorde edmond syde departed euen handes bothe sydes xi game fully played whitsonday viii day iune themperor kyng great honor apparelled cloth siluer eysed gounes cote apparell white except bonettes roade churche saint paule heard high masse whiche song cardinal whiche trauers cupborde masse ii baron gaue water gospell ii erles last lauatory ii duke whiche pride spanyardes sore disdayned masse done returned brydewell emperor highly feasted thesame sonday noone two prince went water westminster roade churche ridyng sanctuary menne cryed mercy pardon hastye presed nere sergeaunts armes could scase kepe theim touchyng emperor kyng cardinal gaue gentle answere whiche contented theim tyme wer receiued procession abbey heard euensong beheld kyng henry seuenthes chapel went westminster halle largenesse wherof emperor muche meruailed turned brydewell supped moday thei dyned southwarke duke suffolke hunted parke roade manor richemond lodgyng next day hampton court great chere thence thursday wyndsore hunted fryday saterday sonday night great halle disguisyng play theffect ye proud horse would tamed brideled amitie sent prudence pollicie tamed force puissaunce brideled horse ment ye freche kyng amitie kyng englad themperor prisoner counsail power play ended sumptuous maske xii men xii woman men garmentes clothes golde siluer lose layde crimosyn satten knit pointes gold bonettes whoddes buskyns al gold lady thesame suite whiche riche behold daunced came costly baket voidy spice departed lodgyng monday tewsday wednesday prince counsail sat moste parte counsail corpus christi day great triumph rode collage wyndsore emperor ware mantle garter satte owne stall gaue herauldes cc crounes day bothe prince receiued sacrament masse bothe sware kepe promise league eche amitie great ioy made party masse ended went dyner great feastyng fryday departed wyndsore easy iorneys came wynchester xxii day iune way thether emperor hunted hart emperor come wynchester therle surray admyrall england kynges nauy come hampton lorde fitz water baron curson sir gyles capell sir nicholas carew sir richard wyngfeld sir richard iernyngham fraunces bryan anthony browne iohn russell whiche many kynges preuy chamber many mo departed hampton xxx shippes well manned ordinauced ende iune noisyng onely skoure sea safegard emperor nauye priuy instruccions go another place shal heare warre party picardy hotte capitaine bullain called fayet wrote euer mockyng letter garison calaice sayd garison calayce would issue would mete halfe way iiiim men whervpon sir edward guildforde
