layde ordynauce walles shot without fearcely duke burbon determyned best lye styll withoutrome assauted slayne ordinaunce consideryng naked people without great ordinaunce wherfore determined take chaunce geue assaute manfully approched walles betwene burgo nouo olde rome romayns valiauntly defended handgnnes pykes stone weapon enemyes fayne retreyte romaynes glad sette many faire banner tower bulwarkes made great showtes seeynge duke burbon cryed new assaute drumslades blew euery ladder mounted yrst encouter agayn romayns put lytel backe perceiuig duke burbo cryed god themperour euery man manfully sette sore fyght many arrow shot many man felled last emperours men gotte wall betwene euery assaute fell myst within coulde see parte without would assayle profitable themperours partie three assautes sleyne iiic swyshes pope garde last assaute duke burbon stryken thygh handgonethe duke burbon sleyn shortly dyed chapell syst whyther souldiers brought chaunce notwithstandynge armye entered rome toke pope palace set vp themperours armes day three assautes made pope clement passed lytell emperours armye urse pope accursed theim saturday curse called almaynes lutheranes spaniard murreynes more hearyng masse sodeinly almaynes entered churche slew garde dyuerse seeyng fled haste preuye way castell angell al followed hym way coulde entre sleyne fury ben taken ben sleine cardinal prelate fled castel angel ouer bridge many commen people ouerpr ssed drowned thei gaue way cardinalles estate passed towarde castell succour cardinall sene sesaryne tudertine iacobace ualle taryed long coulde get castell multitude people wherefore compelled take nother house called palace george kepte theym selfe whyle secretely thei myngt must vnderstand thorough citie rome ronneth famouse ryuer called tyber one syde ryuer standeth castell angell borough angell side called burgo nouo new borough brydge called brydge syxte lyeth directly castell ende brydge wonderous strong bulwarke well ordinaunced well manned emperours men saw coulde doo nothynge pope porte citie bridge determyned assaute bulwarke men without feare came bridge romayns well defended slew almost iiiim men seeyng prince orenge marque gnasto spede gaue assaute notwithstandyng romaynes shot great ordinauces handgonnes quarrel myght shot yet imperiall persones neuer shranke manly entered bulwarke slew threw downe loupe romains thei found rased bulwarke grounde pope castell angell behelde fyght xxiii cardinalles one called cardinall sanctorum quatuor cardinall pouche slayne hym prelate priestes vc genglemen vc souldyers wherefore immediatly capitayns determined ley siege castell angell lest thei within myght issue turne theym damage wherfore sodeinly siege planted rounde castellrome spo meane srason souldyers fell spoyle neuer rome pylled neither gothes uandales souldiers content spoyle citizen robbed church brake vp house close religious person ouerthrew cloysters spoyled virgin rauyshed maryed woman men wer tormented geue euery new asker demaunder wer strangeled wer punyshed priuey mebres cause confesse treasure woodnesse contynued great whyle man myght thynke gotten moche thei would ceasse quyet plaied cotinually dyce vc ducates cast came play laded wtih pla e went awai almost naked fell ryfelyng agayne many citizen whiche coulde paciently suffre vexacion drowned selues tiber souldiers daily ley siege made iestes pope sometyme one ridyng lyke pope whore behynde hym sometyme blessed sometyme cursed sometyme thei woulde one voyce call hym antech ist went vndermynde castell haue throwen downe head water ennironeth castell dispoynted purpose season duke urbyne xvm men came ayde pope hearyng rome take aried lx myle fro rome tyl heard word marque saluce sir frederico de bodso xvm footemen horseman wer uitarbe x dai maie thei hering citie rome taken also taried cardinal colume came army neapolitan helpe themperours men saw crueltie souldiers dyd lytle helpe hated moch bisshop rome thus besieged tyl viii ides iuli dai yelded selfe necessitie penury al thinges castell restored geue grace graunte bulles dyd taryed styll castell saynt angell great nombre almaynes spanyardes keepe spanyardes bare rule castell man entered came castell moneth iuly came corne began fayle rome pestilence beganne waxe strong wherfore great army remoued place called naruya xl mile fro rome leauyng behynde suche kepte bysshop rome departed spanyardes neuer contented tyll gotten almaynes castell angell whole custodye pope rome continued peace tyll septembre tyll armye came agayne naruya almayns sware woulde set citie fyer excepte pope woulde pay full wage bisshop rome sumwhat astonyed sent commen onely two archebisshops two bysshops two gentleme syxe persones almayns tooke pledge coutrarye pope meanyng sayde would keepe tyll payed put strong chaumbre palace george euery day almost woulde bryng furth openly scolde chyde make beleue woulde hang payed kepte emprisoned chaubre xxiiii watched euery nyght without chaumbre dore xiiii day lykewysean escape yet watche got chymney saynte andrewes eue seene escape sooner knowen spanyardes kepte pope almaynes watched dore almaynes woode chauce thei came prince orenge generall capitayne demaunded money hym suche rigorouse manier fayne secretely flee sene hym chose capitayne marque gnasto whiche gouerned tyll february brought naples aboute xxviii daye maie letter broughte kyng englande frenche kyng parte troble sonday second day iune kyng receyued letter castell wyndsore whiche perceyued ordre manier sackyng rome taking pope manier forme haue hearde wherfore kyng sorye many prelate comminaltie lytle mourned sayde pope ruffyan meete roume wherfore sayde beganne myschief well serued cardynall tooke matter highly called hym prelate clergy muche mourned fall bisshop rome saw people grudged agaynste spiritualtie greate pride pompe yll lyuyng wherfore came kyng sayde sir onely callyng god made defendor christian faith nowe consydre state churche christe standeth see howe head churche rome captiuitie see holy farthers e brought thraldome without comfort shewe selfe aide defendour church god shall reward kyng answeredthe kynges answer lorde lament euel chaunce toungue tell lay defendor faith assure war betwene emperor pope faith temporall possessios dominios sith bishop clemet take men war doo perso people cannot reskue treasure may help take semeth conuenient offer cardinall thanked kyng kneethe thr g ther vppon cardinall caused gathered together kynges treasure xii score thousande pounde caried ouer sea shal heare cardinal set comissions legate al bishopes commau dyng thei shoulde cause euery parish churche solemne procession made releuyng pope moued people fast iii day weke ew men fasted priestes saied commaundement waspraier fastyng exhorte lay people fast fall selfes lay people saied priestes first fast verie cause fa yng lwas priest none bothe almoste fasted seaso began fame londo kynges cofessor beyng bishop lyncolne called doctor loglad diuerse great clarkes told kyng mariage betwene lady katheryn late wife brother prince arthure good damnable kyng vpo mary dutch alanso sister frech kyng toue caleis sommer viscout rochforth brought picture saied ladi retorne frauce ye cardinal passe th se go frauce fetch rumor sprag much kyng sent sir thomas seimer maior londo straightly charged people sease comunicacion vpo payne kynges high displeasu e whatsoeuer common talked cocluded kyng counsayll cardinall shoulde passe frauce high ambassadour cause persone knew kyng til retorne much preparacion made calleis receauyng ye cardinal como saiyng kyng would coe caleis meet frech kyng cause preparacio made ca al alwaies people comoned thei durst kynges mariage iii day iulythe cardinal rideth rde fraunce cardynall yorke passed thorough citie londo accopaigned many lordes getleme nombre twelue hundreth horse towarde sea side cauntorburie rested people declared destruction rome howe pope captiuitie many cardinalles wherefore caused letany sog moke christes church manera new fonde letany maria pro clemente papa petri os pro clemente papa furth al letany exhorted people fast pray deliuerauce fewdid xi day maye cardinal al traine toke shipping douer day laded caleis wher receiued procession hole garrison towne whe cardinal ladedbarrelles gold set lande xvi barrelles al ful gold kynges money wer deliuered capitain castel charge money people much grudged saied money shalbe spet realme yet englisheme shal haue parte proffit shalbe spet ye cardinalles pleasure frenche kynges pope proffite cardinal sore displeased emperour kepyng pope pryso although wer agaynst wil knowlege imagened al wayes meanes possible hurte dommage themperour therfore set thenglish marchautes willing kepe ye mar e caleis bu thei aswered towne caleis towne warre al marchautes must haue libertie al houres night marte season whiche thei coulde haue caleis also hauen able receiue greate hulkes carikes come martet e marte kept calice marchautes please cardinal brought clothes caleis caused ther frendes andwarpe come caleis say thei bought marchautes clothes ther caleis paied custome caried towne andwarp theglish menes charge ther sold great losse theglishme cardinal lay calleis frenche men daily resorted calleis welcome cardinall sodenly vpon noyse sprang calleis deliuered frenche kyng whiche vayne saiyng made many men muse xxii day iuli cardinall departed oute calleis hym lorde cutberd tustal bishop london lorde sandes chamberlayn kyng earle darby sir henry guildforde sir thomas many knightes squyres numbre xiic horse cariages lxxx wagon lx moyles sumpter horse sandifelde met coutie brian gouernour picardie monsir de bee capitaine bullein iiiic men armes well appareiled banner displaied al well horsed trumpet melodie receiued cardinal marguiso met hym cardinal loraynthe receauing cardinal bole yne vi bishoppes xl gentleme wel furnished copany iiiic horse thei rode furthe bullein burges receiued gate made pageaunte nonne called holy churche thre spaniardes thre almaynes violated cardinall reskued set vp newe agayne nother pageaunte cardinal geuyng paxe kyng england french kyng token peace nother paegant pope liyng vnder emperour sittyng maiestie cardinall pulled downe emperoure set vp pope whe wise men sawe pagiaunt thei smiled saied well frenche kyng flatter harde one cardinall subde hath pulled downe master cardinalles many wordes wer spoke reproue pageaut stil great triuph rode ii cardinalls together abbey vnder canapie boren ouer lodged morow beyng thre twentie day al traine remoued toward muttrel ii mile without towne ther met bailies ther made solempne oracio whe came towne receiued clergie ther englishman strayt lodging nombre greate ye morowe remoued toward abbeuil wher reciued baylife aduocates towne garison men warre towne receiued procession pageauntes praise vnder canapie brought chruch lodging canapies set c thomas cardinal al seruauntes cote third day august citie amia came frenche kyng cote blakce ueluet vpon white satin tied lace agglated golde kyng nauer cardinall burbon greate master duke uandosme monsir de guise monsir uaudemount brother frenche kynges mother many lordes lady solemplie receiued soday iiii daie august cardinal came fro pickqueny toward amia towne lay night way receiued prouost citie many honorable personage citie came iustices aduocates eloquent oracion saluted halfe myle towne frenche kyng hym selfe noble mette louinglie embraced welcommed toke noble england hand brought saied cardinall amia hym deuised many pagiauntes prayse euer called cardinalis pacificu cardinall pacifique writen gate lodging frenche kyng brought cardinal lodging would haue brought kyng courte agayne would nowise suffre left lodgyng night cardinal rode visit frenche kynges mother long communicacion departed lodging v day august cardinal great estate frauce conueighed frenche kynges courte receined frenche kynges garde first chambre receiued knightes getlemen secoud chambre earl baron bishoppes third lady chambre kyng lay bed mother sate hy sore legg cardinal shewed commission large none alone bishop london lorde sandes another commission shewed thei called counsail cardinall highly thanked greate loue bare house fraunce frech lordes fell counsaile first concernyng article peace suerty performaunce day thei sat foure houres euery day cardinall counsaile frenche kynges counsaile tyll xxviii day august day made cathedrall churche amia cardinall englande place north side churche traues directly middes quere curious chappell wroughte carued wood gilt set frenche kyng mother couered crimosyn veluet richely embrodered hanged clothes antike makyng set pearle stone curiously masse song cardinall masse french kyng diuers lordes sworne kepe league great charter sealed high aultare deliuered cardinal kynges awne hand cardinall england gaue theim saied clere remission te deum song thei departed leaue cardinall styll amia counsaill retorne sir fraunces poynes clareceaux tyme arriued spaine towne uale doli e third day iuly thei found doctor le kynges almoner ambassadour kyng englande taried till sixte day iuly sir fraunces poynes brought presece deliuered kyng master letter beside praied maiestie co sider kyng england doen hym sence tendre age holpe time money treasure howe suche tyme lordes spayne would receiue hym kyng duryng mother life yet kynges meane greate labour cost realme receiued also howe kyng england alwaies defended protected contreys flaunders brabant zeland persones quarell themperoure strongly inuaded realme frauce inuasion home themperour obteyned great victorie forein place could haue done al whole realme fraunce ben without enemy home wherefore kyng reason woulde one halfe profite battail pauy also parte required duke orleauce deliuered also paie kyng fourtie thousad pownde ought money lent towardes charge farther shoulde delyuer pope make resonable amendes farther make warre dominionsthe emperours answ r emperor demaunde answerered sir assure loue vncle england toward v manifolde benefites haue receiuid meanes shal neuer forget although oure power able recompence thesame yet good shall neuer fayle endeuer v pleasure concernyng letter oure counsaile shall take aduice trust shall haue reasonable answere time may repose althinges necessarie shalbe commaundement answere sir frauces departed time whe knowen spaine kyng england alied frenche kyng spaniardes spake largeli saied thei cared kyng england saied farther drift cardinall reason hereof englishe marchanntes euil entertained spaine emperoure perceiuing gaue generall commaundement englishman shoulde orderid reputed louing frendes moneth tidynges brought emperour howe inhabitauntes turnei conspired distroy monsire delanoies capitaine deuised bid banket ey hym al loued emperour god would knowlege treason toke chefe capitaynes sharp execucion feare whereof many fled fraunce emperour within day twayne called hym doctor lee syr fraunces poynes kyng englandes ambassador saied lordes haue percei ed kyng master request greate waightie importaunce wherefore wee entend spede write kyng vncle haue receiued answere wee shall delyuer suche thinges demaund praiyng meane season take pacience tyme departed tyme knowen cardinall england frenche kyng ful well knew emperour cardinall woulde doo aide frenche kyng domage hym yet great pencion emperour englishe marchauntes fearing sequele matter co ueighed away goodes daily emperours dominion still englishe ambassadours came emperours courte one day emperour saied lordes marueill kyng myne vncle moued aginst subiectes assure wyl warr hym trust faithful promes accustomed goodnes people take fredes loue freche kyng may vntrue kepeth iust promise neuer compelled make offer offer owne mocion also sworne mainteine whiche refuseth great preiudice hath persuaded v dere vncle england peruers imaginacions whiche trust neuer enemy many tymes emperor would comen englishe ambassador whiche lay spayne must returne cardinal england whiche lay amyas great counsailyng day day fyrst pope deliuered sea rome brought quietnes secondarily bryng emperor reasonable agrement frenche kynges child might deliuered well considered themperor great ordell reason sayd ii hostage fordele might perchaunce stomacke would agre new condicions agrementes answered otherside great armye sent italy whiche might driue emperor power italy armye set pope libertie also driue themperor come purpose el le se realmes naples scycylle duchie myllayn dominion wherfore frenche kyng determined end army royal italy vnder conduict mounsire yt de law rick erle foys whiche appointed afore iune go border italy smal nomber assigned viiim breton notable capitaines thesame coutrey viiim norman like capitaines viiim gascoynes vim burgonions iiim sauosyns viiim swyches almaines vim pycardes whiche men vm horseman vnder conduict mounsire ealyas army went sir robert iernyngham ihon carew hakam lxxx englishe gentleman whiche sent thither cardinal amyas army assembled cardinal deliuered kyng englandes mony brought england barrel haue heardenglish oney deliu red whiche money armye payed two monethes hand remnant deliuered sir robert iernyngha whiche called treasorer warres army iiim cariage men aduenturers iiii thousand ouer mountaines lixm men writer say c thousand armye called latin excercitus angli et gallorum regum pr pontific r mano liberando congregatus say armye kynges england fraunce gathered deliueraunce bishoppe rome armye reputed although fewe people knewe beginnyng englande conueiyng money ouer sea yet englishe coyne common payment armye openly knowen many menne sayd ala muche mony spent realme charge realme shal one peny better kyng hath v loane payde great subsedie grauted make kyng riche money helpe olde enemy pope whiche neuer shall v good people spake muche worse cardinal frenche kyng pope sent bull made uycar general vnder al kyng englandes dominion bull created anthony de prato bishop sen chauncelor frenche kyng cardinal great solempnitie cardinall solace rode frenche kyng compeigne mountdedier euer highly feasted kyng mother chauncellor fraunce nobilitie concluded cardinal freche kynges counsail article offer sent emperor whiche refused open defiaunce made name bothe kynges profters fyrst frenche kyng pay raunsome xxvm crounes whiche amounteth vm pound sterlyng one writer calleth two myllions crounes second release pencion naples al right third neuer clayme title duchie myllain iiii release superioritie flaunders euer right citie turnay v release homage persones within sayd countreys vi withdrawe army italy vii forsake ayde swyches emperor viii take part robert de la marche emperor ix neuer ayde kyng nauerne although maried kynges sister x neuer ayde duke gelder chalenge thesame duchy xi ayde emperor shippes men coronacion xii mary lady elianor quene portyngale sister emperor xiii dolphyn shoud mary sayd quenes daughter xiiii frenche kyng child male sayd quene duchy burgoyne remayne sayd child bryng male xv frenche kyng frende emperor frendes enemy enemyes many article whiche wer openly knowen wer sent bishop tarby vicount thorayn ambassador emperor frenche kyng article wer sent kyng englandes ambassador beyng spayne fyrst moue emperor take reasonable peace frenche kyng also kyng england would release summes money due aswel themperor maximilian graudfather himselfe take frenche kyng detter thesame item emperor would therto agree frenche kyng mary lady mari doughter kyng englad enemy emperor thinges wer concluded cardinal toke leaue frenche kyng mother whiche tolde noble ambassade shortly sent england realme fraunce fortefiyng conclusion sayd cardinall great rewardes returned traine iorneys last day september came rychmond kyng england ascertained kyng doynges could lord comission knew nothyng doynges whiche sore greued stomackes cardinal whiche muche reioysed peace came fyrst day terme starre chamber comaundement wer present lordes spiritual temporal kynges counsail maior alderman citie london iudges lawe iustices peace shyres beyng westminster sayd muche realme england bounde god high peace concluded high peace yea suche peace neuer cocluded betwene realme labor industry haue knit realmes england fraunce suche perfite knot shal neuer fayle thre estate fraunce whiche cal parliament haue affirmed thesame therfore lordes mery kyng shal neuermore charge warres fraunce mayer marchautes shall neuer charged farther expences exaccions warres frauce shall charged kyng shall haue nede league shalbe richest prince world assure shal haue treasure frauce yerely reuenewes customes amount yea counte wardes forfeites suche casualty syth haue suche honorable peace suche profitable peace muche bou hath brought peace peace secula seculorum peace noble sealed seale golde caused present looke seale whiche verye great seale fraunce printed fine gold tale many man laughed thinke cardinall lyed knew sayd owne glory nothyng folowe sayd frenche kyng accordyng appointment sent lorde anna momorancy great master house high constable fraunce bishop bayon chiefe president roan mounsire de hunyers ambassador kyng england accompanyed lx gentleman well appointed whiche xiiii day october laded douer whose seruauntes demeaned selfes passyng kent muche busines lodge lodon cardinal comaunded corporacions citie prouide lodgyng whiche neuer seen wherat people murmured sore saiyng cardinal frenche xx day october sayd ambassador wer met blacke heth marque exeter bishop london uycount rocheford lorde moutioy many men honor gentleman nomber vc horse maior alderman citie lodon chiefe comminers horsebacke gounes mette sayd ambassador george bar made solempne oracion fro thence wer conueyed lodon bishop london palays nere wer well lodged citezens london preseted v fat ox xx shepe xii swannesa present ge n french ambassador xii crane xii fesantz iiii dosyn patriches xx loaues suger comfettes spyce waxe viii hoggesheades wyne many thinges whiche cannot reherse tewsday beyng xxii day septeber sayd ambassador wer conueyed water grenewyche kyng sittyng vnder clothe estate foresayd mounsire bayon president roan made eloquent proposicon whiche muche thaked kyng sendyng high ambassador cardinall man suche prudence wit appeared knittyng league like could none found h mediacion ii prince wer accorded surely neuer wer prince time cofederacion pope cardinal whiche wer captiuitie thraldome power ii prince deliuered emperor power clene banished driuen italy pope restored olde estate dignitie oracion done answere made thesame kyng welcomed al gentleman fraunce thei wyne spyce brought wherof toke part dranke departed barge daily ambassador repaired ye cardinal place wer highly entertained morow symons day ude bishop bayon great nomber ye frenchegentlemen dyned maiors feast taried london til al alonday whiche day kyng accompanied ambassador frauce nobilitie rode cathedral churche paule wher cardinal sang masse masse done people wer desired pray praiers pope clement might soner deliuered captiuitie wa done kyng england sware kepe performe league comon people sayd ede swearyng frenche kyng sworne nobilitie yea good tounes yet brake v againe see auntage loue engendered betwene two prince concluded kyng england elect freche kyng knight noble order garterthe frenche kyng knight garter frenche kyng elect kyng england companion order saint mychel whiche leccions passed party wherfore spede ye kyng sent sir arthur plantagenet uycount lysle bastard sonne kyng edward fourth doctor taylor master rolles sir nycholas carew knight master ye kynges horse sir anthony broune knight sir thomas wryothesley knight bryng garter kyng armes order whole habite coller habilimentes order whiche order receiued sonday x day noueber citie parys rode sayd habit fro house saint poule lady church heard solempne masse dyned robe order hauyng thambassadors englad thesame night made banket next day departed likewyse selfe sonday kyng grenewiche receiued order saint mychel handes great master fraunce mounsire huniers compaignions thesayd orderthe kyng england knight order saint mychel al ware mantel sayd order whiche cloth siluer embrodered frauces knottes kocle shelles collor thesame deuise hauing hangyng brest image saint mychel mantel went doune chapel masse heard masse whiche ong bishop masse returued kinges chamber made great feast diner whiche late thei conueyed tyltyard iustes pleasure xii xii whiche valiauntly furnished course til broken c staues departed night sodainly come kyng brought ambassador newe banket chamber whiche haged costly verdor new ground therof gold flower al sattyn siluer brightsomenes gold flower appeared freshly semed growyng dede cupberdes gold gilte plate eweryes thesame ouer passe haue heard thereof beginnyng yere kyng quene ambassador satte doune supper serued lxxxx dish galleryes chamber full lordes knightes gentleman ga rate aboue full frenche lackays verlettes whiche wer pleteously serued supper done kyng led ambassador great chamber disguisynges banquet house ende thesame chamber fou taine one side hawthorne tree silke white flower side fountaine mulbery tree ful fayre beryes silke toppe hawthorne armes england compassed coller garter mychel toppe moulberie tree stode armes fraunce within garter fountaine white marble grauen chased base thesame balles golde supported rampyng beastes wounde leues golde fyrst worke gargylles golde fiersly faced spoutes runnyng second receit foutaine enuironed wynged serpentes golde whiche gryped second receite fountain somit toppe thesame fayre lady whose brestes ran aboundantly water merueilous dilicious sauer foutaine bench rosemary fret ed braydes layde gold sydes sette rose braunches wer growyng fountaine bench sat viii fayre lady straung attier richely apparelled clothe gold embrodered cut ouer siluer cannot expresse connyng workema ship therof kyng quene set played child latyn tongue maner tragedya play effect wherof pope captiuitie churche brought vnder foote wherfore peter appeared put cardinal authoritie bryng pope libertie set vp churche againe cardinal made intercession kinges england fraunce tooke part together meanes pope deliuered came frenche kynges child complayned cardinal emperor kept hostage would come reasonable point father wherfore desired cardinal helpe deliuerauce whiche wrought kyng master frenche kyng brought emperor peace caused two yong prince deliuered play wisemen smyled thought sounded glorious cardinal true matter dede play done iiii company masker daunsed kyng great master fraunce duke suffolke marque exceter sir edward newel thre apparelled cloth gold purple tynsell sattyn set cutte warkes cloth siluer plyghted goord fret folded eche clothe vpon one plucked vnder another richely also mantel crimosyn sattyn cast bauderike wise garmentes might largely appeare entered noyse mynstrelsie toke lady sat fountaine daused lustely daunsed inough put visers knowen disporte al night passed next day great master company toke leaue kyng except bishop bayon whiche abode ambassador england highly rewardedthe amba dors departed passed douer toke shippe landed bullein frenchman wer departed comons spake sore cardinal sayd frenchemen neuer good england cardinal pleasure forsake olde fredes receiue olde enemy cardinal heard saiynges content wherfore sent comission maior lo comaunde al men talke ye kinges affayres busines ye quene kynges cousail persone spake talked matter taken brought cardinal commaundement knowen euery man mistrusted noman durst breake mynde moneth nouember cardinal legate called whole clergie westminster sayd abusions churche amendedarthur b lne geffery lome garret nothyng therto abiured arthur bylney geffery lome garret spake pope aucthoritie pompe pride reason great raines whiche fell sowyng tyme beginnyng last yere beginnyng yere corne began sore fayle throughout realme insomuche citie londona great derth wheate bread skant people starue dayly bread wheat failed none could gotten money sauyng kyng goodnes sent citie owne prouision vic quarter el weeke litle bread lo yet scarcitie derth wheate xv quarter fro thece rose xx xxvisviiid quarter men sayd negligece sir thomas seymer knight maior many substancial men would haue made prouision house feared left cominaltie would haue taken comissions sent shyres commissioner appointed se wheat realme commissioner ordered wheate conueyed one shyre another whiche comaundement like haue raysed trouble specially citie london wt thesame sore agreued thei arable ground sowe must make prouision money prouision denyed diuers shyres comaundement whereat citezens grudged maior alderman seyng people began murmur came cardinal moued mischiefe like ensue either people must dye famyne el strong hand fetche corne haue answered haue wheat inough frauce frenche kyng sayd cardinal thre bushel corne fraunce england haue twayne muche loueth regardeth realme answere departed euery day loked freche wheate none came farther suche wheat ye marchautes england brought shipped normady place wer restrained relefe failed gentle marchautes styliard brought fro danske breme hamborough place great pletie marchautes flauders holand frisland wheat better chepe lodon england ouer people sayd see serued frenchemen necessitie themperors subiectes holpen v kyndnes comon people loued themperor better subiectes kyng goodnes hearyng ye wheat fraunce stopped mused litle comfort citie lodon lent quarter whiche thaked praied within short space marchauntes london diligently made prouision place wheate rye christmas lacked none party adioynyng wer faine fetche wheate none denied notwithstadyng vnkynd comaundement geuen londoner none haue let v speake army lorde lawtrick italy ye charge kyng england frenche kyng deliuerauce pope clement lorde lawtrick whole army come lyon al thinges necessary wer readines set forward great diligence passed mountaines uenicians army come lobardy abidyng ye comyng frenchemen meane season thei marched toward themperors army whiche lay citie myllain wherof hearing anthony de leua viiic almaines spaniardes foote many italyans marched forward mete wt force caused take toune meligna refuge wher hearyng ihon de medices great nomber wer comyng toward uenicians euenyng enemy aware sodainly set sayd ihon de medyces whiche began set men order enclosed could nothyng tooke horse fled le company alone whiche slaine almoste lost iiii great piece ordinaunce whiche anthony de leua car ed myllam whiche season lorde lawtrick army pa ed mountaines come citie er abidyng swyches heard tell lewe erle lodron great crew almaines come toune boskenye alexadry money vitail ayde almaines kept alexandrye wherfore sent horseman stoppe passe alexandry folowed whole army beseged boske whiche certain day defended last yelded toune became souldiers lorde lawtrick season andrewe dorye admyral frenche nauy lay hauen gene kept genowayes al marchaundise vitailes whiche citie might repaire especial letted certain shippes corne whiche lay pont de ferry betwene gene sauona come gene genowayes whiche lacked corne land side besieged citezen owne whiche frenche part called cesar fulgosus imagined bryng shippes corne citie sawe andrewe dorye xvii galyes prepared vi galeyes fight wt andrew dorye duryng fight shippes corne shuld entre hauen galeys wer abrode sodain tempest rose suche violence andrew dory tayne take ye port saunona succor shippes corne came safe hauen geane galeys safetie good fortune geane tyme citezens geane thus vitailed tooke good courage warlike maner issued agaist cesar fulgosus whiche knew well thei litle iiic spaniardes could skyll warre remnant neither stomacke experience warre wherfore boldly set whyle thei wer fightyng without citezens within whiche euer mutable sodainly cried fraunce fraunce whiche lamour came eares adurnus whiche imperial wherfore retired backe citie appeace rumor enemy folowed suche hast entred together geane become frenche thither came lorde lawtrick put capitaine retinue safe kepyng citie adurnus duke geane whiche castle diuers emperor frendes lacked vitail saw comfort reskue yelded castle vpon condicion depart bagge baggage meane season certain frenchman whiche wer lefte boske defaced toune came alexandrie kept siege volant ayde succor come toune till whole army wer assembled besiege ye toune al purpose dounes alexandrie albericke barbian vc souldiers came toune whiche muche comforted garrison whiche maner dismaied ayde boske fayled frenchman besieged toune bet ordinaunce within manfully defended made new countermures enemy could enter without ieopardy last uenicians brought thither great piece ordinauce sore bet walles baptist lodryn capitain saw able defende deliuered toune vpo coposicion depart bagge baggage weare harnys freche kyng confederate space vi monethes lorde lawtrick deliuered toune frauces sforcia according league frauces put co uenient garriso thece army remoued belgrasse yelded also deliuered ye duke myllain fro thece remoued toward citie myllain wherof hering anthony de leua fortefied myllayn sent lewes barbyan defende citie pauye lord lawtrick wt viii myle myllayn sodainly returned toward pauy whiche men iudged done displeasure done frenchemen kyng taken xix day september besieged pauye daily betwene wer great skirmish last bet walles great ordinaunce made toune assautable frenchman threwe dyches fagottes emptye pypes shortly entered toune capitain per eiuyng toune entered opened gate yelded himselfe prisoner frenchman lewe kylled euery side robbed spoyled house church spared person place crueltie rausomed one man v vi tymes gascoynes whiche moste cruel set fyer fayre house brent whole citie lorde lawtrick vii dayes spoilyng commaunded case pauye thus taken spoyled lorde lawtrick determined cardinal innocent legate bonony whiche come deliueraunce pope incotinent pa e rome driue away al emperor power fro thence restore pope libertie f aunces sforcia duke myllayn hearyng determinacion came lorde lawtri k pauye required first rid duchy myllayn themperors souldiers rather go forward leaue enemy behynd lorde lawtrick answered thesame opinion comission frenche kyng kyng england spede go forward deliuer bishop rome whiche done faythfully promised would returne expulse emperor power lombaroy meane season would duke uenicians besiege anthony de leua castle myllayn duke fraunces semed content answere yet perceiued frenche kyng cared restoryng lest emperial tyme duke dissembled matter tooke possession citie pauye lorde lowtrick layen xvi dayes pauy dismyssed swyches whiche wise would go rome wherfore marched forward wt owne army came plesance cocluded league alphons duke farrer frederike marque mantua knew wel might wel passe saftie good order battail marched toward rome finishyng enterprise passed lobardy themperor sent letter b rome excused self neither willed commaunded suche mischief done straightly comaunded capitaines deliuer prince orenge capitaines themperors hearing comaudemet toke agremet wt pope cardinal xii cardinal wer boud performe certen article ye nober xi deliuered castle sainct angell x day december conueyed oruyetclementpope deliuered paied certaine money souldiars wage put full libertie emperor people departed thence remoued ancona tidynges brought england deliueraunce cardinal great hast caused te deum song newyeres day kinges chapel declared opely escaped sayd deliuered made many men muse sonday v day ianuary cardinal great triumph came churche saint paule london attended diuers prelate clergy te deum song doctor capon opely declared bishop clement long kept distres faulte tyranes infidel kept prisoner behofe charles emperor tyll late praiers good christen people escaped hades enemy whiche cause wylled men geue thankes god night great fyers made kynges court london shortly trueth knowen pope deliuered composicion frely escaped cardinall blowen abrode men sayd could leaue liyng whyle lorde lawtrick cotinually goyng forwarde deliuer poeple clement credibly enformed bonnony deliuered h libertie wherfore thought iorney voyde go rome nothing therfore determined turne toward naples take citie wer fortefied replenished men warre accordyng purpose iornied forward great diligence emperor capitaines perceiuyng frenchemennes entent caused souldiers depart rome beginnyng february whiche minde souldiers came realme naples fortefied certain tounes passed came toune called troy taried remouyng fitable taried rome thei set italyans one side frenchman otherside euery mannes iudgement haue taken slaine lorde lawtrick departed bonnony inmole fayance forlicke pezere senegal ancone rauenna loret ferne whiche foote mountaines sybylles duchie bresse percell realme naples whiche toune wer certain noble coutrey whiche seyng army puissant departed thence naples armye passed mountaines lent season died colde vc gascoynes mo muche paine came nere troy puylle xv day marche spaniardes emperor armye lay sir robert iernyngha england whiche capitain light horseman knowyng enemy nere desired lorde lawtrick company might assay spaniardes lorde lawtreck whether lacke corage corrupted money wise would suffe sir robert iernyngham fight saied would take theim auantage shortly whiche answere sore greued sir robert somuche saied would accuse hym kynges master spaniardes whiche laie troy thought entre naples frenchemen xxi daie marche beeyng saterdaie thei remoued came naples fortified citee whiche happie emperor surely frenchman come first thei master citee emperor people wer departed troy haue hard frenchemen besieged within xi day yelded thece thei remoued melphe strong litle toune thei ewe put flight iiiim spaniardes thei lost many men ther toune theim profitable sith armie entered realme naples euer sickenes emongest especiall raygned emongest sore hore feuer whiche many gentleman died thei came naples toune uerse died sir richarde iernyngham ihon carew hackam twoo valiant capitaines sent thether kyng englande diuerse whiche twoo gentleman buried frenchemen taken melphe thei remoued boniuet thence magdelon thei laye al easter easter thei came citee naples firste thei tooke palace standeth without citee pleasant beholde taken thei planted siege round aboute citee cast trench made fortificacios defence sodain inuasions enemy whole armie laye open plaine ground without couerture nere citee reason whereof thei wer sore cubered hete drougth whereupon ensued greate mortalitie death thei lien hill side nere couerte thei lien wholesomly intent lye nere word intent kepe enemy straight therfore thei planted word playne whiche turned muche displeasure disease thus siege pla ted naples beginnyng aprill continued till xxvi daie august nexte insuyng meane mortalitie thei remoued shall lord lawtreck thus passing toward naples sir fra ce poynes knight whiche sent clarenseaux kyng armes spain emperor returned england christmas thende december left clarenseaux behynde bryng farther answere fro themperor thynges demaunded wherof said would take longer auice would answere sir france reported emperor muche fauored estemed kyng englande onely request contemplacion released discharged twelue article whiche wer moste greuous disprofitable freche kyng frenche kynges sake intercessio kyng englande yet notwithstandyng cardinall muegled kyng highly fauored frenche kyng cause tooke reputed awne might bryng frenche kynges purpose aboute emperor time written frenche kyng also aduertised thereof frenche ambassador laye spaine would frenche kyng sende hym diffinitiue answere would withdrawe people italy lett duchie millain alone cease inuasions answere bee geuen last daie ianuary folowyng said frenche kyng answered day lacke answer taken defiaunce french ambassador daie shewed emperour proffe whiche frenche kyng offered hym article haue harde conclusion taken amia frenche kyng cardinall august laste passedthemperors answer foresaied article whiche profers emperoure hard seen saied ambassadours thought surely cosin frenche kyng full conclusion league appoyntmet agreed toune madrill sued deliueraunce v counsaill offered v certain profers whiche wee neuer demaunded pitie hauyng compassion affliccion accepted thesaied offer agreed deliueraunce whiche article promised othe kyng also holy euangelistes performe vttermoste inuiolatly obserue kepe whervpon wee clerely remitted deliuered hym countrey whiche promise hath performed none wherfore take hym periured worthy trusted nowe offereth newe offer whiche cannot performe money beleue able pay money dewe kyngdom naples knowe suche dutie inheritaunce although kyng charles seuenth sotletie vsurped thesame log enioied release title millain release voyde duchie imperiall gifte many seigniory bee touchyng tournay right possession thynges would release rendre thynges hath withdrawyng armie italy shall nede wee truste armie shall expell theim italy maugre harte touchyng kyng nauarr duke gelder robert de la marche pitie let alone till se tyme thei shall knowe puyssaunce touchyng offre aide v nauie trust haue suche nauie prouided shall nede none saith mary sister quene aelienor daughter portyngall true might haue dooen nowe wee entende geue enemie touchyng daughter bee maried dolphyn wee leaue suspence tyme saieth defend v toucheth honour well knoweth awne might puyssaunce hath euer defended v power hath defaced vanquished wherefore nede defence whiche able defende hymself touchyng kyng englandes debt shall reasonably answere ambassadours toucheth frenche kyng lordes ambassadours saied emperor let frenche kyng master fulfill promise sworne true prince ought shall haue child deliuered el accordyng othe let hym yelde hymself prisoner shal honor truthe saued el answere ambassador departed neuerthelesse thei daily sued emperour counsaill take offer whiche profered frenche kyng emongest thynges warre sore laied fre che ambassadours charge frenche kyng made warre emperours possession without cause without defiaunce whiche accusement thei answered armie procured cardinal englande amia deliuery clement bishoppe rome kyng england bare moste charge emperour hard answere sent ambassadoure englande hym saied lorde ambassadoure muche maruaill kyng master hath great loue frenche kyng newe reconsiled frende withdrawen loue fro cosyn alye fortuneth olde auncient enemy bee fauoure olde frendes cast fauoure se well indignacio estate way sought greue v whiche wee hope withstande would haue thought uncle englande would haue made warre v would haue v graunt requestes desire frenche kyng seyng sheweth open enemy ambassadoure discretly answered neither heard knewe suche dooynges faithe honoure well saied emperoure bee true reported myne uncle prince haue taken hym bee myne enemie muste withstande hym greate fury emperoure withdrewe hym ambassadoure priuie chamber daily ambassadours bothe englande fraunce sollicited themperor counsaill accept frenche kynges offer whiche made euer answere thei would truste newe promise seyng olde promise whiche sworne obserued kepte nowe whosoeuer indifferently shall consider article whiche offered treatie madrill article offered amia shall openly perceiue greatest thyng whiche freche kyng refused deliuery duchie burgoyn countie charoloys declaracion whereof frenche kyng sent noble bothe countreys declared theim promise concord taken emperor whiche answered realme dominion could transferred forrein prince person without sentence agrement submission noble common thesame countrey therefore thei would neuer assent alteracio answere deliuered lorde charles de la noa uiceroy naples ambassador emperor fraunce whiche thereof certified emperours counsaill emperoure counsaill thought bee deceipte somuche frenche kyng onely called suche burgoyne hym pleased substanciall countrey farther emperor muche desired duchie burgoyne heire bloude discended duke phillip soonne kyng ihon fraunce meanes would haue article broken would haue duchie frenche kyng perceiued mynd offered hym greate somme money redemyng article kyng englad also offered suretie paiment could moue emperoure would haue burgoyne thesaied treatie agrement performed kyng englande consideryng muche doen emperor callyng remembraunce bothe lordes common spaine would haue taken hym kyng mother liuyng although lunatike heire without greate labour intercession also holpe hym elected emperour whiche frenche kyng obteigned putte thereunto aide sent docter richard pace secretory elector franckeford moste tymes succoured thesaied emperoure money paied wherefore alitle displeased emperours wilfulnes vnkyndnes perceiued clerely sithe meanes exalted forgotte kyndnes hym shewed wherefore thought make hym knowe hymself warres soner bryng hym accomplishe request make hym reme ber olde kyndnes auise cardinal yorke whiche loued emperour bishoppe rome case counsaill sent woorde clarenseaux kyng armes make defiaunce emperourdef aunces made emperour guyan herault french kyng thesaid clarenseaux kyng englande xiiii daie ianuary citee burgues castle came emperour beyng nobly accompaignied duke marque erles baron greate hall made defiaunce defiaunces made bothe kynges armes haue heard noble whiche present constable castell duke massedonia duke inuancaso duke alberkirke duke ciuill duke nassaw nazareth duke aluoy marque sturgus marque agular marque uillafranca erle barcelon erle salamatero erle boniu nt erle arowen erle agulard erle salienas erle geneuer sixe great lordes commendatories crossed many noble menne gentleman truthe nomber seuen hundred least drewe swerdes sware defiaunces made reuenged saied emperoure sir dispite defiaunce vnreuenged infamy rebuke thereof shall remain v heires euer wherefore landes life lordshippes shalbe commaundement lyen succession remain ignominie shalbe euer newe dye till haue obteigned double honor enemy emperor thus defied warre proclaimed ciuill ualedolite burgus place spain commen people heard defiaunce thei wrong themselfes berdes sware landes goodes spent honor emperor bee reuenged frenche kyng thei called periured prince common people cried stretes come tyme spain shalbe renoumed reuenged frenchman falsenes wrong doynges ala saied thei wee make warre englishe nacion whiche euer loued v neuer offended v defiance procedeth onely frenche kyng cardinall englande whiche sworne frenche thus spanyardes talked euer excused kyng englande accused cardinall saied greate pencion spain notwithstandyng might haue bishoprike toledo caused warre proclamacion warre proclamed baners displaied whiche painted redde swerde cresset burnyng frenche kyng parte taker meanyng kyng englande expresse name rehersed proclamacion kyng englande manace defied emperourthe englishe merchantes arrested spain frenche kynges querell wer englishe merchantes spain attached goodes put safe custody saied thei staied onely till emperour aduertised subiectes wer ordered englande tidynges first knowen fraunce thence letter sent frenche ambassadours london bothe ambassador fraunce englande beyng spain guien cl renseaux officer armes wer retained emperor prisoner whiche report false thei libertie well cherished especiall englishe ambassador clareseaux wer frendly enterteined place cardinall hard report light credence whiche forthought afterward sore therewith moued fury xii daie february caused hugo de medosa emperor ambassador taken house sainct swithines lane london bee brought sir ihon daunces place marke lane prisoner house goodes wer kept cardinalles seruauntes til kynges plesure wer farther knowen morowe beyng xiii daie february cardinal beyng starre chamber called hym al iustices peacethe cardinalles saiyng starre chamber honest personage greate nomber said lordes kynges louyng subiectes grace pleasure declare howe highnes awne sekyng rather intent entered warre electe emperor charles fifth hath hym handeled moued must necessitie hym make war first vnknowen good kyng hath hym fithe infancie hath defended lowe countreis duryng noneage ye pain king toke ambassador sollicite lordes spain whiche refused take kyng mother liued kynges onely labor came kyngdom spain cost kyng helpe emperor counsailers tell kyng surely frech kyng emperor beside kyndnesses hath lent thesaid emperor diuerse greate somme money defend countreys profite countreis haue resort englishemen thether ye merchauntes tell thynges many mo proffites commodity gratuity kyng hym litle regarded halfe ashamed report true france frenche kyng hym prisoner whiche chaunce hath happened many high prince kyng master highly regardyng peace christen prince whiche peace god might glorified disired emperour take resonable nde deliueraunce purpose hath sent sondery ambassador whiche gaue ea e dalied nothyng would doo regarded requestes would desire seruaunt perauenture muche gratuity frendshippes hym kyng souereigne lorde tymes shewed sheweth ingrate vngentle kyndnes rendere h vnkyndnes frenche kyng assure hath hubled hymself asmuche prince maie honor saued hath offered hym greate offer excepte geue realme croune offer larger whiche offer sure sore minishe beautie croune whiche shall breuely declare vnto offereth paie fiue hundred thousande poundes sterlyng whereof three hundred thousande bee paied hand remnaunt sufficient banker bound farther discharge emperoure suche somme money oweth kyng englande deliuer hym sufficient acquitaunce thesame also frenche kyng haue kyngdome naples hundred thousande crounes yerely frenche kyng release thesame pencion arrerages whiche small also release whole title right whiche hath duchie millayne enheritaunce neuer chalenge claime thesame posteritie also countie flaunders maie lawfully appeale parliamentes fraunce iudgementes geuen emperour iustices content release thesame superioritie resorte whiche greate minishement prerogatiue royall realme fraunce whiche saied cardinall would concent kyng release seignioritie superioritie wale irelande cornewall dare saie would rather spende liues goodes farther frenche kyng bought kyng citee tournay sixe hundred thousande crounes odde yet content yelde release thesame citee emperoure euer yea beside offereth take wife elianor quene dowager portyngall without dower yea kirtell endowe tenne thousande markes sterlyng yere farther child bee male whiche shalbee gotten theim twoo shalbee duke burgoyne bee partetaker honour fraunce whiche greate thyng also dolphyn sonne heire shall mary daughter thesaied lady elianor without threasure bee receiued thesame whiche proffer worthe twoo hundred thousande markes sterlyng farther woll lende emperour shippes mariner conueigh hym rome also defende hym menne yea woll doo although kyng nauerr haue maried awne sister whose kyngdome emperour kepeth force yet offereth neither ayde comforte hym emperoure querel hym also offereth forsake old approued frendes sir robert de la marche duke gelders whiche faithfully hath serued realme fraunce al emperours sake emperoure saied indurate vnkynde wilfull neither regardes reasonable requestes yet kynges praiers requestes answered saied frenche kyng dooe shall haue child emperoure woll truste manne euery manne muste truste hym yet frenche kyng offereth farther withdrawe puyssaunt armye lorde lawtrecke italy yet thesame passeth prosperiously forwarde like doo emperour disauauntage reherse emperour proude people cruell nothyng regardeth offer crueltie pull doune goddes uicar rome persecute holy athers extreme tyranny violated holy sacrament threwe hostes doune aultar like robber toke pixe farther churche thei violated uirgins stupred matrones dispoyled holy reliques citee rome like kyng huntyng tyme hath iiic dere garbage paunch bee cast round euery quarter parke saied cardinal euery strete laye full priuie member genitures cardinalles holy prelate whole history abhominable tell yet notwithstadyng offer mocioned nothyng regardyng detestable tyranny whiche euery good christen man abhorreth encline reason sure could shewe xx article promise whiche hath broken kyng assure kepeth promise souereigne lorde also contra ius gencium whiche sure greate turke would dooe kepeth prisoner kynges ambassador docter lee frenche ambassador ambassadour uenice asmuche emperor refuseth offer whiche amount eight kynges raunsomes trust warre shall bridle hym bryng hym peace occasio warre would declare countrey cardinall saiedthe murmor f people knocked elbow said softly lieth said euil wil said neuer wel said frenche crounes made hym speake euill themperor thei knewe haue hard saied shame hym lie suche audience common people muche lamented war arise betwene kyng themperor especiall consideracion emperor dominion holpen corne releued grain whe thei could haue corne litle fraunce rumor wer diuerse ship come flau ders party laden heryng sturgion victale necessary beside eight faire shippes whiche wer laden corne saied shippesshippes arrested shippes spain wer staied arested ailes taken put safe custodie doyng muche talked merchantes whiche frequented emperor dominion thei knewe openly saied let entercourse merchantes turne greate losse prince yet englishemen content obeye kyng counsaill declaracion warre englande emperoure restraint shippes emperoures subiectes shortly knowen lady margaret daughter sauoy aunte emperour whiche gouernor flaunders brabant zeland lowe countreis wherefore auice emperoures counsaill associate caused englishemen goodes shippes bee restrained thei goodes put safe kepyng thus poore merchantes suffered greate losse doynges prince horace saieth qui quid delirant reges plectuntur achini whatsoeuer kynges common punished sodain storme whiche cardinall moued openly emperour euill entreatyng kynges ambassadour perfect knowlege emperor bothe kynges ambassador greate honour also neuer restrained hym libertie wherupon caused emperor ambassador whiche restrained libertie sent awne lodgyng saied reporte made frenche ambassadours hym restraygned sithe knewe truthe mocioned kyng deliueraunce emperours ambassadour called hugo de mendosa dissimuled matter apparant signes cardinall auoyde suspicion behalfe towarde worlde saied kyng enformed frenche ambassadours ambassadours bothe prince put prison farther saied clarenseaux made defiaunce emperoure without kynges commaundement onely mocion frenche ambassadours accompaignie frenche herault presumpteous act suffre death calice returne excuse cardinal shewed emperor ambassador whiche certified emperour euery poynt sent letter poste spain whiche letter opened copied capitain bayon poste passed waie clarenseaux returned homewarde spain capitain gently shewed hym copie letter emperours ambassadoure writtenclareseau made ear thynke clarenseaux dismaied day shorte yet trustyng truth grace prince passed forward came bullein hard worde danger wherefore like wise man lefte calice tooke ship bullein landed rye came secretly hampton court kyng la e frendeship sir nicholas carew one kynges priuie chamber brought kynges presece cardinall wist returne hym shewed three letter whiche cardinall sent hym chargyng hym make defiaunce intimate warre declared farther neither ambassadours kyng frenche kyng wer neuer sequestered libertie gently entertained kyng shewed chayne value seuen hundred ducat whiche emperoure geuen hym shewed also copie emperoures ambassadoures letter whiche bayonthe wi e saiyng kyng kyng heard circumstaunce declaracion mused greate saied lorde iesu trusted moste tolde thynges contrary well clarenseaux wil bee light credence hereafter nowe see perfectly made beleue thyng neuer doen kyng sent cardinall priuily talked hym whatsoeuer saied hym cardinall mery tyme kyng mistrusted hym euer kyng counsaill well digested emperoures answere gentle demeanor toward kinges ambassador also pondered lowe countreis emperor wer glad please kyng englande subiectes wherefore kyng commaunded sir ihon stile knight discharge duchemen shippes deliuered sailes gaue license returne naye said duchemen spanyardes emperours subiectes thei also discharged sir ihon stile answered commission onely discharge duchemen fearyng frenchemen would take sea stop departed hastely curssyng cardinal aucthor war lady margaret heard tell howe duche nacion shippes goodes released spanyardes sent englishe merchauntes theim saied sir sithe kyng master hath deliuered onely duche menne spanyardes relese body fr e go libertie goodes shall remain till knowe shal become spanyardes thei bee deliuered come goodes shall haue theim deliuered thus englishemen departed came kyng declared hym counsaill thei entreated warr emperor displeasant bothe merchantes clothierscoplaynte h clothi r merchauntes durste auenture spaine sithe aprill last past come xi daie march wherfore brode clothes kerseis cotton laye handes somuche clothier essex kent wilshire suffolk shire whiche vse clothmakyng brought clothes blackewell hall lo sold thei wer wont fewe merchantes none bought cloth clothier lacked sale thei put fro theim spinner carders tucker suche liue clothworkyng whiche caused people greatly murmor specially suffolke duke norffolk wisely appeased theim doubt thei fallen riotous act kynges counsail aduertised inconuenience cardinall sent greate nomber merchantes london saied sir kyng informed vse selfes like merchates like grasiers artificer clothier daily bryng clothes market ease greate cost ready sell wilfulnes wil bye haue accustomed maner men saied cardinall tell kyng straightly commaundeth bye clothes tyme haue accustomed vpon pain high displeasure merchantes answered lorde knowe well haue trade outward twelue monethes past haue many clothes handes knowe vtter therefore greate losse v bye wherefore trust moue v bye thyng whiche wee cannot vtter place vent stopped forbidden well saied cardinall wil bye clothes blackewell hall thei shall bee brought white hall westminster london shall lose libertie kyng shall bye sell merchant stranger answered wise merchant lorde kyng maie bye theim aswell blackewell hall please hym stranger gladlyer receiue theim westminster shall ordre matter saied cardinall first sende london knowe clothes haue handes doen kyng counsail shall appoynt shall bye clothes warrant answere londoner departed clothier hard cardinall toke part thei wared proude spake euill merchantes mercha te came bye clothes clothier set hire thei accustomed solde length thei fain bothe abate price also seke merchant men cardinalles saiyng warre displeasaunt many englande haue hard surely asmuche displeasant tounes people flaunders brabant hollande zelande especiall tounes andwarpe barrow martes wer kept resorte englishemen thei saied martes vndoen englishemen came marte shippes hoyes waggon might rest artificer hostes broker might slepe people fal miserie pouerite thynges daily complaintes made lady margaret emperor counsaill whiche wisely pondered complaintes long consultacion thei appoynted certain ambassador go kyng englande entreate truce abstinence warre whiche ambassador came englad associated themselfes hugo de mendosa ambassadoure emperor one ambassador prouost cassell master ihon lay souereigne flaunders iii ambassador came kyng xxix daie marche richemond reuerence doenthe saiyng hugo mendos lorde hugo de medosa said kyng sir themperours maiestie muche knowlegeth hymself bound grace manifolde kynde actes beneuolences doen shewed hym sith tendre age wise woll take defiaunce dooen herault paremptory intimacion warre till heard farther pleasure therefore counsaill hath sent hether twoo noble persones knowe determinate answere finall resolucion behalfe kyngthe kynges swere good auisement answered saied warre nothyng ioyfull warre lesse fearefull thanke god haue cause care warre haue bothe men money thyng ready prepared thesame whiche thynges knowe prince lacke high woordes therefore question warre could sone agre make determinate answere part mynd declare tell although master greate emperor mightie prince cannot maie suffre hym bere doune destroye realme fraunce whiche true inheritance whiche brother alie frenche kyng paieth v yerely greate pencion tribute wherfore iustice equitie muste maintein lande whiche haue faire rent suche profite saied prouost cassell yea sir please call remembraunce olde auncient loue familiaritie whiche hath betwene realme house burgoyne flaunders lowe countreys assure people coutreis liue dye aboue men next souereigne lorde wherefore moste noble prince neuer concent olde loue hath long continued broken seperated saie feare well furnished war bothe men strong castle whiche tyme hath comaundement therfore loue haue euer borne continue offer nowe continue offre choyse war peace pleasure surely emperour meaneth honor though commaunde whiche would chose warre haue commission entreate peace chose peace haue like commission thanke offre v comaundement saied lorde hugo de mendosa kyngthe saiyng hugo de mendosa sir right emperor countreys ought haue loue fauor frenche kyng nacion frenchman tyme affliccion made humble sutes requestes grace whiche thei neuer would tyme prosperitie emperoure hath euer continued one man tymes wherefore better bee trusted thei whiche neuer wer long true wel said kyng sithe haue well perceiued intent commyng woll auised make auised answere meane season content abstinence warre tyme ambassadours departed season prouost casselles departed lady margaret answere kyng wise well learned farre castyng prince consulted counsaill matter long debatyng considered kyng riche strong puyssant inough make warre prince christen prince could hurte hym warre inuasion therefore thought best haue warre kyng wiser sort cosidered warre emperor marchauntes lese muche thei lost clothyers clothworkers whiche great multitude lese brought extreme pouertie considered emperor lorde spaine naples sardinia southward epuskaia likewise northest ward grauelyn rye reuell englishe marchauntes passyng costes euer dauger also alame could come england dominion reason wherof cloth making decay wherfore kyng considered marchauntes lost porer sorte lese length lese customes wherfore leauyng glorye warre tooke mercye subiectes concluded take peace tyme till farther comunicacion might betwene cousail emperor vpo point letter wer sent spayne fraunce flaunders matter continued vndertermined till answer brought outward partes season bishop bayon whiche afterward bishop cardinal parys beyng ambassador frenchekyng soiornyng lodonthe su te frenche bassadors hard tell empe or ambassador made muche su te kyng counsail came ye court desired speake kyng brought kynges presence sayd pleaseth highnes consider great high peace cocluded betwene louyng brother perpetual alye frenche kyng master whiche ratified confirmed thre estate realme fraunce ye whiche haue yerely xxm pound sterlyng whiche realme haue promised defende persones shewyng loue beare frenche kyng subiectes would make sharpe warre emperor subiectes assure whole realme fraunce would take thankefully neuer forgottenthe kynges answer well sayd kyng touchyng league amitie betwene brother frauce shalbe inuiolately kept sir enter warre nedeth counsail end warre honor pro ite men must nedes study touchyng defence realme frauce assure shalbe defended power though losse studye lesse haue peace whiche might honorable master myne owne self whiche saiyng ambassador held well contented may perceiue great pencion profite king england fraunce great league amitie concluded sworne cause kyng england muche helde frenche kyng mere loue matter daily great counsailes one day themperors ambassador present another day frenche kynges ambassador present cardinal euer frenche part thus continued daily counsel great study season frenche crayer xxx tonne manned xxxviii frenchemen laye margate wayte pray flemyng come ryuer thames chaunce crayer armew whiche appointed waft fisher botes betwene grauelyn ost end come north goodwyn sade hsand head came grauesend toke bread crayer xxviii tonne xxiiii flemynges vitayled made sea warde sodainly espyed frenchemen whiche houed vnder saile flemynges mistrusted incontinent put selfes readynes came nye hayled frencheman frenchman shot piece ordinaunce layde flemyng aborde sore fightyng frenchman crosoowes flemynges handgunnes frencheman fell would haue gone seyng flemyng whysteled frencheman made sayle wynde straynable est frencheman could sayle whither thames fleuiyng folowed grauesend flemyng borded frencheman fought away againe went frenchman flemyng wt sayles farre sayled frencheman rane long tower wharffe though would haue reuen shippe flemyng set entered shippe thyng frencheman could cryed haue take thefe ship hased tower wharfe sir edmond walsynghga leuetenaunt tower wharffe saw fight called men entered shippes toke capitaines men flemyng boldly chalenged prise sayd open warre betwene fraunce flaunders sayd farther frencheman pirate kynges counsail tooke vp matter made ende betwene chaunce muche talked two shippes sayle chase margate tower wharffe ye tyme suche like thyng neuer hard let v returne lorde lawtrick whiche gotten many tounes italy great army besieged citie naples happened prince orenge capitaines xix day april set great part frenche armye notwithstandyng hardynes emperor army obteined victorie tyme forth frenchemen lost pestilence whiche great italy sodain skyrmishes yere xxii day february kyng created wynsor sir pierce buelar ireland erle osserey xx yere kyng kept day sainct george companion order garter great solempnitie manor rychemond came tidynges army lorde lawtrick italy whiche letter shewed lorde lawtrick sent lorde peter de nauarro third day marche last past great toune called melffe xm frenchemen within toune viiic spaniardes good men warre lorde peter de nauarro besieged toune gaue great assaut spaniardes defended ordinaunce resistences slew v vim frenchemen caused retrete lorde lautrick hearyng came persone great nomber toune smel merueilously toune ordinaunce gaue great fierse assaut sore spaniardes put backe yet defended meruail beholde slewe destroyed iiii frenchemen frenche armye entered toune side yet spanyardes kept market ordinauce long might last beyng oppressed multitude slaine without mercy cruel frenchemen toune taken prince melff noble man perteinyng emperor thus toune melffe taken spoyled greatly frenchemennes profite lost almost xm menne whiche sore diminished power although season abstinence war taken betwene kyng england ladye margarete dutche nacion might safely come go england englishman might safely epaire thither yet betwene frenchemen flemynges hot warre frontier many prisoner taken many men slain likewise one part toke sea someti frenchemen would spoyle englishe shippes saiyng ha flemynges goodes spaniardes goodes likewise flemynges would enter englishe shippes say frenchemens goodes englishman lost till kyng sent shippes kepe sea trueth spanyardes strong sea frenchemen muche harme kyng perceiuyng nothyng cocluded betwene themperor thought behynd hand wherfore ordained lord sade passe guisnes souldiers vc archer vc horsmen duke suffolke passe ouer great army inuade flaunders lordes made muche preparacion mustered men mantel beside saint ihones redy depart emperor ambassador thambassador flaunders muche kyng cousail frenche kyng also asseted truce taken betwene england flaunders countreys pycardy side water viii monethes peace begyn first day may endure ye last day february peace pro laymed lodon xix day iune englishman might lawfully passe low countreys spayn whiche sore greued mare auntes haunted party ye proclamacion farther conteined final peace wer fully agreed betwene sayd iii prince within ye sayd viii monethes ch ute haue two monethes passe owne countreys ware marchaunoises safetie emperor sone enclyned peace saw marte many frendes high dutcheland place ke great profite especially owne low coutreys wherfore thought hurt frendes displeasure bare enemyes fraunce also shewe himselfe ouyng kyng england content take peace season duke charles g lders perceiuyng emperor warre fraunce raised great power horsmen came great toune holland called hage lawe iustice kept countrey reason wherof toune riche sodainly entred toune without resistence spoiled robbed toune slew diuers persones muche rich laded wagon departed caryed diuers riche prisoner lady margarete gouernesse low countreys hearyng raised great power vnder conduict lord isylsteinge whiche lorde great puis aunce entered gelderland gat toune hatton castle howryng forraied destroied coutrey la ly whitsonday beyng last day maye gelders gaue battel lord isylsteinge fought valiauntly men could yet fortune warre ouercome fled wer chased great way many slaine chaunce treatie peace england ende may began citie london sickenes called sweatyng sickenesthe swea yng sicknes afterward went realme almost whiche many dyed within v vi houres reason sicknes terme adiorned circuites assi e also kyng sore troubled plage diuers dyed court one sir fraunces poynes whiche ambassador spayne kyng space remoued almost euery day till la came tytynhangar place abbot saint albones wt fewe determined byde chaunce god would send whiche place purged daily fyers preseruatiues neither quene none company enfected disease suche pleasure god great plage dyed sir wyllyam compton knight wyllyam cary esquier whiche wer kynges priuy chamber kyng highly fauored many worshipful men woman england reason plague watch whiche wont kept yerely lodon saint ihons euen mydsommer saint peter eue kyng counsail commaunded left yere wherfore armorer made great suite kyng declared great hynderaunce whiche muche considered mischief might haue ensued great nomber haue assembled together hote tyme plage sw atyng raynyng let v leaue england sommer season troubled vexed sweatyng sicknes let v returne affayres italy emperor knew lord lawtrick italy wt great army thought profite leaue army vnsuccored wherfore sent ye lorde henry younger duke bruswyke great copany almaynes fote horsebacke wherfore uenicians set fraunces duke orbyne kepe straytes stoppe passage heard puissaunce duke bruswycke great municions prouisions warre almaynes brought turned iorney aduise uenicians determined fortifie tounes defende almaynes duke bruswyke armye passed mountaines entered italy burnyng rasyng raunsomyng tounes passed euer marched toward myllain wherof hearyng mylleners whiche brought extreme pouertie warres beganne lament waile great tyranny iudged folowe whiche folowed dede almaines came myllain demaunded money citezens nothyng paye tyed chaynes kept miserably prison tyll made prouision payment whiche caused citezens flee citie leaue maner desolate whiche thyng anthony de leua perceiuyng moued great compassion desolacion citie called citezens together promised theim would paye wage souldiers xx dayes onely would cause whole army remoue citie poore citezens made shyft payed souldiers al departed fro myllayne came citie pauye tooke litle labor tooke diuers tounes anthony de leua knewe well duke brunswycke would spryng yere set forward towarde naples ayde emperor armye lorde lawtrick therefore desired duke passed duchye myllayne would put frenchemen suche fortress kept whiche thyng sayd might easely done consideryng great puissaunce almaynes debilitie lacke power duke myllayne especial consideryng uenicians kept tounes would ayde frenche parte whiche persuasion duke agreed went toward citie lawde whiche thei gaue assaut within well defended almaynes lost wanne wherfore duke determined famishe within knewe great nomber vitaile must nedes fayle dede creature men war vitaile therfore poore citezens compelled either go ha de enemy dye famyn season italy vniuersal warre famyn pe ilence morreyn wherof people died euery place especially duke armye whiche caused moste part almayues returne countrey wherfore duke wisely considered chauce saw army greatly minished death saw farther lacke vitaile money able conuey remnaunt armye naples aduise anthony de leua concluded returne shortly good order returned lost pestilence enemy frenche kyng aduertised lorde lawtrick people decayed sore naples duke brunswyke commyng raise siege reskue citie wherfore frenche kyng sent lorde fraunces erle saint poul brother duke uandosme viiim men folowe duke bruswyke naples went naples ioyne himselfe frau ce sforcia duke myllayne uenicians expel anthony de leua emperor souldiers lombardy spaniardes within naples aduertised new succor commyng frenchemen wherfore determined fight new ayde came one day issued citie fought frenchemen slewe many force compelled returne lorde lawtrick knew well citie could hold long lacke vitaile suertie vitaile come sea toune yelded wherfore lorde lawtrick suffered armye lye still plaine fielde heate sommer brought theim shadow reason wherof fell suche disease amongest armye dyed daily great nomber himselfe fell sicke lefte armye lay uerse whiche mortalitie dyed frenche campe aboue xxiiiimthe death naples men besyde moste part horse beastes whiche nomber diuers wryters agree dyed aboue vm gentleman amongest dyed lorde uawdemont brother anthony duke lorraine lorde grauntmount capitain molyac lorde lauall dolphenye capitaine luper lorde charles uyuone lorde chataygneray sonne lorde andrewe uyuone seneschal poytew many othex nobleman name duryng whiche plag e toune cappe whiche moste tounes realme naples helde frenche part became imperiall turned emperor part whereof hearyng lorde lawtrick made therfore great sorowe beyng somewhat amended disease tooke horse came visite campe sawe nomber minished campe deso ate people perceiued enterprise could performed fell suche malencoly sickenes toke feruetly within two day whiche xxi day august died body sered conueyed fraunce marque saluce whiche liuetenaunt vnder lord lawtrick called counsel erle guy rancon peter de nauer capitaines wer left long consultacion cosidered nomber small either kepe siege abide battel passed vm wherfore cocluded leue siege returne xxv daye august brake vp campe returned toward frauce whiche returne spaniardes euer costed tooke frencheman aduauntage either siewe tooke thus ende iorney reason great mortalitie whiche happened citie whole realme naples recouered citie naples could haue holden x dayes army remoued con essed erle saint poul whiche appointed passe italye haue heard knew nothyng mortalitie naples wherfore spede passed mountaines sea duke bruswyke returned came duchy myllain tooke certaine fortress whiche emperor power wonne aydes uenicians duke fraunces sforcias ioyned besieged citie pauye within fewe dayes citie taken force walles beaten doune ground dispite frenche kyng taken toune doynges muche pleasaunt frenche kyng losse citie geane displeasaunt season andrewe dorye whiche doet frenche kyng sea tyme frenche kynges quarel vanquished lord hugo uiceroy naples taken ye marque gnasto ascayne de columna capitaines belongyng emperor whiche prisoner frenche kyng comaunded deliuer hades thing andrew dory thought reasonable cosideryng tooke cause wage payed tooke galeys sayled geane borne also great authoritie estimacion persuaded people became unperial tooke trenulsius frenche kynges frende put warde prepared detende citie frenche kynges power whereof hearyng erle saint poule sent al hast light horseman succor citie came citezens wer furnished frenchemen hope recouery wherfore returned alexadry thei counsailed together take citie myllayne whiche sore desolate people brought great mischiefe crueltie spaniardes almaines heard tel emperor sent iim spaniardes ayde anthony de leua chaunged purpose determined recouer citie geane againe whiche purpose erle lefe uenicians casyan power duke fraunces sforcie left pauye kepe passage spaniardes stray farre abrode also kepe passage vitayle come spaniardes whiche tyme onely citie castle myllain none fortresse resorte therle himselfe lay village called landryan spede enterprise sent forward artille toward eane hauyng middle warde rerewarde doynges anthony de leua liyng myllayn espyals truely tyme tyme aduertised wherfore like polletike capitaine considered erle done folishly sende ordinaunce forward therfore determined take auauntage frenchemen might called capitaines theim sayd felowes armes souldiors emperor masteranthony de enco ag th soul r see consider great occasion victory offered v present day uenicians sforcians seuered frenchemen therle saint poul parte army lyeth landryan hath sent forward ordinauce toward geane wherfore set sodainly agree ouercome praise shalbe flye comyng yet folowyng shall get great pray botie entent souldiers agreed wer nedy glad haue somewhat caused proclaymed men shuld redy houre euerye man haue white shyrt aboue apparel one darke might know another euery man ready euenyng approched anthony de leua accordyng enterprise set forwarde armed satte chayre caried iiii camisad strong persones citezens myllain saw thus armed borne chayre knew wel ronyng gout could styrre thei meruailed much audacitie experiece thynges done iudged entended great enterprise nomber people lytle doubted sequele aduenture imaginacions people secretely issued myllain passed forward without noyse mornyng sodainly set therle saint poul army erle leysure send ordinaunce forward fayne trust suche fyrst brunte almaynes fled frenche horseman also litle fight fled erle himselfe fleyng ouer great iche horsebacke erle guy raucon lord castillyon many noble gentleman wer taken prisoner vitail purue aunce artillerie wer prayes themperors souldiers muche refreshed iorney ye frenche kyng army italy wherfore fraunces sforcia seyng himselfe de titute ayde made meanes emperor pope clement appointment duchy myllain also answere certain treason accused emperor themperor answered next sommer would come italy receiue emperial croune would take suche order right equitie require ende warres begon betwene kyng england frenche kyng ye one partie emperor partie xix yere kyng haue heard iorney lady margaret duches sauoy aunt themperor lady loyse duches angulesme mother french kyng continually labored peace meanes treatie appointed kept cabray iune folowyng shall heare let v returne kyng england whiche great scruple conscience quiet mynde diuers diuines well learned secretely enformed liued adultry wt brother wife great peril soule tolde farther court rome could dispence wt god comaudement precept thinges talked among comon people sith fyrst daye mariage haue heard insomuche kynges counsailors aduised know trueth wherfore like wise prince qui tyng coscience called toge best lerned realme whiche seueral opinion wherfore thought know trueth indifferent iudges lest perauenture spanyardes fauor ye quene would say owne subiectes wer indif erent iudges wherfore wrote cause rome best erkes christendome wer also sent al vniuersities italy fraunce great clerkes al christendom know opinion desired court rome send realme legate heare cause debated whiche indifferent great iudgement whose request whole consistorye college rome sent thither laurence campeius prest cardinall man great wit experience lerned ye papal law diuinitie whiche sent legate england x yere kyng haue heard sayd yere ioyned comission cardinal yorke legate england cardinal campeius long iorneyes came england muche preparacion made receiue triumphantly lodon sore vexed goute refused suche solempnities desired heartely might without pompe coueyed lodgyng quiet ix day october came saint mary ouereys water bishop bathe place without temple barre lo ged last tyme england visited car inal yorke di er e tate prelate cardinal ampe u co ng london rested season somwhat releued pain brought kynges presence liyng brydewel ye cardinal yorke caried chayer crimosyn veluet borne betwene iiii persones able stand cardinal yorke sat right hand kynges throne one frauncisco secretarie cardinal campe made eloquent oracionthe oracior latin tongue whiche rehersed yrst crueltie emperor souldiers handeled pope tyranny thei shewed cardinal priestes sacrilege spoyle comitted saint peter churche thei violat virgyns rauished mennes wyues conclusion spoyled robbed tormeted romaine inhabitantes citie rome farther shewed fredship college rome found kynges
