dyuers realmes know iudgementes case surely kyng master sore lamenteth chaunce bewaileth tyme myspent uccede realme destitute lawfull heyre begotten body whiche greatest displeasure maye come prince mariage well ment bothe kynges father quenes father maryed together aduyce councell frendes louyngly continued together man wyfe without scruple doubte tyll spayne moued fyrst question put maryage ambiguitie therfore honour thynke kyng hath doone lyke wyse prince searche solucion doubte neare toucheth soule suretye realme thynge hath done hath done great aduysement great deliberacion wherefore reasonable man saye hath done lyke wyse vertuous prince marque hearynge aunswere sayde kyng dyd wysely trye truthe somewhat ashamed spoken infourmed present haue hearde howe cleargye conuocacion graunted kyng one hundreth thousa pounde pardoned premunire leuiyng whyche summe euery bysshop dioces called hym priestes well chauntrie parysh priestes persones uycars amongest doctor ihon stokesley bysshop london man great wytte learnyng lytle discresion humanitie caused hym fauoure common people called hym preistes within citie london whether curate stipendaries first day septembre beyng fridaye chapiter house saynt paull whyche daye priestes appeared bysshoppes policye haue onely syxe eight priestes together persuacions haue caused graunte porsion towarde payment foresayde one hundreth pounde nombre priestes great syxe hundreth least came many temporall men heare matter bysshoppe disapoynted purpose bysshoppes officer called certayne priestes name chapiter house great nombre entered putte bysshppes officer kepte dore syde ter officer got dore shut agayne priestes without sayde wyll kepte without fellowes within knowe bysshoppe wyll doo temporall men beyng present stomaked conforted priestes enter force opened dore one strake bysshoppes officer ouer face entered chapiter house many temporall men long sylence coulde made last appea ed bysshop stoode vp sayde brethern meruayle lytell heddy know shall sayde youthe bishopes saiyng therefore pray keepe sylence heare paciently frendes knowe well wee bee men frayle condicion angel frayltie lacke wysedome wee haue misdemeaned selfe toward kyng soueraygne lorde lawes wee clearge premunire reason wherof promocions landes goodes catelles hym forfayte bodyes eadye enprisoned yet grace moued pittie compassyon demaunded v wee coulde say shoulde extende lawes vpon v father cleargye humbly besought grace mercye answered euer enclyned mercy great offence lytell penaunce might rygor law haue taken al lyuelod goodes catels contented one hundreth thousand poundes payde fyue yeres although maye easelye beare yet rygor lawes shoulde haue borne whole burdeyne wheerfore brother charitably exhorte beare partes liuelod salary towarde payment graunted shortely sayde bysshoppe lorde twentye noble yere ba e lyuynge priest nowe victayle euery thynge maner deare pouertie maner enforceth v saye naye besyde lorde neuer offended premunire medeled neuer cardinal faculty let bysshoppes abbottes whych haue offended paye bysshoppes officer gaue priestes hyghe woordes whyche caused ob nate also dyuers temporall men whych present conforted priestes bade theim agree payment rumor dyuers bysshoppes seruauntes buffyted stryken bysshop beganne frayde fayre woordes appeased noyse thynges whiche done sayde pardoned gaue blessyng praied departe charitie departed thynkyng heare matter disceyued bysshop went syr thomas moore beyng lorde chauncellor whiche greatly fauoured bysshop cleargye hym made greuouse complaynte declared facte greuously wherevpon commaundement sent syr thomas pargitor mayer citie attache certayne priestes temporall men xv priestes v temporall men arrested whych sent tower fleete prison remayned long season dyuers preachynges realme one contrarye another concernyng kynges maryage especiall one thomas ab clerke bothe preached wrote booke mariage lawfull whiche caused many symple men beleue opinion abell queenes chaplayne wrote booke please withall wherfore kyng caused determinacio uniuersities iudgementz gret clerkes compyled booke printed whiche booke dyd satisfie myndes indifferent discrete person men perciall neither learnyng reason could satisfy wylfull myndes yere kyng kepte christemas grenewyche great solempnitie men sayde myrthe christemas queene lady absent christemas xv daye ianuary parliament began sytte amongest dyuers griefes whych common greued sore coplayned crueltie ordinarirs callyng men theym ex officio reason ther office ordinary woulde sende men ley accusacions heresye say accused ley article accuser brought furth whiche common dredeful greuous partie assited must either abiure burned purgacion myght make none matter exaction done clergy courtes long debated common house last concluded agreed griefes temporall men greued shoulde putte writyng delyuered kyng whiche great aduyce done wherfore xviii day marche common speaker accompanyed dyuers knyghtes burgess common house came kynges presence declared hym temporall men realme sore agreued cruell demeanoure prelattes ordinaryes whi h ouched bothe bodyes goodes whiche griefes speaker delyuered kyng wri ynge humbly besechyng gr c ke soche ordre direction aie hygh wysedome myght seme conuenient beseched kyng consyder payne charge cost humble subiectes nether house sust yned syth begynnynge parliament woulde please grace princely benignitie dissolue courte parliament subi te myght repayre countreys kyng receyued supplicacion common paused whyle sayde offyce kyng iudge lyghte credencethe kynges saiyng haue wyll vse wyll heare partie accu ed speake geue entence booke conteyn th dyuers article great weyghtye matter perceyue agaynste spirituall persones prelate realme whiche thynge desyre redresse ormacion whiche desyre request mere contraryant yout last peticion requyre haue parlyament dissolued departe countreys yet woulde haue reformacion griefes diligence although payne haue ben great tariyng ure myne hath ben lesse yet payne take wealthes pleasure therefore wyll haue protyte complaynte must tary tyme orels without remedy moche commend wyll contende stand stryfe spirituall men whiche youre christen brother moche thynketh shoulde contende youre souereygne lorde kyng consideryng seke peace quyetnesse haue sent byll concernynge wardes primer season thynges greatly wronged wherfore haue offered reason thy ke yea thynketh lordes haue set handes booke therfore assure wyll take reasonable ende offered wyll se che extremitie lawe wyll e moche agayne answere speaker company departed cause kyng spake woordes daily men made feoffementes landes v declared wylles landes soch remaynders alonly kyng lordes lost wardes mariages relieffes kyng also lost primer season profyte lyuerey hym prediudiciall great losse wherfore lyke indifferent prince willyng take lose caused byll drawen learned councell deuysed euerye man myght make wyll halfe lande lefte halfe heyre discent byil came fyrst amonges common lorde ignoraunt persones greued howe shamefully spake byll kynges learned councell wyse men vnderstoode sawe myschiefe come woulde gladly haue byll assented least haue put kyng suretye thyrde fourthe parte whiche offer credebly informed kyng woulde haue taken many frowarde wylfull persones regardyng myght ensue dyd deede woulde neither consent byll lordes agreed set handes yet agree reasonable qualificacion whiche sore repented kyng called iudges best learned men realme thei disputed matter chaucery agreed lande coulde wylled ordre common law wherupon acte made man myght declare wyll parte lande acte sore greued lordes gentleman many chyldren setfurth therefore may iudge myschiefe cometh wylfull blyndnesse lacke foresyght great cause parliament proroged tyll tenth day apryll whiche parliament acte made bysshops shoulde pay annates money bulles pope openly proued payed bulles bysshoppes fourthe yere kyng henry seuenth kynges father tyll yere one hundreth thre score thousand pounde sterlyng besyde dispensacions pardones wherof summe incredible parliament begonne agayne ester came downe common house lorde chauncelloure duke norffolke suffolke erles arundell oxforde northumbrelande rutlande wylshyre sussex set lorde chauncellor declared howe kyng aduertised councell especiall duke norffolke howe march betwene englande scotlande lytell habitacion englysh syde scottysh syde great habitacion scottes dwelled euen iust border reason wherof inuaded england dyuets tymes dyd kynges subiectes great hurte displeasure wherefore kyng entended make dwellyng house also make new diuers pyle stoppes let scottysh men inuasions great commoditie people dwellyng thynges coulde doone without great cost wherefore consideryng kynges good entente sayde lordes thoughte conueniente graunte kyng reasonable ayde toward charge prayed comons consulte lordes departed departure comons cosidering kinges good entent louingly grauted xv toward charge graut enacted sessyon bicause sodeinly began pestilence westmynster wherefore parlyament proroged tyll nexte yere yere olde tolle demaunded flaunders englysh men called tolle hounde ryuer passage tolle xii penny fardell tolle ben often tymes demaunded neuer payed insomoche kyng henry seuenth demaunde tolle prohibited subiectes kepe marte al antwerpe barow caused martes kepte calyes tyme agreed sayde tolle shoulde neuer demaunded englysh men woulde resorte agayne duke countrey demaunded tyll wherefore kyng sent doctor knyght calyes thyther came themperours commissioner matter put suspence tyme ye haue hearde kyng purchased bysshop yorkes place whiche fayre shop house meete kyng wherefore kyng purchased medowes saynt iames whole house iames made fayre mansion parke buylded many costly commodious house great pleasure must declare noble enterprise although doone england yet bicause diuers englysh men auenture wyll declare lorde master religion saynt ihons wrote lorde saynt ihons englande lorde ma er religion lamentyng sore losse rodes whiche thought sone recouered consydered turke helde towne modon whiche standeth see syde fayre porte woul e haue gladlye towne oute turkes possession called hym trusty seruaunt called caloram well langaged hym declared woulde haue hym sayle modon dwell turke vnknowen myght meanes come seruice massie de huga capitayne caloram answered go thyther accomplyshyng lord master desyre well content come seruyce fauoure capitayne must come processe tyme continuance without great expence lorde maister promysed hym sufficient treasure great rewarde caloram perfectly enstructed thyng toke leaue came priuely modon dwelled within shorte space capitayns seruaunt great diligence master great fauoure wrote lorde miaster thyng asserrayned hym entent coulde take effecte hastely bade hym euer readye thys matter thus contynued two yeare whiche tyme caloram well perceyned howe towne myght taken therefore wrote lord master shortly came place called mucollutea turkes haue condicion august septembre resorte countrey see fruytes solace theim selfe wherfore lorde master appoynted prior rome tur uplya england capitaynes enterprise lx knightes religion viic fyftye souldyers vi galyes brigantes passed cape blanke lande calaber xviii day august ankered place myght sayle lx myle modon vnder hylles stroffadees waye stopped shippes passed toward modon thence sent woorde caloram sent woorde hastye uenicians reported modon galyes religion see also capitayne turkes called frombylam come modon iic horseme vew towne caloram great feare enterprice nyght came modon gripe small vessell thre knyghtes religion marynors arrey sought fresh water victails necessary knightes spake calora day capitayne frombylam departed modon caloram sent worde capitaynes trusted iourney shoulde well sped knyghtes departed came capitaynes whiche wysely assembled people roade called stroffades declared commission lorde master also shewed calorams letter whereof euery man greatly comforted know enterprise went appoynted prior rome shoulde fyrst entre take gate principall tower turkeiplier vi english knyghtes appoynted defende molle peere hauen mouthe euery gate capitayn appoynted nombre gate towne fortress well knowen religion ihon baptist ordre appoynted galies disancored came ile sapience iii myle modon whyle caloram great eare tyll two capiteins sent vessell called gripe iiic men thei ner entered peere turkes came borde asked merchautz men wer appearlled lyke mariner answered merchauntes charge gone land towne sayde would bring merchauntes merchaudise good wodde thyng turkes moch desyre christe knyghtes lyke mariner weut turkes wer nombre xiii entendyng begyn enterprise went towarde tower went toward gate followyng xii turkes issued souldiers gripemodon tak force thei got gate ye molle pyre set baner religion caloram helped moch came galyes landed begane terrible slaughter al partes turkes fled christen men followed capitaynes tooke walles thence caloram lead house messyre huga whiche house great strength house lyke fortresse tower whiche ioyned walle towne posterne wherof issued certayn turkes askryed christen men abrode countrey meane season christen men assauted sayde fortresse whiche sore defended prior rome hackbush slayn whiche chaunce made christen men furious slew towne iiic turkes aboue blew retreite councelled together well perceyued coulde keepe towne excepte fortresse tower coulde obtayne without siege ordinaunce people ynough therfore determined take aduauntage pyllage spoyled towne tooke viiic prisoner sent galyes turkes saw cristen men styll pulfer vsage souldiers issued holde fortresse fought christe men boldely stretes stretes ranne bloode canels fyghte sore euer turkes came posterne askry assauted christen men valiauntly defended turkes power came galies pray prisoner came ile malto booty leesyng xl persones iourney wherof lorde master moche reioyed well rewarded caleram whiche also came malto enterprise dooen sonday beynge xviii day august yere lorde thousand fyue hundreth thyrtie one xxiii yere reigne enterprise xxii day septembre dyed lady loyse dutchesse angulesme mother frenche kyng wyse sad lady whereof kyng beynge aduertised caused solempne obsequye made kepte abbey waltham essex whiche solempnitie kynge great nombre noble prelate realme wer present mournyng apparell kynges coste charge pthe xxiiii yere beginnyng xxiiii yere lady anne bulleyne moche kynges fauour commen people knew kynges trew entent sayd thought absence quene onely sake trew king openly rebuked preacher keping company brother wife thoccasyon eschued companye tyll truth wer tryed last daie aprill parliamet sittyng kyng sent thomas awdeley spekar common house certain dec ared thei exhibited boke greues last yere spiritualtie whiche requestes deliuered spirituall subiectes make answere could haue answere till within three day last past whiche answere deliuered spekar saiyng thynke answere smally please semeth v slender bee greate sorte wisemen doubt loke circumspectly matter indifferent betwene truth answere sophisticall nothyng auoydyng greues laye people farther kyng saied marueiled litle one parliament house spake openly absence quene fro hym whiche matter determined saied touched soule wisshed matrimony good neuer vexed coscience docters vniuersities said haue determined mariage bee voyde detestable god whiche grudge conscience caused abstein compaignie folishe wanton appetite said xli yere old whiche age lust man quicke lustie youth sauyng spain portyngall hath seen one man hath maried two sister one beyng carnally knowe brother mary brother wife abhorred emongest nacions neuer heard christen man self wherfore se conscience troubled praie reporte spekar departed declared common kynges saiyng bothe spirituall mennes answere also concernyng kynges mariage whiche sight answere displesed common occasion kyng spake marige one temse common house moued common sue kyng take quene compaignie declared certain greate mischiefes bastardyng lady marie kynges onely childe diuerse inconueniences whiche woordes reported kyng whiche cause declared conscience xi daie maie kyng sent speker xii common house hauyng hym eight lordes saied theim welbeloued subiectes thought ye clergie realme subiectes wholy wee haue well perceiued thei bee halfe subiectes yea scace subiectes prelate consecracion make othe pope clene contrary othe thei make v thei seme subiectes copie bothe othes deliuer requiryng inuent ordre bee thus deluded spirituall subiectes spekar departed caused othes bee redde co mon house tenor whereof ensueth ihon bishop abbot fro houre forwardothe pope shalbe faithefull obedient sainct peter holy churche rome lorde pope successor canonically enteryng shall counsaill concent thei shall lese either life member shall bee taken suffre violence wrong meanes counsaill credited theim messyngers letter shall willyngly discouer person papacie rome rule holy father regalie sainct peter shall help retain defende men legate sea apostolicke goyng commyng shall honourably entreate rightes honor priuilege aucthorities churche rome pope successor shall cause bee conserued defended augmented promoted shall bee counsaill treatie acte whiche thyng shalbe imagined hym churche rome rightes state honor power knowe suche bee moued compassed shall resist power sone shall aduertise hym suche maie geue hym knowlege rule holy father decree ordinaunces sentence disposicions reseruacions prouisions commaundementes apostolicke power shall kepe cause kept heretickes sismatikes rebelles holy father successor shal resist persecute power shall come sinode called except letted canonicall impediment lightes apostle shall visite yerely personally deputie shall alien fell possession without pope counsaill god helpe holy euangelistes ihon bishop vtterly renounce clerely forsakeothe kyng suche clause woordes sentence grauntes whiche haue shall haue pope holines bishopricke wise hath hereafter maie bee hurtefull preiudiciall highnes heires successor dignitie priuilege estate royal also dooe swere shalbe faithfull true faithe truth shall beare souereigne lorde heires kynges thesame life lymme yearthly worship aboue creature liue dye people diligently shalbe attendant nedes busines witt power counsaill shall kepe holde knowlegyng self hold bishoprcke onely besechyng restitucion temporalty thesame promisyng shalbe faithefull true obedient subiect saied highnes heires successor duryng life seruices thynges dewe youre highnes restitucion temporalty thesame bishoprike shall truly dooe obediently perfourme god helpe sainctes openyng othes one occasion pope within two yere folowyng lost inrisdiccion englande shall afterward xiiii daie ye parliament proroged til iiii daie february next ensuyng whiche prorogacion sir thomas chaunceller englade long sutes made kyng discharged office xvi daie maie deliuered kyng westminster greate seale englande kynges fauor discharged whiche seale kyng kept til whitson de folowyng mondaie whitson wekethomas wdeley keper great al dubbed thomas awdeley speker parliament knight made hym lorde keper greate seale called kyng beyng progresse sommer aduertised pope frenche kyng appoynted mete marcelles prouince beginnyng nexte spryng wherefore kyng like wise pollitike prince thought conuenient speake frenche kyng awne persone pope come together declare hym bothe determinacion uniuersities doctor concernyng matrimonie also generall cousailes whiche ordeined suche cause tried poruinces countreis doubt rise trustyng frenche kyng cause pope encline goddes law leaue awne tradicions voyde dispensacions whereupon bothe prince concluded mete october folowyng betwene calic bulleyn wherfore kyng englande sent letter nobilitie prelate seruauntes commaundyng theim bee ready cantorbury xxvi daie september passe sea hym accomplishyng enteruew betwene hym brother frenche kyng many men wer sory kyng passe sea winter specially october sea rough saiynges letted purpose marched forward ampthill wynsore sundaie beyng firste daie september created lady anne bulleyn marchiones penbroke gaue one thousande pound lande yere solemnitie finished rode college masse masse ended newe league concluded swornea new league betwene kyng french kyng messire pomoray frenche ambassador beyng present ter othe taken doctor fox kynges amner made eloquent oracion latin praise peace loue amitie whiche dooen trumpettes blewe kyng returned castle kepte solempne feast thence kyng remoued grenewiche forward cantorbury daie appoynted found ready fur ished suche commaunded passe sea hym well richely adorned bothe thei seruauntes x daie october kyng came douer xi daie mornyng beyng fridaie three clocke tooke shippyng douer rode x clocke thesame daie lady marchiones pembroke landed caleis honorably receiued procession brought sainct nicholas church hard masse place called thexchequer lodged sondaie came caleis lorde roche baron monsire de mountpesat messenger fro frenchkyng aduertisyng kyng englad frenche kyng would repaire abuile night marchyng towarde bull yne whiche tidynges kyng glad sodainly came messenger reported great master fraunce archebishoppe roan diuerse noble men fraunce wer come sandifeld entendyng come caleis salute kyng kyng master beyng therof aduertised sent greate hast xv daie october duke norffolke marque excester erles oxford darby rutlande lorde sandes lorde fitzwater iiic gentleman whiche honorably receiued frenche lordes englishe pale brought kynges presence caleis whiche stode vnder ri h clothe estate suche value thei muche mused rich kyng knewe honor nurture receiued frenche lordes louyngly amiably toke daie place metyng lordes wer highly feasted diner departed bullein kyng lay thus caleis vewed walles tower bulwerkes deuised certain newe fortificacios maintenance defence toune toune caleis season xxiiiic beddes stablyng ii horse beside village adiacent xx daie moneth kyng beyng aduertised fre che kyng come village called marguiso nigh englishe pa e marched caleis next daie accompaignied duke norffolke suffolke marquess dorcet excester erles arundell oxford surrey essex derby rutlande huntyngdon sussex diuerse uiscountes baron knightes garter gentleman freshely appareled richly trimmed passed toward place appoynted enteruewe leuyng behinde greatest part ye yomen caleis bulleyne litle bothe traines frenchemen saied train xx horse whiche caused englishman cast many perelles especially bruted abrode frenche kyng saie kyng englande enemie mainteined emp ror duke burbo hym become moste frende rehersyng olde grudge many englishman suspected lothe kyng go bulleyne kyng continued still iorney came sandyngfelde litle place valey frenche kyng nobely accompaignied three hundred horse muche kynges tr waued lefte hande geue frenche kyng train ight hande like wise frenche part geue englishemen right hande twoo kynges louely honor met bare heddes embrased suche fashion behelde reioysed kyng englande appareledthe kynges apparell cote greate rich braides golde laied lose russer ueluet set traifoyles full pearle stone frenche kyng coate cr mosin veluet cut lined slender cloth gold plucked cuttes noble men bothe party wer richely apparreled reported frenche kyng saied openly kyng englandethe saiyng freche kyng sir thesame persone moste bounde worlde sithe hath pleased persone visite bound persone seke frendship haue found require take put bonet kyng england soberly answered euer thyng likyng glad touchyng pain come hether se assure greate comforte yea come farther haue visited kynges embrased lordes estate frenche kyng lordes england kyng england lordes fraunce doen thei set forward toward bulleyne ridyng thei cast haukes called sakers kytes whiche made theim greate sporte valey beyonde sadyngfeld kyng nauerr met kynges thei lighted dranke ter thei mounted horsebacke haukyng princely pastyme thei came nere bulleyn hill stode ranged faire bande nomber fiue hundred menne horsebacke chief wer frenche kynges three sonnes dolphin duke orleaunce duke angulesme gaue attendaunce admirall frauce three cardinalles diuerse noble fraunce three prince marched forwarde welcomed kyng englande whiche theim well behelde louyngly receiued could muche nurture prince euer frenche kyng saied child ope ly child father prince muche bound naturall father redemed captiuitie wherfore blessyng charge hym louyng alwaies kyng englande ceassed frenche kynges tale embrased young prince eche three apparelles blacke ueluet embraudered siluer damaske noble compaignie came bulleynethe kynges commyng bulleyn greate shot artilery one side thei shot greate pellettes whiche made greate noyse twoo prince offered lady bulleyne frenche kyng brought kyng englande lodgyng abbay directly awne lodging kyng englande diuerse chamber vtter chamber hanged faire arras another chamber hanged grene ueluet embraudered uinettes gold fret flower siluer smal twigges wrethen worke middle euery pane pece fable ouid matamorphoseos embraudered clothe estate thesame worke valanced frettes knotted langettes tassaled uenice golde siluer chamber hanged great braunche siluer percell gilte beare lightes er chamber hanged riche clothe gold tissue ro e siled thesame iiii chamber veluet hachementes armes diuises nedle worke connyngly wrought eue man appoynted lodgyng straight accordyng degree greate chere made engli hemen poultrees larder spicer sellars wine al open likewise hay litter thynges aske haue man durst take money frenche kyng paied frenche kyng caused twoo gounes made white veluet pricked gold damaske cape ventes wer frettes whipped gold damaske riche whiche twoo gounes sent kyng englande praiyng hym chose one weare sake whiche gladly toke tewesdaie twoo kynges wer bothe one suite thesame night freche kyng made kyng englande supper chamber whiche hanged arras iled ouer riche silke two clothes state wer set vp one one ende ende one clothe embraudered image old man woman naked child h r arme woman gaue old man sucke brest writte french better child en wantonly wepe old mea nede peri clothe estate enbraudered sunne goyng doune ne gold beast theron hed couered helme coro ail duke estate beastes body al perle cloth crimosin satten riche cupbord set vp plate wi h greate nober peces newe fashion iiii great braunches hong chaber siluer gilt bare torch white waxe al getlemen frauce made thenglishemen greate chere serued delicate viandes churche bulleyne trauerse set vp frenche kyng ope euery side sauyng siled blew veluet embraudered lower delices golde pillers hanged thesame worke frenche kynges right hand another trauerse siled cortened white satten embraudered cable cast cut clothe gold embraudered gilted fashion mariner cast rope trauerse valensed like woorke fringed fine gold daily kynges heard mass trauerses commonly thei went together masse diuerse tymes kynges communed together counsaill sometyme mornyng prince wer stirryng cousailes met sat together agreat kyng englande lay thus bulleyn frenche kyng shewe hymself louyng noble men englande xxv daie october called chapiter compaignions ordre called sainct michell kyng englande one elected thomas duke norffolke charles duke suffolke bee compaignions thesaied ordre whiche brought chapiter collers deliuered theim sworne statute ordre obeysaunce souereigne lorde alwaies reserued whiche duke thanked frenche kyng gaue officer armes twoo hundred crounes pece season frenche kyng courte wer freshe gard appareled frockes blewe crimosin yelowe veluet frenche kyng kyng nauerr dolphin uien duke orliaunce angulesme uandosine guyse longuile erles sainct paule neuers estampes lauall many erles baron prince melffe foure cardinalles leuen bishoppes traines resort whiche surely greate compaignie continued twoo kynges bulleyn mondaie tewesdaie wednesdaie thursdaie fridaie xxv daie october thei departed bulleyn calice frenche kynges train twelue hundred persones many horse without calice twoo mile met duke richemond kynges bastard sonne englande goodly young prince full fauoure beautie greate compaignie noble men whiche wer bulleyne duke compaignie embrased frenche kyng noble men lorde englande set forward duke richemond norffolke suffolke marque excester erles arudell oxford surrey darby worcester rutland sussex huntyngdon uiscountes li e rocheforde bishoppes london winchester lyncolne bathe lorde willia haward lorde matrauerse lorde montacute lorde cobham lorde sade lorde bray lord mordat lorde leonard grey lorde clinton sir william fitzwillyam knight tresorer kynges house sir william paulet coptroler thesame gre te nomber knightes beside lustie esquire yong gentleman noble personage gentleman england accompaignied frenche lordes newnam bridge thomas palmer capitain fortresse faire compaignie souldiours saluted kynges thei passed towarde calice commyng toune castle ricebancke shippes hauen frenche men saied thei neuer heard suche shotte thei entered mille gate souldiours toune stoode one side appareled redde blewe side stretes stoode seruyng menne englande coates frenche tawney lordes master diuises embraudered euery manne scarlette cap white fether whiche made goodly shewe lodged caleis night beside toune dweller eight thousand persones least kyng englande brought frenche kyng lodgyng staple chamber hanged rich verdorethe firste chamber hath seen ground gold damaske ouer tuffes flower satten silke siluer curiously wrought thei semed growe euery chamber richer otherthe seconde chamber seconde chamber tissue clothe estate nedle worke set great rose large pearle third ha ged ueluetthe thirde chamber vpon veluet pirled grene crimosyn embraudered ouer braunches flower gold bullion garnished armes beastes thesame golde set pearle stone frenche kyng made good chere kyng england trayne bulleyne assure trayne requited caleis plentie wylde foule uenison fishe thynges whiche marueill see kynges officer englande made preparacion euery place frenchemenne serued suche multitude diuerse fish fridaie saterdaie master french kynges houshod muche wondered prouison like wise sondaie thei al maner fleshe foule spice uenison bothe falowe dere redde dere wyne thei lacked none well thenglishe man might wel entertain french man lordes frauce neuer fetched viandes thei wer sent often tyme proporcion victaill abundaunt thei refused greate parte thereof kynges wer thus caleisthe trauerses thei roade euery daie sainct marie churche set twoo trauerses one frenche kyng whiche crimosyn ueluet replenished greate rose massy bullion fine gold seede thesaied rose greate orient pearle euery rose wrethe al pearle stone whiche trauerse muche wondered frenchemen trauerse blewe ueluet clothe tissue raised flower siluer paned al blewe ueluet embrodered knottes subtle draughtes leaues braunches fewe men could iudge cunnyng workemanship sundaie night french kyng supped kyng englandthe supper made french kyng chamber hanged tissue reised siluer paned cloth siluer reised golde semes thesame wer couered brode wrethes goldsmithes worke full stone perle chamber coberd vii stage high al plate gold gilt plate beside hong thesaid chaber x brauches siluer gilt x braunches al white siluer euery brauche hangyng long chain thesame sute beryng v lightes waxe tell rich clothes estate basens vessel whiche occupied assure wit insufficiet nothyng occupied night gold frech kyng serued iii course meat dressed frech fashion kyng england like course thenglishe fashion first course euery kyng xl dish second lx third lxx wer costly plesant ter supper came marchiones penbroke vii lady maskyng apparel straunge fashion made clothe gold compassed crimosyn tinsell satin owned clothe siluer liyng lose knit lace golde lady brought chamber foure damoselles appareled crimosin sattyn tabardes fine cipres lady marque tooke frenche kyng countes darby toke kyng nauerr euery lady toke lorde daunsyng kyng englande toke awaie lady visers lady beauty shewed thei daunsed thei ceased frenche kyng talked marchiones penbroke space toke leaue lady kyng conueighed hym lodgyng thesame night duke norffolke feasted noble fraunce beyng castle caleis many goodly sportes pastymes mondaie beeyng simon iudes daie dined kyng englande kyng nauerr cardinall lorrain greate master admirall fraunce whiche daie kyng englande called chapiter knightes gartier whiche chapiter frenche kyng ware blewe mantell ordre thesame ordre wer elected anna memorancie erle beaumont greate master frenche kinges house phillip de chabbot erle newblanke greate admirall fraunce whiche collers garter deliuered whiche thei rendered kyng greate thankes morowe beyng thirtie daie october two kynges departed caleis came nere sadyngfeld alighted faire grene place table set englishemen serued frenchemen wyne ypocras fruite spice abondantly twoo kynges communed litle thei mounted horse enteryng frenche groundethe kynges departure thei toke handes princely countenaunce louyng behauor hartie wordes eche embrased departed kyng englande frenche kynges dominion vpper hande like wise frenche kyng dominion frenche kyng paied al englishmennes charge bulleyn kyng englande caleis euery thyng recopensed sauyng kyng england gaue frenche kyng diuerse precious iuelles greate horse noble great pletie plate whiche could neuer heare gaue kyng englade thing white goune haue hard lordes kynges counsaill gaue certain plate chaines kyng returned calice many gentleman tooke ship saile englande wynd contrariant diuerse wer driuen backe calice diuerse flaunders nouember rose suche wynde north north weste al hippes caleis hauen wer greate ieoperdy especiall hoyes whiche season suche spryng tide brake walles hollande zelande drouned diuerse tounes flau ders somuche water rose three foote aboue wharfe key stode andwarpe storme continued till fourth daie nouember wynd chaunged eight daie rose suche wynde tempest thonder man could conueniently stirre streates caleis muche lamentacion made theim taken shippe englande man knewe become theim sondaie wether faire kyng caused bedde thynges shipped entended departe sodainly rose suche mist master could guide ship taried daie tewesdaie midnight tooke ship landed douer morowe beyng xiiii daie nouember v clocke mornyng wherefore saterdaie song te deum cathedrall churche sainct paule london lorde keper great seale maior london diuerse noble sad persones whiche made abode london gouernaunce realme kynges absence beyng present kyng returne kyng maried lady anne bulleyne maried priuily lady anne bulleyn sainct erkenwaldes daie whiche mariage kept secrete fewe knewe til greate child easter kyng passe ouer sea cosidred scottes robbed subiectes bothe sea land redresse made thesame imagined absence thei would attempt outragious enterprise people wherfore like prudent prince suretie sent sir arthur darcy knight thre hundred tall menne barwicke defende inuasions scottes scottes hearyng commyng came northumberlande ye middle march came place called fowbery iorney fired certain village returned sir arthur darcy hearyng auenture nothyng contente nowe season laie berwicke archibald doglas erle angus whiche maried quene scottes kynges sister banished scotlande hym diuorsed maried another scottes bragged enterprise saied sir arthur brought good lucke said erle angus slepte well barwicke thei hearyng bragge made roade iiiic men scotland set village fire shortly assembled together viiic scottes thenglishemen perceiued scottes thei caused trompet blowe retreate erle xx hym shewed hym self hill euen face scottes trumpette blewe backes scottes thought ii compaignies whiche caused scottes flie englishemen folowed slewe great nomber toke many prisoner brought berwicke twentie daie october kyng yere kepte christemas grenewiche christmas sir thomas awdeleysir thomas awdeley made chauncellor lorde keper greate seale made chaunceller englande parli ment beganne office spekar voyde hufrey wyngfeld grais inne elected spekar parliament whiche presented accordyng haue heard spekar whiche parliament made acte persone appeale cause realme courte rome commissarie bishoppe bishop archebishop archebishop kyng cause kyng bee tried vpper house conuocacion thesame parliament enacted quene katheryn thence furth called quene prince dowager prince arthur sommer season last past died willyam warham archebishoppe cantorbury bishopriche named doctor thomas cranmer kynges chappelein manne good learnyng verteous life also long kynges ambassador bishop rome whiche consecrate lent kyng perceiuyng newe wife quene anne bee greate childe caused officer necessary bee appoynted easter eue went closet openly quene solempnitie kyng appoynt coronacion bee kept whitso sondaie next folowyng tynges wer sent al shriues certi e name menne pounde receiue ordre knighthod el make fine assessement whiche fine appoynted thomas cro well master kynges iuell house counsailer kyn newly high fauour whiche pollitikely handeled matter raised sessyng fine greate somme money kynges vse also kyng wrote letter citee london prepare pagiauntes thesame coronacion pthe xxv yere kyng beginnyng xxv yere kepte daie sainct george manor grenewiche great solempnitie courte grea ly replenished lordes knightes lady gentlewoman great nomber soalce pleasure haue hard last yere parliament enacted person daie appele rome cause wha soeuer wer quene called prince dowager h appeled court rome acte made doubted whether appele good question well handeled parliament hou e muche better couocacion house house alleged yea bokes shewed counsailes calcedone af ricke toletane diuerse famous counsailes primitiue churche yea tyme sainct augustine affirmed delcared determined cause risyng one prouince determined thesame neither patriarcke constantinople medle cause moued iurisdiccio patriarcke antioche bishop entermit within anothers prouince countrey whiche thynges clerkely opened connyngly sette furthe intentes euery man witte determined folowe truth affeccionate wilfully wedded awne mynd might plainly se appeles made rome wer clerely voyde none effect whiche doctrine counsailes wer shewed lady katerine prince dowager woman loue lose dignitie euer cotinued old song trustyng pope parcialitie determinacion christes veritie wherupo archebishop cantorbury accompaignied bishoppes london winchester bathe lincolne diuerse great clerkes greate nomber rode dunstable whiche sixe myle fro ampthil prince dowager laye doctor called doctor lee ascited appere thesaied archebishoppe cause matrimonie thesaied toune dunstable daie apparaunce would appere made defaute called peremptoriethe kyng quene katherine diuorsed euery daie xv day together laste lacke apparaunce c tumacie thassent learned men beyng present diuorsed kyng mariage declared voyde none effecte whiche sentence geuen archebishop returned whether pleased whiche diuorse sued many wise menne saied kyng well counsailed mary lady anne bulleyne diuorse adiudged mariyng firste mariage dissolued thei said second mariage might brought question verely thei saied true monethe maie three yere folowyng shall come tyme diuorse euery man spake discrecion wisedom wise men saied godly honorably doen discharge kynges conscience profitable suretie realme god loued mariage consideryng newe quene sone childe saied bishop rome would cursse englishemen themperor would inuade realme destroye people specially spanyardes bosted muche thankes god doynges wer muche lesse wordes euery man talked inough communyng matter peace litle tyme worshipfull esquier glocester shyre called wyllyam tracywylliam tracy todyngton whiche made wyll would funeral pompe buriyng neither passed vpon masse farther sayd trusted god onely hopyng besaued saint gentleman dyed sonne executor brought wil bishop cauntorbury proue whiche shewed couocacion vnaduisedly adiudged taken ground brent heretike sent commission doctor p rker chauncelor dyoces worcester execute sentence whiche accomplished kyng hearyng subiect exhumate brent without knowlege order lawe sent chauncelor layde high offence whiche excused archebishop cautorbury whiche late dead conclusion cost ccc pound haue pardon yet farther trueth knowen gentleman death cruel ignoraucye bishoppes haue expressed wylle worde worde foloweth name god amen wyllyam tracy todyngton countie gloucester esquier make testament last wille hereafter foloweth fyrst al thinges commit vnto god mercy beleuyng without doubt mistrust grace merites iesus christ vertue passion resurreccion haue shal haue remission sinnes resurreccion body soule according writteniob beleue redemer lyueth last day shall ryse yearth fleshe shall see sauior hope layde vp bosome touchyng wealth soule fayth haue taken rehersed sufficient suppose without mannes worke workes ground belefe one god one mediator god man whiche iesus christ accept none heauen yerth mediator betwene god onely iesus christ peticioners receiuyng grace none hable geue influence grace therfore bestowe part goodes entent man say helpe soule therin trust onely promise god beleueth baptized shalbe sauedmarke xvi beleueth shalbe damned touchyng buriyng body auaileth whatsoeuer done therto saint augustine sayeth de cura agenda pro mortuis funeral pompes rather solace liue welth comforte dede therfore remitte onely discrecion myne executor touchyng distribucion temporal goodes purpose grace god bestowe accepted fruites fayth suppose merite good bestowyng merite fayth iesus christ onelymath xxv suche workes good accordyng wordes lorde hungry thou gauest eat c foloweth ye haue done least brother ye haue done c euer consider true sentence good worke maketh good man good man maketh good workeroma xiiii fayth maketh good righteous righteous man liueth fayth whatsoeuer spryngeth fayth synne temporal goodes haue geuen deliuered geuen writyng myne hand bearyng date present writyng leaue geue margaret wyfe richard sonne make myne executor wytnes myne owne hand x day october xxii yere reigne kyng henry viii true copy wille whiche haue heard almoste thre yeres dead toke vp burned moneth maye pope clement sent orator kyng grenewyche certifiyng appointed generall counsail kept mantua yere folowing therof aduertised prince christen requiryng kyng likewyse prince christen vniuersal welth christendome quietyng opinion newly growen appeare personally whiche answered ieopardeous kyng whole realme haue prince absent feare inuasions vtward enemy sayd would sende thither sufficient procuracie conuenient proctor desired see orator commission euil shewed commission appered neither place tyme counsail kyng knew well commyng marque mantua made full denial pope would haue suche assemble kept citie dominion diuers great vrgent cause pope orator departed vncertain answere vncertain demaund vnrewarded kyng beyng aduertised frenche kyng pope mete nece iune folowyng thought conuenient sende solempne ambassade frenche kyng accompany nece also comon bishop rome concernyng vnlawfull stay kynges deuorce wher vpon appointed duke norffolke lorde rocheforde brother newe quene sir wyllyam pawlet comptroller kynges housholde sir anthonye browne sir fraunces bryan knightes ambassador made great prouision purpose nomber clx horse came douer calys whitson eue whiche day quene made entry citie london toward coronacion thei made abode certain space passed fraunce till came lyon remayned space shall season daily skirmishyng betwene borderer march england scotland yet warre proclaimed many robbery murder maslaughters done partes although comissioners realmes england scotlay newcastle vpo tyne entreatyng truce amitie yet duryng communicacion scottes ceased robbe sea land toke dyuers litle botes laden corne fishe wherof hearyng kyng england decked vitailed dyuers shippes warre sent north sea defende subiectes scottes hearyng englishe nauye come cost al hast fled home harbor yet englishemen folowed fetched many praies hauens maugre heades beginnyng may kyng caused open proclamacions made al men claimed seruice execute office solempne feast coronacion way tenor graunt prescripcion put graunt iii wekes ester starre chamber charles duke suffolke tyme high steward england lorde chauncelor commissioner duke norffolke claymed erle marshall exercise office feast erle arrondell claymed high butler exercise thesame erle oxforde claymed chamberlain vicount lys e claymed panter lorde burgaine chiefe larderer lord bray claimed almoner sir henry wiat knight claymed ewrer noble parsonage desired office fee besyde maior london claymed serue quene cuppe golde acuppe assay xii citizen attende cupborde maior haue cuppe cuppe assay labor whiche peticion allowed v porte claymed beare canapie ouer quenes head daye coronacion iiii gilte belle haue rewarde whiche also allowed dyuers put petie claymes whiche allowed semed e done kynges coronacion season great purueiauce made maner vitailes lordes knightes squiers sent countreys whiche came london day great nomber people receiuyng conueiyng coronacion quene anne vvyfe high mightie prince kyng henry eight kynges highnes addressed gracious letter maior cominaltie citie signifiyng pleasure solempnise celebrate coronacion moste deare welbeloued wyfe quene anne westminster whitsonday nexte ensuyng willyng theim make preparacion aswell fetche grace grenewyche tower water see citie ordered garnished pageautes place accustomed honor grace conueyed tower westminster common counsail called comaundement geuen haberdasher craft maior sir stephen pecocke prepare barge batchelers wafter foyst garnished wich banner streamer likewyse vse dooe maior presented westminster morowe symon iude also craftes commaunded prepare barge garnishe alonely banner accustomed also decke theim targettes side barge set vp suche semely banner bannorettes thei halle could gette mete furnishe sayd barge euery barge haue mynstrelsie accordyng whiche commaundementes great preparacion made thynges necessary suche noble triumph commyng vvater grenevvyche thursday xix day maye maior brother scarlet suche wer knightes collers es remnant hauyng good chaynes counsail citie assembled saint mari hyll one clocke discended newstayre barge whiche garnished many goodly baners stremers richely couered whiche barge shalmes shagbushes diuers instrumentes whiche continually made goodly armony maior brother wer barge seyng companyes nomber fiftie barge ready wayte vpo theim gaue commaundement companyes barge rowe nerer another twyse length barge vpon great paine see order kept thre light wheryes prepared euery one two officer call kepe order whiche commaundement geuen set forth order hereafter discribed fyrst maiors barge foyst wafter full ordinaunce whiche foyst great dragon continually mouyng castyng wyldfyer round sayd foyst stode terrible monster wylde men castyng fyer makyng hidious noyses next foyst good distaunce came maiors barge whose right hand batchelers barge whiche trumpettes diuers melodious instrumentes deckes sayd barge sailyardes toppe castle hanged riche cloth golde silke foreship sterne two great banner riche beaten armes kyng quene toppe castle also long stremer newly beaten sayd armes side barge sette full flagges banner deuises company haberdasher marchauntes aduenturers cordes haged innumerable penselles hauyng litle belle ye endes whiche made goodly noyse goodly sight waueryng wynde outsyde barge thre dosen scochyons metal armes kyng quene whiche beaten vpon square bocrame deuided right side kinges color left syde quenes whiche scochyons fastened clothes gold siluer hangyng deckes left hand left hand maior another foyst whiche mount thesame stode white fawcon crouned vpon rote golde enuironed white rose red whiche quenes deuise whiche mount satte virgyns singyng plaiyng swetely next maior folowed felowship haberdasher next mercer grocer euery company order last maiors shiriffes officer euery company hauyng melodye barge himselfe goodly garnished banner garnished silke arras riche carpettes whiche goodly sight beholde order owed grenewyche point next beyond grenewyche turned backward another order wete maior shiriffes officer first meanest craft next ascendyng vttermost craftes order ye maior last go poules christmas order rowed douneward grenewiche toune cast anker makyng great melody thre clocke quene appeared riche clothe golde entered barge acco panied diuers lady gentlewoman incontinent citizen set forwardes order minstrel continually plaiyng batchelers barge goyng quenes right hand whiche tooke great pleasure beholde aboute quenes barge many noble men duke suffolke marque dorset erle wylshyre father erles arrondel darby rutland worceter huntyngton sussex oxford many bishoppes nobleman euery one barge goodly sight behold thus beyng accompanied rowed towarde tower meane way shippes whiche commaunded lye shore lettyng barge shotte diuers peales gunnes landed meruailous shotte tower euer harde landyng met lord chamberlain officer armes brougth kyng receiued louyng countenaunce posterne water syde kyssed turned backe againe thanked maior citezens many goodly wordes entred tower entry citezens houed tower makyng great melody went alande none wer assigned land maior recorder two alderman speake people stode euery shore beholde sight sawe would beleue fryday diner serued kyng suche aswere appointed highnes knightes bath whiche dyner brought chamber night bathed shreuen accordyng old vsage england next day mornyng kyng dubbed theim accordyng tot ceremony thereto belongyng whose name ensueth marque dorset erle darby lorde clyfforde lorde fitzwater lorde hastynges lorde mountaigle sir ihon mordant lorde uaux sir henry parker sir wyllyam wynsore sir fraunces weston sir thomas arrondell sir iohn hulstone sir thomas pownynges sir henry sauell sir george fitzwillyam sir ihon tyndall sir thomas iermey saterday xxxi day receiuyng conueiyng quene london entent horse slide pauement ye people hurted horse high stretes quene passe graueled tower temple barre railed one side within whiche rayles stode craftes along order grace churche marchauntes styllyard stode till litle conduite chepe alderman stode ther syde strete stode constable citie apparelled veluet silke great staues handes cause people kepe rome good order stretes somewhat ordered maior clothed goune crimosyn ueluet riche collor es two footemen clad white red damaske roade tower geue attendance quene shiriffes officer wayte till came tower hill takyng leaue roade doune high streates commaundyng constable see rome good order kept went stode alderman chepe quene traine come cornehill gracious streate hanged fyne scarlet crimosyn grayned clothes place riche arras tapestry carpettes moste part chepe ha ged clothe tyssue golde ueluet many riche hangynges whiche made goodly shewe wyndowes replenished ladyes gentlewoman beholde quene trayne shuld passe fyrst quenes company set forward xii frenchemen whiche belongyng frenche ambassador clothed coates blewe veluet steues yelowe blewe veluet horse trapped close trapper blewe sarcenet poudered white cross theim marched gentleman squiers knightes ii ii iudges knightes bath uiolet gounes hoddes purfeled miniuer lyke doctor abbottes baron bishoppes erles marquess lorde chauncelor england archebishop yorke ambassador uenice archebishop cauntorbury ambassador fraunce roade ii squiers honor wt robe estate rolled worne baudrike wise neckes cappes estate represetyng duke normandy acquitaine roade maior london wt mace garter coate armes whiche maior bare mase westminster halle roade lorde wylliam haward wt marshal rod deputie brother ye duke norffolke marshall england whiche ambassador fraunce right hand roade charles duke suffolke day high constable england bearyng verder siluer appertainyng office constableship lordes moste parte clothed crimosyn veluet quenes seruauntes officer armes scarlet next befor quene road chaucelor barcheded sergeautes officer armes roade side lordes came quene litter white cloth golde couered bayled whiche led ii palferies clad white damaske doune ground head led fotemen circot white clothe tyssue mantle thesame furred ermyne heere haged doune head coyffe circlet ful riche stone ouer borne canapie clothe golde iiii gilte staues iiii siluer belle bearyng whiche canapye appointed xvi knightes iiii beare one space foote iiii another space accordyng owne appointment next quene roade lorde borough chaberlain next wyllia coffyn master horse leadyng spa e horse syde saddie trapped doune wt clothe tyssue roade vii ladyes crimosyn veluet turned vp cloth gold tyssue horse trapped cloth gold ii chariotes couered wt red cloth gold fyrst chariot ii ladyes whiche ye olde duches norfolke old marchiones dorset secod chariot wer iiiii lady crimosyn veluet theim roade vii ladyes suite horse trapper theim came third chariot white vi ladyes crimosyn veluet next came fowerth chariot redde viii lady also crimosyn ueluet f lowed xxx getlewomen veluet silke liuery lady gaue attendaunce folowed garde coates goldsmythes worke whiche order roade forth till came fanchurche made pageaunt child apparelled like marchauntes whiche welcommed citie two proper preposicions frenche englishe fro thence roade gracious church corner costly meruailous connyng pageaunt made marchauntes styllyarde mount pernasus fountayne helycon white marble iiii streames wt pype rise ell hye mette together litle cuppe aboue foutain fountain ranne aboundantly racked rennishe wyne til night mountaine satte appollo feete satte calliope euery syde mountain satte iiii mus plaiyng seueral swete instrumentes feete epigrammes poyses written golden letter whiche euery muse accordyng propertie praised quene thence passed leaden halle goodly pageaunt type heauenly toffe vnder type rote golde set litle mountaine enuironed red rose white type came doune fawcon white sate vpo rote incontinent came doune angell great melody set close croune golde fawcons head pageaut satte saint anne issue beneth vnder mari cleop satte iiii child whiche child one made goodly oracion quene fruitfulnes saint anne generacion trustyng like fruite come passed conduicte cornehill wer thre grace set throne afore spryng grace continually ronnyng wyne afore foutain satte poete claring property euery grace done euery lady selfe accordyng propertie gaue quene seueral gift grace done passed great coduite chepe whiche newly painted armes deuises whiche conduit goodly fountain set one end rane continually wyne white claret noone rode standard richely painted ymages kynges quenes hanged baners armes toppe meruailous swete armony song instrument went forward crosse whiche newly gilt til came alderman stode master baker recorder came lowe reuerence makyng proper briefe proposicion gaue name citie thousand markes golde purse golde whiche thankefully accepted many goodly wordes roade lytle conduite riche pageaunt full melodye song whiche pageaunt pallas iuno uenus stode mercury whiche name iii goddess gaue balle gold deuyded thre signifiyng thre giftes ye thre goddess gaue saye wysedome ryches felicitie entred paules gate pretie pageaunt whiche satte thre ladyes rychely clothed circle head written regina anna prospere procede e regna lady middes tablet whiche written veni amica coronaberis vnder tablet satte angell close croune ladye sittyng right hande tablet syluer whiche written domine direcre gressus meos third ladye tablet golde letter asure written confido domino vnder feete written anna regina nominum regis de sanguine narum cum paries populis ea secla tuis ladyes cast doune wafer whiche two verse written thence passed east ende paules churcheyarde schole stode affolde two hundreth child well apparelled whiche sayd diuers goodly verse poetes translated englishe honor kyng whiche highly commended came ludgate gate newly garnished golde byse lede sainct martyns churche stode goodly quere singyng men child whiche sang newe balades made praise passed ludgate proceded towarde fletestrete conduict newely painted armes angel refreshed chyme melodiously sownyng upon conduite made toune iiii turrettes euery turret stode one cardinall vertues token property whiche seueral speches promisyng quene neuer leaue aydyng comfortyng myddes tower closely suche seueral solempne instrumetes semed heauenly noyse muche regarded praised beside sayd conduyte ranne wyne claret red al afternoone companye maior roade forth temple barre whiche newly painted repayred stode also diuers singyngmen child til came westminster halle whiche richely ha ged clothe arras newe glased myddes halle taken littre led vp high dece vnder clothe estate whose lefte hand cupborde x stage merueilous riche beutifull behold within litle season brought quene solempne seruice great standyng spyce plate voyde spice subtilties ipocras wynes whiche sent doune ladyes ladyes dronke gaue hartie thakes lordes ladyes maior geuen attendance withdrew selfe fewe ladyes whitehalle chamber shifted went barge secretely kyng manor westminster rested night sonday beyng vvhitsonday first day iune day coronacion sonday maior cladde crimosyn veluet collor alderman shiriffes scarlet counsail citie tooke barge crane seuen clocke came westminster thei wer welcomed brought ye halle master treasorer kynges house gaue attendaunce till quene come forth betwene viii ix came halle stoode vnder clothe estate came kynges chapel monkes westminster riche cope many bishoppes abbottes cope miter whiche went middes halle stode season raye clothe spred quenes standyng halle palace saintuary whiche railed bothe sydes high aulter westminster raye clothe cast officer armes appointed order accustomed fyrst went gentleman esquiers knightes alderman citie clokes scarlet iudges mantel scarlet coyffes folowed knightes bathe beyng lordes euery hauyng white lace left sleue folowed baron vicountes parliament robe scarlet came erles marquess duke robe estate crimosyn veluet furred ermyne poudered accordyng degr e came lorde chau celor robe scarlet open bordered lettice came kynges chapel monkes solempnely singyng procession came abbottes bishoppes mitered sergeauntes officer armes went maior london mace garter cote armes went marque dorcet robe estate whiche bare scepter gold erle arrondel whiche bare rod yuery doue together went alone erle oxforde high chamberlain england whiche bare croune went duke suffolke robe estate also day beyng high stewarde england hauyng long white rod hande lorde wyllyam hawarde rodde marshalship euery knight garter collor order proceded forth quene circot robe purple ueluet furred ermyne coyffe circlet saterday ouer borne canape iiii v porte crimosyn pointes blewe red hangyng sleues bishoppes lodon wynchester bare vp lappes quenes robe quenes traine whiche long borne old dutch norffolke folowed lady beyng lordes wyues whiche circottes scarlet narow sleues brest lettice wt barres accordyng degree ouer mantel scarlet furred euery mantle lettice necke like neckercher likewise poudered ye pouderynges degre knowen folowed lady bryng knightes wyues gounes scarlet wt narow sleues without traines edged lettice likewise quenes gentlewoman thus brought high place made middes churche betwene quere high alter set riche chayre rested discended doune high alter prostrate self archebishop cauntorbury sayd certaine collettes rose bishop anoynted head brest led vp againe diuers orison sayd archebishop set croune saint edward head deliuered scepter gold right hand rod iuery doue left hand quere sang te deum c fone bishop toke croune saint edward beyng heuy sette croune made went masse offertory begon discended doune offred beyng crouned asceded vp sate chayre till agnus went doune kneled alter receiued archbishop holy sacrament went vp place againe masse done went saint edwardes shryne offered whiche offeryng done withdrewe litle place made none one side quere ye meane season euery duches put bonettes coronal gold wrought flower euery marquess put demy coronal golde euery county plaine circlet gold wtout flower euery kyng armes put croune coper gilte whiche worne till night quene litle reposed company returned order set forth quene went crouned lady aforesayd right hand sustayned erle wylshire father left hand lorde talbot deputie erle shrewsbury lorde forynfal father saintuary appered within palace trumpettes played meruailous freshely brought westminster halle withdrawyng chamber duryng whiche tyme ye lordes iudges maior alderman put robe mantel clokes toke hoddes neckes cast shoulder lordes satte onely circottes iudges alderman gounes lordes serued day serued circottes hoddes aboute shoulder also diuers officer kinges house beyng lordes circottes hoddes scarlet edged myniuer treasorer controller master iuel house circottes gilte order sittyng diner quene chamber euery lord ought seruice coronacions prepare according dutie duke suffolke high steward england whiche richely apparelled doblet aket set orient perle goune crimosin veluet enbrodered courser trapped cloth trapper head ground crimosyn ueluet set full letter golde goldsmithes worke hauyng long white rodde hand left hand roade lord wylliam deputie brother erle marshal marshal rod whose goune c imosyn veluet horse trapper purple veluet cut white satten enbrodered white lyon erle oxforde high chamberlaine erle essex caruer erle sussex suer erle arrondel chiefe butler xii citizen london geue attendaunce cupbord erle darby cupberer uicount lysle panter lorde burgayne chiefe larder lorde bray almoner coperteners maior oxford kept buttry barre thomas wiat chiefe eurer sir henry wiat father thyng ready quene vnder canapy came halle washed satte doune middes table vnder cloth estate right side chayre stode countesse oxforde wydowe left side stode countesse worcester dyner season diuers tymes dyner tyme hold fyne cloth quenes face list spet otherwyse pleasure table ende satte archebishoppe cauntorbury right hande quene myddest betwene archebishoppe countesse oxforde stode erle oxforde white staffe diner tyme quenes feete vnder table satte ii gentlewoman dyner tyme thynges thus ordered came duke suffolke lorde wyllyam haward horsebacke sergeauntes armes sewer knightes bath bringyng first course whiche xxviii dish beside subtilties shippes made waxe meruailous gorgious beholde whiche tyme seruice trumpettes stading wyndow netherende halle played melodiously grace setued two dish archebishoppes seruice set doune whose sewer came equal thirde dishe quenes seruice left hand quene archebishop serued baron porte began table right hand next wall next table sat master clerkes chau cery beneth table doctor gentleman table next walle left hande cupborde begon maior alderman chamberlain counsail citie lodon beneth satte substancial marchautes douneward worshipfull persones table right hand ye middes halle sat lorde chauncelor temporall lordes right side table circottes lefte side thesame table sat bishoppes abbottes parliament robe beneth sat iudges seriantes kynges counsaill beneth knightes bathe table left hande middle part sat ducheses marque countess baroness robe lady circottes gentle woman gounes al whiche lady gentle woman sat left side table long none rightside thus set thei incontinent serued quickely maruaill seruitors gaue good attendance meate drynke ne thyng el neded called whiche greate multitude maruaill touchyng fare ther could deuised costlier dish subtilties maior london serued xxxiii dish twoo course wer brother suche sat table quene seconde course xxiiii dish thirtie thirde course betwene twoo last course kynges armes cried large three partes hall stode place bekins kynges benche right hande cloyster stephes made litle closet whiche kyng diuerse ambassador stoode behold seruice duke suffolke lorde willyam rode often tymes aboute hall cheryng lordes lady maior brother thei dined thei wafer ypocras thei washed commaunded rise stande still place table fourmes till quene washed taken wafer ypocrase table taken vp erle rutlande brought vp surnap laied bordes ende immediatly drawen cast master rode marshal hall quene washed archebishop surnap drawen arose stode middes hall place erle sussex goodly spice plate brought voyde spice comfettes hym maior london brought standyng cuppe golde set cup assaie gold dronke gaue maior cuppe cuppe assaie leyar accordyng claime citee thankyng hym brother pain vnder canapie departed chamber entry chamber gaue canapy belle baron porte accordyng clayme greate thankes maior london bearyng cuppe hande brother went hall barge noble men gentleman sixe clocke mondaie iustes tilte kynges gate maior brother goodly stadyng wer fewe speres broken reason horse would cope wednesdaie kyng sent maior brother westminster hymself gaue theim hartie thankes many goodly wordes midsomer daie lady mary frenche quene died suffolke lordship late wife lewes xii maried charles duke suffolk buried season kyng kepte progresse aboute london quene vii daie september beyng sondaie betwene thre foure clocke noonethe christenyng lady elizabeth quene deliuered faire lady whiche daie duke norffolke came home christenyng quenes good deliueraunce te deum song continently great preparacion made christenyng maior brother xl chief citezens commaunded bee christenyng wednesdaie folowyng vpon whiche daie maior sir stephen pecocke goune crimosin ueluet coller alderman scarlet collers cheines counsaill citee theim tooke barge diner one clocke citezes another barge rowed grenewiche many lordes knightes gentleman assembled walles betwene kynges place frier hanged arras waie strawed grene rushis frier church also hanged arras funt siluer stoode middes churche three steppe high whiche couered fine clothe diuerse gentleman aperns towelles neckes gaue attendaunce aboute filthe come funt ouer hong square canape crimosin satten fringed golde aboute rayle couered redde saye betwene quier body churche close place panne fire make child redy al thynges wer ordered child brought hall euery man set forward firste citezens two two gentleman esquiers chapeleins next theim alderman maior alone nexte maior kynges counsaill kynges chapel cope baron bishoppes erles came erle essex bearyng couered basin gilte hym marque excester taper virgin waxe next hym marque dorset bearyng salt behynd hym lady mary norffolk bearyng cresom whiche riche perle stone old duches norffolke bare childe mantell purple veluet long train furred ermine duke norffolke marshall rod went right hand thesaied duches duke suffolke left hande theim went officer armes countes kent bare long train childes mantell betwene countes kent child went therle wilshire right hand therle darby left hand supportyng thesaid train middes ouer thesaid child borne canapy lorde rocheford lorde husee lorde willya haward lorde thomas haward elder child folowed many lady gentlewoman child come churche dore bishop london met diuerse bishoppes abbottes mitred began obseruaunces sacrament godfather lorde archebishop cantorbury godmother old duches norffolke olde marchiones dorset widowes childe named elizabeth al thyng doen churche dore child brought fount christened doen garter chief kyng armes cried loude god infinite goodnes sende prosperous life long high mightie prince england elizabeth trumpettes blewe childe brought vp aultar gospell saied ouer immediatly archebishop cantorbury confirmed marchiones excester beyng godmother archebishop cantorbury gaue prince standyng cup gold duches norffolke gaue standyng cuppe golde fretted perale marchiones dorset gaue thre gilt boulle pounced couer marchiones excester gaue thre standyng bolles grauen gilt couer brought wafer comfettes ypocras suche plentie euery man asmuche would desire thei set forwardes trumpettes goyng thesame ordre towarde kynges place thei thei came thether warde sauyng giftes godfather godmother gaue wer borne child foure persones saie first sir ihon dudley bare gift lady excester lorde thomas haward younger bare gift lady dorset lorde fitzwater bare gift lady norffolk erle worcester bare gift archebishop cantorbury one side thei went full staffe torch nomber fiue hundred borne garde kynges seruauntes child borne many proper torch borne gentleman ordre thei brought prince quenes chamber taried brother alderman last duke norffolke suffolke came kyng thankyng theim hartely commaunded theim geue thankes name thence thei wer seller drynke went barge yere also one pauierpauyer toune clerke citee london hanged whiche surely man nowise could abide gospell bee englishe self heard hym saie wer swearyng great othe thought kynges highnes would set furth scripture englishe set red people aucthoritie rather would long liue would cut awn throte brake promes haue hard hanged hymself mynde intent god iudge season espied newe founde saincte holy hypocrite called maide kent whiche greate labor dilig nce pain takyng tharch bishop cantorbury lorde cromewell one called hugh latimer prieste whiche shortly made bishop worce er iugglyng craftie decept maide manifested brought light wherupon diuerse examinacions adherentes wer nouember brought starre cha ber name shall folowethe holy de kent firste elizabeth barton whiche called self ye holy maide kent richard master priest person aldyngton countie kent edward bockyng doctor diuinite mo ke cantorbury richarde deryng monke also cantorbury edward twaites gentleman thomas laurece register tharchedeacon cantorbury henry gold person aldermary bachiler diuinite hugh riche frier obseruaunt richard risby thomas gold gentleman beeyng starre chaber diuerse kynges counsaill confested feined hipocrisy dissimuled sanctitee treit rous purpose intentes kynges counsaill adiudged stand paules crosse wher thei aw e handes seuerally deliuer eche preacher bee appoynted bill declaryng subtile craftie supersticious doynges whiche thyng nexte sondaie thei aboue rehersed standyng stage paules crosse made purpose accomplishe treason committed matter therof respited parliamet nexte folowyng thei abouesaid ye shall wer attainted act parliam suffered death traitor hangyng drawyng quarteryng tyborne september kyng scottes sent commissioner toune newe castle wer kyng englande commissioner sir thomas clifford doctor magnus sir raufe elderkare first scottes without long communicacion demaunded greate amendes saiyng englishman robbed spoyled theim losse greatly saied kyng england honor must nedes make satisfaccion would called honorable answered notwithstandyng league written sealed sworne scottishe nacio would neuer kepe peace somuch treatyng people robbyng wherfore kyng demaundeth goodes prisoner taken contrary peace wherof deliuer writyng scottes receiued next metyng thei saied shippes wer lawfull prises reason therle anguishe maintened englande whiche rebel kyng therle haue doen v muche skathe haue taken shippes recompence pa greate loss whiche maie deliuer therfore parie demaunde theim wee deliuer boke whiche amounteth greater somme tenne thousande marke englishe commissioner receiued boke thesame scottes demaunded recompence burnyng tounes destroiyng many strong pile aboue xxiiii whiche destroyed xxiiii daie aprill laste xxiiii yere kyng xxx daie aprill englishe comissioners answered scottes would send kyng englade thei doubted thei haue good answer kyng englande bad hym chose peace warre thei agreed sende bothe kynges letter doynges whiche haste dooen muche suite scottes parte thei muche demaunded litle nothyng graunted thei beyng wery warre desired peace whiche concluded duryng bothe kynges liues twentie daie maie next yere kyng folowyng openly proclaimed greate comforte reioysyng louers peace xviii daie december duke suffolke sent kyng counsaill bugden beside huntyngdon lady katheryne prince dowager laye kyng aduertised good proues thesame froward mynde would consent neither determinacion uniuersities yet sentence whole conuocacion realme beyng counsailed fewe spaniardes whiche litle lernyng could infringe determinacion thesaid uniuersities clergie somuche wrote pope potentate greue kyng realme would folowe mynd breake commaundement god wherefore kynges counsaill mocioned kyng suche wer moued thereto put thei thought reason haue suche libertie woorke hyng whiche kyng an realme might haue detriment damage wherefore thesaied duke sent whiche shewed openly article suite pope howe soughte meanes greue kyng realme whiche hereafter suffered dooe thesame tyme cursse sent popethe pope accurssed kyng realme whiche accurssed bothe kyng whole realme whiche cursse bearer thereof beeyng like hardiest manne euer shewed hymself front battaill thought greate deale better hym bestowe without kynges reche aduenture come within dominion therefore set vp toune dunkercke flaunders taken doune wyllyam locke mercer londonwillya lock mercer quene answered duke highly obstinately many high woordes sodainly fury departed hym priuie chamber shutte doore seeyng brake ordre quenes courte discharged greate sorte housholde seruauntes yet lefte conuenient nomber serue like prince greate lamentacion emong theim departed remedy thei remaigned serue sworne serue prince dowager quene saied thei sworne quene otherwise thei would serue thei departed wer sworne serue prince remained vtterly refused seruauntes wherfore remained lesse nomber seruauntes kyng kept christmas grenewiche greate solempnitee christmas beganne parliament whiche parliament elizabeth barton holy maide kent adherentes ye haue heard attaynted offence bothe god kyng greate wicked like neuer heard knowen declare vnto processe matter suche maner truthe thereof declared attainder acte parliament firste thesaied elizabeth barton beeyng nonne professed house priory sainct pulcres cauntorbury whiche long professed nonne dwelled one thomas cobbe parishe aldyngton countie kent happened bee visited sickenes occasion thereof brought suche debilitie weakenes brayne could eate ne drynke long space violence infirmitie semed bee traunses spake vttered many foolishe idle woordes one richarde master clerke beeyng persone thesaied parishe aldyngton thesaied countie kent made late archebishoppe cauntorbury farre larger reporte concernyng hypocrisy traunses speaches thesaied elizabeth could iustifie abide commaunded thesaied archebishop geue good attendaunce vpo shoud fortune haue suche traunses speaches sende hym knowlege thereof intent mainteigne vphold verefy suche reporte made aswell archebishoppe aforesaied wounderfull traunses speaches thesaied nonne falsely craftely informed thesaid elizabeth merueilous wordes whiche spake traunses afore ridyng archebishop aforsaied proceded inspiracion holy ghost greatly blamed would hide dissemble wonderfull workes god shewed afore saied informacion instruccion saied constantly could remember spake suche notable wordes traunses reported vnto thesaied richard master whiche elizabeth beeyng maner wise often tymes perswaded procured informed thesaied persone aloyngton tooke boldenes courage forge feigne counterfeat suche maner tra s craftie speaches thesaied persone aldyngton told vsed sickenes afore went thesaid archbishoppe thesaid elizabeth vsed false feigned cou terfeatyng ceason perfecte therein fame thereof greatly spred abroade party thesaied person intent aforsaid intent people geue faithe credite vnto would haue increased deuocion people commyng pilgrimage chapell set courte stete within thesaied parishe dedicate honour lady awne lucre auauntage imagined deuised compassed declared aide helpe counsaiill one edwarde bockyng monke professed monastery christes churche cauntorbury doctor diuinitee thesaied elizabeth beyng extasy extremitie sickenes maner distract trauses saie emongest wounderfull woordes neuer take healthe body till suche tyme visited image lady beeyng thesaied chapell courte strete aforesaied lady appered vnto shewed came thesaied chapell daie appoynted restored health miracle deede restored perfecte health diet phisike course nature whiche expelled matter beyng cause sickenes meane tyme thesaid person aldyngton archebishoppe afore rehersed albeit thesaied elizabeth restored healthe yet beeyng accustomed acquainted maner fashion distracte traunses counsaiell conspiracie confede ie thesaied edwarde bockyng richarde master falsely practise vse shewe vnto people diuerse merueilous sondery alteracions sensible partes body craftely vtteryng saied feigned false traunses diuerse many verteous holy woordes tendyng rebuke synne reprouyng suche newe opinion beganne spryng realme whiche called heresyes induced taught thesaied edwarde bockyng richarde master vsyng way false hypocrisy intent people geue belefe credence vnto whereby thei might bee soner brought detestable crymes blasphemie idolatrie agaynste almightie god thesaied edwarde bockyng beeyng maliciously fixed opinion agaynste kynges highnes detested matrimonie quene katheryne intendyng mynde afterwardes parte falsely trayterously vse thesaied elizabeth diabolicke instrument stirre moue prouoke people realme aswell noble murmoure grudge agaynste maiestie oure soucreigne lorde iuste lawfull procedynges thesaied deuorce feperacion deede accomplishyng saied false malicious trayterous intentes falsely deuised conspired thesaied richarde thesaied elizabeth shewe manifest self people bee excellent verteous holy woman woordes deedes appere worlde procede maru ilous holines rebukyng common synnes vice worlde though taught inspired holy spirite god onely moued counsailed thesaied elizabeth thus vse self surmittyng spake suche thynges extasy sickenes came inspiracion god also counsailed procured thesaied elizabeth bee brought conueighed thesaied chapell oure lady therein openly presence people assembled procurementes vse experiment suche like traunses alteracions face outward sensible partes body vsed extremitie extasy sickenes whose counsailes aduertisementes thesaied elizabeth agreed whereupon daie appoynted agreed thesaied edward richard laboured solicited procured aboue nomber twoo thousande persones repaire thesaied chapel surmittyng thesaied elizabeth whiche thei saied marueilous many uisions reuelacions god bee broughte thether receiue healthe miracle oure lady whose image thesaied chapell reason whiche false feigned detestable conspiracy hypocrysy daie theim appoynted assembled thesaied chapell aboue nomber twoo thousande people whiche daie also thesaied edwarde bockyng richarde master procured caused thesaied elizabeth repaire thesaied chapell thesaied elizabeth albeit tyme long afore restored healthe bodie discharged tormentes affliccions whiche extasy sickenes yet neuertheles procurement craftie counsaill thesaied edwarde bockyng richard master falsely feigne shewe vnto people thesame chapell many alteracions face outward sensible partes body falsely feigned shewed self traunces vtteryng wonderous woordes subtelly craftely induced taught thesaied richarde edwarde dooe emonges thynges vttered pleasure god thesaied edwarde bockyng bee ghostly father bee religious woman taught thesaied edward bockyng richard master within demonstracion suche false feigned dissimuled traunces appered people bee sodainly reueled sickenes affliccions intercession meanes image oure lady beeyng thesame chapell meanes whiche false feigned hypocrysy dissimuled cloked sanctitee conspired craftely imagined thesaied edwarde bockyng richarde master thesaied elizabeth brought meruellous fame credite good opinion greate multitude people realme increase ame thesaid false feigned hypocrisy thesaid elizabeth wardes counsaill procurement thesaied edwarde bockyng entered religion became nonne professed thesaied priory sainct sepulchre thesaied edwarde bockyng commonly resorte without probable vehement violent suspicion incontinencie pretendyng bee ghostly father goddes appoyntment conspiracy betwene caused still persist abide practisyng said false hipocrisy dissimulyng traunces raptes surmit people suche simuled alteracio sensible partes body rapt almightie god thaffeccions worlde tolde holy spirite god many thynges folowe worlde punishement synnes prince people also muche prouoked tempted aswell synne fleshe otherwise ghostly enemie deuill diuerse sondry tymes diuerse sondery way fashion yet neuer theles grace almightie god preserued stedfastly resisted suche temptacion
