occasion whiche counsaill procurement thesaid edward bockyng thesaid elizabeth continuaunce tyme toke suche courage vpon falsely feined saied many reuelacions almightie god holy saincte heuenly lightes heuenly voyces heuenly melody ioyes specially chapell giles thesaid nonnery whiche chapell often tymes resorted receiue vision reuelacions co maunded god falsely reported specially night saiyng dorture doore made open goddes power vtteryng thesame aswell thesaied edward bockyng diuerse persones whiche false feined reuelacions cloked hipocrisy reputed emongest many people realme holy woman inspired god deede neuer vision reuelacion god hath plainly openly confessed self therefore stealyng furthe dorture nighte whiche twise wekely spiritual busines receiue reuelacios god rather bodely comunicacio pleasure fredes could haue goodleasure oportunite daie andfor ratificacio false feined reuelacios thesaid edward cospiracy betwene thesaid elizabeth reueled thesame reueret father willya late archbishop catorbury false vntrue surmise tale lie thesaid edward elizabeth allured brought induced credite theim made diligent serches triall saied falsehodes consideracions suffered admitted thesame blasphemie almightie god great deceit prince people realme perpetuall memory thesaid feined dissimuled hipocrisy false reuelacions thesaied elizabeth thesaied edward bockyng richard master one ihon deryng monke thesaid monastery christes churche forsaied made writ caused written sondery bokes bothe greate small bothe printed written concernyng perticularities thesaied false feined hipocrisy reuelacios thesaid elizabeth defece great praise thesame surmittyng puttyng furth thesame false feined practises reuelacios thesaid elizabeth iust true miracle shewed almightie god fauor sanctitee thesaid elizabeth dede thei wer falsely deuised compassed cospired written mainteined thesaid elizabeth barton edward bockyng richard master iho deryng thonly intet bryng thesaid elizabeth fame credite people realme wherby people bee apt disposed false cloked hipocrisy sanctitee commit crime blasphemy ydolatrie god also soner induced false reuelacions thesaied elizabeth murnor grudge euill opinion maiestie souereigne lorde great perill dauger moste royall person one edward thwaites getleman traslated wrote diuerse quaiers shetes paper concernyng thesaid false feined reuelacions thesaied elizabeth also one thomas laurence cantorbury beyng regester tharchebishop cantorbury thinstance desire thesaid edward bockyng wrote greate boke thesaied false feined miracle reuelacions thesaid elizabeth faire hand redy bee copie printer thesaied boke put stampe emonges whiche false feined reuelacions surmised thesaied elizabeth put writynges diuerse bokes false cospiracie meanes procurement thesaid edward bockyng richard master ihon deryng complices expressed deuill appere thesaied elizabeth diuerse fashion sometymes like man wantonly appareiled sometyme like birde deformed sometyme otherwise mary magdalene often apere thesaied elizabeth reuele many reuelacions one tyme deliuer vnto letter written heuen part wherof limmed golden letter deede thesame letter written hande monke sainct augustine cantorbury named hawkhurst also written coteined emongest thesaid false feined miracle reuelacios kynges highnes calice thenteruewe betwene maiestie frenche kyng heryng masse churche lady calice god displeased kynges highnes grace sawe masse blessed sacrament fourme bread taken awaie fro priest beyng masse angell ministered vnto thesaid elizabeth beyng present inuisible sodainly conueighed rapt thence power god thesaied nonnery professed many false feined fable tale deuised conspired defended thesaid elizabeth edward bockyng ihon deryng writce miracle thesaid bokes memorial set furth false feined hypocrisy cloked sanctitee thesaied elizabeth people realme thesaied sondery bokes writynges therof made seen examined kynges moste honorable cousaill plainly ape eth whiche bokes written termes senteces reproch slaunder kynges highnes quene wer shameful writte vile vngracious persos liuyng whiche would abhorre euery true subiect realme thesaid elizabeth suche false feined hipocrisy dissimuled sanctitee brought great brute fame people sondry party realme thesaid edward bockyng procurement secret conspiracy diuerse persones vnknowen whiche maligned kynges procedynges seperacion deuorse thesaied detested vnlawfull mariage traiterously intendyng put kynges highnes murmor euil opinion people thesame counsailed irred thesaid elizabeth aske peticio almightie god knowe whether god displeased kynges highnes procedyng thesaid deuorce seperacion mariage betwene highnes thesaied lady katherin declaryng many tymes diuerse learned men realme many common people thesame firme opinion kynges procedyng thesaied deuorce lawes god wherupon thesaid elizabeth subtlely craftely concerning opinion mynd thesaied edward willyng please hym reueled shewed vnto thesaied edward knowlege reuelacion fro god god highly displeased souereigne lorde matter case desisted procedinges thesaid deuorce seperacion pursued thesame maried within one moneth suche mariage lenger kyng realme reputacion almightie god king one daie one houre dye villeines death saiyng farther roote iii braunches til thei wer plucked vp neuer mery england interpretyng roote late lord cardinal first braunche kyng souereigne lorde secod duke norffolke iii duke suffolk whiche false feined reuelacios mischeuous malicious cousail conspiracie thesaid edward bockyng said elizabeth wer written expressed thesaied bokes volume conteignyng false feined reuelacions miracle thesaied elizabeth perpetuall memory thereof vtter reproche perell destruccion kynges persone honor fame name priuely secretly set furthe thesaied elizabeth edward bockyng ihon deryng richarde master generally diuerse many kynges subiectes specially electe persones ihon bishoppe rochester ihon adeson clerke chapelain thesaied bishop one henry gold priest bacheler diuinitee hugh riche frier obseruaunt late wardein frier obseruauntes cantorbury whiche beare malice malignitie kynges procedynges thesaied deuorse seperacion contrary peruerse froward opinion intendyng colour thesaied false feined hypocrisy reuelacions thesaied elizabeth onely let thesaied deuorse seperacion also bryng set furth secretly heddes people realme aswel noble al kynges actes procedynges thesame holy scripture pleasure almightie god whereby kynges highnes brought grudge euill opinion people thesaied ihon bishoppe rochester henry gold hugh riche richard risby richard master ihon deryng sondery seuerall tymes place spake thesaid elizabeth toke relacion thesaied false feined reuelacions whiche feined almightie god aswell concernyng kynges highnes fourme termes aboue specified hauyng knowlege therof thesaied hugh riche richard risby henry golde clerke gaue suche firme constant credite thereunto thei trayterously conceled fro kynges highnes trayteroyusly beleued harte kyng souereigne lorde ter late mariage solempnized betwene highnes moste dere entierly beloued wife quene anne lenger rightfull kyng realme reputacion almightie god whereby harte willes thei trayterous withdrewe highnes naturall dueties obedience secretly taught moued persones thei reueled thesaid false eined reuelacions thei ought might lawfully doo thesame wise practised thesaied matter kynges maiestie falsely maliciously trayterously sodery place tymes father nonnes syon diuerse monkes charter house london shene diuerse freers obseruauntes place richemont grenewiche cauntorbury diuerse bothe spirituall temporall persones greate nomber intent sowe secret murmor grudge harte kynges subiectes maiestie souereigne lorde procedynges thesaied diuorse seperacion intendyng therby make suche diuision rebellyng realme emongest kinges subiectes whereby kynges highnes onely haue put peril life also ieoperdy depriued croune dignitie royall playne perticuler declaracion malicious trayterous intentes sayd elizabeth edward bockyng ihon deryng hugh ryche rychard rysoy henry golde concluded confederacy among selfes eche set forth sermon prechynges thesayd reuelacions people realme kynges maiestie whensoeuer please sayd elizabeth appoint tyme agreed eche secretely set forth thesayd false fayned reuelacions acquayntaunce frendes realme intendyng make great multitude people realme secrete conspiracy aptnes receiue take suche sermon preachynges intended make aforesayd cocernyng premi e trayterously intedyng therby put sayd souereigne lorde peril life also ieopardye losse depriuacion croune dignitie royal realme fro lawfull succession euer accomplishyng false trayterous malicious intentes sayd souereigne lorde caused sayd elizabeth ii tymes secretely declare thesayd false fayned reuelacions ii pope orator ambassador city cautorbury london whiche tyme sayd henry golde tooke vpon interpretor therof betwene thesayd elizabeth thesayd orator named anthony pulleon interpretor orator named syluester foresayd lawrence cauntorbury entent kynges highnes procedynges thesayd deuorce seperacion brought euil opinion pope prince potentate sayd hugh ryche actually trauailed sondry place realme made secrete relacion premiss concernyng kynges highnes diuers lordes bothe spiritual temporal diuers persones lay lerned seculer religious sayd henry gold ouer actually trauailed made relacion therof thesayd lady katheryne prince dowager animate make commocion realme sayd souereigne lorde surmittyng thesayd elizabeth haue reuelacion god sayd lady katheryne prosper well issue lady mary kynges doughter prosper reigne realme haue many frendes sustaine maintayne sayd elizabeth edward bockyng ihon deryng richard master likewyse actually trauailed diuers place realme made secrete relacion thesayd false fayned hipocrysie reuelacions thesayd elizabeth gaue knowlege hereof dyuers sondry persones realme whiche conspiracy confederacy thesayd elizabeth complices aboue mencioned trayterously maliciously deuised practised sayd elizabeth edward bockyng ihon deryng rychard master henry golde hugh ryche rychard rysby entent trayterously destroy sayd souereigne lorde depriue lawfull succession fro croune dignitie royall realme whiche matter hath practised imagined amongest space many yeres whereof whole circumstaunce long written acte sayd ihon fysher bishop rochester one thomas gold gentleman thesayd thomas laurence edward thwaytes ihon adeson chapelein thesayd ihon bishop rochester hauyng knowlege false fained dissimuled reuelacions trayterously cospired sayd soueraigne lorde aforesayd neuerthelesse make concelement therof vttered sayd souereigne lorde honorable counsail dueties allegeaunce behalfe furthermore sayd thomas gold accomplishement trayterous intent hath late messenger fro thesayd elizabeth sithen warde tower london thesayd moste false trayterous offence sayd complices committed done beyng libertie message hath comforted dyuerse others stande stifly reuelacions god notwithstadyng confessed sayd falshed diuers kynges counsailours manifestly proued found tryed moste false vntrue whiche thyng raise put sedicion murmur people kynges highnes croune dignitie royal one thomas abel clerke beyng confederacie aforesayd takyng suche irme constant credite thesayd fals fayned reuelacions miracle thesayd nonne onely caused printed set forth realme dyuers bookes thesayd deuorce separacion disslaunder sayd souereigne lord also animated thesayd lady katherine obstinatly persist wilful opinion thesame deuorce separacion thesayd deuorce lawfully vsurpe take vpon still quene procured diuers writynges made name quene also procured abbetted seruauntes thesayd lady katheryne kynges expresse commaundement proclamacion name call accept repute thesayd lady katherine quene realme intent make comon diuision rebellion realme great peril daunger sayd souereigne lorde thus muche haue recited vnto act expressed worde worde foloweth maner attainder act large doeth appeare conclude xxi day april next folowyng drawen tyborne executed mooste iustly deserued may perceiue premiss place execucion present tyme suffered sayd wordesthe wordes elizabeth barton otherwyse call holy maide kent death hether come dye haue onely cause myne owne death whiche moste iustly haue deserued also cause death persones whiche tyme suffre yet say trueth somuche blamed cosideryng well knowen vnto lerned men poore wenche without learnyng therefore might haue easely perceiued thinges done could procede suche sorte capacity learnyng could right well iudge whence proceded wer altogether fayned thynges whiche fayned proffitable vnto therfore muche praised bare hande holy ghost theim beyng puft vp praise fell certain pryde folishe phantasie selfe thought might fayne would whiche thing hath brought case whiche cry god kynges highnes heartely mercy desire good people pray god haue mercy suffre parliament also made act succession suertie croune whiche euery persone beyng lawfull age sworne vpon payne expressed acte thesame ye may moste euidently see monday xxiii day marche parliament tyme solempnely receiued london ambassador iames v kyng scottes bishop aberdyne abbot kynlos adam otterborne kynges turney diuers gentleman attedant whiche brought taylers hall lodged day annunciacion lady brought kynges place westminster shewed commission message whiche kyng appointed dayes cousail shortly commissioner appointed shall heare duryng parliament tyme euery sonday preached paules crosse bishop whiche declared pope head churche xxx day marche parliament proroged euery lorde burges sworne act succession subscribed handes parchement fixed thesame othe parliament proroged till third day nouember next commission sent ouer england take othe men woman act succession whiche fewe repyned except doctor ihon fysher sir thomas moore knight late lorde chau celor doctor nicholas wylson parson saint thomas apostle london wherfore thre persones long exhortacion made bishop cauntorbury lambeth expresse denyall sworne sent tower remayned oftentymes mocioned sworne bishoppe sir thomas sayd thei writynges written prince dowager quene therfore might go doctor sayd preachyng called quene whiche would withsay howbeit length wel contented dissembled matter escaped twayne stode realme opinion yere chaunced two marchaunt straugers fell louewolfes wife harlot whiche called wolfe wyfe harlot often h unted straungers chamber one tyme thesame harlot appointed st auger come westminster prepar bote whiche bote one manne rowe whiche trong e ende boate laye wolfe husbad couered lether botemen vse couer cusshyns straungers satte doune mistrustyng nothing boteman brought theim farre place called turnyng tree sodainly stepped vp sayd wolfe dagger thrust one thorow cryed saue life offred great somme money boteman saue life proferres heard mercy would extende cruel murderer without pitie slew also bound theim face face threw thames foresayd place long found immediatly harlot wolfe wyfe went straungers chamber toke f thence muche could come last husband deserued apprehended arraigned hanged foresayd tu nyng tree hanged still cut doune vntil suche tyme knowen beastly filthy wretch moste shamefully abused beyng dead xxvi yere nynth day iuly lorde dacres north arreigned westminster high treasonthe old dacr north duke norffolke sat iudge high steward englad sayd lorde dacres beyng brought barre axe tower inditement red improued thesayd inditement false maliciously deuised answered euery part matter therin contained also manly wittily directly confuted accusors whiche ready auouche accusacions great shame great honor found day peres giltie whiche vndoubtedly common excedyngly ioyed reioy ed insomuche hall woordes giltie greatest shoute crye ioy like man liuyng may remembre euer heard xiiii day iuly one ihon frith beyng well learned andihon fri excellent goodly witte brought tower long imprisoned makyng booke purgatory meane whyle required one heartely loued good opinion declare faith opinion sacrament body bloud christ would put thesame writyng whiche thyng chauced thesame persone whiche writyng ihon frith acquainted taylor london called wyllyam holt whiche outwardely professed muche honestye inwardly verye spye verye betrayer many menne might bring daungier holt required seen haue writyng forthwith presented sir thomas lorde chaucelor immediatly made answere thesame writyng whiche also meanes thesayd holt came handes ihon frith ihon frith perceiuyng thing loth write meddle matter none could get talke sauyng suche much trusted selfe nowe farre spred abroade answered vnto litle rebuked negligence folye frende trusted stoode derence first treatise made farther declaracion mynde vpon thesame matter appereth booke whiche beareth name whiche opinion wt diuers sondry examinacions aswell lambeth bishop cauntorbury also croydon likewyse bishop wynche er brought vnto consistory paules churche london diuers bishoppes muche disputyng would yelde submit himselfe theim codempned deliuered seculer power brent heretike thesame tyme one andrew hewet simple vtterly vnlerned yong taylor whiche also betrayed foresayd holt yong man beyng like maner accused consistory thesayd bishoppes holding opinion sacrament one bishoppes asked beleued sacrament answered beleued therin master frith sayd doest thou beleue ye body christ really fleshe bloud euen borne virgyn mari sayd sayd bishop sayd christ byd yt beleue say christ christ alse christes false prophetes shal arise deceiue sayth christ certain bishop smyled doctor stokesley bishop lodon sayd frith heretike codempned deliuered temporal power brent thou wilt submit thy selfe acknowlege thyne errour thou shalt likewise condempned deliuered content sayd wylt thou abiure thyne heresie bishop sayd wil master frith doth condempne thee sayd ye bishop sayd pronounced sentence deliuered shiriffes thence sent newgate remained til xxii day iuly day brent one ake smythfelde thesame tyme one doctor cooke person hony lane one master temple willed people pray would pray dogges whiche vncharitable wordes frith smyled prayed god forgeue people sore grudged saiyng xiiii day august great fyer temple barre diuers house brent xvi day thesame moneth burned kynges stable charyng crosse otherwise called mowse wherin brent many great horse great store haye yere third day noueber kynges highnes helde high court parliament whiche cocluded made many sondry good wholsome godly statute among al one special estatute aucthorised kynges highnes supreme head churche englad whiche pope college cardinalles pardon indulgence vtterly abholished realmethe pope abholished god euerlastyngly praysed therefore parliament also geuen kynges highnes fyrst frutes tenthes dignity spiritual promocions ende parliament kynges maiestie mooste graciously graunted wylled thesame parliament established moste gracious general free pardon yere also came great admyrall fraunce whiche admyrall honorably receiued departyng liberally rewarded tyme dyed erle kyldare prisoner tower euen thesame tyme thomas fitzgarard sonne begane rebell kyng tooke kynges ordinaunce sent ambassador emperor haue intre ted take pa also slewe bishop deuelyn brent robbed suche would obeye last apprehended deserued shall appeare xxvii yere beginnyng yere duke norffolke bishop ely went caleys thether came admyral fraunce xix day iune thre monkes charterhouse hanged drawen quartred tyborne quarter set vp aboute lodon deniyng kyng supreme head churche name exmewe myddlemore nudigate men wer arreigned westminster behaued selfes stifly stubbornly hearyng inditement red trayterously spoken kynges maiestie croune dignitie neither blushed bashed folishly hipocritically knowleged treason whiche maliciously thei auouched hauyng lernyng defece rather beyng asked dyuers question thye vsed malicious silence thinkyng examinacions afterward tower london appeare sayd yt thought men ye lorde crumwel satte vpon iudgement heretiques churche god therfore worthy either aunswered spoken vnto therfore deserued receiued haue heard also xxii day thesame moneth ihon fysher bishop rochester beheaded head set vpon london bridgeihon fy bishop rochester bishop many menne lamented reported man great learnyng man good life therin wonderfully deceiued maintained pope supreme head ye church maliciously refused kynges tytle supreme head sayd pope helde manfully stoode stifly cause elect cardinal sent cardinalles hat farre caleys head haue stande high lodon bridge euer hat could come bishop fysher late therfore neither ware enioyed office man sayd accoumpted learned yea nota ly learned yet haue heard howe deceiued elizabeth barton called holy mayd kent doubt defence vsurped authoritie pitie wonderful man beyng lerned blind scripture god proueth supreme aucthoritie prince manyfestly also vi day iulye sir thomas beheaded likesir thomas oore behedded treason ore rehersed whiche haue heard deniyng kynges maiesties supremitie manne also coumpted learned haue heard lorde chauncelor england tyme great persecutor suche detested supremacy bi hop rome whiche himselfe highly fauored stoode till brought skaffolde tower hill blocke head striken shoulder harme cannot tell whether call foolishe wyseman wise foolishman vndoubtedly beside learnyng great witte myngled tauntyng mocking semed best knew thought nothyng wel spoken except ministred mocke communicacion insomuche commyng tower one officer demauded vpper garment fee meanyng goune answered shoul haue tooke cappe saiyng vppermoste g rment lykewise euen goyng death tower gate poore woman called vnto besought declare certaine euidences tyme e ice whiche appreheded could come would reate might haue agayn el vndone answered good woman haue pacience litle kyng good vnto euen within halfe houre discharge busyness helpe thee himselfe also went vp stayer skaffolde desired one shiriffes officer geue hand helpe vp sayd come doune againe let shift selfe aswell also hagman kneled doune askyng forgeuenes death maner sayd forgeue thee promise thee thou shalt neuer haue honestie strykyng head necke short also euen shuld lay doune head blocke hauyng great gray beard striked beard sayd hangma pray let lay beard ouer blocke least ye cut thus wt mocke ended life yere tyme kyng went progresse whiche gloucester westward kyng scottes installed wynsore lorde erskyn procurator october folowyng stephyn gardiner bishop winchester sent ambassador fraunce remained thre yeres nouember solempne procession citie london priestes religious citie recoueryng frenche kyng health viii day ianuary folowyng dyed prince dowager kymbalton buried peterborough quene anne ware yelowe mournyng february folowyng quene anne brought bedde aquene brough tyme childe tyme whiche borne dead yere moneth september wyllyam tyndale otherwyse called hichyns crueltie clergie louayn condempned burned toune besyde bruxelles braband calledwyllyem tyndall uylford man translated new testament englishe fyrst put prynt likewise translated v bookes moses iosua iudicum ruth bookes kynges bookes paralipomenon nehemias fyrst esoras prophet ionas nomore ye holy scripture made also diuers treatise many well lyked highly praysed many vtterly dispised abhorred especially moste part bishoppes realme often great labour caused proclamacions made bookes gatte condempned brent aswell newe testament woorkes doynges suche best knewe reported sobre man borne vpon border wale brought vp uniuersitie oxforde life conuersacion vnreprouable last beyng oxford luther settyng foorth certaine woorkes byshop rome tyndale occasioned theim searche scripture whether luther sayd trueth therby onely himselfe attaine knowlege vsurped aucthoritie bishop rome supersticious dampnable doctrynes taught published christendome also lamentyng ignoraunt state natiue countrey england altogether wrapped errours thought dutie god reueled light gospell bestowe talent honour god proffite countrey thought waye good reduce people errour fyrst make theim acquaynted goddes woorde might knowe goddes bishoppe rome sayd must therefore fyrst aforesayd translated englishe newe testament woorke doubt notable verye paynefull forced flye owne natiue countrey lyue straunge lande among people well varyed maners persones vnknowen amongest great paynes taken many dyuers treatise published andwarp yere one philippes englisheman scholar louayn betrayed taken many sayd without helpe procurement bishoppes realme true prison yere almost forgotten labored letter written lorde cromwell hast would recat part doynges burned haue hea yet report procurator generall whiche call liuetenaunt make homo doctus pius et bonus say learned godly good fowerth day february kyng held high court parliament westminster whiche many good wholsome statute lawes made concluded tyme geuen vnto kyng consent great fatte abbottes religious house value ccc marke vnder hope great monastery haue continued still euen tyme one sayd parliament house thornes great abbottes putrified olde okes must nedes folowe christendome doctor stokesley bishop london many yeres passed xxviii yere may day solempne iustes kept grenewyche sodainly iustes kyng departed hauyng aboue vi person came euenyng fro grenewyche place westminster sodain departyng many men mused moste chiefely quene next day apprehended brought fro grenewyche tower londonquene anne sent ower arreigned high treason condempned also thesame tyme likewyse apprehended lorde rocheforde brother thesayd quene henry norrys marke smeton wyllyam bruton sir fraunces weston kynges priuy chamber wer likewise committed tower arreigned condempned high treason gentleman beheaded skaffolde tower hyll quene sworde beheaded within tower folowyng woordes spake day death whiche xix day may good christen people come hether dyethe wordes quene anne bolleyn death accordyng lawe lawe iudged dye therefore wyll speake nothyng come hether accuse noman speake thyng wherof accused condempned dye pray god saue kyng sende long reigne ouer gentler mercyfull prince neuer euer good gentle soueraigne lorde persone medle cause require iudge best thus take leue worlde heartely desyre pray lorde haue mercy god comende oule kneled doune saiyng christ commende soule iesu receiue soule diuers tymes till head stryken sworde assencion day folowyng kyng ware whyte mournyng weke whitsontyde kyng maryed lady iane doughter right worshipfull sir ihon seymer knight whiche whitsontyde openly shewed quene viii day iune kyng helde high court parliament whiche parliament kynges two first mariages say lady katheryne lady anne bulleyn bothe adiudged vnlawful large appereth acte booke statute parliament ceason lorde thomas hawarde without kynges assent aff ed lady margaret douglas daughter quene scottes nece kyng whiche presumpteous acte attainted treason acte made like offendors dyed tower long prisoner tyme parliament bishoppes clergie realme helde solempne conuocacion paules churche lodon much disputacion debatyng matter thei published booke religion intitled article deuised kinges highnes c booke specially mencioned iii sacramentes whiche lyncolneshyremen meane ignoraunt priestes offended occasion depraued kynges doynges first beginnyng ye shall plainly heare booke whiche passed kynges aucthoritie co sent clergie published whiche cotained certaine article religion necessary taught vnto people among specially treated nomore thre sacramentes alwaies people taught vii sacramentes beside booke certain iniunccions tyme geuen wherby nober holy dayes abrogated specially suche fell haruest tyme keping whiche muche hinderaunce gatheryng corne haye fruite suche like necessary profitable commodity article thus ordained people deliueredthe insurrecci n lyncoln hyre inhabitauntes north partes beyng tyme ignoraunt rude knowyng true religion meant altogether noseled supersticion popery also meanes certayne abbottes ignorant priestes litle stirred prouoked suppression certain monastery extirpacion holishyng byshoppe rome nowe takyng occasion booke saiyng see frendes nowe taken v fower vii sacramentes shortly ye shall lese thre also thus fayth holy churche shall vtterly suppressed abholished therefore sodainly spred abrode raysed great shamefull slaunders onely moue people sedicion rebellion kyndle people hateful malicious myndes kynges maiestie magestrates realme saiyng let v fully bend selues mayntenaunce religion rather suffre thus decay euen dye felde amongest theim also many euen nobilitie lytle prouoke stirre vp ignoraunt rude people stifly rebell stand therin faythfully promisyng theim bothe ayde succour kyng owne natyue country like foolishe wicked menne thynkyng doyng haue done god high pleasor seruice also certaine malicious busye persones added oyle adage sayeth fornace made open clamour euery place oportunitie serued christian religion vtterly violate dispised set asyde rather behoued partes euery true christen manue defende euen death admit suffre meanes fayth whiche forefather long many thousande yeres haue lyued continued nowe subuerted destroyed among many priestes whiche deceiued also people many false fable venemous lye ymaginacions whiche could neuer entre take place heart good man faythfull subiect saiyng al maner praier fastyng goddes seruice vtterly destroyed taken away man mary wyfe partaker sacramentes length eate piece ost meate thesame fyrst pay vnto kyng certain somme money brought bondage wicked maner life sarazins vnder great turke suche like errours slaunderous tale people thus instructed may trulier speake deceiued mocked beyng light credite incotinent helpe maintenaunce religion established confirmed stifly stoutly co spire agree part lincolneshire first thei assembled shortly ioyned army beyng supposed men apte feete warre nombre aboute twentie thousand trayterous rebelles haste spede might harde thereof kynges toyal maiestie awne proper persone furnished goodly warlike armie lackyng nothyng suche company oulde appertein marched towarde rebelles hearyng maiestie present power armie royall feared woulde folow matter suche noble men gentleman fauored began withdrawe selues thei wer destitute capitaines last thei writyng made certayn peticions kynges maiestie professyng thei neuer entended hurte toward royall persone kynges maiestie receiued peticions made swere vnto foloweth first begyn make answere foure sixe article vpon theim dependeth muche restthe kynges answer rebelles concernyng cho yng counsaylors neuer haue red hard knowne prince counsailors prelate appoynted rude ignoraunt common people thei wer persones mete habilitie discerne chose mete sufficiet cousailors prince presumpteous ye rude common one shire one moste brute beastly whole realme least experience fynd faute prince electyng counsaylours prelate take vpon contrarie godes lawe mannes lawe rule prince whome ye bounde lawes obey serue youre lyues landes goodes worldly cause withstad contrarie wherof like traytors rebelles haue attempted like true subiectes ye name youre selfes suppression religious house monastaries wolle ye oure subiectes well knowe graunted v noble spirituall temporall oure realme common thesame acte parliament set furth counsailor counsaylors vpon mere fantasie ye full falsely would perswade oure realme beleue ye allege seruice god muche diminished trouth therof contrarie house suppressed god well serued vice mischief abhominacion liuyng vsed doth wel apere awne confession subcribed ther awne handes tyme visitacions yet wee suffered great many neded acte stand wherin thei amend ther liuyng feare haue answer suppression al rest hospitalitie relief pore wonder ye ashamed affirme thei haue bene great releief pore people whan great many parte hath past foure fiue religious person diuers one spet substaunce goodes ther house norishyng vice abhominable liuyng vnkyndnes vnnaturalitie may impute oure subiectes mynde leauer suche vnthriftie sorte vicious persones shoulde enioy suche possession profites emolumentes growe thesaied house maintenaunce vnthriftie life wee youre naturall prince souereigne lorde kyng doth hath spent youre defence awne sixe time thei woorth touchyng acte v maruaile madnes youre brayne vpon grounde ye woulde take aucthoritie vpon cause v breake lawes statute noble knightes gentleman realme whome thesame chiefly toucheth hath bene graunted assented seyng maner thynges toucheth basse common realme also groundes v wer false neuer admitted lawe vsurped vpon prince contrarie equitie iustice hath ben openlie disputed declared al well learned men realme englande westminster hall whereby ye may well perceiue mad vnreasonable demaundes rest v mete v dishonorable graut asset vnto lesse mete decent rebellious sorte demaunde thesame prince touchyng fiftene ye demaud v released think ye faintharted perforce ye one shire wer ye great many mo coulde compell v youre insurrection suche rebelleous demeanor remit thesame thinke ye man wil may take true subiectes first make shewe louyng graut perforce woulde compell youre souereigne lorde kyng release thesame tyme paiment whereof yet come ye seyng thesame coutreuaile teth peny charge daily sustein tuicion safegarde make sure occasios ingratitude vnnaturallnes vnkindnes v administred ye geue v cause whiche hath alwaies bene asmuche dedicate wealth euer kyng somuche set studie settyng forwarde seyng vnkyndly vntruly ye deale v without cause occasion doubt ye though haue grace naturallnes consider dutie allegiaunce youre kyng souereigne lorde rest oure realme doubt hath thei shall loke cause truste shalbe confusion accordyng youre former letter submit youre selfes touching first frutes let wit thing graunted v act parliament also supportacion parte great excessiue charge whiche wee supporte beare maintenaunce youre wealthes oure subiectes wee haue knowen also ye common haue much complayned tymes passed moste parte gooddes landes possession realme spirituall mennes handes yet bearyng v hand ye louyng subiectes v may ye cannot fynd harte prince souereigne lorde shoulde haue parte thereof yet nothyng preiudiciall vnto common rebel vnlaufully rise agaynst youre prince contrary duetie allegeaunce goddes commaundement si remembre youre folie treiterous demeanour shame natiue countrey england offend greueously youre vndoubted kyng naturall prince alwayes hath shewed sel louyng vnto remembre duetie allegiaunce ye bound obey v youre kyng goddes commaundement law nature wherfore wee charge eftsones vpon forsaied bondes paynes ye withdraw selfes awne house eue man assemble contrarie oure lawes youre allegeaunces cause prouokers mischief deliuered oure liftenauntes handes oures selues submit suche condigne ponishment wee oure noble shall thinke worthy doubt el hat noble wil suffr iniurie youre handes vnreuenged ye geue place v souereigntie shewe selfes bounden obedient subiectes nomore entermeddle youre selues hencefurth weightie affaire realme direction whereof apperteigneth v kyng suche noble men counsailours li elect chose haue orderyng thesame thus pray vnto mightie god geue grace duty vse selfes towardes v like trew faithfull subiectes may haue cause ordre thereafter rather obediently consent amongest deliuer hades liuetenaunte hundreth persones ordered accordyng demerites pleasure obstinacie wilfulnes put selfes wiues child landes goodes cattalles besides indignacion god vtter aduenture totall destruction vtter ruine force violence swerd lincolneshire men receiued kynges answer aforsaied made peticios eche mistrustyng shoulde bee noted greatest medeler euen sodenly theibegan shrin hand thei deuided euery man home awne house peace capitaines rebelles eskaped clere wer appreheded thei deserued toke vpon capitain rowte named selfe capitain cobler monke called doctor makerel diuerse afterward taken executed thynges thus ended contrey appeased thinges quiet kynges maiestie retired brake vp army se euen within six dayes folowyng kyng truly certefied ther new insurrectiona new insurrecc made northrenmen assembled selfes hou e great armye warlikemen wel appincted capitaines horse harneis artillary nombre fourtie thousand men whiche incamped theim selfes yorkeshire men eche theim bound selfes othe faithfull obedient capitaine thei also declared proclamacios solemply made insurreccion extend farther maintenaunce defence faith christe deliueraunce holy churche sore decaied oppressed also furtherauce aswel priuate publik matter realme touchyng wealth al kynges poore subiectes named sedicious traiterous voiage holye blessed pilgrimage thei al certaine banner felde whervpon painted christ hagyng crosse one side chalice paynted kake side diuerse banner like hipocresie fained sanctitie souldiars also certain cognisaunce badge embroudered set vpon sleues coates similitude fiue woundes christ middest thereof written name lorde thys rebellious guarrison sathan false couterfeated signes holines set foorth decked selues delude deceiue symple ignoraunt people kynges highnes credebly certefied new surged insurrection makyng delay weightie matter caused al spede duke norffolke suffolke marque excetter erle shrewsburie accompanied mightie royal armye great power strength forthwith set vpo rebelles whe noble capitaines cousailors approched rebelles perc iued n mbre sawe thei wer bent battail thei practised great pollicie haue pacefied al without bloudshedyng northrenmen wer stif necked thei would nowise stoupe stoutly stode mayntayned wicked entreprise wherfore noble abouesaied perceiuyng seyng none way pacefie wretched rebelles greed vpon batayll battail apoincted ye day assigned se ye night night day ye battail appointed fel smal raine nothyng speak yet wer great miracle goda true miracle god water smal forde maner day might haue gon dr shod ouer sodenly roase suche heigth depnes bredth like noman ther inhabit could tell euer thei saw fore day euen houre battail come impossible one armye come appointment made betwene ar y disapointed thought god extended great mercie compassion great nombre innocent persones deadly sla ghter like haue bene murdered coulde take place great wisedome pollecy thesaied capitaines communicacion pardon kynges may ie obteined al captaines chief doer insurreccion thei promised suche thynges thei founde theim selues agreued thei shoulde gently harde reasonable peticions graunted article presented kinges may ie highnes aucthorie wisedome counsaill thynges brought good ordre conclusion ordre euery man quietly departed bent hote fyre fight beyng letted therof god went peaseably house colde water domino factum est istud tyme insurrection rage horley borley euen kynges armie rebelles eady ioyne kynges banner displaied kynges mais ie liyng winsore ther boocher dwelling within v myle winsore caused priest preache suche toke parte yorkeshiremena bocher priest hanged whome named goddes people fight defend goddes quarell farther thesaied bocher sellyng meat one bid lesse price shepe made aswered nay b godes soule ad rather ye good felowes north amog skore best haue priest boocher wer accused kynges maiesties counsayl tresos abouesaied monday mornyng day sent confessed treason accordyng law mershal thei wer adiudged die thesaied monday thei examined condempned hanged boocher hanged new paire gallowes set bridge ende castell gate priest hanged tree foote winsore bridge yere decembre thamis london frosen ouer wherefore kynges maiestie beuti ull spouse quene iane roade throughout citie londn grenewhich christmas king messenger herauldes sent doune north generall pardon allk c pitall offendours shortly came aske london court kyng aske chefe capitain last rebellion northaske rebel north bothe pardoned kyng grace receaued fauor gaue vnto hym apparel great rewardes ye shal perceaue aske enioyed kyng newe frendes kyndnes yere day pitie fauor liued veriar wretch aswell parson condicios dedes specially agaynst anointed gouernour souereigne lorde third day februarie thomas fitz garrad late erle kildare fiue vncles drawen hanged quartered tiborne high treason also thesaied moneth nichol musgraue thomas tylbie withe began newe rebellion kirbie stapha westmerland eight thousand persones beseged citie carlile whence thei beaten power citie returning duke norffolke made liuetenaunt north encountred toke capitanes accordyng lawe marciall arreigned threscore fourtene haged carlile walles musgraue escaped thesame moneth februarie began yet nother insurrectio intysement sir fraun e bigodsir frauces bigod man doubt loued god feared prince right obediet louyng feare nowe beyng deceaued prouoked thervnto false rebellyous persones fortune tast ende apperteigneth rebelles suche men god leaueth selues thei entreprise doyng thyng goddes holy woord vtterly forbiddeth bigod apprehended brought tower london last rebellion began setrington pikeryn leigh scarborough also latter ende yere lord darcy aske sir rober constablerobert aske taken sir ihon bulmer wife sir thomas percie brother erle northumbreland sir stephyn hamelton nicholas tempest esquier william lomley sonne lord lomley began agayn conspire although thei euery one theim pardon thei taken brought tower london yere one robert packyngtonrobert packyngton mercer london man good substaunce yet riche honest wise man dwelled chepeside signe legg vsed daily foure clock winter sommer rise go masse churche called saint thomas acre named mercer chapel one mornyng emong beyng great mistie mornyng hath seldome besene euen crossyng strete house churche sodenly murdered gonne whiche neighbor playnly hard great nombre laborer tyme standyng soper lane ende sene go furth house also clap gonne hard dede doer neuer espied knowen many suspected none coulde found fauty howbeit true forasmuch knowen man great courage one could speake also woulde harde thesame tyme one burgeses parliament citie london talked somewhat gainst cou tousnes crueltie clergie contempte theim therefore mooste lyke one theim thus shamefully murdered perceiue master honne sixte yere reigne kyng xxix yere iune lorde darcy lorde hosey wer arreignedthe lorde darcy lorde hosey westminster marque ex eter high stuard england thei founde giltie iudgment caces high treson shorty wer also arreigned sir robert conestable sir thomas percy sir fraunces bigod sir stephen hamelton sir ihon bulmer wife reported wife paramour also william lomley nicholas tempest abbotes ierney riuers robert aske founde giltie high treason put death tiborne sauyng sir robert conestable haged chaines beuerley gate hull aske also hanged chaynes yorke tower sir ihon bulmers paramour brent smithfelde london latter ende iune lord darcy behedded tower hil shortly lord hosey behedded lincolne yere feast saint george lorde cromewell made knight gartier ocobre saint edwardes euen borne hampton courte noble impe prince edward whose godfather christenyngthe birth prince edward nowe souereign lorde edward sixte archebishop cauntorburie duke norffolk godmother lady mary kynges daughter bishopyng godfather duke suffolk birth noble prince great fire made whole realme great ioye made thankes geuyng almightie god whiche sent soquene iane departed noble prince succed croune realme lorde lamentacion shortly made death noble gracious mother quene iane whiche departed life fourtene day octobre next folowyng none realme heauelier taken kynges maiestie self whose death caused kyng imediatly remoue vnto westminster wher mourned kept selfe close secret great whilequene iane buried eight daye nouembre corp quene caried winsor withe greate solempnitie buried middes queer castell churche tyme made poules solempne herce masse dirigie like maner song masse dirige euery parish churche london kinges maiestie kept christmas grenewich mournyng apparell courte till morow candle ay chaunged also yere viscout beauchamp created erle hertford sir william fitzwilliam high admirall created erle southhampton yere iames kyng scottes maried lady magdalene french kynges eldest daughter xxx yere maye freer called freer forestfr er fo st one obseruaunt freers might haue bene trulier named ter shall appere obstinate freer obstinat freer secretly confession declared many kynges subiectes kyng supreme head beyng therof accused appreheded examined could say kyng supreme hed church selfe sworne contrarye answered toke oth outward man inward man neuer consented thervnto answer lordes examined loked straug lye dissmulacion freer beyng farther cused diuerse heretical dampnable article held contrary scripture god sondry examinacions conuinced confuted gladly submited selfe abide ponishment church vpon submission hauyng libertie aswell talke whome would also would talke ce teyn suche outward men talked incens outward freer farr open submission euer abiuracion sent read looke vpon vtterly refused obstinately stode heresy treasos cospired al getle meanes possible soughte reconciliac n gentler magestrates onstinat freer would neither argue answere wherfore iustly codepned prepared smithfelde londo gallowes ha ged chaines middle armhole quicke vnder galowes e fire cosumed bret death commyng place execution prepared greate skaffolde sat noble realme kynges maiesties moost honorable counsayle haue graunted pardon wretched creature spark repentaunce woulde haue happened ther also prepared pulpit right reuerend father god renoumed famous clerk bishop worceter called hugh latimer declared errours opely manifestly scripture god confuted many godly exhortacions moued repetauce uche frowardnes neither would speke litle execucio houge great image bronght galowes image brought wale welshman muche sought worshiped iamage called daruell gatheren welshman prophesya prophesie image set whole forest fyre prophesie toke effect set freer forest fyre consumed nothyng freer sawe fyre come present death hand caught hold vpon ladder would let go vnpaciently toke death man euer put truste god neuer vnquietly vngodly ended lyfe men might iudge hym outward man appered haue litle knowlege god sincere truth lesse trust endyng upon gallowes died set vp great letter verse folowing dauid daruell gatheren saith welshman fetched outlawes hell come black augustine croched freers likewise al pulling nonnes cloysters house wer suppressed put doune season sute made emperour kynges may ie would take wife duches millayn matter emperor counsaill infourmed thei indited mali e greate many whiche ready prison bene shortly skourged smithfelde iry fagottes would haue made best bloud ther body haue sprong graciously time grace remitted although tyme e sixe article indured whiche eight yeres thei brought many honest simple persone deathes suche rigour lawe two witness false true accused auouched thei spoken agaynst sacramet ther way death boted confesse faith cotrarie saied accusors reported would beleu witness ye sometime certain clergie thei wine would procure elles thei slaundered kynges highnes whiche neuer ceased stody take payne auaunce ment common wealth realme englad supreme gouernour hed also defence al thesame lately enfourmed trustie faithfull frendes cakerd cruel serpet bishop rome archetraitor reignold poole enemie godes worde natural contrey moued stirred diuerse great prince potentate christendome inuade realme england vtterlie destroy whole nacion thesame wherefore maiestie awne persone without deley tooke right worshipfull syr tomas forman knyght mayer londo brother certifie name men betwene age lx xvi nombre harness weapon kyndes diuersities wherevpon sayde lorde mayer brother euery one hauyng one councell learned men citie repayred wardes othe common counsayll constable warde tooke nombre men harness weapon accordynge commission well viewed bookes nombre persones thought expedient admyt whole nombre soche certefied able apte persones muster wherefore assembled theym selfes agayne chose able persones put thother specially soche harnesse whome harnesse coulde prouyded credebly aduertysed kynges counsellor thomas lorde cromewell knyght noble ordre gartier lorde preuye seale whose prudence goodnesse citie moche bounden kyng hym selfe woulde see people citie muster conuenient nombre set furthe power leaue home keepe citie eftsones euery alderman repayred wardethe great muster london put syde soche hadde iackes coates plate coates mayle bryganders appoynted none soche whyte harnesse excepte soch beare morysh pykes harnesse skulles appoynted none soche whyte harnesse neither dyd admyt straunger although denyzens knowen king would see muster lorde glad people prepare desyre prince seruyce would haue made faythfull subiectes herte haue reioysed euery man beyng substauce prouyded hymself coate whyte sylke garnyshed bassenetes turues lyke cappes sylke set ouches furnished chaines gold fethers gylted harnesse halb rdes pollaxes especyall certayne goldsmythes theyr brest plate yea whole harnesse syluer bullyon constable iornettes whyte sylke chaynes battell ax meaner sorte euery warde wer made xxx new stadardz deuise citie yde baners whe euery thyug prepared euery alderman mustered owne warde feldes viewyng euery man harnesse cause could shote take bowes hades thother bylles pykes viii day maie accordyng kynges pleasure euery alderman ordre battell warde came common felde myle ende gonne seruered selues one place pykes another bowman another likewise byllmen rynged capitayne entered agayne lytle conduyte last muster entered paul churchyarde iiii clocke noone nombre xv thousande besyde wyffelers wayters yere feast ihon baptistinsurrection gaunt comon people town gaunt flauders began grudge officer emperour thoccasion comon people supported dyuers ryche merchauntes towne complained excyse wyne great payed euery pottell iid thexcise solde retaile besyde price wyne likewyse payed merchauntes solde great yet greued abbot frier chanons religious persones men church whiche grer store towne among greatest ryches wealth towne shoulde exempt dronke wyne free without paiyng excise whych thyng turned charge therwith comons founde selues sore greued aud sayde oppressed contrarye olde auncieut priuileges ruler made promise ordre way shoulde taken therin desyred respyte thei might know mynd queene hungary regent emperoure lowe countrey whyche quene tyme bruxell euen goyng vset countrey holand queene consented nothyng common desyred sent cruell frowarde answere without great threates woulde euery man quietly remayne house pay excyse ben accustomed lyke rebel thei wer forced thervnto whether thei would wherfore comons assembled well digested answer quene determined seke another meanes fyrst assembled themselues battel nobre x xiim wel armed night day watching warding towue sorte themperours officer bare rule called chiefe bailyf gouernour towne durst shew face amomgest helpe boy coueied postern got towne people gaunt perceiuyng ruler thus departed chie est wer towne condisceded agreed write vnto frenche kyng ayde caused gentleman towne deuyse letter whiche terwarde lost head sute request sayde men gaunt would please frenche kyng sende vnto theim men municions succour auncient subiectes crowne fraunce delyuer bondage remoue great exaction imposicions officer sayde emperour oppressed woulde yelde delyuer vnto soueraigne lord lyke maner would townes adioynynge truth sayth writer annales quytayn frenche kyng woulde haue herkened vnto request sute ben easye thyng haue enioyed possession greatest nombre townes lowe countrey flaunders arthoys rest countrey also haue put emperour great hazarde frenche kyng wyllyng kepe holde truce concluded sworne hauyng greater respect ayth promyse profite gayne thinkyng consent request gauntoys begyn new warre noiaunce comen people christendome wherfore refused vtterly either ayde succour queene hungarye thynkynge haue pacifyed rumor sent vnto towne gaunte ryght trustye valyaunt knyght lorde sempy house crouy accompanyed lorde lyquerque one preuy councell men amongest comons wer well entertained thought shoulde haue ben therfore taryed longe amongest glad conuey selues dissimuled apparell emperoure beynge aduertysed busynesse perceiuyng lowe countrey reason sedicion daunger deuised meanes might come tha spayn thought woulde hazarde hymselfe vpon sea durst trust almaynes broken promyse theim en concernynge generall councell promysed haue assembled wherfore determyned moue frenche kyng sue safeconduyte passe thorough fraunce whiche gladly frenche kyng graunted hym insomuch french kyng knew desyre dolphyn entreted hertely emperour passe way trustyng therby sho lde haue ben occasyon peace betwene thynges meete themperours assuraunce appoynted constable frauce emperour departed spayn came bayon fro thence burdeaux poyters came loch met french kyng quene thei together passed fro thence orleaunce paris citie entered fyrst day ianuary yere lorde thence great chere royall enterteynment passed thorough lower coutreys last came bruxelles braband fyrst emperour vnder colour haue pytie remedye poore comons gaut saiyng wold pardo offe ce also could blame oppressed complayn meanes obteined licence county reux accopanyed wt iic men armes vm launceknightes entered towne saiyng thinhabitantes power kepe towne peace quyet tyll good profitable ordre shoud taken comons poore inhabitantz beleuig al promised said vnto mistrustyng nothyng threw harnesse euery man peaceably went house entered towne themperour accompanyed brother kyng hongary syster quene dowager hongary duke sauoy many prince lordes gentleman great power men warre whyche entery mydsomer yere mvcxl themperour beyng gaunt hauyng thupper hand say beyng stronger within towne thinhabitantes wer place gret pytie semed haue poore inhabitatz fyrst entery immediatly began golde behynd gentleman stoode seruyngme good ordre well horsed apparelled whosoeuer well viewed theim might saye thei tall comely personage cle e lym body wer able geue greatest prince christendome enbrodered coates garded chaynes golde ryche beholde whiche well horsed trapped ensued baron yongest fyrst syr willyam holly knyght lorde mayer london rode lorde par beyng yongest baron followed themperour nexte followed lorde preuy seale lorde cromwell lorde chauncellor garter kyng armes officer armes serieantes armes gaue attendance euery syde lordes whiche lordes moast parte apparelled purple veluet lorde marque dorcet suyte bare kynges swoorde estate hym good distaunce followed kynges hyghnesse mounted goodly courser trapped ryche cloth golde trauerced latyce wyse square ouer enbrodered golde dammaske pyrled euery syde enbroderye buckle pendentes fyne golde persone apparelled coate purple veluet somewhat made lyke rocke ouer enbrodered flatte golde dammaske small lace myxed betwene golde lace goyng trauerse wyse grounde lytle appered whyche garment ryche garde curiously enbrodered sleues brest cutte lyned cloth golde tyed together great button diamondes rubyes orient perle swoorde swoorde gyrdle adorned stone especiall emerodes nyght cappe gartnyshed stone bonnet tyche iuels ewe men coulde value besyde ware baudricke wy e coller che balystes perle men euer saw lyke aboute persone ranne x footemen rychely appa elled goldsmythes woorke notwithstandynge ryche apparell precious iuelles wer plesaunt noble beyng present beholde yet princely countenaunce goodly personage royall gesture farre exceded creature beyng present comparyson persone ryche apparell lytle estemed folowed lord chauberlein tha came sir anthony browne master horse goodly getleman comly personage wel horsed trapped rychely apparelled leadyng kynges horse estate long reyne golde whyche horse trapped maner lyke barde crimosin veluet satten al ouer enbrodered gold antyke fassio curiously wrought followed page honor coates riche tynsell crimosyn veluet paled ridyng great courser al trapped crimosyn veluet enbrodered wt new deuyses knottz golde pleasant costly beholde followed syr antho wyngfeld captayne garde garde well horsed ryche coates ordre kyng rode last ende ranke speares pencyoners stoode euery persone came kyng placed hymselfe one syde kyng standyng myddes grace aduertysed kynges comyng issued tent beyng apparelled ryche goune cloth golde reised made rounde without trayne dutche fassyon heade kall ouer rounde bonet cappe set full orient perle propre fassyon cornet blacke veluet necke partelet set full riche stone glystered felde dore tente mounted ayre horse richely trapped fotemen goldsmithes worke enbrodered blacke lion shoulder carbuncle golde marched towarde kyng whych perceiuyng approche came forwarde somewhat beyonde crosse blacke heth paused lytle fayre place tyll came nerer put bonnet came foreward louely countenauce princely behauyour saluted welcomed enbrased great reioysyng beholder lykewyse forgettyng duty amiable aspecte womanly behauyour receyued grace many sweete woordes great thankes praisynges geuen hym whyle two thus communynge fyftye pencioners garde departed furnysh courte halle grenewyche kyng talked lytle whyle put ryght hande footemen rode though thei ben coupeled together syght see goodly prince noble kyng ryde fayre lady goodly stature womanly countenance especiall good qualyties thynke creature could see herte reioysed kyng mette bothe companyes ioyned together returned thorough rankes knyghtes esquyers stoode styl whyle remoued ordre fyrst trompettes went forwarde whyche twelue nombre besyde two kettle drommes horsebacke followed kynges trompettes kynges councellours gentleman pr uy chaumbre gentleman grace countrey coates veluet great horse mayer london crimosyn veluet richecollor coupled yongest baron baron nexte followyng bysshoppes earles rode earles quersteyn waldocke countrey duke archbysshop caunterbury duke phillip bauire nexte followed ambassador lorde preuye seale lorde chauncellor lorde marque kynges sworde nexte followed kyng himselfe equally ridyng faire lady behind rode anthony browne kyngz horse estate hearde behynde rode syr iohan dudley maister horse leadynge spare palferaye trapped ryche tyssue downe grounde followed henxemen page honoure followed ladye margarete doglas ladye marque dorset dutch richmond suffolke countess rutland hertforde countess followed grace chariot rode iourney well carued gylte armes coutrey curiously wrought couered cloth golde horse trapped blacke veluet rode page honor coates veluet whiche charyot rode ii auncient ladyes countrey nexte chariot followed vi ladyes gentlewoman countrey richely apparelled cappes set perle great chaynes dyuers fassyons vsage countrey fayre face rode vi lady england well besene followed another charyot lykewyse gylte furnyshed thother charyot followed x englysh ladyes well apparelled nexte another chariot al couered blacke cloth iiii gentlewoman grace chamberers followed remnaunt ladyes gentlewoman maydens gret nombre dyd weare day frenche whodes last came another chariot blacke iii launders appertaynyng grace nexte followed horselytter cloth golde crymosyn veluyt vpon veluet paled horse trapped accordigly king sent followed seruyng men trayne clothed blacke great horse ordre thei rode thorough rankes thorough parke late freers walle men alyghted sauyng kyng ii maisters horse henxmen whych rode halle dore ladyes rode courte gate passed behelde wharfe howe citizen london rowyng vp downe thames euen euery crafte barge garnyshed banner flagges stremers pencelles targettes paynted beaten kynges armes grace armes armes crafte mistery besyde barge euery crafte barge made lyke ship called batchelers barke decked cloth gold penons pencels targetz great nombre wayted foyst shot great peces artillary euery barge dyuers sortes instrumentes chyldre men syngyng sang plaied altogether king lady passed wharfe syght noies much praised allowed kyng wer within vtter courte alygted horse kyng louyngly embrased kyssed byddyng welcome owne led lyfte arme thorough halle furnyshed beneth harth kynges garde aboue harth fyftye pencioners batell ax brought vp preuy chaumbre lefte tyme assone kyng entered courte shot tower grenewyche great peale gonne kynges company entered parke haue hearde horse men blacke heath brake aray lycence departe london lodgyng se howe longe horseman coulde passe howe late nyght yer footemen coulde get ouer london brydge assure wonderous beholde nombre great thus noble lady remayned vnmaryed vntyll tuysday followyng beyng day epiphany whych day viii clocke mornyng grace beyng apparelled gowne cloth golde raysed great flower syluer furred blacke ienettes coate crymsyn sattyn cutte enbrodered tyed great diamondes ryche coller necke came solemly nobilitie galery nexte closettes paused lordes went fetche ladye anne whiche apparelled gowne ryche cloth golde sette full large flower great orient pearle made ter dutche fassion rownde hangyng downe whych fayre yellowe long head coronall golde replenyshed great stone set full braunches rosemary necke myddle iuelles great valew estimation apparell goynge betwene erle ouersteyn graunde master hostoden conduyte ordre performaunce maryage demure countynaunce sad behauiour passed thorough kynges chaumbre lordes goyng tyll came galery kyng made three low obeysaunces curteisyes archebysshop caunte bury receyued maried together erle ouersteyn dyd geue aboute mariyng ryng written god sende vvel kepe mariage celebrate went hande hande kinges closet ther hard masse offered taper masse wyne spyces done kyng departed chaumbre ladyes wayted chau bre duke norffolke goyng ryght hande duke suffolke lefte hande grace ix clocke kyng gowne ryche tyssue lyned crymosyn ueluet enbrodered came closet apparell maryed came closet serieant armes al officer lyke queene kyng went openly procession offered dyned together dyner chaunged gowne lyke mannes gowne tyssue longe sleues gyrte furred ryche sable narrowe sleeues costly head cap ware saturdai cornet laune cap ryche perle stone iudged great valew fassyon ladyes gentlewoman apparelled riche costly chaynes dyuers fassions apparell went nyght eueniong supped kyng supper bankettes maskes dyuerse dysportes tyll tyme came pleased kyng take rest sonday kepte solempne iustes whyche moche pleased straungiers whiche daie appareiled englishe fashio frenche whode whiche set furth beautie good visage euery creature reioysed behold erle ouerstein lordes lady whiche geuen attendauce grace al iornay highly easted kyng le supteously thei toke leaue greate g te geuen theim bothe money plate returned toward countrey leauyng behynd erle waldocke diuerse gentleman damoselles whiche wer reteined grace till wer etter acquainted realme fourth daie february next ensuyng kyng came westminster water accompaignied many noble prelate barge maior brother skarlet xii chief compaignies citee barge garnished banner penons targettes richely couered replenished mynstrelsy gaue attendaunce waie shippes shot ordinaunce tower shot greate peale gonne goodly ordre xii daie february duke norffolke sent ambassade frenche kyng well enterteigned thende thesame moneth returned englande xxiii daie february wer foure reader sent starre chamber euery house foure principall innes cou te one sat lorde chauncellor lorde preuie seale xiiii chief kynges counsaill lorde chauncellor clared sir ihon shelto knight aduise sir humfrey broune knight kynges seriaunt si nicholas hare knight kynges counsailor speaker parliament willyam coignesby esquire attornay duchie lancastre beyng seruauntes fee declared fraudulent landes contrary statute made anno xxvii greate hynderaunce kynges prerogatiue true meanyng thesaied statute also euill example defraude lordes seigniory wherefore thesaie sir humffrey browne sir nicholas hare wer daie whole counsaill kyng dismissed office seruice kyng sent tower within three day william coign sent thether thei remaigned ten dayes wer deliuered thei three lost office thei kyng first sondaie lent stephyn gardiner bishop winchesterstephe gardiner bishop wynchester preached paules crosse intreated gospell daie sermon especially touched article iustifica io handled third sondaie lent next folowyng one doctor barnesdoctor barnes haue heard reproued thesaied pulpit paules doctryne thesaied bishoppe beeyng vexed bishoppes doctryne vsed many tauntes hym one specially whiche saied bishoppe wer together rome pope knewe greate somme money could saue life bishoppe feare litle intreataunce purchase fauour enough hym noted bishop bee papist whiche bishop vnquietly tooke complained barnes kyng hym examined last kynges commaundement came bishoppes house likewise bishoppe onely examined hym also toke vpon hym skolemaster moste menne specially suche muche knewe least cause lye reported prepared tower skole house made suche rod beate skoler beate hym small ash left hym although barnes twoo persones saie iherom garret next yere folowyng ye shall bishoppes procurement appoynted easter weke folowyng preache sainct mary spittle beside london three solempne sermon one whiche sermon barnes made barnes openly al people asked bishop forgeuenes speakyng vnreue rently former sermon required bishop forgaue hym token thereof holde vp hande whiche like long appered afterwarde many counterfeat forgeuenes xii daie aprill began parliament sir nicholas hare restored office speaker whiche frely graunted without cotradictios foure fiftenes subsedy twoo landes xiid goodes toward greate charge bulwarkes xviii daie aprill westminster thomas lorde cromewell created erle essexthomas lord crowel creat erle esse daie barrier fifth whiche chalenge thei valiautly performed commers also thei kept open houshold duresme place feasted kyng quene lordes beside tewesdaie regacion weke thei feasted knightes burgess comon house morowe thei maior alderman wife dinner fridaie thei brake vp houshold parliament whiche began xviii daie april afore rehersed religion sainct ihones englande whiche named knightes rhodes dissolued wherof hearyng sir willyam weston knight prior sainct ihones thought died assencion daie beyng fift daie maie monethe sent tower docter wilson docter sampson bishop chichester releuyng certain traiterous persones whiche denied kynges supremacie thesame offence one richard farmer grocer londonrichard farmer grocer condempned pr munire riche welthy man good estimacion citee committed marshall see westminster hall arraigned attainted premunire lost goodes ix daie iuly thomas lorde cromewelthomas lord crowel committed tower late made erle essex haue hard beyng counsail chaber sodainly apprehended committed tower london whiche many lamented mo reioysed specially suche either religious men fauored religious persones thei banqueted triumphed together night many wisshyng daie seuen yere fearyng least escape although imprisoned could mery knewe nothyng truth hym bothe lamented hym hartely praied hym true certain clergie detestably hated specially suche borne swynge meanes put dede man doynges semed fauor kynde popery could abide snoffyng pride prelate whiche vndoubtedly whatsoeuer el cause death shorten life procured ende brought vnto whiche xix daie thesaied monethe attaynted parliament neuer came answere whiche lawe many reported causer makyng thereof truthe thereof knowe article whiche died appereth record attaynder written whiche long bee reher ed conclude attainted heresy high treason xxviii daie iuly brought skaffold tower hill saied wordes folowyng come hether dyethe wordes lorde crowell spoke deth purge self maie happen thynke shuold wer wretche miser lawe condempned die thanke lorde god hath appoynted deathe myne offence sithence tyme haue yeres discrecion haue liued synner offended lorde god whiche aske hym hartely forgeuenes vnknowne many haue greate traueler worlde beyng base degree called high estate sithes tyme came therunto haue offended prince whiche aske hym hartely forgeuenes beseche praie god forgeue father forgeue sonne forgeue holy ghost forgeue thre person one god forgeue praie beare record die catholicke faithe doubtyng article faith doubtyng sacrament churche many hath sclaundered reported haue bearer suche hath mainteigned euill opinion whiche vntrue confesse like god holy spirite doth instruct v truthe deuill redy seduce v haue seduced beare witnes dye catholicke faithe holy churche hartely desire praie kynges grace maie long liue healthe prosperitie sone prince edward goodly ympe maie log reigne ouer desire pray long life remaigneth fleshe wauer nothyng faithe made praier whiche long long bothe godly learned committed soule handes god paciently suffered stroke axe ragged boocherly miser whiche vngoodly perfourmed office sainct peter euen kept serieantes feastsergeauntes feaste sainct ihones al plentie victaile whiche feast wer made ten serieauntes three greyes inne three lyncolnes inne euery temple twoo whiche feast present lordes common parliament beside maior alderman greate nomber common citee london morowe midsomer daie kyng caused quene remoue richemond purposyng bee health open ayre pleasure sixt daie iuly certain lordes came doune neither house whiche expresly declared cause mariage lawfull conclusion matter conuocacion clerely determined kyng might lawfully mary would might thei clerely deuorsed seperated parliament enacted concluded bee taken quene called lady anne cleuequene anne deuorced called ladi anne cleue yere lord leonard grey brother thomas lord marque dorset beyng kynges lieutenaunt ireland practised sondery feates proffite deliueryng treytors beeyng hostage especially nephew fitzgarard brother thomas fitzgarard executed also caused suche itishe menne intelligence muade suche kynges frendes whiche fauored wherefore kyng sent hym mistrustyng seyng refuge wrote kynges enemy inuade thenglishe pale departure also kepte kynges treasure awne vse without reteignyng souldiours accordyng commission whereupon came london sent towerthe lorde graye sent tower iuly prince salerne realme naples lorde lois deuola came england se kyng whiche high chere greate rewardes departed came done fredericke marque padulla brother duke farrar prince macedonia marque terra noua mounsire de flagy sixtene gentleman emperours courte englande see kyng whiche daie mary magdalene came court westminster wer highly fea ed well enterteined greate rewardes departed twentie eight daie iuly haue heard yere lorde cromewell behedded hym likewi e behedded lorde hongerfordlorde hungerford beheded heytesbury whiche certainly tyme death semed bee vnquiet mynde rather frenesy otherwise thirtie daie iuly drawen herdelles tower smithfeld robert barnes doctor diuinitee thomas garard wyllyam ieromebarnes garrard ierom bachelers diuinitee powell fetherston abell firste three drawen stake set vp burned latter three drawen galowes likewise set vp hanged hedded quartered ye must note first three wer menne professed gospell iesu christ preacher thereof wherefore thei thus cruelly executed knowe although haue searched knowe truth finde atteindor ye muste vnderstande thei preached sainct mary spittle haue declared barnes learnyng lesson better committed skolehouse prepared whiche tower kepte neuer called examinacion till rod bee beaten withall made whiche sharp greate fire smithefelde compaignie sake sent skolehouse hym fornamed garet ierome whiche dronke one cuppe saied thus muche finde attaindor thei detestable abhominable heretickes thei taught many heresy nomber whereof greate atteindor recited one alleged whiche haue often wondered heresy wer many one alleged special cause deathe deede deathe thei asked shirif wherfore thei condempned answered thei could tell maie saie truthe moste menne said preachyng doctryne stephen gardiner bishoppe wynchester chiefly procured death god knoweth greate pitie suche learned menne bee cast awaie without examinacion neither knowyng laied charge neuer called answere laste three whiche powell fetherston abellpowell fetherston abell put death treason attaindor speciall mencion made offence whiche deniyng kynges supremacie affirmyng mariage lady katheryne good treason thei wer attainted suffered death fourthe daie august thomas epsam sometyme monke westminster whiche prisoner treason thre yeres newgate came iustices gaole deliuery newegate would aske kynges pardon sworne true wherefore monkes garment plucked backe repr ed till kyng knewe malicious obstinacie last monke seen clothyng englande monethe certain commissioner sent kyng ireland inquire lorde leonard gray whiche certefied diuerse article hym ye shall next yere folowyng eight daie august lady katheryn hawardkatheryn haward shewed quene nece duke norffolk daughter lorde edmond haward shewed openly quene hampton court whiche dignitie enioyed long ye shall ye latter ende moneth vniuersally realme greate death reason newe hote ague flixes pe ilence whiche season suche drougth welles small riuers cleane dried muche cattell died lacke water thamis shalowe freshe water small strength salt water flowed aboue london bridge till raine encreased freshe water xxii daie december raufe egerton seruaunt lorde audeley lorde chauncellor hangedegerton hanged drawen quartered counterfetyng kynges greate seale signet whiche neuer seen sealed greate nomber license denizen one thomas harman wrote theim executed statute made last parliament sore bounde straungiers whiche wer denizen whiche caused theim offre egerton greate somme money desire whereof caused hym practise whiche brought hym ende declared ende yere frenche kyng made strong castle arde also bridge ouer englishe pale whiche bridge crewe calice beate doune frenchemen reedified thesame englishemen bet doune kyng englad sent fiftene hundred woorke men wall fortefie guysnes sent fiue hundred men warre capitaines defende noyes ranne fraunce wer fiftie thousande englishemenne landed calice greate ordinaunce wherefore frenche kyng sent hast duke uandosme diuerse capitaines frontier picardy defende thesame kyng englande hearyng thereof sent erles surrey southhampton lorde russell greate admirall march calice set ordre sent cc light horseman border scotlande frenchman called stradiates whiche lordes thei set thynges good ordre shortly returned yere burned smith eld child named richard mekinsrichard kyns brent child passed age xv yeres somewhat heard folkes talke chaunced speake sacrament aultar boye accused edmond boner bishop london diligently folowed accusacion first found meanes indite hym arreigned hym burned tyme brought stake taught speake muche good bishop london greate charitee shewed hym defied heresy curssed tyme euer knewe doctor barnes hym learned heresie whiche died poore boye would sauegarde life haue gladly said twelue apostle taught hym cared named suche childishe innocencie feare deede many spake saied great shame bishop thei saied ought rather haue labored saue life procure terrible execucion seyng suche ignoraunt soule knewe affirmyng heresie haue hard beginnyng yere doctor wilson doctor sampson bishop chichester wer sent vnto tower wer pardoned kyng set libertie pthe xxxiii yere beginnyng yere v priestes yorke shire began new rebellioa newe rebellion thassent one leigh gentlema ix temporall men whiche apprehended shortly diuerse place put execucion somuche xvii daie maie thesaid leigh one tatersall thornton wer drawen london tiborne wer executed sir ihon neuell knight executed thesame yorke thesame daie magaret countesse salisbury whiche long prisoner tower behedded tower last right
