chauncellour englande daie high stuard thesame westminster thesaied lorde chauncellour peres confessed inditement iudgement bee hangedthe lorde dacres south haged twentie nyne daie iune beeyng sainct peter daie none led foote betwene twoo shirifes london tower citee tyborne strangled common murderer body buried churche sainct sepulchre cause death noble manne gentleman murder symple manne vnlawfull assemble made sussex greate moane made al moste specially mantell wittie towarde gentleman realme manne able haue dooen good seruice sommer kyng kepte progresse yorke passed lyncolne shire made hym humble submissionsubmissons temporaltie confessyng offence thankyng kyng pardon toune staunforde gaue kyng twentie pounde lyncolne presented fourtie pounde boston fiftie pound parte whiche called lynsey gaue three hundred pounde estren churche lyncolne gaue fiftie pounde entered yorke shire met two hundred gentleman thesame shire cote ueluet foure thousande tall yomen seruyng men well horsed whiche knee made submission mouthe sir robert bowes gaue kyng nyne hundred pounde barnesdale met kyng archebishoppe yorke three hundred priestes made like submission gaue kyng sixe hundred pounde like submission made maior yorke newe castle hull eche theim gaue kyng hundred pounde kyng yorke twelue day came hull deuised certain fortificacions passed ouer water homber lyncolne shire halontide came hampton court tyme quene late maried kyng called quene katherynequene katheryne beheded accused kyng dissolute liuyng mariage fraunces diram secretely many knewe sithe mariage vehemently suspected thomas culpeper whiche brought chamber lyncolne august laste progresse tyme lady rocheforde together alone leuen clocke nighte till foure clocke mornyng hym gaue chayne riche cap upon kyng remoued london sent sion kept close yet serued quene offence confessed culpeper diram thei put death tiborne tenth daie december twentie two daie thesame monethe arreigned westminster lorde wyllyam hawarde wife whiche lorde wyllyam uncle quene katheryne tilney whiche counsaill hauyng dooe diram elizabeth tilney boulmer restwould quenes woman walgraue wyllyam asby damport gentle menne seruauntes olde duches norffolke margaret benet butter wife indited misprision counsailyng euill demeanor quene slaunder kyng succession thei confessed iudgement perpetuall prison lose goodes proffite lades duryng life howbeit shortely diuerse wer deliuered kynges pardon sixtene daie ianuary parliament began whiche lordes common assented desire kyng certain peticions first would vexe hymself quenes offence lady rocheford might attainted parliament also protractyng tyme whiche bee vnquietnes would vnder greate seale geue royall assent without tariyng ende parliament also diram culpeper attainted common law might also attainted parliament also agnes duches norffolke katheryn countesse brigewater daughter whiche counsailyng thesaied offence committed tower indited misprision lorde william arreigned thesame might likewise attainted also whosoeuer spoken doen act detestacion abhominable liuyng pardoned whiche peticions kyng graunted saiyng thanked common thei tooke sorowe bee whereupon quene lady rocheforde attainted bothe house saturdaie beyng leuenth daie february kyng sent royall assent greate seale lordes robe common house called vp acte redde assent declared thirtene daie twoo lady beheddedquene katherin lady rocheford beheded grene within tower axe confessed offence died repentaunt parliament kyng proclaymed kyng irelandethe kyng proclaymed kyng irelande whiche name predecessor neuer wer alwaies called lordes irelande beginnyng marche died sir arthur plantagenet viscount li e bastard kyng edward fourth tower london vnattainted haue deliuered put liberty twelue daye saied moneth sir ihon awdeley sonne heire saied lorde lisle wife westmynster created uiscount lisle parliament sittyng lent one george ferreisgeorge ferr y bourgeoys tonne plimmouth arested london vpon condempnacion suite one white whereupon seriaunt armes common house sent counter bredestrete fetche hym clerckes would deliuer hym wherfore serieaunt manne would haue brought awaie perforce diuerse shirifes officiers present withstoode serieaunt thei fell quarellyng serieauntes man sore hurte fraie ended shirifes london whose name wer rowland hill henry suckely came counter first denied deliuerey prisoner howbeit afterward thei deliuered hym matter taken common house shirifes clercke fiue officiers partie plaintife sent tower laye twoo day wer deliuered speaker common house although haue vsed muche declare priuat thynges doen forrein realmes yet tell one thyng reported matter self writte deliuered must nedes iudge truthe like woorke expressed therfore purposed woorde woorde writen vnto expresse matter certein gentelman scotlande contemning bisshop rome vsurped aucthoritie praisyng commendyng affaire procedinges englande reprouyng naughtie life scottishe clergie hereticke accused conuented diuerse theim maie appere make answere suche article bee obiected hym knowyng accustomed fauor fled theim englande gone thei proceded suche sort foloweth whiche true copie processe maie appere sir ihon borthwikesir ihon borthwike commonly called capitain borthwike accused suspected defamed conuicted witness whiche men suche honestie could none excepcion bee taken yere lorde thousande fiue hundred fourtie xxviii day may abbay sainct androwes presence moste worshipfull father christ eawyn archebishoppe glasgue chauncellor scotlande william aberdowyn henry bishoppe galloway kynges chapell sterlyng ihon bishoppe bre th willyam bishop dunblan andrew abbot melros george abbot dumfermelyng ihon abbot paslay ihon abbot lundros robert abbot kyllos willyam abbot culros malcolme prior whitytern ihon prior pettywerin master alexander balfour uicar kylmane rector uniuersitie sainct androwes afore cunnyng master master ihon mair master peter chapilain professor doctor diuinitee master marten balfour bachel r diuinitie lawe officiall principall sainct androwes ihon wyrem supprior ihon wannand thomas cunnyngha chanones abbay sainct androwes ihon thomson felowe prior blacke frier sainct androwes ihon tullidaff wardein grey frier androwes ihon patersone vicar thesame couent also noble mightie right worshipfull lordes george erle huntley iames erle arrain willyam erle marshall william erle montrosse malcolme lorde flemmyng chamberlain scotlande ihon lorde lindesay ihon lorde erskyn george lorde seiton hugh lorde symeruall sir iames homilton finnart walter lorde ihones torphecten knightes master iames foules colynton clerke register moste souereigne lorde kyng many diuerse sondery lordes baron honest persones required witness premiss doth affirme hath holde error folowyng openly taught instructed saie first moste holiest lorde pope uicar iesu christ cannot haue exercise aucthoritie emongest christian bishop priest secondly indulgenses pardon graunted moste holiest lorde pope value strength efficacie vtterly abusion people deceiuyng soules thirdly saied pope simoniack euer sellyng gyftes priestes might mary fourthly englishe heresy thei called least greater better part obserued englishemen hath good obserued christen men true consonant law god somuch yt perswaded many people accept thesame fiftly people scotlande clergie therof hath vtterly execated blinded affirmacio thei true catholike faith affirmyng opely saiyng faith value better ecclesiasticalles realme scotland item likewise accordyng vnto tholde opinion iho wi lief hus heresiarches master heretikes condempned counsail constantine hath affirmed farther declared ecclesiasticall persones possesse haue enioye temporall possession neither exercise iurisdiccio kynd aucthoritie temporall matter neither vpon awne subiectes vtterly bee taken awaie day englande item hath saied holden affirmed falsely contrary honor state reuerence sacred kynges maiestie scotlande kynges maiestie scotland moste clerest defendor christian faith would contrary lawe libertie holy churche vendicat chalenge vnto priuate v ecclesiasticall possession landes yerely rente geuen fore father also hymself inforce matter hath also writyng perswaded moste noble kyng endeuor item hath willed sought many time hath desired hartely churche scotlande come brought thesame poynt ende suche like fall churche england come deede item hath saied affirmed taught openly cannon lawes decree holy father approued catholike apostolike churche valewe strength bryngyng affirmyng thesame made set furth contrary lawe god ite hath said holden affirmed many yt way religion kept bee abolished destroyed bee destroyed englande vilipendyng holy religion affirmyng bee abusion people whose clothyng sheweth manifes ly deformed mosters hauyng vtilitie holines bryngyng perswadyng asmuche hym laye adherentes opinion religion realme scotlande destroyed vtterly taken awaie moste greatest losse catholike churche deminishyng christen religion item plainly knowen lawfull probacions thesame iho borthwike hath actually hath diuerse bokes suspect heresy dampned aswell papall regall ordinary aucthorities forbidden saie firste newe testament englishe printed englande oecolampadius melancthon diuerse tractes erasmus codempned heretickes also boke vnio discidentium conteinyng moste manifest error hath red studied communicated presented thesame men aswell openly priuatly hath instructed taughte many christian thesame effect turne true catholike faithe item openly knowen thesame ihon borthwike bee stubburne foresaid error heresy haue susteined taught thesame suche indurate mynde would declyne maner meanes fro thesame diuerse frendes person whiche loued hym would haue hym conuert catholike faithe neither would consent theim wise rather vnmoueably persist error whiche said article many error holden saied publicated taught hym common voyce whiche stil holdeth teacheth forsaid ihon borthwike bee taken holden coumpted heretike master heretike euil iudger holy faithe therfore dauid title saint stephyn mount celo holy churche rome priest cardinalthe sentence iudgement archebishop saint androwes primate whole realme scotland apostolike seate legate create sittyng seate iustice nature iudges holy euangelistes god set afore v iudgementes procede fro sight god eye must loke equitie hauyng onely god catholike faith afore eye name god beyng called vpon folowyng counsail aswell deuines lawyer foresayd ihon borthwike called capitain borthwike condempned foresayd heresy accused suspected infamed lawfull probacions brought foresaydes conuicted cited called appearyng absentyng selfe like runaway therfore let v thinke pronouce declare conuicted punished worse heretike mouables vnmouables whatsoeuer title begotten whatsoeuer party lye geuen secular power office dower wife confiscat spent vse custome law also declare presentes image sayd ihon made likenes brought metrapolitan churche saint andrewes market crosse citie brent signe memorial condemnyng example feare lykewise declare thesame ihon taken within liberty punished accordyng lawe heretikes also warne true beleuers christ whatsoeuer state condicion thei fro day receiue admit ito house tetes village tounes ihon borthwike eat drynke preferre kyng humanitie paine suche like punishement b founde culpable foresayd shalbe accused fautors maintayners heretiques shalbe punished accordyng law sentence red made put writyng metrapolitan churche saint androwes sittyng tribunal seate yere lorde xxviii day maye drawen regester made heretikes agreyng sentence ihon borthwike xxxiiii yere yere iames erle desmod came kyng honorably entertained wel rewarded septembre great onele came kyng grenewyche capitaine north partes ireland called magannysse bishop cloar made submission writyng cofessyng offence promisyng serue kyng heyres truely whiche submission kyng considered vpon first day october created grenewyche thesayd sir eustace onele called great onele chiefe linage called onele erle tereowen commonly called tyron gaue great chayne made magannysse cosyn knightes gaue chaynes gaue lorde mathias sonne erle barony duncan ceason kynges maiestie prepared warre scotlande cause warre made manifestly declared whiche foloweth kynges maiestie published title declaracion conteignyng iust cause consideracions present vvarre vvith scottes vvherin also appeareth true right title kynges moste royal maiestie hath souereigntie scotland beginneth thus beyng enforced warre whiche haue alwayes hitherto mu abhorred fleda declaracion cause warre land set yng neighbor nephieu kyng scottes one aboue manyfolde benefites towardes hath moste iust cause loue v honor v reioyce quietnes haue thought good notify vnto world doynges behauour prouocacion warre likewise meanes wayes v vsed exchue aduoyde iust true occasion wherby prouoked prosecute thesame vtteraunce diuulgyng matter disburden part inwarde displeasure griefe circumstaunces knowen lament openly worlde infidelitie tyme whiche thinges suche enormitie brest appeare kyng scottes nephieu neighbour youth tender age preserued maintained great daunger authoritie power coduced safely reall possession estate nowe compelleth forceth v preseruacion honor right vse puissauce power like vnkindnes hath heretofore shewed semblable case goddes lawe mannes lawe humanitie oftener chaunceth abhorred yet persones prince raritie theim happen seldome hath nowe come passe hath rarely seldome seen kyng scottes hath mariage doughter england ne reprehend kyng father art therein lament sory toke better effect kyng ou father matter minde loue amitie perpetuall frendship betwene postery whiche soone fayled death kyng scottes due punishment god iniust inuasion realme shalbe perpetual testimony reproche euer yet present tyme could th vnkyndnesse father extinguyshe v natural loue nephieu sonne beyng miserable age ten er youth forgettyng ye displeasure haue worthyly prouoked v inuade realme norished brought vp nephieu achieue father possession gouernement wherin nowe vnkyndly vseth behaueth towardes v compelleth v take armour warre specially noted vpon groundes meanes compelled warre wherin among chiefe griefe displeasure vnder colour fayre speche flatteryng word dedes iniured cotempned dispised ought sufferaunce pretermitte passe ouer woordes writynges letter message ambassiates excuse allegacios could pleasauntly gently ne reuerently deuised sent hath made kyng scottes behalfe vnto v euer trusted tree would bryng forth good fruite one partie good stocke continually apparaunce put forth fayre buddes therfore would hardely beleue geue eare euer alleged dedes contrary beyng neuerthelesse thesame dedes manyfest must nedes haue regarded theim lothe thynke euil nephieu w om many wayes bound best sorte toward v therfore hauyng message sent vnto v yere past sayd nephieu promi e made repayryng thesayd kyng scottes vnto v yorke great preparacion part made therfore thesame metyng onely disappointed also beyng yorke lieu therof inuasion made oure sayd nephieu subiectes realme declaryng euident contempt di pite v yet glad impute defaute metyng aduise counsail inuasion lewdnes subie te accordyng vnto gaue benigne gentle audience suche ambassador repayred hither christmas afterwarde suche cause displeasure occurred specially consideryng good woordes swete woordes pleasaunt woordes eftsones proponed sayd ambassador ely excuse past also persuade kyndnes perfite amitie ensue albeit kyng scottes hauyng contrary rticle league amitie receiued entetteigned suche r belle chiefe principle stirryng insurreccion north v refusall tyme vpon request made restore thesame yet neuerthelesse vpon offer made thesayd ambassador sende comis ion bordures determyng debate confinies thesame great pretence amitie fayre woordes could speche desired content tyme forbeare presse ouer extremely matter rebelles albeit neuer remitted thesame desyrous make triall sayd nephieu correspondence dedes condescended sendyng commissioner border whiche great charge id kyng scot e sayd nephieu semblable great trauaile made commissioner fruit ensued beyng part chalenged piece groun e plainely vsurped scottes great value beyng also thesame shewed suche euidence substancial autentique plaine euident brought furth part gournde within realme thesame neu rthelesse theim denyed refused euidence onely cause reiected made alleged englishemen yet soo auncient could counterfaite nowe value grounde lytle small wayte manne would haue attempted falsifie suche matter yet denial beyng wise made vnto commissioner neuerthelesse comaundement departed frendes fro commission r scotland takyng order hath accustomed good rule vpon border meane tyme whiche recesse lorde maxwell warden west march scotlad made proclamacion good rule yet added therwith borderer scotland withdrawe goodes borderer england incontinently scottishe men borderer fowerth iuly entred realme sodainly spoyled subiectes contrarye league euen suche extremitie tyme open warre wherat muche meruailed wer compelled therfore furnishe border garison defence thesame wherevpon kyng scottes sent vnto v iames leyrmouth master houshold letter deuised moste pleasaunt maner offeryng redresse reformacion attemtates yet neuerthelesse entry sayd leyrmouth england great nombre scottes looked made forrey border great annoyaunce subiectes extreme detr ent wherewith vnsemely dissimulacion litle moued reason would yet finally extremely persecute cotinue sayd displeasure gaue benigne audience sayd leyrmouth suffered selfe somewhat altred woordes fayre promise tendyng persuasion euer desired fynde kyng scot e suche nephieu vnto v proximitie bloud gratuitie vnto require meane tyme fayre wordes dedes border wer extreme might subiectes spoyled roade made sir robert bowes reuenge therof thesame sir robert bowes many taken prisoner yet deteined scotland without puttyng fine raunsome hath euer accustomed beyng tyme surceaunce made bothe side suite sayd leyrmouth season scottes ceassed make sundry inuasion realme suche wise wer compelled forget fayre woordes onely consider kyng scottes dedes whiche appeared vnto v sorte ought dutie defece ou subiectes ne could respect honor passed ouer vnreformed therfore put readynesse armye due meane wherby might attaigne suche peace safegard subiectes bound procure whiche praparacion made knowlege therof kyng scottes ceassed vse accustomed meane fayre woordes whiche naturall inclinacion wrought eftsones accustomed effect euermore desirous fynd kyng scottes suche regard respect declared dedes correspondence naturall loue nephieu suche uncle haue shewed selfe towardes doth require wherfore vpo newe request suite made vnto v determined staye armye yorke appointyng duke norffolke lieutenaunt lorde priuyseale bishop dureham master horse commen treate conclude ambassador scotland amitie peace vpon suche condicions reason equitie indifferent wherby warre might exchued beyng sundry inuasion scottes open manyfest communicacion betwene theyr commissioner dyuers degree comissions shewed scottes finally one commissioner allowed mat er wer proponed co clusion amitie nothyng difficile hard part agreabl reason commissioner scotland sayd doubted might brought passe kyng scottes nephieu might haue metyng v matter easely componed determined wherevpon left speakyng article amitie ambassador scotland made muche outward ioy communicacion metyng shewed theimselfe wordes facion behauor muche delight oyce therewith thought easy facile cocluded accomplished part thei toke thyng passed thyng concluded moste certain take effect onely desired vi dayes obteigne aunswere master armye tyme stay go whervnto commissioner agreed vi dayes sent commission scotland power conclude metyng precisely suche place knewe well would ne could wynter obserue kepe wherwith commissioner miscontent ambassador scotland relieue displeasure tempre matter whereby wynne tyme shewed forth instruccions wherin libertie geuen ambassador excede comission appointment place consent commissioner thought conuenient whiche maner procedyng commissioner used alleging thei would conclude metyng men hauyng commission thervnto ambassador scotland vpon pretence send ample large comission agreable instruccions appointment place obteined delay vi dayes send thesayd ample commission without restraint place vi dayes brought forth newe commission made good fourme without excepcion therewith shewed also newe instruccions coteinyng suche restainte former comission conteine libertie geuen commissioner commission nowe last remoued taken away instruccions addicion special charge ambassador excede thesame thus first ambassador scotlad semed haue wyll desire conclude place semely conuenient whiche want co mission thei might last might haue concluded metyng vertue commission feare comaundement secod instruccions durst shewed first instruccions partly excuse kyng seme secretely wyll commission openly professe ample commission fro kyng shewed secrete instruccions defence theimselfe proceded accordyng commission caryng muche charged therin kyng whose faulte disclosed discharge theim selfe trustyng benefite wynter approchyng tyme lost comunicacion master defeded power yere without doyng part honor right lawe league obliged bound meane tyme subiectes taken prisoner scotland could deliuered vpon rausome cotrary custome vsage border tyme peace warre meane tyme stayed great part armye allready prested wage go forward tyme ambassadours ye haue heard assembled talke amitie conclude treatyng amitie put ouer communicacion metyng comunicacion metyng handled alteracion commission instruccions behalfe appereth plaine deuise onely excogita e delay whiche hath geuen v light wherevpon certainly iudge kyng scottes inwarde affeccion towardes v whose dedes woordes well wayed considered doeth v plainely vnderstande hath continually labored abuse v swete pleasaunt woordes satisfy appetite home abrode vnkynde displeasaunt dedes wordes professeth insoluble amitie allegeth kynred knowlegeth benef te onely faulte speaketh another language worlde dedes thereby toucheth v honor denegacion iustice inforced compelled vse sworde whiche god hath ut hand extreme remedy wherby obteigne quietnes subiectes also due vnto v right pactes league haue pacietly suffered many delusion notably last yere made preparacion yorke repaire v suffre people subiectes oft spoyled without remedy done scottes whatsoeuer wordes suffer rebelles deteigned contrary league without remedy also done theim whatsoeuer woordes suffre land vsurped contrary moste plaine euidence onely vpon wille pryde arrogancie partie done whatsoeuer wordes ouer pre umptuously done v geue suche significacio arrogacie necessary v oppresse beginnyng lest thei gather courage ye greater displeasure v posteritie hereafter yet ye intreatyng mattter euidently perceiued lacke suche affeccion proximitie bloud req ire would muche rather haue remitted iniuries respect proximitie bloud nephieu heretofore inuasion father consideryng surely ascertained ye lacke therof bloud frorne wt colde ayre scotland ther neuer prince violently compelled warre vnkynde dealyng vniust behauor vnprincely demeanour yet nature nephieu actes dedes declareth himselfe moued ther wt ne haue suche ernest regarde obseruacion pactes league ne suche respect intertainement administracion iustice naturall equitie byndeth coseruacion amitie doeth require whiche muche lament sory vse nowe force puissaunce reuengeance priuate displeasure beyng often deluded haue recouery right preseruacio subiectes fro iniuries obseruacion suche league haue passed betwene v firmely trustyng almightie god vnder reigne woll assist ayde iust procedynges herein furtheraunce aduauncement right whiche doubt shall euer preuaile wrong falsehead deceipte dissimulacion hitherto appeareth present warre hath proceded demaunde right superioritie whiche kyng scottes haue alwayes knowleged homage fealtie progenitours euen beginnyng warre hath prouoked occasioned vpo present matter displeasure present iniury present wrong ministred nephieu uncle moste vnnaturally supported cotrary desertes benefites moste vnkyndly mynded possession scotland mocion warre attain thesame neuer kyng realme oportunitie minoritie nephieu ne realme prince hath iust title euident title certain title realme clayme haue scotland deuised pretence mariage imagined couenaunt contriued inuencion argument lineally descended beginnyng state established progenitor recognised successiuely kynges scotland dedes woordes actes writynges continually almost without interrupcion leest intermission till reigne progenitor henry vi whose tyme scottes abused ciuile warre realme licence boldnes omittyng du tie whiche proximitie bloud betwene v haue ke require beyng also selfe inclined peace haue euer alwayes glad rather without preiudice omitte demaunde right might coserue peace demaudyng therof seen moue warre specially neighbor nephieu haue preserued daungier suche tyme expedient christendome vnite peace wherby able resist comon enemy turke whatsoeuer cosideracions haue omitted speake hitherto matter neue theles true ye kynges scottes haue alwayes knowleged kynges england superior lordes realme scotland haue done homage fealtie thesame appeareth fyrst history written suche confirmacion trueth memory haue truely noted signified secondly appeareth instrumentes homage made kyng scottes diuers notable personage scotlad diuers sudry tymes sealed seales remainyng treasory hyrdly appeareth regesters recordes iudicially au ntiquely made yet preserued confirmacion atter title beyng moste plaine furnished also maner euidences declaracion therof fyrst concernyng history whiche called witness tymes light trueth life memory finally conuenient way meane whereby thynges antiquiti may brought mennes knowlege shewe plainly matter could wyshed required consent writer could agree vppon vntrueth conteignyng declaracion suche matter hath moste euident probabilitie apparaunce probable likely better administracion iustice amonges rude people two one estate might ruler one countrey vnite isle probable likely beginnyng ordred auoydyng discencion shuold one superior right sayd estate depend accordyng whervnto rede brute realme called brytain tooke yrst tat name beyng tyme inhabited gyauntes people without order ciuilitie thre sonnes loc ine albanact camber determinyng haue whole isle within occean sea gouerned theim thre appointed albanact rule nowe called scotland camber party wale locrine nowe called england vnto beyng elder sonne two brother homage recognisyng knowlegyng theyr superior consider brutus coquered al iland history sayeth tyme made order superioritie afore title deuised plaine beginnyng iust beginnyng conuenient beginnyng order iland tyme specially people rude whiche cannot without continual strife variaunce coteine two thre rule al pointes equal without maner superioritie inward conscience remorse whiche superioritie part dul diminishe peruerse corage resistence rebellion fyrst diuision isle fynde written ter sort without cause suspeccion write amysse accordyng herevnto fynde also history set forth diuers transgression superioritie predecessor haue chastised kynges scott deposed put theyr place omit speake rudenes antiquitie particularitie whiche cared distinctly commit writyng author anthonius sabellicus amonges diligently enserchyng might truely write europe ilandes adioynyng ouer besydes whiche writeth nature maners condicions scottes whiche lyst rede shall fynde haue tymes paste fynde theim present calleth scotland part england whiche aagreable diuision aforesayd beyng dede land continuall without separacion sea also homage fealtie vnite vn thesame particuler declaracions shal manifestly appere testimony suche haue left writyng profe nd con irmacion therof whiche matter passyng ouer death kyng humber actes dunwald kyng realme deuision brene victory kyng arthur shal begynne yere oure lorde dcccc whiche dcxlii yeres past tyme sufficient auncientie whiche shal make special declaracion euident execucion right title superioritie euermore continued preserued hitherto edward fyrst ore conquest sonne alured kyng england vnder dominion obedience kyng scottes noted matter notorious manifest maryon scot writyng story dayes graunteth confesseth testifieth thesame dominion continued state xxiii yere whiche tyme athelstaine succeded croune england hauyng battaile conquered scotland made one constantyne kyng partie rule gouerne coutrey scotland vnder addyng princely worde honor make kyng kyng xxiiii yeres whiche yere lorde ccccxlvii eldred kyng progenitor athelstaines brother tooke homage ise kyng scottes xxx yeres whiche yere lorde dcccclxxvii kyng edgar predecessor toke homage kinald kyng scottes litle trouble england death edward kyng martyr destroyed deceite mother lawe yet memory xl yeres homage done kynald kyng edgare say yere lorde mxvii malcolme kyng scottes homage knute predecessor homage done scottes vttered piece theyr naturall disposicion wherevpon warre made oure progenitor saint edawrde confessor xxxix yere homage done say yere lord mlvi malcolme kyng scottes vanquished realme scotland geuen malcolme sonne sayd progenitor sainct edwarde vnto thesayd malcolme made homage fealtie within xi yeres ter wylliam conqueror entred realme whereo accoumpted perfect conquest vntill likewise subdued scottes therfore sayd yere whiche yere oure lorde mlxviii sayd malcolme kyng scottes homage sayd wyllyam conqueror superior conquest kyng england xxv re yere lord mxciii sayd malcolme homage fealtie wyllyam rufus sonne sayd wyllyam conqueror yet offence demerites deposed sonne substitute place likewise fayled dutie therfore ordained estate sayd wyllyam rufus edgare brother last malcolme sonne fyrst homage fealtie accordyngly seuen yeres whiche yere lorde mc sayd edgar kyng scottes homage henry fyrst progenitour xxxvii yere dauid kyng scottes homage matilde emperatrice daughter heyre hery fyrst wherfore beyng required stephyn obteignyng possession realme make homage refused made sayd matilde thervpon forbare whiche dauids death whiche ensued shortly sone sayd dauid made homage sayd kyng stephyn xiiii yeres whiche yere oure lorde mcl wyllyam kyng scottes dauid brother noble scotland made homage henry secondes sonne reseruacion dutie henry second father xxv yeres whiche yere lorde mclxxv wyllyam kyng scotland muche rebellion resistence accordyng natural inclinacion kyng henry seconde beyng normandy wyllya kyng scottes knowleged finally errour made peace composicion confirmed great seale seales nobilitie scotlande makyng therewith homage fealtie within xv yeres whiche yere lord mclxxxx sayd wyllya kyng scottes came citie cauntorbury homage noble progenitour kyng richard fyrst xiiii yeres thesayd wyllyam homage oure progenitor kyng ihon vpon hyll besides lyncolne makyng othe vpo crosse hubert archebishop cauntorbury beyng pr sent meruailous multitude assembled purpose xxvi yeres whiche yere lord mccxvi alexander kyng scottes maryed margarete doughter progenitor henry third citie yorke feast christmas whiche tyme sayd alexander homage sayd progenitor reigned realme lvi yeres therfore betwene homage made sayd alexander kyng scottes homage done alexander sonne ye sayd kyng scottes edward fyrst coronacion westminster fifty yeres whiche tyme sayd alexander kyng scottes repayred sayd feast coronacion duetie aforesayd within xxviii yeres whiche yere lorde cclxxxii ihon baliol kyng scottes made homage fealti sayd kyng edward fyrst progenitor began robert bruse vsurpe croune scotland moue di ion therefore theim house balioll whi h made cason interrupcion thesayd homage yet without termes memory within xliiii yeare ter whiche yere lorde mcccxlvi edward baliol great victory scotlad thother factio enioying croune scotlande made homage progenitour edwarde third xx yeres whiche yere lorde cccxxvi dauid bruse euer contrary faction neuerthelesse title croune scotland whereof possession make homage sayd progenitor edward third within ix yeres edward third chas ise infidelitie scottes made warre theim great victory edwarde balliol hauyng iust right title realme scotlande surrendred lerely thesame sayd progenitour toune rokysbrough scotlande sayd progenitour accepted thesame caused himselfe crouned kyng scotland tyme enterteigned enioyed proprietary owner realme thone partie confiscacion acquired part free surrendred vnto death sayd progenitour edward third beganne sedicions insurreccions realme tyme progenitour richard second whiche augmented alt ation e state thesayd richard deuolucion thesame henry fowerth scottes leysure play v gues folowe accustomed manier yet henry v recou ry right fraucne commaunded kyng scottes attende vpo iourney tyme realme scotland beyng descended house stewardes whiche nephieu directly commeth iames stewarde kyng scottes yere oure lorde mccccxxiii made homage henry vi wyndsore whiche homage distaunt tyme homage made dauid bruse lx yeres farre within freshe memory man whiche homage fealty appeare storye haue made done tymes season afore remayne instrumentes made thervpon sealed seales kynges scotland testifiyng thesame yet doeth appere story scottes practi ed steale treasurye dyuers instrumentes whiche neuerthelesse recouered againe intent ye may knowe fourme tenour sayd instrume te inserted effecte worde sentence made whiche mete cauellacion contriued euasion scottes allegyng homage haue made erledome hutyngto trew allegatio burnt hande saye cut sikle therfore tenour homage ihon n kyng scottes shall trew faithfull vnto lorde edward grace god kyng england noble superior lorde kyngdome scotland vnto make fidelitie thesame kyngdome scotland hold claime holde shall beare faith fidelitie life lymme worldly honour men faithfully shal knowlege shal seruice due vnto kyngdome scotland foresaied god helpe holy euangelies third parte touchyng recordes registres wee haue formall autentiquall seriously handeled circumstaunces declaryng matiers thei ought great corroboracion hath ben story writen reported matter monges thynges haue solempne act iudicial processe progenitour edward first discussion title scotland challenged twelue competitours say forentius come holandie patricius de dubar come de merchia vvillielmus de vesty vvillielmus de ro robertus de pinbeny nicholaus de soules patritius galightly rogerus de mundeville ioannes de comyn ioannes de hastinges ioannes de balliolo robertus de bruse er ius rex norvvegie finally great consultacion mature deliberacion dis ussion allegation proponed party sentence geuen title balliol accordyng wher vnto enioyed realme confirmacio dutie homage tyme obserued kynges scottes appereth recordes competitours realme scotlande repaired oure saied progenitour chief lorde discussion muche horitie iudgement geuen depended ther vpon ordered whole parliament scotlande spirituall temporall degree assembled purpose cosidering vpon ground foundation kynges scotlande tymes past made saied homage recognition superioritie saied parliament yndyng good trew thei demed yeld geue place expresse consent recognise thesame whiche parliament alledged vnto appereth recordes actes prince day befor rehersed also besides testimonye story writynges letter forein prince tyme recityng rehersyng thesame wherevppon thesaied parliament ther agree superioritie ensuyng determination particularly seuerally make homage fealtie proclamation whosoeuer withdrue sel e doyng dutie therein shoulde reputed rebell made homage fealtie oure progenitour edward first realme tyme discussion title ruled gardians deputed hym al castels holdes surrendered superior lord tyme vacation benefises office fee promotios passed tyme mere gift saied progenitour right croune england shirifes named appointed writtes preceptes made obeied executed finally wee nowe duchie lancaster dyd progenitour tyme contencion title realme scotlande consent agrument estate realme assembled consulted purpose whiche tyme bishopes saint andrewes glascoo wer thei arche byshopes recognised archebishop yorke whiche extended ouer al countrey scottes wil take exception homage ther prince made warr force whiche true thei say thei shame allege ther awne parliament confirmed testefied writynges seales wherevnto nothyng enforced right reason beyng passed peace q iet wit armoure compulsion thei say thei thei speake like selfes thei say thei like self withdraw ther duetie much blamed ameded thus apereth vnto begynnyng right superioritie perpetuall continuaunce without intermission within memorie certayne omssi forbearyng vpon groundes occasion specified deny wherby thei haue many time sought taken oportunities withdraw doyng ther dutie knowlege superioritie ouer auoyde thei haue cared thei saied alleged though wer neuer vntrue lyeng alwaies wait whan thei might annoy realme without awne great daunger peril extreme detryment thei detracted doyng dutie god euer graunted vnto realme force compell thervnto within memorie notwithstandyng interruptio resistaunce vnto tyme progenitor hery sixt neuer indured long made intermission within tyme mynd wherby possession might seme enpaired time henry sixte vnto seuenth yere oure reigne oure realme hath bene season lacerate torne diuersitie title tyll oure tyme sithence war outwardly vexed troubled storye lalamentable parte therof tedious reherse sythen death progenitor henry vi graundfather edward iiii reigned great traueyls attayne quietnes realme finally tyme preparation warr scotland dyed rycharde iii vsurped small tyme yeres kyng father strength god hand ouerthr w battayll iustly attayned possession realme neuerthelesse great tempestious stormes fyndynge matter yet brought perfecte quyet rest ceassed forbare requyre scottes duty thinkyng policy rather tyme assay tame nature pleasaunt coniunction conuer ation affinitie charge faulte requyre dutye oportunitie serued force feare constrayne compell thus passed ouer reigne father without demaunde homage beyng reigne nowe xxxiiii yeres xxi yere latted nephieu minoritie beyng careful bryng dauger place king receiue homage full possession wherfore beyng passed sithens last homage made king scottes progenitor henry vicxxii yere tyme homage done wyndesore iames stuard kyng scottes afore lvi yeres crowne realme contencion trouble wherof engendred also busynesse tyme kyng father xxiiii yere tyme xxi yere hath passed minoritie nephieu finally scottes resortynge defence discontinuance possession alledge iustli xiii yere sylence tyme reygne beynge tymes sythens homage done iames steward suche sylence thei ben neuer long could haue engendred preiudice losse ryght may yet declared proued due imputed kyng edward demaundyng homage beynge stryfe estate whervnto homage due rychard iii serch homage scotland neither ryght ne leasure haue homage done vnto hym englande blame father knowyng scottes nature neuer dutie feare demaunded whych woulde exchue thei might beyng realme clerely purged yll seede sedicio sparkled scattered cruell ciuile warres lawe reason serueth passyng ouer tyme commodious purpose allegeable prescriptio losse ryght minoritie kyng scottes hath endured xxi yeres reigne whiche beynge impediment parte whole prescription scottes matter prescriptible thus deduced euidently xiii yere xiii yere without excuse haue ceassed forborne demaunde dutie lyke scottes haue lykewyse eassed offer tende whych cause neuerthelesse doo enter warre ne mynded demaunde anye suche matter nowe beyng rather desirous reioyce take comfort frendship nephieu neyboure moue matter vnto hym displeasure wherby alienate suche naturall inclinacion loue haue toward v workes god superior ouer suffer occasion ministred wherby due superioritie maye knowen demaunded requyred entent accordyng ther vnto thynges gouerned due ordre may pleasure passe ouer lyfe honor glorye graunt v doo suche rest peace tranquilitie shalbe mete conuenient v kyng setfurth declaracion cause war aboue mencioned sent furth duke norffolke li utenaunt generall accopanyed erles shrewisbury da comberland surrey hertford anguysh ru land lordes north party syr anthony browne master kynges horsse syr ihon gage comptroller kynges house xx men well appoynted whych entered scotland xxi day october taryed viii dayes without battell brent townes paxton ramrige styne gradyn shylles lang ednem newton skytshell newthorne smellem spyttle two merdens siederyke two broxlawes flory fayre crofte ednem spyttle roxborough kelsey abbey lang spronstow ryden hadenston whyle duke farneton scotlande iiii day came speke hym halfe myle hoste kyng scottes bisshop orkeney iames leiremouth maister houshold entreate peace agreed armye laye long scotland myght hongre colde without anye countynaunce harme necessytie returned barwycke iourney standarde erle hampton dyed new castell borne forwarde appoynted capitayne kyng scottes hearyng army returned reysed army xv thousand chosen men pa te realme vnder guydyng lorde maxwell wardeyn west march bosting tary long england duke dyd scotlad fridai beyng katheryns euen thei passed ouer water eske brent certayne house greues border thomas bastard dacres iacke musgraue set word sir thomas wharton wardein king west march come succour sayd ii valiaut captayns although scottes entered fiersly yet thei manfully coragiously set theim c light horsse left stale side hill withall scottes wer wonderfully dismaide either thynkyng duke norffolke come west march great army el thei thought greater armie came uictorie water esk thei espied sir thomas wharton commyng iiic men onely tyme god ordeined thei first bront fied thenglishemen folowed wer taken prisoner therles casselles glancarne lord maxwell admirall wa dein lorde flemmyng lorde somerwell lorde oliphant lorde gray sir oliuer senclere kynges minio ihon rosse lorde oragy robert eskyn sonne lord eskyn carre larde gredon lorde maxwelles twoo brother ihon lesley bastard erle rothus twoo hundred gentlemenne aboue eight hundred common people somuche one man yea woman three foure prisoner thei toke also twentie foure gonne foure carte speares ten pauilios onely handstroke god cardinal scotlande promised heauen destruccion englande kyng scottes tooke greate thoughtthe death scottishe kyng discomfiture also englishe herauld called somerset slain dunbarre whiche thynges together tooke vnpaciently died frenesy although many reported kyng hymself bickeryng receiued deathes wounde fled therwith scotlande howsoeuer true aforesaied died quene wife deliuered daughter lady euen christmas called mary prisoner aforesaied twentie foure chief theim brought vp tower london twoo day saincte thomas daie apostle christmas thei solemply conueighed london westminster kynges counsaill sat lorde chauncellor declared theim vntruthe vnkyndenes false dissimulacion declaryng farther kyng cause warre bothe deniyng homage also trayterous inuasions without defiaunce also kepyng subiectes prisoner without redempcion contrary olde lawes march whiche doynges god thei might perceiue skourged theim howbeit kyng regardyng honor princely power content shewe theim kyndenes vnkyndenes right wrong although might haue kept theim straite prison iuste lawe armes yet content thei haue libertie bee noble realme house accordyng estate thei wer appoynted duke erles bishoppes knightes gentleman whiche entretaigned theim thei confessed theimselfes neuer bee better enterteigned haue greater chere newe gladnes tidynges came theim death kyng whiche thei sore lamented hearyng lefte onely daughter heire thei wisshed englande bee maried prince kynges sonne kyng counsaill perceiuyng ouerture nowe bee made whiche waie without warre twoo realmes might bee brought one sent prisoner fewe lackyng manor hapton court sainct stephen daie thei wer well enterteigned bothe kyng noble thei saied thei neuer sawe kyng hym saied god better serued countrey howbeit kirkmen preached englande neither masse seruice god thei promised kyng doo theim laie frendes performe asmuche required whereupon without greate rewardes thei departed towarde scotlande newe yeres daie waie thei sawe prince came newe castle duke suffolke vpon hostage deliuered theim entered scotland wer well gladly welcomed likewise therle angus whiche banished scotlande kynges fee yerely thousande marke sir george douglas brother fiue hundred marke wer accepted scotla restored last kynges therle angus diuerse lordes prisoner made priuie counsaill realme erle arrein gouernour young quene realme next heire apparaunt notwithstandyng archebishop sainct androwes cardinall enemie mortall kyng realme englande bishoppe rome aucthoritie partly set frenche kyng thesame cause forged kyng made hym gouernour associate twoo erles affinitie bothe realme young quene contrary lawes scotlande whereupon thesaied erle arrain accordyng right helpe frendes tooke vpon hym rule gouernour put thesaied false cardinall prison deliuered sir robert bowes prisoner bandes accordyng custom march marche next folowyng scottes beganne parliament yere neither perfite peace open warre betwene englande fraunce shippes taken bothe side merchantes robbed laste merchantes goodes bothe party seazed likewise ambassadours bothe realmes staied howbeit shortly ambassadours wer deliuered yet merchauntes wer robbed warre proclaimed ende yere came gouernour scotlande ambassadours sir william hambleton iames leyremouthe secretory scotland whose message meanely liked thei fain sende herauld scotlande ambassador hether came erle glancarn sir george douglash whatsoeuer answere sir george returned poste within twentie day came honest answere honestie eudured small tyme pthe xxxv yere beginnyng yere trinitie sondaie newe league sworne betwene kyng emperour hampton courte bee frendes frendes enemy enemy thirde daie iune came courte realme irelande lorde obryn lorde macke willyam brough lorde macke gilpatricke iuly thesaied obryn created erle townon lorde macke willyam created erle claurikard sir dunon obryn made baron ebranky rewardes thei tooke leaue returned also thesame monethe scottishe ambassadours returned greate rewardes season kyng emperoure sent garter toyson kynges armes demaunde certaine thynges frenche kyng whiche deny defie hym would suffer theim come within lande thei returned whereupon thesaied demaundes shewed ambassadoure westminster iuly kyng sent ouer sixe thousande tall menne whereof capitain generall sir ihon wallop sir thomas seymour marshall sir richarde cromewell capitain horsse menne whiche assaulted toune called launderseylaundersey vnto whiche assaulte came emperoure proper person shortely came doune frenche kyng proper persone greate armie offered emperoure battaill reason whereof siege reysed streight frenche menne victayled toune whiche onely cause commyng nexte daie emperoure beeyng ready houre appoynted geue battaill frenchemenne made greate shewe though thei would haue come forwarde thei dalied daie night thei ranne waie trusted horsses legges like tall felowes monethe indited arraigned condempned new wynsore foure mennefoure perso condempned saie anthony persone prieste robert testwood syngyng manne henry filmer taylor ihon marbeck syngyng manne menne one tyme aforesaied arreigned condempned heresie force sixe article heresy thei condempned thei alleged inditementes firste anthony personeantony person preache twoo yere arreigned place called wynkefelde saie like christe hanged betwene twoo thefes euen prieste masse hath consecrated lifteth hym vp ouer hedde hangeth betwene twoo thefes excepte preache woorde god truly hath taken vpon hym also saied people pulpet ye shall eate body christe hang vpon crosse gnawyng youre teethe bloud tonne lippes shall eate daie ye eate morow next daie euery daie refresheth body spirite also preached commended scripture callyng woorde god saied foloweth woorde bread body christ also saied christe sittyng disciple tooke bread blessed brake gaue disciple saiyng fleshe take eate like wise tooke wyne blessed gaue disciple saiyng take drynke bloudde v take scripture god breake people item henry filmerhery filmer taylour arraigned article saie sacrament aultare nothyng similitude ceremony also god sacrament aultare haue eaten twentie goddes life robert testwooderobert testwood arreigned article shou saie tyme prieste liftyng vp sacrament wilte thou lifte hym vp high yet higher take hede let hym fall ihon marbecke arreignedihon marbecke awne hande gathered diuerse mennes writynges certain thynges expresly bothe masse sacrament aultar foure persones arraigned condempned burned article aboue saied except ihon marbecke whose honestie innocencie purchased hym kynges pardon thre wer burned wynsore aforsaied beside menne greate nomber gentle menne aswell kynges priuie chamber indited procurement one doctor londondoctor london wyllyam symons prebendary wynsore one wyllyam symones uaunt parler whiche gentlemenne made suy e kynges maiestie declaryng case thei stoode whereupon doctor london examined thesaied symones whiche vpon othe allegeaunce denied trayterous purpose proued face wherefore thei adiudged periured persones weare paper wynsore thei committed flete thesaied doctour london died haue occasion doctor london periury tell howe also occasyon another commytted wylfull periury matter certayne robbery commytted oxford college wherof sayd doctor london master certain plate one said college taken away brought london sell solde goldsmyth london named willyam calawaywillyam calaway goldsmyth bought muche plate partye solde sayde stollen plate beynge man credyte therfore suspected nothynge matter folowed partye stole taken dyuers accessaryes last doctor london knowyng solde goldsmyth man newe learnynge called hym sware great othe woulde hang hym elles shoulde coste hym fyue hundreth pounde wherevpon caused also sayde goldsmyth attached accessarye arreigned hym sessyons holden newgate london alleged ought lawe enquyre accessarye principall dispatche sayde goldsmyth alleged principall hanged whiche nothynge set lybertye lyueth styll shorte goldsmyth vndoubtedly knowen tryed proued honest man euer honest name fame founde gyltye remedy must declare coulde say dye accordyng law prayed haue booke answered coulde haue bigamus cometh periury promised tell wyfe persos knoweth certaynly knowen honest woman fro byrth hathe euer ben muche honesty woman maye woman two husband also honest men child therfore alleged goldsmyth bigamus good woman perceyuyng former mariages shoulde shorten husband dayes came open courte iudges affyrmed othe contrarye truthe neuer maryed mo men sayde goldsmyth althoughe chyldren husbandes contynued dyuers yeres theim yet sware whore bothe maryed defamyng selfe great prayse delyuered innocent husband yeare london great death pestilence therfore myghelmas tearme adiourned saynt albons kepte ende weke christmas came kyng hampton courte ferdinando de gonzaga ui eroy cicile prince malfeta duke iuano capitayne generall chyualrye army emperour charles whyche came kyng appoynte tyme army empero r shoulde readye inuade fraunce appoyntment taken departed reward cliii ouces golden plate iiiimiii oz gylte plate al curiously wrought tyme lay lay kynges cost sonday christmas lorde willyam parre brother queene maryed doughter heyre lord henry burchier erle essex hampton courte created erle essex syr willyam parre knyght vncle bothe made lord par horton chaumberleyn queene newyeres day syr thomas wriothesley kynges secretary made lorde wriothesley tychefelde also yere open warre proclamed fraunce lycence geuen kynges subiectes ieaze vpon frenchemen goodes lyke case ben accustomed xxxvi yere yere kyng sent gret army scotlande sea made erle hertfford lieutenaunt generall uicount lisle hygh admirall whiche valyaunt capitaynes sped thyrd day maie lorde admirall arryued flcete two hundreth sayle fryth landed dyuers men tooke dyuers vesselles whiche dyd hyghe seruyce shortly approched vnto towne lyth landed men marched forwarde three great batteyles wherof lorde admyrall led vawarde erle shrewsbury arrerewarde noble earle hertforde beyng lieutenaunt battayle founde scottes assembled nombre syre thousande horseman beside footemen stop passage army fyrst scottes made towarde englyshmen thoughe would haue set vaward thei perceiued englyshme willynge encountre theym namely cardinall present perceyued deuocion englyshmen see holynesse certayne shot bothe sydes made sodayne retreate leauyng artillary behynde fled towarde edenborough fyrst man fled cardinall lyke valyaunt champion hym gouernour erle huntley murrey bothwell manye great men realme shortly englishman mauger al scottes might entered towne lith wher night army encamped themlyth ta en thei found richesse thought haue founde towne scotland next day armie went towardes edenborough toune whe thei approched nere prouost toune accopanied one two burgess two thre officer armes desired speake kynges liuetenaunt name al toune saied key toune shoulde deliuered vnto lordship condicionally thei might go bag baggage toune saued fire wherunto aunswer made thesaid lorde lieutenaun e wher scottes manifestly broken promise confirmed othes seales certefied whole parliament euidetly knowen whole worlde sent thether kynges highnes take vengeaunce detestable falsehed declare shewe force highnes sworde suche shoulde make resistence vnto grace power sent theither purpose therefore tolde esolutely onlesse thei woulde yelde vp toune franckly without condicion cause man woman chylde issue feldes submittyng theim pleasure would put sword ther toune fire prouost answered wer better stad ther defece whereupon co maundement geuen thesaied prouost officer armes vpon perill depart forth lord li utenaunt sent vaward thei shoulde marche towardes toune whiche courageously set forwarde english gonners manfully set gate specially sir christopher morice thei beat skottes ordinaunce entred gate called cany gate fine force ther slew great nombre skottes finally determined thesaied lorde lieutenaunt vtterly ruinate destroy thesaied toune fire thyng immediatly attempted night come armie withdrue campe fresh next day set fyre none beforeedenbo ugh brent continued day two dayes burnyng shortly came vnto army land foure thousande light horsmen sent kyng whiche thei come army forsoke shippes sent theim home laden spoyle goneshot whiche thei founde dislodged camp toune lith set fire euery house brent grounde returned home land mayn contry scotlande burnyng destroiyng euery pile fortresse village walke great honour grat reioysyng aswel kynges maiestie faithful uyng subiectes thei returned gayn englad losse ska fortie persones great exployt may better inowen shal folowe name chief boroughes castelles tounes brent desolated royll armie borough toune edeborough abbey alled holy toode house kynges palace adioynyng thesame abbey newe botle parte muskleboroug toune happell lady lawret hadingto toune frier nonry lauresto grauge toune lith brent hauen pier destroyed castell village cragmiller preston toune castell castell oliuer sancklers toune dumbarre drilawe broughton dudistone beuerton markle hatherwike bowland blackborne wester crag chester felles stanhouse trauent trapren belton butterden raunto enderleigh pile toune crawnend ficket shenstone kirkland hill east barnes quickwood bildy tower also tounes vilages brent vpon sea englsh flete cannot name halfe kynkone minetes quenes fery parte petynwaynes brent islad many whose name could come yere also kynges maiestie prepared two great army fraunce one conducted led duke norffolke gentle lorde russell lorde preuy seale encamped muttrell beseged toune lay long tyme left toune founde yt army led valiante duke suffolk kynges liuetenaunt armie beyng accu panyed lorde chambreleyn erle aro ndell marshall felde sir ihon gage comptrollor kynges house sir anthony browne master kynges horsses diuerse many capitaynes ninetene day iuly encamped bul leyn est syde thesame vpon hillboleyn besege many sharpe skyrmishes thei gayned first oldman shortly basse boleyn fourtene ay iuly kynges maiestie royall persone passed s douer cali six twentie day encamped selfe bolleyn north syde lesse halfe toune grace remayned tyll toune surrender vnto maiestie toune sore assauted beseged uche boundaunce greate ordinaunce neuer aliauter assaute made besyde vndermyning castel tower nd walles toune beaten withe ordinaunce left one house whole therein sore laied charge f ec men kyng aslauted theim space monet thei sent furth toune kyng two chie captaynes ca led mounsire semblemound mounsire de hay declared tha chief capitayne toune retinew conteted delyu toune vnto grace thei might passe withe bag baggage whiche request kynges maiestie mercifully grau ted theim next daie duke suffolke rode bullein kynges name thei deliuered keyes toune none departed bullein frenchemen ber men warre strong galaunt came toune horseman lxvii footemen xvclxiii gonners viiic hurte menne lxxxvii woman child xixcxxvii came toune foure thousande foure hundred fiftie foure beside greate nomber aged sicke hurt persones able go furthe toune last persone came furthe monsire de ueruine graund capitain toune approched nere place kyng stode alighted horse came kyng talked hym space kyng toke hym hand reuerently knelyng vpon knee kissed hande afterwarde mounted vpon horse departed xviii daiethe kynges enteraunce bullein kynges highnes hauyng sworde borne naked hym lorde marque dorset like noble valiaunt conqueror rode bullein trompetters standyng walles toune sounded trompettes tyme enteryng greate comfort kynges true subiectes thesame beholdyng enteryng met hym duke suffolke deliuered vnto hym keyes toune roade toward lodgyng whiche prepared hym south side toune within twoo day kyng rode aboute toune within walles commaunded lady churche bullein defaced plucked doune appoynted mount made greate force strength toune kyng set thynges suche ordre wisedome thought best returned greate reioysyng louyng subiectes meane ceason kyng laie bullein like haue coquered thesame last haue hard emperor tooke peace frenche kyng litle grefe displeasure kynges maiestie cause kyng sodainly brake vp armie aswel bullein also muttrell returned shortly beside diuerse many sharpe skirmish made frenchemen bullein aswell dolphin greate power whiche night season stale vpo base bullein takyng great sort sicke persones woman beddes without mercy thei slewe howbeit manfully englishman whiche escaped base bullein behaued theimselfes gettyng weapon high toune thei bet frenchemen base toune helpe high toune thei slewe greate nomber theim possessed quietly thesaied base toune beside saie ski mishe many mo monsire de bee came xvm men encamped right toune otherside water entendyng haue buylded forte fourthe daie february set vpo awne campe moste valiaunt fortunate erle hertford lorde lisle lorde gray whose commyng thesaied monsire de bee puyssaunce fled leauyng behinde ordinaunce tentes plate pthe xxxvii yere vii daie iune greate armie frenchemen came nere hauen bullem skirmished thengl shemen greate gain frenchman armie whiche accopted nomber xx encamped began build fort whiche thei departed accoplished thesame iune lorde lisle admirall englande thenglishe flete entered mouthe riuer sain came newe hauen greate armie fraunce laie whiche wer cc saile shippes xxvi galies force wherof bishop rome sent xx well furnished men money aide frenche kyng thenglishemen beyng clx saile greate shippes determyne set whole nauie shot certain peces ordinaunce theim whiche caused galies come abrode shot englishemen whiche galies greate aduauntage reason calme wether twise eche part assauted ordinaunce sodainly wynde rose greate galies could indure rage sea thenglishemen wer compelled entre main sea feare flattes sailed vnto portesmouthe kyng laie knowlege espialles freche army entended land esle wight wherfore repaired cost se realme defeded departyng thenglishe nauy new hauen admirall fraunce called lorde donibalt man greate experience halsed vp sailes whole nauie came poynt isle wight called helenes poynt good ordre cast ankers sent xvi galies daily hauen portesmouthe thenglishe nauie liyng hauen made theim prest set towardes still one shot one daie aboue whole nauie englishman made purposed set frenchman settyng forward goodly ship england called mary rose muche foly drouned middest hauen laden muche ordinauce porte left open whiche lowe greate ordinaunce vnbreched ship turne water entered sodainly sanke sir george carewe knight capitain thesaied shippe foure hundred men muche ordinaunce thesame tyme certain frenche menne landed isle wight capitain slain many bothe greate losse pain driuen galies kyng perceiuyng great nauie frenchman approche sent letter men hampshire somerset shire wilshire diuerse place adioynyng whiche repaired presence greate nombers well furnished armure victaill thynges necessary isle garnished frontier scacoast furnished men greate nomber frenche capitaines hauyng knowlege certain fisher menne whiche thei toke kyng present also great power readines thei disancted sailed along coastes sussex small nomber landed sussex whiche neuer returned shippes thei taken vp waie thei searched costes saw men euer redy receiue thei turned sterne returned home without acte worthie writte doen enterprised sauyng meane time newe forte bullein strongly furnished finished nober frenchemen diuerse prisoner wer taken isle wight sussex report wer lx tyme frenche kyng wrote emperor declared hym armie gotten e wight porte hampto portesmouth diuerse place whiche writyng true frech kyng hath league promise kyng englande august folowyng noble erle hert ord entered scotland xiim men destroyed tounes middle march passed west march greate detriment losse scotlande destroyed coldyngham abbey yet frenchman scottes whiche laye kelsey durst encountre moneth died charles noble valiaunt duke suffolkethe death charles duke suffolke hardy gentleman yet hardy almoste estate degree menne high lowe riche poore hartely beloued death muche lamented buried wynsore xxiiii daie nouember parliament began westminster aucthoritie whereof graunted kyng subsedy ii viii pound moueable goodes iiii pound lande paied twoo yere college chaunteries hospitalles wer committed kynges ordre duryng life alter tra spose grace prorogacion parliament promised glory god common proffite realme litle tyme noble valiaunt lorde li e lorde admirall landed normandy brent subbarbes tre port diuerse village along sea coast destroyed toke almoste shippes hauen whiche riche goodly pray returned without dammage frenche kyng sore moued dooynges sent monsire de bee xiim men whiche entered thenglishe pale beside grauelyn brent marke diuerse small village returned euer maner wer skirmish alarmes betwene high bullein new builded fortresse losse ran euer frenchmenes side winter meanes made thempetor certain ambassador englande fraunce might mete comon peace whervpo kyng england sent guisnes curbert bishop duresme sir william paget secretory doctor tregonell frenche kyng sent arde bishop chief president roan notarie conclusion came effecte wherefore kyng hauyng perfite knowlege frenchemen intended build newe fortresse ihones rode betwene bullein calice whiche thyng onely sore distrussed calice daily put bullein trouble wherefore meanyng preuent greate mischief sent ouer noble erle hertford valiaunt lord li e admiral many valiaunt capitaines viim good souldiers whiche gate rode two dayes frenchemen appointed haue place encaped theselfes monsire de bee leader conducter al french affaire encaped hymself beside hardelow durst come furth set men notwithstandyng former preparacion deuice thynges thus hangyng many great skirmish daily betwene bullenois frenche bastilion one daie thone parte lost gained likewise loser regained one skirmishe wer lost xvi englishe gentleman lxxx although slain three rascall frenchemen skirmishe slain sir george pollard like iorney slain sir raufe elderkare capitain light horseman fewe englishemen yet greate multitude frenchemen tyme laye grounde xxiiii daie december kynges maiestie came parliament house geue royal assent suche actes passed made vnto hym speaker eloquent oracion whiche hath euer accustomed lorde chaucellor made answere tyme kynges pleasure bee otherwise kyng hymself made hym answere foloweth woorde woorde nere able report although chauncellor tyme beyngkyng henry answere speaker parliament hath tyme vsed eloquently substancially make answere suche oracions hath set furth high courte parliament yet able open set furthe mynd meanyng secretes hart plain ample maner self wherfore takyng vpon answere eloquent oracion master speaker saie name welbeloued common hath praised extolled notable quality haue conceiued moste hartely thanke al haue put remembraunce dutie whiche endeuor self obtein get suche excellent quality necessary vertues prince gouernor ought haue whiche giftes recognise self bothe bare barrein suche small quality god hath endued withall rendre goodnes moste humble thakes entendyng witte diligence get acquire suche notable vertues princely quality haue alleged incorporate persone thankes louyng admonicion good counsaill firste remembred eftsones thanke consideryng greate charge pleasure defence gain greate cost whiche haue lately susteined aswell defence enemy conquest fortresse whiche realme moste displeasaunt noysome shalbe goddes grace hereafter nacion moste proffitable pleasaunt haue frely awne myndes graunted v certain subsedy act specified whiche verely take good part regardyng kyndnes proffite thereof setteth louyng harte substauce beside hartie kyndnes cannot litle reioyse whe consider perfite trust sure cofidence whiche haue put men hauyng vndoubted hope vnfeined belefe good dooynges iust procedynges without desire request haue committed myne ordre disposicion chauntreyes college hospitalles place specefied certain act firmely trustyng wil ordre glory god proffite common wealth surely contrary expectacion suffre minister churche decaie learnyng whiche great iuell minished poore miserable people vnrelieued might say ibeyng put speciall trust cace trustie frende charitable man mine euen christian neither louer publike wealth yet one feared god accompt must rendered doynges doubt praie expectacion shalbe serued godly goodly wishe desire hereafter shall plainly perceiue sithence find suche kyndenes part toward chose loue fauor affirmyng prince world fauoreth subiectes subiectes commos loue obaye souereigne lorde perceiue whose defece treasure shall hidden necessitie require persone shall bee vnaduentured yet although perfect loue concord frendly amitie continue except bothe lordes temporall lordes spirituall louyng subiectes studie take pain amend one thyng whiche surely amisse farre ordre whiche moste hartely require whiche charitie concord emongest amongest discord dissencio beareth rule euery place paule saieth corinthian xiii chapiter charitie gentle charitie enuious charitie proude furth thesaid chapiter beholde loue charitie emongest one calleth hereticke anabaptist calleth hym papist ypocrite pharisey token charitie emo gest signes fraternall loue betwene assure lacke charitie emongest selfes bee hynderaunce asswagyng feruent loue betwene v said except wound salued clerely made whole must nedes iudge faute occasion discorde bee partly negligence father preacher spiritualtie knowe man whiche liueth adultery muste iudge hym lecherous carnall persone se man boast bragg hymself cannot deme hym proude manne se daily clergie preache one another teache one contrary another inueigh one another without charitie discrecio stiffe old mumpsimus busy curious newe sumpsimus thus men almoste varietie discord fewe none preache truly sincerely woorde god accordyng thei ought shall iudge charitable persones doyng cannot ala poore soules liue concord preacher sow emonges sermon debate discord thei loke light bryng darckenes amende crymes exhorte set furth goddes worde bothe true preachyng good example geuyng el god hath appoynted uicare high minister se diuisions extinct enormity corrected accordyng duetie el vnproffitable seruaunte vntrue officer although saie spirituall men faute charitie kept emongest yet temporaltie bee cleane vnspotted malice enuie rayle bishoppes speake slau derously priestes rebuke taunte preacher bothe contrary good ordre christian f aternitie knowe surely bishop preacher erreth teacheth peruerse doctryne come declare counsaill v committed god high aucthoritie reforme ordre cause behauiours bee iudges selfes awne phantasticall opinion vain exposicions suche high cause ye maie lightly erre although permitted reade holy scripture haue worde god mother toungue must vnderstande licensed doo onely informe awne conscience instruct childre famely dispute make scripture railyng tauntyng stocke priestes preacher many light persones sory knowe vnreuerently moste precious iuell worde god disputed rimed song iangeled euery al house tauerne cotrary true meanyng doctryne thesame yet euen asmuche sory reader thesame folowe dooyng faintly coldly sure charitie neuer faint emongest verteous godly liuyng neuer lesse vsed god hymself emongest christian neuer lesse reuerenced honored serued therfore said bee charitie one another like brother brother loue dread serue god whiche supreme hedde souereigne lord exhort require doubt loue league spake beginnyng shall neuer dissolued broken betwene v makyng lawes whiche made concluded exhort maker bee diligent puttyng theim execucio wer makyng furtheryng thesame el labor shalbe vain common wealthe nothyng releued peticion concernyng royall assent geuen suche actes hath passed bothe house thei shalbe redde openly ye maie wer thei openly redde many grace assented diuerse assented vnto kynges oracion subiectes present suche comfort like ioye could vnto theim worlde thus actes redde maner assen geuen grace rose departed tyme frenchemen voyage made towarde isle bra le ship called barcke age barcke age whiche thei taken edglishemen waie thei fortuned mete sodainly litle craer master one goldyng whiche goldyng feate hardy man barcke perceiuyng small craer bee englisheman shot hym bouged hym wherfore craer drewe streight greate ship sixe seuen men lept barke frenchemen lookyng ouer boorde sinkyng craer nothyng mistrustyng thyng might doen englishemen fortuned englishman whiche climed ship founde ende thereof greate nomber lime pottes whiche thei water quenched rather nature thereof set fire threwe theim frenchemen aborde blynded theim fewe englishemen entered shippe vanquished al wer therein driue vnder hatch brought barcke clerely awaie englande pthe xxxviii yere moneth aprilla peace cocl dede betwene england fraunce meanes diuerse prince assemble betwene bothe realmes englade fraunce guysnes arde kyng englande erle hertford lorde lisle admirall sir willyam paget secretary doctor wotton dean cauntorbury frenche kyng lorde clado ball admirall marshall fraunce bishoppe eureux president secretary long debatyng diuerse breches peace concluded proclaimed kynges courte citee london whitsondaie sound trompettes likewise dooen paris roan performaunce whereof uiscount li e admirall bishoppe duresme diuerse lordes aboue hundred gentleman ueluet coates cheynes golde went paris solemply receiued feasted shortly returned whose returne admirall fraunce accompaignied bishoppe eureux erles naunteuile uilliers diuerse greate lordes beside twoo hundred gentleman well appoynted tooke galey depe hauyng compaignie twelue faire galies well trimmed decked sailed englande neuer toke lande til came grenewiche receiued erles essex darby xix daie august next daie galies landed tower wharfe bankes water side laie peces ordinaunce whiche shot especially tower london shot terrible peale ordinaunce fro thence rode london greate triumphe maior craftes standyng stretes good ordre bishoppes palaice london lodged till bartholomew euen whiche daie conueighed toward hampton courte waie prince hauyng hym archebishoppe yorke erles hertforde huntyngdon aboue twoo thousande horsse mette hym enbraced hym suche lowly honorable maner beholder greatly reioysed muche marueiled wit audacitie came courte geuyng prince vpper hande roade vtter gate courte lorde chauncellor kynges counsaill receiued hym brought hym lodgyng bartholomew daie kyng richely appareled welcomed hym great triuphe went chapell league sworne signed tel costly banquet house wer buylt great banquette costly maskes liberall huntynges shewed hym would muche maruell skant beleue fridaie folowyng beyng rewarded cupborde plate valure twelue hundred pounde returned london daie tooke galies departed beside diuerse compainie muche plate many horsses greyhoundes geuen also admirall geuen hym citee london twoo flagon gilte twoo parcell gilte somme hundred sixe thirtie pounde beside wine waxe torch thus thei laden rich thei brought returned fraunce although peace pleased bothe englishe frenche nacions yet surely bothe mistrusted continuaunce thesame consideryng old prouerbe iye seeth harte rueth frenche men still longed bullein englishemen mynded geue ouer muche duryng admiralles frauce beyng englande capitain newe fortresse began make pile euen hauen mouthe bullein lorde gray capitain put awaie woorke men tooke awaie tooles filled trench frenchemennes greate displeasure frenche kyng caused vpon greate pain trench new inuencions bee caste doune filled awne people least seme breaker peace yere arreigned condempned burned affirmyng opinion contrary sixe article foure persones saie anne askew gentlewoman ihon lacelles gentleman nicholas otterden prieste ihon adlam taylor wer burned smithfelde xvi daie iuly whole processe matter diuerse writer sette furthe therefore passe ouer ianuary wer attainted high treason thomas duke norffolke henry sonne erle surrey whiche erle behedded tower hill approched noble kyng whiche god decreed appoynted menne ceason monethe ianuary yelded spirit almightie god departed world lieth buried wynsore laste daie ianuary true lawfull onely sonne prince edward proclaimed kyng al father dominion xix daie february crouned annoynted kyng realme iesu preserue long reigne ouer v finis god saue kyng londini officina richardi graftonitypis impress cvm privilegio ad imprimendvm solvm anno mdxlviii
